review_body: I was really looking forward to my trip to Waikiki and to the Equus in May 2020. It was my birthday trip!Unfortunately, the Covid-19 pandemic hit and we had stay at place orders here in California and Hawaii also had strict quarantine orders. We had to cancel our trip.Unfortunately, I placed the reservation through a third party website (I will not name them, but they are horrendous to deal with) and the refused to refund me. Fine, I figured I would deal directly through the hotel.I called and was greeted by Rene. I explained to him my situation and requested to see if I could get a voucher to use my stay at a later date. He said he could definitely work with me and told him he would call me back. He called me back and did some research - Apparently, Equus didn't charge the website, and they never got any money from the transaction. He gave me his name and told me to call the company to request for a refund. If they had any questions about it, he would talk to them on my behalf.What fantastic customer service! I really appreciate Rene for being so upfront and helpful with me. I will definitely stay with them when I do rebook a trip to Waikiki. Unfortunately, I was not able to get my money back with the third party website, but I was able to get a credit on the account. I will try to use the credit with them or I will go directly through the hotel to book next time.

We recommend staying at the Equus. For the price, the hotel is very comfortable and quaint! The customer service was GREAT!! We especially appreciated Lincoln who worked for the valet. He always greeted us with a smile and cheerful attitude. He was awesome at giving us suggestions on what to do and where to go. Thank you Equus for making sure we were taken care of while visiting Honolulu.

I always choose a hotel through the reviews on Trip Advisor and find them accurate. I read all the reviews from terrible to excellent. Usually if there are any terrible reviews, I choose something else. The excellent reviews kept luring me back to The Equus Hotel. We arrived late at night and we got to our room, I realized that the terrible reviews had some merit. The room was tired and had some cleanliness issues. We spoke to Chad at the front desk and he was very helpful in finding us a beautiful suite in the hotel. It did have some street noise, but was very comfortable. The next morning we spoke to Rene at the front desk. She was the best!! We were put into a quiet room down the hall and Linelle had it sparkling and smelling fresh! Unfortunately, we didn't get Linelle cleaning our room after that and there were a few issues with towel and glass changes. The staff was great at making the situation better and we had a good stay while vacationing in Honolulu!

Linelle at the Equus hotel in Honolulu demonstrates great Aloha spirit. I was here on business for 2 weeks and she made me feel like home! She is very friendly and she is a hard worker covering different areas to help the hotel. Such a great person

I was on a solo trip and I stayed at the Equus Hotel. I was happy and satisfied with my room. It was very clean and spotless. The Housekeeping staff was very friendly. I was happy to run into Linelle. She greeted and welcomed me and asked me if I needed anything to let her know. Thank you Linelle for going out of your way and making my experience an Unforgettable one. Keep up the great work and continue doing what you do at your best!

I Melvin Schlitzkus , Stayed at Equus hotel on Feb. 22,2020. The Staff is outstanding & very friendly . Kika is a really outstanding . last night their was live entertainment by Garton , He was very great . I definitely will be going back to Equus hotel . Thank you very much Equus hotel ..  Thank you  Mr Melvin Schlitzkus  MelSchlitzkus49@gmail.com

My wife and I traveled to Oahu so I could visit a local men's bible study class. We checked in late and met Chad. He was working the overnight shift and was very pleasant and accommodating. The next day we met Cher, who ran the lobby like a boss. Jonah, Uncle and Lincoln all helped us with our valet parking, Ice, and directions. They even held food for us in the hotel refrigerator for me to take to the bible study. Renee was so kind and pleasant. We will stay here on our next trip in a couple of months. The location was perfect as we were close to everything, but not stuck in the middle of it all. Thank you to the whole Equus family for making our trip so nice. May God bless your business and continue to give you Joy in being the servants you have been called to be.

We checked in this evening and was Pleased and Impressed to find a card with a note from the Housekeeper Linelle, along with a cookie. We thought that was such a nice gesture and was caught off guard in a good way. Our room had a nice clean smell and the bed looked so comfortable. Our bed was made with perfection and our stripe sheet looked to crisp. Thank you Linelle for such a wonderful gesture. We are feeling right at home. Keep up the great job . We always admire your penmenship. Mahalo as your note says.

We just got back from an outing and wanted to Thank the Housekeeper who cleaned our room and left a note with her name on it saying Have a great day and enjoy our stay. Mahalo, Linelle. She did such a wonderful job. Hopefully we get to meet her. Thank you again Linelle. Mahalo from the guest staying on the 4th floor

After checking in on Sunday, I proceeded to my room and upon entering I found a cookie along with a welcome note written by Linelle, (Beautiful penmenship by the way!)I really felt at home with such a welcoming ambience knowing the housekeeper went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable and pleasant. Thank you sooo much Linelle for taking the time and making that effort to make your guest feel special.

This smaller hotel met all my needs : location was close to a variety of eating places and a short walk to Convention center . Room and bed was comfortable . The check-in and out were seamless with Rene assisting me with my boarding passes on way out plus allowing my bags to be left securely at hotel during my final day + they even had a change room and shower to use prior to leaving for the airport and the all-nite flight back to North America . John

We traveled as a couple and stayed here a few days. We would like to say thank you to Linelle who verified with the front desk our last name , before letting us into our room, because our key had expired. She saved us a trip going back downstairs. It's nice to see she followed proper procedures. Thank you for that Linelle and thank you for wishing us a Happy Valentine's Day! You made our day even special. Aloha, Guest that stayed on the 9th floor.

If you’re looking for quiet relaxation, this is not the place for you. This hotel is on Ala Moana Blvd. All night long and early morning, traffic is noisy, car alarms are going off, horns are honking, motorcycles are revving their motors, and sirens are blaring. I was awoken often, thinking the vehicle was actually in my room. The street noise is deafening. The only thing that helped cover up the noise from the traffic is the loud commotion and music from the bar. The air conditioning was powerful, so it was either freezing cold, or turned off and hot in our room. The “Resort Fee” is actually $25/day, not $20/day as advertised on their website. The staff is pleasant and the location is a quick walk to Ala Moana Mall. Stay here for the location and helpful staff, not for peace and quiet.

We were amazed with the way our room was cleaned thank you to our housekeeper Linelle who changed our Lenin an left a note and a trip advisor card on our bed our room was well done an we appreciate her efforts into changing our Lenin good job Linelle!!

I Traveled solo from the Mainland and stayed at this hotel for a few days on the 5th floor. This is a cute Family owned hotel. My room was nice and clean, it even had a little bird made out of wash cloths with a soap in it, in the bathroom. That was a nice touch. I just wanted to say Thank you to the Housekeeper Linelle who always greeted me when I was in the elevator or Lobby area. She was always Friendly and had a smile. Thank you Linelle, Keep up the Awesome job! I Enjoyed my stay and will be referring my Family and Friends to this hotel.

My wife and I checked in yesterday and we were amazed by the greeting we recieved from the front desk clerk. She had key points that guests like us look for when checking into a hotel. SHe greeted us with a warm welcome, nice smile, and great eye contact. Her attitude is just superb. Thank you for asking how our flight was and we were more than welsome to help ourselves to an apple and ice water at their water dispenser. These little things she offered, meant a lot to us. Thank you Linelle, we were more than happy to do this review for you. It's well deserved.

First time staying and already feel like family. Staff literally couldn’t be any better . Love the whole ambience, would definitely recommend to anyone staying in Waikiki!!! Oh , and can’t forget the 2 free drinks that come with the room :)

You know there's something great about the hotel if the front receptionist welcomes you with the biggest, boldest red lipstick smile. It's ”Aloha” and everything else is history. The design of the hotel was very unique. The feeling of waiting in the lobby almost bring back the feeling of being in mommy’s arm. The room was simple yet very representative of the local culture, especially with the bed frame and through the color palette. I may have only stayed one night but it was a one night worth it investment in the hotel.

A lot of street noise at night, the glass door to the balcony had a broken lock and could not be secured. The staff was nice but this hotel is not comfortable especially the bed. I will not stay here again as the hotel is very old and small. If you have heavy luggage, you have to lug it up the flight of stairs to the reception area. The bed has this weird wooden frame which took up space in the already small room.

The Housekeeper that serviced our room was very Informative and super friendly. We asked her a ton of questions on where to go and the cheapest way to get around. She was nice enough to write down everything we needed to know. She carried the conversation very well and even told us don't hesitate to ask if we needed anything else. She did an AWESOME job cleaning our room and replenishing everything we needed. From toiletries, Amenities and coffee. We love n thank you Linelle. We won't forget your Hospitality and awesome job.

Extremely convenient location within a close walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center.Cute hotel with an equestrian theme, a refreshing change from beaches and surf boards. Renee at the front desk is lovely and very helpful.

From the time that you drive up to The Equus the valets greet you warmly. As you walk upstairs to the lobby you encounter The Paniolo Bar where local musicians are highlighted and play out for the audience. The bar staff is very attentive and their signature drinks are really good. The rooms and facilities were clean, the beds are so comfortable, and we were well-stocked with toiletries and a mini Kuerig with cups for hot tea and coffee. Hats off to Kika who really made our stay special. She made sure we were taken care from the get go. She really made our stay at The Equus very special and we will definitely be back.

Maui locals enjoying a short stay at the Equus. Greeted with aloha from Linelle at check-in:) staff, housekeeping was great and our room was clean and inviting. Valet was always attentive. CHEEHOO!We will certainly recommend the Equus and stay on our next trip. Big Mahalo's Scott & Joann

Last week when I checked out the housekeeper was cleaning a room and I asked if she could please help me with my luggage to the elevator. She was nice enough to stop with her cleaning to help me with my belongings. I just wanted to say thank you to the housekeeper Linelle for assisting me and going above and beyond!

I Checked out on Friday and I was truly impressed with the Housekeeper. She had knocked on my door before I checked out. When I answered the door, Her exact words were " Good Afternoon Mam, My name is Lynnelle ( not sure if that's the correct spelling of her name) and this is a Courtesy Knock, Just to see if you need anything before you check out. I replied No Thank you, But Thank you so much for asking and checking and she said You're very welcome and Have a great day. I stayed at many hotels and none of them ever did a courtesy knock. To the Housekeeper Lynnelle, Like my title say's for this review, That is such a Brilliant Idea and I was truly Impressed. That was such a nice gesture, One I'll never forget.

When I arrived at the hotel last night, I was greeted by the front desk clerk named Linelle! She was very polite and friendly, made my check in very smooth and clear, and had a great smile and pleasant attitude! Very open personality and very sociable!!! When I asked about suggestions on where to go around here, she was knowledgeable and keen about where I should go and do here!! My day has been very fun so far, thanks to Linelle! By the way, I love her aloha uniform, That’s what I would expect when I would check into a hotel in Hawaii!! Thank you Linelle for making my first day great with your amazing service!

We stayed during the Christmas season for our Parent's 50th wedding anniversary. There were reviews about cockroaches so I was skeptical at first. But it was a great deal so I gave it a shot. We were greeted by Cher at the front desk. She was really nice and pleasant. We rented a car and used the hotel's valet service (Parking is difficult in Honolulu!). Lincoln made it easier for us to park and get the car.Day 3, we met another valet personnel who assisted my husband. Man, he was funny and so nice! Can't remember his name but I think it was Rory.Day 4, I had some questions on the bill which Renee made it easier for me to understand. Our overall stay wasn't that bad. It was great. I guess my only feedback was the lights at the hallway. Kinda dim so my inlaws found it difficult to walk at night.Oh! and I saw NO cockroaches at all!

The Housekeeper Linelle made my stay, Great! She was always very Energetic and Friendly. I Love her Aloha spirit. She always made my day and made me smile. Keep up the great work Linelle. Your the best.

I have stayed here several times for business, and so appreciate the hospitality, fun coffee shop and bar, pool and gathering rooms. Most of all, for our recent group event, the staff were collaborative, so kind, fun, accommodating and flexible! Easy walk for a morning swim in the ocean, very close to convention center and just 10-15 mins from downtown.

I was walking down Ala Moana Blvd one evening last week and came across The Equus Hotel. Curious, I decided to walk up the steps and check it out. I was immediately greeted by a cool guy named Chad. We chatted for a few minutes and he gave me great information about the hotel. It's history, and it's involvement with Polo here on Oahu's North Shore. Very cool, because I love horses!Learning that it was the only family-owned and operated hotel in Waikiki, was an awesomely interesting fact. Chad also mentioned that he runs the bar a few days during the week as well, so I went to visit the bar during their Happy Hour. Best decision ever! The cocktails and menu are great! Wonderful tasty drinks, great conversation, and engaging customer service. I had a great time, and I also learned that they have live music during the week. Right on! I will definitely be recommending this hotel to anyone I know looking for a cozy, beautiful and convenient place to stay in Waikiki. With that being said, I plan to visit The Paniolo Bar frequently. Great atmosphere, cool polo memorabilia, and decorative horse jockey flare. 10+ stars from me!Mahalo to Chad and the entire staff at The Equus Hotel and Paniolo Bar! I will be back soon.

Stayed as a group of three couples for a short stay. Arrived early in the morning and was given our room early!! Thank you!!! Some of us slept but hubby and I took the opportunity to explore and have a dip in the pool on the property. Rooms were huge and well equipped with everything we needed. Beds were comfy and room could be darkened to enable sleep. Perfectly positioned virtually next door to an ABC ship and McDonalds (if you’re that way inclined) but more importantly within a ten minute walk to Ala Moana Shopping precinct.Staff were welcoming, friendly, warm, helpful and there was an air of relaxation and good vibes. Loved this hotel and definitely recommend for long or short stays. We will absolutely be making it our Hawaii home for future visits.

Not as pretentious as some of the surrounding hotels, but none the less very friendly with helpful staff. Swimming pool though small is deep enough to swim in properly without touching bottom. No restaurant to speak of but bar meals available/ Rooms Motel style are rather dated but the beds are very large and comfortable.

Met an old friend for a short vacation in Waikiki. Only stayed a couple of days at the Equus but we had breakfast there both days because the cafe staff were so nice (coffee was good too!). Check-in was super efficient even though we arrived really late at night. The room was clean and big and comfy beds. Small hotel and not much to look at from outside, but quiet and restful. Rene at the front desk is great and helped us planning our trip around the islands. Thank you Rene and everyone at the Equus (Jacque, Linelle, Savannah, and the rest—I hope I spelled your names right!).

We had a good and relaxing stay in the hotel for 4 days. Jacquie, our cleaning lady was really good - changing the sheets and giving us new fresh towels everyday. Rene, the front desk lady was very accommodating and so sweet. She got us a rollaway bed because I have 2 grown boys who didn't want to share a double bed. Overall, we had a pleasant experience and would love to stay again in the hotel next time we're back in Honolulu.

I stayed there for a week. It was a great place to base our vacation from. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. People were friendly and helpful. The only thing I would recommend is that they have someone available when more than one person is trying to check-in. They valet parking worked great.

Came here for a night due to water main breaking down the road from my house, so ended up needing a place to shower. The staff here was very welcoming! Thank to Chad, Jacquie, Linda, Bennie, Junjun, Warren, and Rene for doing a early walk in for us! The hotel is nice and cozy and very clean definitely coming back to this locally owned hotel again!!

Ohana is the Hawaiian word for family and that’s exactly how the staff make you feel at this authentic Hawaiian boutique hotel. There are a lot of resort hotels in Waikiki and if you want to spend a small fortune to be just another number then you certainly have that option but when I travel I like to get in tune with the real local flavor and feel of the area I’m visiting and that is exactly what I experienced during my week at The Equus. I had the pleasure of getting to know many of the staff and literally all of them were so friendly and genuine, it truly was one of the top highlights of my entire experience in Hawaii. Both Puka and Rene who greet you upon checkin are simply amazing and super accommodating. They are both lifelong locals that know the area inside and out and are incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. The staff at the coffee/breakfast bar-Jen & Lynda-are also extremely friendly and wow do they make amazing coffee, paninis and pastries available in the morning! The bar coverts to a cocktail bar in the later afternoon/evening and the evening staff-Lana, Bailey & Rory are super chill and exude the true Aloha spirit serving up locally made rums, beers and sodas (I no longer drink alcoholic beverages so went with some locally made cola which was amazing). They specialize in all things local and were the first hotel on Oahu to go green:) The valet staff-Roy & Dwayne-are very quick and helpful. Even the housekeeping staff that I met-Teddy & Jackie-were excellent and great at paying attention to detail-something that’s important to me. The Equus is also the last locally owned hotel left in Waikiki and I’m sure that’s another reason they are so much like family. Sadly I wasn’t able to bring my babies (chow chows) with me on this trip but they are also pet friendly for those that do:>~The equestrian theme is really a nice touch and I learned that in the spring guests get VIP passes for free to polo matches at the polo club the same family owns on the North Shore! When I return to Oahu, I won’t even consider any other hotel. Just really love this place❤️

We came in for one night before continuing our trip overseas. We were given some gifts from family that we couldn’t bring on our trip but the post office was closed. The Equus staff were so helpful and found us a flat rate shipping box and held the package until we could get a family member to pick it up. The room was also very nice and charming. Definitely recommend a stay at the Equus!! Big thanks to Connie, René, and Jacquie!!

the Hotel front desk receptionist is very friendly. As an international visitor during vacation, she (Linelle Rene) was patient and was willing to help when i had trouble. The location of the hotel was close to the south part of the Waikiki-Beach, it means that you can walk to the beach and enjoy the sunshine.

This is an old old place that need upgrading. The rooms are small with oversized furniture. The bathroom is very small. Trying to dry yourself off from showering is a challenge. The carpet was dirty looking but old. Over all the room was clean.

Good vibe, good location & friendly staff. My wife and stayed here for 3 days. The staff was very nice and friendly and accommodating with the special requests we had. We would be happy to stay here again.

Great boutique hotel with a "chill" bar and cafe. It is close to everything, the staff are friendly and the rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are comfortable. We would happily come back again.

Great little hotel,close to all the amenities required,clean rooms and plentiful supply of clean towels and bedding.Close to the beach and harbour.Friendly staff with 24 hour security.Nice small bar for drinks.

Great service at the Paniolo Bar! The drinks are great, the bartender, Bailey, is very friendly and helpful. The ambiance is wonderful! A great place for drinks in the afternoon or evening! Definitely recommend!

The Equus was the perfect location for this local girl who wanted a staycation right where Ala Moana and Waikiki meet. For a girl who has traveled a lot, the king sized bed in the hotel room was one of the most comfortable I’ve ever experienced, so much so I want to get my hands on one. Customer service was superb and two employees, Puka and Kika, made my stay especially enjoyable and the reason I want to come back for future stays. From check in to check out, Puka made sure our needs were met and in a timely manner.

Great location and nice room. Rory at the bar was awesome - in addition to making stellar drinks, he gave lots of helpful information about all the cool spots one should visit on Oahu! Rory, you rock! Thanks for the memories!~Joe

Better Than expected,Near the best Spots , Restaurants and the Beach easy walking Very Pleased with Employees Renee,Lynda,Jen and Hannah. They took good care of Me and My Son . We will be back and I recommend The Equus to All!

We stayed at this place for 10 days and would definitely not recommend it to anyone. It was at best a 2star and to describe itself as a boutique hotel it quite amusing. Location is good and that is the best I can say about it.The room we had had 2 beds, no balcony and although on the 8th floor was noisy. Most of the furniture was old and missing handles or broken. The cleaning of the rooms was minimal and on some days no service was provided at all. Strangely enough it did not spoil our holiday as Hawaii is great and on the whole the staff were friendly. I have never stayed in a hotel like this before and I hope I never do again.

We love it here @ Equus!! It's so close to everything very convenient & Haunani @ the front desk is so Beautiful with so much Aloha as She Greeted Us & made sure we were taken cared of!! So if You're looking for a fast get away weekend, Check in @ The Equus!! Aloha & GOD Bless!! Mr & Mrs. Kekaula

This boutique gem is a great and welcoming, authentic vintage Hawaii experience. As a first time guest at the Paniolo (but former O'ahu resident) I was made to feel like ali'i (royalty). I will strongly recommend the Paniolo to everyone I know and will plan on staying here for any of my future visits when I want to stay near Waikiki. Mahalo to all the friendly staff, especially front desk manager Rene! Super sweet and accommodating upon my early arrival.

I checked in to the hotel before check in time after flying for many hours. Puka was the one that greeted and helped me at the desk. His friendliness and over all personality was par none. He made the trip so much more with his Hawaiian charm and energy. Great recommendations and even upgraded my room after knowing it was my first visit. The cleanliness was there and the Equus in general was a great First Hawaiian experience. Thank you Puka and thank you Equus. - Tyler

Great hotel, great staff, awesome location! Able to walk to many places. Valet parking, although $29 per day...the attendants couldn't have been more helpful. Loaned us beach chairs, towels, umbrellas and boogie boards. The rooms were clean and well appointed. They could update the room safes...the couple with us were not able to get a key to theirs and had to use ours. The staff were very friendly, and helpful with advice. Our bill got a little mixed up but we will figure it out!! They could definitely invest in new patio doors in the rooms - a little noisy. I read a review that the stairs were very dirty. We watched a man polish all the brass one day...very shiny and bright! The free drink in the bar was a bonus, and the staff there very friendly! Would definitely recommend and would stay here again. Thank you!

The Equus is a delightful family hotel in a quiet part of Waikiki, but within walking distance of all the action. It's clean and comfortable with great coffee and food, live music, and the friendliest staff! Special thanks to Rene and Lana.

This has been the first place that had the most wonderful customer service all around from getting out of the car and helping with luggage to checking in and a free aloha drink. Excellent! The only complaint I have is the ac. It didn't get the room cool enough.

Rooms were clean and have everything you need. Location is great, just few minutes walking to Waikiki Beach, Lagoon and Ala Moana Mall. Breakfast (not included) was good as well.We stayed for 3 nights and I was happy to stay longer.Highly recommend.

My wife and I found the Equus to be a wonderful hotel that suited our needs perfectly. The staff at the front desk were consistenly pleasant and helpful. Everything was spotless, the bed was comfortable, and the room featured plenty of storage space, an in-room safe and hair dryer, and a Keurig (much appreciated for that quick cup of coffee in the morning). The location was great--a very short walk from the beach with an ABC store steps from the front door for anything that you might forget. All this at a reasonable price; definitely recommended.

Good location, horse themed hotel, helpful friendly staff. Food not included but plenty of places to eat close by safe walk. Cheaper than a lot around. Bus service close and tour pickup point also close. Clean hotel, and bar is good again friendly staff our room on the top floor, large comfortable bed, with fridge.

I visited this hotel for a special birthday and was not disappointed. The welcome we received was carried on throughout the holiday by the very obviously happy staff working at the hotel, always having the time for a chat and to ask about our day. The rooms were large and comfortable. Location wise, this was perfect, on the edge of Waikiki so could walk to the busy areas within a few minutes, but also quiet when needed. Very close to the large shopping mall and lots of fantastic restaurants. Nice quiet beach within a 10 minute walk. We were given complimentary tickets for the Polo match whilst there, which was a great day out. I could not have asked for a better holiday, and cant wait to visit again. Thank you everyone

First time ever in Hawaii and I chose to stay at the Equus hotel for 10 days. I could not fault the place! Upon arrival we were greeted and asked if we wanted help straight away, unfortunately I forgot to get his name! We arrived quite early and Renee who was working behind the desk was super lovely, she allowed us to leave our bags so we could go tour around as we had a four and a half hour wait before check in. By the time we got back we met Keahi who checked us in. He had a laugh with us, literally made us feel at home straight away, and always has a smile on his face which is very warm, welcoming and very approachable. He’s definitely a top bloke. Also Lana who works behind the bar ! She has got to be one of the best bartenders I have ever come across! She is super outgoing and fun, she’s literally an all round superstar! She’s so down to earth, easy to get along with and has such a good vibe about her! There’s also a female, I forgot her name but she usually works late nights behind the desk, I talked to her briefly and she was also lovely!! All the staff members I came across were super lovely, always smiling, down for a conversation! Lastly a quick message to the owner of The Equus Hotel, you’ve hired a bunch of legends and should be proud of all who works here! They are amazing people Overall it’s in a prime location, close to the beach and the shopping. You get a free beverage upon arrival and there’s FREE WIFI!!

It may be a small hotel but the personal is just awesome!! Very welcoming! Just to mention Miss Aloha Renee K . She is so welcoming like I said !! It’s like I’ve known her for years . Also Kika, Cher ,Yoshi who carried all our luggage upstairs!! I think that’s the only downfall the stairs ! My husband walks with a cane it was very hard for him to go up and down ! Which he almost stripped couple of time ! But besides that we enjoyed our stay !! Away from the jungles of Waikiki!! Mahalo for a great stay !! Especially to our miss Aloha Renee K .❤️❤️

“What a nice surprise”Pending reviewOne refreshing change of pace… Whoever created this small boutique hotel should be aplauded wo. Such a warm and charming gathering place with both great staff and great guestsVey come to all Waikiki shopping and beautiful - warm beachesMust have a polo club near by??We wile the place ...Aloha PT Brent

My wife and I only stayed for one night as a stop off before flying back to the US. Would definitely recommend the Equis though. Staff were great and attentive and room was spacious with a really comfy bed. Just wished we could have stayed longer! Would recommend their bar too!

We get to the hotel after many delayed flights, we were very very stressed and tired but then we’re very welcoming and even recommended food and tourism spots nearby, such kind staff and lovely rooms, thank you all so much staff, such a lovely hotel and I would 100% stay againFrom the Gillaspy’s

We loved this little gem in the heart of Waikiki. It was cozy and intimate, low key and quiet, just the way we like it. It is an older building, but they have done a beautiful job of updating the spaces. We received a warm welcome from Renee (who is like a caring Auntie) along with a welcome drink in their cute little bar upon arrival. Our room was on the smaller side but very well appointed with lots of fluffy towels, refrigerator/freezer, coffee maker, and snacks. There was even a personal note from the management. Breakfast was delicious each morning in the coffee bar/cafe that doubles as a bar after 2 pm. It was like an oasis in the middle of the craziness that is Waikiki. Lovely experience all around; we would definitely stay here again.

We arrived several hours early than check in time, but we had a very long flight and I was fighting off a very bad cold. The man at the front desk Mr Puka, did absolutely everything he could to help us check into a room earlier... As soon as we came into the room he even gave a courtesy call to make sure I was ok, if we needed anything, i was impressed at the timing as he was concerned for me but called early enough to not disturb us. The room was clean and beds very comfortable, temperature comfortable.Additionally, I am a architect so I appreciate design and clever use of spaces. This boutique hotel transformed an inbetween buildings narrow space into a welcoming cafe/bar with a equestrian deco as its entry point. Food and coffee at the cafe was very good. The design of the hotel/room is not of a modern sleek but more a vintage and comfort with good taste. The furnitures pieces in the room were gorgeous all wood antiques modified for the modern appearance even the hinges and locks all crafted of wood so you can tell its not mass produced off the shelf items.The only comments i would have for reviewers is that the pool is small, more of a dip pool which would be great to cool off after swim at the beach, but not so much for kids to play, was not welcoming for kids. During the day the pool area was cold and windy, which might work out well on a hot day to cool off for adults.One more regarding service, the stay was for few days on our flight back. We stayed at a different hotel on the initial leg of the trip. However equus allowed us to store my sons bodyboard at their storage until we checked in in a month time. This saved as the hassle of taking it to a paid storage place else where. Again great service, clean comfortable beautiful small scaled boutique hotel.

We are so pleased and very greatful for the great service that we have recived from the staff and the room accommodation is so pleasing the aloha spirt given from your staff Rene and puka is so great and so are the parking staff as well and Jackie so awesome everyone thank you for making our stay enjoyable .mahalo...cindy

Visited The Equus last night for the first time with some friends. Evening entertainment at the Paniolo Bar was Garton Bailey and he was awesome! Great selection of music! The staff on shift were also very hospitable. We did not know of The Equus amidst the the other outlaying hotels. The location is prime. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping and not to mention the beach.

What a beautiful welcome we received when we checked in to this wonderful boutique hotel. The surroundings were gorgeous and our room was beautifully appointed, such a refreshing change from the sterile chain hotels. The pool was a welcome relief from the heat and the bar area was relaxing and had excellent coffee and pastries.

All the reviews that say “this is a hidden gem” are correct. This is a great little boutique hotel, just one block to Waikiki Beach and the Lagoon by Hilton Hawaiian Village, and just one block in the other direction to Magic Island (my favorite).This is a family owned hotel and you will feel it. Excellent staff that will make you feel right at home, and a hotel bar where you will find fellow guest travelers much more interesting than the typical vacationing families with screaming kids. Great mix of locals and visitors, just off the main drag, but literally a block away from both Waikiki and Magic Island/Ala Moana beach. Also the (free) WiFi actually works very well, an extra plus in my book Cannot recommend this enough. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Love this property. Located in the west corner of Waikiki, it's *easy* to get in and out (much faster than getting to other Waikiki hotels) with all the good things in Waikiki still easily accessible. Perhaps my favorite thing about The Equus is the community / ohana vibe. The staff and overall energy of the property feel like family, not corporate talking heads and plastic marketing messages. Last but not least, The Equus tells the story of Hawaii's deeply-rooted paniolo (cowboy / equestrian) culture. This history is a fantastic part of Hawaii, and The Equus tells an authentic story. The hotel owners have run Hawaii's #1 polo club and school for over 50 years. The Equus is a great foundation for any Hawaii visit or staycation!

Love this "hole in the wall gem" place! The Equus Hotel staff are very professional, friendly, & made us feel welcomed like we were family & friends already. Kika definitely showed us what the Aloha spirit is all about & she is always so helpful & such a great personality. Definitely visit the bar & pool area (Paniolo Bar) when Garton Bailey plays Island music live, He takes you on an Island journey & sings his heart out while entertaining & making us laugh & smile. We will definitely be coming back! Thanks again Equis Hotel for sharing your Aloha & Island roots... You got a friend in me!

Nicely redone hotel in Honolulu. Tiny pool, and comfortable, stylish rooms. Welcome drink has too much ice that immediately melts and ruins it. Needs real cream pods instead of cheapskate powdered creamer in the rooms.

We didn't think this hotel was worth the value. The pictures were misleading, the rooms were much smaller than expected. The balcony doors were dirty and looked across to another dirty building. Because of this, we kept the shutter doors closed the whole time. The shower stall was very small. The staff was not always helpful. The hotel is located conveniently if you want to go to Ala Moana shopping center or beach, but it is far from central Waikiki. We chose this hotel because it was an affordable option, but now we wish we had chosen a different hotel. Overall, we were disappointed with our stay and would not return.

I enjoyed my stay, the room was cosy and my boyfriend enjoyed the coffee machine.A couple of less positive things:- my credit card was overcharged- which took a few email exchanges to sort out.Also, housekeeping came into the room when the Do Not Disturb sign was on the door (a little disconcerting) then they promised to return in half an hour (which they didn’t do).

The hotel was clean, front desk staff helpful. The hotel itself was quite basic, pool was very cold, windows in the room didn’t open, and would’ve loved to have a microwave in the room. Also would’ve been nice to have queen beds not just doubles.

After looking over the other reviews, I decided to take a chance on this place. The price was cheap for the area, but the reviews and pictures they had looked worth it. My mistake. When we arrived, we had to carry our bags up a flight of stairs being that the check in is on the second floor and there is no elevator from the ground floor. Check in was easy. We then waited on the only elevator in the hotel for several minutes ( It wasn’t busy) and got to our room on the fourth floor. The door was wide open and the furniture was piled in the beds and a fan was trying to air out the room. I had my family wait while I went back down to the front desk. I was told it shouldn’t have been available as it was under maintenance but in the system it was. Got another room, went there and checked it out before going back to get my family just in case. The room looked like the pictures except in the pictures they must have used another source of lighting to make it look homier. The bathroom was on the small side but manageable. The tv was on when I entered the room but you couldn’t change the channel. This was resolved with no issue. The beds and carpet is where the problem is. The carpet looks like original carpeting. Rarely cleaned and there were stains on it. The bed, which is labeled as double pillow top mattresses felt like I was laying on pillows with springs in them. More like a big full size bed. If you have two small children, they’re fine. Two adults not fine. We were there for 3 nights and barely got any sleep. This was the result of the bed and the constant street noise. Very busy area, which I understand, but the walls and door to the hallway are paper thin. The best part of the hotel is the Paniolo bar and HI brew cafe, same place just different hours. Everyone in the hotel was friendly, so they aren’t the problem. I believe the management needs to spend a night in a room to see what they can improve on. Major tune up needed.

Equus is very close to Waikiki beach and Ala Moana center. Both within walking distance so very convenient! I also left my waterproof bag with some cash and hotel card key in the lobby area, and the bar manager and hotel staffs were able to locate it and return it to me at the end of the day!! Thank you so much! (I forgot the names of the people who helped out since i lost the name cards unfortunately :( ) There are also towels and beach mat and parasol available to borrow, and also welcome drinks at happy hour 4-6pm! Would recommend to people looking for a more budget option (compared to all the other hotels on the Waikiki boardwalk) with great location!

We found the Equus Hotel to be fabulous. It is close proximity to all of Waikiki, ala Moana shopping centre is 5 minutes away and the beach is 2 minutes away. The rooms were clean, tidy and well appointed and good in size. We found the staff to be really friendly and super helpful. The quaint little cafe/bar next to the pool and lobby had great coffee and breakfast food in the morning and great cocktails in the evening. We made lots of friends there and look forward to coming back soon. The owner and host, Mike, is a charming guy that was really accommodating and great to have a drink with listening to his polo stories. Highly recommend the Equus.

Thanks to Mick and the team at Equus, we had the great time in Hawaii and our stay at the Equus was fantastic. Awesome staff great location hope to come back and visit again soon. Friendly greetings when you arrive, rooms are clean comfortable and well serviced. Regards Adam

Beautiful hotel with heaps of character in a great spot - short walk to restaurants and the beach and only a 5 minute walk to ala Moana shopping canter. all the staff where fantastic. Highly recommend a visit!

Well where do I start arrived have to go up about twelve stairs with all your luggage and we had some people in late seventies with us so not good We had to leave our cases as could not check in till three !!! The receptionist was not clued up could not find our paper work they were overbooked and some people had to go to another hotel it was a shambles We got into rickety lift when doors opened to our floor it was an open balcony with your doors exposed so def not a hotel more a motel style Opened the door we were right on front of hotel I use that word loosely and was noisy windows were filthy had spores growing on them Bathroom was dated and there was dirt along the top of the tiles was disgusting had to use a towel on the shower floor was not going to risk it Beds were clean had nice white sheets but did not dare look underneath it def was not like the rooms shown on their promotion video old furniture and I mean old Just was an awful experience quite heart breaking as was not cheapThere was a coffee shop morning coffee was cold the bar in evening coffee shop shuts at two becomes a bar Ran out of stuff we asked for five drinks sorry no lemonade left no OJ left this was eight thirty in evening So not the best experience steer clear it’s just not nice !!!!

Myself and my husband stayed at The Equus and were very happy with the receptiveness of the staff. We were very well catered for. The room is wonderful, very clean and the Paniolo Bar serves breakfast and delicious drinks. Super indicate!

I highly recommend this hotel for its convenient location to Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall and warm excellent service by a sweet Hawaiian-Chinese lady, Rene at the concierge desk with original old Polo horses, lamps and original art. This cute boutique hotel with Polo theme makes you feel like you’ve gone back in time back to rolling hills and horses like on the North Shore of Hawaii.and the rooms are reminiscent of comfortable country feel with upgraded amenities with organic Paul Newman coffee pod makers, hemp natural soaps and nice refrigerator and TV/wi-fi. This hotel is sustainable with filtered water dispenser where you can fill up with free water. This place also has a horse themed bar, Paniolo for breakfast, coffee or drinks. I highly recommend this small adorable boutique hotel for staying in Honolulu at reasonable prices and friendly happy atmosphere all-around.

My boyfriend and I really enjoyed staying here. The room and hotel were better than expected, the location was great for the price, and the price just couldn't be beat. It was a bit of a walk to the beach, but definitely doable. Seriously. The only thing I didn't like was the size of the shower, but that wasn't bad enough to make me give a bad review.However, 3 days after checking out, I noticed 9 additional charges to my credit card all made on various days during my stay. I called the hotel to ask what was going on, but was met with hostility and did not receive any explanation.The hotel's policy is to charge you a deposit at booking, then charge the remainder on check in. This all went smoothly. On check out, we weren't notified of owing any additional monies, nor were we given a receipt, so these charges were totally unexpected. When I called, I was told that the two $20 charges that went through were resort fees and not to worry about the other 7 charges because they were declined. I explained that they wouldn't have been if my card would've had the money on it, and asked again to know why the charges were even attempted. Aside from the two $20 charges, all of the others were in various amounts from $50 to $160. She asked me the dates, I told her, but she said she couldn't tell me why the attempts were made because she wasn't working those days. I asked her to find out who was and have them call me, to which she replied that she was the manager and again tried to tell me I didn't need to worry about the charges because they were declined. I ended up hanging up on her because she got increasingly defensive and rude, and kept talking over me. I never got any resolution, nor an answer as to why the random charges were attempted. After the conversation, I emailed asking for my receipt and received it. (I'm sure it's the same person I talked with that emailed it to me because 2 other people were CC'd on the email.) The receipt is hard to understand and some of the charges don't make sense, but no where on it does it show that I had two days of unpaid resort fees, nor does it show any other outstanding amounts to explain ANY of the charges that were attempted, including the ones that went through.Since they could never explain why the charges were attempted, I feel I should probably just cancel my card since I can't be sure they won't make more random attempts.

This hotel has wonderful staff members, a great location, and offers reasonable pricing in an expensive area. So, why only three dots? The rooms need a serious cleaning. The high traffic areas were cleaned daily, but a glance under or behind furniture revealed thick layers of dust & had clearly not been cleaned recently. Shower floor looked suspicious too. Furniture getting worn, but is serviceable. AC worked great until the last day, when it stopped working. Friendly staff responded promptly and fixed the problem right away. Enjoyed the free drink at the small bar downstairs, did not enjoy the "de rigueur" Resort Fee which every hotel in Waikiki seems to charge for no apparent reason. Wi-Fi worked good, appreciated the mini-fridge in the room. There was some road noise every night, apparently the stoplight just down the street is a local "peel out" spot for sports cars cruising Ala Moana Blvd. If you don't mind the cleanliness issue & need to save some money, this is a good option in Waikiki. The staff are very friendly, courteous, and helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel if they would do a deep clean of the rooms.

10/10 would recommend. Excellent service, perfect location having great access to Waikiki, comfortable beds and clean and tidy rooms. I will definitely be coming back to stay here next time I am in Hawaii.

We stayed at the Equus as part of a package deal, (cruise, flights and hotel). So i didn't do my customary Trip Advisor check of the Hotel before booking. First impression: We were greeted by wonderful young men who were Valet Parking, 10/10 for them. Not too happy that we have to then negotiate 17 steps up to the lobby area.We checked in around 1pm, our room wasn't ready yet (which is totally understandable) We went off for many hours and returned after dinner. our suitcases had not been delivered. We call the reception and ask for delivery. We receive our luggage minus 2 back packs which were delivered to another room in error.we note the room is nice enough, bed is big and comfy. but on closer inspection there is dust on lampshades, chair rails, all flat surfaces. I grab a wet cloth and wipe down the counter near the coffee machine and it is flithy. i check the shower, also filthy, mould on the grout and floor is grimey. there is a safe, but it came off Noah's ark, it had no key and was locked, i called reception and asked for a key, i was told all the $$$$'s it would cost me if i lost the key, then the key was delivered. then turned on the TV, batteries were flat, so had to put in a call to reception( for the 3rd time and i only arrived half an hour ago)to have batteries delivered, which they promptly did. the roads are incredibly noisy, and the sliding glass door is so thin, it felt like there was no door at all, it was so noisy. Speaking of which, i could not open the sliding glass door. it had a dodgy bolt, but even when i managed to open it, the door would not slide.for the next 2 days we put a Do Not Disturb sign on our door, but that didn't stop the housekeeping from entering our room. surely this is an invasion of our privacy.on the 3rd night, the fire alarm went off in our room for no reason, we were sound asleep and it went off... we didn't know what it was at the time, as we were deep in sleep, and to be woken to the screaming sound... we were in a shocked state to say the least. the thing was situated less than 5 feet from our bed.we had the battery taken out and asked they not fix it until we left 2 days later.upon checking out, we asked for a nights discount as it was totally ruined because of the disturbance and we could not go back to sleep, but the person checking us out could not do that, all he offered to do was to take of the "Resort Fee" of $20 a day.....not satisfactory if you ask me. And Resort fee???? for a tiny little pool squeezed in behind the bar area... I cant believe they charge $20 a day for that.so to sum up...Staff are wonderful, Valet Parking guys..Fantastic. Room dusty and dirty (room 603) shower mouldy and grimey and 17 steps is a long way to drag your suitcase. no, not happy at all.

This is a lovely little hotel in a great location. The staff was amazing and treated our large family with such Aloha. Renee at the front desk, Kai (spelling?) in maintenance & Chad at the valet were all so friendly & helpful. The beds are comfortable & everything was very clean. We were happy with the price & even happier with our stay, we would stay here again. We had two rooms and were traveling as a large family of 7. Mahalo to the Equus staff!

Stayed 2 nights recently. Rooms clean with comfortable bed. Staff very helpful and friendly nice little cafe and bar downstairs. Close to beaches, shops and transport. Fast wifi. Perfect for a short stay

Arrived to this cute little horsey lobby and loved the decorations. It was fun and nicely decorated. The valet was adorable and very helpful as there is no elevator up to the lobby so he needed to carry our bags. That was a bit of confusion. But the lobby is quaint and compact but the people at the front desk were darling. The lady who checked us in was calm and happy and a friendly face after a long trip. I wish I knew her name. The young man who helped shepherd us thru the process, Keahi, was knowledgeable, friendly, patient and very helpful on many levels. I say this about the staff because when we arrived they were having some work done in the tiny lobby and people were arriving to check in in droves. So for them to stay so calm and happy was appreciated. The little bar was cute and there was easy access to rooms. The only thing that was a bit of an issue for me was the pool. I was hoping for a pool that was really a pool but this was not that. It was cute and certainly worked for a dip. A fun little boutique hotel. I amswered a lot of unsures because I didn't need an iron, or the front desk at night. Also there may be a horse ride excursion from somewhere but this hotel does not have horses.

Affordable accommodation close to beach and shopping. Found stairs to lobby hard to carry luggage, no elevator from street level. Rooms clean with character furnishings. Includes a safe in room but need to ask for the key. Balcony is nice but doors were hard to open, they need to be upgraded. Road noise was a bit loud. Would stay again.

Kudos to Kaihi for taking care of a incorrect charge. He was very helpful on the phone after we returned home. The front desk had somehow misunderstand and charged us for days we weren't there. They corrected the mistake after I showed them my credit card statement and showed them that I had stayed at another hotel for those days.

The hotel was well priced and the location ideal for my stay. The staff were all very friendly and nice. On the night we stayed they did have a special DJ music night with a personality from the movie, "Empire Records." Not really want I wanted after a long trip from Australia. Music was very loud and it was hard to make it an early night with noise and music continuing until midnight. When I made this booking, no information about the event was forwarded to me. No further discount on the room, no complimentary drinks or morning coffee for having to listen to a few hours of noise. This is the last thing I expected on a Monday night. The parking garage is pricey, $35 for the night, park across the road in the parking garage. The rooms are located on an upper floor from street level. Not easy to get up the stairs with luggage. Surrounds, include places to eat, ABC stores and the Ala Moana mall. After being hit with a resort fee upon check in, I doubt I'd stay here again. Just a list of annoying things that added up to 1 nights stay being.....just average. Room was nice, bed comfortable, but overall the hotel was far from boutique and closer to average.

A Big Mahalo to Rene who helped make our stay very comfortable, relaxing and memorable at the Equus Hotel. My family and I are from the North Shore of Oahu and have lived here for 50 years. I would highly recommend the Equus for its excellent customer service and attention to sharing the 'Aloha".Looking forward to our next Staycation.Warmest Aloha's Fallas Ohana

The Equus is in a good position, Wakki beach is just across the road. On arrival we was very disappointed. Our room was very dark and small for three guests, we was also told of extra charges and only given two complimentary arrival drinks, even though three guests. When we complained about all these things they was rectified.The new room still was small for three people.The bar staff were mainly rude, to the point they would not even give you some hot water. Reception staff were very nice and helpful. The room was cleaned everyday, and we was given an abundance of towels everyday. Yes I would stay again.

Beautiful, quaint historic hotel right in the heart of Waikiki. Prideful of its background linked to historic O’ahu Polo games, fortunately it’s only about a block away, walking distance, from Waikiki beach. Rooms are very nice, very clean, up-to-date electronics but with vintage wooden furniture, very cozy bed. Staff is out of this world! Made our stay 10x better than anticipated. Reneé, our front desk concierge and O’ahu native, treated us like Hawaiian royalty as well as any housekeeping and maintenance staff we encountered. Reneé dubbed us family immediately and let us in on awesome local tips as well as some practical O’ahu “do’s and do-not’s”. Almost each evening of our honeymoon week we returned to our room to find heartwarming gifts left for us by the staff: wine, champagne, thank you cards, etc. The staff and their vibes really made us feel at home as opposed to the fluorescent, corporate feel of a luxury resort. This place is perfect blend of 5 star service with a native O’ahu ambience. Hotel is extremely eco-friendly with power saving guidelines and recycling. There is a nice, clean mid sized pool on lower level with patio cabana. Another huge perk is the outdoor/patio cafe/bar downstairs known as ‘The Paniolo Cafe @ The Equus’. This is laid back patio bar with great signature cocktails and a nice selection of local/national beers and wines. There is also an amazing locally brewed coffee and a great selection of pastries and brunch food items. Each day was a different server/bartender, but each one was just as awesome and friendly as the previous. Kelly, Bailey and Rory each treated us with the upmost kindness and respect and were very welcoming as well as knowledgeable in local fun facts and adventure ideas. Mahalo guys!!! These 3 individuals just added to our already awesome vacation. All in all, we would most definitely return here. This is a great place to stay to get the true O’ahu feel with romantic overtones and avoids the hustle/bustle, touristy atmosphere that the typical beach resorts thrive on. 100% must stay!!

Booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews as we needed a place to sleep prior to an early check in at the Hilton. Arrived at 950 am and to access the Lobby you need to climb a flight of stairs as there is no elevator to lead up to that area. Check in was smooth and we got our key for room408 a few minutes later. We weren’t given welcome drinks as the bar closed at 10. The lady ended up comping us a bottle of wine. Walked in and the room was outdated but seemed ok. We sat down and a few minutes later we heard the door open and a couple walked in and were surprised to see us as were we. They had been given the same room key as ours, kinda scary especially if we were asleep. Now, as we were about to goto sleep we pulled the covers off the bed and saw a towel on the bed. Thinking that’s weird we removed the towel and what did we discover? A big stain of.....BLOOD. Rooms were changed, apologies were given and a full refund was given. Would I recommend or come back? No! Shining star - Yoshi, the night employee was super nice and apologetic!

Perfect spot for enjoying Dinners, the Beach and Nightlife. They offer a welcome drink after check in. Quiet hotel with convenience nearby. Valet was a nice addition, very nice guys. We really enjoyed our stay.

Many thanks to Ursula, Brock, and Renee. Their hospitality was above and beyond. They were also very accommodating. The hotel is walking distance to shopping and restaurants. The room was very clean and cool. Great place to stay.

My wife and I loved the experience. You are greeted by the most friendly and helpful guy at the check in desk, and our room was perfect for our needs. AC was blasting when we came in (so nice on a hot day) and everything was clean and professional. We will actively seek this spot out next time we come to Waikiki. Mahalo!

I deeply enjoyed my stay at this friendly and welcoming hotel. The staff are welcoming and exude a wonderful sense of 'ohana. I felt very much "at home away from home" during my stay. 10/10 will visit again.

Totally blown away by the Equus! From the incredibly accommodating staff, the great location with easy access to parking, all the personal touches, and comfortable and hip bar and pool area with complimentary welcome beverages, the Equus is the place to stay in Waikiki! My husband and I had our "staycation" at the Equus and it was a wonderful experience where the staff makes you feel like family! I would recommend this quaint hotel to both tourists and locals! Walking distance to many great bars and restaurants in Waikiki! Would definitely book again!

Rooms-comfortable and beautiful. Hospitality unmatched from the minute you arrive. Linelle's hospitality was refreshing and made my day. Complimentary welcome drink delicious! Thanks, Lana. We'll be back

I treated myself to three nights at the Equus and absolutely loved it. It’s a lovely hotel with a small but well equipped bar and great, very personal hospitality. It’s family owned and that clearly shows. I hope to be back!

The Equus is a close 5 minutes away from the Ala Moana Mall and 5 minutes from the Hale Koa resort. Perfect location. The reception folks were super friendly. Our housekeeping, Verginia, kept our room immaculate.Will definitely stay here again. This is not the Trump International or the Hyatt, but a comfortable clean room with friendly people and clean rooms.

I stay here multiple times a year for business. Parking is valet, which is very convenient. It's clean, comfortable and close enough to walk to all the fun resorts and shopping. The staff is great. breakfast is not included, but Jen runs a great place in the lobby for a bagel sandwich. There's a small bar in the evenings with a fun selection.

We would like to thank Renae and Jacquie for their amazing hospitality! They really went above and beyond in making sure we felt welcome and at home at the Equus! The room was a great size for 4 adults. The hotel was clean and the beds were super comfy. Last but not least the pineapple, biscuits and free drink on arrival were such nice touches. We appreciate all of the staff being so friendly and accommodating. We will definently be back.

The team at Equus is top notch when it comes to hospitality. Rene at the front desk helped me arrange for something special (last minute) to surprise a guest at check in. Really love booking with folks who are willing to go the extra mile for their guests. Thanks, Rene!

The start they have on hand were so welcoming and warm, went above and beyond to accommodate us while we were there our room was room 204, everything about the room, hotel, and customer service exceeded our expectations. Thanks for everything!

The TV in our room went out on our trip to Honolulu in January 2018. Jacquie came to our room, quickly went to work trying to figure out what the problem was, and determined that the wireless access point had inadvertently become unplugged. She plugged it in, tested the system, and the TV worked perfectly. A big mahalo to Jacquie's expert knowledge for a very quick resolution. On top that Jacquie was just a pleasure while taking care of the problem; she did a great job with the aloha spirit, and made our trip all the more pleasurable despite minor technical difficulties. A hui hou!

We were booked for 3 weeks holiday upon arrival my heart sank the hotel didn't reflect the pictures and information given pre booking We were mislead we arrived at midnight tired and stressed after a long flight Only to be asked for extra payment and what a shock of horror we had The room was dark dirty cables where electric power had been cut off were exposed The whole room smelt of stale smokeWe immediately contacted our agent and moved The lobby was so small and so untidy The maid never clean the room The wardrobe was in the bathroom by the shower The swimming pool was a small fish pond I would never return kit recommend this place to any one My advice check and double check prior to booking it very misleading

If you are visiting the island of Oahu, know that this is THE BEST KEPT SECRET on the island! The rooms are nice, the staff is amazing and the location is close to shops, restaurants (like The Chart House), and best yet.... WAIKIKI BEACH! You will love the welcome drink (a fantastic bonus with an excellent bartender) and the advice on what to do locally including climbing Diamond Head. If we could rate this property and their staff 10 stars, we would!

We arrived at the hotel and were made to feel like family right away. The room was comfortable and clean. Rene' the hotel concierge was amazing she made us feel like staying longer, oh we had such a good time I felt close to everything. Our family stayed at the Hilton village. very nice better view more amenities, but not as intimate and cozy as the Equus. We look forward to staying there again!

"We chose this hotel based on other trip advisor travelers reviews, as well as the location. Not needing to be “on” the beach, The Equus seemed perfect, and at a decent price of around $125/night. Booked directly through the Choice Hotels website, we thought our room preferences (not near the front busty street noise) would be heeded. Upon check in, I inquired, and Reception indeed had to change our room for us. “No problem!” So we headed to our new room # 607. It didn’t matter! Street noise (through closed sliders and running a/c) was a problem. While the room itself was ok, (bed comfy, nice tv, Keurig coffee maker) the carpets were stained, and the bathroom shower tiles seemed dirty. Oh, and our room was never serviced for the 3 day stay. We would leave the room around 10 am, and return around 2-3pm, never even seeing a housekeeper on our floor until the morning of our check out. Maybe they do late housekeeping?? Possibly this was due to the hotel workers strike in Honolulu?? Whatever the reason, it just didn’t seem right, or up to Ascend or Choice standards. I do want to give props to the two women working the breakfast coffee bar on the Reception level, although I’m not sure if it was run by the hotel. They were pleasant, attentive and served excellent coffee! (And the bartender in the evenings poured a nice size glass of wine.)"

So disappointing. Poor sleep quality, second hand smoke from other guests (even if this is a non smoking hotel), awful service and terrible housekeeping. They "forget" to even make the bed. Unbelievable. I would not recommend staying in this hotel.

We booked 2 nights. We were happy with the location as it was walkable to the beach and shopping. Check in was easy and the gentleman at the desk was very pleasant and welcoming. The hotel is dated in every area, especially evident in the rooms. Our room was an exterior room with an alley view near the front and was very noisy with Ala Moana traffic noise. The bed was old and uncomfortable and dipped in the middle. All areas lacked in cleanliness except for the hotel entrance which was kept clean. The same cigarette butt laid on the floor in the hall to our room while we were there and the cups for coffee had coffee stains in the bottom. There was a fridge and in-room safe but no key for the safe. The small pool area was not used by anyone while we were there. It was very shaded and didn’t seem to get any sun at all. We were given a complimentary welcome drink which was nice. The bartender on duty did not seem to enjoy his job, he never smiled or did anything to make you feel welcome . He was off putting. However, we had coffee in the morning at the bar and the gentleman there was very pleasant. An okay hotel as long as you know what you are getting.

This is a nice, small hotel tucked away in Waikiki! Upon arriving to the hotel we were told that we got an upgrade to a suite (we’re choice hotel members) which was unexpected! We went up to the 10th floor and had a beautiful kitchen and living room along with the comfiest king bed! Our kitchen came equipped with a mini fridge, wine fridge, microwave, plateware, cutlery, and cookies, coffee, and tea (which was refilled each day) for the keurig! It was such a beautiful stay and there is the paniolo bar downstairs, which is a small bar that serves coffee and food in the morning and drinks in the afternoon. Near by is an ABC Superette which is like a convenience store and a McDonald’s and restraurants within walking distance! We stayed for three nights but I wish we booked it for longer! The room was beautiful, staff was very inviting and nice and I look forward to coming here again in the future.My only complaints (which are small ones) would be that the tvs are difficult to turn on and off and the volume on one of our tvs only had two volumes; mute and super loud. And the elevator makes lots of mechanical noises as you ride up and down which just made me nervous but the elevator itself was fine each time I took it up and down.

I spent a night at the Equus recently, between international flights. The front desk staff was courteous and helpful; the room was spacious and clean; and the open air bar a friendly gathering spot. I will definitely be here again!

Thanks to all the people at the front desk, they were all very courteous and helpful. When we told them about our bed concern, it was immediately addressed. We appreciated so much. Their employees are very considerate, too. Winston their concierge was so helpful, great guy to guide what good tours to to experience. Thank you all, this review might be too late Burt all your great help was appreciated. Your place is very convenient with good staff.Cheers for the Happy New Year!

I just checked out after two nights stay. Don't let the reviews fool you. It's 2 star hotel, maybe 2.5 star. The carpet is dirty. The bathroom is abominable. You can hear every noise from the street. It's just not a place I would ever return. If you want to be near Ala Moana mall, then the location is good. They also charge resort fee of $18 per day but there are no amenities so I am not sure what that fee was for. My first reaction upon entering the room was how do I cancel my reservation and get out of there. I've stayed in various hotels in Honolulu. There are modest hotels that are clean. This is not one of them.

This was my second stay, at The Equus, in 7 years, and I must say, it has only gotten better. Upon my arrival, I was greeted by a most helpful parking attendant, who took care of my vehicle, as I checked into this boutique hotel. At check in, I was made to feel like I was a VIP, by the extremely friendly staff. The beautifully renovated lobby / lounge area, did not go unnoticed, nor did the cleanliness of the property. I opted to take the short elevator ride, up to the floor where I would be staying (7). Gained entry to my room, without any problems (secure swipe card access). I was pleased to discover the energy conservation efforts that are in place (when not in your room, simply remove key card from the wall port, and the lights & air conditioning power down). The layout of the room, is well thought out, plenty of space to move about (including the spacious washroom), a bar fridge with drink prep station on the counter above, extremely plush beds and lounge seating, an entertainment centre, and your room specific complementary WiFi access. The theme of the hotel (Polo, Horses, and Hawaii), is maintained throughout, with personal touches from the owners. I slept undisturbed, all night, in the completely occupied hotel. As I ventured out, in the early hours, to make the scenic walk to the starting area of the marathon, I received well wishes from the front desk staff, which was a nice touch. Checkout time was perfect, giving me plenty of time to get back from the finishing area, eat, shower, and pack. I have yet to have a negative experience, at this fine accommodation, in Honolulu, and would not hesitate to recommend this place, to anyone looking for a great, authentic, comfortable, and friendly place to stay, while visiting Oahu. Mahalo!

was a great little hotel with friendly accommodating staff we stayed two nights and opted for late chqout rooms were a bit dated and noisy but price was right and little bar was great close to beach and shopping

The staff was friendly and service oriented. We were allowed to leave our luggage the next day until a later pickup which was very convenient. The hotel is conveniently located and the amenities are nice. We appreciated a free drink in the bar. An ABC store is at the corner, if you care about that sort of thing. I feel that for Hawaii there was a lot of value to our stay here for this location and would stay here again.

If your on a budget and have the ability to take a few nice walks, the beach is right across the street, a high end (Ala Moana) mall is to the West and Waikiki is to the East. All within a nice walk. A short drive to other great locations. They provide beach towel to borrow and have their own pool, a welcome drink and have in and out privilege parking ($29/day) and a resort fee of ($18/day) but it still fits the budget :)

This is a charming Hotel and I discovered this accidentally when my flight to Chicago was cancelled. I had to book this Hotel to stay for one night. Very clean, spacious and great maintenance. Walking distance to eateries and Stores and has a coffee shop/Bar. Great staff who were helpful. I recommend this Hotel for it's charm and area it's in.

This is a no frills hotel and has all the basic facilities. The maintenance could have been better but no major complaints. I wouldnt mind staying here just for the area. It is very close to the beach.

I stayed here on business and unfortunately was sick the 3 days in Hawaii. When I checked in, the guy behind the counter (Puka) was very kind and surprised me by upgrading me to the top floor since he knew I was having a rough time. The hotel itself is very charming. Full of antique furniture which is a breath of fresh air compared to all these corporate, mass-produced hotels. Easy 10 minute walk to the beach, lots of restaurants down the street, and plenty of shopping everywhere. There's even a coffee shop downstairs which is really convenient. Only bummer is it doesn't really have an ocean view but the beach is just so close. I would definitely stay here again.

Angela and I were so pleased to stay at this "treasure" of a hotel:-- staff -- professional yet warm and engaging -- thank you Jen for the morning Tumeric Lates, and Chris and Rene for all of your help in answering questions.-- room -- chique, clean, and quiet -- thank you to Mira for your thoughtful touches!-- bar -- great food and drink, chill atmosphere -- thanks to Ana? Can't remember your name, but our short conversation in German was delightful.We would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Honolulu, and we want to thank the Equus for having us. Worst part was having to leave and head back to ice and snow..... ; )

We got to the hotel early and our room was ready. Megan made it quick as we were tired from traveling. We got to the room and it had one bed (there were 3 of us all adults (a teen that was adult sized). We went back down to share our frustration with the room and Megan was soooo gracious. She put us in a different room that fit our family. That’s was the first wow factor. The next day we were trying to figure out where to go, our first time to Hawaii we were overwhelmed with choices. The absolutely amazing older lady at the front counter made the stay unforgettable. I would like to call her mama (for the life of me I can’t remember her name and it saddens me!), because she told me the ways and beat places fo go. We too her advice and have gone to all of the local places. As I sad chatting with her. We spoke about my love for IZ. We high fived, laughed together and I was sad we had to part. Our overpriced condo rental has NOTHING on the Equus and we would come back and stay at the Equus. Oh, don’t let me forget our valet person. A wonderful person as well. We stayed the Nov15-17, so if that helps the business know who was working those days I’ll just ask to please tell Mama, MAHALO. (Let her know we were the family with the daughter that has a broken back). Please give her big Colorado hugs for us! We will definitely be back!

Front desk staff was great. Nice hotel for a good price, chill atmosphere in a great location. Upon arrival they also gave us a complimentary drink ticket at the bar. The room had a keurig coffee machine and mini refrigerator/freezer.

Nice hotel, we check in this hotel one month ago and we met this lady named mhila. She was so nice and made our room so clean, she always greet the love and aloha to us. Mhila was so kind, so that’s why I’m writing this review for her so that I can appreciate what she did for us. I recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Thank you and god bless.

I normally don't take the time to write reviews but given the lengths the staff took to make sure my stay was a great one, I felt obligated to put in the time on this one. Since this wasn't entirely a vacation trip for me, I was definitely looking for something a little easier on the wallet, and the price was what initially what caught my eye. I was pleasantly surprised by both the location (short walk to Waikiki Beach) and the quality of the lobby/bar and rooms. There are plenty of restaurants, bus stops, and a grocery store all located within a short walk. Ala Moana Center is just down the road as well. I'd like to thank Rene, Meagan, and Cillaher at reception for helping me extend my stay and answering any questions I had. Thanks to Mihla and Jaquie for their hard work as well. I'll definitely be coming back if I need to stay in the Waikiki area again.

The location is smack dab in the downtown. There is a comfortable bar on the first floor and guests receive a complimentary welcoming beverage. Very clean and the towels are are plush!The highlight of our stay was the front desk service personnel. Renee is the quintessential embodiment of the "Aloha" spirit and Hawaiian hospitality. She offered very personal overviews of the unique history of the hotel and the city. Great recommendations of where to go and what to visit. Her manner and delivery is very relaxing in itself! Meghan who also was on the desk, called to see if our room was satisfactory. Later she e-mailed me to assure I had navigated the quirky WiFi set up.The hotel has a great connection to the polo players on the islands. The equine motif is very well presented and tasteful. It is so splendid that this is a hold out and not a cookie cutter chain hotel,Friends recommended this spot to us, as they had stayed here for a month while in the process of moving into their condo. They are very well traveled and gave this hotel stellar recommendations! We do too!! KUDOS!!!

Stayed there 4 nights during convention. Hotel located in a middle of downtown, but still very close to the river and beaches. Cosy atmosphere created by equestrian theme decor. Personnel are nice and helpful.

I did not want to stay in the hubbub of Waikiki, so this boutique hotel on the western edge of Waikiki was perfect. It's about a mile to central Waikiki, but there are also a park/beach, harbor, and the Ala Moana shopping mall (with amazing food courts) nearby. The valet parking at $29/night is expensive but convenient. There is coffee in the room but no restaurant--breakfast items can be purchased in the morning in the lobby, and there are restaurants nearby.
