The bar is small and we got gratis drinks one night during our stay. The room was relatively small but suited our needs. The staff stored our luggage until our room was ready. I recommend the Equus!

It's a small family owned boutique hotel. My family seeks these little gems out for the service and to be a little less mainstream. We were only in town for a concert, so we had a short stay but we fell in love with this cute hotel!The hotel is older, but it's the last standing family owned hotel in Waikiki, how can you beat that in a sea of high-rise corporate hotels? Rooms, linens and bathrooms are clean and look to have been updated fairly recently.It has a Paniolo theme, paying respects to the First cowboys to Hawai'i from Portugal. Plenty of of photos with tons of history!!Easy walk to Waikiki Beach and easier walk to Ala Moana Mall. The esspresso bar in the lobby is on point. Yummy coffee, and goodies sold all day. Puka at the front desk was a gem! We were misinformed about the airport shuttle, but he made sure we got all starightened out, and then called me to make sure we made it to the airport ok. Who does that anymore? He has the true Aloha spirit! Mahalo Uncle for taking care of us! We don't make it to Oahu often, we live on Hawai'i Island, but when we do we will be staying there again!

I stayed here because of the points I had. Nicely kept up. Older hotel. Luggage must be dragged up a staircase. After you make it up the stairs you’ll find a bar and elevator for your convenience. Comfortable stay. I was exhausted.

I enjoyed my stay at Equus hotel. I was very satisfied with my room its so very clean. The staff was very friendly and accomadating especially to Mhila Talledo one of the staff I met she's so nice they are lucky to have you. Thankyou, you make my stay very relaxing.

I have stayed twice at this hotel and had a excellent experience both times . Puka at the front desk as well as all the desk agents are great and very helpful and accommodating. The coffe/ bar staff are some of the nicest people to sit back , have a drink (excellent coffe or mixed drinks) and talk to. Everyone here seams to really enjoy being here and not just killing time till the end of the shift. I look forward to coming back here because of the people at this hotel.

Lots of positives...There are lots of positives re staying at the Equus including it being a relatively small family run hotel, early checkin, attractive small bar, short walk to restaurants/shopping at Ala Moana or easy access to Waikiki via 'The Bus' with a stop nearby.But there was a real negative for us... the aircon in our room. It was so hot we had trouble sleeing for the 3 nights we stayed at Equus. It seems in some rooms the power supply which runs the airconditioner is shared with the adjoining room thereby reducing output. We set the temperature to the coldest setting but that made it worse and we were advised to leave it on the default setting. We asked for help several times and staff visited to try to make improvements but no real change. Even a standing fan would have helped but none were available. Apparently most of guests have cool air air in their rooms so my advice would be to be ensure you have cool aircon when you arrive or ask to change to another room!

Equus hotel one of the neatest and aproachable staffs.One of the staffs named Mhila Talledo she's very nice and very friendly she makes my room very clean and relaxing.They are lucky to have her because she's the best and I hope i'll met her again I'll be back soon with my family.I'll recommend this hotel to my co-workers.

I am happy to say that I’ve visited this hotel 3 times, and I was offered complimentary welcome drinks at the bar. I was never once disappointed with the hotel staff or service. I will continue to come back to this great hotel with they’re amazing staff. I would recommend this hotel to all friends and family. Thank you Puka for making our stay in Hawaii easier, and relaxing! Mahalo!

The staff was wonderful! Especially the Hawaiian lady at the check-in desk, and housekeepers Jacque and Analyn. However, this hotel is NOT handicapped friendly. Only a staircase to main floor and although the staircase has handrails, no rails on the two steps up to the desk and none in the bathroom. There is an elevator once you climb the stairs, but only stairs to access the main floor and to return to street level. Granted, we did not request a handicapped-equipped room, but the staircase-only access to the main floor was quite a challenge when using a cane. See photo of stairs below. Again, the staff was friendly and provided excellent service. Sincerely, N. Houck

Equus hotel is the best...the staff were very friendly most especially to Mhila Talledo shes so nice.she make my room very clean the beds were very comfortable and very relaxing place to stay the Equus hotel ill recommend this to my friends and relatives.thank you for making my vacation memorable.

I'm so glad we found this hotel. Convenient to Ala Moana Park and the Mall (10 minute walk). Our room 1006 was on the top floor. View of the ocean from the common outside hallway. Nice room touches include robes, Keurig coffee machine, small fridge with a seperate freezer and a complementary welcome drink. Towels are provided for the small pool/beach and there is a filtered water dispenser. We filled our used water bottles nightly and froze them to have cold water at the beach. Room has enough plugs for electronics and A/C is quiet. Wi-Fi fast. The shower had good pressure.Just a few minuses, The driveway is 1 car wide. Valet parking only, but at $29/day for the area, reasonable. There are about 10 steps to the lobby from the street. It's a bit difficult to drag luggage, but valet will help. Only one elevator to rooms and it can be slow.But these few minuses are overshadowed by the very friendly, efficient staff.Thanks to Rene and Megan at the desk, Javian and Chris who helped with our car and luggage. Mira, Jacquie, Arlene and Duane kept our room clean and stocked.We had a wonderful stay and look forward to booking at The Equus again.

Stayed here for four nights. Great location. Nice room. Staff very helpful Our flight got in at 8:00 AM and Rene got us checked in early at noon. At the end of our stay Cher arranged for our airport transport

In the business of Waikiki is the Equus. Our room is very clean, the A/C is chilly as should be, and the staff is the nicest people so representative of the spirit of aloha. I didn’t even have to ask for help...’Puka’ saw right away I was looking for help. Immediately he came to assist us and made sure we were able to get our car. Service with a smile! Mahalo Puka!

We are'nt done with our stay and already feel super welcomed and cozy. First thing we pulled into the valet parking, we had great service from the General Manager, Christopher who did the valet himself. Super cool guy and good to see that management isn't the lazy type. Super comfy beds as well!

We stayed on the 10th floor 1 bedroom suite as soon as we walked in it felt like home comfy setting large living room area huge bedroom and also a large bathroom very very clean. as soon as we got there the valet guys was the the bomb even tho he was done with his shift he still got us checked in took our keys set everything up for us customer service was 100% i will be booking this hotel again and also let my family and friends know about this place.It was also my husbands and my birthday and our 9th wedding anniversary we got a personal note and a bottle wine we love it.Mahalo again to Rene and staff

There’s something so uniquely different about the Equus! You feel it right away when you step in the lobby. The vibe is cozy and, for a second, you feel like you’re in a completely different place, yet without a doubt still in Hawaii. A little gem, perhaps Waikiki’s “best kept secret.” And don’t go without trying their coffee. My choice is the turmeric coffee with coconut milk!

I got to wake up to a swim off Ala Moana Park , great coffee (and more...) and a staff who Never stopped helping me when I needed it. Cool pool, easy bar, Good room too... next time I’m going to get in on the horses!

Apparently this is the last remaining family owned and operated hotel in Waikiki. It is only 10 floors and the Giants have built all around it. The best thing is its location- a block from the Ala Moana Mall and Ala Moana Park and beach, only 15 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Sadly the rooms are very dark, the small balcony is useless as the AC units blow hot air from above and the small pool is dark and totally hidden from any sunlight. Staff for friendly but not daily cleaning of rooms

What a special and unique hotel. After a long overnight flight how wonderful to be greeted with a warm Hawaiian welcome by Rene, who then gave us our room key immediately. Clean room, very comfortable bed. The cafe downstairs makes the best coffee and then becomes a bar at 3.00pm. Friendly staff and great hospitality from Puka, Matt, Jan, Riley and all the others. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable.

We tried to use Airbnb and had a horrible experience. Decided to get a hotel after we were in Honolulu. What a find. This is a boutique hotel that is charming and has the best staff ever. Many of the staff have been there for over 20 years. Rene at the front is as authentic Hawaiian as it gets. There is a great coffee bar in the mornings ( i recumbent the Tumeric iced coffee) and then a Spirits Bar in the evening. We loved loved this place and would not stay anywhere else after this lucky find.

On this occasion we stayed at our favorite hotel in Waikiki. We were greeted by Yoshi one of long time employees.What a great place it's right on the main drag but still has a cozy feel about it. The New bar is a great addition To the lobby and pool area.I won't stay anywhere else in Waikiki.Brian F.Waianae, Hawaii

Definitely our go to hotel when visiting Oahu! The Equus was our home away from home for 4 nights and 5 days- (A family get away, birthday celebration, business trip all rolled into one weekend!)Mahalo to Aunty Rene who welcomed us with a beautiful smile and hug- best greeting ever! We arrived in the morning and were relieved to hear that we could check in early- no lugging around luggage .  Our room was clean, cozy and spacious- best of all we were surprised to see that the staff had placed a bouquet of roses in the room, birthday cake in the fridge along with a hand written note for my birthday!!! This was a great start to celebrating an epic weekend! We were so sad to be going home- but again was shown so much Aloha during check out with Uncle Puka- mahalo uncle for the speedy check out! We are definitely coming back in a couple months and we can’t wait!

Small but unique hotel, equestrian themed rooms and public space. Free drink upon arrival and the bar serves coffee in the mornings.. Rooms were good sized and very clean. Location was good, close to beach and harbor. We would recommend this hotel if you do not need a big resort type hotel with huge pool. Staff was very friendly.

Equus is a unique hotel amongst the towers of Waikiki. The staff are really friendly, thoughtful and accommodating. My room was just what I needed with super comfortable bed and execellent air conditioning. Got good use out of the little capsule espresso machine too. Location was good, could walk to good eats and stroll to the beach. Check in a bit slow but it didn’t bother me, the receptionist was pretty entertaining.

I booked this hotel for seven (7) people and called Rene for another day of stay for the other couple who is staying in Waikiki after our cruise. Amazing!!! everything went hassle free. Rene is the best of making you feel at home. Since I talked to him over the phone, I asked him if he knows my name by simple giving my last name, he remembers my first name, it was truly a great pleasure meeting someone like Rene. Cher is an ultimate charm too, the guys who help carry our luggage hats off to them too. Equus is great in training people but I believe in it is their personal style that makes you feel you are in Waikiki... great stay. Mahalo.

We had a great room we always get great service Rene and Puka. Makes our stay there so enjoyable and being away from the craziness in Waikiki is so relaxing it so enjoyable..the new lobby change makes it feel so personable it's truely a great change thank you to all your staff for aways making our stay relaxing and enjoyable ..much mahalo Twyla ululani Mendez

I cannot say enough about this hotel. Absolutely loved loved loved it. Extremely accommodating, great rates and locations. Renee is amazing as is Matt the bartender. 5 stars 5 stars. Location is perfect, but it’s the customer service that wins it

First I'd like to say what a beautiful upgrade you all did to your lobby it has such an inviting atmosphere it's so personable..Id also like to take the time to say how great Rene is with expressing that great aloha spirt and making you feel so important and like family.please give her our aloha ..our stay is always great I love staying there..mahalo for making our stay there just awesome and much Mahalo to your entire staff....

I arrived as weary traveller from a distant land looking for reprieve. I stumbled upon a small but welcoming abode. The Equus, as it was called, was as stunning as a stallion. I found comfort in the soft beds and spacious rooms. Ursula was really helpful, her friendly demeanor was the bow on top of this lovely gift of a hotel.
user_name:
WeariedWanderer
New York City, New York

review_body: They let us check in early as it was available (about 9-10am). Rooms are nice and comfortable. We might have mucked up with the aircon settings but they fixed it right away. They do daily hotel maintenance (hotel exterior, not room cleaning) from what we observed so it looks like they care a lot and respect their jobs. A walk away from beach, towels and apples provided.Very highly recommended if you are on a budget and want an overall clean and trustworthy experience.

My friend came to visit from the Big Island so we planned our stay 8/23-25 to attend a music venue & enjoy downtown! Considering the hurricane threatened to effect our staycation; we had a wonderful time! The staff at the hotel were so helpful, considerate, courteous & kind! All of the restaurants, bars, art & music venues and the beaches we wanted to enjoy were an easy walk away! Our accommodations were so comfortable and we could truly relax and enjoy our time despite the windy hurricane weather! We look forward to our next stay!

This hotel is in the Choice Privilege group. It's an older hotel but the beds are very comfortable, rooms are nice and look better than the exterior, it's close to the beach and activities and is significantly cheaper than other hotels. There is no elevator from the ground floor so you do have to walk up quite a few steps to the bar/lobby area. We have stayed at this hotel twice- in June 2018 and 7 years ago. This time, we stayed 4 days and rented a car for touring all of Oahu. Valet parking, which is the only option, is expensive- $28/night but it was nice to have a car. Both times, we have been satisfied with the hotel. If you want to be right on the beach, then this isn't the hotel for you. It also is close the mall where we walked to for a few meals. FYI- staff were very courteous and friendly.

We want to send a big Mahalo to our Equus 'Ohana! Thank you so much for taking care of us during our stay!We've been staying at the Equus for over 10 years now and one of the main reason is the hotel staff. Rene and Puka, since day 1, have always personified the aloha spifit and made the traveling experience heart felt by treating us like family. Their hospitality is so inviting. They greet us every morning, checking to make sure we are comfortable and satisfied with our accommodations. For me, a room is a room and a bed is a bed. So long as there is air conditioning and the room is clean I am content. What makes the hotel experience enjoyable is the positive interactions you have with hotel staff and thanks to people like Rene and Puka, we have found our home away from home here at the Equus. I feel that is what keeps us coming back to the Equus. I highly recommend staying here at the Equus and can't wait for our next stay. Mahalo again Equus 'Ohana!

We stayed for a weekend, and really enjoyed it. We got a free drink after we checked in, and there was live music at the bar. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. The location is convenient--it's a short walk to the beach, and there are a lot of decent restaurants nearby. As an added bonus, the beach near the Equus is much less crowded than the area near the Outrigger. On Friday evening, we were a short walk from the Hilton fireworks. We'd definitely stay here again.

This a well appointed hotel but not 5 star. The location was everything its a short to Ala Moana Mall and a good walk to Waikiki BlD. Enjoy a Sunset Maitai at the Surf Rider it is incredible.Easy Jog to the Beach and a Wonderful walk to my Fav Diner experience Restaurant. Fotr that Morning American Brekkie- Wailani's ... ExPat's understand...

One night stay this time enroute from Maui back to Australia. Stayed her last year and still love it., Some improvements, being the bar area and the happy hour and everything else as good as before, including the staff and service. Thanks again.

We just love this hotel and it's staff. We stayed here last year in Nov..2017. Check in was a breeze, staff very professional and made us feel at home. The housekeeper Fely kept our room clean and was always available for us when we needed anything in our room. Location for us is perfect, close to beach, restaurants and transportation to attractions. We have stayed here various times and we hope to come again! Love you Rene & Pao!

I stayed here for 2 weeks in November of 2017. As soon as I checked in they charged my credit card...that way you cannot cancel your stay and find another hotel. The room was dark and small. There is a reason they do not show you the balcony on the website - horrible and unusable. The furniture was old and breaking. Handles on the drawers were broken or missing and the bed was horrible. I was very afraid of bugs (ie. bed bugs)...however, I should be happy that the next day there was a note in my room advising me that there were doing their monthly bed bug and rodent check. That made me feel so much better. I strongly recommend any to really find something else. There are so many other places to stay.

Perfect, Prime Location with Great Rooms!Professional, Sincere, and Attractive Staff! Pleasant Accomodations and Amenities!Neat and Authentic Theme! Fun and Relaxing Coffee & Cocktails Bar! Cool, Clean, and Cozy Pool!

The executive housekeeper Jackie and front desk Ms. Rene made a minor request their priority. They went above and beyond to provide for our comfort. Aloha is alive in Waikiki wonderful staff so kind and considerate

quaint hotel in a very good central spot, the last private owned hotel on the strip and the owners and staff will bend over backwards to help , rooms are clean and service is good, what else could you want ?? oh yeah it has a great bar and happy hour

The price for Honolulu cannot be beat but beware...this hotel is extremely fated and small. Rooms are reasonable size but furnishings are super old. please note road noise is very loud at this hotel regardless of floor so that bothers you, find another place. it is by Hilton Waikiki Village.

Stopped in Waikiki after a beautiful vacation in Maui and was pleasantly surprised with my selection of the Equus Hotel. This little gem tucked away, up a staircase, offers a wonderful breakfast and coffee bar in the morning, generously sized guest room with a very quiet and effective A/C, a refrigerator with small separate freezer, and Keurig coffee maker. The bathroom is slightly on the small side but otherwise I would highly recommend this hotel. However the best thing about the hotel are the wonderful staff which truly make it feel like a "home away from home". Oh, the Welcome Cocktail was a special surprise.

We flew into Honolulu to get on the cruise ship the next day. We stayed at this hotel on that day, the day we got off the ship and about three days later before we left the island. The staff is very friendly. Be sure to ask for a room on the top floor or that has been updated. There is a small bar at the hotel and they serve a few items for breakfast but it is not free. It is an easy walk to the beach.

Rene was very nice and friendly. She extended her kindness to my daughter and I. Rene patiently explained to us the café is a separate business from the bar. We wanted to receive our complimentary drinks and café personal did not take time to explained like Rene did. thank you again! Rene bought our non- alcoholic drinks for us..

I still love this place and the staff Renee Brandon Puka Yoshi all housekeeping and nightshift you all are the best. Your boss on the other hand is a nasty and ignorant women who I am sorry you have to work for. I have spent a lot of time and money there and the ignorance and attitude that she gave me the last time I stayed was downright rude and highly unprofessional in almost every way shape and form.I have worked in management and if I had every spoke to a customer the way she spoke to me I would not have had a job after that.

I always like to give a disclaimer. We are a very practical family that sees the hotel as primarily a place to sleep and the location and cleanliness tend to be our top concern. That said...Pros: - Location. It is not on the beach but very close - easy walking distance to restaurants, beaches, shopping. Since the room has a fridge, we shopped a block down at the ABC store for incidentals.- Friendly staff - seemed like they liked their jobs- My most telling praise is would I stay here again. Yes.You should know: - It is not a new big chain hotel with an ocean view. You will find some things in your room that have been repaired. Our room had several patches on the ceiling. - It does have a set of steps you will have to overcome with your luggage in order to reach the elevator.- The decor is not modern. Attempts were made to make it more rustic to fit the theme kinda' like a B&B. This means that some of the furniture pieces are, in fact, older. Since each room is unique, do not expect the room you get to match the traveler's pictures.Needs improvement:- Put some more hooks in the bathroom to hang things PLEASE- I read in a review response that: "$11.00 per day, it includes Wi-Fi, daily in room coffee & tea, use of beach towels & chairs and a "wiki wiki" breakfast which includes muffins and fruits". While we were told about the towels and did take advantage of the Wi-Fi and coffee; we did not know about the "chairs". Nor did we know about the "wiki wiki" breakfast - that would have save us some trips to the ABC and McD's...and some money. Perhaps this was written in some literature that we should have read but when you are hotel-jumping it is difficult to keep track of which hotel provides which amenities. Please mention at check-in and/or provide a specific hand-out.

OMG!!! ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ I don’t know how to get started ... stuff were excellent!!!!!! I was treated like I was home. Rooms very clean !!close to the beach PUKA❤️RENE❤️ Very polite, friendy ....hotel looks just like the pics!!!

Clean and nice Hotel with convenient location and friendly staff ! We received helpful tips to get around Waikiki and check-in was smooth and very friendly by receptionist Rene . A very memorable stay but too short because of our schedule !

Staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!The location is fantastic and would stay here over and over. We liked that this hotel was quieter than the touristy places to stay.
user_name:
X4951WSericl
New York City, New York

review_body: The Equus is a boutique hotel and we booked it for an amazing price on-line a couple of weeks before we went.It is very groovy with a bar/cafe when you enter, large rooms, and ten minutes walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre. Also the bus stop is very close by too.I am paranoid about cleanliness and it was very clean and very well maintained. All the staff were wonderful. The lady who ran the cafe/bar, Rene, Yoshe. All very friendly and very helpful. Highly recommended.

We enjoyed the hotel and staffs are friendly. Rene, Winston are the most helpful! Thank you so much!!! We enjoyed the polo match as well. Thank you for the free tickets and it was a treat for our family!

The hotel is very well located only a few minutes walk from Waikiki beach and not that far from Ala Moana center shopping mall where there is a good food court and lots of designer and other shopping outlets. The furniture is a bit dated but the rooms were clean and comfortable and were cleaned daily. The staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. There was some traffic noise but you get that everywhere. The rooms were air conditioned. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

The bed was comfortable,the furniture needs replaced, dirty, worn. NOISY, there might as well not be a wall to the outside. Traffic noise is awful. They went green. Ants everywhere! Floor filthy. Doesn't feel sanitized. Yuck, I'm tired!

the equus was in a great location and a great hotel. this was my first time saying here, and it was nice to be in waikiki, but away from most of the craziness. brandon, renee and puka were so welcoming and accommodating!

Nice tucked away bar at hotel. A good break from busy touristy stuff. Great selection of cocktails and beers. Friendly staff. Bartender Matt goes out of his way to make all feel welcome. In the mornings the bar area shifts to coffee mode with excellent pastries and sandwiches. Jen is also friendly and does a great job!Highly recommend both bar and coffee shop!!

Called and spoke with Rene, she was very sweet and very helpful.. Went our of her way to help with all my request... The true meaning of the aloha spirit, The greatest display of CUSTOMER SERVICE.. Also spoke with Megan who also help in a huge way both on the phone and in person.. we will definitely be visiting here again Much mahalo,Monique

If you want to have a beer and feel like you belong to the island, Matt and Jared are the bartenders to hang with. Whether you are looking for a true local beer or you want to know about local places for great food, these boys are in the know. True southern hospitality the Hawaiian way.

Hotel has great location on Ala Moana Boulevard. 5 minute walk to both Ala Moana Shopping Mall for retail therapy and Beach Park for morning walks. There is an ABC convenience store 1 minute walk and bus stop to Waikiki beach area is 2 minute walk across the road.Furniture/decor is very nice and front bar is coffee/breakfast area in morning then full bar later in the day.Staff were very friendly and knowledgeable of local area and very willing to assist with tour details.We checked out in morning and our flight wasn't till late at night and we were given use of shower facilities in the evening.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for the weekend and absolutely loved it! This boutique hotel has a much more personal touch than the box chain hotels I’ve stayed in in the past. Everyone was so lovely- the valet who helped us store our huge surfboards and chatted about surfing with us, the receptionist was incredibly kind and helpful, the bartender at the paniolo bar downstairs was wonderful as were our drinks! The room was comfy and clean and large. Being located so close to the downtown Waikiki scene, Ala Moana, the beautiful harbor and beaches, and 5 star restaurants, made our stay that much more special. We parked the car for the night instead of trying to find parking all over waiakiki and just walked down to see the Memorial Day lantern ceremony after getting our drinks from the bar, then walked just 3 minutes to Chart House for an incredible dinner, cruised around the harbor and lagoon, before retiring for the night. Very comfortable bed, hard to get out of. Haha Overall fantastic stay! Would recommend.

I frequently travel to Oʻahu on business and before this year, Ala Moana has been my hotel of choice, mainly for convenience. I stayed at The Equus last weekend for the Na Hoku Hanohano awards show. I was so impressed with Brandon. He greeted us so warmly and had rooms ready, keys in hand and we were ready to go. Exactly what I need as I am always in a rush. The next day we were greeted by Renee and Puka. They so warmly gave us the breakdown of what was available as far as dining in the area, where to get lei for the show etc. I left on Sunday feeling like I was leaving family. This is what true aloha spirit is about, making people feel like they are at home. Until The Equus I thought that aloha spirit was lost in our visitor industry but these people proved me wrong. The aloha spirit is alive and well at The Equus!!! Mahalo nui

We stayed at The Equus while visiting family who live near the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. The position of the hotel was perfect for our visits and for shopping. 10 minutes max. It was also close to the other hotels which were pickup points for a couple of tours we did. The hotel itself is understated and not being a huge high rise has a lovely low key feel to it. The staff were accommodating while unobtrusive and the room itself very comfortable (if a little dark) There is a coffee shop in the entrance just off the street which turns into a bar in the evening. This proved to be perfect for a quick coffee in the mornings and a debrief drink at night. We felt like we were staying in a little secret part of Honolulu. Would stay there again.

I will definitely be returning. Great hotel. Great amenities. Awesome staff. Renee, Brandon and Puka were beyond helpful and made our stay even that much better. The rooms are clean and spacious. The bar is excellent and friendly, we received 2 free welcome drinks. They even give out towels for trips to the beach. Close to everything. Loved it.

Equus one of the hotel that i rated it 5...it is so amazing.....tha staffs are very friendly most especially to Mhila of the staff that we met shes so friendly and always.smiling they are lucky to have you...the rooms are clean and very comfortable place to stay...ill recommend this hotel to our friends and we will be back soon....

We stayed here for 4 days of our trip to O'ahu. (To attend Hawaii Pacific Graduation!!!!) The hotel was in a great location as we preferred to walk most places to eat, swim, and shop. The parking was a little tricky because the rental car company gave us a large SUV rather than the midsize we reserved. The Valet was AWESOME and took care of the parking for us. Our room was clean and bright. The windows opened and we had a great breeze blowing through our room at night. The hotel provided towels for the beach and had a splash pool if you didn't feel like swimming in the ocean very nearby. I have to say, I am all about the coffee in the morning. The morning coffee bar and breakfast treats were really good and served with a smile! The service was excellent and everyone was so friendly! We had the opportunity to visit the Polo Club on Sunday as well. What a great day! The horses were beautiful as was the ride up there. The beach the club is on is also worth the ride up. So many rainbows and seashells! Thanks for a great stay and to Emily M for recommending:-)

Great location. . the room is spacious and clean my friends and i had the best sleep, thanks to mhila one of the stuff she's friendly and always smiling us we will definetly stay here again soon, i'll tell to my friends who are planning to stay there vacation to check in hotel i'll recomend this equus hotel to them.

The Equus is a great little boutique resort virtually right across the street from the Wikiki beach. Though there was no contential breakfast the staff had some fresh apples out for guests and Rene even gave me her personal granola bar before my beach run. Supposedly they also have a 100-acre area where they have polo fields and horse riding with free transportation to and from. That will have to be next trip!Support this local hotel. It's the last locally owned hotel on the island. Thanks to Rene and Cillaher for all their help. I even was able to meet up with my best friend there that I hadn't seen in 3 years. We both ended up staying there unbenounced to each other. It was meant to be, all at the Equus!

Unfortunately my friend and I had a failed airbnb experience and we had to find a hotel very last minute. (As in we had to find a hotel for the next day). We were super doubtful because almost everything was booked or super expensive in Waikiki. However we found the Equus hotel and it was seriously a heaven sent gift. The staff was so nice and understanding. They were so patient and chill. They even offered us complimentary tickets to a beautiful ocean side polo match~ I believe they are the one of the last locally owned hotels and honestly I wish I had booked this place from the beginning. The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated. And it comes with a local Hawaiian vibe. All to say this is probably the hotel I would come back to when I'm back on this beautiful island.

Really enjoyed our 5-night stay at the Equus.Lots of positives:Rene at front desk - if you can't relax around Rene, you just can't relax! Rene offered us complimentary tickets to a polo match at Hawaii Polo Club (in Waialua). We took her up on her offer and ended up having a total blast. Polo field is right next to the beach. Enjoyed the polo match, swimming, food trucks, bar, post-match concert and hours-long dance party!Valet parking staff are super friendly.Room was clean, bed/pillows were comfortable. Housekeeping (by Mhila) was spot-on.Staff responsive to needs & requests.Live acoustic music Friday night.Bartender & musician gave us great information about island activities.Location - close to beach, restaurants, Ala Moana Mall. Walked to Ala Moana Park for some stand-up paddleboarding (& saw several sea turtles...pretty cool).Could be better:Called front desk to request an extra blanket our first night...but no one answered, so had to head downstairs in my pjs. Luckily, Chris just so happened to be bringing some other guests to our floor, and he radioed for said blanket...which was delivered in less than 10 minutes. Housekeeping brought us a nice comforter the next day.Carpet in our room could use a deep cleaning.Traffic was pretty noisy but the comfortable bed/pillows helped us sleep through it.No ice machine on our floor, but got ice from front desk.

Rene, javian & team were extremely helpful and are such lovely people.We actually booked in next door for a different hotel but their check-in and staff weren't available until 3pm. My partner was extremely sick when we arrived and Rene helped us with a room so he could rest u till we were able to check-in next door. She was so lovely. And the same with all her staff. If i hadn't had paid for my other accomodation, i would have loved to have stayed at The Equus Hotel. Décore is themed throughout and the rooms are really cute and clean! For one of the last privately owned hotels with such a big history - this was an amazing experience from a guest who just happened to stumble onto this gem.

We stayed there for 5 nights. Generally, we had a great time there. The staff there were all very nice and friendly. They responded to our requests quickly. They also gave us many good suggestions for tours or restaurants. We stayed there for a conference and it's very close to the Hawaii convention center. The hotel is in the Waikiki area so we can easily walk to the Waikiki beach or find some good restaurants nearby. However, the soundproof of the room was worse than I think. You can easily hear the sound from the main street even when the window is closed. If you are easily affected by noise at night, you should have a pair of ear plugs. Also, the bathroom in our room smelled a little moldy. Some other small issue like we still did not get our water kettle after we requested twice. The WIFI is not fast enough.If you are looking for a good-price hotel in the Waikiki area, this hotel may be a good choice. However, you have to keep in mind that it's a old hotel with noise problem. The room is very clean though. The staff there are also very nice and helpful.

The customer service that I received at The Equus Waikiki was the best service I've experienced by any Hotel in a long time. They were understanding and responsive to a miscommunication that was a mistake on my part and helped me resolve it quicly and efficiently. A great big thank you to the staff Renee, Chris,Junjun and Jazian for making my experience a great one. I will definitely book with the Equus waikiki whenever I am in Waikiki!

Rene was the most welcoming lady to this gorgeous hotel . We had been let down by another hotel on arrival . We wandered into this little piece of paradise and she made us welcome and took special interest in us each day and gave us local knowledge . The room was comfortable and clean , the cafe on site was friendly in the mornings and then a happy hour bar at night . We will go back and recommend to anyone . Handy to beach , all amenities. Lovely family atmosphere . Thanks Rene x

We spent our first night on Oahu at the Equus. It was quaint, nicely decorated and a very short walk to the Mall. This is the last family owned hotel in Honolulu and I was very happy to patronize them. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The coffee bar made really delicious drinks and has cocktails in the evening. Our room was large, clean and comfortable. It think this was a very good value. I would stay here again.

A charming boutique hotel with Hawaiian Hospitality. I happened to arrive the day before the grand opening of the Paolini Bar and Coffee Bistro. More than one staff member made it a point to invite me to join in their grand opening celebration. So glad I went! I saw Hawaiian traditions and hospitality that far exceeded my expectations for this trip. This place is quaint, peaceful, and cozy. The owner and the staff all interact with guests in a way that is much like a B & B. The building (and my room) showed signs of aging, but I know that there are updated rooms and renovations underway. Ask for an updated room, and be sure to note that there are stairs leading to the lobby. Also of note, Ala Moana Park/Beach is within walking distance. Much better beach than Waikiki. Thanks for the hug, Puka!

Wonderful place to stay in town for my first trip to Oahu. Everyone that works there is so friendly & kind. They all go above & beyond expectations for anything you may need. I will definitely be coming back again!

Hubby and I enjoyed our staycation at the Equus. staff is friendly, Renee at the front desk, Maraiah at the bar, and Mhila in housekeeping were all accommodating, friendly and helpful. Great customer service. Thank you for making our stay enjoyable and memorable.

I found this little gem for the last 2 days of our vacation. I was looking for a reasonable price for 2 adults and 2 teens. We were able to walk to the mall, Waikiki, the marina It was the perfect location to walk everywhere! It’s a clean and nicely appointed place to stay. I loved the equestrian theme. There were great photos of Hawaiian cowboys and polo. Neat little pool, bar and coffee shop. The lobby was an experience. Great prices .Loved it!

Unexpectedly in Honolulu on my own for several days. Hadn't been here for 30 years. Found the hotel online and what a find. This "boutique " hotel dead opposite of sterile, modern generic highrises. Greeted personally on arrival at 7am by the lovely welcoming Rene. She , like most of the staff, has been here for decades in this family owned hotel. Despite the early hour, she found me a room to sleep off my 10 hrs plane trip.Rooms and beds very comfortable with fridge and excellent coffee maker provided. Absolutely spotless. Plenty of places to sit in lobby, pool area, bar, to chat to people. All staff, especially bartenders, incredibly friendly and helpful- providing lots of info about things to do and places to go. As a result, guests also chat away with those from other parts of the world. Location is superb with easy walking access to shops, restaurants, beach. The only drawback is proximity to very busy road so traffic noise pretty continuous. However, I am a very light sleeper but was given a room as far away from street as possible which was fine.If you want a completely different Waikiki experience from the standard provided to millions of tourists, at a very reasonable price, this is the place to stay.

While we were in Honolulu for 5 days we stayed at the Equus Hotel, close to the Waikiki beach area. There are many places to eat in the area and the mall is within walking distance as well as the beaches including Waikiki. The bus stop is less than 2 blocks away. This Hotel is in a great location and there are many things to see and do in the area. Staff was very helpful and the rooms were very comfortable. Would stay here again on return to Honolulu.

What a wonderful first time in Hawaii and what made it even better was the staff at this hotel..Very welcoming and always very pleasant made the stay enjoyable. The valet attendants were always smiling I mean the staff it self was Amazing. Management keep up the great work with all your employees and your hotel . Rooms very clean and kept up as well as the grounds. Mahalo all of you at Equus until we meet again.

So this was my first visit to Hawaii so I wasn't sure what to expect. My friend and I stayed here twice during our trip. When were were Island hopping they let us leave our bags behind to save us lugging the whole lot and it saved us money on airline baggage. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The room was adequate and in a great location away from the real tourist part but close enough to walk to the main shopping centre and beaches. It is the only locally owned hotel so it had a nice history to it. The pool wasn't available during our stay due to upgrades but we didn't miss it as we used the pools at the Hilton which is close by. The price was right for a budget to mid range hotel in what was a busy time in early August 2017. I'd definitely stay again on a return trip.

we stayed in the Equus Hotel twice during our trip. once for one night and the other for 3 nights. the room we got for our first stay was on the 3rd floor, at the end of hallway. it was kind of out dated but adequately clean. there was a weird odor in the bathroom. our room for the second stay was better. it was on the 6th floor, also at the end of hallway. the room seemed to be in a better condition than the first one. and felt cleaner. the staff was nice and friendly. the hotel is at a great location. walking distance to the ala moana shopping center. very close to other shops and restaurants in the waikiki area.

Positives:1. Front desk people are exceptionally good at making you feel welcome2. Rooms are cozy3. Close to ABC store, beaches, Ala Moana, and restaurants4. PriceNegatives:1. Rooms are a bit smaller than the pics suggest2. No microwave 3. Pool closes at sunset4. Far way from the beaches tourists may want to visit. Hopefully this hotel keeps their way of catering towards locals because I would definitely stay here again. Brandon at the front desk was great and the entire staff was very helpful during our stay.

The rate and reviews made me choose this hotel. Not what I am used to but at the end of my stay I was very pleased. Small, clean a little outdated but cannot beat the location if you are using public transportation. Very pleasant check in. I asked to check out a day early and had no issues. We were allowed to keep the room a little longer to freshen up before heading to the airport. Front desk people were very warm and helpful.

I've stayed 3 nights at this awesome boutique hotel .I had a great stay ! I've dealed with Rene , Puka and the Siberian girl ( Istella ) and they were fabulous .I liked the location , the little coffee machines in the room , the cleanliness .Thank you !

Great place to stay for the price we paid! Staff were awesome and very accomadating. Room was clean and a good size. Strongly recommend this place! From the Kiwis!! The walk to shopping mall is 5mins and the beach is a 10min bus ride. We loved our stay.

Located perfectly right across the road from the yacht harbor, this little hideaway is a quality and budget choice. There is a small pool, a bar, morning coffee bar and very friendly and helpful staff.

Location is awesome with bus stops about less than 5 minutes walk away. McDonald's and ABC mart is just 1 minute walk where you can grab snacks, drinks and souvenirs too. Ala Moana Center is about 8 minutes walk and you can enjoy food and shopping. It is also very accessible to the beach, just 8 minutes walk.Hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We arrived on an early flight and requested for a room before official check-in hour. Puka kindly helped with the arrangements and we were able to get to our room a couple of hours earlier than expected. We really appreciate it. Other staff at the front desk whom I didn't get their names were very friendly too.Rooms were well equipped with coffee machine, cookies, clean towels and bedsheets and toiletries. Carpet felt a little dusty and it would have been good to have bedroom slippers. If you get a room nearer to the road, it can get pretty noisy due to constant traffic. Light sleepers should request for quieter rooms away from the road.

This little gem should not be missed if your are looking for comfort, location, and amazing staff.The staff: Brandon, Matt at the bar, Yoshi, Rene, and Mira housekeeping are incredible. They cannot do enough for you. They will drop everything to answer your tourist questions and all of their recommendations have been spot on!Mike the hotel owner and Jen the bar owner are there for you too and you walk away from every time with a smile and a feeling of satisfaction.

This is the third year in a row I've stayed at this hotel. Great location, quiet, and clean. Hats off to the staff, Mike, Rene, and Puka, who really made my stay enjoyable. Can't wait for my next visit in the fall.

I am truly surprised seeing all those favorable reviews about that hotel. I can say two positive things regarding my stay at the Equus - the place is cheap and has convenient location in downtown Honolulu. Everything else was far below my expectations. The interior is old and worn, in my opinion should be replaced long time ago. Moreover, the staff does not use any scent inside the hotel. The only thing you could smell was dust and hot air. I would expect from Hawaiian hotel a pleasant, floral scent at least in the main lobby. The room itself was average, moderately clean and very dark. Sliding door was difficult to use/lock. Toilet and shower were tiny, which didn't bother me. Problematic guests were another issue. Terrible screams were heard at night. Happily, I did not find any bugs in my bed. At the end of my stay I asked for an invoice. Despite promises, I have never received it. Bottom line is that I would not stay there again.

My friend and I stayed at The Equus for a few days and the hotel was in the perfect location, walking distance to great restaurants, shopping, etc. We booked one night here and later that night we decided to book another night because of how clean and beautiful the hotel was. Rene was awesome, she was very helpful and made our stay more enjoyable! I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Boutique? Absolutely not in the British sense of the word. Small, basically a room only place, rooms accessed via elevator onto open air corridors, with a very small bar area that offers coffee and coissant type breakfast and vastly overpriced cans of beer. Rooms very old and dated, wardrobe is a peculiar cupboard with a wire shelf in it in bathroom! Single glazed so VERY VERY VERY noisy at night. If you are a light sleeper then no chance. If you are a smoker of any description DO NOT STAY HERE. Can't even have a fag on your own balcony! Lit up 3 steps from street level on the way out, in itself completely outside, to be accosted by some snotty nosed little bell hop type following me up the road being most insistent that I had signed a contract so I could not smoke within 400ft of the building. Absolutly no disabled access. Plus points, well positioned for everything. Relatively clean. Lots of clean towels, good air con. No idea how much I paid for this place as booked as a package through travelbag, however my advice would be to spend a little more and stay in one of the proper hotels of which there are many in this area.

We normally stay at Queen Kapiolani but we came across this hidden gem on a last minute booking. At first we were skeptical about the outward appearance but after Checking in with Yoshi and open the doors to our room we discovered a hidden gem ! I’ve been reading a few other not so nice reviews and I scoffed at it. This hotel had quite the charm, It was clean and comfortable ! A few blocks from the busy shopping area on Waikiki . Ok people that complain about parking, and all the other little things and fees Hello ! You are going on vacation to a tourist destination ! Expect all these things ! But what won us over was the staff ! From valet to the front desk, housekeeping they were the plus !!!! When we checked out I got to “talk story” with Auntie Rene, and was telling me about the history and the equestrian theme of the hotel and another plus Local Owned ! It really made me sad to go home it’s like that feeling of leaving after visiting Ohana. The manager even came in to help with valet, Very rare now days to have genuine conversation with staff at hotels it really made it a great experience for us, I hope that you guys give Equus Hotel a chance ! As for the staff I hope your manager will see this and recognize what a great team He/She has ! Keep us the great work and a Mahalo Nui Loa for making our short stay a great one ! Looking forward to coming back and will definitely share to friends and Ohana to check out Equus :)

A very welcoming hotel in the Ala Moana area of Honolulu. This last family owned and operated hotel provides personal attention to assure visitors have a positive & relaxing experience of 'Ohana' (family). Fresh complimentary oranges & apples in the lobby are nice touches along with an in-room coffee maker & fridge. Take a shuttle from airport and you will be within walking distance of Waikiki, Ala Moana Center, restaurants & bus/trolley stops. Know in advance that you must climb stairs to access lobby & elevator. Security, private pool & on-site cafe were all welcome. Very clean, comfortable beds, attentive housekeeping staff. Ask for a unit with lanai - just delightful for sky watching! We hope to return when on island of Oahu.
Best hotel I've stayed in on the island. The bar is the cat's pajamas, the bee's knees, you get what I'm saying. If Emily is your bartender, then you're in good hands. Chill vibe, close to downtown.

I rated this hotel because of the service- Winston our conceigere was outstanding!! Accommodating us to the fullest. I’m not sure of the gentleman at the desk tonight (Feb 6, also, outstanding and accomidating! We had to leave our luggage at hotel till 9:00 p.m. and no one got annoyed, we took out what we needed and awesome! Also there is a shower in the women’s restroom by the bar, I could shower after for a quick dinner before we left for the airport! So rare to have this ability in a Hotel. Thank you to all your staff!!

No demons here, just a solid property with many advantages over comparable Hotel’s in its price range. Family owned and operated with genuine old style service. I have been a multiple return guest in recent years and it suits on many levels.Particularly it’s location with a 5 minute walk to Alla Moana mall and 15 minutes into Waikiki . 10 minutes to the beach and very close a beach walking track for some fitness activities without dealing with cars. The rooms have a good fridge, microwave and a safe, which is always handy to store your valuables. I sleep well in the beds and enjoy the walk in shower, not the typical American shower in the bath crap. They have recently opened a bar opposite the reception to enjoy a welcome beer or cocktail after a long day outside. They also offer a light reasonably priced Breakfast.It’s not 5 Star, but a solid mid range option.

I really loved this boutique hotel. Everyone there was so friendly. The rooms were clean and inviting. We arrived before check in time and they were happy to store our bags so that we could go get a bite to eat. We had a great sleep and woke early the next day. We had a Pearl Harbor tour scheduled and again they were happy to store our luggage. Made me wish I had more time to visit Honolulu. I will definately keep them in mind for next time. Loved the sense of family here.

I arrived at 11:15 on a Friday morning to see if I could store my bags somewhere until check-in time. Puka (sp?) at the registration desk handed me the key to my room and said have a nice stay! Awesome!!! Mahalo!

Being a regular business traveler to Honolulu, I was bummed out that my normal lodging arrangements were not available. Since I am also a Choice member, I was pleased to see that The Equus Hotel was affiliated with Choice so I figured I would give it a shot. I will admit that I was a little skeptical at first, but my mind was put at ease shortly after my arrival. PROS:The location is great. Right on the outside of downtown Waikiki so you aren't going to be blasted with all the noise coming from the hustle and bustle from the street below. Easy walking distance to the beach, downtown and the Ala Moana mall and surrounding shopping areas. Room: My accommodations were very comfortable. One of the nicest beds I've had the pleasure of sleeping on in a long time. Room size was ample and by far exceeded my needs. Bathroom and shower was a little smaller than I would have liked, but you can't necessarily have everything. Amenities: Love the morning coffee in the room and downstairs in the lobby. Jen is extremely friendly and provides the utmost in customer service. She makes a mean latte too! In the afternoon, Matt the bartender does a fantastic job! Very attentive to the guests and knowledgeable about the area, things to do, places to visit and where to have a good time. Made the best Pisco Sour I have had in a long time. Only one better was in Chile'. CONS: If I had to list anything, the only things I could really gripe about would be the elevator. It gets a little creaky around the 7th floor, but I never felt unsafe in it. I will admit that $25 a day parking with valet only is a little bothersome, but far from a showstopper. There was one afternoon when I returned from work to find no valet in sight, but Kika (the manager on duty) was quick to assist me and address the situation. If you can find a better option for parking in Waikiki, be my guest, because every place in town charges for parking, but you are going to miss out on what really makes this hotel something special......the people. The staff here was fantastic. From Mike and Mariah, to Kika and Matt, Jen, the valets and all the hotel staff, there is a true sense of family which is what makes The Equus my new hotel of choice in the Honolulu area .

Web photos are deceiving. This hotel needs some TLC. Maintenance is needed. Cramped rooms, mostly facing busy, all-night traffic eliminates a quiet sleep. Weathered mattress. Cramped lobby, cramped pool, and cocktail lounge. Located near Ala Moana. In-room coffee is weak. Hotel lift is noisy and scary. Unfortunately, there is not much in this place that would suggest a return.

Stayed here for one night an loved it. The hotel an room was really clean an neat. The people at the hotel were really nice to me there names were Jacquie, Jun jun an also the desk worker was really nice her name was Rene. They have all have good service. Id love to stay here again an hopefully soon. Thanks

Renee,Brandon,Nancy,Yoshi and all of the Equus ohana all go out of their way to accommodate you and make you feel as close to home as possible even when home may be thousands of miles away. Thank you all for providing amazing service in a clean facility all at a reasonable price. When I stay at Equus I'm not just staying anywhere I am staying with ohana. Mahalo Nui Loa

Great & friendly service!! Location is VERY convenient! No long waits for elevator, or parking valet! VERY clean!!! Room service is quick! I recommend this hotel 100%! Thank you Equus Hotel and employees for your wonderful hospitality. We’ll definitely return.

This quaint little hotel in the middle of a busy part of Honolulu is a gem! The rooms were a little small, but cute and clean. We enjoyed our stay tremendously. The pool was right outside the room, filtered water always ready, and front staff were extremely friendly.

Awesome!! Beautifully clean rooms, bed was like a cloud that was almost to good to leave every day. Staff were friendly and very helpful - awesome little bar downstairs with some delicious cocktails, recommend stopping in for a drink before heading out for the night. Location was awesome all you need, many restaurants around and only short walk from the main strip and beaches! Couldn’t recommend this place more - you will not regret your stay

Staying there for 3 night is a wonderful memory for our honeymoon. The location is quite good, having ABC mart, MacDonald’s and near the bus stop. When we stepped inside the hotel just feel like “I’m home!” The counter staff Renee, she’s so nice and provided a very good service to us. She also advised us some place that must-go in Hawaii. Also, the room is definitely clean and offer anything you need. It’s a must-stay hotel and we definitely will choose there to stay again.

Amazing family owned boutique hotel with great helpfull service! hotel bar and cafe is a perfect touch. Da hi brew cafe has hand crafted esspresso and delicious morning snacks. The Paniolo bar looks like it will be amazing when it opens this month.

Didn't think much about the name of the hotel until we arrived as viewed the beautiful polo and horse decor about the rooms and lobby. If you love horses, this is the place to spend the night! Close to the beach, Outback Restaurant, and we were lucky enough to see fireworks on the beach from our room on a Friday evening! Very friendly and informed staff. Loved it. Thanks!

I arrived early (8am) and Puka allowed me to check in. Thanks mate! Room was nice, great deal!"Amenities include a plunge pool, a terrace and a business center. There's also free access and transportation to the hotel's sister property, which offers a beach, dining and horseback riding, plus polo matches at an affiliated polo club."

This hotel is comfortable and good value for money. It's near the Hilton Haiwaiian Village Hotel which has the beach at the back. I could not work out the tea making facilities in the room - they should just provide a normal kettle.There are no numbers in the room to call reception.Wifi was free although not made clear when checking in - had to make enquires. Slow to begin with but then got faster.Good check out time of 12pm.Some noise at night but it was not a problem for me once I got to sleep.I booked initially for one night, then extended to another night - I was able to stay in the same room.Friendly, helpful service.Bible available in room.Good strong shower.Near ABC Shop, McDonalds and Subway. If you want to save some money and stay in a decent hotel - this one will be adequate.

Warm, welcoming staff quick with local tips and a smile are the best thing about this hotel, but we also loved the location on the quiet end of Waikiki, within walking distance to the beach and Ala Moana. Rooms have real Hawaiian charm without being kitschy, and the lobby coffee bar is nice too. Things to note- street noise, particularly on the lower floors could be troubling for light sleepers- due to the greenery next door, the lower floors can be a bit dark. Opt for higher if you need morning light- reception is up a flight of stairs, though the valets kindly carried my big suitcase

I'm not sure why I was shocked about this little "boutique" hotel. I guess because all of the other hotels along Ala Moana Blvd. started in the $250 price range. This was a great little find near Waikiki Beach. There were good restaurants within walking distance (just ask the front desk, they'll tell you where they are). I have a simple rule about the hotels I stay at. They must be clean, safe and quiet. This hotel met all of my requirements. The staff was very friendly. There is a young man by the name of Winston, who will help you with tours. He's awesome. They have a specialty coffee bar for that extra morning kick. And, they said they will be having a wine bar for the evenings coming soon. I would stay here again.

My husband and I visited Honolulu for the first time and our stay was AWESOME!! We stayed at the Equus Hotel and this is going to be our place to stay anytime we visit Honolulu. We have already recommended the Equus to our friends. Rene Kahumoku is a JEWEL! This place feels like home away from home.

This is a family run business where staff are welcoming and offer friendly service well beyond what is given at name brand corporate hotels. They were exceedingly accomodating and professional. Can't wait to stay with them again.

Another fabulous stay at Equus. This is by far my favorite hotel on Oahu! This is a small family owned, boutique hotel I stay at least once a month, and I live here on this island. It is not the Waldorf or the Ritz but it does feel like home. It is close to where we need to be and the price is right. I can stay for a fraction of what the big hotels charge and as a result stay more frequently.The staff treats us like one of the family. Super hospitable and appreciative of our business.Decimate yes!!

We've finally returned to honolulu and stayed at our favorite spot, the Equus! You can always count on feeling the aloha spirit while staying at this hotel. We really feel like we've become a part of the Equus 'ohana, always being well taken cared of by Puka, Rene, and all the staff. They are always there to talk stories about your day, and just making sure that you're as comfortable as possible. The rooms are always refreshing with the most comfortable beds. We stayed at the Equus from 12-7 to 12-10 and our mornings would start with a refreshing dose of Puka and Rene; sharing laughs, talking about Hawaiian culture, and connecting through sharing memories from our life. Our last day was bitter sweet. We would return to our home on the big island but we were leaving our Equus Ohana (family). We've made a connection with everyone at this hotel through their simple kind gestures and amazing attention to our needs as guests. Can't wait to return. Thank you folks so much for everything you always do for our family. Me ke aloha nui!

Aloha,My family and I had three rooms and every room was clean and with nice furniture.We’ve stayed at The Equus numerous times and it never surprises me that we receive a very warm and humble welcome from Puka and Rene. They both have the “aloha spirit”. We are very grateful for their kindness and expertise in the hotel industry etiquette. It is over and beyond what a person will learn in any training. They possess the real heartfelt aloha. We thank you very much Puka and Rene. We look forward to returning. MAHALO!

A lovely hotel, not far from the thick of things in Waikiki. A quick walk to the Ala Moana shopping complex. The room was well laid out with a balcony. The pool isn't large and it doesn't get a lot of sun. The outstanding thing, however were the staff. They were so friendly and so nice! I really felt welcomed at this hotel!

Shout out to the reception manager, Puka for helping us accommodate early check-in even though we understand rooms are quite full because we arrived during thanksgiving season from New Zealand. He was so kind and hospitable making sure we are comfortable since we really look a bit exhausted travelling with children and baby plus luggage. Room is clean and fresh, always changing our daily towels and beddings. Unlimited Kuerig coffee cups, yummy muffins and fresh fruit to start your morning. Best Hotel location for us, 5 mins walking distance to the Ala Moana Mall, Ala Moana Beach, ABC souvenir shops and restaurants. Pleasant memorable family holiday experience. Will definitely come back soon. :)

I had a computer glitch of some sort and reserved a date in Dec, when I needed that date in August. We are not sure how it happened, but I did not catch the mistake until I received an email asking about my stay. Choice Hotels tried to reach the manager several times for me, but all they were able to do was leave a message. I took a chance an called the Hotel directly and Rene answered the phone. He was the manager that was needed and when he heard what happened he bent over backwards to help me in every way he could. Such a Gem. If the hotel is half as nice as he is it will be a great stay. Thanks Rene.
user_name:
Debra V
Ft. Rucker, Alabama, United States

review_body: We stayed here for 11 days and we were greeted with a smile from day 1 till day 11. Staff will go above & beyond to help you out in any way they can. The rooms that my family and i stayed in were always clean & neat everytime we would return from a day out. Got to meet some of the awesome staff...Renee, Puka, Jackie, Raymond & the operations manager (sorry i didnt get her name) but they were awesome and so so nice to us especially when it was our first time in Beautiful Hawaii! Location of the Equus was perfect as alot of shops was within walking distance (Alamoana Shopping Centre). Buses were just across the road to go to Waikiki and alot restaurants to choose from which was also within walking distance. My family & i loved staying here and we couldnt be more happier with the choice we made to stay at the Equus Hotel. Will definitely stay at the Equus again when we return to Hawaii. The staff at the Equus are beautiful people and they make you feel at home. Mahalo to everyone at Equus Hotel.Love from MelbourneTunai Family & Seulupe Family

I stayed at the Equus twice a few years ago, and a couple of years before that. I was on my own, just looking for some peaceful R & R. I loved staying here because the service was great, the staff, was friendly, the location was great, and the price was right. I stayed about a week (5-6 days) each time, and I liked being just out of Waikiki (i.e., close enough to go there if/when I wanted, but not being in the middle of all the hustle bustle). I also liked the proximity to Ala Moana shopping center and to the beach park across the street. I'm writing this NOW, because I booked another stay there for my 50th birthday, but had to cancel last minute, because of the wildfires burning in California, near to my home. I had booked months in advance, online, and gotten a great rate, but without the ability to change or cancel as a result. I called the hotel and spoke with Rene, and she gave me a full refund anyway, because of the very unfortunate circumstances. I hope that my home does not burn... my family and I left town because of the fire danger and the hazardous air quality. I am grateful to Rene and to the Equus for their flexibility and understanding. I do plan to re-book at the Equus, if and when we return home, and once everything has settled down to "normal" again. I am sad about having had to cancel my trip, as I was so looking forward to returning to paradise, but as soon as I can, I'll be back. Wait for me Equus!

Can’t say enough of how thankful and grateful my ‘ohana and I are for Rene and Puka. They go over and beyond to make our stay so comfortable. They treat us like family and exemplify the true meaning of Aloha ❤️ They also have a great rapport with their employees which shows on how attentive and kind they are to us and other guests. What more can you ask for. We are loyal customers and look forward to returning soon.Mahalo nui nui loaPauole ‘Ohana - Kailua-Kona, Hawai’i

I only needed 1-night stay before my cruise. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. The location is close to the port and within walking distance of the shopping mall and restaurants. This made the stay worthwhile. However, this hotel is very dated. The furnishings in the room are very outdated. The rug and lampshade in my room had stains. The shower stall was the smallest that I have ever seen. I would think this would be an issue for larger people. The free wifi was very weak. The rate of this hotel was lower than other hotels in the area. This was good enough for 1-night pre-cruise but this hotel would not be a choice for an extended length of time.

Aloha~ The Equus Hotel is my ‘Ohana’s home away from home. I feel selfish in that, I don’t want to share & keep this hidden oasis a secret from the world. Would not want to stay anywhere else when we visit Oahu. Top notch customer service!It’s pretty rare to find places in Hawaii where the true “ALOHA” still exist. But, You’ll find it here with Rene, Puka and the staff at the Equus.. They live and breath Aloha. It is not learned, it just comes from within. And these two special Friends that became Family exemplifies that true meaning of “ALOHA”.To the Equus management. I nominate Rene and Puka for employee of the month/year. They make the Equus what it is today and everyday and that is why we keep coming back. Also, want to Mahalo some of the new faces that joined the Equus team. Ke Aloha Nui,Kalei and Paul Vigilla

The Equus Hotel is truly a hidden gem. Perfect location between Ala Moana and Waikiki. Not only are the rooms spacious, the beds are out of this world comfy. There’s nothing better than to come back and relax in your oasis after a long day of shopping or adventuring. The accommodations are great but what makes Equus really special is the undeniable feeling of ʻOhana (family). Rene and Puka embody what the Aloha spirit is all about. From their professionalism to hospitality, you will surely feel the love long after you leave. Equus has become our home away from home and we are beyond grateful for all that they do!

Really friendly place. Nicely situated between Waikiki and a huge shopping mall in Ala Moana. My room was clean, sufficiently equipped for a one week stay.Valet parking expensive, but so is Honolulu.Not good: Hotel is facing a 6-lane-boulevard, which remains busy 24/7. Lots of noisy traffic. Windows (sliding doors to balcony) do not seal at all, so even with 'closed' windows, your are exposed to noise.

We spent only 1 night before boarding a cruise. There were 4 of us (adults) and we found the room a little too cosy, so would suggest young families or couples only. Our room was old and had stains on the floor with an odour that resembled old vomit. Good effort was made to clean it, but it was still lingering. Location to Ala Moana, the beaches and the port are excellent so if only for a short stay, not a bad option. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Stayed here for the first night in town and was very comfortable. Renee checked us in and was very warm and hospitable. The room was spacious and exactly what we needed for the night. Checking in and out was a breeze and close to shops!

The location is really convenient; walking distance to Waikiki beach/shops, Ala Moana shopping centre, and bus stops. Service was very good, rooms were cleaned daily with friendly staff. Especially would like to recommend the travel tour agent Winston downstairs, he kindly helped us plan and book all our tours, and gave some great recommendations on where to eat, hike, transport etc. Very friendly and reliable :)

Such a great convenient location! They have a friendly staff and really good service. We checked in with Rene who was so sweet and made us feel welcomed. Their rooms are clean with super comfortable beds. We definitely will be returning and recommending The Equus to friend and families.

I had booked 4 nights at the Equus Hotel, but after less than one night I had to cancel my remaining stay and booked another hotel. This is a nasty hotel. Cockroaches everywhere - in the rooms! Moldy shower stall - disgusting! $11/day resort fee - I have no idea what you get for this. $25/day parking. Hated this hotel. Strongly recommend staying elsewhere!

Cute little hotel with great staff. Pool isn’t used by anyone (because right now it’s ice water). A lot of small repairs and renovations were happening during our stay but it didn’t interfere with our activities. Had a good stay here!

equus hotel is good at services they are friendly most especially to mhila talledo who with me when i have to attend the business trip in this hotel.thanks to her for her warmest approach to me when i'm staying at my room

Although the hotel was quite booked, I had called in to request a King room instead of the Queen room I was able to book online - Renee was most helpful over the phone and had promised to do the very best and came through for our request! The Equus Hotel demonstrates the optimum in customer service for any hotel in its class and has the welcoming 'Aloha' spirit! We look forward to our stay and will have follow up review!!!!! But thank you so much to Renee for being so kind and helping us with our request!!!!!

I really appreciate the staff and features of this hotel. In some ways it has a boutique feel with its nice appointments to the style and decor, and in some ways it can be a modest atmosphere due to its size and age (which I am perfectly fine with). I have stayed here five times and will always choose the Equus for my Waikiki accommodations, especially if it is just me (my wife sometimes prefers more of a traditional large pool/resort experience). Renee and Puka are especially kind and welcoming and I am pleased to see them each time I visit. They really are a perfect representation of providing the best guest experience. And I haven't even yet mentioned the room rates...each category of room type is very affordable for an in-close Waikiki hotel location. If you are open to a smaller, more traditional hotel experience, the Equus is a great choice.

This hotel was exactly what we needed. It was close to everything in Honolulu and Waikiki. The employees were very friendly, professional and accommodating. The room was always very clean and tidy and the bed was large and comfortable. The guy on the tour desk was very friendly and helpful as well. The only thing I would say is our room could be a bit noisy at times due to looking over the main road and there does not appear to be much sound proofing in the rooms. But the fact that we had access to a fridge was brilliant.Would recommend this hotel if visiting Oahu.

This small hotel is located near everything. The rooms and furnishings are clean, but the furnishings and old single pane sliding glass doors should be upgraded. Noted some street noise. Enjoyed our stay and the location close to public transportation is a definite plus. Would stay here again.

Went for a couple of days. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The place was older but clean and cozy. There were restaurant's around the area and several shopping centers near by. They were updating several things in the building. Rooms were clean. The lani could have been cleaner but it was still good to set at when you wanted to be out doors. There are tall buildings around it but you can still see somethings. Everyone was so friendly and helpful we will be back.

Nice hotel super friendly staff “Puka”. Nothing super fancy simple but effective. Clean hotel central location walking distance to multiple area. Reasonable priced I would definitely come back. You can hear some traffic noise from road but nothing major in a bad way. Well worth the experience

The hotel that is in question was not my hotel this is a hotel next to my hotel they were in charge of car parking One day I needed help with a problem I had and no one was not around from my hotel so I ask For some help they knew I was not a customer of theirs hotel but they still help me with the best of their ability I have not never received so good customer service like I have received from the three workers who work There I would like to say thank you to WINSTON and JAVIEN and MATT The three gentleman in question gave me all the help that was possible I would like to say thank you very much one more time keep up the good work and on my next vacation to Hawaii I hope you have a room

In conclusion it was a great honeymoon trip and one of the best hotel we ever stayed, the staff is so friendly, I met MHILA TALLEDO shes tha one who cleaned our room. The room is very clean. We feel so comfortable and relaxing place.

This hotel was exactly what we needed. It was close to everything in Honolulu and Waikiki. The employees were very friendly, professional and accommodating. Rene at the front desk was very helpful with extending our stay and making us feel welcome. Matt was helpful with our luggage (and we had a lot) and giving us information about things to do. There was a water refill station that kept me hydrated. Free coffee and snacks were available in the lobby. I will definitely stay here again.

The hotel is so clean and provides you great hospitality. THe staffs were very helpful. It is one of the best and amazing hotels were ever stayed in. We had a wonderful stay.thank you to mhila talledo one of the staff that make our room so perfect everything is so clean and always ready.someday well be back again...

Great location, staff are super friendly and accommodating. This is very cozy hotel and you can feel that you are well taken care off. Hats off to Puka who always finds a way to help us whenever we need some assistance. Thank you for making our vacation memorable

Good location,nice staff...its the right place to stay Equus hotel its a lovely hotel,it was a great honeymoon trip and one of the most awesome hotel we ever stayed.The staff are friendly and welcoming especially to Mhila Talledo thank you for being good to us the room was clean and ready when we arrived.We would absolutely stay there our next trip again...

I stayed in Euuse two years ago, and I choosed again.Because Hotel staff are very kind.They remember us and treat us very nice.I enjoyed staying in there with my mom.Ofcouse room is very cozy.I want to visit and see Rene and Puka again.They have wonderful mind.Thank you very much.

I live on a neighboring island and needed a room centrally located in Waikiki for the night. The Equus was by far the best price. I was greeted by Puka, at the front desk who was extremely welcoming, polite and a pleasure to speak to. I found everyone in the hotel staff to be just as welcoming, polite and accommodating. The room was great, bed super comfy and the hotel located in a perfect spot walking distance to everyone of my destinations. I will absolutely stay again when I visit next.

So very nice hotel . their room service is so good. the housekeeper Mhila Talledo is so very friendly and nice and Im very thankful for her hospitality. me and my friends enjoyed there. we will be back again.
