Very nice small hotel at very reasonable price for the quality. Everyone who works here was super nice and really seemed to care about making our stay enjoyable. When our first room had a little glitch with the air conditioner not working, service people responded in minutes. Since it couldn't be fixed immediately, we were moved to another room. The staff did all that they could to be sure we were comfortable and compensate for the inconvenience. We found the location to be very convenient. On site tour director was very helpful. Public transportation, shuttles and rental cars are all close by as well as several good restaurants and shopping.

I love to stay in equus hotel for 3 days, I feel so comfortable and the room i stay is super clean and all I need is ready,thanks to Mhila who I met.She is so very friendly, thank you very much for all the good service.I will be back again.

My boyfriend and I decided to runaway from our home island Maui and spend ONE night in Waikiki to celebrate our 4 years together. We were luckly to have our work schedules jive for that one night. We are super glad to have stayed at The Equus Hotel. The entire service was GREAT!!! Every employee we interacted with had genuine aloha. Not the corporate “aloha” you get all around Waikiki. Honest...corporate aloha isn’t genuine. RENE and PUKA were outstanding first impressions for the whole Equus Hotel experience.We tried to get a second night but they were booked solid since it was Veteran’s Day. PUKA and RENE said not to lose faith because cancellations may arise. Sure enough, we were blessed to get that second night.We didn’t have our own car so we don’t have experience with parking but Waikiki is totally walkable. We used Uber when we had to and there’s also Biki stations all around Waikiki.Mahalo nui to The Equus Hotel for an awesome stay.-Kahi and Bob

It's been awhile since I've stayed at this hotel. However the staff here are awesome and so welcoming. Puka who works the front desk always greets you with a smile. Jackie was very helpful with directions and was always on top of things If anyone wants to stay at a quiet hotel within walking distance from everything and at a reasonable price....this is definitely the hotel for you and the family.

The rooms are the best part. Its a little hard to get to them- not a spacious lobby and parking is valet only ($25/day). I have a king room. Includes a fridge, bar, keurig, 2 chairs w table, dresser, 2 nightstands and TV. And a sitting bench.The nicest people work here! The valet, check-in staff and room service was wonderful. Jacquie (one of the room service staff) went way beyond nice and brought extra coffee pods to my room after I couldn't find any downstairs. Very professional and helpful.

Puka, Rene, Isabella and Brandon .Thank you so much for making this stay a great one. I will most certainly return to this hotel if I ever come back to Honolulu. If anybody stays here, trust me, you will not be disappointed. The room was always cleaned to my satisfaction, the hotel was near the mall and the beach, I always had a polite and professional response to my requests by everybody at all times at this hotel. The only thing missing would have been a toaster and a microwave in the room but besides that, 5 stars overall because it's defenetly worth the money I paid and more.AlphaJason

My wife and I made a change of plans thanks to the hurricanes in the Caribbean. Instead of sailing we wound up in Hawaii. Last minute plans left us with limited options. We found the Equus and couldn't believe how fortunate we were. The property is a little tired but the staff more than made up for any short comings. We have visited many cities and hotels around the world but have never experienced a staff as friendly or accommodating as that at the Equus. The people at the front desk that I would like to commend are: Puka, Ramon, Izabella, Yoshi, Achew, Rachel and Rene. I can not forget Matt, the maintenance man that got our TV going. The location is also a big plus. While not in the heart of Waikiki, you are a short walk away. We will use this property on any return trips to Honolulu.

I stayed at the Equus a few months back and had a great visit! The location was great, being in Waikiki, but also very close to Ala Moana. The staff were friendly overall, and in particular, my housekeeper, Fely was especially courteous.

Puka was so good to my husband and I. We had stayed in a Condo and had to get up at 5am to clean and be out by 9am. We came with our reservations at about 12:30pm and asked Puka if there was anyway we could go to our room early. He said I do not think so, but let me check. He did let us in early, wonderful quiet room. Feel asleep immediately. These beds are fantastic, my husband and I think this is better than my son's expensive room at the Prince Waikiki, which was nice, but ours was more cozy. Fresh muffins and fruit for breakfast, a single cup Kerig (loved this form my tea and coffee). This is the place to come for relaxation, Beach is about a 1/4mile walk, easy walk to the beach. I love this place and would recommend for anyone who wants to get away from the Honolulu busy atmosphere!I love to swim, pool a little cool, but beach close. Rooms are cozy and great new AC!

We stayed at this hotel for our last night once we returned from another island. It was a bit further from the Waikiki Beach and shops but being from a major US city we are used to walking so we didn't find that bad. I liked the room a great deal and found the lobby staff super friendly. The wifi worked fine and we were totally comfortable. I would happily stay here again to save a few $$$ but be able to access what I wanted at Waikiki.

Being a local here, it's quiet hard finding a place to do a ,"stay-cation"...but staying at this hotel the staff and rooms never fail me. Jackie was so welcoming. Puka was to funny but very helpful. This hotel is a very good place to stay at. Its literally in walking distance from everything. If anyone is looking for a place to stay at....its this hotel!

For an extremely last minute Staycation booking on a three-day weekend, it was reasonably priced. We were amazed we could still even get a room on a budget so late in the game. We only needed a place to sleep for the night and freshen up in between our activities without worrying about parking in Waikiki. This was our first stay at Equus for everyone in our party.Parking: Valet only. There was a little confusion with the parking situation; however, we resolved everything within a couple of minutes.Check-in: We were greeted by a Keurig buffet. When our attention focused back to checking in, we were a little confused with the check-in station; however, quickly figured out it was the gentleman sitting at the furthest corner of the room on a teeny stool and table with a laptop. We had a difficult time deciphering who were employees and who were patrons with the exception of the maintenance workers. By the way, great job buffering out the brass on the staircase!Room: upon entering the room, we were greeted to an Equestrian atmosphere with a wonderfully cool room, clean towels, nice array of complimentary toiletries and complimentary entrails in the toilet, a Keurig greeted us along with some complimentary cookies and several antenna friends (expected in a tropical environment), as well as a little refrigerator (had to ask for ice from the front counter), new flat screen television, nice digital radio/time clock, and neatly set beds. We were aiming for a suite; however, it was already booked, so Equus arranged to allow us the use of two conjoining rooms with a door in between the rooms. The conjoining door was still locked upon our arrival; however, two friendly maintenance men came within a couple of minutes to unlock the door for us. On a side note, for those of you who enjoy a nice, hot shower, the water gets nice and hot. I also appreciated the ample electrical socket availability. They were easily accessible from several sides of the room.Pool: We were unable to get to the pool area because it looked like there was some minor renovation going on near the entrance of the pool area. Whatever is being built looks very nice and looks to be just about ready to use. I hear it may be the home of their future bar. The pool being blocked did not matter because the beach is located right across the street.Check-out: We got an early start the next day and were greeted to complimentary muffins in the lobby/check-in/out area. We decided to catch a quick breakfast at a near by restaurant, then catch some beach time before checking out. Check-out was fairly quick and easy.I felt like the Equus staff were family members running a family owned business. In all, we ran into a few minor hiccups which were all resolved quickly. The stay was reasonably priced especially on such short notice. We had a decent bed to sleep on and a cool room to cool us off in the humid summer heat. It was a bonus to have the conjoining door to our rooms so we could still spend time as a group as originally planned plus we didn't have to share beds. ;-) I cannot speak for the rest of the group; however, I would not mind returning for a quick and reasonably priced stay in Waikiki.

My husband and I had planned on going to Hawaii for our belated Honeymoon and as we are both avid travellers (go away a few times a year) we decided that we didn't want to blow all our budget on accomodation (resort fees etc), we discovered The Equus Hotel via Tripadvisor which suited us perfectley as it was well located, on budget, provided some breakfast free of charge and had good reviews.Rene and her team instantley made us feel at home (great customer service all round) and they went the extra mile when I realised I had left my cell phone at our last hotel in Kauai, and needed to get it shipped asap to the hotel as we were only there for 2 days! Was so pleased to get in back in time as it would have cost me more than the phone to probably get it shipped abroad! Would definately recommended this hotel as it was within walking distance of the shops, resturants, beach and on our last day we were lucky enough to catch the floral parade directly outside.

We traveled to Hawaii for our daughters wedding in October. We loved the location of the hotel and the staff was superb. Rene, Jackie , yoshi, Isabella and Puka were informative and new all the best places to visit. They were all helpful and gave us the customer service we all wish to experience. They truly demonstrated the light of hospitality.Thank you all for a wonderful visit.

I am a platinum choice member, and usually stay at comfort inns for my work trips. I was excited to stay at an Ascend property as these are supposed to be the highest rated in the choice family. I wasn't impressed with this location sadly. First, let me say the staff is amazing and I had 0 issue with them. The hotel is on the Main Street and it NEVER quiets down. I was lucky to have ear plugs from an international flight I just took. If you are a light sleeper this hotel is NOT for you. The front desk told me there is no quiet room in this hotel. Second issue, on the site it doesn't say that valet is the only option and that it's 25$ plus tax a night. I went back and looked, where it does say it, is in the email you receive AFTER You book the room. Very expensive. Had I known I wouldn't have stayed here. Last issue and almost the worst, I was sitting in bed working last night and a huge roach walked up next to me on the pillow. I killed it but needless to say I had a hard time sleeping. Sad to have written this review, but I will not stay here again.

Stayed here for 3 nights and were very satisfied. Bus stop, restaurants and shopping all near by. Friendly desk and valets. Only negative is $25.00 a day for parking, which isn't unusual but still unpleasant. Would definitely stay here again!

The Equus hotel and staff.. Rene, Jackie-Hskg, Puka, Isabella, Yoshi, and the rest of their staff were very welcoming.. showing our family what the Aloha spirit is! Our week with the Equus family could not have gone better. The hotel was very clean, well appointed, and is very convenient to everything in Waikiki.. at very reasonable pricing. Mahalo to everyone at the Equus!Joe

The second time we have used this hotel for a two night stopover and each time we have enjoyed our stay.situated on Ala Moana Blvd it is very central to restaurants,beaches and the Ala Moana shopping complex.There is a short stairway to the top of the informal reception area (this is not an issue as you only have to do it once.) The reception staff were welcoming and friendly. Explained everything we needed to know. WI-fi passwords ,safety deposit key etc The air conditioned rooms (although perhaps needing a bit of an upgrade ) were more than adequate with the usual trimming and services.We have experienced bot back and front of house rooms.A bit noisy on the boulevard side,but with the shutters closed at night it broke the noise.Small pool on ground floor level with a bar area.(being finished when we were there). Certainly good value for money in Hawaii.Would we stay again? Yes.Hope this has been helpful.

Auntie Renee at the front desk was suuuuuper AMAZING. She really made us feel welcome and displayed the highest level of Aloha Spirit. The environment was very welcoming and I will definitely recommend this boutique hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Waikiki area. You will NOT regret staying here, I can definitely assure you that.Thank you auntie Renee and staff for setting such a great tone to this beautiful establishment. Mahalo! -Chris Punzalan

The staff was very friendly and warm, especially Fely. She was helpful and always have a smile on her face. She also recommended to go to Ala Moana shopping center, and other spots in Waikiki. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Decent value hotel, plus hotel does not charge an extra "resort fee" (unlike a lot of hotels in Waikiki). Rather noisy as right on Ala Moana Blvd (lots of noise from traffic). Room was okay. Very old, small in-room safe that used a traditional metal key (and the key was missing). In-room mini-refridgerator was very nice; had a separate small freezer compartment above refrigerator to keep ice cream. One old, slow elevator that was having problems. Best thing about hotel is the staff; the front desk staff are very nice and helpful. Equus is okay, but would probably stay elsewhere next time.

Mhila was the nicest and friendliest housekeeper that I came in contact with she was fast to accommodate all our requests..... thank you mhila for making our stay enjoyable..... the front desk staff was also very nice

My is Tom from Las Vegas , me and my friend had a wonderful vacation in Hawaii last month , we enjoyed the 3 days we stayed in Hawaii.This hotel was awesome, I met a housekeeper name Mhila but I don't know the last name ,I think it begins with T, she was very friendly and she makes our room clean.she does a very good job.I will recommend this hotel to all my friends who's planning to go to Hawaii for vacation. To Mhila keep up the work.

We stay for 3 days in this hotel.the room was very clean and the bed is comfortable.all staff were friendly and helpful specially to Mhila Talledo she is nice housekeeping..thank you for making our room clean all the times...

We love this hotel. the staff makes you feel like ohana! Rooms are comfortable and island style. Thank you Rene and Puka for always making us feel welcomed.Location close to shopping center and great eateries. Blocks from beaches and convention center.Jackie made sure our room was in tip top shape.We will return.

I keep coming back here because of the hotel staff. I see some bad reviews but honestly. Be nice and treat others as you expect to be treated. They have treated me with nothing but respect and utmost courtesy. I have stayed here multiple times and it is because I have always been greeted with a smile. It's a small hotel and run like a family business. It's always 1 person at the desk but they will take care of all your needs. Mahalo!

Great location right on the edge of Waikiki. It's not a new pricey place like the Trump International Waikiki ($450 a night) but it's a 5 star for the price point. Walking distance from the Honolulu Yacht Club, Dukes Lagoon, Waikiki Beach, restaurants, and the Ala Mona Shopping Mall. The room was great, not new, but clean and comfortable. It's a walk-up lobby but they are eager to help with the luggage. The lobby is small but comfortable and they are in the process of building a Tiki Bar outside with a social area, it's going to be very nice. The staff was great and friendly, but Rene & Puka are the best, extremely friendly and helpful!!! Lot's of Aloha here...

Stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to be very convenient for exploring the Hilton Hawaiian Village end of the Waikiki beach. The rooms are of a reasonable size. Bed was very firm and comfortable. Toilet and shower facilities very clean (in fact they look new). Good thing about staying here is the options for meals as the Ala Moana Center is just a short walk away - tonnes of dinning options there including two food courts one specializing in Japanese food. For breakfast, there is the convenient McDonalds and Subway just a short walk from the hotel. All in all, the hotel was value for money.

We stayed at this hotel for four of our eight nights in Hawaii and loved it. The hotel is still family owned and has been kept up very well. Our room was nice and was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and was very attentive. The valet parking is only $25 a night and the valet staff are very helpful as well. There is no resort fee either which is sooo nice and hard to find. I highly recommend this hotel!

We wanted to say a special thank you to Puka and Renee at the Equus Boutique Hotel.They were both so kind and thoughtful and paid great attention to detail.We highly recommend this establishment. They made our stay especially comfortable and accommodated our needs impeccably.We will definitely be staying there again.The facilities was clean, easily accessible, near to a large shopping mall and above all else quiet.The staff, Renee and Puka, although busy accommodated not only our requests but also was able to handle all the waiting guests in reception on the day of our check-in.We were impressed with the ease and relaxed atmosphere at Equus.Thank you all for making our stay a memorable one.

Me and my husband stayed in this hotel for 3 days and we're both amazed co'z our room was so clean and you can see the nice view. One of the housekeeper named Mhila Talledo was very nice to us , she makes the room clean and organized, she was doing a fantastic job. Hopefully next year we can go and visit Hawaii again and we will stay in the same hotel.

The nicest independent family run hotel we've ever had the pleasure of staying in.Staff are so friendly and helpful, rooms are spacious and clean, they are in the process of building a bar next to the terrace outside reception, this looks great and will be a good addition to the hotel, right next to the swimming pool, which is a welcoming site on hot Ohau days. If ever we have the good fortune to visit hawaii again, this is we're we'd head to.A big thank you to the staff.

The reception lobby was small and very busy. There was no bar or restaurant to hang out in while people waited for their rooms to become available.We were disappointed with the rooms which were very old fashioned and in need of renovations.The rooms were noisy especially lower floors with traffic noise.the bathroom was out dated and worn with leaky taps, small shower that leaked water.We struggled with the lighting in the room which was not adequate for reading.There was a very small swimming pool which had no sun so very cold and nowhere to sit around it.The positives were the amazing and accommodating staff, the lovey complimentary coffee and tea, muffins and apples.We were moved after the first night as we couldn't sleep to the "executive floor" which, incidentally was exactly the same as our previous room but without a balcony. We had the same bathroom as well. We were not sure what executive meant really apart from the room being on the tenth floor. The beds and bed linen was good and nice fluffy towels.We found the hotel pricy for a very basic hotel with no breakfast.The best thing about the hotel is the location, Rene and Jackie. Thank you for your help and Hawaiian hospitality. The shopping centre and Waikiki beach are walking distance away.

Equus is such a lovely little place..we could stay at larger hotels,but,the Aloha,and immediate attention you receive from Miss Renae, Puka and the entire staff makes for a perfect stay. We have stayed at Equus many times and will continue in the future!

The lobby was small and packed with people. It wasn't where I thought it was in relation to Pier 2, according to the advertisement. So unhappy when standing in that tiny lobby, but Renae and Paku helped me to calm down. They were definitely carrying the aloha spirit. They found us a room right away, which helped even more, considering it was 9:30 and check-in wasn't till 3pm.

Love the new bar in the lobby for hanging out with the latest and greatest polo players frequently in town from all over the world. Waikiki's best kept secret for this tiny little corner of the world where the meet and greet with the famous to nearly famous is at budget prices with the "biggest bang for the buck" in Waikiki. Best location in town where you can walk to almost everything otherwise public transportation is easily accessible. Bring your bathing suit and a great attitude. Become part of the family and plan on the greatest vacation ever. It won't disappoint.Sandy HerronSanta Barbara California and Aspen Colorado

This Hotel has about 16 steps from the road up to the reception before you get to a lift, this info was not provided in their brochure and as we fell into the over 65 bracket this caused us much concern. The Hotel itself is old, both in appearance and layout, rooms are exposed to the weather as the hall is on the outside, rooms are fairly small and basic. On a brighter note the Staff are friendly and helpful, the value for money compared to Waikiki prices is good and the location is close to Ala Mona Shopping Centre, Restaurants and the Cruise ship Terminal, the bed was comfortable and the room quiet. Would not stay again because of the stairs, but if your younger and fit, the value and location make this Hotel a reasonable option.

Registration with Puka was quickly and easily completed as well as knowing that our room was ready!! The Equus is a smaller, established, and well located hotel nestled among the tall and very tall hotels & resorts. Our room was cool, clean, and well equipped for our five night stay. Our room request was met - lower floor and away from elevators and vending machines! Many tourist spots were within walking distance including an ABC Store!! Though we'd been to Honolulu a number of times, this was our first to attempt our 'tourist-ing' on The Bus. It would be best to contact the transit information for routes as a number of drivers were testy, lacking the aloha spirit!!The Equus' AC was great as well - quiet and efficient, unlike the noisy, single, in-wall units located in the mainland hotel/motels! The room had a bar area with a sink, Keurig single cup coffee maker, and mini refrigerator which kept our beverages icy cold. So nice to have an ice cold beverage after walking and riding the bus around the area. The only mark against the Equus is the walk up from the street to the lobby; there is no 'lift'. If one is ambulatory and in good health, the Equus is the place for you. The small lobby has a Keurig for coffee and tea along with muffins and apples. The hotel was well organized and run efficiently; I wouldn't mind a return stay in room 208!! Mahalo to the management and staff for a relaxing and enjoyable stay!!

I stayed for two nights after spending a few nights on Big Island, prior to flying onwards to New Zealand. The hotel has a number of steps up to the Reception which may cause a problem to those with mobility issues or even those with large heavy suitcases. There isn't presently a bar, or an area to purchase any kind of food or beverage! The staff diect you to the local grocery store or McDoalds. And there is only one slow, lift which serves all floors. The 'swimming pool' isn't available due to remodelling of the adjacent area! The rooms are comfortable and clean, but the decor is 'tired'. For the price, this place is adequate at best!

We are a group of nine people and reserved three bedrooms on Aug 21 to 26, 2017. The rooms are not so clean. My friend's room is on the 2nd floor, the sink has a certain amount of ants crawling everywhere. On the day of leaving, we all asked for the receipt, the man at the front desk is very rude and not helpful at all. He refused to give us a hard copy of receipt, he said he will only send me an email of the receipt. I insisted for 2 times that we have to make sure all the rate is correct before we left Honolulu, he sent us an email and I checked it on my phone right away. When we asked about the parking, he said we didn't asked for the receipt of the parking, so that he will not give us! What kind of service the hotel provided to us! Very bad experience, never return to this hotel, and will not recommend this hotel to anyone. It was the worst experience that I have in the hotels for last 15 years! It was the impressions from all 9 people: not friendly and helpful to the tourists at all!

From looking at the pictures online before my visit the hotel and the rooms seemed ideal for us as we were only there for a few nights. The hotel was in a perfect location, just a short walk to the beach and shopping malls. The staff at the desk were lovely and helpful. But our stay was made disappointing by a few issues...On our arrival we noticed a coffee machine with mugs and cups with bugs crawling around that area. We moved the coffee machine slightly to reach the plug to find a swarm of bugs crawl out from under the coffee machine! We had the same problem in our bathroom with bugs crawling around the sink area and floor. We had fresh towels everyday which was perfect but our used towels were not being taken so we had a growing pile of towels. The shower was fine, only problem was there was a used flannel at the top of the shower curtain from a previous visit which was still there the day we left! Not sure how often the shower was being cleaned.The bed was comfy but was constantly awaken by the room next door. Our room had a door next to our bed which led you to next doors room but this allowed us to hear every conversation, duvet rustle and ringtones. We felt like we had no privacy because they were likely to hear the same from us. We loved the area and would love to return, but sadly wont be returning to this hotel.

We needed a place to stay in Honolulu for a week to help our youngest child get settled in for her first year of college at Hawaii Pacific University (HPU.) The Equus came up as a place that was reasonably close (only a little over 2 miles away on a single main road) to the campus as well as the off-campus house she would be renting with others on her team near the University of Hawaii (also less than 2 miles in a different direction.) The Equus is situated very close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, the Honolulu Yacht Harbor and the Ala Moana Beach Park, all of which are within walking distance. This is a plus, because one of the things we were not prepared for is the $25 mandatory daily valet parking fee at the hotel. The reason for this is completely understandable giving the location of the hotel squeezed into a compact area between a number of other residential and vacation buildings. However, this needs to be not only taken into account as a cost factor, but also as a logistics factor as it can take up to 10 or 15 minutes during busy times for the valet runners to be able to get your vehicle. Make sure to allot yourself enough time if you need to be anywhere at a certain hour.The staff at the front desk were awesome every time we had contact with them. Upon arrival, the lady who greeted us was extremely friendly and helpful, and even offered my daughter a flower lei of the same school color for Hawaii Pacific University. A very generous and appreciated touch. Another time I let the front desk know that our room needed service and the gentleman had someone at our room within 5 minutes.The room we had with the hotel's equestrian themed décor was suitable for our stay, but be aware that this is an older hotel. It has one elevator which was not in service at one point during one brief period during the week, which could be a significant problem if you are on one of the higher floors. A big consideration for staying here is that we did miss having a kitchen and clothes washing capabilities which we have been accustomed to in previous condominium stays. Take this into account, as eating out every meal in Hawaii is expensive, and we took advantage of the small refrigerator to store food from the grocery store as often as possible. There are a couple of nearby laundry service options, one of which is a little more clean than the other, but both are within 1/2 a mile walk from the hotel. We found it necessary to use services twice, because of the heat and humidity and the fact that Fabreze only works so well in these conditions.The Equus does have a pool, but it is small an in an area which receives little to no sun. (As a side note, in late 2017 they are doing work to add a small bar area to the hotel which made access to this pool problematic at various times.) If you are looking for a pool for children or to lay out at, this one does not really fit the bill. Fortunately, it is a less than 15 minute walk to the Ala Moana Beach Park directly across the street from the shopping center of the same name, and this is a nice beach area with lifeguard stations.Taking a small walk north to the Ala Moana Shopping Center will give you a large number of food choices, including sit down restaurants and a large, central food court with about 20 places to choose from. The only downside of this is that, along with much of this part of Oahu the number of homeless in the area is stunning. Most of them are harmless and will not bother you, but during our week's stay we were followed or subjected to uncomfortable verbal displays at least three times. This, obviously, has absolutely NOTHING to do with the Equus hotel, but is a factor for any visitation in the area.In summary, our stay had no frills, but this hotel served our need functionally for the week and we were able to accomplish getting our daughter set up for her semester at HPU successfully.

Aloha! THIS is what makes The Equus Hotel a place that I would stay again! Meeting Rene and team and feeling like we'd known them forever was the highlight of our stay at this hotel. From the minute we made our arrangements on the phone to the moment we left to head home, the warmth and true "aloha" spirit was given with each interaction we had. I can't say enough about Rene...she is old time Hawai`i at it's best. Guests become `ohana (family) and here in the Hawaiian Islands, that means everything. Our Senior Softball League team stayed at the Equus Hotel in early August. The rooms were pleasant but not as luxurious as some hotels down the street. The guest rooms could use a total refresh but as we were not there much, they were adequate for what we needed. The bathrooms were clean and tidy and the hotel provided the full range of shampoo conditioner, lotion and clean towels every day. The housekeepers did a great job on the rooms! One of the other things that we appreciated is that The Equus Hotel is locally owned. So much of the Hawaiian Islands is becoming overrun with visitors, big box stores, and other Mainland entities. When I can find a locally owned business that offers such great guest service, that is going to be my first choice each and every time I have to be in Honolulu. Life is simple here. What matters to locals most is family, friends, and supporting one another. That is the aloha spirit and this hotel demonstrates it!

My two toddlers and I recently stayed here and Renee the front desk associate was incredibly sweet and helpful to make it happen that we could stay until after naptime the day we were leaving! She was seriously so precious and made my day and my kids loved her. All of the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly to my babies and I from valet to even the guys reconstructing the bar area. It is a beautiful boutique hotel and close to a very beautiful beach, a McDonald's, and a convenient store! The beds were very comfortable and we had a great stay.

We were happy with our stay here. The room was clean and cosy. The bed was very comfortable and kitchenette area handy for preping your own basic snacks / drinks etc for a longer stay. The shower could do with an update and unfortunately there was some renovations going on during our stay rendering the pool unavailable at times. Otherwise location good - close to beach / restaurants and big shopping mall and staff were friendly and down to earth.

This is an older hotel that exemplifies the phrase to not judge a book based on its cover. The rooms are big, comfortable and clean. The staff are amazingly friendly and will go beyond their way to make you feel at home. The location is a plus. It is within walking distance of the beach and the big Ala Moana mall. The bus stop is also around the corner.Now the downside, because it's older, don't expect the same amenities that you will get at newer and fancier hotels. No spa or restaurants on site and the parking is valet only. Meaning that they will charge you for the day and they have to park it. That was one big inconvenience.Other than that, it's a good hotel with great staff and might be your best bet if you are planning a long stay.

Always satisfied and enjoy staying at the Eqqus Hotel,Waikiki. Friendly customer service with clean,comfortable and cozy units.Ideal location near Ala Moana Shopping Center, restaurants and beaches.Staff and management outstanding.Always a pleasure staying at the Eqqus Hotel Waikiki, and highly recommend to travelers book a stay and experience for yourself.

My husband & I visited Waikiki late July-early August for our ten year anniversary en route to another very special engagement. We stayed at the Equus for six nights of our two week vacation. Firstly, I will lay out the positives so it doesn't seem like I didn't give this place a chance. Believe me, I have a very calm and optimistic personality so I really wanted to have a great time. The price was reasonable for its location, quick walk to Ala Moana shopping mall, a quick bus ride to Waikiki beach, a lovely evening stroll to the public lagoon, and an ABC store just a stones throw from the hotel. It was pretty good. I loved our king sized bed and we didn't mind the noise pollution invading our dreams every morning. We decided this was a good fit. It was affordable to sleep, shower and store our luggage here, whilst we explored Waikiki and the island throughout the day, often returning late in the night. I have to admit, it started off well. However, the pool was closed the entire time we stayed, Disappointing. The shower was very small and narrow, Disappointing, and worst of all; on my final night, as I was packing my luggage, I noticed a number of items missing from our room. These items were purchased four days prior and I packed them ever so carefully in our hotel room. I live in Australia and found a woman in Hawaii who custom made these items. As I had travelled to Waikiki especially to purchase these items. I was stoked to have tracked her down and purchased them. I carefully packed them and stored them out of the way. When I discovered them missing I was beside myself with confusion and overwhelmed with emotion. Our room was locked every morning with only cleaning staff coming in every day. When I brought it to the attention of hotel staff I was promised an enquiry. Apparently someone looked in the bins. I was so overwhelmed and heartbroken I cried to staff for a solution, but no other remedy/compensation was presented. I spent the night feeling utterly betrayed. Early the next morning I checked with them again for help. They did not get back to me until after lunch time and by then I had two hours until I had to fly out, it was not enough time and I did not have the budget to buy a second lot of items. My request to those considering The Equus Hotel- Do not stay here if you have items of value. If they go missing, you will not get them back. I have returned to Australia with a sad reminder of my vacation in Waikiki. I wish things had not turned out this way but I would not recommend this place to anyone. A simple apology will not do. It is not good enough.

Good location centrally located near Waikiki beach, restaurants, stores and transportation. Nice, responsive staff, quiet clean room, coffee and refrigerator and comfortable bed and seating. Reasonable price, would stay again!

Aloha,I've been meaning to write a review on my stay at your hotel. I was very pleased with the excellent customer service that was given to my by your front desk personnel Rene. She made me feel right at home with her warm spirit and so full of aloha. I could stay anywhere else in Waikiki but after staying here for the first time I'd definitely come back knowing that she will take good care of me. She is the reason for my return to your hotel. Mahalo nui for hiring qualified personnel with aloha spirit. Nadine

The pool was closed for our entire stay, and appears that it will be closed long term while the hotel adds a bar to the area. We were not notified that tthe pool was closed at check in or prior to.... we would have stayed somewhere else if we had known. This is Hawaii... pools are a must!!! When we expressed our disappointment they offered a $25 room credit. We said that wasn't enough to cover the lack of pool for the entire trip and they increased the credit to $25/night. The air conditioner in the room was not very cold at all. They sent maintenance up to check it out and he said it was just an old unit, and this is as cold as it got. Upon check out with Yoshi we discovered that he had locked the keys to the office inside the office. This is where the valet car keys are locatted. He tried to break the door down to get in, he tried to call other co-workers to see if anyone else had a key. Finally i suggested calling a locksmith. The lock smith showed up and was able to unlock the door so he could get the keys, but in all the confusion Yoshi had lost the key tag that identified which set of keys belonged to our rental car. Finally, we found them and took off in a mad rush to the airport so we did not miss our flight. We ended up having to retrieve our own car because the valet worker hadn't shown up for work yet.... it was 6:30 & he was supposed to be there at 6:00. I really wanted to like this hotel. It was quaint and centrally located, but i wish i had stayed somewhere else with a functioning pool and competent staff.

Great location and great customer services. We were especially impressed with the help we received from Rene, who helped us identify options for car rental. She was extremely professional and knowledgeable!

Just completed a fantastic trip to Waikiki stayed at the Equus "Boutique" Hotel. First let me say, the place is very clean. The staff are extremely friendly, no complaints what's so ever. The location is good, it's a short walk (8 mins at most) to the lagoon at Hilton Village and beach. You can also easily walk to Ala Moana Center, very upscale indoor/ outdoorish mall. Now onto the things that will annoy you. The rooms are small, but workable. The decor is looking dated. The bed was super comfy actually, so no issue there. Has a small fridge, no microwave . The bathroom has small shower, very motel 6 esq. Now onto the balconies!! The issue here is, that the AC units are located in the balcony area above your head, and blow heat on you, so it gets hot out there. The room AC is good though. Next up, Pool, it's basically just there for the brochure pictures. It gets no sunlight, small, cold, I never used it. (The hotel should rip it out and put hot tubs if you ask me.) Overall impressions, usually boutique in a hotel name provokes images of modern, exposed concrete, trendy room, open concept, etc.. this hotel is not that. What it is in its current state, is standard clean room. Good location, that is it. It's not a bad place at all, it just needs a remodel.

We spent 5 nights here (2 adults and a 15 y.o.). Comfortable room, good air conditioning, lift access. Great spot close to food, beaches etc, clean and tidy, great staff, friendly and obliging. Car valet service crew were great. No complaints at all. Only downside maybe was no in-house restaurant but with a myriad of choices within a block or two in each direction it was not a problem. Would stay here again when we return to visit the rest of Hawaii.

This is a great place to stay.. Rooms were clean and service was good. It's a family owned Hotel that caters to the locals and travelers. Rene who is full of Aloha was great. We were very surprised not only on the price but the overall vibe. Laid back and simple. I would recommend this Hotel. Thank to all the staff! Oh and you get 4 free polo tickets on the fa

We stayed here three nights and the hotel was great! The view was amazing, and the beds were comfortable. It was close to the ocean, and in walking distance from the mall. And had a reasonable price, this hotel was amazing. We'd definitely stay here again.

We stayed at the Equus for four nights on a short trip to Hawaii. We chose the Equus for its location close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and proximity to Waikiki Beach. As we weren't planning to spend a lot of time in the room we didn't feel that we needed a five star hotel. We were not disappointed. The room was a little old-fashioned but had solid wood furniture (unusual in a modern hotel) and a bar fridge with no minibar so you actually had room to put a few things in the fridge.The proximity of the hotel to the Ala Moana Center is handy for those who enjoy shopping but also because the shopping centre is a major transport hub for the local buses. We found the Equus to be well-placed for jumping on a local bus to go sightseeing further afield.The hotel was accommodating about our early arrival and let us check into the room immediately. I'd like to say a big thanks to the lovely Renée on reception for making us feel so welcome.The hotel doesn't have a restaurant or cafe which might be a concern for some people but there are a number of restaurants a short walk away. Access to reception is via steps and there is no lift or elevator option from street level as far as I am aware so the Equus would not be a good choice if you have mobility issues.For those who like to pick up a few groceries and take picnics during their holiday there is a supermarket at the Ala Moana Center where you can pick up everything you might need.

My husband and I are here in Hawaii celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. My mother and father in-law joined us here in Hawaii from Australia. We are staying at the Equus Hotel and saying that this hotel is "wonderful" is an understatement because of the location and customer service! The Equus is located in walking distance to both Ala Moana Shopping center and Waikiki Beach. Although you won't find a better hotel in this prime location for the price, the real reason to stay at the Equus is for the customer service. The people at the Equus Hotel epitomize the Aloha spirit. Rene (at the front desk) is so friendly and will welcome you with open arms. She definitely goes out of her way to make your stay amazing. Bryce and the other valet attendants are flexible and offer a variety of convenient options for parking your car and storing your bags. During our stay at the Equus, we definitely were treated as members of the family. Much Mahalo to the Equus Ohana from the Roberts Ohana for making our stay so special.

Our family and our inlaws' family stayed 4 days here at the Equus, and enjoyed everything about our stay. The staff were friendly, always helpful and courteous, and one nice touch was their text messages at the beginning of our stay to see how things were going and if they could do anything for us.The location is great - less than a 10 minute walk to newly remodeled and renovated Ala Moana Mall, same to Ala Moana Beach Park. Lots of other options going further into Waikiki by foot.The hotel is done up in classic Hawaiiana style, from the old wood features in the lobby, to the rooms, etc. The room was very nice, suited us perfectly, and my favorite part were the personal Keurigs with Newman's Own Organic Coffee. We will definitely be back again!

I just needed a place to stay overnight, but the Equus exceeded expectations. The room was comfortable, well-appointed, and clean, the staff friendly and helpful. I'd recommend this little gem to anyone wanting a relaxing stay in a busy part of town. I loved the horse-themed art, and the old photos of paniolo were delightful.

We stayed here for one night and found the location to be very convenient to the airport and other things we had planned. Lots of dining options within walking distance. The ABC store (Hawaii's version of a convenience store) is on the corner so it's very convenient should you forget anything or need anything. The shower is Very small and even though we stayed on the top floor away from Ala Moana Blvd we still were woken by the noise from the road. Friendly staff. Valet service was a bit slow at times but the friendliness made up for the slowness.

Clean room, friendly staff, nice pool (though we didn't need it with the ocean minutes away). We went with some friends and we were on separate floors, but they allowed us to switch rooms the next morning so that we could be on the same floor, so very accommodating. We had no issues with them at all but our friends found their door wide open after returning from the beach one day - apparently the cleaning staff forgot to close the door, but the front end staff were very defensive about it and not so nice to them in that moment. Other than that, the beach is a 5 minute walk away, along with everything else. Amazing food and shopping nearby. Perfect location, really! We wandered off to visit a few other hotels/resorts to compare, and while they were more luxurious, they were farther from the main strip. Parking is $20/day which I found on the expensive side, but this is very common in the downtown Honolulu/Waikiki area.

I stayed at this hotel for the Hokule'a homecoming. Sadly other hotels were booked, but when I spoke with Renee, she was amazing! She helped me get a room, gave excellent advice and specific details on parking, how to get to the venue, etc. I needed a hotel walking distance since I knew parking was doing to be hard and I was performing with Tahiti Mana. I had a bit of trouble finding where to bring my car in, but once that was settled, everything went perfect! Great view walking to my room, warmly greeted by Renee and the staff was so nice! In the morning I met Puka and OMG was Puka a huge help as well! As a performer with fresh pieces, Puka helped with anything we needed. Great service on front desk, Valet, and Housekeeping! Appreciate you guys so much for helping me out! A few tips to know:-Need to reach front desk, you must call out (as in like you're calling the hotel from your phone..they are reached by their phone number and no connection on their hotel phone)-ABC store for food, etc is literally just down the street to walk to which is great! and of course Ala Moana mall is a traffic light stop away so even better for shopping-have ALOHA spirit :) I say this to a lot of people because positive vibes will mirror itself..

We came to Honolulu to attend a conference at the Hawaiian Convention Center, which was just a five minute walk from this hotel. The Waikiki beach, malls, car rental services were all within easy access which was convenient for us. We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. Room service and cleanliness were excellent. The staff was very friendly- especially Scott, who recommended many tours around the island for reasonable prices. His suggestions and comments were really helpful in deciding what to do and where to go in Oahu island. Would totally recommend Equus for a great Hawaiian holiday accommodation! Thank you!

Nice little hotel, perfect spot great price. with all the tourist action going on once in the room it was so quiet you could not hear the craziness going on outside. Staff were very helpful and courteous they were very accommodating. Rooms very perfect size.

The hotel was a good value to experience Waikiki without overpaying. It is close to everything related to the Waikiki experience; within walking distance to the mall, beach, restaurants and bus stop. The hotel concierge, Scott, will help you plan out of your whole week if you wanted him to. He did for us and it was fantastic.Somethings to consider before you book:1-Hotel pool is small but clean. There are no gyms, Jacuzzi, etc. that comes with the more expensive hotels.2-There is only one elevator and it is slow but hey, you're on vacation so why rush.3-You have to pay for parking a car so rethink getting a rental. You probably won't need it anyway. We only drove our rental car two days out of the week we were there.4-Hotel has stairs so be prepared to haul your luggage up to the lobby. However, if you find a staff member, they will help you.5-Hotel is near highway so it will be noisy so bring ear plugs. I thought it would bug me but I was pretty wiped out each night and fell asleep despite the traffic noise outside.

Nice quiet hotel. Room was clean. Desk clerk was helpful with some sights to see including g a polo match. Hotel was near the beach, shopping and restaurants. The room was a little cramped but still a good value, we weren't there to hang out in a hotel.

The Equus Hotel is a boutique hotel one block from the beach that provides the personal service which you deserve. The Equus provides beach towels to take to the beach and breakfast is banana bread with coffee or tea.

The hotel is very clean, the room has a good size, perfect to a couple. The continental breakfast is good enough to start a leasure day in Oahu. The hotel is very close to good restaurants and there are a terrific brewery a few blocks away.

For the most part, we had a very good experience at this property. We were in a room near the front of the hotel and it was fairly noisy. And problems with the elevator when we arrived made for some inconvenience. However the people we dealt with were always quite friendly and accommodating.

An excellent choice. Close to shopping. Walk to cafes, beach, supermarket Transport at door. Everything you need. Enjoyed our stay here much better to our last trip to Waikiki. happy to recommend Would stay again without a doubt. Thank you so much to Isabella for organising our unexpected early check in. Customer service was outstanding

It was a great place to stay. The staff is very warm, knowledgeable, and helpful. We want to give a shout out to Scott. He went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable by suggesting places to visit. The location is just perfect. You could go to the beach, frequent nice restaurants such as the Outback, or walk to the beautiful Ala Moana Shopping Center for great bargains..
user_name:
Theody
New York City, New York

review_body: If you're looking for a place to stay on your vacation and don't want the place to be your vacation, then the Equus Hotel is a place to stay. The rooms are simple yet accommodating with the usual amenities. This is what one would call a Boutique Hotel, it is family owned. The staff friendly and helpful, the Aloha Spirit is practiced. The rates are affordable, leaving you with more to explore.

Loved and totally enjoyed our stay at this one of a kind adorable quaint yet modern vintage Equus, the staff and stay exceeded our expectations! Our accommodations fit our needs perfectly and the staff went above and beyond the call of duty meeting our every need. Scott and the crew were most kind and friendly and we now consider them extended family. Thank you Equus for a wonderful stay while in Honolulu you made us feel right at home with your wonderful hospitality! Mahalo!

We booked here for 2 nights June18-19 2017. The motel was family run and the staff was very courteous from checking in to housekeeping. Especially helpful was Alex and Puka. It is an older motel, but the rooms were immaculate with comfortable beds and linens. It s walking distance to beaches on Waikiki and Ala Moana Park. If you want the true Aloha spirit without the aloha price please consider this motel. If you want a beach view plan on spending another 200.00/day. It has refrigerator/freezer and there is a store ABC you can purchase soft drinks and snacks. We have stayed in numerous motels in Waikiki at double the price and would definitely come back again.

On our first night we had some issues with our room. When brought to the attention of hotel staff, they immediately took action to remedy the situation and in my opinion, went above and beyond! This does not always happen and we were pleased to be treated with so much respect.The hotel is conveniently located by Waikiki Beach and a short drive to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor. You are easily able to take a 5 - minute walk to the beach, shopping and more.

When I check in I feel at home. The service is outstanding and the staff is very memorable. If something goes wrong, they make it right and they do it Hawaiian style! This family-owned property is a rare find putting you close to shopping centers Waikiki and eateries. Please support local businesses. The staff is very friendly and everyone makes you feel at home. I love the breeze that comes from the lanai. The beds are comfortable and the property is clean. How many of you can say that you remembered the person who checked you in or the housekeeping staff that took care of your accommodations and the valet guy! You won't get that genuine hospitality at any of the other resorts!

I arrived in the late evening of June 1, 2017. Check-in was very smooth and took no more than a few minutes. The rooms are cozy and warm and have a balcony. Air conditioning works great along with nice hot showers. There is a microwave at front desk if you need to heat up food and a mini fridge in room. Rene at front desk is AMAZING, so friendly and warm and makes you feel like you matter and very accommodating. Rene gave my 2 grandkids 2 plush toy turtles to take home on checkout day. So thoughtful. Brandon is also extremely thoughtful and accommodating. Always has a smile on his face always! He also printed our boarding passes for us from the front desk and did so with a smile once again. Scott at the tours counter I can't say enough good things about!! WOW. He is outstanding. So friendly, thoughtful (gave my grandkids Honolulu cookie company cookies several times) and also a stuffed toy to my granddaughter. He was a lifesaver in terms of getting tips on best places to visit on the island!! Where to eat, etc. He always has a smile too and is great to chat with. Anywhere you want to go on the island Scott can guide you and give you best tips, directions, etc Paka in guest services (gave us great customer service) and Jacquie in housekeeping also gave outstanding service to us. My room was always clean and stocked with supplies. The location is superb. They are close to everything you would need. An ABC store is a block away, Red Lobster is across the street as well as McDonalds, Subway, coffee shops, the Ala Moana Centre is 2 blocks away as well as the Ala Moana Park Beach where u can watch Stunning sunsets and is a great place to relax etc. There is also snack bar there. Waikiki beach is 5 minute walk from hotel also. Also other hotels in area just a few blocks walking such as the Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki, etc. Bus stop outside hotel also. Bus is $2.50 adult and kids free. I used the bus to get around the island. You can also buy bus pass for a week. The bus terminal is at Ala Moana Centre also - the hub. Few blocks walking. I would highly recommend staying here. There is also no resort fee like the other hotels in the area. All staff are warm, friendly and very accommodating to guests. I lucked out finding this hotel. I will definitely return on my next visit to Honolulu!!!

We had an excellent stay at this boutique hotel which is conveniently located a couple of blocks from the Ala Moana Mall. Friendly staff. Scott/ concierge was very helpful with directions and advice. Breakfast muffins and coffee are complimentary each morning in the foyer. The property does not have an abundance of facilities but that is reflected in a competitive room rate and no resort fee. We would stay there again.

When I booked my 2 hotel rooms on line I got a confirmation email and there was something wrong with my booking. So the day of our check in my husband called the hotel about 12:30 to make sure everything was ok the manager Rene K had told my husband don't worry I'll take care of everything and if we wanted to check in now she had one room ready. So my family and I went to the hotel and Rene greeted us and had fix the problem I had with my booking. And because we had our grandchildren coming down to Rene had put our family room on the 2nd floor so it was easy for the kids to get to the pool. She was such an amazing women that this hotel made it feel like home. Rene was not just out there to help the tourists but also the local people. She made our Memorial Day stay so smooth and easy. It was easy to get to the floating lantern ceremony in the evening. This is one amazing hotel that do there very best to help out us local family's to. It's a family oriented hotel. Thank you Rene K for been an amazing women and taking care of us local family's to. Next time we are in the area we will drop of some chicken to you to enjoin. We checked in on Monday 5/29/2017Much love and Aloha, G. Haunani kalauawa& Rico Rodriguez

We only stayed one night while preparing for our flight home. It is in a quiet section of Waikiki near the city of Honolulu; but the building is older and needs some paint and upgrades. The rooms can use some new colors and linens; however, everyone tries to be so very helpful and attentive from Reception to the housekeeping staff. The pool area is small; but that means it was accessible also. I would consider this again if it were improved. Some guests are residents here.

We had some hiccups with our stay here. One thing that can't be helped: this is an older building in established Honolulu, and it is hard to see where you are supposed to pull in. We did pull in to the valet parking first (which is where you have to go, though no signs are posted to indicate that) but there was no attendant, in spite of the sign saying one should have been available when we got there. Confused, we ended up driving around in frustration, trying to find the correct entrance. We parked in another hotel lot and walked in, in the end, and then retrieved our car and brought it over.The entrance is up a couple flights of stairs, well away from the street, just past the valet. Park in valet and then go check in. Your car gets parked in the tower behind the hotel. For $25 nightly. Hey, it's Honolulu. You pay for parking, I guess. By the time we got to the hotel, we were very tired, and I was a little cranky. I don't like getting lost in a city I don't know at night. We got to the room and found that the lamp and clock on the nightstand weren't working, and the shower stall wasn't well cleaned.I received a survey text the following day, and when I responded with "average," the manager contacted me immediately. We were told the issues with our room would be handled immediately. We were out all day that day. When we returned, the bathroom was cleaned better, and the lamp and clock were working. However, the person who had been in the room had turned on the TV and left it on, as well as all the lights in the room. We had gone on a tour at 6:30 that morning and did not return until after 6 pm, so we have no idea how long the room was left like that. It was disconcerting. The beds and pillows were comfortable. We were hardly there except to sleep and shower. The shower stall is very small, though. The manager did respond quickly to our requests. However, it was uncomfortable to wonder about who was in our room and how long they were there when we came back to everything turned on. I'm not sure we would book here again.

We stayed in this hotel for an entire week. Staff was friendly. Clean, comfortable, air-conditioned room. We got a great rate via United Vacations. Excellent location in the eastern end of Waikiki. A couple of blocks from Ala Moana Mall, which has an excellent food court. We walked everywhere in Waikiki.

The room was clean, well-maintained and kept clean by the staff. Desk staff were always very helpful and attentive. The Concierge', Scott Aki, was very helpful in making the most out of my short stay. I would definitely recommend this place!

The managers and service team are amazing (Mariah, Rene & Yoshi) cares a lot about the comfort and quality of service received to their customers; They went beyond the call of duty to address and concerns or needs. Thank you for such amazing customer service you guys rock :-).

My friend and I stayed one night after her doctor adjusted her pacemaker. We checked in to find the insurance did not let the hotel know we were there for medical not vacation, a couple things came up but the desk person let us have the room immediately and had us bring her the information after we charged our phone. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the front desk person to housekeeping and grounds keeper. We asked for a 5:30am wake up call and we received a personal wake up not some automated robot. We would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.

It is located kitty-corner to Red Lobster. Excellent location from which you can walk and enjoy the beaches, restaurants etc. There is a great breakfast deal just down the road at Snapper's Bar. Enjoy!

Hotel affordable in price, clean, centrally located. Front desk welcoming and customer service oriented. Mr. Yoshi and Mr. Puka were very knowledgeable. Room with king size bed comfortable. Bathroom modern and clean. Hotel decor was pleasantly interesting. Location was great - right on city bus line? No need to rent car. Only suggestion for improvement: elevator to and from ground level would be ideal. We would return to this hotel.

We stayed just one night at The Equus Hotel. We had just got off a 12 hour flight plus figure in a 6 hour time change. The room was nice, beds comfortable, and bathroom was adequate. Staff that we dealt with were nice and helpful. The pool looked lovely but we didn't use it. A nice touch was the coffee n pastries available in the morning. We would not hesitate to stay again. There are quite a number of steps up to the lobby from the street but if you ask, their are staff that can help you with your luggage.

I found a good rate and decided to have a short staycation at the Equus Hotel to relieve stress. I was a little concerned about the hotel, knowing its and older, smaller property. When I arrived, in the early evening, on a Sunday, I was pleasantly surprised.The location for me was great. At the west edge of Waikiki, it's close enough for me to do dome walking and exploring but not stuck in the middle of the congestion that can be Waikiki. From the lobby, the renovations to this property were well done. clean and quaint, the equine theme was carried out well. Getting to my room on the 6th floor, I found that the renovations followed thru to the rooms and it was clean, well maintained and comfortable. Small bathroom with everything I needed and a fairly comfortable sized room with a king bed, sitting table and chairs, flat screen tv, countertop with coffee maker and under counter mini-fridge. The sliding glass doors opened to a little balcony overlooking Ala Moana Blvd and the surrounding hotels. All done well and comfortable.Two things to keep in mind, the bathroom is small, shower was tight but functional, and the street noise can be loud during the day and evenings with the older sliding glass doors to the balcony not keeping much of the sound out.Over all, I had a very nice stay and will be staying again next time I need a little break. The location, comfort and easy going staff make it a nice place for a get away.

At The Equus Hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Not a fancy hotel but service was great! Mattress a little worn in our room but we were exhausted from our day trips that we still slept fine and didn't hear any of the traffic going by.

Well-appointed Hotel, I notice those things. Great toiletries and a nice touch to provide muffins and organic coffee in the morning, Had a partial view of canal and marina. Central location was the cherry on top!

The hotel itself is nice. The rooms themselves are nicer than the outside looks. Very friendly staff. Our frustration came with parking. Just a shock to a traveler that hotels don't provide parking...

Check in took awhile as a foreign group was ahead of us and it was difficult for staff to communicate with them. Our assigned room was not clean and we asked to change it and were accommodated by a very tall Hawaiian woman (Do not remember name)at front desk who gave us a nicer and cleaner room. She was extremely pleasant and apologetic and even sent a bottle of wine to our room for the inconvenience. She is an asset to this hotel. Hotel is charming and in a convenient location. Nice little pool.

My wife and I had a 4 day stay at the Equus in the first week of May. It was our second trip to Hawaii, and our first to Oahu. I chose this hotel based on location close to beaches and waikiki, and the good reviews on Tripadvisor, which I always have had good luck with. Not disappointed. The location is a very short walk to beautiful beaches and the Hilton lagoon. Right across street from Outback and Red lobster, as well as some local restaurants. The staff here is excellent!! Cant rave enough. Always friendly, and willing to chat. This is a locally owned establishment, and it shows. It feels like a B&B the way these members obviously care about what they do. Should we plan a return visit to Honolulu, this is where we will stay. Without a doubt.

Hotel was nice and convenient for our needs for one night. However, upon arrival our group of 14 found that no rooms were cleaned and ready for check in. While waiting the computer system went down and a technician had to be called. We were told no rooms could even be allocated for us to put our myriad of luggage in. All 14 of us were told we just needed to wait in the very small waiting room for almost an hour before rooms were assigned to us. We were offered a complimentary drink of juice which was nice considering it was quite hot. The people were nice but I wish they had been able at least take our luggage into holding (which we asked and were told was possible but never followed up on by staff) so we could have at least gone and eaten lunch/dinner since we had been up and traveling since 4:00 AM that morning. After almost an hour and a half a manager finally arrived who was much more helpful and accommodating and tried to get us situated as quickly as possible.

We stayed on may 1 and I had a wonderful stay ...your staff was excellent and very help and show the awesome aloha sprit..mahalo to Puka and Rene and your parking staff..I look forward to my next stay there thank you to everyone one there..

Ok, if you want a 5 Star resort, keep looking. But if you want a great place at a reasonable price, this is it.Location, Location, Location. Waikiki beach is just behind a building across the street. Tons of restaurants and clubs in close walking distance. Just a great place to be. Valet is one the side of the hotel, then you have to walk about 50 feet up the street and then up stirs to get to the front desk. Valet worked well, didn't seem to be out racing my rental mustang convertible!Slight deductions because you are outside to get into your room (weather is great so not a big issue) and you do have to climb stairs to get to the hotel (I imagine that is an issue for some).

Room wonderfully appointed with neat Asian style furniture and horse themed art. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I chose this hotel because Equus means Horse in Latin. The room has a Keurig machine and refrigerator. No microwave. Sorry, but this is not the type of place you go to then decide to cheap out by microwaving your meals in your room! Did not hear air conditioner. I was in one of the rear rooms, so I cannot say anything about traffic noise, but traffic doesn't bother me anyway. I was on the 10th or top floor where upgraded rooms are. There are also no balconies that I could see. There is one suite on that floor in the front. This is not the type of hotel to bring children, in my opinion, and personally was glad not to have run into any. The hotel seemed very popular with younger couples from Japan, and it is probably the closest little hotel to the shopping center, the marina, the park at the marina, and toward downtown. It is NOT in the skyscraper hubbub of Waikiki!!! Plus no resort fee, since it's a hotel. No restaurant on site, nice swimming pool area. There is limited parking, and steps, not an elevator up to the main desk from street level. Not many. It is a half block from the bus stop, and all busses are $2/ride, period, unless you get a special weekly pass. For me, it was perfect and I will go to Equus when I'm in Honolulu.

My husband and I love to travel simple. This hotel is perfect! Our room was ready upon arrival, and we arrived early! The room was nice and clean, with a queen bed, a tv, a dresser, a balcony, and a bathroom with a sink, toilet and shower! The location is perfect, it's a 15 minute walk to get to the downtown area of Waikiki, and if you walk to the harbor you get a shortcut to the beach!

This is hidden gem and my stay was awesome. I recommend for anyone needing a good stay. The room is very roomy for it's price in Waikiki and ala Moana areas. Staff is very helpful and made my stay feel more easy. Though it requires to take steps to come to lobby it was not a deterrence from not staying.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in a standard room. Beware that this hotel is situated on a major road. I thought our room was nice although a bit small. Not much space to spread out with bags. Bathroom was good. It could do with a bit of a makeover but other than than we experienced no issues. Front desk staff were always friendly & helpful. Our balcony overlooked one side of the hotel and even with the door shut we could hear traffic noise. We had hired a car so its US$25 per day to park. There is a small parking area next to the main entrance which you have to rush into if there is traffic behind you on the road and then try to get out of when you are leaving. It's not too bad but depending on what time of day it is can get a bit tedious. Unfortunately your car is not always on hand as they have to park it in a larger car park behind the hotel, so when you are leaving allow time for them to get your car. Big plus is that the hotel is within walking distance of a major shopping centre, the Ala Moana Center. We didn't eat at the hotel at all so I can't comment on the breakfast, which wasn't included by the way you had to pay extra. Might be worth doing that as we didn't find any nice breakfast options around the hotel.

We have just spent 5 nights at the Equus in Honolulu. We arrived in the early morning to heavy rain and an expected checkin time of 3pm. It was wonderful of Puka and Jackie to arrange a room by 10am for us.The king room was perfect. Lovely presentation, comfortable bed, cable tv, fridge, balcony, coffee machine, safe etc and very clean. We were on the 5 th floor and there is some traffic noise but very little from surrounding rooms.The Equus is close to the harbour and about 10min stroll to kakanamoku beach, a lovely spot next to Waikiki. It's 700m to ala Moana shopping centre and the beach and park across the road from there are very nice. We spent a little more time there as it's a lot quieter. The zoo is at the end of Waikiki beach and is 3km away. There is a convenience store and food places close by. There are lots of great restaurants on the 3rd level of ala Moana with sea views.The staff at the Equus were fantastic, always helpful and friendly. Renee is lovely and I've forgotten a couple of others that were great.We also considered it excellent value for money.

Stayed here for one night before heading off to Maui with the family and thought it was okay. I made my reservations as a package deal with airfare and thought it was it should be nice. We had the deluxe double and it came with a fridge and a coffee maker. The bed was a soft pillow top. The one plus is that it is walking distance to the International Market and a lot of restaurants.I thought the rooms needed a make over. The rooms were dusty and didn't look like they were cleaned. The walls looked dirty and the bathroom is tiny. The shower is maybe 4x4 and the shower head is low. I'm 6' tall and I had to lean down to rinse my hair.Since this was my first time staying within Waikiki, I can't really compare it to anything within the area. If I had to compare it to something, I would say it was like staying at a motel 6.

I chose this hotel because of my budget so I was aware I was going more 'boutique'. My room was perfectly functional and clean with a nice large bed. I mainly used this as a base for my luggage and a place to sleep.If you do come here and you are a light sleeper then pack some ear plugs. My rooms balcony half looked out onto the main road and the balcony doors are pretty old and did not completely seal the noise. The road is pretty continuous with traffic being one of the larger roads around the area.The best part of this hotel is the location, you have a supermarket a few steps away on the corner and the beach is less than a 10 minute walk. If you want luxury and peach then this is not for you, try one of the beach front hotels. But if you are like me and you want something cheaper in a good location, then this will suit you perfectly.

My wife & I stayed in The Equus Hotel during April 12 thru April 18, 2017. The service was outstanding and Yosh & Rene were most helpful. We were looking for a less expensive but clean & comfortable hotel & this place met our needs perfectly. Our room on the 5th floor was very comfortable & clean. The king sized bed was great! The bathroom was very clean and there was plenty of hot water, although the shower was small. Valet parking is available for $25.00 per night & this is worth the price because parking is hard to find in this area. The only negative is the noise from the Ala Moana Blvd. but this will be the case with any hotel situated on Ala Moana Blvd. The noise however did not keep us from sleeping.A room more toward the back of the hotel will be quieter. The air conditioning was nice & cool & quiet. There is a small refrigerator in the room & we made good use of it with food that we bought from the nearby Costco. Gasoline is available there too.This hotel is very convenient, safe & accessible. There are some delightful places to walk with sidewalks along the water. There are also some great places to eat nearby.

We stayed at the EQUUS Hotel for a WEEK - Great Location and wonderful Staff - i will say that the pleasure of meeting SCOTT - Scott provided a possible daily agenda even after we had done some pre-planning prior to traviling from Michigan to HI

I decided to stay at this hotel with my family on our visit to Waikiki for a night. The hotel is walking distance to the international market, a lot of others restaurants, and the beach ; which is a plus. It is an older hotel. My room when I check-in was dusty and had scuff marks all over the walls. The rooms seemed dreary and dark. The bathrooms are really small, especially the shower. I'm 6' and I felt crowded and had to slouch to wash my hair. It's my first time staying at a hotel in Waikiki so I can't really compare it to anything else but if I had to compare to a Las Vegas hotel then I would say it's on par with Circus Circus, Excalibur or Stratosphere.

This is a functional business type hotel but perfectly fine if you are not after lazing on the beach. Good value and convenient for public transport. Efficient and clean. Would stay here again rather than looking at other options which, to me, is always a good test.

Renee and Puka were AWESOME! They were so helpful and accommodating. Our room was ready early which was perfect. Clean and simple room, even had a peekaboo view of the harbor. Super conveniently located.

I never heard of this hotel until my friend suggested this hotel. It is a hideaway with cozy rooms and a quiet atmosphere. We enjoyed a nice weekend and will return again and again. Rene was very accommodating when I made reservations. Lots of Aloha and warmth. Puka was very helpful when we checked in for our weekend stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel, The price is cheaper than other hotels and only a block away from Ala Moana.

Conveniently locatedPrepare for a flight of stairs upon arrival, but there is a person in the car park to assist you with your luggageFriendly StaffElevators to rooms providedDescent sized roomLove the ambient lightingComfortable bedAir Conditioner with remote controlFlatscreen TV with many High Definition channelsMini fridge with separate mini freezer. So cuteSpacious Balcony where one can enjoy a cool beverageSmall bathroomSink separate from shower and toilet, which helps with spaceShower is small; only fits one person. Not for people on a romantic getawayPlenty of towels: 4 bath towels, 4 face towels, 4 washclothsEarthTempo toiletries: 1 cleansing shampoo, 1 balancing conditioner, 1 moisturizing bath gel, 1 hydrating lotionBar soapMany restaurants in which to walk➡️Red Lobster, McDonaldsThe ABC Convenient Store is nearSchedule an Activity or Tour at the front deskEmbrace the fruits of Hawai'i at The Equus Ascend

I stayed in this hotel for 7 days from 21st to 28th of April. I have chosen this hotel for a conference held in Hawaii Convention Centre.The one and only advantage of this hotel is its location. It is located in Waikiki island and close to the Hawaii Conference Centre. It is good for those attending conference which is around 10 mins walk from the hotel. The hotel is also close to major shopping area (Ala Moana shopping centre) and Waikiki beach. However, there are several down sides for this hotel:1. No elevator from car drop-off area to hotel lobby, you have to carry your luggage and walk up few flights of stairs. No one is gonna help you to carry your luggage. 2. Hotel room is quite small for American standard. The room sound proof is extremely poor, the hotel is located just next to Ala Moana Blvd, which is the main road of Waikiki.
