The sound proof of the hotel window or glass door is so poor that you are like sleeping beside the main road. I can never fall asleep at night without an ear plug. I would not stay in this hotel if I realised the noise before I arrived.3. Room has lots of wear and tears, for e.g. the room glass door to balcony is cracked.4. The one and only one lift of this hotel often malfunction, I encountered 4 incidents of lift broke-down during my stay in this hotel.5. Lack of staff in this hotel. You can only find the only staff of this hotel is in the reception. 6. This hotel do not have any restaurant facilities.7. The hotel wifi is very slow.

Alex, Renee, Isabelle, Presley & Scott -- just a few of the standout staff, they are so friendly and happy to help you have the best time in Hawaii. The bed & pillows are wonderful, great fresh muffins every morning with "fix it your way coffee". This hotel is true to my concern - no extra fees, I wanted a clean place to sleep and shower, and to pay simply for that, and this place worked well. Location was convenient to using Waikiki beach or using the AlaMoana beach. Only thing I'd suggest is to change the TV remote laminated flyer......made it more complicated than it really was LOL. I definitely recommend this little gem for a less expensive choice. Mahalo

The location,was good and all the team at front desk was very nice. Muffins and coffee in the morning was very helpful! The man at the tour desk was very nice and gave us some tips. Relation quality/rate was very good

The Equus surprised me. We didn't care if we stayed on the beach and wanted to avoid the high cost of doing so. This was a very nice property with an intimate feel and the price was about a third of other properties. Our room was very nicely appointed - though a microwave would have been nice - with everything needed for a comfortable stay. The beds were comfy and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful with any questions we had. Loved the fresh apples! My only complaint was that the windows are paper thin and we could hear street traffic which fortunately diminished at night. We had a room on the third floor. I would probably request a higher floor if I were to return.
user_name:
Deborah B
Daytona Beach Shores, Florida

review_body: Booking and check in was easy and seemless. Friendly staff. Valet Parking with USD 25 per night expensive taking into consideration that we are hotel guests. Room was clean and nicely furbished. A tipical city hotel in Waikiki. We used it as a homebase to venture outside the city to see Ohau which was great. We enjoyed our stay since we did not book it to be mainly in Waikiki.

Equus is a great little hotel located just outside of Waikiki but still near the beaches and places to eat. The rooms are very nice and wonderfully decorated. The theme of the hotel definitely focuses on equestrian which is really great. The rooms are big and a cool place to relax after time in the sun. The noise from the nearby busy road can be a bit much at times but is bearable. Overall if you're looking for a nice and affordable place to stay with a cool flair the Equus is a great place to stay!

We stay for two nights arriving early Easter Sunday. The staff were welcoming finding these tired travellers a room earlier than expected. The room was clean and the service quick when some items needed servicing. Isabelle was a friendly face who made us feel at home. Only reason we could not give 5 stars was the room was really noisy with road noise making it hard to sleep.

I spent 13 nights at The Equus. I hated to leave! Room was very clean! King bed, with pillow top was very comfortable! Great location! Close to beach, restaurants, shopping centers, and downtown Wakiki! Each room has a kuerig coffeemaker, and coffee and biscotti was provided each day! The entire staff was amazing! Isabella, Yoshi, Paku, Glenn, Mike, Ipolani &JunJun took care of my every need/want and made me feel at home! They even allowed me to stay in room until my evening flight (that's the plus to a family owned hotel!)I will be back...And will stay here again!

We were in town for the Hapalua Half marathon and Equus, an Ascend Hotel, was the perfect location. This was the last family owned hotel on Oahu. We needed to get to the convention center to pick up our bibs for the run and the hotel was a nice, shady walking distance along the Ala Wai to the convention center. Then we walked to the Ala ‪Moana‬ shopping center for lunch. The food court had all kinds of different food to choose from. Scott, the concierge/travel guide was very helpful in finding the starting point of our hike on the Moanalua Middle Ridge trail head. There is even a chilled filtered water filling station where you can refill your water bottle. In my book, very environmentally friendly. Now that's a 5 star hotel.

We enjoyed our first week on Hawai in Equus Hotel. First we wanted to stay for 3 nights but then stayed at least 7 nights! Perfectly situated a few minutes from the rumble of Waikiki, near the Busstation, near beaches, parks and harbours beside the Ala Wei Channel and 10 minutes to Ala Moana Shoppingmall this was our best decision to stay longer as planned!Very friendly and helpfull staff made our stay pefect in the nicely equipped and clean rooms with cooler, AC and balcony.Veeery good coffee, bananamuffins and fruits topped the package.Our special thanks to Rene who made it again possible to stay although the Hotel was sold/booked out. She was a great help and made our day! Will come back for 2 more nights before we fly home ;-)

Great family boutique hotel. The staff Always charming and helpful. Renee, Ramon and Glenn deserve special mention and always make us feel at home. We are locals and we stay here at least once a month.

Stayed 2 days, solo at the end of three weeks doing local Hawaii things with locals on the big island and Oahu. Equus is one of the few remaining family owned and operated hotels on/near Waikiki. Location is extremely convenient--2 short blocks off the waterfront, by the marina at/near the west end of Waikiki. The staff is extremely helpful and accommodating (e.g., they allowed my mom to park there for two hours free of charge while waiting for her flight, they allowed me a 3hr late checkout to accommodate some late am/early pm business calls). Just the kind of customer-focus one might expect from a well-run family business. Note that the Hotel is a bit dated; the rooms are small but functional. This is not a place to show off. That said, I very much enjoyed my stay, made the most of the convenient location, and wld definitely go back again. Thanks for a very nice and easy stay.

Knowledgable and friendly staff, complimentary coffee as well as coffee and tea in the lobby. Very convenient to everything--- ABC store right down the street and ocean ten minutes away. Staff very willing to help you find beaches, hikes, etc and very generous with towels, supplies, etc.

A beautiful and charming boutique hotel We were checked in by Puka, the nicest and friendliest reception person ever! He was amazingly helpful... organised our taxi and even called our next destination to confirm the address. Our room was just lovely... comfortable beds and quiet floor. We had a great sleep. Luv the coffee machine.

The hotel does have an elevator but you must climb a flight of stairs to reach from the street. It is an older "boutique" hotel which I gather means smaller rooms? It was clean enough but not as well staged as mid class hotels in most cities. I requested the next morning that they replace the sheets with holes in them with newer sheets. The patio sliding doors are probably not dual paned so fairly noisy even on the 7th floor. They have muffins and coffee in the lobby in the morning though which is nice. Easy walk to beach and considering the price of hotels across the street - the rates might encourage you to stay! The tv worked fine. The staff was friendly. Basically $130 (which was our rate) doesn't buy you fab in Waikiki:)

Equus is always a nice place to stay. The rooms are clean and nice and the staff are pleasant, particularly Puka, Jun-Jun-and Rene, who assisted me recently. I travel to Waikiki over a dozen times per year and Equus is my favorite place to stay if I need to stay Ewa-side.

From the start very easy registration process, beautiful rooms, excellent customer service from their staff! Top notch! Will be using them for all our business needs! Very professional, took the time to really listen and help with our needs!

First off this is not a luxury hotel more of a boutique hotel. The rooms are clean but SMALL. The street noise is loud but I'm not a light sleeper so doesn't bother us. Valet is $25 with in and out privileges. Now for the star of the hotel. Puka and Mr Glen. These guys are what customer service is all about. They go above and beyond to make sure you're happy . Btw no resort fees which was quite a pleasant surprise. Also hotel is in walking distance to the beach.

Our room was comfortable and clean enough. (The slats in the shutters could have been dusted, as could the wiring around the WiFi router behind the bed side table--but those are nitpicks.) All the conveniences we used worked just fine, although we didn't use the iron, hairdryer or safe. I would have preferred a firmer mattress, YMMV. I liked having our own in-room WiFI router. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I appreciated the free Mai-Tais our first night (coffee and water were also available for those that wanted to socialize without drinking alcohol). We didn't use the pool as there was too much else to do on O'ahu, and the beach was just a short bus ride away.

This hotel is great. Better than I expected. The room is very nicely appointed. Has a mini-frig with a decent sized freezer section. Keurig coffee maker. Nice bath, tile shower. Bamboo four-poster bed. Small balcony but big enough for two. The staff is nice and attentive. I got a text message from their customer service staff after my first night to see that I was satisfied. The only down side is having to lug my heavy luggage up those first set of stairs. They told me later that there's someone there to help with luggage, but you'd need to either call them from the street, or first climb the stairs to let them know you need help. I also need to mention Honolulu's great bus system to get around. With Google maps it lays out the bus route you need, what way to walk to get to the needed bus stop, gives you choices of routes, etc. And $1 fare for seniors! I'm very pleased with my choice of hotel. My travel agent was trying to steer me to a different one, but I found about the Equus myself, and I'm glad I did. Mahalo & Aloha!

The Equus is a nice clean hotel that I recently stayed in. The staff was friendly and while the rooms are basic they were clean and well appointed. Near the pink line bus which is only 2.00 per person. The only negative is there is no elevator to check in desk. You must walk up several steps. Parking 25.00 per night.

We had received such great customer service at this hotel. Yoshi working the front desk is so helpful and very kind! This trip was great because of how helpful all the staff was. You ask for any help and their on it! Thanks Yoshi

We have stayed at the Equus many times and love their clean rooms and great service.This trip we stayed next door at the Marina Tower which was not as nice but the Equus staff helped us get settled into the room even though they no longer are obligated to assist guests in that hotel.Rene & Puka made sure our stay was enjoyable and Rene's brother Mark made several trips to our room bringing some more coffee, shampoo, etc. He also worked on getting my laptop internet access and even fixed the room phone.When vacationing at Waikiki, we are made to feel welcome, safe & comfortable by the Equus staff!Steve & Bonnie

Everyone at Equus was so wonderfully kind...So much Aloha...rooms are large, comfy and very clean...All of the staff is more than willing to go out of their way to help with anything. Convenient location...Rene and Puka are so on top of things and made our stay at the Equus a really great experience...Thanks to all the staff!!!!!

Very satisfied first-time visitor to this hidden gem close to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Ala Moana Beach (not nearly as crowded as Waikiki). Izabella at the front desk ensured my stay was as pleasant as could be. My room was more than adequate for its reasonable price point; the service, warm and attentive. Although many of the furnishings could use some updating, never have I slept in a more comfortable bed – the body pillow was a nice bonus! Will definitely be returning upon my next visit to Honolulu!
user_name:
wanderingjws
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Finding somewhere affordable to stay at/near to Waikiki can be very difficult but The Equus pretty much meets the bill.Situated north, off strip but only about 10mins walk from that end of the beach.The room was roomy, good bed, fridge, freezer, pod-coffee machine, in room sink but no crockery or cutlery. Air conditioning, many channel TV.Loads and loads of towels.Balcony, but ours just overlooked the car parkDisappointed that for two days, from 5, the room wasn't serviced, but when we went out on evening 5, after asking for toiletries that hadn't been replaced, we came back to find that the room had been serviced that evening whilst we were out.

While the hotel room was nice, you need to expect a lot of road noise on the busy front street. Take ear plugs if you have them. Otherwise, the hotel is within easy walking distance to the beach, shopping, and Waikiki sights.

Wonderful small hotel - convenient to all of the wonders that Waikiki has to offer. Clean & comfortable accommodations; warm, friendly staff; and very affordable. Manager's happy hour on certain evenings, combined with the overall ambience, makes it seem like you're staying with good friends rather than a commercial property. Thanks so much!

Very personalized and refreshingly fragrant lobby and Polynesian hospitality. Rene, Isabella, Puka, Glenn, and Mack have time to talk story and they even deliver ice to your room! Unparalleled and uncommon hospitality skirting Waikiki beach and did I mention walking distance to world class eateries and shopping at Ala Mosns shopping center. Aloha nui loa Rene

Renee went above and beyond in helping me with a complicated reservation. Thanks for your help! Great service! The hotel is super close to the beach, reasonably priced and centrally located to stores and other activities.

Warm, welcoming staff. Front desk staff and doorman were especially helpful! Central location for the beach, restaurants and shopping! Clean, comfortable room! Quiet atmosphere day and night. Affordable! We will definitely be back!

I have been staying at Equus for 8 years and counting. The location is ideal, in the sense that you are at the end of Waikiki and so not as noisy and hectic as being in the heart of Waikiki, yet, you are still close to the Mall, Sports Bars and State park Beach. The staff is very proactive, friendly and customer service oriented to ensure a restful experience. Jackie in Housekeeping is amazing and does a great job in making sure your room's are to your preference. Rene K, The guest services Manager is a true pro, who will go out of her way to make sure your needs are met, and she has a great ability to take charge should a challenging situation arise. She has always taken care of me, and my conference Attendee guests that I have referred to the Hotel through the years. The front Desk staff are also great. Yoshi is a super nice kind, customer service oriented person, and even was thoughtful enough to bring his personal DVD player to the Hotel so i could have one in my room for a few days. Lastly Achew, is a veteran presence who works the late shift and whenever I needed wake up calls, or extra towels or directions he was always gracious to accommodate me. Added shout out to Paul in Valet who was very fast and efficient in helping me with my luggage and my car rental. Lastly Mariah D, is part of Executive team, and has also been a very reliable trusted and gracious host through the years. 5 stars for the Equus team and their ability to make your vacation work conference feel like a second home away from home. Mahalo,Warren Julian Levin

The location was amazing, I attended a conference at the Hawaiian Convention Center, and it was located within a 10 min walking distance. This hotel is close to good food places, a few minutes away from the mall, and Waikiki. Rene was very helpful, she made sure I was having a comfortable stay at the hotel. Izabella and Glenn were always very attentive!This is a very recommendable place for a reasonable price :)

Just returned from our second stay at the Equus. Nothing much has changed from 2 years ago. Rooms are very nice, beds extremely comfortable, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We borrowed beach towels and chairs every day that we went to the beach. Weather was great. The location of this hotel is really good for us as we love the Harbor Pub across the street and the convenience of the ABC store a few doors down. Lots of restaurants in walking distance. The traffic noise was worse this year, even from the top floor! Motorcycles especially annoying racing down the street in front of the hotel. Not a huge fan of the dressers. Drawers are hard to open and the furniture has a musty smell so I lived out of my suitcase all week. Still, we will return to Equus. The price is reasonable and the location is a plus.

A nice place near the shopping mall and downtown. Air conditioning and coffee machine are available in a room. A refrigerator is not that small so you can put food and bottles of water and you can make ice in the freezer. The most important thing is a nice service. I had a problem with parking but one of the staffs, Ramon, helped me a lot. I really appreciated it But one thing that I'm sorry about is there's no microwave in a room. If you stay at this hotel, i'm sure you will enjoy your vacation here.

A great small hotel. Air conditioning masks street noise. Stairs not an issue as Glenn the bellman carries your bags for you. Izabelle and Ramone at the front desk help you with all your needs. Go to Aloha Sushi and pick up an excellent cheap supper. Easy 4 minute walk to Ala Moana Center. Valet parking staff quick and worth the $3.00 tip.Felt like staying with family !!

I have stayed at numerous Hotel's in Waikiki, many of which are far more expensive. Yet I have returned here for my third visit. Let's not kid anyone it's not a top end Hotel. But it is currently undergoing some renovations which will improve it. The property is not big, but that's what I like and you can walk anywhere. Whether the beach, Ala Moana Mall or the Beach Strip, they are all close by. I enjoy the walk in shower, it's great not to have to climb in and out of a bathtub to take a wash. Also the in room safes are a great benefit, when storing your valuables. Free coffee is available next to the front desk, as is some daily fresh fruit. There are many restaurants nearby and Snappers, only 100m away has some great $5 cocktails. I can't complain about the staff, as l have always found them very helpful.You will get fair value for your money here and a Greta location.

Yoshi at the front desk was very helpful. Having a dirty, roaches crawling on counters and uncomfortable cheap mattress that you can feel the spring on your back place to stay at the Marina Towers on your week long vacation was very frustrating and stressful! We decided to check out early and walked next door to The Equus Hotel and Yoshi made us feel welcome right away and the place was very nice, neat and clean. Thank you so much Yoshi for the friendly welcome !!!

Wow!!! This is a great go to hotel. Comfortable, clean and close to everything. Friendly staff and Yoshi is super. He is one of the most friendly,helpful and accommodating people we've met here in Honolulu. If you plan on staying in Honolulu than the Equus is a must... thank you Yoshi for kick starting our vacation!!!

This is nice little hotel on the outskirts of Waikiki. Close enough to Ala Moana and decent food, it was great for a weekend getaway for my wife and I. Older place, but nicely renovated and clean. The only con to this place is that the windows dont do much to keep out the noise from the street below. That could be a deterrent for light sleepers. We were on the 6th floor.

This is a great location where you can walk everywhere, including the beach and marina. They really treat you like family and the price is right! Home of visiting polo teams and many regulars that visit frequently. Don't pass this one up.

this is a great value ! I always stay at this hotel each time i go to Hawaii . i travel a lot andmy family and i love the boutique feel to this small hotel. The hotel even serves fresh muffins and coffee each morning and afternoon .

Came here for my 1 year anniversary and man was it worth it. Prices and check in was easy. The room we had was fantastic. Very cozy along with the a/c. The bathroom and shower were very clean compared to the other hotels I've ever gone to. Too bad I didn't get to try the pool but I'll definitely be coming back here again.

My husband and I decided to stay at the Equus because of the value based price and the location - which was key since we didn't rent a car. We absolutely loved our stay. It was very clean. The staff was extremely friendly. You can even text for room service. Wifi was great. We stayed on the 9th floor and yes the elevator is slow, but there were 2 stair cases that I noticed and walking up the stairs only took a few minutes. If you're going to wear a bikini, might as well get the workout. Me and my husband decided we will come back next time we visit Honolulu. Close to airport and you'll be at the beach in 5 minutes walking. Very conveniently located next to restaurants, the world's largest outside mall, and of course the beaches -all with walking distance. It was a perfect stay. Will be back! Muhalo Equus! We enjoyed Hawaii more because of you.

The Equus family is AWESOME. My significant other and I have booked at least 10 nights over a period of time when we want to spend the night/weekend in Waikiki. I have stayed in many hotels in Waikiki, ranging from 2 star - 5 star hotels and I am quick to refer them to The Equus if they are just looking for a clean and intimate hotel stay. The customer service is what brings us back at least once every couple months. The rooms are always clean and if we ever run into an issue with the room, they are quick to respond. The location is perfect for us being next to Ala Moana, Bowls beach which is a minute walk across the stress to the firework show hosted by Hilton Hawaiian village on Friday nights at 745. Unfortunately, the view from the hotel is blocked from the Hawaii Prince hotel. Some may complain about the street noise but its really not that bad as long as you keep the sliding door closed. Not sure if they do this for everyone but the past few times we've stayed there they brought us a bottle of red wine and fresh pineapples just to show appreciation for our loyalty. For my girlfriends birthday they even upgraded us to the SUITE for no extra charge. All the staff are amazing but Rene takes the cake :) we always look forward to running into her to talk story and catch up.

We stayed in a king bed room on the 4th floor and it was a nice sized room. The staff and management were all very nice and helpful for our big group. They were quick to send someone to our room to help reset our A/C as well.

We've stayed at this hotel a couple of times. It's very nice. Clean, spacious and conveniently located. It's also a great place to stay if you don't want to spend a fortune on a room that you're only in at night. There are a lot of restaurants within walking distance. The staff is very friendly. We have recommended this hotel to others we know that have traveled to Hawaii.

We found the Equus hotel to be a comfortable and friendly place to stay while we were in Waikiki for a few nights. Everyone was very helpful. The room was spacious, and the king size bed was perfect for a good night's sleep. The parking valets were efficient; they took off at a trot when you came to collect your car.

This hotel is very nicely located in a safe area. Our room is very clean and the A/C was quite silent. Sound isolation of the room was very good. They allow you to leave your luggage at the check-out date. Would stay again.

This relatively small hotel, surrounded by huge ones, is a good choice for access to beach while being away from the large crowds of Waikiki. Good sized, comfortable room, small lobby, very helpful staff. Would stay again.

We stayed here for a very short night during our stopover. I loved the horse theme and the Chinoiserie furniture. Even though the furniture looked old like originals from the mid century it was a very elegant room and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever been in; seriously like sleeping on clouds.Noise was not a problem.I can't comment on location given we stayed for 6 hours but it was worth the 60 dollars worth of private shuttles to and from the airport.Note that breakfast I've been told is just muffins and coffee and there is no bathtub.

this hotel treats you like family they have a lot of aloha and great service at a great price they also offer kama'aina and military discounts. so if you are looking for a cute homey hotel this is the place to check out.

Very nice, comfy bed, well appointed, friendly staff, great value, no A/C noise whatsoever! I was in the back, so I had minimal street noise. Wind noise never bothers me, nor does rain. The west end of Waikiki I found desirable because it's close to the marina park, the shopping center, downtown, but still many restaurants, and NOT in the company of the resorts with bazillions of floors and people. Also, really nice: it's a neat hotel, so no resort fee! I like the horse theme personally, and I like that it's not a hotel where a family would go. It's great for couples, or, at most, one well behaved child who doesn't need outside entertainment. There is a pool tucked away, but no on site restaurant. There is parking, at a price. It sits on a main boulevard, and therefore main bus lines. A single bus ride costs $2.50 with a transfer. Want to go around the island? $2.50. I really liked Equus, and as a creature of habit, would stay there again, even though I have a sister in Honolulu.

I love this hotel! It is a boutique hotel right across the street from the ocean. When staying in the hotel you will be greeted by the friendliness staff. Very clean and comfortable. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

We came here for New Years Eve and at the Equus Hotel for five nights. The service we received from Yoshi was fantastic and really set the tone for our entire stay! I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quick getaway in a great location who is after great hospitality!

All of the reviews that mention the road noise are correct...and on the windy weekend we stayed here, the howling wind rattling the windows made it even noisier. And yet...it's a charming hotel in a great location...at a reasonable (for Waikiki) price.I slept with ear plugs in every night and slept great. I enjoyed the coffee in my room--and in the lobby--in the morning and the free mai tai's during happy hour. I heard the pool was ice cold but I'm not a swimmer, so I didn't care...and if you are, Waikiki is a short walk away.Staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but include a refrigerator and a coffee maker...and a comfortable bed. Bathrooms smaller yet, but big enough. You're not here to stay in the room: go out and explore!Yes, you have to walk up stairs to get to the lobby--but there is cheerful assistance with your luggage.The facility is a bit tired, dated, old...but hey, so am I. And, I look forward to coming back.

Equus ..ALOHA ....made us feel like family!From the valet, to front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and bell service my family was totally blown away by the ALOHA SPIRIT here.Rene was easy to work with booking our family vacation. Our special request for an earlier check in was greatly appreciated.Thank you for a memorable family vacation! Nuuanu 'Ohana

The Equus is a well appointed, conveniently located boutique hotel, with perhaps some of the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever experienced. Everyone there personifies the true Hawaiian meaning of "Aloha". From reception to check out all staff members made us feel like we were guests in their own home. Renee, Yoshi, and the entire staff were attentive to our every need.The property is located in a very nice section of Honolulu, convenient to everything. walking distance to restaurants, shopping, markets, and the beach was a real benefit. The only two challenges we encountered was parking and access heading North on Ala Moana Blvd. Parking is very limited, and valet is the only option. And access from Northbound Ala Moana requires a U-turn after you pass the hotel.I would heartily recommend The Equus to anyone visiting Honolulu. They will treat you like you are the only guest, giving you full attention and service. 5 star service and comfortable accommodations!

What a great, accessible place to stay. Located very close to Ala Moana Shopping Center (walking distance) and accessible to Waikiki. This place was near a lot great eateries as well. Making our stay very convenient and enjoyable!

I booked this hotel because it came up on my app when I was looking for a hotel under the Comfort Inn chain. This was a nice hotel, staff went out of their way to give each person 5 star service. My friends and I only stayed one night before boarding NCL Pride of America - it's location was great!

We enjoyed our stay simply because we were looked after without staff being in your face. House keeping got on with the job in a quiet professional way. Location was great we could walk to Ala Moana and to several family restaurants. We also had a short walk to the beaches. Loved access to the balcony but it did let in traffic noise.

Pros: This hotel is in a great location for food, mall, conference centers, and beach. For the week we stayed it was the best price place in that area. Compared to other places in this area, the parking fee was reasonable. Room was okay.Cons: noisy due to thin walls and single pane windows. The pool is in the shade at all times. There was a bug in our coffee maker. Construction going on so noisy during day.

This is well located on Ala Moana Blvd very near the large shopping center and across the street from a Red Lobster, Outback and a local pub. McDonalds is less than a block away and a small store on the corner sells everything including beer, wine and liquor.We really enjoyed the Friday evening Mai Tai's made by and served (free) by the owner!Breakfast is not included but the lobby had coffee, great muffins and apples every morning that we were there! (ample breakfast for us)

We stayed at the Equus for the 2016 marathon. Great location, can sleep in the morning of marathon as it 15 min walk to start line. Close to beach, shops and tons of restaurants. Great Acai bowls at Tropical Tribe (1 block away). Paul at the front desk was very helpful. If we do the marathon again, this is the place to stay.The small balcony and keurig coffee maker was nice to have.

Certainly wasn't overly impressed. Everyday we had to have the air conditioner worked on/reset. You never knew what it was going to do. It could be pleasant when you went to bed and like an ice box in the AM. The road noise was terrible even on the 9th floor. When we checked in the sheets on the bed had holes in them. If you wanted ice you had to go to the desk to get a small bag. The bathroom was extremely small, I've had bigger on cruise ships. The construction noise in the AM was a bit bothersome. The fit and finish in the room left a bit to be desired. The exterior glazing on the windows was in such bad shape that I worried if the glass would fall out. The carpeting looked clean but was filthy. The small closet only had 4 hangers. You had to go to the desk to get s key for the room safe with a $50 deposit. But it is a very quaint hotel. The location is ok. I only wish that when we checked in we had been informed about some of the amenities such as they are. There is a definite lack of accessible electric outlets in the room.

My wife and I had read a lot of the reviews from those who have previously stayed at the Equus Hotel (both good and bad) before we arrived in Honolulu, Hawaii. Nevertheless, we both kept and open mind, and in the end, we were struck with a lasting impression by the Aloha Spirit from ALL of the employees from the front desk to the valet guys. Below, I have added the email that I had sent to Rene, the Guest Services Manager at the Equus:Rene, Aloha!  Now that my wife and I are back here on the mainland and beginning to readjust and get back into the swing of things, we would like to extend a heart-felt thank you to everyone there at the Equus Hotel for making us feel so welcome and helping us to have the best vacation that we've EVER HAD!!!!  Sure, we've seen some other beautiful states and have done some things that can now be crossed off of our bucket list, but, Hawaii was by the far the best experience.  We definitely miss the people, the weather, the ocean, the mountains, and most of all, the Aloha! We would like to thank you for your consideration to help us with the possibility of receiving some 100% Kona coffee from your friend.  This friendly gesture was extremely thoughtful and nice, and we will be forever grateful for your thought alone, should this end up not panning out, for whatever reason. And, not to leave anyone left out, we would also like to send a well-deserved thank you to the valet guys.  All of them were great, however, Paul (the skinnier of the two) played a huge part in helping to make our vacation great.  He never once misdirected us, and his suggestions and advice were nothing less than excellent.  Paul is a valuable asset for the Equus Hotel as he often went above and beyond.  Before we left for the airport, we were glad to see that he was working, and he was rewarded with a big, grateful hug from my wife and a thankful hand shake from me.  We will never forget him! We just wanted to thank you very much for helping our time on O'ahu to be the best vacation experience on record for us.  You and the Equus Hotel will be held in high regard, as far as we're concerned.  Shaka! Mahalo and Aloha!How 'bout them apples, huh? We can just go on and on about how awesome the Equus staff was.In regards to some of the previous reviews written by others, maybe we might be able to help others make a decision based upon our own experiences while staying at the Equus Hotel:Yes, as others have stated, the entire group of people who make up the Equus staff are nothing short of awesome, accommodating, friendly, and easy to talk to. I would definitely stay here again based on them alone, as well as, highly recommend the Equus to anyone interested in staying in Honolulu.Yes, there are stairs leading up to the front desk; however, there is an elevator available to get to all of the rooms. And, as others have said in their own reviews, we also agree that the beds were very comfortable!Yes, they are currently working on updating the hotel; and although it's not as colorful or extravagant as some of the other hotels right on Waikiki, we found it to be quite comfortable and convenient, and suited our needs very well. Its location was even nice for an evening walk to the ABC Store, a few of the local restaurants in the area, and even to the west end of Waikiki Beach.Yes, it is located right on Ala Moana Blvd., which, does lend to some road noise, but, my wife and I actually felt that the noise was a non-event. The noises really didn't bother us at all.And, since the hotel is right on Ala Moana Blvd., the traffic can become heavy at times depending upon the time of day, which can make it a little challenging to get out into traffic every once in a while. Yet, it isn't much different than trying to get out into traffic in any other large city here on the mainland.In closing, when it comes to getting to the Equus Hotel from the Honolulu International Airport (from the west), you will want to be in the far-left lane on Ala Moana Blvd. When you see the Ala Moana Shopping Center on your left (parking garage on street level), then you're getting close.You will cross the Ala Wai Canal, where you can also see a marina on your right as you're crossing the bridge over the canal.The next traffic light will be Hobron Lane. This is where you will want to get into the left-hand turn lane and cut a (legal) U-turn. (A Red Lobster will be on your right; a Crazy Shirts t-shirt shop will be cattycorner and across the street from the Red Lobster on the right; a McDonald's will be cattycorner to the left; and on the other side of the hedgerow in the median will be an ABC Store - you may not be able to see it, but trust me, it's there.)After making the U-turn, be sure that you're in the right-hand lane, and just a short distance away, on the right, will be the entrance to the Marina Tower Waikiki, which is literally just before you get to the hotel entrance. This is where you will pull your car in for the valet guys, who will take very good care of you. (If they're not there when you get there, they're probably busy parking or retrieving a car for someone else). The parking area is kind of tight quarters, but, the valet guys are helpful.And, on another note, should you require your car during the valet off-hours, all you need to do is make arrangements with them beforehand, and they will make sure that your car is available when you need it.I certainly hope that this helps those who may be undecided in regards to staying at this hotel. Although, I can't speak for everyone else who has stayed there in the past, I can assure you that my wife and I will definitely be returning to the see the people at the Equss Hotel during our return trip to Hawaii . . . whenever that might be.

I enjoyed my stay at the Equus Hotel. The staff was very friendly, attentive and eager to accommodate your needs. Clean rooms, mini fride/freezer & comfortable beds. It is centrally located to the mall and lots of restaurants.

We recently spent the last night of our vacation at the Equus Hotel and were very pleasantly surprised by the experience. Rene at the front is such a doll, and took great care of us...they even upgraded our room! Location, value, service and cleanliness were all excellent. We'll return in the future!

My wife and I recently visited O'ahu for our anniversary. We were looking for a boutique hotel to stay at for our last two nights on the island. Overall, we enjoyed our stay but there were a few issues. The hotel is a little challenging to access by car, as the driveway is located right on busy Ala Moana and is very narrow. Getting to the hotel requires a stair climb (which the hotel is very clear about when making a reservation). The room was very comfortable, but don't expect a view without traffic noise (again, the hotel is located on a busy street). We would stay here again, but would not choose the city view room.

Staff were very friendly and helpful. Gave us good advice on where to go. Texting helped because we needed extra glass, cup and coffees for our third person in the room. Someone brought them up. Stairs for people with hip, knee and foot surgeries was a real hassle. A/c was a puzzle: finally pulled the keycard out and in again to reset. Muffins were good!

I have dealing with Puka. He has been wonderful. I am moving back to Hawaii and he has helped me extend my stay as my apartment is not ready yet. He has been extremely helpful and understanding. He also was able to keep me in my same unit which was wonderful.

Clean and tidy. The rooms are very comfortable and well equipped with hair dryer, iron,ironing board and safe.Free wifi.We found the lack of street lights up to the hotel a bit daunting at first but got used to it.

Makes you feel welcome, treat people with dignity and respect. Exceptional staff, goes the extra mile to make your stay comfortable. The manager Rene, represents Hawaii by here kindness, respect,charm.The place is small, but neat, clean and neat all activitied

Alright, lot to say about this hotel. First and foremost, would I stay here again. Yes, but it would not be my first choice. Because it is an "Asend Collection" it gives you the impression of something really impressive, it is not. Average yes, much higher priced average. Although I didn't research it, maybe not so much considering it is in Hawaii. On the good side, the location is great, the people super friendly and accommodating.On the down side, as I see many others have complained about, starting with the entrance, if you are handicapped, this is absolutely not an ADA compliant hotel in my opinion. If I had to get myself or my wife up those steps in a wheelchair, I don't think I could do it. It looks nice, but not easy for ADA people. The parking was by valet only and you really go into the driveway of the neighboring property. We did not go out late at night, but the valet (at a forced $25/night + tip) is not there during late night hours, so beware. The main room is OK in size, the restroom is odd shaped and had a very small shower. If you like baths, we stayed here twice, both rooms only had showers, no tub. Like others, I noticed the water had an unusual smell. Many complained here, and I can't stress it enough, the things that can keep me awake are light and heat. If noise will keep you awake, this is NOT the hotel for you. I kept double checking the sliding door to make sure it was closed, it sounded as if it was open the entire time. The wooden shudders do not do a very good job keeping the light out, but I understand it is the decor. The balcony is great, however view was horrible, and even noisier. We like to people watch so we watched the passing traffic and pedestrians. The second room we were in had the A/C until on the balcony making it even noisier and way to hot to sit out there, very disappointing. The A/C unit did not work very good, they seem to be in disrepair or not strong enough for the room size. Like others we attempted to keep costs down by eating in the room after shopping at the grocery store. We packed the small fridge, and I never did see any ice, when I asked where it was, they brought some up to me instead.We did not use the pool, looked beautiful but rather small, and where situated doubt it gets much sun. What I also noticed, other than the metal rail steps, there appeared to be no regular steps leading into the shallow end of the pool, very unusual to see.Except for the real low end Choice Hotels, most have breakfast, not here. So we bought milk and cereal for breakfast that we ate in the room. Considering the price, this was disappointing.Again, not horrible, but considering the price, it fell short in many areas. We would strongly look elsewhere before staying here again, but we would not rule the place out if it seemed where we wanted to be for location, but with the A/C issues, non-ADA aspects, noise issues, most likely would stay elsewhere.

From the moment we pulled up to the hotel, it was one amazing staff person after the other. They have the sweetest valet I've ever met in my life. Renee at the front desk was the essence of hospitality. The room was clean and quiet, with a large refrigerator, a few blocks from the water. The price was fantastic. Plus no $30 breakfasts here. They served coffee, fruit and muffins, plus McDonalds was a few steps away for breakfast. Definitely, a great hidden jewel.

They messed up our reservations. We did not get the balcony room which we paid extra for. I will take this issue up with my AAA travel agent. Desk staff did not seem to be familiar with immediate area and was of little help with directions, recommendations, etc.At least they had free mai tai's on Friday night.

My family and I had the most fabulous stay at the EQUUS Hotel from Oct 27 to Nov 2,2016. Pooka and all of the front desk staff were very friendly and provided my family and I with excellent Customer Service. Our rooms were serviced and cleaned daily. I highly recommend this fine hotel hands down. I have been in Customer Service for 35 years and I was extremely happy and pleased with this fine hotel. I give it five stars! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Ms. Tammy Delgado & Family~ Sacramento, CA

Very welcoming from the second I came to the front desk. Rene made me feel like a king because I support choice hotels and she gave me extra special treatment ( very easy to join and quickly adds up to free room night). The room was an amazing upgrade and very comfortable. Really felt valued by all staff the entire stay.Ps. For fun you can rent a scooter out of their garage.

We came in on a Friday afternoon and were greeted by the bellman (forgot his name) who helped us with our bags. Rene at the front desk gave us a warm greeting with plenty of aloha spirit and we were quickly offered fresh pineapple juice and a mai tai at 5 pm. Our stay was comfortably Hawaiian with an airy comfortable room, great wifi and a location that was not on the beach but very close. The price was quite reasonable.We would and will certainly stay at the Equus again.Thank you for the hospitality.Scott

Wonderful welcoming staff from front desk to concierge to housekeeping. Very Sweet Rooms!! Everything clean and in order. Quiet. Comfy beds. Lovely bathroom. Plenty of amenities. Close to everything. Beach and buses less than a block away. LOVE the horse theme. Affordable. Highly recommend.

We enjoyed our stay at the Equus Hotel. Can't beat the location surrounded by much more expensive hotels charging well over twice the cost of the Equus. Yes you need to carry your luggage up from the street level- but this should be no surprise as it is clearly stated in their web page. From where you check in-there is a lift that will carry you up to your floor. We liked having the fresh water dispenser in the lobby area saved us from purchasing bottled water. The staff are friendly, rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels, we had no bugs for the 4 nights we stayed. Parking is $25 per day with in and out privileges, valet was always there when we needed him. We were on the 4 th floor you can hear the traffic from the street, but this did not bother us. If you are a light sleeper, and don't like to carry luggage up one flight of stairs you may want to check into one of the high priced hotels close by (The Modern across the street is $450 +). We were very happy here and would stay again if we ever decide to come back to Honolulu.

The first bad thing about this hotel was the stairs up from the road level to reception. It's a double flight with no lift - not good with luggage. Next was the overwhelming traffic noise in the room. Ironically, the AC was the quietest we'd encountered in the USA so we couldn't use that to neutralise the traffic noise. We asked for a different room but none were available. As it was Friday night, the noise continued until well after we were trying to get to sleep. This hotel needs to install double glazing.Honolulu is now an expensive place for accommodation so there's no such thing as good value any more. The day we were leaving to the airport was the flower parade along the road outside the hotel and we had difficulty finding out whether the carriageway towards the airport was going to be closed or not. In the end, it turned out that it was staying open. However, Uber, Lyft and the shuttle companies all said they couldn't get to the hotel. The girl on reception was very helpful and managed to call a taxi to take us, although they took a long time to arrive and we actually turned down a couple of passing taxis.

Once you get to your room, it's great! The room is clean and very roomy, they have a larger then small ice box and they have a miniature Keurig coffeemaker with lots of options which was awesome!! However, before you can get to your room you have to lug your luggage up a 2 flights of stairs just to get to the lobby!! There is no elevator from the parking lot to the lobby, so that was a bad first impression. Then the valet (which you're forced to pay for the $25/night valet charge because they have no self parking) only has one guy working and he takes FOREVER to just take your car from you. The 4 times that we arrived and left our hotel, there was never anyone waiting for you at the podium. But what really made me rate this hotel poor is that the morning we checked out of our hotel, we went down to the parking lot and our car was parked right in the front where we had parked it OURSELVES the night before - and the door was UNLOCKED!! I parked it there, so I know I locked the door before giving the valet my key. So when I commented to him that my door was unlocked he said, "Oh, I know...no worry, we were watching it all night". Which I know was not true because their valet is only open from 6:00am - 10:00pm!! So I will NOT be staying there again.

Here are the positives of The Equus: it was relatively inexpensive, especially in looking at other hotels in the area; the staff was attentive and responsive when an issue arose; and it is easy to be away from the crazy traffic of the main street. Prior to booking the hotel, I reviewed not only Trip Advisor, but also another website before booking, so I was a little dismayed that after we became settled, we discovered some creepy crawlies in our room. And let's just say, there were enough of them that made us ask for a change in rooms. If we had been in the second room first, I probably would have rated them as very good instead of average.The rooms and hotel are a little dated. They are currently doing renovations. I am not sure what the renovations are for, but there were signs posted indicating when they would do them, which is helpful and lets me know they are working on making the hotel better. I will say I am not sure if I will return, but I am always willing to give something a second chance, especially once time has lapsed.P.S. As noted above, the service was very good. Puka, one of the hotel staff, was very cordial and was willing to allow an hour late check out for me despite the hotel being sold out the next night. Also, although he asked for someone to take my luggage downstairs, he ended up doing it as the other employee was probably busy. This goes to show great customer service.

I would likely not stay at this hotel again. I was hesitant to book but the reviews are what sold me. However, after staying on Waikiki beach it is definitely a vast difference. I will say I expected this. When we arrived you had to walk upstairs to the small lobby and there is only one outdated elevator. The staff greeted us and was very pleasant with refreshments.However, we had to change rooms due to bugs. Yes, bugs the kind you definitely don't want to bring home with you. We searched the reviews over and over again and no one ever mentioned them. The front desk and the housekeeping was right on it but I could not sleep in the room. Both rooms the infested room and the new room were outdated and the I know the hotel is undergoing renovations. Maybe it will be better. It I could do half stars it would be 2.5.

The room was really comfortable,and clean,a short walk to the beach,very good located next to restaurants, the staff were very nice and helpful,I met Rene she is a very nice person,Wifi was fast, overall it was a very nice stay

The Equus Hotel in Honolulu was spendy but small which is a nice feature. Nicely decorated, helpful and professional staff, clean and well maintained. Within walking distance of anything you may need.

This sweet off the beaten path yet a short walk to Waikiki beach. Charming, quaint, comfortable, complete and Aloha come to mind again as I'm relaxing here in the lobby enjoying a complimentary morning cup and snacks... All the staff seem to know me by name, welcoming me, thanking me, sharing ways to make my stay even more comfy!

We initially arrived mid-morning after a cruise and the hotel was great in letting us into our room as soon as we arrived. The room was a good size and quite comfortable beds and had a fridge and small sink, Staff were fine and it is located reasonably central as to a big shopping center, with Waikiki beach not too far away.

stayed there 8 nights while at a conference. First impression is not the greatest: weird lay out with very small reception upstairs. building need some update. Rooms are clean if deco is a bit outdated (that is comment that can be made for many building in town). no restaurant on site and not much within 5 min walk. no desk in my room but apparently it can be asked for.On the plus side very attentive and prompt service. I could interact by text message (getting light buld changed, booking a late check out etc...). Price was good too. Location is very convenient for Hawaii convention Center: a nice 10min mostly in a park along the canal. easy cab ride to airport or shuttle. 20min walk to Waikiki.

Affordable, comfortable, one night stay. The room was immaculately clean. Nice balcony. Wifi was fast. I was able to connect easily and watch a movie on my laptop with no problem. I would book this hotel the next time I'm in Honolulu.

I stayed here for work. It was comfortable, and had good AC, and very friendly and helpful staff. It was about a 10 minute walk to the convention center. It is about a 20 minute walk to the restaurants down by Waikiki Beach -- or you can take one of the various buses nearby.

The Equus was trying hard to deliver more than we paid for. The building is, to be honest, a bit crap, but it was well renovated and the room was extremely comfortable and I thought all of the facilities were really solid. On top of that, the staff were 5-star, amazingly helpful and super-friendly. We actually sorted out the 2 best parts of our trip based on local connections from hotel staff...turns out we didn't need to buy that Lonely Planet after all. Also, excellent location...Ala Moana center is practically next door, and the beach across the road is great...perfect for viewing those Friday night fireworks. Starts at 8!

What a pleasant change from the adjacent Waikiki Marina Towers that we had booked for 19 nights but had checked out of after a frustrating sleepless 8 nights. The staff here are very courteous and friendly. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and acquaintances. When we return to Honolulu we will be staying here again.
user_name:
Neville H
Central Otago, New Zealand

review_body: The staff at this hotel were extremely helpful and went out of their way to accommodate us. It is an older style building with a well equipped room and very comfortable bed. There is some street noise, so a room on the upper floors is preferable.

I stayed for a long term business trip. The customer service was excellent, and really made my stay feel like home. All the employees are warm, caring and interested in helping you make the most of your travels to Oa'hu.

We loved our stay at the Equuis. The moment we arrived we were made so welcome by the front counter staff Puka & Rene and all other staff during our stay, always so helpful to all our needs. Normally we would stay at a 4 or 5 star hotel but because our Aussie dollar is so weak we decided to choose a less expensive hotel, we were not disappointed. There is no breakfast inc but we enjoyed our yogurt and fruit on our balcony every morning from the ABC shop 50 meters away. Its a great location, only 5 min walk over the bridge to Ala Moana Shopping Centre or the beautiful beach or 10 min walk to the Waikiki Centre. Great room with air-conditioning, a very comfortable king bed and stylish furniture, large TV, cable channels, safe, fridge, coffee machine, including basic standard amenities, the shower pressure and Free internet was the best we’ve experienced at any Waikiki hotel. Robert & Halina

I stayed in the tower and the view was AMAZING! The staff were great too. Special mention to Shawn for lending me his after sun gel after seeing me in the courtyard sunburnt. I forgot to get my sunscreen out when i dropped my bags off and left for the day before checking in. He also suggested some great places to eat and also made sure i was taken care of when booking a tour.

Not great but not terrible, yet had a laid back Hawaiian vibe so we enjoyed our stay for the most part. Good location and provides basic accommodation for sleep and shower. An Okay place if you don't plan on staying in the room. Cons: dusty, furniture is outdated, shower is very tiny and narrow, poor sound insulation so you can hear noise from the street with the sliders closed. Wasn't the most comfy or attractive place but offered basic standard amenities and was the most affordable option in waikiki for a last minute booking in mid Aug. Parking is $25/night, valet staff are very friendly and helpful.

The Equus Hotel is a very cute boutique hotel off of Ala Moana Blvd. I stayed in here a total of 14 days on a long business trip. As a business traveler I stay in chain hotels most of the time but the chain hotels in the Waikiki area are much more expensive so I decided to give this hotel a try because of the much lower room cost difference for my longer trip. The rooms are very comfortable and the furniture in each room is unique, with Hawaian type furniture. I had the city view room (1005) on the 10th floor which was recommended to me due to the noise from the Blvd traffic. There is honestly a lot of noise on Ala Moana so the higher the room the better. There is no morning breakfast other than basic coffee service in the lobby so be prepared to hit the nearby McDonalds or IHOP in the morning. Beach access is just 5 minutes’ walk away. Wifi is good but not super-fast nor reaching outside the room. There is only one elevator and depending on the time of day it may be a few minutes wait. Handicap access is not available and there are steps involved to get checked in or to get into the elevator. During my stay I did have AC in the room suddenly stop for no real good reason. I did call reception and the staff came up at 1130 pm but could not get it working so let me have a small fan and I opened the windows. Another room nearby reported AC problems and even a few days later another guest in the same room also had AC problems. The staff here is always so welcoming each morning and evening and takes great care to meet your needs as best they can. For example one night my room was not made up and when I called reception they immediately sent up staff to freshen up my room. For me, this place is a real good deal for the money. You don’t need to spend 300+ dollars a night in the chain hotels and can cut your hotel stay in half. This hotel is a great value if you have a longer stay and don't mind not having direct beach access and some minor inconveniences line AC, and no breakfast. I would stay here again only for a longer stay.

We stayed at The Equus for a few nights while celebrating my friend's 30th birthday. It is such a gem of a hotel I definitely recommend! It's family owned and operated and you really feel that in the warm hospitality. I love the beautiful pool; it's perfect when you're returning to your room and want to cool off and relax.CARS/WALKINGWe arrived late but the front desk and valet staff were as friendly and helpful as ever, checking us in and parking our car. There's a lot under the hotel, which is really convenient and reasonable for Waikiki. The hotel team valet the car and the price is added to your card when you checkout. A car's not totally necessary at this location if you want to stay in Waikiki, since you can walk everywhere from this location: Ala Moana Mall and Park, to Duke's in the heart of Waikiki. ROOMWe arrived in our room and gifts and a hand-written note were waiting, which my friend's boyfriend coordinated with the hotel for my friend's birthday. It was extremely thoughtful. Even without the added surprise of the gift, the room was clean and the perfect blend of modern (white sheets, flat screen TV, new mini fridge/freezer, marble counters, rain shower, etc.) and charming (Hawaii Polo Club pictures, white shutters on the windows, which open for fresh air!). We felt so relaxed. The room had two beds, super comfortable, and was really spacious. We filled the fridge with snacks from the nearby ABC store which is open late if not open 24 hours. We called it "our" ABC store, since we went there all the time. They have everything.SERVICEWe enjoyed the text message concierge service as well as the normal route of calling the front desk for things we needed, like a corkscrew. We borrowed beach towels from the hotel and enjoyed the plentiful water, coffee and snacks in the open air lobby. I definitely recommend taking advantage of the hotel's affiliation with the Hawaii Polo Club, it's an unforgettable experience on a part of the island you might not normally see. Also, the hotel has a desk outside their lobby, near the pool, completely devoted to helping you plan trips and activities around the island. Not to be missed!

My company has used The Equus for our annual Hawaii trip for the past several years.  Each year, we have worked with Rene to coordinate our reservations.  The Equus is extremely fortunate to have Rene on their staff.  All the details are worked out ahead of time and we’ve had no issues upon arrival and throughout the duration of our stay.  While I have not personally been out to Hawaii yet, all of my associates say nothing but good things about their experiences at The Equus.This year, however, was a little different.  Our trip was cancelled last minute, roughly 24 hours prior to check in.  It was cancelled due to issues on our end, at no fault of The Equus.  Their cancellation policy states that any deposit is nonrefundable if not cancelled 48 hours prior to arrival.  I let Rene know what the situation was and was assured that it was a busy weekend and that they’d likely be able to sell the rooms anyway.  If that was the case, they’d still be able to refund our deposits.  Well, guess what?  I got a message a few hours later from Rene that all of our rooms had been booked and our refunds were on the way!  When I was able to tell my management that I was able to get back our deposits, I looked like a super hero!So, thank you Rene and thank you to the Equus for working with us year after year and making our trip out to Hawaii easy and comfortable.

My spouse and I stayed at the Equus hotel for a total of 4 nights. This family owned hotel has a Polo theme throughout but the staff members are the real treasures. The location is wonderful, especially if you don't want to fight the traffic. Located 5 minutes from the Ala Moana mall and park, it made going to the beach a snap. The small frig and Keurig coffee maker helped us do breakfast in, especially after a staff member pointed out the ABC store practically on their doorstep. This isn't a 5 star property but if you want to support a family owned, not mega corporation experience, the Equus may be for you. Clean rooms, responsive , friendly staff, wonderful location , great rates all added up to a lovely Hawaii experience. And even though you had to go up a flight of stairs to get to the entrance, the staff was always helpful with your bags. We would return if we go back to Oahu.

Aloha and a special thank you/mahalo to Rene in guest services for going above and beyond to accommodate my company USA Environmental, Inc.’s team of employees atthe last minute. He also worked with us on our rate requirements for an importantproject there in a professional manner. His friendly manner and help that exceeded our needs meant so much. We will definitely return to the Equus Hotel in Honolulu.

Hotel is older...quaint, very small. Room door was sticking a lot, had to force it open/closed. HVAC unit could not keep up with temperature. Room felt warm, even at night. I adjusted down to 68, no help. The outside unit blew out so much hot air that the balcony could not be used, and was very very noisy. Traffic noise was excessive... sound enhanced by close proximity of other buildings, I was on the 9th floor. Pool is tiny and uninviting. Grandfathered in for ADA... no elevator to lobby. Quite a few stairs to lug up and down.No vending machines to speak of. No bathtub, only a shower.I only stayed to complete my gift card promotion with Choice Hotels. Staff was very friendly. Valet was expensive but staff was very helpful and friendly.

I had to cancel my reservation due flight delays. The staff was willing to work with me in cancelling my reservation for the evening. The staff member Rene was polite, friendly and professional. I appreciate the great customer service over the phone.

Thanks to Renee and Puca who worked with me when I missed my connecting flight due to delays. They really were life savers! Great customer service. Look forward to see them on my next trip to Hawaii. Aloha!

I had a last minute change of reservations and Renen and Puka were extremely helpful on working with me to make the change. You cannot go wrong with this level of service, and they will ensure to make your trip the best! Thanks again!
user_name:
sc0ttpaisley
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: There is a definite horse theme, so if you like that (which my daughter does), then that is the one feature that sets this hotel apart. Pros: 1) Good location. Not right on the beach, but a quick walk. Also quick to walk to Ala Moana mall. 2) Great wifi! Speedtest.net clocked it in at over 40Mbps down and over 10Mbps up, which is the best I've experienced in a non-wired connection at any hotel outside of Hong Kong. 3) Staff is friendly4) The price is a bit less than other hotels of similar quality in Waikiki, but see belowCons: 1) $25/day to park! They do NOT have their own parking, but use an outside valet service. We were there for four nights, which means parking alone added $100 to our total. This is ridiculous, and actually $5 more per day than the much more posh but not much more expensive, nearby Ala Moana Hotel. 2) Most people going to Waikiki aren't worried about working, but for those who are, be advised that at least our two double-bed room had no desk. 3) No view, at least from our room. This may be a question of which room one pays for, but we looked out on the wall of the neighboring hotel. 4) No microwave oven (although there is coffee maker and fridge)

We stayed here for one night as we had an early flight home the next morning after arriving back in Waikiki from the Big Island and didn't want to pay a lot for accommodation.As we had stayed at the Hilton Waikiki Village for 6 nights prior to going to the Big Island we knew the location was good and it was walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre which we intended to visit.The hotel can only be accessed by steep stairs so hard to get heavy suitcases up to reception. Also, there is only one very old and slow elevator to get to the rooms. Our first key card didn't work so we had to go back down to reception to get another.The room was quite big, clean and modern although the wardrobe being in the bathroom area was a bit weird bit not a big issue. We also had some issues getting the TV to work and had to call someone up from reception to fix the problem. They responded promptly and fix the problem so, again, it wasn't a major problem, just an annoyance.The balcony was quite small but did have views over Ala Moana Boulevard to the sea (sort of) but the glass sliding door and windows facing the street were old and thin and did not block out any road noise. As we had to be up at 4am we really wanted to get some sleep but it was hard to sleep with the road noise which was like sleeping on the median strip.Overall the hotel was ok and served the purpose we needed but I could not imagine staying here for an entire holiday as the road noise would drive me insane.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. Great location. The parking is expensive. Also, the AC doesn't work too well. It was on but just not very powerful. Other than that, it was was a nice stay and the staff was friendly.

Stayed there to be close to the Ala Moana mall. An average and reasonably clean and comfortable place but being right on Ala Moana Blvd. and having older single pane patio doors the noise of traffic going by all hours of the day or night means I won't be back.

It was a great stay ... At a great location close to the beach and the center .But most of all Rene you are a such a nice person . Thank you for making our stay one to remember .it was such a nice experience to walk and see the sunset on Waikiki beach . The hula at the Hilton And to do the island tour we booked at the reception from The Equus.Mahalo Anne-Marie & Wim

This was a great hotel. Right across from the beach. You will feel like family. Everyone is soooooo nice. Say hi to Renee'! Even the toiletries were great quality. They will welcome you with refreshing tropical juices. Nice balconies. Enjoy your stay. You will have a great time. If I ever come back to Honolulu I would stay there again

Everyone at the hotel is wonderful. The Equus is about a 7 min walk to Waikiki beach. If you walk over the bridge it's about a 12 min walk to the magic lagoon and Ala Moana beach (less crowded). It is also about a 10 minute walk to the largest outdoor mall in the world. The front staff was wonderful helped us plan for activities for 2 of the days we were there. The night time noise was non existent. We were welcomed with the most fresh and delicious pineapple I have ever eaten. The hotel provides beach towels which is a great way to keep the luggage light. Just ask for one on your way out. Since the hotel is not directly on the beach there are no resort fees. The rooms are beautiful decorated with rustic wood furniture. My husband and I had a lovely and relaxing time. We also enjoyed the free Mai Tais on Friday. It is a true boutique hotel where you recognize every single face and they accommodate your every need. We would definitely stay again and bring the kids.

We had a hula function this weekend and our stay at the Hotel was perfect the location was so centralize and the front desk employees were so accommodating ty to Ms Rene , she represents the aloha spirt and so willing to help make our stay comfortable and our room was very comfortable..

We booked this hotel for the two nights we were in Honolulu (specifically for our Pearl Harbor tour) and chose it for the price. The reviews had me a little nervous, so we went not expecting anything all that nice. The room was basic. Full beds, not huge, nothing awful, and nothing to write home about. And it was loud, but it's in a city, there's traffic noise and I'm not sure how any hotel in that area wouldn't be loud - and we certainly slept fine, so it wasn't THAT loud. But the bathroom was very nice, my 11 year old wants that shower head in the kids' bathroom at home. And the staff was above and beyond. We requested a cot and it arrived less than half an hour after we checked in. We enjoyed complimentary mai tais our first night there and had a lovely conversation with the woman serving them. Excellent service!

For the price, this was a perfect hotel, but if you look at the star rating on certain sites, it's not a 3 star. More like a 21/2. We were only there for 2 nights. They only have valet parking, so it gets expensive to tip on top of $25- parking fee. The rooms are okay, they don't exactly match the pictures or we got a room that wasn't sunny like the picture. Yoshi and the other front desk person was very friendly and helpful. The internet was down for most of the duration of our stay, so we couldn't use the computer in the lobby. The Ala Moana shopping center is a stone's throw away, so that was perfect for us to walk over there. I wouldn't come there if you are expecting an upscale boutique, but if it's a quick trip and you'll be gone most of the day, it's perfect.

The hotel was in a great location as it was very close to the beach. It was within walking distance to a bunch of little shops and also to the ABC Corner store, which luckily sells a lot of useful little items like toiletries. The hotel seemed a bit dated, but it got the job done. I only use it for sleeping and nothing else. The room and bed were clean and we were provided fresh towels. The hotel staff was very friendly. As soon as I arrived for check in, I was greeted with smiles and some juice. They have fresh apples and muffins out every day if you need a quick snack as well. I would recommend this place if you are looking for a no-frills hotel at a decent price.

The Equus Hotel had a friendly desk staff, valet, and concierge. Rooms are small, bathroom is small, and the balcony overlooked the busy street. The hotel is small and settled in between condos. However, it is within walking distance to the beach (you do have to cross a busy street), there are a few restaurants close by, and trolley and bus stops are close by. I would recommend downloading the Uber app to call for rides if you do not have a car, which is almost half the price of what a taxi will charge you. We were recommended Charley's Taxi Service to get a ride to the airport which had a flat rate of $29. Check out Hawaii Rainbow Tours with Paolo, if you are looking for an excellent island tour, you will not be disappointed!! Be sure to speak with concierge to find "things to do" around the island. I would stay here again, especially if I know I will only be using the room to sleep!

We liked our short stay at Equus. We only stayed one night there but the desk men were so lovely and helpful. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. And spacious too. So close to shopping and beach!! Not to mention food and restaurants.Great value for money. We wouldn't hesitate to stay at Equus again.

We stayed there only for 1 night because our condo unit was not ready. I found it very comfortable and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The reception is small and has the hawaiian charm. I would recommend for a short stay.

Renae was so helpful after being stranded by Jeannie Lau at Waikiki Condo Marina we were ushered to another hotel until we could sort out the mess of the original booking . All of the front of house staff couldn't be more helpful and i would recommend staying there .10/10

Every time I have the opportunity to come to Honolulu, I always stay at the Equus Hotel. The staff at the Equus, from the front desk to housekeeping are absolutely phenomenal. Their willingness to serve and to make your stay an enjoyable one is beyond words. Additionally, Ms. Rene Kahumoku always remembers me by name and greets me with such a warm welcome. Ms. Rene also checks on me along with the staff to ensure that I am comfortable throughout my stay. Overall, you cannot go wrong staying at this hotel. It is a close walk to the mall, the beach and several restaurants.

We loved this cute hotel! Room was perfect, bed was SUPER comfy, perfect location (walking distance to everything). Can't say enough about Rene at the front desk....amazing customer service! Street traffic noise was a bit much but overall a wonderful experience!

After a knight mare of sabotage by a group of criminals whom had used 2 other horrible hotels in Waikiki to commit there crimes i found the Equus The Equus was like a mirage in the desert to me , its rooms and beds where superior to any hotel in Waikiki . The staff and service where honest respectful to my amazement the customer was treated as BoSS , Waikiki and hawaii in general has front desk help whom must of woke up and thought they where king and queen and forgotten customer is king. At the Equss you feel at home and in good hands secure and protected with the best Staff in Hawaii.the group of Criminals also had tried on numerous occasion to sabotage and destroy my rights as an American citizen while staying at the Equss / its staff where approached by phone and walk ins yet the Equss did the right thing LONG LIVE THE EQUUSJSP

Wow it was literally like i was at a Fairmont property but into a boutique. Rene at the front desk was amazing oh my gosh like literally i can't even tell u. I work in customer service at a resort in Maui and i will tell u it definitely can be a struggle deal with guests especially needing ones on a day to day basis. But Rene was so fresh and helpful and amazing. She was so pleasant and had a room ready early and also recommended the most amazing breakfast spot that we went to right away. She had them help us with our bags and they valeted too! Even brought the bags up to our rooms and then kumaka brought us the most amazing beautiful juicy pineapple it looked like art!!!! And while we were waiting in the lobby kumaka also brought us juice!!! It was so wonderful he was so so so courteous!!! And they both really made sure to go above and beyond. When we inquired about staying at another hotel at a later date rene even went and called around to her friends to find us a hotel and a good deal!!! On her own time i couldn't believe it. She really helped with us when she could've just brushed us off. Pretty amazing definitely don't get this service at the big brand hotels who are too busy to care. Also they have beautiful furniture and the place is spotless! Very clean and updated! They even have keurigs!!!! And creamer and muffins in the lobby. Awesome walking location. The hotel was nice but Rene kumaka and all the other gang was what really stood out and what will continue to make this hotel stand out. Thanks so so so much!!!!! Rene is the most outstanding person on this island. No words. She wanted my auntie to be genuinely happy and made her whole vacation!!! Thanks everyone especially Rene!!!

There are a couple of cliches to consider here....."You should never judge a book by its cover" and "You get what you pay for".This hotel is trying hard to be a "boutique" hotel but all it really is is a re-vamped block of old flats. When they did the makeover the developers should have spent some extra money on a couple of things they completely overlooked or couldn't stretch the money far enough. 1) One thing they overlooked was the large aluminium framed glass sliding doors on the balcony. They are HUGE and the runners are worn out. The locking mechanism likewise. My wife accidentally locked herself out on the balcony and luckily I was there to let her back in. Then, a few days later, the same thing happened to me. But the REALLY bad thing about these old doors and windows is that they let in an unacceptably massive amount of road/traffic noise from Ala-Moana Boulevarde just below. The noise is so loud that it disrupts sleep (if you can get to sleep in the first place) and if you're not trying to sleep, forces you to turn up the TV volume.2) The other thing they overlooked was that from the street to the lobby, there is a flight of narrow-ish steps. Just perfect for carrying you're luggage up and down.3) On arrival we found some small (about 5mm long) grubs wriggling around inside 2 paper napkins on the counter.
