We dealt with them easily but they shouldn't have been there in the first place.4) The room was made up each day, but for some reason the toilet paper wasn't replaced, so I had to visit reception to get some.5) We could easily hear the people upstairs who made a lot of noise when walking around their room.6) The hot water took about 2 to 4 minutes to get to our room (902) meaning that all that cold water was a waste.7) The plumbing is so bad that you could hear when the neighbouring rooms flushed their toilets.8) Why on earth would the only wardrobe in the room be placed inside the bathroom? When I wanted to dress I couldn't, because I'd be interrupting my wife's privacy.....and Visa Versa. In its favour the hotel is ideally placed should you want to do some shopping in the Ala-Moana shopping center. Just an 8 minute walk gets you to the lower level food court for breakfast.Regarding the Cliches.... "Never judge a book by its cover"......The hotel's website makes the place look really classy. But its not. Its average. I'd be giving it 3 green dots if it wasn't for the noise and poor sleep quality."You get what you pay for".....The price is very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. But having stayed in some of those "other" hotels, I wont be going back to this one.

We had a short 2 night stay here last october! Is quite central which is handy! Lovely clean rooms abit on the small side but perfect for what we needed! Theres a dipping pool which we never used but looked lovely for cooling off your feet after a busy day of shopping! And receptionists were very welcoming and helpful

Travelling with a friend and having just graduated we didnt have alot of money. The Equus was great it was right opposite the big name hotels (The Hilton, The Modern, The Ilikai), which meant you got the experience of staying expensive but without the cost. The rooms were perfect - the staff went out of their way to attend to our requests for two beds and were immacuately cleaned every day. Ala Moana mall (the big shopping precinct) was a 5 minute walk down the road and in the opposite direction was the rest of central Waikiki.The best part by far was the fact it was my birthday while we were there. When we returned to our room that night the staff had made a personalised birthday card for me and all of them had signed it - along with that were two shell lei's, a beautifully carved pineapple, chocolates and a bottle of red wine. It made it to be the best birthday by far.Highly recommend staying here.

The Equus is nice hotel in a great location and offers some of the best value for your dollar in Honolulu. Rooms are big and clean with large flatscreen TVs. The bed was very comfortable. Furniture is in good condition. The fridge even has a freezer. Staff is very friendly and helpful.The location is perfect. Waikiki is a short 10-15 minute walk away, and Ala Moana Center about 5 minutes. I use the bus to get around the island, so being only a short walk away from the main bus terminal was very convenient. I realize some people complain about traffic noise. I had no trouble sleeping. I have stayed at many different hotels in the marina area over the years and all hotels along Ala Moana Boulevard get some degree of traffic noise, especially the rooms that face the street. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

The Equus is a nice hotel, with friendly staff. My room was large, with a comfortable bed, fridge for convenience, coffee maker, and a big screen tv. The bathroom is small but functional. Unfortunately the street noise is excessive. At first I thought the balcony door was open, but no, the glass door offers no noise protection, so it sounds like the 6 lane boulevard is running right past your room (even though it isn't). If you're not used to the noise then I don't recommend you stay here.

Honolulu is not cheap. For what we paid at the Equus, I firmly believe we got the best value for our dollar. This hotel was clean, up to date, and very comfortable. The staff was so friendly and hospitable. I would recommend this hotel for anyone not looking to stay in the middle of Waikiki but still be close enough to experience downtown Honolulu. We walked to Waikiki (about 1.5 miles or 20 minutes) several times. We also drove to Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor (both about 15-20 minutes). It's also only 20 minutes from the Airport. There are plenty of restaurants and stores within walking distance as well (some only a block down the street). I would stay here again on my next visit without even looking elsewhere, we had a great stay. One thing to note (and possibly the only downside) is that the pool doesn't get much sun and was fairly chilly. I didn't see it get much use during our stay, but with Waikiki less than 20 minutes away, why go in the pool? We stayed on a lower floor and were not bothered by street noise, but are also not super light sleepers. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to opt for a room on a higher floor.

Spent 4 nights here. Great location if you want to be in Waikiki. As a boutique hotel it is "cozy" compared to a vacation condo but the staff was great, room clean. Valet parking only - for $25/day. Would be relatively easy to skip having a car. Had a balcony - mostly in name only. Steps up from Ala Moana Blvd to the lobby - no elevator to that level (that I found). Could be a little noisy from the street at rush hours.All the staff was friendly, helpful - really- every one of them from the valet, front desk, maids, maintenance. Only negative is the concierge to help plan and book activities was only there Mon-Fri. Arriving on Saturday one of the staff actually ran out to another hotel to get us some activity pamphlets.

I really enjoyed everything during my stay at the Equus hotel. Rooms and all facilities are very nice, so are the surroundings. I cant forget to mention very friendly staff, especially the guy at the front desk, his name was Ramon and he was very helpful and was able to solve all our inquries! Thanks again and Im definitely coming back!

Excellent location, friendly staff, great entertainment options, and a happy hour make the Equus a winner!Short walk to Waikiki beach, plenty of restaurants within short walking distance, the Ala Moana shopping mall is right around the corner, and the Ala Moana Promenade is great for a walk or morning jog.

You might be seeking the friendliest hotel or the most comfortable hotel or the best location or the best value. I have the answer for each of your goals. The Equus. Complimentary tickets to the Hawaii Polo Club on Sunday's. Walk to Waikiki Beach.

Stayed here one night and kept coming back everytime I see it on hotwire or thru another booking site...Aunty RENE from the front desk is the BOMB!!! Always smiling and always asking if everything was ok.....She has alot of aloha and isnt scared to share it with people..The whole staff is actually greast they was also accommading...mahalo again for another great staycation.!!!!

What a gem to find in the amoung the towering corporate owned hotels in Honolulu. Our room was a little suite complete with a wine cooler, mini frig and sink. NO stove but who cares when there are great locally owned restaurants like the Aloha Kitchen and Goofy's within walking distance. The kitchen and bathroom were newly renovated but the charm about our room was it was filled with antique, hand carved polynisain furniture. General manager, Mariah Dailey, Assu and her staff were wonderful host, greeting us every time we came back, asking about our days adventures and where we ate so they could suggest something new for the next day. Great personal place to stay. Getting your car out of the parking lot takes some time so plan accordingly, don't be in a rush. Of course you'er in Hawaii don't rush to do anything, leave the main land in the main land and enjoy.

I was on a two week business trip for an event that I was a part of at the convention center. It is rare for me to get a good night sleep during business trips but the beds at the Equus are the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept on and I slept soundly for all of the nights that I was at the Equus. I stayed at another hotel for a few nights during the trip for work purposes and couldn't wait to go back to the Equus so I could sleep on the beds!! Rene the group coordinator & Mariah the general manager were phenomenal in hosting our group and the service I experienced from the valet all the way to the front desk was incredibly hospitable. The location is great being a block from the Ala Moana Park and Mall and just a 15 min walk from Waikiki. The elevator was one of the only drawbacks as it was small and a little old but frankly I didn't even mind as the care I received while with the Equus was well worth it! I will absolutely be staying at the Equus next time I return to Honolulu!

I stay in motels most weekends of the year and have for almost 2 decades for business. I can honestly say that this motel has the best service I have ever experienced: from the desk, to the parking valet, to the manager, to the cleaning service: everything I requested they accommodated. I even phoned down to see if they had any newspapers, and they didn't. But, minutes later, there was a knock on my door and a New York Times hand delivered free! You are within a short walk of Waikiki Beach, great coffee, McDonalds, Red Lobster, a market. This is my default motel for future business in Honolulu!

We planned the last night of our Hawaiian honeymoon in Honolulu so we could visit Pearl Harbor before flying Bach home to Massachusetts. Since it was for just one night, we didn't do as much research as we did for the resorts on the other islands we visited. Shame on me, I read their "boutique" hotel description and immediately thought that they would be in the same class as a Kimpton...I was wrong.  The Equus started off badly from the moment my husband and I stepped out of the cab. We weren't sure where to enter the building, we walked towards the front and saw only two slights of stairs with no doorman or bellman, so we walked along by the parking lot to see if we missed a ramp or an elevator. In doing so, we walked directly past a valet three times who never looked up to offer guidance or help. When we finally approached him, he informed us that there was no other way in and we had to take the stairs. He only got up to help after my husband requested help getting our 3 suitcases plus our carry on luggage up to the lobby. When we arrived in the lobby, the gentleman at the check in desk was polite, and noticed that we were very unhappy with our arrival experience. He apologized for us being upset, but again offered no assistance. When we got into the elevator we rode up with another couple who also noticed we were disappointed, and they told us that we were lucky because they are on the 9th floor and for the first four nights of their stay the only elevator in the hotel was out of order!The room was small, which was OK and they did have a boat made out of fresh pineapple on the counter for us as a welcome/happy honeymoon gift. The street noise was quite loud and very noticeable in the room even with the balcony door and curtains closed. The shower was extremely tiny, probably the smallest shower I have ever seen in a hotel. The bed was comfortable, and the TV was a flatscreen in good condition. This hotel may be small and independent, but it isn't quaint and doesn't excel in any area. We wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

I was staying in Marina Towers Waikiki and they closed the only remaining elevator until the 180 kph winds subsided. The other elevator had never worked. My room was on the 38th floor.Mariah, the General Manager at The Equus, took me in free of charge and I spent the remainder of my Honolulu stay there in safety. She gave me a pass to buy dinner and made me very welcome. The hotel was clean, had everything you needed and was a godsend. Thank you Mariah. Big hug coming your way.

My wife and I only had the chance to stay at the Equus for one night, but it was a great night! Staff is friendly and very attentive...my wife and I were traveling with a significant amount of baggage but were offered prompt help in moving everything around. Rooms are clean, cool, and well appointed to make for a comfortable stay after your day out and about. Management is hands on and extremely friendly...you are treated like 'ohana' (family). Location is perfect and this boutique hotel offers the best of easy access to the beach and shopping without being in the thick of the tourist madness that is central Waikiki. Would highly recommend!

When I lived in Italy, I sought out properties like this one, over bigger, flashier hotels. The Equus is simple and elegant with the slightly European feel that all truly-kama'aina establishments offer.

We stayed at the Equus on a trip to the Philippines. The location was good and parking while available, expensive per night. There was no elevator from street to lobby; there is an elevator to room floors. We found the staff efficient if not overly helpful. Rooms are comfortable and while you can hear street traffic, i expect you can hear this from all the hotels on Ala Moana Blvd due to the traffic. Hotel is abit long in the tooth, but again comfortable beds.I wish they served breakfast or at least coffee in the lobby.

Air conditioning was not working properly in our room. Maintenance man could not fix the air conditioner to make it get cooler. We had to change rooms and lost our king bed but the unit in the room was working properly. Another lady said her room was not very cool. When we checked out the next day the lady at the front desk said we were the second complaint about the room in which we were originally booked. Overall room was ok and good location and staff very helpful.

This is a boutique hotel very centrally located at the Ala Moana end of the Waikiki Beach. It's within a short walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre and the Waikiki Beachfront (near the Hilton Village). A quick bite is always available with a Macdonald and ABC store just round the corner. For those opting to travel around Waikiki by bus (thus avoiding the hassle of parking problem in the area), there are bus stops on both sides of the streets just round the corner in front of the Macdonald, with direct bus service to/from the airport( #19, #20) that, together with #8, also go all the way to the major Waikiki hotels until the Diamond Head end of Waikiki. Ala Moaner shopping center is also a major bus transit center for all-island routes.We arrived in the hotel, after some breakfast in the Chinatown, at about 11 am with a request for early check-in and was told to expect availability in about 2 hours. To our pleasant surprise, at 12 noon, the front desk gentleman came to us to inform that the room was ready. Our room was reasonably spacious with comfortable beds and equipped with a coffee maker, a mini fridge, safe box, a very quiet air conditioner and a 40" LCD which we hardly had time to watch.  We find the front desk staff very polite, friendly and helpful although the supervisor-looking house-keeping lady appeared somewhat miserable. There was once a few hours of lift failure and the management was on site to offer personal apology. We find our staying experience at at the hotel very pleasant,comfortable and relaxed. We have no hesitation In returning to this hotel in future.

Family friendly Hotel, always greeted with a smile. Great room with a wonderfully comfortable bed, great after a full day. Walking distance to Ala Moana shopping centre. Will stay here again. Loved the beach this end of waikiki-just a short walk.

The location is great. Walking distance to the beach and to Ala Moana Center. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Everything was clean. However, the room was very small and over stuffed (too much furniture). The shower space was really bad. Very small, and oddly shaped so taking a shower (specially with a toddler) was a very difficult task. The stairs up to the main level is brutal when you are carrying a lot of stuff, which is always the case with kids (the staff was very helpful in getting us and our stuff up the stairs).

I had to review this hotel again after staying there last month.Our company has a corporate contract with the Equus, and I'm normally a grouchy traveler when it comes to Hawai'i because our office is over by the airport, and with no nice hotels out there, I have to stay in Waiks which means tourist, traffic, tourists, and of course no parking.While the hotel charges for valet, they seemed to have fixed some of the kinks from my previous visit and I never had to wait more than a few minutes for a valet. The charge was as expected for Waikiki.This stay I was in a BAMBOO QUEEN.. and it was marvelous. Absolutely loved the bed, and it was nice having a table with two chairs so my friend and I could eat or play a game. The upgraded TV's and cable system was also nice - I didn't have to pull out my Roku stick.Best of all, the front desk staff remembered me... especially Renee. I will continue to come back to Equus Waikiki, be it for work or pleasure - they've kept this hotel in good shape, the internet is good, and the location is the best if you need to get in and out of Waiks in a hurry.

We booked the hotel through a United Vacation Package, and it was a terrible mistake. We will NEVER stay in this hotel again. Their service is very slow, even check-in took almost thirty minutes because the guy managing the front desk went off to attend to someone's bags (and this was around 11 pm at night when we were already supremely exhausted), and at first we thought it was just the pace of the island lifestyle. But then, during our week long stay, our room was not cleaned for three days-- and not because of their "eco friendly" policy. It turned out that it wasn't just the pace, it was very much a lack of proper service. Our dirty mugs and glasses were not cleaned or replaced, the bed was not made, and the towels weren't replaced. When we complained, it took the person in charge four trips to bring fresh cups and glasses and clear the waste basket. He was nice enough, but did tell us that he was not the one that was working in the morning when the room should have been cleaned so he had no explanations to offer. The next day, when the same thing happened again and I called the front desk, I was told that I had to go downstairs to get fresh mugs because no one was available to bring them up. They were nice about it, but whats the point if you don't do the bare minimum? On other things-- the shower is tiny, and I mean Manhattan tiny. The room costs as much too! There is no microwave, so don't plan a long stay! The AC didn't work the night we checked in so they gave us a fan instead of a room change. We woke up sweating in the Hawaii heat-- they fixed it the next day however, and it worked fine for the rest of the trip. The bed is not very comfortable either-- so not a good place to sleep off a long day at the beach. The shower had hair on the wall left behind by the previous guests that had not been cleaned. I cleaned it before we showered because it was already 1 am by the time we got a fan to replace the broken AC.... and that's how our stay began, sure taught us a thing or two about picking places to stay in Honolulu next time.I won't recommend this hotel to anyone. There are many nicer options for the same price in Waikiki, choose those. Or even better, go out to the North Shore!
user_name:
AlePad2013
New York City, New York

review_body: My Ohana and I recently stayed at Equus for the weekend as we came to O'ahu for a wedding. When we checked in on Friday, we were greeted by the lovely Rene. Check in was quick and easy and we couldn't wait to get to our room. Seriously THE BEST BED EVER! With the AC on full blast and the cool and extremely comfortable down comforter, we had such a hard time leaving the room! When we did leave, the guys downstairs were really friendly an were prompt in getting our car. When we left early Saturday morning for the wedding, Puka gave us a wonderful ALOHA as we both shared a good morning. I will keep saying this time and time again that The Equus Hotel is the epitome of the Aloha Spirit. There is no need to fuss in the craziness of Waikiki. Location is perfect. We love you our Equus Ohana!

Had a nice stay at the Equus. I actually took them up on their Polo match tickets on Sunday! A must do. Super fun gathering with tons of locals. The hotel was also a nice place to stay and had deals on tourist attraction. The location was pretty good if you want to be close to the mall.

Nice hotel located on the end of Waikiki. very friendly staff. Walking distance to a few chain restaurants, and just a little further to some of the beach front dining available at the larger hotels. Parking is valet only ($25 per night) and they close at 10am. I missed the tiny driveway my first time around. Rooms are smallish, but comfortable and clean. This was perfect for a solo business trip (me) , or a couple looking to be away from the beach front action. Balcony is nice with a small table for enjoying the evening breeze, so long as you don't mind the view of the apartments across the way. Decent coffee across the street, and an ABC store on the corner makes it close enough for the essentials.

We stayed at the Equus for two nights prior to departing for a cruise. This hotel was chosen because of location and price. However, it is very hard to see as well as drive to from the west because of the high divider separating the east and west traffic. We actually had to turn right and find a place to turn around so we could access the hotel. The hotel sign was small and the valet parking was not very well marked. There is no elevator from the parking area to the registration desk. The only way to get to the registration desk was to climb a flight of stairs which is hard to do when you have large suitcases for a cruise. The lobby is not air conditioned. The staff was very helpful in telling us where to eat and answering other questions that we had. The room was comfortable and a card had already been placed in the light switch so we did not have to use our key card to turn on the lights. The carpet was old and dirty and needed to be replaced. Air conditioning was good, but was tricky to adjust using a remote. The elevator was extremely slow. The Wifi was the one of the best hotel Wifi's that we have used. The hotel is well located near shops and restaurants and the beach is only a short walk away. The hotel did not serve breakfast but there were breakfast establishments a short distance away. This hotel could use a renovation.

Very budget friendly hotel and close to beach, car rentals and general shopping.Absolutely no frillsI would not stay at this hotel again because of the lack of breakfast, staff wasn't friendly, and have to carry your suitcases a few stairs to the elevator.

This was a great little hotel. Our room was very clean and is good shape. the location was nice, Across the street were little boutiques and places to eat, only a block away from the main downtown area. service was excellent.

After 16 nights on 3 islands our flight schedule changed so we needed an extra night on Oahu and wanted to stay near Waikiki but only needed the room until 5am. The room was clean and comfortable, we (2 adults & 2 teens) shared 2 double beds and it was a little squeezy but for 1 night but it was fine. The WIFI worked well, the bathroom was clean and the room was big enough for our bags etc. The location is 5 min walk to Ala Moana Shopping centre and about a 15 min walk to Waikiki. We like to walk so this was a good spot for us. The staff were friendly and helpful with directions and local information.

We stayed here for one night before flying out to the Big Island. They have valet parking which was fine. We arrived early and it was before check in time so they held our bags and told us they would call as soon as the room was ready. We spent the morning and afternoon walking around Waikiki expecting a call as check in time I believe was 3 pm. We never heard from them so we ended up calling in the late afternoon to see if the room was ready which it was. Check in took forever and there was apparently someone stuck in the elevator that day. The room was really small and dark but clean. I'm not sure why this is considered a boutique hotel as it was not very impressive. We stayed the previous night at the Aqua Palms and it was much nicer.

Good Location, nice room except unbelievably loud... we were on 4th floor nearest avenue and I actually checked to see if I had left sliding glass door open it was so loud. Staff helpful and friendly.

From the time we arrived at the Equus--the parking valet, check-in, concierge, and gentleman who helped with luggage--we were very impressed with true hospitality. AND we were in our room just a short time, when there was a knock on the door with a surprise welcome gift of fresh pineapple and handmade shell necklaces! What a treat. We definitely will return when on Oahu.

hmmm.... There is no lift from the tiny carpark to the foyer. Its a walk up with your luggage. Good luck!Foyer and reception is dated. Dont ask for early check in because you wont get itThere is no bar or restaurant/breakfast roomCannot use the pool because it is too cold as it is situated between two buildings. The pool never sees sun. Room size is pretty good. Lots of drawers for clothes. Asked for a quiet room and even being up the top you still got all the street noiseAsked at reception about booking tours and we were told to look on google. Then the next day a tour desk a few feet way was open. Then the day after it was closed again.10 min walk to Ala Moana which is handy but not handy if you intend to spend alot of your time at WaikikiShort walk to a pink line trolley stopWont be staying here again and have complained to our Travel Agent for recommending this hotel

Hotel was perfect for our needs. Some reviewers have mentioned concern about street noise (at least there's no honking here),ease in finding hotel, steps to reception, and wait for elevator- but none were an issue for us. Staff was super friendly and eager to please. They made sure our needs were met and satisfied. As an added bonus- the hotel offers free polo tickets to Sunday matches on the northshore. We loved it up there and the beach (right behind the field) was gorgeous. Thanks staff for a great honeymoon!

I went on to do some mini vacation and found this hole in the wall hotel which was great because it was near the beach and mall. When I first arrive a gentlemen name Alden helped me with my luggage. What Made this experience with Aloha is the juice they provided while waiting to be checked in.

THANKYOU Renee and staff at Equues for your great service,The Equus is a lovely hotel close to everything very comfortable bed and wonderful facilities THANKYOU once again Renee for making mum and I happy with your kindness cheers Margherita

You still struggle to beat the Equuis in Honolulu in terms of bang for your buck! It's in a super convenient location, being a $20 Über ride from the airport, within walking distance of Waikiki beach and the mall. They also have free Mai Tais on Friday's!Staff are super friendly and helpful.Only downside is the appearance... The hotel could do with a little make over and a lick of paint. But hey, for under $100 who is complaining?

The staff was very helpful with storing our luggage and then putting it in our room while we were at the Polynesian Cultural Center, which was fabulous!! The next morning they let us know which Bus to take to Pearl Harbor, only took an hour to get there, it cost $2.50 each. The room was very clean and the bed really comfortable. There was some road noise but we slept great! Would definitely stay again.

We were greeted by a friendly staff. Check in was quick and easy. Opened the door to find a nicely cut pineapple surprise and a handwritten letter of thanks, I thought that was a great touch! Our room was gorgeous and the bed was so comfortable! Perfect for our relaxing staycation. I recommend this hotel to all my friends!

We arrived at the hotel around 8.30am to leave our luggage until we could checkin later in the day. The gentleman at reception was very helpful and obliging and allowed us access to our room by 11am. Room was very clean and comfortable and well appointed and we had a great nights sleep on the 9th floor. All the staff were lovely and willing to help with any query. It is very close to Ala Moana shopping centre and a good walk to Waikiki beach which we did easily. Highly recommend this hotel.

I never stayed at the hotel. I cancelled my reservation one month prior to my trip however they still charged my credit card and only refunded the money after making several phone calls. Not sure I would trust them with another booking.

Greeted with the great "Aloha" spirit that you find in Hawaii!! Room was clean and met our needs. Loved the bottle of wine and the other nice gift of eye mask, ear plug(used on long flight home to NJ) and tea that was left for us on second night. Very conveniently located in the heart of Honolulu! Would stay there again for a short visit!

The bell boy help with our luggage to check in and to our room. The room was nice, so we unpacked and took a walk. We were pleasantly surprised at how close Wakkiki Beech was and enjoyed walking its length. There are many choices for eating near the hotel. We had a sound undisturbed sleep.

The location is great. I usually stay at the other end but this was a nice change. We liked being close to the mall and the food court. The staff was very friendly and helpful . The room was nice and we enjoyed having a Keurig in the room. This was a great value !

The room was very clean and the staff was super nice. They gave us a beautiful carved pineapple as a welcome gift. The hotel was in a central location which made it easy to get around. We loved it and hope to return.

Very well located property in Waikiki right on Ala Moana Boulevard. Close to good shopping - Macy's, etc. ABC Shop on the corner next door for all groceries, alcohol, pharmacy, etc. requirements. Great beds - nice linen and comfortable mattresses. Quiet - a good sleep was had! No breakfast provided, but they do give you coffee and muffins in the lobby in the morning. Overall good value property.

Hotel was exactly as advertised. Great room for 2. Yoshi is the man at the desk!!! Will stay here again! Loved the place. Small, Family friendly, Great shower, small pool. Very helpful and informative!

I stay here 6-10 times a year for business. The rooms are relaxing after a long day and you're not far from the beach, mall, restaurants, and shops. The rates here are generally cheaper than most hotels with this quality of room. It's also part of the Choice Hotels system, so you can earn points if you stay in their hotels (Comfort Suites, Econo, etc).Rooms:They offer themed and non-themed rooms. There is a small refrigerator under the granite countertop in the main room. They give you a Keurig with 4 k-cups (generally 2 regular, 1 decaf, and a tea), creamer, sugar, sweetener, stirrer, and paper towel. They have two coffee mugs, and two high-ball glasses (you might want to clean the cups before you use them). Bathrooms are decent. No tub, just a shower and the toilet has a commercial flushing unit on it (loud, can hear neighbors flushing). Bed is soft and they give you 5-6 pillows. Linens are always clean, never had anything that looked soiled. Some rooms have balconies, some don't. They offer wifi in every room and they have basic cable on their TV's (most are LG flat screens).Grounds:There's a pool on the 2nd (main) floor. They offer drinks in the lobby and even free Mai Tai's on certain days (Thursday & Friday?) during happy hour. There's one elevator and two sets of stairs. Stairs from the street up to the lobby can be slippery when it's raining, so watch out. Parking below is valet. Just like anywhere in Hawaii, it's pretty expensive to park. Honolulu currently has Uber, which makes it easier to get around Oahu without a car.

The Equus Ala Moana was a quaint, comfortable, accessible and HOSPITALITY plus environment. We had a 2 Queen Suite that was comfortable, the pool was smaller but clean and relaxing, especially the Mai Tai complimentary hour to meet other visitors. Not only did our stay exceed our expectations being near to the beach with easy to park with valet service, but Rene K, Check & Chad were such wonderful helpful employees. The concierge was Exceptional, anything we asked about we were well informed & taken care of. I cannot express enough how welcome we felt, especially as my Mother was in need of a wheelchair from time to time. For the 7 days we spent there, every day was easier & our vacation was a true paradise get away. We will be back again!

The rooms are tiny, and the sounds of Ala Moana Blvd are quite loud, but that is where the bad things end. While tiny, the room was extremely comfortable and very clean. The events staff person at the little desk in the lobby was extremely friendly and very good at his job. The free Mai Tais the day we checked in didn't hurt either. The valets were all very efficient and friendly. The text message app that allowed you to contact a member of guest services was THE BEST! Very efficient and very helpful. I haven't seen that feature before and I loved it. The hotel is in a great location in Waikiki. We didn't use the pool, but enjoyed the lounge area. The elevator was slow, but again not a problem. Check in and out was very easy. The tv and internet worked well, as did the AC. Would definitely stay again if in Honolulu.

So I am lucky enough to live on the Island of Oahu. I live about 30 miles ( on Waianae Coast)from Waikiki and we stay with 2 kids. We stay "in town" about 2 weekends per month I have stayed at probably 2 dozen hotels on this Island. All things considered this IS my favorite hotel.The staff is great and super accommodating. Its not the 4 seasons if you want formal, opulent, room service this isn't it. But The Good news they are across the street from the ocean, 1 block from great Ala Moana Beach Park and the Ala Moana Mall. You are on the edge of Waikiki and close to everything here.Rooms are well appointed if you can try the Suite. RM 1001 with kitchenette is great if you have kids. No DVD Players but excellent Wi-Fi and Cable TV with Premium channels.The staff goes the extra mile to make sure we are comfortable.The PRICE $$$$ cant be beat. Across from a Hilton resort these rooms are comparable but only 1/2 or less of the cost.Great value and as a boutique hotel not as busy and traffic like large resorts at check in time. If there is room at this inn I wont stay any where else!Yoshi, Ramon and Rene always take care of us.

Normally i have a hard time checking in.. (Long Lines, Slow workers, etc) I had help from Puka and Renee, they were quick and easy to talk to. They made this dreadful thing a wonderful experience. When i asked them about places to eat or things to see, they really showed me a lot and i am really grateful!I wish more places had workers like the Equus.

We received great customer service upon check in with Puka & Renee at the front desk. They were very helpful with recommendations and locations where to eat, things things we definitely should do and places we should not miss. Very knowledgeable about the Hawaiian culture.

The staff at the Equus welcome you with the Aloha spirit from beginning to end of your stay. This has been the best service ever for me on Oahu. I have been to the island countless times. Renae listened to our needs and stories. Loaned us a wheelchair when we needed one., surprised my daughter on her birthday with a bottle of wine, a pineapple beautifully cut in shell, and a box of chocolates with a lovely hand written note. All of the staff were charming and lovely people.

When we first arrived our thoughts we "oh no" because the hotel is small compared to the others in the area, we were dead wrong! From check I'm to check out our experience was first rate. The whole staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was small but accommodating and had everything needed. The only reason I didn't rate it a 5 was the condition of the balcony, bird poop everywhere. The next day it was cleaned and we enjoyed it from that time on. I could go on but why spoil the surprise. If you want a nice place to don't pass up The Equus.

The Equus was our first stop after a twelve hour flight. We arrived in Honolulu and endured heavy traffic en route to the hotel. It was around 10 degrees in Ohio and 80 degrees in Waikiki. The staff at the Equus were very welcoming, an no sooner had we checked in than we were being offered complimentary Mai Tais! No drink has ever been as good as that one was after traveling.The room was nice; perhaps a little dark, but it was clean and had everything we needed. After dropping off our luggage, we went outside again for another drink and took time to relax in the Hawaiian sunshine.The staff recommended the Chart House for dinner. It was just a short walk from the hotel, and we got to enjoy a fabulous sunset while eating an excellent meal. We sort of couldn't believe everything was real after starting our day in Ohio!The bed was comfortable, and the in-room coffee was nice. The next morning, we walked down the road to a cool retro coffee shop for breakfast. We were departing on a cruise, and the Equus graciously allowed us to store our stuff there after check-out time.Overall, we were impressed and would stay there again.

If your looking for a nice clean hotel, for a value price the this is the hotel for you. All we were looking for is a clean comfortable room in a nice location. This is it As we don't need the 4 seasons .

The room was good. Cable tv was better than a 4 star hotel I stayed at after as was the bed which was very comfy. The only let down was the street noise from Ala Moana Blvd. Apart from this they were a top notch hotel.

The Equus Hotel provided us with an excellent overnight stay in Waikiki. They kindly took one of our suitcases into store (without making a charge) while we travelled to a few other Hawaiian Islands. Check in was efficient and our room (905) was spacious, clean and comfortable. There was free wifi, a lift, facilities for making a hot drink and a TV in the room.All the staff we met were friendly and helpful. The taxi fare from the airport was circa $35 each way. For the price this was a decent hotel.

My son and I traveled to Oahu in late March. I booked at The Equus based in part on the good review found on this site, and they did not steer me wrong. Our flight arrived at 11:45 a.m. and even after collecting our luggage and taking a shuttle in busy traffic, we were well ahead of the 3:00 pm check in. No problem said the very cordial gentleman behind the counter. In fact, our room had been upgraded and we were put in a room on the top (10th floor), at the very end of the corridor. The room was comfortable, we had a king bed and a rollaway. Keurig coffee maker in the room, with a selection of coffee and tea. Our wifi reception was just fine our entire stay. Every staff member we spoke with always greeted us with a friendly smile and were always helpful. Our room was quiet -- except for the street noise that drifted up at night. However, that noise usually died down by midnight or 1:00 a.m. and we slept very well. One night, there were some 20-something ladies that checked in to a room next door. They were somewhat loud but when I called down to the front desk, they took care of the situation right away. Close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, Waikiki beach, and the Bus - Oahu's public bus. Son and I took the bus all over the island and the stop was only one block away from our hotel. We even could see a bit of the Friday night firework show!

The room was small, by Choice Hotel standards, and the AC had a hard time keeping up. The pool was very small and not practical for swimming. However, the location is close to the action, the rooms very clean and modern and the staff was helpfull. Will likely stay here again on future trips to Hawaii.

I spent one night in a gorgeously cozy and classy little room here. Complete with an empty and ready to go mini fridge, Keurig with coffee, and epic view for a good night. We drove up to the extremely helpful valet who not only parked my car, but accommodated us in going to and from our cars twice after leaving the parking area in a span of twenty minutes! Thank you Kevin! We approach the desk and get a speedy check in from a vary sweet man and turn around to an elevator 5 feet away. We found the room easily and went straight in ware music plays on the tv, and the lights are low, I found that vary welcoming. I put my bags down, things in the fridge, and walk into the clean bathroom to freshen up, only to find plenty of towels and make up remover wipes!!We then walked down the street to Kobe and enjoyed a vary entertaining meal. Went straight back to the room and had a drink (yes we brought some drinks with us) and had the best sleep anyone could ever ask for.I don't ever stay In Honolulu but I hope I get to visit this hotel again soon!

great location. and front desk staff. very close to ala moana shopping center and beach (where the locals go). this is not a four seasons and there arent a ton of amenities and the small pool seems to be alwaysin the shade, but the wifi is super. ths place has a frig and a coffee maker. and the price is right most of the time.HELPFUL HINT. not all rooms have balconeys so if this is important request one

My family and I have traveled all over the world and this is honestly one of the best hotel staffs that have ever checked us in. Rene and Puka immediately made us feel like family. They bent over backwards to get us in the room early and made sure we loved the rooms. They were so kind to us that our kids made Rene and Puka homemade leis.The hotel is perfectly placed in the heart of many restaurants, close to the beach, right down from the harbor. The rooms were super clean and perfectly decorated. This is a must stay when visiting Honolulu!

Such a beautifully decorated boutique hotel with the nicest front desk staff in Hawaii. Rene & Puka greeted us upon arrival with the true Aloha Spirit & made our entire vacation better! They are the secret to this hotel's immediate draw! Easy to find. Great location with lots of food & shopping around. Extremely clean. GREAT VIEW from our room ~ GREAT PEOPLE - 5 Stars!

Clean and confidently located, I had a great stay at the Equus, staff was very friendly, attentive and accommodating, I was allowed to check in early, was kindly moved rooms when I requested a safe key and there was none for my room, the valet was also very good at remembering me, helping me with my suitcase and chasing me when I forgot my phone in the car :)

We are so happy we stayed here. It's clean, has a friendly staff, and is centrally located. We were within walking distance of all the great spots but this hotel is not overly crowded. It was just right for us. We will stay here again, for sure. Honestly, I cannot say enough wonderful things about The Equus. They served muffins, apples, and coffee in the morning. Our room was perfect for the two of us. We used Uber to get around town and it was easy for the Uber drivers to find us and pick us up. It's within walking distance to Outback Steakhouse, McDonald's, several rental car agencies, the beach, the Ala Moana Mall, parks, and more. Stay here if you want a fair price for a cute, centrally located motel.
user_name:
Jennifer F
Monterey, California, United States

review_body: We loved everyone we met here. Clean and nicely updated bathrooms. Comfortable beds. Good wifi reception. Close to everything. Walking distance to a lot of downtown areas. Great boutique hotel. The kids loved the pool after the beach. We would stay here again.

If you are looking for a smaller, more personal hotel in Waikiki and want to avoid the big skyscraper hotels, this little boutique-hotel can be a good choice. The staff is very friendly and happy to assist you with anything. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable, but to be honest - the rooms have seen better days. The wifi works very well (very important for me).If you like to see Waikiki and Honolulu and want stay near to the Ala Moana Center (important bus terminal), the location of this hotel is really good.The biggest problem though is the very noisy main street in front of the building. All rooms face it in some way and as it is the main connection between Waikiki and Honolulu, there’s traffic noise all night (the scooters are the worst!). All in all, it’s a nice hotel, but if you’re seeking quiet and a place to relax, this might not be it.

The location is quite good. Three minutes' walk to the Waikiki Marina and the beach. Positive is also the fact that it is small sized hotel, with small sized rooms... Very clean, a bit old-fashioned and not the shiny "Waikiki style". Good for daily fitness, as everybody takes the stairs instead of waiting for the elevator!

The hotel is conveniently located about 5 minutes’ walk from the start of the main beach drag. It is a motel style sort of place – you enter the rooms from a stairwell that is on the outside. The rooms are small but have character, particularly the bathroom which had a very nice layout compared to the standard business type hotels. There is no bath, only a shower. The free internet worked very well. There is parking downstairs but it appeared to be valet parking at a price. There is also a bus stop just one minute’s walk away which has an array of buses that can take you to the main sights including Pearl Harbour and the airport. Buses cost a flat $2.50 so if you have hand luggage only you can use this from the airport. However, the buses do not take anything more than hand baggage so if you have something large and no car then you will need to take a cab or the super shuttle. The staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful.There are some major negatives to this place. Firstly, the constant noise from the main road just wasn’t blocked out to any extent by my windows (which looked single glazed) so there was continuous noise all day (Honolulu does seem to be an early to bed early to rise sort of place). Secondly, my room had no curtains. Instead, it had a set of louvre doors that I had to slide along to block out the light. Unfortunately, the light simply shone through the louvre slits so the only way I could sleep was to wear a Lone Ranger style mask given to me on the plane to block out the light. Also, although the room was characterfully decorated with a wicker four poster bed, I kept banging my head on the overhanging frame.When compared to all the other hotels in the area, with their fancy foyers etc., this is clearly a budget option at a budget price so I wouldn’t see it as a bargain – you pay less but get less (having said that, I still paid more for this hotel than any other on my trip but I think that is the way Hawaii works). The room size is ideal for one person but two people (particularly if they are of largish size) might find it a little cramped. And yes, the lift does take forever.

If you are looking for a Honolulu hotel where you can lounge at the pool and walk to the beach, this is not the place for you. However, if you are looking for an affordable, comfortable hotel with nice hosts in a convenient location, the Equus is the place for you. We found the rooms to be clean and well appointed and the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. It is on a main road in Waikiki so I suggest the upper floor rooms for more quiet. We found that we could walk to most many restaurants in the area, and since we had a rental car, found it to be a good home base for a daily trips around the island. Personally, I think when you visit beautiful Hawaii you should spend as little time as possible in your hotel room.

So I'll start with the pros. I love the bed and pillows; the room is spacious enough, and the decor is fine and fits the boutique style. The pineapple they brought me was tasty as a welcome gift. I'm not sure if that was a welcome gift because of my Diamond status here or if it was a welcome gift for everyone. The air conditioner was quiet and while there was road noise, it wasn't unbearable. Onto the cons. I'll skip over the inherent issues such as location as that's something to be factored in when booking. Valet: only one person works there and they're never there. I parked my car every time myself. Why pay $25 for mandatory valet if a 10 minute wait isn't enough for valet to come park the car?Booking: I booked a room online using my Choice points. I chose a "top floor, superior room, larger room" the room I was given originally wasn't top floor and apparently all rooms here are actually the exact same size. So to start off, the booking choices is based on rooms that don't exist. Security: I came in around 8pm after a roadtrip around the island, parked my car myself again, and then went to the front desk to ask for a second key as the one they gave me didn't work for my room. Without hesitation and without asking for any proof of ID, I was given a second card! Great, anyone could have come into my room. Room: There are only 2 accessible outlets in the room, both by the coffee machine. The bathroom fan cannot be turned off. Service: I had gone downstairs to get a couple packs of single serve coffee and the staff mentioned that they had "no more stock for the night". Whatever that means.Building: Not accessible for wheelchairs as the lobby only has stair access. The elevator button lights also don't work so you'll never know if you called the elevator or if it's broken. To sum up: The Ascend Collection is not upscale. Security alone is a reason I'd never come back. I'm greatly disappointed with this hotel as I've had wonderful stays with Choice Hotels in the past (as per the diamond status).

This is part of the Choice Hotels "Ascend" collection, which I mistakenly thought meant upscale. Not. It's right on the main drag, and the windows are very not tight at all, so it was very noisy. Also encountered a homeless man hanging out in the stairwell. Their continental breakfast consisted of coffee and muffins, and not always muffins. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Rooms could use updating.

stayed at the Equus for 3 nights earlier this month. Hotel is a smaller location with a definite boutique feel. Had a room with a king bed. Flat screen TV and lanai which overlooked the adjacent hotel parking lot. Room was clean and cozy. Bed was really comfortable with nice bedding and lots of various sized pillows. Hotel is on the older side but well maintained. Pool was at the main lobby level. Close walk to the marina and the Waikiki beach. Good value for this hotel, but keep in mind you are at the west end on Waikiki beach area. i found there to be a lot of traffic noise around this area being that the hotel is located at the main thoroughfare to Waikiki.

This is probably the friendliest hotel that we have stayed in . This is an older hotel, and the rooms are small with some street noise, but overall, very clean and comfortable. We didn't come to Hawaii to spend time in the hotel, but rather to see the sights! I would recommend this hotel. We slept very well every night. You can walk to the beach and most restaurants in the Waikiki area. It is updated and has a very homey feel. Great for folks on a budget.

A little hard to write this review but felt like a really needed to. I want to start by saying that the staff was great. Whatever I needed or had a question, they were there to help. With that said - some have mentioned the street noise. I can't stress enough, this hotel sites on a six lane Blvd which just might be the busiest in all of Hawaii. The noise was worse than anything I had read here. If noise bothers you - stay away from this hotel. Also, they charge you for your entire stay in advance. So if you leave early, they have to work the whole credit thing. As for the rooms. I upgraded to their Executive Suite. I did so because the description said they were larger rooms and well appointed. If these rooms are larger I'd hate to see the smaller rooms. Very small. Overall I was disappointed. I will not stay here again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Not sure why Choice hotels thinks this earns their upscale rating of Ascend hotel. Maybe just the location in Hawaii. Its on a very busy street and the noise level is very high, even with ear plugs in. Needs updating, esp. the windows. Had a patio, which we usually always enjoy but it was too noisey to do so. Liked the shower, good flow. Bed bounced whenever the other person moved. NO Stairs to lobby area (they make this clear on their website), so if you can't climb or lug luggage, this is not for you. Staff very friendly. Valet parking helpful but costs. Asked for extra hangers and got 1. It wasn't terrible but could be better on so many levels. No breakfast. Muffins some mornings.

This is definitely a no-frills hotel. Everything was fine, but very basic. They are super tight with changing sheets and towels, so make sure you read the fine print carefully (e.g. sheets are changed every three days, if you want more frequent changes you have to cal them). It wasn't a deal breaker, but the dim room and lack of patio was a surprise. Not blaming the hotel for this - we should have checked for it. But when traveling with a kid would've been nice to spend the evening on the lanai. Full points for the location though, very close to a local ABC store to get supplies from. Also, there is $25 valet parking that is not included in the hotel fees. Something again to be aware of.

I have stayed 3 nights with my family and the room condition was very nice.located in downtown, the hotel is very useful both shopping and getting to the beach.Most of all, the staffs are very kind especially Leela(sorry I do not know the exact spelling^^) is wonderful.In front of the Hotel, I left my car and locked the door but the engine was still running!!I was panicked and the rend car's(Alamo) 24 Hours call center did not answered my call.Finally, Leela asked for help her friend and a guy unlocked my car.she was very kind and tried her best for me despite of busy schedule dealing with other hotel guests.Thank you again Leela and the Equus!

Just returned from a wonderful week. I would recommend The Equus to anyone wishing to holiday on Oahu. It was affordable and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room easily accommodated our family of 4, it was clean and quiet and the beds were comfortable. The daily change of towels and sheets was greatly appreciated even though the room wasn't supposed to be serviced.If I had to be really picky, I'd say the little bar-fridge could have been colder but it didn't affect our holiday at all.Short walk to beach, shopping, restaurants, take-aways.

I stayed at this hotel for two nights, and right on the first night money disappeared from my bag. They don't have cameras and security is definitely an issue. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

we spent 14 nights at this boutique hotel, check in was smooth and the room was nice and clean, the beds were very comfy. great price, awesome location only 5 minute walk to the ala moana mall and so many restaurants and shops within very close walking distance. the service and staff were great and they are always happy to look after your every need.

I stayed at the Equus hotel Saturday night and could not be more pleased, the beds are super comfy, the comforters on the bed are the best, I wanted to steal one actually, and the best part is it's prime location! Next time I need a room in town I'll be staying at the Equus!

Nice little hotel near Waikiki. No bells and whistle just a nice cheaper place to stay that is clean and good employees. You are able to walk to most spots in Waikiki. Be aware that you have to take stairs to get to the lobby and there is a 25.00 a night parking charge.

We stayed at the Equus whilst attending a friend's wedding in Honolulu recently. Very pleased that we did. The room was spacious and comfortable. The location was good, although not at the heart of the fashionable 'high end' of Waikiki beach [for those for whom such things are important]. It was also given the expensive nature of accommodation in Honolulu good value for money. Most of all the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Having arrived from Australia at 6.am in the morning, the staff bent over backwards to get our room ready as soon as possible, resulting in us being able to check in around 10.00am to our very comfortable room. One tip for travellers coming from the airport; if you don't have excessive baggage [ie you can put under your seat or on your lap] consider getting the public transport bus [Number 19 or 20 Direction: Waikiki beach and hotels] get off at the corner of Hobron Ave and Ala Moana Bvd -$2.50 per ticket. In fact generally speaking public transport is a great option for Honolulu and can get you to major sites like Pearl Harbour and Hainama Bay for a flat fee of 2.50.

Travelling with my 17 year old daughter to celebrate her recent high school graduation we opted for the Equus initially based purely on price. But I must say, I was very impressed with the whole establishment! The staff could not have been more helpful or delightful. The room was clean and comfortable with loads of cupboards (sideboards) that we were able to store our piles and piles of shopping in! We had a room on the 9th floor at the street end and could see glimpses of the ocean from our window and from the balcony outside our room. We weren't really bothered by the street noise. The air conditioning was good. Before we arrived I was a bit concerned about our luggage with those front stairs but our Hawaii23 driver carried our bags up and down for us. There is only one lift, but we rarely waited more than a few minutes and it was very often at the lobby waiting when we arrived. The location was a nice easy walk to the Ala Moana Centre, Walmart and a Ross store. All the tours/shuttles we used (e.g. to Pearl Harbor, Outlets, Circle Island Tour, Luau etc) picked us up from Ilikai which is a 5 minute walk across the road and McDonalds and an ABC Store are about 3 minutes walk. Buses and trolleys to take you into the middle of Waikiki also leave from the Ilikai. One night we caught a cab from the middle of Waikiki back to Equus and it cost around $10. Overall we are glad we chose the Equus and would gladly stay there again. Mahalo to you all for such a lovely experience!

Very nice hidden gem hotel. Very much a boutique hotel. Our room had a full refrigerator, desk, king bed and a bow-tie view of the ocean. Very well furnished. Friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again. You get free continental breakfast and free Beach towels. 5 min walk to the beach.

Loved my one night stay in the 2 room suite. I always book at this hotel, this was the first time I stayed in the suite. Clean, cool, and comfortable! Easy access to nearby bars and restaurants. Super sweet and helpful staff. Perfect fit for a girls night out :)

We spent a night @ The Equus 2 weeks ago & we Love staying there when ever we go Oahu! Our Room was Awesome as always with 2 Queen Beds, We Loved the Pineapple with a Box of Chocolate & a Greeting Card that made Us Feel @ Home & Special!! The kierig coffee machine, Cookies & we Love The Little Fridge to keep our drinks cold! The Equss is so convenient cause it's close to Ala Moana Mall & Beach, The Theaters, Dave & Busters, Waikiki Beach! But not only that, we Love Haunani & Puka!! They are so Awesome, All Your Staff They know how to take Good Care Of Their Guests!!! Yes, You Visitors out there Come Experience The Aloha @ The Equus Hotel For You Will Return!!! Aloha, Kekaulaz

I stayed at the Equus for a night in Waikiki with my friend to celebrate me birthday! I had the best time. All of the staff were very friendly and courteous! I was greeted with a super friendly young woman who was serving Mai Tais in the lounge area. I was pleasantly surprised that there was a nice pool and Internet available in the lounge. My room was so spacious and amazingly comfortable and I did not want to get out if bed it was so comfy! Thank you for letting me have the most relaxing stay ever! I will indeed be back soon :)
user_name:
Kiyoko F
Oahu's North Shore, Hawaii

review_body: We went to the UB40 concert on Thursday and decided to spend the night at the Equus, instead of driving back to the North Shore. What a refreshing surprise. I've read the reviews before I chose to book, and people complained about the smallness of the rooms and bathroom. Yes, it was small, but it was cozy, comfortable and affordable. When we arrived, the valet guy helped us immediately, within 3 minutes the bellboy was there to fetch our suitcases and snorkel gear. Up the stairs we go to a speedy check-in. I've read people complain about the few stairs they had to climb, but seriously if it bothered you that bad, I'm sure the friendliness and efficiency of the staff makes up for any stairs you had to climb. We were on the 7th floor, Rm 307, saw a bit of the harbor view from the front door. The room was clean, and cool. After unpacking a few things we headed to the lobby for a complimentary Mai Tai at 5pm, that's where we met Chad, who was very helpful and knowledgeable of the local restaurants, clubs, pubs and other sites.It's in walking distance to the harbor & even Ala Moana Center. Red Lobster & Outback is opposite the hotel, as well as Chart House, which faces the harbor. We had breakfast at Ilikai's Cinnamon restaurant, also in walking distance. If you don't feel like walking, there are numerous busses, cabs and Uber. Also my fave store was located on the corner. Who does not like to shop at the ABC store. I will go here again.

We stayed three nights, but I slept very little. The noise from the street never stopped, and the room had no AC fan to turn on to counter the ceaseless racket that included loud car engines, construction noise, sirens, and even booming fireworks.The hotel is also inconvenient in that guests have to climb quite a number of stairs just to get to the front desk, and that's after being forced to submit to valet parking (at $25 per day plus tip). We had to unload all of our luggage and get help from a bellhop (another tip) to lug it all up the stairs. There was no luggage cart available, and even if there were, the stairs wouldn't allow its use.We had a refrigerator, which would have been great for reducing the cost of overpriced food in the area, but since there was no microwave oven, that hope was dashed.Also, the Internet connection was slow most of the time and cut off completely at times.In addition, the room was too warm, and although there was AC, there was no way to control the temperature.I will not visit this establishment again. It was a poor choice, a mistake I will not repeat.

Look no further for a great value if you're staying in Honolulu. The location is perfect, whether you're walking, driving or taking public transportation. The staff are perfectly atuned to your needs.

I would have been able to say that hotel is nice, because the rooms themselves and the lobby are really nicely decorated, and it is in walking distance of Waikiki beach (20 minutes). But everything is overwhelmed by the noise from the street. The hotel is right on one of the busiest streets of Honolulu and has virtually no windows (of course, there are windows, but they do not provide any insulation). We stayed somewhat on the middle of the hotel, but with the reflection of the adjacent buildings, I doubt that being on a higher floor or at the rear side would have changed anything. We spent a very bad night, and that was even more disappointing because our last night before flying back (a two nights flight). Furthermore, the hotel entrance is on the second floor, there is no elevator from the street, and during our stay, we've never seen somebody from the staff helping people to bring their luggage up or down.

Booked via Choice.com (2 nights on points and one on cash)...Price was 155US$ (flex with extra 1000 points), so a good deal.Check in was very friendly...Room was not ready but they kept our luggage as we went out exploring. Upon return, at 3PM, room was provided on 9th floor. The set up is similar to a motel, with room entrance on the outside. Room was big, with 2 double beds, good LCD TV with excellent channel selection, wifi, bathroom with shower only, fridge, sliding wooden "curtains" (I have seen those in other hotels here). Furniture was very "Polynesian". Parking is 25$ per night, a bit cheaper than other places, valet only.There is a small pool on premise, and a huge pool 10 minutes away called the Pacific Ocean, either via Marina or via Hilton.There are no restaurants on premise but plenty of choice nearby. 5 minutes walk to Alo Moana Mall and its fantastic food courts. They do serve Kuerig coffee pods and little muffins in the morning, in the lobby/business center area.Overall, recommended.

I came with a school group, and we were extremely large and a hard group of teenagers to handle. They took care of us perfectly and even organized our luggage so it was easy for us to take. The pool and cabana are really nice. The maids are so nice!

Rene was great in working with us to accommodate a high school educational group - something many hotels in area would NOT do - so this is probably a phenomenal option for parents with many older children or educators looking to take an alternate spring break trip with this age group. The wonderful help we got in organizing the trip was exceeded only by the quality, size, and setup of the rooms! Very environmentally friendly while still allowing for great amenities (shower pressure and heat was great still, bathrooms were great). Free wifi, fantastic (and LARGE) cable channel selection, nice sized mini-fridge for the frugal and wise visitor (for groceries or leftovers). The lobby had nice beverages and snacks in the mornings, which were a favorite of our students, and it always smelled so nice! I honestly could not say enough good things about this place, and will definitely look to stay here again if we can do this trip next year. We thank Rene and the The Equus Hotel for contributing to a wonderful stay in Hawaii!

The Equus is a great hotel with clean rooms, excellent refreshments and easy access to the Honolulu/Waikiki area. Everything about the hotel was excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

Perfect size and price for the trip, the hotel was clean, friendly and offered a good spot from which to explore the area. Located in a central area it provided good access to ala moana and waikiki beach as well as public trasportation. The rooms were clean and had a good amount of room for a few people.

So I am a teacher who took 10 teenagers to Hawaii for learning purposes. First, they were one of the few hotels who accepted teenagers in the rooms by themselves. Many of the hotels I looked at said a chaperone or someone at least 18 needed to be in the room. Secondly, they were one of the few hotels who did not try to pressure me into booking when I called to inquire.  The manager, Rene, worked with me to get my group squared away. I was able to send in a check beforehand so when we got to the hotel we were all set to go. Rene was so sweet that I was even upgraded to a nicer room. Additionally, some of the staff already knew about my arrival and that I was traveling with a school. One of the things that really stuck with me was that most of the rooms were ready when we arrived at 12:00pm so we did not have to wait for the 3:00pm check in time. This was a huge deal for a big group. The Wifi is complimentary...and it works great.There are complimentary muffins and lemon water in the morning.The hotel is walking distance from the beach.I hope that I do this trip with my students again next year and if I do I know which hotel I am calling.

Cool location, friendly staff, nice room, funny elevator, affordable price, wifi in the room, all in all, great place to stay, check it out!! nice to try!! My Mom had an accident and the service from the Hotel was very good! Great Job!!

We went there because of the tripadvisor ratings and it is over rated. It is a correct hotel for the price but do not expect more than that. Service is ok, rooms are clean. A building dating from the 70s, you need to carry your luggage to the first floor for checkin. Free coffee in the morning and free printer and pc are a plus. Five minutes to ala moana and ten to the beach are good too. Twenty minutes to waikiki beach and it's shopping area. I would highlight the general manager for her great service.

Overall I liked the hotel. It is a narrow entrance, up some stairs to the hotel. Old slow elevator. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean, with only a shower, no tub. Basic but nice. I did not use the pool, Lanai (due to the heat and noise generated from the bedroom air conditioner), or the lobby. The location is excellent, close to the beach, as well as Ala Moana mall, which is within walking distance. There is a bus stop close by, as well as an ABC store and a Red Lobster restaurant. There is a wonderful Indian Restaurant within walking distance, in the Discovery Bay Center. Truly loved this location.

The hotel is not brand new and not super quiet (as it is on one of the busy roads of Waikiki) but staff easily make up for it with their super friendly, customer focused attitude. Loved the Mai Tai session :)

Thank you to Renee and the team for a wonderful stay at this fabulous hotel. Our every need was met with care and attention. A home from home experience, a treasure memory for our 15th wedding anniversary.

Our daughter from SF was staying at the Modern but the price for us in Australian dollars was about $750 a night!!! Close to Christmas, nice hotel but!!!!The Equus is across the road and still $360AUD (way overpriced too!!) but we had not much choice. Turns out when my daughter booked the Modern a couple of weeks before it was $360AUD!! I guess when bookings are heavy the hotel prices go bezerk!!After all, the Equus turned out to be friendly, bed was good, AC worked, and, best of all, they had a great little coffee machine in the room, with restocks of capsule coffee available all day in the lobby.Yes- free wifi! Ala Moana shopping in walking distance.Suited us even at the price.

The rooms are nice and they are clean. They have a nice lounge and will let you wait there if your flight out is much later than then check out time. The people are very friendly and helpful.The only draw back is that you must climb about 20 steps to get to the lobby on the 2nd floor and there is no elevator from ground level.

Location was perfect for what I needed on my weekend trip to Oahu. Walking distance to the mall and ABC store and multiple restaurants. As many had stated before, the road noise is a bit loud but it quieted down at night. Bed was super comfortable and overall it was a good experience.

We stayed here in October 2015, prices were not much cheaper than the Hilton. What a difference between the two. The hotel staff were friendly but I would put this under a budget hotel. Bathroom was good plenty of hot water. Proms were nothing like this picture. Ours was dark and dingy and to be honest I don't think it was that clean and they upgraded us as room wasn't ready when we arrived. I would have hated to see standard room. They did have a kettle and they did replenish tea/coffee daily. The hotel was close to amenities so handy for that, ie Ahoa shopping and walking distance to beach. They had a pool but to us it was more like a fish pool as it was in the shade no sun beds and did not look encouraging at all. It would have been ok for a couple of nights but not happy we stayed for 6.

There are classier hotels with views of the ocean - but they come at a hefty price tag - this hotel is, for its price - excellent. It is located a short 5 minute walk to Ala Moana so if you enjoy shopping it is perfect. It is directly across the road from the beach too. I use Waikiki as a stopover more than a destination so for me it is perfect. The rooms are generous in size and have a certain class and style in their decor. The staff are very friendly and helpful, nor could I fault housekeeping. The king size bed was the most comfortable of all hotels I visited last trip. A couple of small minus, no lift from street level to reception although if asked I am sure they would carry your luggage up the 15 or so steps, it is on a major thoroughfare and invariably at night you hear sirens - ear plugs are necessary if you are a light sleeper and there is no attached restaurants however there are plenty within very short walks - plus a well stocked ABC store on the corner. Also you can order meals to be delivered to your room. I have future bookings with this hotel and I look forward to returning.

Was a good hotel with budget price. Location is very good. Walking distance from the beach. But the room was very narrow and small. In addition, the hotel does not have a restaurant so you need to take care of your own breakfast. However, it has its own coffee machine in each room.
user_name:
Eunpyo R
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed for 25 nights on Business each night when I returned from work I could let go of the demands of the day. With the convention center and Ala Moana shopping center just a short walk a way I could find ever thing I wanted and then slip back in to my place of peace.If you are visiting the convention center you will enjoy a peaceful walk along the river to and from your room.Come and step back in to a time when life was simpler with less demands.If you would like to stay in a part of Hawaiian history this is the place for you to come relax and enjoy be prepared to be come a member of this Ohana.With the Equus location I could be off the heavy traffic of Ala Moana Boulevard in one block.. Jerry from Seattle

The short version is that you should book this hotel online only. And you have to look past the low prices and book with AAA or military or whatever class you fit in. The pool is tiny and it feels uncomfortable in the space. That being said I give this hotel a 4 star for the nice room and friendly staff. Ask for "late check out " before you check in.

What a great little hotel at a reasonable price. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. This hotel is not for folks who seek "updated" looks. This is a tiny hotel squeezed between monolithic high rises. The rooms are clean, comfortable and charming, a sweet slice of old Waikiki.

We stayed one night at this hotel when we arrived in Hawaii. It is just a few blocks walk to Waikiki Beach. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The staff made us feel very welcome and went out of their way to help us. They stored our luggage for the day and lent us beach towels to go snorkling - even though we had already checked out. I would definitely stay there again.

From the top:Even before I checked in they were ready for me; the parking valet service had my details preprinted and ready to go.At the desk the clerks were courteous, and knowledgeable about the area.The room was the perfect size.Best:Location -- Waikiki a bit off the beachOn Ala Moana which made the drive to Ford Island very convenient..Within walking distance of some nice restaunts (Gooofy, Wailana Coffee House)Favorite Amenity: The Room Key control for the airconditioner - this gem kept me from doing what I have done at every other hotel I've ever stayed in, Losing the key card.Downers:View - Rooms have a view of the adjoining hotels;Street noise - Ala Moana Blvd is a major route, so expect some bus and traffic noise, it didn't keep me from sleeping soundly, but your experience may be different.Summary:Would I stay there again - Absolutely! It was the perfect hotel for what I was doing and was convenient to all the local landmarks.

We stayed here twice over the span of 1 week and each visit was nice. The rooms are cozy and comfortable with a balcony. This hotel doesn't have a lot of frills - but it is clean, the staff is helpful and the valet parking is easy to use! Yes - there's street traffic - you are in Honolulu which is a modern, busy city - but it was easy to forget about the noise and get a good night's sleep. We enjoyed our stay here. Thank you!

This hotel has nothing of boutique; we stayed here only for one night on our way back home from Maui. We arrived around 8:30/9:00 PM. and since we rented a car for a day we had to wait for the valet to appear for about 10 minutes. The guy at the front desk had an attitude, like he was making us a favor by doing his own job, not even an Aloha on our arrival, made me sign papers, gave us instructions and pointed to the elevator (which by the way takes ages to arrive) No one there to help with our luggage...The room is small and dark. We were in the ninth floor and still could hear the traffic in Ala Moana Blvd. Piece of advice: Don't even bother to book this hotel...

I made reservations with Rene after my friend told me of her enjoyable stay while she was here . The bellmen Glenn , greeted us and he started our stay off on a good note .When I checked in , I was greeted by a nice man in an aloha shirt named Puka . We arrived early and he did his best to accommodate us and we were very pleased with him and all of the hotel staff. We stayed for a weekend since we had an event to attend I'm Waikiki . I enjoyed this hotel and my weekend stay here very pleasant , I will be back again !

Amazingly beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff and exceptional service!!! Close to all attractions, great selection of activities, and are always super accommodating to any and all requests. The rooms are very comfortable with fantastic wifi service for business or personal use. I highly recommend The Equus to everyone!

The staff is very sweet and helpful. The room was clean and cozy. The location was perfect. My fiancé and I had an overall excellent stay at the Equus, and we would definitely stay there again. It's across the street from world class surfing, close enough to walk into Waikiki if you want or cruise over to some great parks on the ocean in ala moana. Oh, and its in prime location to walk to many great restaurants as well. Again, love the location.

Boutique seems to be an excuse for poor service and standards. Booked this after good tripadvisor reviews. Check in took almost 20 minutes - the lady told me nothing about the hotel and you could barely hear anything over the traffic and music anyway. No one helped me with my heavy luggage up the numerous steep steps. They then charged my stay in advance before i even saw the room without any explanation. I arrived at 1 - before 3pm checkin and asked if there was a room ready or if I could leave my bags and come back at 3. She said there would be a room free in a few minutes. 15 mins later still no room so I left.The rooms are dark, small and no soundproofing whatsoever. The traffic sounds like it is in your room, the door needs to be slammed shut to close and then bangs in the wind.
