Loud noise of scraping furniture in room above most of the afternoon and from 2am onwards loud enough to wake you up. Room wasn't properly cleaned and i had to take new shower gel from the cleaning trolley that was left in corridor all day. When I mentioned the lack of cleaning to reception they said absolutely nothing and did nothing. Only positives are the coffee machine and aircon.I would advise you stay in another hotel where you get made to feel welcome and there are soundproofed rooms.

my name is nicolas valdez and i really love the hotel its really clean and really friendly...for all the people who visit hawaii equus is the place to go it also has a perfert view of the ocean for wedding birthdays and lots things.....Thank you

My stay was apparently nowhere near as nice as the majority of the other reviews. I traveled to Oahu for business and I booked this hotel because it was all I could find at the last minute. It is in an okay location. I was able to walk to the beach and most shopping, but it is still a bit of a walk. I ended up with the queen bamboo room, and I would not recommend this room. The room was extremely small, and the bamboo furniture was uncomfortably large for the tiny room. The mattress was terrible and sloped toward the center. The shower was so tiny I have a hard time imagining a large or even a normal sized person using it (I am quite petite and still had difficulty). The air conditioner was sad and did not cool very well and it was extremely loud. The staff was friendly overall, but I had numerous occasions where I could not find anyone to help me. I had to attend early morning meetings and because they make you valet park, you do not have easy access to your car. Despite making arrangements each time the night before – and the front desk person promised me they would be there – I found myself standing by the front desk for 15 to 20 minutes yelling for someone and knocking on various doors to try and find someone to help. This was at roughly 6:30 in the morning. One other thing that was horrible was the steps you have to walk up to get to the hotel itself. It rains often in Hawaii and these steps become wet. I slipped and took a hard fall onto the sidewalk while trying to carry my suitcase down. Overall, three nights was three too many.

Upon my arrival I noticed how friendly everyone was. The front desk was very knowledgible about the different eateries in the area Im not to familiar with the area so it was very helpful. I especially liked the ameneties in the room and how friendly the housekeepers are they always made sure i was well taken cared of. If your looking for a hotel where everyone is treated like family this is definately the place to say and i would recommend it to everyone I know

I booked this hotel to be close to the Honolulu Marathon starting location down at Ala Moana Beach Park. First of the gentlemen that helped me over the phone Puka was such a gentlemen. He answered all my questions regarding parking and the location of their hotel. As I checked it I was amazed at that golden stairs as you make your way up to the reservation desk. As soon as I reached the desk I was greeted by someone with this fabulous cold drink which was well needed after coming from the airport. The check in process was fast and easy. I was in room 501 the corner unit which was great. As I entered the room it was very cozy and nice with a cold air condition unit which I was SUPER happy about. I can't sleep with out air condition so it all worked well. I had made a call to the front desk to wake me up at 4am the next morning to get up for the marathon. As requested I got a wake up call at 4am. The best part through my whole stay at the Equus was after I was done with the marathon I came back to the hotel totally beat and tired. The housekeeper was very concerned and asked if I needed any help to my room, I thought for a split second how is he going to help me???? carry me???? That would have been nice. But just to show the generosity and nice gestures the employees are at Equus. As I was checking out they helped me take my baggage downstairs and walked me to my cab. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I will book for next year and will extend my stay. Thank you Equus Staff.

It felt like home nice cozy warmhearted and private yet very secure and it's at the beginning of Waikiki so you don't have all the noise of town Ala Moana is a block away yacht club is across the street and the convention center is just around the block as well well worth a recommendation

I picked Equus as my holiday home in Honolulu for one month and everything was just wonderful. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful, they always gave me the best advice what to see and where to go, especially guys at the front desk. Rooms and all other facilities were nice and clean. The hotel's location is very interesting as well, lot of restaurants, marina, Ala Moana beach park and mall are in walking distance. I would like to thank you for the time spent at The Equus hotel, I really enjoyed it!

Amazing Boutique Hotel and Superstar Staff. This will be the 8th year, I will be staying at the Equus Hotel and Marina Towers. Best Location in Waikiki, because you are not in the heart of all the noise and you get the best of both worlds. You are a 2 minute bike ride or bus Ride or UBER from Downtown Waikiki and a short walk to the big Mall and Restaurants and State Park Beach. I myself, like staying at the Marina Towers, but my first 4 years were in the Hotel and the service is probably better and more controlled there. Let's start with Ownership and management. Mike, the owner is a great guy, with Integrity and he is ex UCLA Alumni, enough said.LOL. His GM, Mariah, also part of Ownership, is a sweet Gem, and is humble and not afraid to take control and get her hands dirty/wet and put in some work. When I arrived last year, a few hours early, and the Bell Boy was at Lunch, this lady, got it in gear, Grabbed my 40 pound suitcases herself, and brought them next door for me. I will never forget that visual, LOL, as usually upper management delegates these duties, but not in this one case. Also, Mariah, is a fair lady, and within reason, she will listen to your concerns. Lucky to have her there, captain the ship. Jackie of Housekeeping, is a great team player and very accommodating and on the ball. Kika operations Manager is also very nice and let me print my boarding pass in the office when I was leaving back to Santa Monica. Rene Kahumoku, is an incredible member of the team, and is the guest Services Manager. She has been there all 8 years I have stayed there, and whether I need Wake Up Calls, Restaurant Advice, Island Sightseeing advice, Room Add on or upgrades, she is your go to Michael Jordan in the clutch. She is gracious, patient, kind and very sharp. No vacation, would be complete without a good Housekeeping staff and Handyman. Junex is great and there is nothing he cannot fix or respond to in a proactive manner. I would not hesitate for one second to recommend this Hotel and Towers, and I plan on calling them myself in the next few days to book my 2016 conference and mini vacation. Mahalo, Warren Julian L

This family owned and operated hotel is one of the best places I have found in Waikiki.The rooms are comfortable, clean, and, the beds are comfortable. I stayed for 6 nights, and just for curiosity, asked other guests in the elevator what they thought and got this response every time. The valet parking process is quick and very efficient--how nice to have someone worry about parking for $25/night. The wi-fi is free and very fast. The location is excellent, you can walk to Ala Moana shopping center--with tons of shops and restaurants. The hotel is located on Ala Moana Blvd. and there is road noise, but was not noticeable at night.

Honolulu Equus Hotel に三泊泊まりました。お部屋は綺麗で素敵なデザイン、スタッフのおもてなしは最高でした。　メガホテルのリゾートが良いか、小さめのブティックホテルが良いか、みなさんそれぞれですが、こちらのホテルは清潔、綺麗、親切、アメニティーもしっかりしています。お部屋にコーヒーメーカーが用意されいますがロビーでもレモンウォーター、コーヒー、おやつが用意されています。何気にすごく気がきいています。　アラモアナショッピングセンターには歩いて10分以内で行けますし、ビーチも直ぐ近くです。メガホテルリゾートがあまる好きではない方には超お勧めです。　日本語を話すスタッフもいます。　　I stayed 3 nights at this boutique hotel, where the quality of service and friendliness is not the same as mega hotel resorts. The personal touch for little things makes this hotel really nice and cozy. The room was clean and decorated with style. Amenities, includes good coffee and cookies in the room and also at the lobby sitting area. They even have a little "noise box" for light sleepers, which i really appreciated. Free internet, reasonable prices, all make your stay in Honolulu a happy one. Unfortunately, there are no views from the hotel, but the beach is close by, the shopping center is close by, the ABC store is right around the corner, ther is a cute booth offering tours, as well as a cute little pool. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and they put their hearts in their work. I would recommend this hotel especially if you are not travelling with small children, and if you dont care for mega hotels. Thank you for your services!!!

My Wife and I: My wife and I are in our late 20's, travel a fair amount and usually plan our vacations around places to eat. We lived in Dublin, London and Berlin for 8 years and have lived in Brooklyn for the last 2. We generally like staying in hotels that are simply decorated, comfortable, with a staff that is helpful but not in your face, and close to good restaurants to try.Our Trip: We spent a week in total in Hawaii, split between Maui and Oahu and went to Honolulu to explore the city a bit. We spent 2 full days and one night on Oahu.Location: The Equus is located in Waikiki, about 10 min drive from downtown. We went out in Chinatown the night we were there and had a quick Uber ride back to the comfort of the Equus after a great meal at the Pig and the Lady.Room: We stayed in a suite on the top floor. The room was very spacious and furnished with Chinese antiques that fit in the general equestrian motif. The couch and bed were very comfortable, the shower was nice and big and the furnishings were unique and interesting. Staff: It is clear that the staff know their business and their city. Everything was painless and easy and we were greeted with a smile and an ahola at every interaction. The general manager Mariah was particularly delightful and went out of her way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. In summary, I would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for something a bit more interesting than the huge chains that you'll also find in the area.
user_name:
Shane L
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent 13 nights at this delightful little hotel, the staff were pleasant, the rooms spacious, clean and beds were comfortable. Great price, awesome location only 5-10minute walk to the shopping mall. Easy walking distance to the beach. Overall a great place to stay, especially if you would like to avoid over priced chain hotels is Waikiki. This hotel has charm, character and a local ambience, really felt like home away from home. I highly recommend this hotel to the discerning traveller on a mid-range budget.
user_name:
Tania E
Rotorua District, New Zealand

review_body: Great location. Loved my room. Room had lots of bamboo. Bathroom was very nice tile and marble. Everything worked fine: TV, wi-fi, air conditioning. Excellent toiletries and personal care products. Keurig machine in room with coffee and tea. Small refrigerator. My room had a balcony with table and chair.It was perfect for me except for one sour experience. I knew that there was a small pool but other guests told me about a hot tub that was next door at another property managed by the Equus. I was encouraged to ask about it and when I did so, I was given a bad time by a manger because she claimed that it was for the guests of that property and not for the guests of the Equus. I found her manner of speaking to me rude and abrupt.But besides her rudeness, the reality is that some quests were told about the hot tub at the property next door while other guests were not.This experience left a bad taste in my mouth and took away from what would have been a really great stay. I will recommend the Equus for others but I, myself, would not stay there again.

I live and work in the neighborhood and have always heard good things about your hotel. We decided to have a fun night out and not have to drive while enjoying the near-by bars and restaurants. We got a room for the night and we're very pleased. I especially loved the decor in the rooms. Not your run of the mill hotel look. It was cozy. I would stay there again.

The service was very friendly and hotel is 5 minutes from Waikiki beach.Very nice sitting area in the lobby with free internet.We stayed there before our ship cruise and in a week when we are back they allowed us to keep our luggage all day (before our flight) without any payment !

My husband and I chose to stay at the Equus upon recommendation from a friend when we needed a little staycation. Fantastic location in Waikiki, very clean hotel with extremely helpful and nice staff members. I would absolutely recommend this boutique hotel to anyone looking for something other than the big chains. Affordably priced, nice cool AC - steps from the beach, shopping and restaurants. Our new recommendation hotel for family and friends when they visit.

Although your hotel is a bit dated, I still enjoyed the fact that it was not the usual sterile hotel room. I particularly liked the old fashion four-poster beds. It was a quaint room (301) with a view on the front and side. The beds were comfortable. I really liked your sitting area down by the lobby. The things I liked: your coffee and tea maker, the fresh apples, the snack cookies, the way one of your servers came around with the glasses of tropical punch and your computer station where my husband printed our boarding passes. And especially since I have a problem with steps you offered your assistance. It was an enjoyable stay.

We spent our anniversary night at the Equus, and everything from the moment we stepped foot inside to the moment we left was just wonderful. Service: We arrived late at night and were warmly greeted by the front desk staff, and were quickly and efficiently checked in and shown to our room. Where we found a welcome note and congratulations and a little treat of bubbly and chocolate (we let them know it was our anniversary in advance). It really made the arrival feel special and we immediately felt at home.The next day everyone we encountered was super friendly, and obliging without being overbearing. The GM was in the lobby when we checked out and she took the time to have a chat about our plans for the day, and ask us about our stay. She was very genuine and sweet, and offered us tips for the day (go check out the Manoa falls!).Facilities:We had one of the suites on the top floor and it was just perfect. Big enough to feel like a real 'home' (seriously, the size of our entire NYC apartment if not bigger), but not so overly large that you feel adrift as some big name hotels seem to think their suites have to be... The kitchenette had everything we could have needed for a comfortable and self sufficient long stay, it was a shame we didn't stay longer to take advantage of it.The bed was sooooo comfy, and huge! My husband and I both had the best night's sleep of our entire trip to Hawaii, over 2 islands and several resorts. The furniture is an eclectic mix of timeless pieces, with so many unique touches, little statues, original artwork, and cozy throws. The 'Equine' theme is definitely noticeable, with horse artwork, and polo magazines around the place, but like everything else in this hotel it doesn't feel overbearing. A bit like an exclusive but friendly polo club I guess! I don't ride, and don't have much interest in horses and I still loved the theme.The bathroom amenities are all a gorgeous local eco friendly brand - not 'hippie' eco friendly - they actually work! and included both shampoo AND conditioner, which I always appreciate.There is tea and coffee in the rooms and free tea, coffee, water, (and amazing mini cookies...), available in the lobby, which feels more like someone's living room than a hotel lobby. We hung out there for a while when we got back from our excursion, to have a breather before we left and got back in the car. Location:Super easy to access from the airport, and close to the beach, but we could also drive out to the Manoa falls in less than 20 minutes.Overall a wonderful experience, I just wish we could have stayed longer one night was not enough. We'll be back!

We stayed two weeks here with my mother , sister, My Wife and our three kids. we had a great time and the staff was very friendly and helpful.We stayed for Christmas and the staff made personal leis for our kids.They went over and beyond in making our stay memorable.The property was very clean and had all that we needed or wanted. Will deffinately return here again.

Stayed here due to a conference near by. Upon arrival Renee greeted us with a warm Aloha. She made Checking in smooth and pleasant. Through out our stay Renee and Puka were very attentive to every request. Thank you for making our stay at your hotel a pleasant experience!

This hotel is very short walk to the convention center... we had an excellent stay, staff was great.! Short distance to the mall and nearby activities. Convenience store located on around corner stayed opened late. Would stay here again...
user_name:
mikeadamson717
New York City, New York

review_body: The Equus isn't the largest hotel in Waikiki, but if you are looking to avoid the large, touristy hotels, the Equus is for you. Our room was very nice, had a king sized bed, down comforter, large closet, and a stone shower. They serve free mai tais on Friday evenings and it is within walking distance of anywhere you want to go in Waikiki. The hotel staff is very friendly and even came to fix my tv at 11PM when I put it on the wrong input. One thing to note is that if you have a rental car, they charge 20 a night for parking, but it is valet. Any time of the day or night, you just pull in and head up to your room. I've seen other complaints about the AC, but ours worked great. It is also an eco-friendly hotel.I would highly recommend staying here even though it isn't beach front. We used it as a base to explore Oahu.

If you're looking for a budget friendly alternative to the big mega resorts, the Equus is a good option. It's a small boutique hotel, so no big crowds here which I have to say was quite nice. The hotel is pretty basic, but very friendly and comfortable. It's located in Waikiki, just a block and a half from the beach and the same distance to the big shopping mall. I thought one nice touch is that you can text the front desk with questions about the room, local restaurants, beaches etc. The Room: I had booked an "upper floor" but was given 3rd floor. When I asked to change rooms, they switched me right away. Definitely request an upper floor if you can. You'll have more light and it's further from the street noise. There's a mini fridge and wet bar sink in the room, as well as a desk and a flat screen TV on the wall. Free wifi. Some rooms have balconies, some do not. The ones without are bigger. Just personal preference if you want to trade some interior space to have a balcony. I liked having a bigger more spacious room. I didn't need the balcony. Bathroom: The bathroom had a shower (no tub). The lighting in the bathroom was really bad, but as a guy I didn't care. I imagine women trying to put on makeup would not be pleased. Elevator: There's just one and it's pretty slow. Also, it does not go to the street level, so if you have heavy bags you'll have to lug them up one flight of stairs. For this reason, I wouldn't recommend for elderly or anyone who has problems with getting up or down stairs. Location: It's in a good spot. There's an ABC store on the corner which is a great convenience, and as previously stated the mall and the beach are just a block and a half away. If you are wanting to be right on the beach or have a great view, this is not the place. Parking: There is valet parking available for $25/day. For the money, it's a pretty great option. Keep your luxury expectations in check and you'll probably enjoy this place.

The Equus Boutique Hotel is our hidden gem. Our home away from home. Will NOT stay anywhere else when visiting Oahu. Rene and Puka is the greatest asset to this company. They make you feel like family and will go above & beyond to make you comfortable. "Friends that became Family". They exemplify what the true meaning of ALOHA SPIRIT is, and I applaud you.To: Management,Rene and Puka deserves a raise! Mahalo a nui loa,Kalei Vigilla from Moku O Keawe

Within the past 5 years of visiting O'ahu, my family and I have always chose Equus as our first choice hotel to stay at. We're from the Big Island of Hawai'i and visit O'ahu at least twice a year and always look forward to returning to our 'Ohana at Equus. From our first experience with Equus til our most recent, they've always managed to uphold that welcoming aloha spirit centered upon a family atmosphere. The staff are always friendly and accommodating. At check-in we're always greeted by a positive and engaging staff member, talking story with us and making us feel comfortable during the check-in process. The rooms are nice and clean and budget friendly too.  I'd like to extend my deepest gratitude and appreciation to the hotel staff and management for going above and beyond. About 2 years ago my grandpa had surgery in O'ahu. His recovery wasn't going so well and we were scrambling for accommodations. That's when Equus stepped in and assured us that they would do whatever they could to help our family and accommodate us. We didn't know how long my grandpa's recovery would be so we were on a week to week notice with Equus. They told us not to worry and assured us we'd have a place to stay. In total, I've stayed their for 1 month and it was incredible to see the amount of love and support given to us by everyone at the Equus hotel. When heading out and passing the front desk, the staff would always ask how my grandpa was doing and at times would give us food or snacks.The Equus hotel is the best hotel experience I've had in O'ahu and I can't wait to return and stay with them again!

If you'd like to experience the true Aloha spirit, stay at the Equus. Rene, Puka and staff know how to provide excellent customer service. From the time you check in to the time you leave they are always there to kokua anytime you need it. Can't say enough about Rene and Puka. I consider them family. Always going out of their way to make our stay super enjoyable. Love them to pieces.E Hinano PauoleKailua-Kona, Hawaii

AU$260 for one night in Nov 2015 - Booked an "elevated room", offered 3rd floor but on complaint given 9th floor. Air Con not working - "not uncommon problem" fixed. Difficulty in using Wifi because of unclear instructions. Coffee machine looked good but not working. TV was working but on returning to unit would not work so had to listen to street noise instead.Definition of "Budget" depends on which side of the credit card you sit!!

We stayed here for 4 nights. All staff we met were really helpful and friendly. There is no restaurant but that is good, forced us to get out and interact with some locals more. Although an older hotel the rooms are renovated and very comfortable, not the biggest room, but we don't spend long in our rooms on holiday anyway. It has one of the best beds I have slept in. The location is right on the edge of Waikiki which was perfect as I hate the mass tourist crowds that swarm everywhere there. 5 minutes or so to walk to Ala Moana mall and to Waikiki beach in front of the Hilton hotel. The only down side is that because its older there is constant traffic noise, its not enough to be annoying or stop sleeping so much, its just always there in the back ground. maybe a suggestion that the next investment in the upgrade is double glazed windows then this will be a fantastic little hotel :). I will stay here again for sure when I come back hopefully next year!!....oh yeah and it has really good free wifi.
user_name:
pbh81
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

review_body: It is an older hotel which they have made very nice, comfortable, clean and welcoming. The rooms were great but the traffic noise is a little off putting for us. Great bed and the decor is lovely. Also you do need to be able to go up a flight of stairs with your luggage. Our mother could not stay as she is wheelchair bound but we knew this before booking. They gave us a delicious drink as we arrived and were friendly and helpful for our stay. Many restaurants and an ABC store all walking distance. Also they have buses and trolleys running all the time to explore Waikiki. We would stay again.
user_name:
Ann S
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: Had a lay over so stayed only 1 night. The property is an older hotel located in the western edge of Waikiki on a busy road. To get to the center of Waikiki requires a bus/trolley. The hotel is clean and the service is very friendly and accommodating.The room was comfortable with a king bed, and a very small bathroom. Would not choose this location for a longer stay.

Stayed for one night, is a small & cute hotel older style however staff are very welcoming and room was very comfortable - stayed in King Bed room on 10th floor, hotel only goes up to 10th floor and only has one elevator, was still a comfortable nights stay.

Stayed two nights at the Equus upon our arrival in Hawaii from the East Coast. Had a great room on the tenth floor--clean, spacious and well appointed--nothing like a chain hotel. The refrigerator was a bonus. Close to the marina and decent views from outside the room. This is a boutique hotel, so no bar or restaurant. The pool is a "dipping pool" meaning not much larger than a bath tub. The staff were quite helpful. However, the street noise was constant--all night long. It didn't interfere with our sleep, but you always new you were in an urban setting. I enjoyed our stay, but, frankly, liked the Hilton we stayed in at the end of our trip much better--closer to the beach, bar and restaurant, nice pool and cheaper.
user_name:
MarkK348
Colonie, New York, United States

review_body: I had my mother in town and she couldn't find a hotel! This is a problem as my place was not very accommodating. I found the Equus Hotel and they gave me a great rate for a newly renovated room with air conditioning and a nice bed, my mother was very pleased with the quality of the room. The friendly staff is very helpful as well. Have a good trip!

The Equus is sort of halfway between downtown Honolulu and Waikiki (somewhat closer to the Waikiki end) and made a perfect home base for our Oahu explorations. We stayed there for 5 nights and could easily hoof it to many destinations (especially when we wanted to avoid dealing with parking in Waikiki) or quickly get to the highway for journeys farther afield. There is a $25 per day parking fee (to be expected in a dense urban area), but the young men working as valets were so charming I didn't really mind. The room was clean and comfy, and I especially liked the Keurig coffee maker and little Hawaiian candies left for us. We were on the 7th floor in a corner, and although there was no noise from other hotel guests, you can't avoid the traffic noise from Ala Moana Blvd. below. This is a VERY busy street/highway, and you will hear the traffic at all hours. Eventually this turned into white noise for us, and I think it was a minor inconvenience to suffer in exchange for decent lodging at a fairly affordable rate in Honolulu. For its price and location, I would definitely stay at the Equus again.

I stayed twice in October, I'd previously stayed at the Sheraton, Parc and Embassy Suites and when I looked at returning to these hotels they were now charging $380USD per night. The Equus was $100USD per night so I decided to give it a try after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor.The pro's -They let me check in 3 hours early on both occasions.-The staff are all extremely friendly and welcoming.-Large, clean rooms.-Italian bed linen, comfortable beds.-Good wifi.-5 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre.The con's-alot of steps, about twenty into the entrance, no ramp or lift that I could see. -It's an older motel style hotel where your room door opens to a corridor which is open air so the traffic noise is louder.-It has been renovated but it still has old feel hotel about it.-No restaurant on the premises but there is an ABC convenience store within a 2 minute walk.-it's about a 20-25 minute walk to the main strip Kalakaua Ave.-it's about a 15 minute walk to the beach.-only 1 lift between the lobby and 8 levels of rooms.-very small pool.The rooms are located on level 3 to level 10, I stayed on level 4 which was quite noisy with traffic noise and a view of the road, level 10 was quieter but there was still a little noise and a view of the ocean in the distance.For the price I would return and recommend this hotel, it's not a romantic/honeymoon/family hotel by any means, but good for singles and travelling with friends.

Aloha! What a gem of a place but very quiet! Shower was fab, service was fab and the room was huge, great value for money but as i said a litle on the quiet side. Valet Parking comes with the hotel. Some diners etc down the block, but not a great choice of restaurants bars etc.

I stayed at The Equus twice in October. Once on a trip with girlfriends and once with my husband. Both visits were awese. Waikiki is.iconic and The Equus is in a perfect location for the beach and shopping at Ala Moana. The staff are all very friendly and so welcoming Little personal touches abounded. We met interesting people at the Thursday evening happy hour too.We plan to come back soon. Mahalo to the staff at the Equus!

Honest mid range hotel a little dated, but most in Wakiki are. Close to beach and most shopping. Second stay and as I usually say if you get what you pay for you can't complain. Happy to say that's what I received. Welcoming staff and they appear genuinely happy to assist. Happy to have a walk in shower not the usual over the bath rubbish. Also very happy to have in room safe.

Good rooms. Clean need with all amenities you need for a couple of nights. Internet access is free. The area offers a few choices of restaurants within walking distance. And a s always in Hawaii an ABC store is not far away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone staying up to a week. For a longer vacation you might want to look for something with direct beach access.

After airline delays enforced a quick stopover, we found this hotel at short notice at an excellent price. What made our stay so pleasant was the friendliness of the staff; they were really obliging. It's not the most modern property, but it's clean, comfortable, very well located and totally served our needs.

We stayed here for a week during September. We love smaller hotels and this one fit the bill for us. It was really hot and humid, and the A/C worked great. The employees were all really friendly, and the location was perfect for us, away from the busy Waikiki area, but close enough to walk to restaurants. The cocktail hour at the end of the week had excellent mai-tais. I would recommend staying here to just about anyone. We did have a couple of problems, but the management was great in resolving the main one with our room housekeeping. Be aware that since the hotel is located on busy Ala Moana Blvd., it can be a bit noisy, but we easily got used to it.

Friendly employees. Decent hotel... Kinda small and simple... Ac was on all the time we couldn't go out to the balcony cause you could feel the heat from the AC. Overall good if all you're doing there is sleeping and showering. Would want to stay somewhere closer to beach. Stores/ mc Donald's conveniently located

We did not know what to expect when we were booked into the Equus Hotel in Honolulu as part of a tour package, as neither of us had ever heard of it. We were quite pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the small hotel located right at the entrance to the Waikiki area. The front desk clerk, Puka, could not have been friendlier or more helpful. In fact, he upgraded our room at no cost, while the bellman, aptly named Check, served us glasses of tropical juice on a silver tray.The hotel offers a concierge located just outside the check-in desk to arrange any tours or excursions for guests of the hotel. The lobby is small but well-appointed, with comfortable chairs, a glass dispenser of chilled water with lemon available 24/7, a guest computer to be used free of charge & a lobby restroom & a small elevator.Our room was quite nice--spacious & comfortably furnished, with a remote-controlled air conditioner that was well used & greatly appreciated.The professional staff was always ready to accommodate our every request with a smile. Without exception, they were all pleasant, welcoming, efficient & service-oriented.We found the location of this hotel to be quite advantageous, as it is within a very short walk to one of the main stops of the many excursion company buses & also to the city bus line, as well. There are plenty of restaurants within quick walking distance, too.This is not one of the well-known, prestigious hotels in Waikiki (no on-site restaurant, shops or room service), but the value for your money is definitely superior here!

I stayed 10 nights at this hotel both for business and leisure. Was a nice walk to the convention center. Close to the Ala Moana shopping center. Only a couple blocks to the beach. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Staff very helpful and friendly. Greeted me with a nice refreshing glass of juice while I checked in. Glen was very helpful with my bags and stored them for me for several hours after I checked out and also upon my arrival. I had a great view to watch the fireworks every Friday night at the beach. I would most certainly stay at this hotel again.

I knew this was a "boutique" hotel so I expected some differences from a "regular" hotel. No tub and a small shower stall. Although the bed was comfortable, the old sliding glass door leading to the balcony should be replaced with something double-pane with sound deadening properties. We could even hear some conversations from the street with the door closed. Arrived at 3 pm and still couldn't get into our room until 4 pm. Ask for the key to the in-room safe when you get your room key as they keep the keys at the desk. Glad we were just there for a quick overnight. Would not stay here again despite the friendly staff.

We stayed at this property for one night between flights from Honolulu to outlying islands. It is not really convenient to the airport, but seemed to be the best option for the Choice Hotel group. The first thing one will notice is that the registration area is on the second floor, and the only way to get bags from the street to registration is to drag them up the flight of stairs. Elevator to upper floors is quite small. The room was comfortable and nice, but small. It was great for one night, but probably not so much for a multiple night stay. Our room did have an obstructed ocean view, so that was nice and more then we expected. We would stay again for the same purpose.

Just spent 6 nights here, and I was sad to leave. Even though here on business, found this hotel a perfect place to relax after long days of meetings. Exceptionally friendly staff all around. We mainly dealt with Ramon & Chad, (top notch!) but even the parking & room attendants were always smiling and willing to help. Note: this is not a resort, it's a small, very clean, well located hotel. You can see the convention center from the elevator. Very convenient. I most certainly would stay again!

this was my first time visiting.. with that said, this stay was by far the best we had while on several islands. The staff was great the concierge was beyond helpful and I felt like they went out of their way to help us in choosing our Oahu experience.

Once again, although just overnight, the Equus and its customer-service-oriented staff were great! We had an event in Waikiki and decided instead of driving home to Kapolei we would stay at the Equus. Rene Kahumoku in guest services, the front desk staff and all the employees were so gracious and always go above and beyond to make our stay awesome. We look forward to the next staycation at the Equus.

This has become my hotel of choice when staying in Waikiki. We are a local family about every 8 weeks we stay "in town" for the few days. Based on Comfort, price and location this my fav. It is a Boutique hotel only 10 Floors but well appointed, I stayed in 904 this last time.The Staff is wonderful. They will do whatever possible to accommodate. We stayed twice in the last two weeks and a shout out to Yoshi and Roman at the desk for making our stay and check-in/out so easy.I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice room close to it all for a reasonable price.Oh and I cant forget GREAT mattresses.

The rooms were nice but for the price there are much nicer hotels in Waikiki. If you want to sleep on your vacation don't book here. The noise from the main road doesn't really stop and the dodgy glass sliding doors are not at all sound proof. They actually have ear plugs at the front desk because people must complain all the time. The pool has no sun over it, it's blocked out buy all surrounding buildings, but of course you do have the beach so no real big stress. Don't trust the guy near the lobby trying to sell you tours, they are also overpriced. He'll tell you there is a massive line at Pearl Harbour and try charge you $90 but when we went we got straight in. You can just catch the bus from near the hotel there is no entry fee.The walk back to Waikiki from the hotel is about 20 mins or so. I don't think we'll book here again or recommend to friends.

This is a small, clean hotel. The staff are friendly, the beds are comfortable, the air-conditioning is good and the location is very good. It's about an 8 minute walk to the beach and about the same to the Ala Moana shopping centre (huge).

I was in Honolulu for a conference, but I was not satisfied with the hotel quality for the money I paid (maybe the conference helped in increase room price). The issues started from day one. They could not find my hotel reservation (which was done by a travel agency - good that in Europe was morning and the issue was solved fast). Additionally I could not open the window, so the only fresh air was through the entrance door or the A/C.On the positive side, the hotel was walking distance to the conference center (5min walk) and the room was clean. The staff was polite, but not so helpful (their suggestions/proposals not the best).The famous Waikiki beach is about 20min walk away, so middle optimal distance (you cannot go twice). In the area there are some food (breakfast/dinner) options but not so good. You have to walk to Waikiki.There is close by bus stop to downtown or a big shopping center or Perl Harbor.

I have stayed at Equus several times for business, my work brings me to Paradise monthly for at least 4 to 5 days at a time. I often try to book this hotel but I'm not always able to secure a booking. On this trip the weather was very hot and humid, and probably pushed the air con to maximum capacity. My unit wasn't working properly, so when I communicated this to the front desk they went into action!Not only did the offer to fix the air con but if they couldn't they were willing to move my belongings to another room so when I returned to the hotel the issue would have been fixed! Wow, not many hotels would have ensured this on the first communication of the issue. I stayed at a large national brand hotel and went 4 days before issues were taken care of! I also found some Chocolate and a gift certificate to a nice dinner for the inconvenience. ...Keep up the great service and I look forward to my next stay next month!!

I had an overall great stay in Honolulu for a week. The Equus Hotel was a very short walk to the beach and shopping areas. The Equus Hotel supplied a beach towel for the trip to the beach. Every staff member was very friendly and courteous. The ABC store (all in one store had everything that I needed to include gifts at reasonable prices) was a few minutes walk from the hotel. The only thing lacking was a microwave in the room, but that didn't affect my awesome stay and experience in Honolulu.

First time to Hawaii and the hotel was wonderful. The staff was caring and very friendly. The hotel lobby had back lighting and ice water really made the atmosphere relaxing. Close to bus line, restaurants, Magic beach was only 1/2 mile away. It was nice to walk to all our things we wanted to see.. If you don't mind walking,, walk through the shopping centers and then to the state Capitol and Palace. On the way home try to caught the farmer market for a cost effective supper..

not accustomed to Honolulu, we had some problems finding a hotel at a reasonable price...after long search we found the Equus and did not regret our choice. The hotel is nicely located, at walking distance from/to Waikiki, the staff is friendly and very human...the room (on the highest storey) was large enough with a wet bar, well equipped ... some less positive point is probably the fact that it needs a few adjustments to be at present standards but nothing repealing... we were not advised if breakfast was available or not hence we went out for it... not a big fuss but why not inform the guests ?

Location and price sums it up. Near the beach, walking distance to the ABC store & several restaurants and bars, also close to the mall for major stores as well. Friendly staff at the front desk and the valet for the parking. Our room was clean and comfortable, everything worked fine and if we had a request the staff was on it immediately. They have a business center in the lobby with a computer and printer which made it easy to print boarding passes and surf the web. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Waikiki area and not have to pay the big bucks for the same area. We will definitely be staying there again our next trip to the islands Mahalo

This hotel was a good value for a very pricey area. We were just a block from the beach and there were restaurants within walking distance, as well as a convenience store down to block.As others have mentioned, there are stairs to the check-in level. However, they were very helpful and brought all our bags up, so it wasn't a problem at all. One of our group had recently had a hip replaced and did very well.Your room key has to be in the slot on the wall by the entryway for the air conditioner to come on. There is a remote control device to set the temperature. Since we were breaking heat and humidity records, we sometimes left one key in the room to keep the air conditioner running.The other couple in our group had a nice balcony and view. We had a big air return device on our deck and it was loud and very hot. It made the balcony unusable. I would ask for a room without this device on the balcony.One other complaint is we asked for adjoining rooms when we made the reservations in January and then called and asked prior to leaving for Hawaii (in August) and we were put on separate floors. They do not have any ice machines. You can make ice and put it in your in-room refrigerator/freezer. We could only find 7 lb bags at the ABC store and that wouldn't fit in the small freezer. The man at the desk did give me a small baggie with ice in it that he had in his freezer, but you can't count on that.The staff was very friendly and did their best, so I have no complaints there.Again, it was a value considering the location and we were only there for 3 nights.

We visited the Equus on our honeymoon and were made so welcome. The room was comfortable and cool, and the chocolates and fresh pineapple upon arrival were a lovely touch! Clean and very convenient in terms of location, we would love to return some day!

I stayed here for two nights in August. The hotel has few if any amenities (no bar or restaurant, though it does have a small pool) but that's fine. It is walking distance to many restaurants and also to the beach.The room was comfortable and housekeeping left a lot of towels in the bathroom, a nice touch. Air conditioning in room is operated by a remote control. I had trouble getting it to cool the room at first, but a staff member came to my room to show me how it worked. It worked fine, I just didn't catch on fast how to use it, so in case others have the same trouble, just call the front desk and they'll show you how.Rooms open to outside corridor. Staff was always helpful when I needed them for something. This is a good value for what is usually a very expensive area to stay in.

After a long flight from the mainland my Wife and I were warmly received at the Equus Hotel in Waikiki, we both felt the inviting atmosphere immediately. Ms Rene Kahumoku, the Guest Services Manager happened to be on duty and checked us in very promptly. The Equus is as described a Boutique hotel without all resort glitz and hype, the location is excellent within walking distance to restaurants, bars, harbor and beaches. I HIGHLY recommend upgrading to a suite which are large, comfortable and have all the amenities one could ask for.If your choice is to stay at a hotel that receives you with a WELCOME HOME attitude the Equus Hotel is for you.A SPECIAL thank you to Ms Rene for making our stay memorable and MOST IMPORTANTLY MY WIFE HAPPY!!!

The Equus is an exceptional value for being so close to Waikiki. The room was fine with a good bed and quiet at night, provided you request a room on a higher floor. We very much enjoyed walking down on the beach, past all of the extremely expensive beach hotels to watch the surfers and beach goers. We actually walked all the way to Diamond Head! Great restaurants are all around. We had rented a car to tour the island, and you did have to pay a hefty amount for parking, but still you cannot go wrong with Equus.

Overall, the Equus was just okay. The rooms were clean. Price was right for a hotel in Waikiki (albeit by about 200 feet). It's at the very edge of Waikiki, and although there are places to grab something to eat, the main drag of what you'd want to see in Waikiki are about a 20-30 minute walk. So the location is just alright, but nothing stellar unless you want to eat at the same chain restaurants you can eat at on the mainland.There isn't even so much as a continental breakfast here which was somewhat frustrating as a business traveller looking for a quick bite to grab on my way out in the morning.Parking is limited, so you have to pay $25 (August 2015) per day for valet parking. I wouldn't mind that had I had better than a 50% success rate in a valet attendant being present. The times in the afternoon/evening I ended up just parking the car myself and having to drop the key at the front desk. The times in the morning was inconvenient having to wait for the attendant to come off break (at 7:30 AM as no one was sitting there waiting for their car).It's economical and clean, but I've definitely stayed in more satisfactory places at similar price points.

I spent a week at The Equus this summer and I loved it because the rooms are very plush and comfortable. This hotel was a perfect place to get away from the grind of work and get to relax. The beds are so soft and the decor is lovely. The stafff are so friendly and smiled every time I needed help. The building is angled so that there is always a nice breeze blowing through which is so important when Hawaii is super hot, the beach is just across the street and the funnest parts of Waikiki are just a short walk away. Please check this hotel out when you go to Hawaii!

Needed to come to Honolulu/Waikiki for a wedding and could not afford to stay in one of the big hotels and so went shopping and found Equus. Not bad. Not over the top, but not bad at all. Within walking distance of all the big hotels without sacrificing your wallet to the Hotel Gods.

Easy in & out with super staff For a small place amazing amenities Try going in and out of a big joint Hilton or Sheratona night mare just arrivingEquus makes it workHope to be backMahalo Nui Loa from a Happy visitorPatrick

The room was good, the bed sink in quality, notes,...no ice machines gotta get ice from desk each evening, the rooms are off a hallway outdoors each floor. Valet parking only. $25 bucks a night plus tax. Don't have to pay that in the continental US. No frills but very cool spot. The girls that checked me in were so cool and very welcoming. The bellman/parking valet brought me fresh hawaiian juice while I waited for the front desk to clear out during check in. The pool is right there but only open till 7 pm. I get back from work at 9 pm so didn't get to use the pool.

I give this Hotel 5 stars because of what it offers: The most comfortable King Size bed I have ever slept on! Love the amenities such a Keurig coffee maker with organic coffee, cream and sugar. SUPER STAFF! You need help, they come right away. Love the TV Choices that include sports and music. Room AC was on for me room nice and cool before I checked in which I appreciate. Includes fridge with separate freezer unit. Has Street noise up til about 7pm, but was quiet when I was sleeping. Valet service is not a choice at 25.00 per day, but they take care of you. Valet service 6am to 10pm. I was here on business, so it was perfect for my needs. Not what I would call a tourist hotel (small pool) but if you are out and about, the bed is perfect for sleeping when you get back! Note: No elevator, have to walk up 15 steps. Bellman will help you. :) Thx to "Check" for luggage help, "Ah Chew" (yes these are real names) and Auntie at front desk and Valet guys. Mahalo

stayed for three nights，Nice location, good price, clean and comfortable， valet parking for 25 dollars, very covinient， walk to mall and beach， did not have much interaction with the staff ，everything was running smoothly。

The CFA Hawaii Cat Fancy really appreciates the excellent customer service offered by your hotel. We book many rooms every year for our cat show judges who come from around the world to judge our cat shows. The staff makes it easy to book the rooms, handles all concerns and changes with gracious accommodation, and makes our judges welcome and feel at home. Not only is the hotel itself beautiful, but their service and location in Waikiki helps make each of our shows a success!

Great boutique hotel north of Waikiki...two minute drive (or 10 min walk) to Ala Moana Beach, which is much nicer than Waikiki Beach. There's also a yacht club at the entrance to this beach park. The staff was very friendly and if I had a question, someone was at my door within 5 mins to help. Restaurants close by include Outback and Red Lobster (directly across the street), McDonald's, Subway, IHOP, and a Cheeseburger spot are on the same side as the hotel and within 2 - 5 min walk. ABC Store is like 2 mins walk away. The valet staff are a great resource for information too, although some are better than others. On our last day there, the valet attendant (whom we hadn't seen during our short stay) told us about the beach items available for use -- beach chairs, floaties, body boards, etc... -- the attendants before offered no such information even though I clearly mentioned the plan for the day which was to go to the beach. The closet with these items was right by the valet attendant's podium. The kids were sooo disappointed that we weren't informed of this before. Also, upon check-in, I overhead another guest requesting beach towels. I guess they're available for use, but I didn't know for sure because no-one told us. Plus we had already packed beach towels in our bags. Otherwise, nice little spot in a nice part of town. Oh, there's also a shopping mall 5 mins away -- walking distance. AC and wifi worked great.

This cool little treasure gets better every visit. The people are so nice, the rooms are so clean, the location is so great. It is close to the Ala Moana shopping center, the Waikiki Yacht Club, and the convention center. The prices are so reasonable and the atmosphere is so Hawaii. Last visit we were treated to complimentary Mai Tai's on the lanai by the pool. It doesn't get better in my book.

I was arranging travel for several people over different dates and also required a couple of changes. Rene Kahumoku was always very accommodating and ensured that all was taken care of efficiently. The friendly attitude and professionalism was much appreciated.

Having enjoyed the Equus Hotel during last year's "Staycation," we wanted to try it again this year. It was even better this time around. The staff pampered us. Every single staff member that we came across took the time to smile and greet us. The room was excellent and appealing. The "Text if you need anything" program is still in effect and it continues to be a very efficient and welcome touch. There is no on-site restaurant but there are numerous eateries within a short walk of the hotel. If you want true Aloha, look no further than the Equus.

This hotel is very nice. Right across the street from the beach, shops close by, friendly check-in. I was upgraded to a Suite, clean and comfy. The pineapple in my room was the BEST EVER....sunset gorgeous! No continental breakfast served but finding food is only a block away.

I'm from Hawaii but sometimes have to stay in hotels for business purposes and that's why I tried the Equus Hotel. I liked the fact that it's on the edge of Waikiki so I would have to drive through all of Waikiki traffic to get to work. However that was the only positive of this hotel. The elevator situation here is just awful with two elevators to service the whole building. The housekeepers use one for a good part of the morning and afternoon leaving just one for guests. I'm not kidding when I say I've waited 20 minutes to get an elevator up to my room. That's just so bad. The constant sound of sirens as ambulances and fire engines rush into Waikiki is another sore point. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Ohana Waikiki East; for the same price you'll get a much better experience.

My family had the pleasure to stay at the Equus in Honolulu during the 4th of July weekend earlier this month. We were greeted by staff members Erik and Glenn. They were kind enough to open our doors as we exited our rental. They noticed we had small kids traveling with us and had quite a bit of luggage. Glenn then took the initiative to take a cart with our belongings to our room for us. We were again greeted in the lobby by Glenn with a tray filled with glasses of ice cold guava juice as we checked in. Our vacation was off to a great start. Our room was a cool refreshing break from the warm summer heat as it was kept at comfortable temperature. The kids were excited as they began staking claim to which bed was theirs. As an added bonus, our room was equipped with wifi so the kids were able to easily connect and watch their online videos. Not to mention, the wifi would greatly reduce our data usage on our phones during our stay. The room was well stocked and very clean. We immediately made use of the mini fridge to chill water and beverages to use for our daily outings. There was no ice machine onsite, but a quick call to front desk and they delivered two bags of ice to our room. A safe was also conveniently located in the closet to keep our valuables safe while we were out. Being so close to the beach, we never had the opportunity to use their pool. Duke's Lagoon was just across the street and Ala Moana park is just to the right of it. Upon our return from our daily trips, we quenched our thirst with the fruit infused ice water offered in the lobby. There is even a computer workstation to use. A staff member was also readily available outside the lobby to answer any questions or assist you in planning your activities.If we got got hungry, there were a number of restaurants across the street or just a block away. If we wanted to go shopping, we could walk to the Ala Moana Center (shopping mall) just a couple blocks away. There's even an ABC store on the corner to stock up on last minute gifts and snacks. Their ideal location was even more evident on the Fourth of July as the main street was blocked off and the local park hosted the island's largest firework display. We didn't have to fight any traffic and the kids could play in the sand while we watched the fireworks. All just a short walk across the street. On the last day of our stay I met Rene, the manager whom graciously assisted with us with a minor travel dilemma without hesitation. To my family, it's this compassion and unrivaled hospitality towards their guest that will keep us returning to the Equus, our home away from home. Their staff are the epitome of the true spirit of Aloha.

Stayed twice in June, four days each stay. location was great, as we did not have a car, but were able to walk and get the bus to shops, sights etc. The rooms were clean and a good size, we were on the top floors ( 9 and 10), a bit of traffic noise but it did not effect our sleep. Staff were helpfully and friendly.

Our stay was incredible. We were just a short walk from the beach, the accommodations were affordable, the rooms were beautiful and equipped with everything we needed, and the entire staff went above and beyond to provide incredible service. Everything was clean and beautifully decorated. We hated to have to leave, but will definitely stay there again! Thank you!

Great place to stay! If you like personal service and enjoy staying just off the beaten path this is a great hotel for you. I've been off-island for years and really enjoyed the old-world flavor this hotel provides. It's reminiscent of a gentler more down to earth Waikiki than what's available nowadays with the larger hotel chains. The remodeling is tasteful and provides all the amenties. What makes them unique is the level of service Puka and Rene and the rest of the staff provide . Their kindness & attention to detail makes this a hotel I would consider a priviledge to stay in next time I'm on Oahu.Thank you everyone for taking care of us we truly appreciate it!

This is actually my 3rd time staying here, but first time with my family. After 3 weeks of traveling state to state, our final week of vacation ended perfectly thanks to the hotel staff. From the valet service to the housekeeping, everyone made our stay perfect. Eric (valet) was very helpful with suggestions and directions to places where we can eat and visit, especially for our kids. Lita (housekeeping) took care of our room and needs, thank you. The beds were completely comfortable, we asked for extra beds and got them right away. The rooms were clean and welcoming, everything was just PERFECT! The pool was my kids' favorite part of their stay. For my wife and I, it was choosing the right hotel with the perfect staff. Thank you for taking care of us on our last week of vacation. We will most definitely come back next time.

I normally stay at Marriot Waikiki but I was overnighting in Honolulu and needed a room for the night. I was not sure what to expect . What a delightful surprise. A charming change from the cookie cutter hotels I normally stay in. There was something uniquely Hawaiian about this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room was perfectly clean. Went for a dip in the pool before heading back to the airport. Although not ideal for my family vacation with kids, this is a great hotel for adults looking for friendly genuine Hawaiian hotel.I

Me and my now finace stayed here and it was perfect every attendant that we came across went above and beyond we felt very comfortable at this hotel, great location and now im planning my wedding and we will be staying here... Happy guest!

We really enjoyed our stay there. The staff was very friendly and helpful. From the valet service to housekeeping. We checked in with Yoshi Who was very informative and friendly. Housekeeping (Radiant) was on point with being so efficient and taking care of our room. She was also helpful in giving us directions and suggestions on where to eat and places to visit, super friendly and showed the aloha spirit. The beds were very comfortable and we all had a good nights rest. Upon checking out we were taken cared by someone named Romero. He was very friendly and very welcoming and thankful that we stayed. I will definitely come back to stay here. Thank you the awesome staff for the great service.

Great staff, welcomed us with open arms. From the valet guys to the front desk, service with smiles all around. Pukka made us feel right at home with his great personality. Staff Helped us with everything we needed including finding a freezer for our coolers to take back home, thanks Jackie! They also gave us fresh pineapples, yummmmy!! The pool was right outside our door, my kids LOVED it. The perfect location also, walking distance to everything we had in our to-do lists, especially the different restaurants, stores, and of course, the beach. This was our home away from home... We would definitely come back here.

We stayed one night, the hotel and room itself were a bit tired, and not the best sleep as the beds had roll together. The room was quite noisy at night as it is located on a busy street and there was a lot of traffic. Everything was clean however and the service was very friendly. The highlight of this hotel for us was definitely the service.

I couldn't believe when I turned up for our stay at the Equus. The photos don't even do it justice. For the price I paid to stay here, along with the 2.5 star classification, I didn't expect it to be as nice and classy as it was.This place was our home for 9 nights and served us perfectly. Located close to Waikiki and also walking distance to Ala Moana Centre and bus stops to anywhere, the location was perfect. Despite being located on Ala Moana Bvd, noise wasn't loud at all (9th floor stay) and the view at sunset was beautiful.The staff are amazing and always friendly. The front desk is 24 hour which really made you feel cared for and at home. Mai Tai's on Thursday and Friday afternoons was just a bonus and a great way to chat with other hotel guests.Oh, and the beds are soft and every nights sleep was perfect.We will definitely be back in the future, just need an excuse!Thanks again for the wonderful stay!

I recently needed last minute accommodation in Honolulu and, after a friendly chat with the hotel desk, was about to book a room at a fantastic price at The Equus Hotel. The room was clean, spacious and the bed was quite comfortable. Rene and her staff were extremely warm and friendly, and we would happily stay with them again!

What a gem, fantastic staff, lovely friendly touches, Very reasonable prices, located 2 blocks from from beaches. Free cocktails every evening 5pm to 6pm.Not a new building, but renovated and super clean. Owner obviously keen on Polo, lots of prints throughout the building. Complimentary chilled water and computer/printer. WiFi fantastic all over. Would definitely use again

What I like about this hotel is not just the hotel in itself but the staff as well!! The staff is just amazing!! Radiant, Jackie, and the entire staff were very hospitable and very welcoming. I love the fact that they accommodated what my friends and I needed in such a short amount of time. Being that this hotel is trying to go eco-friendly is a most definite plus. My friends were very satisfied with their stay here. The pool was nice and cool. The hotel is practically a walk away from everything so taking a car is unnecessary. You can actually grasp that aloha feeling staying here. This hotel is by far my favorite and at the top of my list. Very secluded not much people bothering you, you literally get your own privacy. I will most definitely come back and stay here again for another stay-cation and recommend my friends and family to come stay here whenever their visiting.Thank you so much Equus hotel and staff!! Whatever you doing keep at it!!!

I was pleased with this hotel as it was well priced and while quite old it was clean and tidy. There is only one lift so that can be a problem but the stairs are right there if you are in a hurry. The staff were extremely helpful and every time we had to deal with them they were very pleasant. On our last day we did not fly out till late in the evening and they were happy to let us keep one room for the duration to shower and refresh in prior to going to the airport at no charge. It is close to the beach and local bars etc.

I was relatively happy with the accommodation as it was decently priced, and a nice walk to Waikiki beach. From my experience, here are some things to be aware of: 1. You have to carry your luggage up a set of stairs to get to the lobby2. There is one lift, it is old and slow (and unfortunately broke down as I was leaving for the airport)3. Lots of street noise at night - bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper

We recently stayed at The Equus Hotel in Waikiki and so excited we did. The customer service , including Queenie, Kaori and Trevor were exceptional and not to mention the entire staff. Very helpful with introducing us to the hotel for the first time and sharing their aloha wherever we were. The decor and accommodations were equivalent to many of the major hotels in Waikiki and for a much better price. Our room was clean, smelled great and had a balcony so we could enjoy the Hawaii breeze. Definitely we'll be staying again at The Equus.

We were exceptionally pleased with the Equus on our recent trip to Waikiki beach. For a modest price we received an excellent room in a hotel that is one block from the beach. The staff was exceptional. Especially Mariah who spent over a half hour with us pointing out places to visit based on our interests.An added bonus was their Happy Hour, with Ash making the best Mai Tais I've ever tasted! We walked along the charming beach path, enjoyed a gorgeous sunset and ended the evening with the Friday night fireworks held each week! They are shot off very close to the harbor near our hotel, so the view was amazing!We highly recommend the Equus to anyone!

Recently stayed at the Equus hotel for a 3 night stay. Very enjoyable stay. Staff friendly from valet to checkin.Hotel is of an older style but still comfortable for our family of 4.Hotel is well located with short walks to Waikiki, Ala Moana centre & restaurants.You do have to climb stairs from carpark to reception & lift was rather slow but not a big problem for our young family. You do here a lot of road noise but still not a big worry for us.The free juice on arrival is a nice touch & the free Mai Tai at happy hour also a nice surprise.Would happily stay here again when visiting Waikiki.

After staying at various large resorts on Waikiki Beach, this was a refreshing change. We were greeted by friendly and attentive staff and offered ice cold pineapple and guava juices. There were complimentary mai tais at happy hour, and the staff went above and beyond. Something you definitely don't get at large resorts. The friendly prices reflect the lack of amenities here but you can walk across the street and enjoy the pools and beaches at the Hilton. The rooms here are clean and comfortable for an older hotel but there were a couple bugs buzzing around the room which wasn't ideal. All in all a very charming hotel though!
user_name:
Rob H
Chicago, Illinois, United States

review_body: This hotel is in a great location with friendly and attentive staff. The are a 2 minute walk from the beach and 10 minute walk from a massive shopping complex that has bars and restaurants also. The hotel has a tour desk which makes it easy to book all your tours at once. The free Friday afternoon Mai Tai is good as you get to catch up and meet new people staying at the hotel also.

Nice room - two comfortable queen beds. Plenty of space for our family with two teen-age boys. Walking distance to mall and several restaurants. Friendly service - couldn't ask for nicer folks! While this is not a 5-star hotel, for price we paid, it was exactly what we expected and very welcoming.

This is an older hotel on the edge of the action of Waikiki. Off of the water 1 block and at the end of hotel row. Waikiki has become so "Vegas" that it was nice to be out of the chaos in a quieter hotel with a quainter feel. Room was comfortable. Our TV didn't work and management was so quick to get us a new room. With the windows closed it still sounded like they were open. Staff is personable and even offer fresh juice on arrival. Location is convienant to ABC store (where you can buy bottled wine and suntan lotion). Parking was 25$ a day. If you want a no frills hotel and a comfortable place to lay your head within walking distance of the action, this is the place for you.

I stayed here when swimming the Molokai Straits. I was looked after and treated like part of the Equus family. I recently returned May 2015 and they recognised me straight away and it was like going home!!! My trip was to go to Kona, however I detoured to stop in Oahu just to stay and say hello. Incredible value for money and they give the personal touches that I have not experienced any where else in Hawaii!! These guys really do care that u have a fantastic stay!!! I will be back soon!!!!! Thank you guys. Adam Ocean Walker xx
user_name:
Adam W
Nottingham, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Located a US$40 cab ride from the airport between Ala Moana Shopping Centre and the start of Waikiki beach was perfect for our needs. Equus is an old style Motel, renovated and again in need of a new makeover. The service and helpfulness of all staff was excellent! Rooms are a serviceable size with practical furniture.Things you should know…There is a short flight of stairs to the Foyer and the lift to all floors. Road noise is high until late in the evening even on the higher floors. There are “shutter” type window coverings but no way to obscure the view from the adjacent apartments therefore you must have the shutters closed to achieve privacy.We would pay more for a more comfortable room.

Stayed at the Equus from 6/4-6/11....the room was exactly as described. The bed was ok for myself however my husband with back issues it wasn't. The head of housekeeping went out her way to provide a board to put under mattress to make more firm. Rene gave great suggestions for local restaurants in the area and Queenie make sure everything was above and beyond satisfactory. The entire staff was outstanding. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others. Within walking distance to restaurants, shopping and 2 blocks away beach.

We originally booked the Marina Tower. Upon arrival there was no one in the office. Luckily one of the guests let us know we should check in at The Equus, located in front. A sign with this information would have been helpful. It turns out that the Marina Tower was fully booked so they gave us an upgrade to the Equus. We arrived at approximately 5:00 and free mai tais were being serve outside the reception area-a nice welcome. The hotel site is quite narrow with the majority of space taken by hotel rooms so the sitting area leading to the pool and lounge area beyond is quite narrow. Check in went smoothly and staff was friendly and helpful. There is only one elevator which is quite slow, benches are thoughtfully provided on each floor. The room was clean and decent size with a lanai just large enough to fit two chairs. The partial ocean view is a small space between two large hotels where a glimpse of blue could be seen. Coffee provided for a fee ($2.75) though the tap water was foul tasting. Although we were located on a higher floor the proximity to the main road into Waikiki made the room continually noisy, pillows were flat, toilet was loud, and air conditioning was also loud though it did cool off the room. Described as a boutique hotel and one that was on the low end price wise, this is a good place for those who are not overly picky. Good location within walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center and beach park (2 blocks), a block from a convenience store, McDonalds, and bus stops. Several restaurants and bars are also nearby. Overall a good older hotel for a reasonable price.

I had an accident the second day I was there. I could not. Make it up the few stairs they had. They were nice enough to refund my nonrefundable prepaid. They also packed up my belongings, and also found me a room with wheel chair access. Definitely a great people to do business with.A big shout out to Rene'.

Well I loved the service I got here it was amazing.. From Check In To Check Out they are nothing but welcoming .. they have complimentary mai tai's on friday in the lobby great location as well very close to everything ... However I had booked for a partial ocean view which I didn't receive & then I was charged a different amount as well that's really the reason for the low scoring review

My first trip to Hawaii and I stayed in this wonderful hotel!!!!!!!!!!! Pleasant staff, comfortable bed and very close to Everything!!!!!!!! I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. Remember if you do not like the room that you're assigned they will switch it out for you, at no extra cost!

Stayed at the Equus Hotel when we stopped in Oahu for two nights. Clean room with a good bed. Decent location. Walking distance to the beach and large mall. Disappointed in staff's suggestion for dinner. When asked where we could get dinner, they suggested a very small food court across the street. Next day discovered a large mall two blocks away which dozens of choices. If you need to spend a couple days on Oahu and want to be by a beach and not spend a fortune, then this is a great option. Note: If you are driving a car that parking is $25 per night.

I stayed here during my birthday June 2015 and I had the best time, we were upgraded on arrival and the staff were amazing and nice and when they found out it was my birthday the sent a bottle of wine with fresh fruits up to the room. The staff were extremely nice and the rooms were nice clean and big!! We had a little fridge to store drinks and food in and it was a decent sized mini fridge. I would definitely would recommend this place to family and friends.

The Equus is certainly one of the finest hotels (boutique or otherwise) in Waikiki.The rooms are beautiful and the service, Hawaiian hospitality at the highest level.Thank you Mariah, Queenie, Rene, Kaori , Ramon and others, who made our vacation so special.Bruce Okrenik, Canada

The hotel is good overall, but it is on Ala Moana Blvd, so there is road noise all day (and all night) long. The rooms do have air conditioning, which you'll need to use. Between it and the road noise, it kind of becomes a background white noise.The bed was very comfortable and the shower had great water pressure. They had already swapped out the feather pillows for foam, based on my request, prior to checkin. I find lots of hotels don't do that, so it was much appreciated.The location is nice, with Ala Moana Center (a huge shopping and dining complex) within easy walking distance. Other restaurants are also nearby. Getting to the heart of Waikiki would be a bit of a walk, but it's Hawaii, so being outdoors is OK.The review is titled "Good option for a short stay" since I don't think I'd want to stay here for an extended period of time. I think it would be a little too isolated from the action if you were here for a longer time. We live on Kauai and were here for 1 night.

It was important to me to support the last family owned hotel in Honolulu. I had a very restful, peaceful, and calming stay at this location. The staff were professional and friendly. This hotel was in walking distance (within a mile) to store, mall, convention center, and beach. Cost was very responsible. The view is limited but I did not mind since I did not spend a lot of time in room. Accessibility may be an issue for wheelchair users or individuals having difficulty with stairs. There are about 10 stairs from street entrance to check-in counter. There is an elevator at the check-in level with access to upper floors. Site has a wonderful cooling pool and open coordinators.

This was a great hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. It's a bit of an older place but great value for the price. I would say the only issue was the location which was a little ways away from the main strip area.

This hotel is very charming, especially the room we stayed in. My daughter and I stayed in RM 1003. The room is fairly spacious w/ very comfy bed. The bathroom is a bit on the small side, but we managed. We had a slight view of the Ocean and when we walked out our door, we were looking at the Harbor. The location is within walking distance to the Waikiki Beach Lagoon w/ many trendy fun bars, pools and restaurants. We were frequent visitors of the ABC convenient store on the same block. The staff was helpful and friendly. I am a hotel snob and I would definately stay at this establishment again.

I traveled to Hawaii for my 23rd Birthday and I couldn't of picked a better hotel to stay in. The value is great, the staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. The Equus is also walking distance to Waikiki beach and shopping area. I definitely recommend this hotel.

The hotel offer 15% discount if you booked on line in advance and there are no resort fees. It is situated 10 mins walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, the beach and Waikiki centre is 15min walk.We stayed for 9 nights. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the staff where friendly and accommodating. We requested a quiet room which was situated away from the main road.Comparing this hotel to another hotel I stayed on Waikiki beach front which was more expensive this was a preferred option. I would defiantly stay at this hotel again.

Rene saved me. Booked a night for a personal trip and found out late I needed another night and while they didn't have any rooms at equus, he called and found me a room at another hotel close. Would have been lost without his help... Thank you, thank you Rene.

The hotel was nicely situated in Waikiki. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The only drawback was there wasn't an elevator from street level to check in desk,otherwise I highly recommend it.

I stayed there for 2 nights with a girlfriend in April.Super cute room. Staff were so nice. The pool looks nice but you can't really swim in it as its in the shade and super tiny. There's a shuttle to take you to the mall but it's a nice walk of you don't mind being in traffic. There's no ice machine .. You have to ask the front desk. Be prepared for the fact that there might not be any ice. The modern hotel is right across the street. Beautiful place for drinks. And the chart house is close too for good food. I would stay at Equus again for the convenience.

My husband booked this hotel for our 2 nights in Honolulu. Apparently it was a good price. I did not check the other options, but it cost us about $125.00 per night and another $25.00 per night for the valet parking. It was convenient.
