The room was nice, two queen beds, the bathroom had a shower/no tub. The room we had was on the end and so we had a view of the ocean and could get a nice breeze. The A/C worked fine. This is not a 5 star hotel, but it was very adequate for our needs and the staff were very friendly.

The staff at Equus is extremely and genuinely friendly. They offer immaculately clean and tasefully decorated rooms. They are conveniently located in Honolulu between the Ala Moana Mall, downtown Waikiki, and the Waikiki Beaches. Their rates are below the Federal Traveler room rates, making it great choice in any case. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely return in the future.

I came in tired and weary from an overnight flight at 10-30am and they immeditately and without fuss allocated me my room at no extra cost, despite the fact that check in is adevertised as 2 or 3pm. The room was large with the best king size bed and great pillows. The shower was a walk in and clean and powerful. There is a good size fridge and coffe maker, with a good selection of coffee and a green tea. A nice touch was a platter with a half pineapple beautifully cut and presented, as well as chocolates. All in all,very comfortable and really friendly staff.Be aware that its a bit of a distance to walk to the beach. Because of the open balconies, it can be noisy with traffic as its on the main road out of town. However it does go quieter at night. There is a flight of stairs up to the lobby, about 20 steps, but the friendly staff are around to assist with heavy suitcases.

A great value hotel in a great location with so friendly staff. Easy walk to shopping at Ala Moana, or to the beach and a short trolley/bus ride to the main Waikiki beach.No restaurant or bar but good food options close by (e.g. Red Lobster right across the street) and the new Waikiki micro-brewery is a few minutes walk away. Room was a decent size with a king size bed, All very clean and comfortable. The decent size TV, fridge and Keurig coffee maker covered our needs. Almost silent air-conditioning and a decent temperature shower. Be aware the aircon and some lights will only work when your key card is in the wall - this is deliberate, of course, to save power when you leave the room - I prefer hotels with this sort of green policy.The real selling point of this hotel is that it prides itself on friendliness, the front desk wish you good morning every day, and welcome you back every evening. The maid is friendly and even the guy at the car valet came over to chat and share his passion for customised motorbikes while we waited for our airport shuttle. Combine that with its really great value rates - I suspect far, far cheaper than the Ililakai almost directly opposite, and this makes a great base to explore Waikiki, Honolulu and Oahu itself (for example, the Pearl Harbour bus stops just a couple of minutes walk away).Wifi was particularly good in the room but lots of access points across the hotel all with the same password so our phones always connected to the strongest. Negatives - well as folk have mentioned there are steps up from the street but there was always someone on hand top carry our bags, so no problem. Slow lift - yes, it was slow and sometimes we might have had to wait probably as much as 3 minutes - no big deal. We had a small lanai (patio) but views weren't spectacular but then again you are definitely not paying the price of panoramic ocean views!If we ever get the opportunity to go back to Honolulu then we'd have no hesitation in booking the Equus again.

Queenie was an absolute delight! She is a shining jewel and her smile is like a fragrant Hawaiian lei. Her welcoming manner and care to make us comfortable was accurate precursor to how we were treated for the ten day stay. Although some of the furnishings in the spacious rooms (with plenty of plugs for electronics) are a bit tattered, the staff works to keep the place tidy and maintained--the brass on the entrance steps was polished each day. (By the end of each day the efforts to keep a shine were thwarted.)Those steps are a bit of a problem managing luggage to the front desk, although the staff is usually available to assist. The valet parking is also a bit of a bother and expense...$25 a day. Nevertheless the attendants are gazelle like in their eagerness to retrieve the vehicle. The shaded pool is more hot tub.Near Ala Moana shopping, the Hilton and Waikiki; convenient but a bit noisy due to traffic. A nearby restaurant, Snappers, offers a $ 3.99 complete breakfast.

Im a Hawaii Resident and I was scheduled to an early pre-natal check up at the Women and children Hospital near this property, so me and my fiancé decided to go one day before the appointment to relax and to be able to get a little extra sleep that morning. The Equus staff was super friendly and accommodating. They offered us Hawaii resident discounted price, which was very helpful to us, plus they allowed us to have an extended late check out that allowed me to rest a little before our flight back to Maui, which was really needed after my long day at the hospital. It was my fiancé's first time at the Equus and he was very happy with the hotel, the room was super clean, remodeled, and extremely comfortable. We had diner right across the street at Red Lobster, it was yummy! We were so close to A La Moana shopping center that we walked there to shop a little and have lunch. We will definitely stay at the Equus again and I totally recommend it! :-)

Six of us, all adults and family members stayed in Equus on April 9th and 10th and again after a cruise we were there one night on April 18th. Qweenie from front desk and all other staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, pleasant and eager to help the customers. The hotel is situated in the center of all, assesslble to restaurants, bus stops and Ala Moana Center. Few minutes walk to the beach. Rooms are clean, quite roomy, nothing to complaint about except you have to climb up to the hotel lobby from street level.

My company has been using the Equus for a few years now and we've seen some decent changes here. Normally I'd complain about valet parking, but with such limited spots it actually makes sense. I suggested to the manager, however, they have some type of sign up if the valet needs to step away for whatever reason - otherwise you may find yourself waiting and getting annoyed.Staff at this hotel has always been very good - they have some tenure there, so its not just some high school kid working part time. One even recognized me from 3 years ago (and I should disclose one of their staff worked for me 6 years ago and I trained her - the fact she works here part time is only mere coincidence). The rooms have been redone since the Polo days - very VERY comfortable beds, new countertops in the bathrooms and kitchenette area (coffee maker/fridge), and it appears each room has its own wifi router now. The bathrooms have been redesigned as best as you can for a classic Hawai'i hotel - I can't complain, they make it work... just wish I had a larger shower.Getting in and out of Equus is quite easy - especially when you come to Honolulu for work and NOT vacation. I somehow made it to our office at the airport in less than 17 minutes one day, and I didn't run anyone over or run red lights! The closeness to the marina & Ala Moana Mall is very appealing.So if you are coming to Honolulu for business, I strongly recommend the Equus so you don't have to deal with all the tourists on Kalakaua or Kuhio. I've stayed at the Wyland/Courtyard as well and that adds 20 minutes to my commute! The hotel will deliver exactly what it promises, and its remarkably underpriced for the value. If you are a tourist - easy in and easy out. Its not on the beach, but neither are 80% of the rooms in Waiks. Restaurants are close, and you'll learn a lot about Hawai'i's history on the walls - courtesy of the Bishop Museum. ABC Store & McDonalds is 2 blocks away, Ala Wai canal just a skip away, and short walk to Ala Moana mall and restaurants.

Nicely furnished room, and theme. Rate was excellent. Staff was very friendly and very helpful. Hotel does not have restaurant or bar, but is very conventionally located. Thursdays and Fridays they had complementary Mia Tia's on the patio. These were made from scratch and by far the best Mia Tia I had during the entire 2 weeks in Hawaii.

Great boutique hotel. My wife and I (33 years and 37 years) loved the Equus. Great location - perfectly placed in Waikiki and close to Ala Moana. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We will definitely be back!

The location of The Equus Hotel makes it ideal for experiencing Waikiki city centre. I have stayed here four times during my journeys via Honolulu in the last three months. Surrounded by attractions within reach and easy access to most facilities by walking distance. Directly opposite to Lobster restaurant and The Stakehouse and also two minutes walk to the ABC store where you can get all traveller's needs including packaged meals, toiletries, drinks, gifts and you name it!The Ala Moana Shopping Centre and Wallmart are just 5 to 10 minutes walk away where you can get most things.Concerning the hotel herself, the beds are plush, comfortable and the rooms are ambient and quiet. You will surely have a real good night sleep! The staff are great and they are ever ready to help you at the 24 hours desk. You can even warm up your meal in their microwaves in the middle of the night. There is a fridge and television in each room and an ensuite toilet and shower or bath. If you like walking, the pedestrians walkways are great around The Equus and you can walk kilometres too keep fit and healthy on the wide walkways without being affected by the traffics. What more? book your holidays and when next you are in Honolulu, make sure you are staying at the Equus Hotel!

The Equus Hotel is a cute boutique hotel located on the outskirts of Waikiki. The location is great and in walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park and Ala Moana Shopping Center. We walked to the shopping center and had dinner and did some shopping. It was a really nice walk to and from the hotel. The beds were very comfortable and there were a lot of towels, which I appreciated. I usually have to ask for extra towels at other hotels. There is no ramp or elevator leading to the building so you have to carry your bags up a set of stairs. But overall, we enjoyed our stay and the staff was very pleasant.

Lovely hotel, roughly 15 minutes walk from the beach and the heart of Waikiki. Roughly 20 minute drive from Honolulu airport. The rooms are very nice with super comfy beds. The staff are also very kind, helpful & friendly and provide excellent service. Thank you so much! :)

This email is a look lovely little hotel at the edge of Waikiki by the ala moana beach park, mall and the marina. The check in was super fast, we were expected. Extra coffee and towels were plentiful and supplied quickly..Upon checkout in I dropped my wallet in my room.. I only discovered this after my hour drive home and called the desk. Ramon at the desk was super quick to send the houseman to search for it and secure it at the front desk for me. Ramon was very helpful and Queenie was super helpful too. I will stay here again.

Hotel was easy to find. And i was very happy to find how clean and updated this hotel was because of the GREAT prices. Its also close to restaurants, beach and bars in Waikiki.the staff was exceptional as well- lots of ALOHA ! My family and I will be returning again soon

We booked a room for a week stay as we were moving to Oahu. At checkin they charged us for one night of our stay. Then double billed us for the entire stay. This over billing put our credit card over the limit. When we discovered the error we went to the front dedk to get this fixed. At first Poki said they would never overbill a customer, it was impossible and that I was mistaken. I offered to show him the proof thru my bank and at that point he printed off my account and saw the billing errors. He assured me he would get it taken care of. I spoke to a manager Rene when I was ready to check out as nothing had been done for me. She said "we would never do this". Again I had to prove what I was saying. She said she would take care of this ASAP. I checked my bank again the next day and nothing done. Called in and asked to speak to Rene and was informed she was on her days off. I then spoke with the GM Mariah. She also said "this never happens". I had her pull up my file so she could see it for herself. She stated she would contact Rene at home, find out had done and get back with me. Mariah called back and said she would contact the credit card company but that it usually takes 3 to 5 business days to correct. Meanwhile here I am trying to move into a permanent place with all my money tied up in hotel,expenses. I asked for and received $40 so I could had up my rental car in order to return it. Four days after my contact with Poki my card was credited with 2 of the 4 charges. I called and asked why they had reversed only 2 and was told they at least wanted to give us something. Still waiting for all my refunds. Now about the housekeeping staff; comfy bed and clean towels, however the mugs that we used to fix tea in were cleaned out by rinsing them out in the bathroom sink and then drying them with a room towel. Ever heard of a dishwasher that sanitizes your dishes? The noise from the street was horrendous. The seals for the sliding glass door and the room entry door were nonexistint. There was a 1" gap around the room entry door and the sliding glass door tracks were damaged and could not close properly. Their wifi and TV reception was lbad. When trying to download docs what should have taken minutes took hours. The tv was broken more than it was on. Each time I shut it off it would not turn back on. I called for repairs and they would jiggle the cable wires till it came back on. Ended up leaving it on. The valets parked my car under a tree or overhang and it got covered with bird excrement. They did not have anything to clean it off with nor did they offer to do so. Stay here at your own risk!

My fiancee and i stayed at the equus last weekend, as we were celebrating a friend's birthday and didn't want to drive home. I've stayed here several times and its always so nice. I recommend it to everyone! Its a small family run operation and it just feels happy and cozy. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The manager is very sweet and goes out of her way to make the guests happy. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. So comfortable we decided to stay a second night!! (The beds are super comfy) We were able to walk from the hotel to ala moana for shopping and into Waikiki for fun. Very convenient location. Easy to get on the freeway as well. I'll definitely be staying there again for my next staycation.

I stayed at the Equus Hotel during my most recent trip to Honolulu and was very impressed. The room was nice and attention to detail in its layout and finish was terrific. The bed was very comfortable and shower was great. The location on the edge of Waikiki was great for shopping, touring the island and accessing nightlife. Best of all the staff was very friendly and helpful. Be sure to say hi to Puka behind the front desk and Zach at the concierge desk. Both were very helpful and made us smile. Great stay.

i needed a place to stay that was not terribly far from the airport. The Equus was decently priced for the location. The room was clean, bathroom with step in shower very clean and nice and window view interesting. I'd stay there again if I get to Honolulu in the future. Also, the place is in walking distance to the ala Moana shopping mall and the Chart House restaurant across the street around the corner.

We stayed for 6 nights. The staff at reception desk were very friendly and assisted in getting a room cleaned up in a very short time so that we could have some some rest after a long overnight flight that arrived early in the morning.Rooms are clean and tidy. Nice location. Plenty of eating places within walking distance. Local bus stop is close by that is handy to travel around Honolulu with a flat fare of $2.50.Travel agent desk was very helpful to put us into guided tour around the island that was excellent.

My husband and I stayed here for spring break. Great staff and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The location is perfect. It was close enough to Waikiki area hotels and shopping, but far enough away that we don't get the wall-to-wall people walking around the streets. Most of the places we wanted to go to are within walking distance and the public transportation and trolleys are within a block from the hotel. We took public transportation to visit Pearl Harbor from the hotel. If the public transportation is not your style, there's always Uber. I would definitely come back to this hotel anytime I visit the island Oahu.

I've worked with the great staff at the Equus in Honolulu for the past 5 years booking rooms for my outer-island staff when they fly to Honolulu for meetings. Although we have Corporate Accts. w/several other larger hotels, the Equus is always my choice for hotel rooms when my outer-island staff come to Honolulu. Aside from the Equus having great, Kamaaina rates, for a small boutique hotel it can't be beat! My staff say rooms are always immaculate, and the staff are amazing.I decided to do a overnight "Staycation" for my bday and although I've always booked my staff to stay at the Equus I never had the opportunity to stay myself. Well, let's just say it was such an awesome experience from check-in to check-out! The hotel room was very roomy, very clean, and the little, personal touches (towels shaped like animals, etc.) were fantastic. The afternoon maitai session was also a great treat and allowed us to mingle w/other hotel guests - - great touch.However, what I feel to be the greatest asset are your staff!!!!! From the moment I checked in - the bellman was just great. The Front Desk, Mr. Puka Palenapa was such a pleasure - very helpful and so much aloha - gave us some tips on great places to eat nearby, taxi info. etc. Next, your Guest Services Manager, Rene Kahumoku, also shared her aloha and made sure we knew if we needed anything to just give them a call. Being a Kamaaina and having stayed at several hotels in Waikiki (some pretty pricey ones too), one thing I know is you can't teach the "aloha" spirit. Your staff, from the valet, to the bellman, to housekeeping, to your Managers, really seem to love their jobs - - and it shows in how they treat the guests. I'm already looking into my next "staycation" because staying there is like staying with family and friends. MAHALO FOR A GREAT BDAY STAYCATION!Kori G.

Stayed here for two nights and got a good deal on the room. Staff was friendly, room comfortable, and the location very convenient. A very nice, updated property. Price has gone up lately, so not as budget-easy as it used to be.

Excellent overnighter with close friends. From check in to check out we had an excellent experience with Renee and Puka. They offered free maitais on Friday which was an awesome touch. The room was very clean and beautiful. I loved it. We had some drinks in the room and dinner right next door. It was wonderful evening. My friends and I had a blast.

very nice staff and great location near to the mall and Waikiki very nice accomodations and staff was always ready to help, nice room very cozy, would stay there again, loved the entire staff and there hospitality

We spent four very enjoyable nights here. The staff made us feel very welcome. The location is so convenient that there was no need to rent a car. Beaches, reasonably-priced restaurants (for Waikiki), and shopping are all within a few blocks. From the nearby bus stops, we took buses directly to Pearl Harbor and Diamond Head. The concierge arranged for our snorkeling trip, which included transportation. Coming from Chicago, it was wonderful not having to deal with traffic and parking.

The Equus is a great place to stay for a variety of reasons. It starts at the beginning, the front desk personnel of Renee and Puka were friendly and helpful. The rooms and the bathrooms are clean and fresh. The beds are comfortable. But it is also being at the beginning of Waikiki, just a hop skip and a jump to so many places. Their is dining, fine dining, convenient ABC store, coffee shops, the Ala Moana Beach park for running and Ala Moana Shopping Center for shopping. It is close drive or cab to Downtown Honolulu for work or into the heart of Waikiki for fun and pleasure. Yummy MaiTai' s on Friday is a plus. Lots of reasons to stay. The only draw back is the one elevator, but there is a stairwell for those willing to get some exercise.

The Equus was a great place to stay while in Waikiki. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was always clean. The location was just a block off the beach and very convenient to all the restaurants and activities. The parking attendants were the best! We were there with extended family and had several rooms. Everyone was pleased with the accommodations and we would definitely stay at the Equus again.

For work travel, it is 20 minutes to Pearl Harbor in the morning. I felt very comfortable being there for two weeks. The staff was very friendly. The complementary mai tais on Thursday and Friday nights were great and made it easy to meet other guests. Good restaurants within walking distance. If you run, the path around the corner to Ala Wai Blvd is a direct route to Diamond Head without having to cut through all the tourist areas. Nice having fresh fruit, lemon/ice water and paper in the lobby.

This past me th I had the pleasure if staying at The Eqqus Hotel. I love this Hotel because their beds are the coziest but more importantly the staff are so friendly and were right there when I needed them! The room was very pretty and breezy and felt like home! I would rate the hotel cleanliness at 100%, the beds, sheets, floors, bathroom were all very clean! The Hotel is also in a great spot in between Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping center and beach park which made me happy because Ala Moan beach is much bigger and quiter than Waikiki so I get to swim and feel like I'm on a secluded island. I would recommend this Horel who wants a lovely place to come back to after a day of adventuring. Shanna M Farrell

We enjoyed the suite at the Equus hotel and loved the room, comfortable and elegantly designed without being glitzy. We walked everywhere from the location: my wife did some shopping at ala Moana center while I did a few laps every morning around the beach park. Good restaurants nearby, highly recfomend the wailana coffee house, an old school diner. Parking is a little tight but the staff is really friendly and helpful, they also have a valet. Overall a great experience, our 4 month old daughter also gives it a thumbs up.

Our travel agent book this hotel for us. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It is located on a very busy main road so be aware that you will get a lot of traffic noise. If you like shopping there is a beautiful shopping mall called Ala Moana Mall which is about a 10 minute walk. The rooms were comfortable and clean.

If you are a horse lover, this is definitely the place to stay!! Decor is centered around a horse themed boutique hotel and rooms are upgraded, beds are comfortable and the ease of accessibility to and from the hotel is nothing but easy! The rooms include a fridge, Keurig coffee/tea and biodegradable toiletries! The friendly staff provided warm, friendly, ALOHA SPIRIT service and we will surely be back for another stay!! If you are looking for a cozy, comfortable hotel away from the hustle and bustle this is definitely the place to be! No waiting in long front desk lines or parking miles away. TRULY LOVED this place!

Our 'Aha had the pleasure of partnering with the Equus Hotel, Hawaii Polo Club and Hawai Polo Trail Rides as part of our invitation to represent Hawaiian Horseback Riding (pa'u hololio) in the Opening Day Ceremonies at the Mokuleia Polo Field. We had the honor of staying two nights at the Equus and Marina Tower in preparation for our participation in the Event. From the point of arrival meeting the Valet Team, to check in, housekeeping services, engineering and continuing throughout our stay, the staff was warm and welcoming, quick to respond to any inquiries we had, and very much interested in what we were going to doing during our visit. Having one room with a kitchen in the Marina Tower was very helpful in feeding our many volunteers and riders. We received a set of connecting rooms on the ground floor of the Equus which was helpful in getting our team organized without having to jump into any elevators. They accommodated our vehicles in one organized location which allowed us the ability to move freely as we needed to be able to leave the property if need be to gather supplies. The staff in all areas were preshifted about us before we arrived and were well prepared for our visit. All introduced themselves to us as they encountered us individually during our stay. Overall, they seem very happy to work there and it shows in the time they take to write personal welcome notes to all arrivals. We respected the fact that they are also energy efficient and was very impressed by the care they took in ensuring guests were well informed of how those features worked in the room. All in all, we were hosted with an enormous amount of Aloha, freely given by all team members we were fortunate enough to meet. The rooms are neat, clean and very beautifully decorated in the equestrian theme and the warm and welcoming staff made our stay quite comfortable. It was like being with friends and family and we are very much looking forward to visiting them again soon. We look forward to a continued partnership with Equus and our weekend event couldn't have gone any better! Mahalo Team Equus for a Fabulous Stay! The spirit of Ho'okipa (Hospitality) is alive and well and may it continue to be with you with other guests that you host in the future! Love and Aloha, the Riding Society of 'Aha Pulma Pa'u Hololio

Good central location in Waikiki, welcoming friendly staff. Rooms toward the front however do pick up some traffic noise. Island tours and events can be easily booked in the reception area. Plenty of choice of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance.

We have been staying at the Equus Hotel at Waikiki since 2011 and think it is so homey and comfortable. Just 10 stories high but located in a great site across from the Red Lobster and easy walking distance to the Hilton Village beach (great snorkeling) or the Ala Moana Mall. The rooms we get have a comfortable King bed, nice linen, great bathroom & shower, luxury towels and a nice balcony. Rene & Puka always insure that our every need is taken care of like we were family. They even have free WiFi so we can send home daily email with pictures. There is an ABC store at the corner to make shopping easy. For us, there is no better place to stay at Waikiki!!!

Great for accessing the trolley service, very very comfy bed one of the best I have stayed in and room was very nice, the hotel itself is quiet but the only thing you need to be aware of is the traffic noise if you are in a low floor that's towards the front of the hotel. It can be very loud and constant at night. I didn't use any other services offered by the hotel and would stay again but further back from the road.

We stayed at this boutique hotel on our way to and back from a trip to Palau. We chose it based upon reviews and price and it suit our needs quite well. Located a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach on a fairly busy street it was nonetheless low key, clean, reasonable and adequate. All of the staff were friendly and helpful, assisting us with our heavy dive bags up and down the flight of stairs, printing out our boarding passes, and answering all of our questions. Rooms were on the small size, but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine and included lots of nice amenities. With the AC running, the windows closed, and the use of earplugs noise was minimized and we slept fine. We walked to the beach and to nearly restaurants for a few meals, and took the airport shuttle to and from the hotel easily. I would certainly stay here again if circumstances were necessary for a layover.

Yes,I knowit doesn't have a grand entrance, it's it splashy or impressive like the huge resortso the beach but let me tell you what it lacks in the curb appeal it more than makes up for i the other services! WE were greeted by a chilled glass of pineapple or guava juice. Our friendly bellman brought our bags up to our very modern and clean room that had all the ammenities you need: keurig coffee maker with teas and coffee and tiny delicious cookies, large toiletries and refrigerator. Comfy bed and nice furniture. Excellent location for walking to beach, marina and shops and restaurants on Waikiki beach! They do not have a restaurant on site, but do have delivery service if you can't find what you want. From the myriad of restaurants. They do have a small pool and reception area, but you will probably go to the beach. Interestingly, they have a concierge service that will text you the advice or answers that you seek and on thursday and Friday evenings they have a manager guest reception. I would recommend this hotel for the budget traveller who doesn't want to break the bank on their room budget. Thanks!

From the Time I drove up to valet parking,checking in the staff has been extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms are very spacious and clean.was so nice having a keurig In my room with me being a avid coffee drinker! The staff was also great about recommending places to see and giving directions. 5stars!!!!!!!!! I will most definitely stay here next time I come to hawaii!

The Equus hotel is a good holiday stay for people looking to get out and about. The rooms are comfortable with a good standard of facilities for the star rating (3 stars). Do not expect too much and you will be satisfied. The Pro's;Good pricing (~$150 AUD online)Close to Alo Moana shopping centre (less then 5 minutes walk)Free paper can be collected from the lobbyBe aware (could be an issue for you but it was OK for me);Street noise from Alo Moana Bvd (easily addressed by closing balcony door and turning on the air conditioning)Steps to lobby as noted by other reviewers (I found the steps easy to climb even when lifting two cases and youi can always pay the staff to do it for you)The hotel is lightly staffed. There is check-in staff plus one or two others looking after other duties. So if you want that 'cared for' experience this may not be your type of hotel.About 30-40 minute walk to Waikiki beach shopping area (much less to the beach at the Hilton Hawiian Village or the other beach near Alo Moana centre)

Just returned from an 8 night visit to The Equus Hotel. This is a small but conveniently located "boutique" hotel, within easy walking distance to Ala Moana Mall, an ABC store, and Waikiki Beach. All of the staff were very accommodating, especially Jason and Queenie. Our room was on the top floor with a small view of the ocean between buildings! Only complaint was the noisy traffic, although it didn't disrupt our sleep. Another downside was the tiny pool, which I never saw anyone swim in. The bed and pillows were great, the room was spacious and clean, with a refrigerator and coffee maker, sitting area, and good water pressure in the shower. The one elevator was sometimes a little slow, but no problem, and whenever we wanted ice or extra coffee, we were taken care of. There are free Mai Tai's on Thursday and Friday happy hour, and a chance to visit with other guests. The hotel will supply beach mats, chairs, umbrellas and towels for your whole visit. (Very nice!!) We walk alot so the trek to Waikiki with our supplies wasn't too much of an issue, but the better beaches are at the far end from this location, so we did hop on a bus a couple of times. Also took the bus to Hanauma Bay one day, and to Diamond Head for a hike on another. (I recommend going EARLY to both places, expecially the hike!) Rented a car one day to explore the island. Beautiful beaches within a half hour drive. Weather was perfect, especially compared to the rest of the USA, and we will definitely consider another February trip! We will also consider this hotel again.

This is a budget hotel so it's not fancy. The rooms are fine. Nice King bed, a flatscreen tv with lots of cable channels, and AC. The hotel is green in that you must have your room key plugged into the device in the room in order for the AC to work. I like that. The shower in our room leaked and it was kind of annoying to hear the dripping at night while we were trying to sleep. Also the pool is really not a pool. It is tiny and out of the sun and no one used it while we were there. But the location of the hotel is great. It's a super short walk to the beach behind the Ilikai and the beach at Magic Island. Its about a 15 minute walk to Waikiki beach. The Ala Moana shopping center is just down the street. Definitely a good pick if you are on a budget.

Nice king beds.. Refrigerator/freezer. Nice tv. Nice towels. Good AC. Great free internet. Great location for Convention Center or Mall. Those are good points. Noisy til 10:30 pm from street and noisy again at 7:30 am. Not bad though. Not clean. Shower had not been deep cleaned in months. Mold in grout No soap dish in shower??? Scummy! Wear flip flops. Since it is part of choice hotels it should have their great pillows. It didn't. Furniture is old rustic. I get the theme. It doesn't work. No real dresser. No desk. A table. Odd. The pool is for eye candy. No one uses it. No sun on it!

Staff was extremely friendly and comforting, will come back again!! They gave us a free upgrade to the suite because of Valentine's Day! There is valet and they are energy efficient as well. I was definitely blown away during my stay.

This was the first time that we stayed at this hotel. We had a end unit room on Ala Moana Blvd and you could hear the traffic at night and the maids in the morning getting their carts out from the storage room.The room was pretty with horse photos and books around, we had two beds which were comfortable except for the hard pillows, I requested down pillows but we had the grandma kind of hard rock pillows.They have a small refrigerator/freezer, no microwave, a Kerig coffee maker.There is no tub for soaking but a small triangle shower.The toilet sounds like you are in a public restroom very loud flushing.They have a small lobby for seating and a small dipping pool on the side of the building.Valet parking only and the driveway is very small you might miss it.You must put your key card in the slot to have the lights and air conditioning to work. Energy saver in place.Overall I would stay here again but bring my own pillows.

The location for this hotel is great...very close to a bus line so you can get to a number of locations (Iolani Palace, Art Museum, Waikiki) without any changes. There are a number of eating places around, although you have to search a bit. The room was very fine...everything clean and nice.The BIG problem is the noise. There is a Lanai, but only with a single-pane door so noise from outside is not well insulated. While none of the rooms overlook the street, it is close with 24-hour noise. We were on the next-to-top floor (8 I think?) and furthest from the street. I'm not sure if close to the ground would be any better.

This hotel is very old. The furniture has been replaced with antique looking pieces, but the AC and Bathroom seem original. The rooms are clean and the bed comfortable. Nothing in the way of things to do at the property. The pool is about the size of my truck. If you just want a place to sleep this this is a low cost alternative.

very nice clean and family owned hotel on Waikiki Beach enjoyed our stay with them for 3 days prior to cruising the islands the staff is very friendly and helpful in anything you may need. the hotel is trying to maintain the original Hawaiian feel in maintaining garden style rooms

This review was originally posted on my blog: http://onesleepymommy.weebly.com/home/hotel-review-the-equus-hotel-oahu-hawaiiI had the opportunity to visit a place some people call paradise on earth. Hawaii is definitely beautiful from the air, and even more so on the ground. Oahu, being one of many islands of Hawaii, offers a balanced mix of city life and rugged countryside. This time I, my husband, and my toddler stayed in The Equus Hotel; a charming boutique hotel on Waikiki’s Upper West Side.We were greeted with Aloha from every member of the staff. Upon check in, we were served refreshing chilled fresh juice. The check in process was fast. After signing some forms, I was given the key to the room and we got a beautiful lei made of shells as a souvenir.I enjoyed the theme of the hotel. The name “Equus” is derived from the word “equestrian”, which is featuring horseback riding. Equus Hotel is keeping true to the theme with Ralph Lauren-inspired details throughout.What we love about Equus Hotel:Strategically locatedThe hotel is close to Ala Moana Center, the largest open air mall in world. It took us less than 10 minutes walk to the mall. It is also close enough to the center of Waikiki where you can swim in the ocean, wine and dine under the stars, or just stroll around the stores. It is nice to be able to go to places within walking distance. My toddler enjoyed the walk and she was happy she was not stuck in a car.Energy efficientI liked this display on the reception desk that shows how to turn on the AC in the guest room. You need to insert your room key to a slot in the wall in order for the AC to run. The AC will be turned off when you remove the room key from the slot and leave the room. This is a great initiative to save energy.Sealed toiletriesAnother great initiative by Equus Hotel is their biodegradable earth-friendly amenities. I am impressed that they seal the toiletries bottles to ensure they are new and never been used. The leftover toiletries are donated to shelters and recycled into other products.Unique detailsEquus Hotel put details in the guest room that I didn’t find in other hotels. The staff artfully folded some towels into animal shapes. This is great for entertaining little kids. My toddler had a good time holding the “duck” and pointing at the “swan.” It put a smile on my face the moment I entered the room and saw these cute animal shaped towels.Popular brewing techAnother nice surprise was the Keurig mini brewing system in every room. It is so easy to use. You can bring your favorite K-cup pod and brew it in the comfort of your room! To satisfy your sweet tooth, they provide you mini cookies to go with your coffee or tea. Or you can share the cookies with your little ones. They always appreciate sweets.Towels, towels, and more towelsI stayed at many hotels before, and a couple of times I had to call the housekeeping and asked for extra towels. But at Equus Hotel, that didn’t happen. They provide the guests with plenty of towels. There were probably 16 towels with various sizes in the room that we stayed in. Those are great if you stay with little kids, as “messy” is their middle name.Affordable in-room diningWhen I stay in a hotel, I am always curious about their in-room dining. I rarely order any food from hotel because their price is usually astronomical ($25 for a simple breakfast, anyone?). Here at Equus Hotel, the in-room dining price is very reasonable. They are even cheaper than some restaurants outside of the hotel. So, the next time your little ones get hungry and ask for a meal, or if you want to snack on something, you don’t have to feel guilty when you order from their menu.CribThey do provide a crib. Just ask, and they will set it up for you. Now, don’t think about a crib with metal bars and curved tops. It is a simple travel crib. The kind that you see in baby store. It does the job and helped my toddler to get the rest she needed.Text for anythingI love to text. I text more than I call. When I learned that Equus Hotel has a number that you can text when you need anything during your stay at the hotel, I was all over it! I had to wait for the crib, so I texted them that I hadn’t gotten the crib set up yet. Within seconds, they responded. It keeps the communication going between guests and the staff. You can also send them a text and ask them about things to do around the island, even when you are not in the hotel. I love this feature a lot.Deal packagesEquus Hotel offers several deals, e.g. business deal, advance booking deal, per diem deal, and fashionista deal. Check back often because they change the deals every now and then. We stayed with the fashionista package, and the deal was awesome. We got $30 Ala Moana Center giftcard, $20 Uber credits, and many more! Very worth it.What’s more from Equus Hotel:If you travel to Oahu and stay at Equus Hotel during polo seasons in April – August, you are in for a treat. Equus Hotel offers complimentary transportation to Hawaii Polo Club in North Shore (the world’s only beachfront polo field), free table at the clubhouse, and two complimentary admission tickets to the polo matches. If you love polo, or if you are curious about it, don’t forget to take advantage of this generous offer.Room for improvement:Though I like the “home away from home” coziness of the hotel, there are several areas that can be improved. Some of them are: flat pillows, very basic shower head, small-sized safe that will not fit a laptop.Another drawback is the steep stairs to go to the entrance of the hotel. Although Equus Hotel makes sure all guests know about this situation by mentioning it in the reservation page, I was still surprised by it. If you travel with kids in stroller, you will need to pick up the stroller and go up many steps.Recommended for:After staying at Equus Hotel and reviewing its features, this wonderful boutique hotel would be suitable for:- People who don’t’ mind the stairs.- People who love horses. They can take advantage of the equestrian experience offered and to travel to Hawaii Polo Club in North Shore. Free of charge!- People who travel light.- Tourists who spend a lot of time outside of the hotel. There are so many things to do close to the hotel location.

Had a blast; staff was supes cordial. Can't wait to go back! The snorkeling, let me tell you...so clear, and blue. I saw jellyfish, sea turtles and when it was all said and done, sipped daquiris straight from big coconuts drink cups. Yes, those exist.

After checking out of this most relaxing accommodation,I could not have expected the ideal location , friendly employee response and professional status. From the valet parking operations personell, to the front desk personell, housekeeping ,management Outstanding! Wonderful, warm friendly feeling allowed me to be as comfortable as if I were in my own home with family!Which of course is what my whole experience meant to me. 5 Star Excellence in my book! Thank. You

Three night stay pre cruise and one night afterwards in January. Lovely hotel. Large rooms with comfortable beds. The delightful Rene and her staff were friendly and helpful. Better location than I imagined when I booked the hotel. Twenty minute of so walk into centre of Waikiki and ten minute stroll to Ala Moana shopping centre which is where you can catch most of the buses to all parts of the island (we didn't want to hire a car on Oahu). Rather carelessly, we left some jewellery in the room. We phoned on discovering our stupidity. The necklace and earrings were returned to us when we got back to the hotel after the cruise. We were so grateful. I wish I could give The Equus more than five stars.

My experience with the hotel was excellent. The staff there was very professional and full of Aloha Puka with front office was very acomidating and he went above and beyond to make sure that my stay was perfect. Jackie Manu with housekeeping was so helpful she answered all my questions regarding shopping and dinning she also made sure that my room was comfortable and I had everything that I need. At check in i was greated by Rene with a huge smile and lots of aloha she was very helpful and very quick with getting me checked in, I've been traveling all day and all I wanted to do was get to my room and get off my feet and Rene made it happen. Thank you so muchEquus Hotel for and Awesome experience in waikiki.It is so Awesome to see that the Aloha spirit still lives in the Hearts of the staff at the EquusWaikiki!

Very unique hotel not like any other they have these bird looking towels to hold the soap in the bathroom swans in the room once you open the door it just puts a smile on your face!!!!! Such good people all around. They sure know how to show the real spirt of Aloha. My maid lorie Ann was to awesome every time she would catch us in the hall wall or elevator she would ask 'you guys need more regular coffee today? " since she knew we loved it after couple times of asking it would already be in our room without no doubt :) the room service we got from day one was more then great. The bell desk was helpful even front desk. We will be sure to always come back here and refer to others.

Located steps away from Honolulu's Ala Moana Shopping Center, not to mention Waikiki beaches, this hotel is perfectly nestled in the heart major attractions and restaurants (Outback and Red Lobster directly across the street). Moreover, considering the price (for an 8 day stay, we paid under $1,000), there are no competitors worthy of comment. A family owned/operated business, the staff are exceptionally friendly, responsive, and helpful. The only criticisms we have are relatively minor, specifically, no microwave over, noisy (sounds of traffic die down later at night), and unheated pool. To be sure, this is a "no frills" facility, which was fine for us considering, again, the very reasonable price. Would we stay here again? Definitely YES, assuming the price remains reasonable.

Amazing location, service and price...all with Aloha! From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we were treated exactly like family. The facilities are kept up nicely and the staff are all not just friendly but truly emoting sincere heartfelt Aloha!

My husband and I started our vacation in Hawaii with a two-night stay in Honolulu. We arrived on a Saturday so we could attend the 8am worship service in Hawaiian at St. Andrews Cathedral. I searched for a hotel with a convenient location to the cathedral, with parking, and discovered The Equus Hotel. We arrived, quite tired, after a full afternoon of sightseeing, and the staff was very friendly, patient, welcoming and understanding. Everyone was helpful and offered many suggestions for places to eat and see. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The location in Waikiki was perfect for us. We needed to leave for the airport before valet parking officially opened in the morning, but that was no problem for the staff, who accommodated us by parking our car in a location that afforded a quick departure. We were at the airport in less than 20 minutes. I highly recommend this hotel.

This was our first trip back in over 20 years and as much as there are a lot of changes...being tons of people and high rises all over the place, it was really comforting knowing that the "Ohana" at Equus were there to take care of us! From Queenie to Ramon and Rene....they made our trip! We actually booked on-line to stay at the Marina Towers but unfortunately, that was not a good experience. Heading back to the lobby at the Equus, my wife was in tears and Ramon was quick to offer us a room there. They quickly took us to the room and the vacation started! A cute, clean room with a wonderful king size, comfy bed. As we just wanted a nice place to sleep and be in the heart of things, the Equus was just perfect. Even-though it was a bit loud at night due to the busy Ala Moana street, one can expect this with being in a busy city. Wifi was good and there was a mini fridge and Kurig coffee machine which they replenished daily. We did know about the valet parking and the guys were great...Kapu, Nick, Aaron and Eli. We want to thank the staff very much and hope to see you again in the near future! Mahalo!

The staff here are what make this hotel stand out among the rest. I have never met such friendly, helpful and accommodating people. For the manager, Rene, and all her staff, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are clean and spacious, the beds comfortable and the dark wood furniture elegant. It is opposite the harbor, which is delightful to walk around, well located for Ala Moana shopping center, park and beach and also close to Waikiki. Surrounded as it is by high-rise condos and hotels, this charming, renovated, ten-story boutique hotel is an oasis.

After researching, we decided to stay here,and were not disappointed. Literally a 5 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping centre.Staff were very friendly, pointed us in the right direction when we wanted advise etc. Room was clean, but I found the constant noise from the fan in the bathroom was irritating, though once asleep, I stayed asleep. Just depends on what you're used to. Some can't sleep in a quiet room. They stored our bags for the day when we checked out in the morning, as we had a very late night flight. When we arrived to collect our bags at 6pm after sightseeing all day, all we wanted was a shower and change of clothing, as we were flying to Canada that night and knew it would be a long time before our next one.Even though I knew that was impossible, we were offered the use of the toilet in the lobby which contained a good supply of clean handtowels and soap. We were able to freshen up and change our clothing before our flight. Highly appreciated.

We had a nice 2 room suite on 10th floor, which worked out well since we were there with my daughter and 94-year old father-in-law. The price was high but location was good. 10-floor hotel is dwarfed by many high-rises that have built up along Ala Moana. Staff was accommodating to carry Grandpa in his wheel-chair from parking place to second floor elevator. Wish things were more wheel-chair friendly in Honolulu.

Small hotel but such great people who shares a lot of ALOHA! Felt so much aloha from the staff from the moment Me and my family stepped foot on Equus . You pay for what you get . They have such cute little duckie birdies to hold your soap me and my family thought it was to creative we LOVED our room attendant Loire Ann who always made our stay feel like we was well taken care of . she always made our room nice and clean we never had a doubt to come back to our room being disappointed. She knew how to keep a smile on with a lot to say when we needed answers or just to chit chat a few with her . We are glad we came to Equus !! We will be back again .

In being very disappointed with our booking in the Marina Towers, Equus offered us a room in their boutique hotel. The room was small, but clean. We had a balcony facing the busy Ala Moana blvd. You need earplugs to sleep as the constant noise from the road will keep you up. The staff were awesome. They were always willing to help. They gave directions, chatted with us and helped us with our bags. Always with a smile. They had the true Hawaiian spirit. Our room had a king size bed, air conditioning, a balcony and clean bathroom. The rain shower head was great after spending the day at the beach. Our Keurig machine helped us start off our day with great coffee. We had TV as well to wind down our day. I never saw any bugs and used our mini fridge for perishables.

Lovely bedroom and beautiful bathroom which had a hairdryer. The only downside is that the windows are so thin and we were overlooking a very busy main road. The staff were great, very approachable and friendly. We found the location to be perfect, as it was maybe a 20 minute walk to the beach, 2 minute walk to the shops and had lovely restaurants and a couple of bars close by. The beauty of it was that our favourite bar (Snappers) was a lot cheaper than the ones along the beach. Also every Friday there is a stunning firework display a short walk away. People took picnics, drinks etc and made a night of it! Ask at the hotel when they serve the complimentary mai tais! :-)

It was simply a pleasure to stay in this elegant (yet relaxed) boutique hotel in Honolulu. The location is great and the staff were friendly and helpful at all times. We loved the equestrian theme of the hotel and of our room - paintings, photographs, statues (well who doesn’t like horses!) which gave the hotel a unique and personal flavour. Too often, hotels appear tired... while everything about The Equus feels fresh and contemporary- it is clearly meticulously maintained. The hotel’s commitment to ‘green’ amenities, including biodegradable products etc is laudable and we are all for it.We had a very comfortable, luxurious and relaxed stay at The Equus.Aloha... we will see you again one day.

We booked this hotel through Hotwire, so I get it..you get what you get. The location is good, if you've rented a car. There are a few shops in the area to pick up water, snacks and light breakfast items. The beds are small and very uncomfortable! The windows are thin glass so if your room overlooks the Ala Moana, good luck sleeping. The constant traffic and late night tourists keep the noise levels very high. The staff were nice enough, but I wouldn't say they went out of their way to be helpful. But the housekeeping was awful. The first morning they tidied and made our beds, the second they just threw the blankets across the end of our beds, leaving half the pillows on the floor. If I had to pay full price for our stay (399/night) I would be even more harsh on this review. Certainly not worth that much, hardly worth what we paid.

The Equus boutique hotel in Honolulu is a treasure. Perfectly located for shops, beaches and restaurants and night-life, it is beautifully decorated, with a polo/equestrian theme. This places oozes style and charm. The staff are attentive, warm and helpful - they work as a close-knit team and all our needs were anticipated - we felt very welcome.Our room was elegant and comfortable with a well-equipped bathroom (and a shower with enough pressure for two at a time :-) We loved the location, we walked everywhere, and it felt like coming home, at the end of the day. Thanks to the great team at the The Equus, who made our stay so pleasant and who welcomed us so warmly. Pretty sure we’ll be back !!

Our one night at The Equus was a gorgeous experience.We were privileged to sleep in the spacious one-bedroom suite, while our friends were in a room with a King size bed, and this room, though without the separate living/dining/kitchen area we enjoyed, looked as elegant and charming as ours. The Equestrian / Ralph Lauren inspired decor is stylish and sophisticated, but without ostentation. The rooms are above all, luxuriously comfortable, and the bed... well, we were asleep the moment our heads dropped onto the sumptuous pillows. We weren’t there long enough to take full advantage of the well-equipped kitchen and the beautifully decorated living/dining room - next time we will stay longer ... The hotel is perfectly located within reach of beaches, shopping and restaurants. The staff are delightful, welcoming and always helpful. The parking below the hotel is a bonus and the attendants took care of our bags from there.We hope to return to Honolulu and The Equus as soon as possible!

Thank you very much for an awesome stay. The bell man was a great help. I think Trevor was his name. Thank you again for everything. I am looking forward to staying at your hotel again in the near future. The employees give such great aloha spirit.

If you are away from the hotel a lot and are just looking for a good night's sleep you may have found your hotel. It has a small footprint, has only one elevator, steps to the reception and a smallish room but the bed is super comfortable and the staff is for the most part fantastic. We only encountered one reception staff member who didn't know what he was doing and housekeeping didn't supply any sugar or clean cups. Most of the reception staff were very friendly and very helpful and this extended to the valet staff. We did have wifi issues but this was solved towards the end of the stay.It's located between the shopping malls to the north and all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki to the South. If you're walker you can even make it to Diamond Head Crater.

My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary last week in Honolulu and we were just surprised by the Aloha spirit that was shown to us by every single person in the Hotel; starting with valet to the front desk and specially the young Rene; a true professional in her approach to helping and making us welcome with a Mai Tai drink in a lovely out door tropical receptionThe location is perfect to the Waikiki beach and shopping area (A la Moana shopping mall)Our room was always made up perfectly We are already planning another trip to Honolulu in January and we will staying at the Equus Hotel again...Good going guys, Aloha and Mahalo!Abel & Christine

To get to the registration desk of this hotel you have to climb up stairs to what is in physical terms the second story, even though they call it the first story. Also the noise level all night long will keep the exhausted person awake, even with the windows closed.

location is awesome, 10 min walk to Waikiki beach, 10-15 min walk to Ala Moana shopping centre, close to restaurants great steak place a couple of blocks down the road. The front desk staff were awesome, really friendly, helpful and ready to please no matter how late we got back from shopping! rooms were nice, beds comfortable, clean, coffee machine, fridge, good bathroom facility and daily housekeeping service. Over all we had a great experience while being very economical.We would stay there again, wouldn't even bother looking for any other place to stay. ABC store on the very next corner great for well, frankly anything you could need, we went there every morning to get our fresh salads for breakfast. sadly we didn't use the pool, lovely area but buildings either side seemed to put the pool in shadow whenever we thought about using,

This hotel is located just one street far from the Waikiki beach. Really very stylish hotel with nice bed and unusual sheeting. Good service, good bathroom with nice amenities, average room size, lanai, TV, refrigerator, tea and coffee maker in the room. Little bit noisy from the main street, but OK. Difficult to park there, however a big parking place is right next the street and for the same price. I think that the service is good for the money, nothing special, but very good place and reasonably priced hotel in actually very expensive area. Really close to all small shops, car rental, as well as walking distance to the big shopping centre. Waikiki beach and the area around it is absolutely amazing. I think really good hotel for the money, close to everything you may need. Rent a car and see the entire Oahu island (one day is OK, plus one day for Pearl Harbor, maybe another day for many excellent places and beaches at the coastline), and enjoy the beach and ocean during the day and shopping, food and the night as much as possible! I'll stay here again.

After much research and deliberation, we chose the Equus for our five nights in Honolulu. No, it didn't serve breakfast, and no, it wasn't situated right smack on Waikiki Beach. Furthermore, it had an odd, horsey decor.But what a wonderful little place it turned out to be! The price was lower than what we found for anything else in the area. The location was excellent --- about 15 minutes on foot to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, a few minutes to numerous different bus stops (including numbers 8, 19, 20, 23, 42, 98A, W1, W2, W3), less than five minutes to a couple of good breakfast spots (Wailana Coffee House, Hiking Hawaii Cafe) and an ABC store, and a couple of blocks from the sea. The desk staff folks were exceptionally warm, welcoming, and helpful. The rooms were very clean, with great beds and nice amenities, including Keurig coffee/tea makers. Other items, such as beach mats, could be borrowed from the front desk.We had only one small nit to pick: The air conditioning was oddly connected to the lights. So when the air conditioner cycled on in the night, some of the lights did, too. With luck, this quirkiness affected only our one room, and hopefully it has been fixed by now.We know where to stay next time we come to Honolulu!

We stayed 3 nights last weekend and enjoyed our stay here. The staff is very customer oriented and friendly.We had a corner room on the street side. It was great to have opening windows on 2 walls.Our room, 701, was good sized. The beds were very comfortable, the bath linens are like new and plenty of them stocked in the room. The shower water pressure was great as well as the temperature. We will stay here again and we were glad to have found it thru the Choice Rewards hotel program.

Does an excellent job w what it offers. Can't match restaurants, etc w the biggies, but it's no more of a walk to a large variety of them than it would be within say the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Rooms are meticulously clean and bountiful fresh linens.

My wife and I have just returned from Honolulu our stay at the Equus was more than we could have wished for. The front desk was very happy and helpful and the rooms were more than adequate with a nice big comfy bed and was clean and well presented. You are literally a stone's throw from the Ala Moana shopping centre and the bus stop was just across the road to take you into the centre of town. This is a great little hotel and we will stay here again next time we in Waikiki

This was our 2nd stay at the Equus. On this visit we had a studio room on the 7th floor.For those who are not aware - there is no ramp leading into this building - you have to drag your suitcase up a set of steps to the front door.Compared to our previous visit (where we stayed on the 10th floor in the suite - see previous review) we did experience some road noise this time.Our room was clean enough, but the small bathroom seemed to be in poor condition with tiles falling off the wall.Overall I would say, good value considering the price of rooms in the Waikiki area. We choose to stay at the Equus as it is within walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping centre and the nice beach. The other plus is that it is a bit outside of the madness of Waikiki and there is easy access to the airport from this locationI would stay here again.

Let me start by the Hotel staff are Amazing! Full of Aloha spirit when you check in! This was my 3rd time back! The rooms are cozy! Beds very comfortable! Fantastic shower pressure! Walking distance to everything Waikiki has to offer! Just steps to the mall! This place truly is a GEM!!! You will not get Aloha/Ohana spirt from other "big hotels" Like the Equus! Also what I love about this hotel is that it is family owned! I love to support local business over chains in a heart beat! Are your bags packed yet? you will Love it! Thank you everyone at the Equus for taking such great care of me! You are all Amazing! I will be back soon! Much love and Aloha!

Stayed here for 2 nights on a work trip. The room was pretty well done up, fully equipped and frequently stocked up. The front office staff were very friendly and most helpful for the duration of my stay. Wifi was excellent, Cable television in the rooms were entertaining enough and when the foldable blinds are drawn....you could almost forget you were in Hawaii. I really appreciated the location of the hotel and the fact that it was central to shopping areas, the Waikiki Beach and other attractions close to town. Highly recommend this place to any working person looking for a nice place to relax after a long day.....especially when you're away from home.

Stayed here for a 3 Day convention. Excellent location in relation to the Honolulu Convention Center. Wish the hotel had a place to eat breakfast.slow elevator and only one.parking was a bit expensive $25.00 per day.

This hotel has a personality of a local, staff who are full of Aloha and amenities I'd expect from a much much more expensive property. Being at 1696 Ala Moana the Equus is only steps away from the ocean, fine restaurants, amazing entertainment offerings across the street and members of their organization who seem to know everyone and answers to ever question we had...where to visit with limited time tomorrow, where to have fine food, what shows are the best, where to buy special leis for other friends who are also staying at the Equus...and not only did they have the best answers, they were able to personally hook us up so everyone, everywhere we went were not only expecting us, but greeted us by name, sat us at reserved tables with our names already on the tables and got us best seats and a drink...they are CONNECTED! It seems like every member of their staff are Gold-Key Concierges...from the greeting Aloha upon check-in to farewell Aloha upon checkout...we always feel like Ohana (Hawaiian for Family)...and we recommend to everyone ... no matter where they've stayed in the past, no matter what other hotel clubs they belong to...the best VALUE is at the Equus. Exemplary

Hidden treasure with top notch customer service. As soon as we arrived we were greeted warmly. Personal attention shown through out our stay. I took advanage of their texting service to ask questions about shopping and restaurant locations, all with prompt personal reply.

This is a very modest hotel. The name explains the "polo decor" in our room.Top floor is best - rooms are a little larger and much quieter. Hotel is located on major artery, and a bus stop is only half a block away. Located near marina, so there is a little view and beach is close by. Room was clean and the bed was very comfortable; bathroom was a bit small; fridge/freezer in room was helpful. No meals provided, but several restaurants are located in close proximity, as well as an ABC store that has foodstuffs and beverages, sundries, souvenirs and ready to eat food. Complimentary mai tais from 5 to 6 PM twice a week in hotel lobby was a nice touch. Parking was available, ($25 per night). Largest outdoor shopping mall in US was within walking distance. No ice machine, but ice is delivered to room quickly after calling front desk. Tour booking stand is located on hotel patio, so it is easy to arrange activities. Pick up point for several activities is within half a block.

This is a great hotel. Not just good but great staff. Room was so inviting and just beautiful furnishings. Bed was large and very comfortable. Small but very Quaint and cozy. Clean and well kept. Second to none. Hotel staff was very customer focused. You could find bigger and more expensive but not better.

Clean, comfortable hotel near downtown, Waikiki, etc. The beds are unbelieveably comfortable--moreso than some upper-scale resorts I've stayed at! Rooms are furnished nicely and the Keurig with a few coffee pods is a nice touch. Would suggest a white-noise machine and/or earplugs as this hotel is downtown along a busy road. I'm a light sleeper and with my white-noise I slept great in this hotel.

My Choice of hotels when traveling on business to Oahu Hawaii. May not be the most luxurious of hotels but I am comfortable, there is a friendly staff and my stay is always a pleasure. Within a short walk to a myriad of attractions and the price is affordable. Unless you are chasing total luxury.. stay here. Yeah, per the reviews, there are stairs from the street to the lobby, the elevator may be a little slow but all else out weighs those whines and cries in my mind. Again, this is my go to when in Oahu when on business as I get lots of rest, I am comfortable and I get my work done in a pleasant, affordable and satisfying environment.

In Honolulu for a week, the first part business, the last vacation. I was treated like family from the first moment I got on the property. Half way through my stay, when Rene found out my lovely lady would be joining me, she upgraded me to a king suite with an ocean view. She also arraigned a bottle of bubbly to be there and chilled when she arrived. Zach, the concierge, arraigned a private horseback ride on the north shore. I could go on and on. The location is great for business travelers. Close to the convention center. Walking distance to almost everything downtown. I will stay here again when in Honolulu. I have found my island family.

my daughter booked the Equus hotel for one night between flights using Choice points-we never would have stayed in this location otherwise. We were not happy with stairs to lobby, extremely slow elevator, and loud street noise, but were prepared to make do since it was just one night. The beds looked freshly made and comfortable but when I pulled back the covers I smelled a nasty odor--like someone who hadn't bathed in a year. I was stunned-couldn't believe anyone could have made up the bed and not noticed. We had to dress, repack and move to another room on another floor, and didn't get much sleep after that, wondering what awful event had happened in that bed. Never found out, and couldn't ask for refund since we hadn't paid-wish someone had at least said "sorry' and offered to refund the points.

The French would say this is a 'bijou' of a hotel. Ralph Lauren might think someone had stolen his hotel blueprints but I would say simply that this is one of O'ahu's best kept secrets. The location is perfectly nestled between the beach at Waikiki, the boutiques and department stores at Ala Moana Center and the great little restaurants and cafe of Chinatown. The rooms are so comfortable and so tastefully designed, it's little wonder they have scooped a number of hotel design awards. The owners are one of the great polo families of Hawaii, so if you're visiting any Sunday between April and September, be sure to ask them for a complimentary pass to the polo.......you won't be disappointed, as the polo grounds are located another of the islands best kept secrets, a stunning white sand beach called Mokulei'a. This hotel is great value and you'll be welcomed like an 'old' friend.

This was a business trip and I was asked to keep travel expenses down so I chose the Equuis based on reviews I had seen which all seemed to be quite positive. I'm not sure what I expected since I had never been to Honolulu before so it's hard to compare this room/hotel to others there. Let's start with the positives. Very friendly staff and they were more than happy to offer assistance. Location was good - we were able to walk just about anywhere and you're close to the beach and to stores, etc. Beds were quite comfy and pillows as well. We were greeted with fresh pineapple juice which was wonderful. Rooms had a fridge and a nice coffee maker and tv was nice too. What didn't I like. You have to go up a flight of stairs. They helped with our luggage but if no one was there, that could be rough. No breakfast is available there. The rooms are very limited on outlet space. There were 2 of us in the room and we had one open outlet to charge our devices. The air took a while to cool the room off but once it's on, you really hear it. We were on a main street so between the traffic and the air, you have a constant flow of noise. The first night I didn't sleep well at all because of it. Bring ear plugs, they help. The shower was tiny! Shaving your legs wasn't an easy task. And the toilet flush could have woken the people down the hall! Also, there wasn't much light in the bathroom or by the mirror by the beds. So maybe it's because it was a business trip, or because it was my first time here. I supposed for the price, it's not bad, but as long as you know what you're getting for the money, it's ok.

Equus is a nice little boutique style hotel in a very good location. It's an easy walk to Ala Moana shopping centre as well as the beaches. Bus services are nearby so it's a great base without being right in the heart of Waikiki.It's an interesting design with the Equine theme and some may say is a bit odd in a tropical island. However you view this, it's a little different and in our opinion nice to get away from the typical resort style hotels that are so overcrowded. It's good for a reliable, friendly and simple place to stay without all the unnecessary trimmings!Check in was wonderful, they recognised our 10th wedding anniversary on arrival and even sent some wine up to our room. The staff are very friendly, very polite and professional, always greeting you as you come and go. A little street noise is audible from the rooms but that is probably typical of the area I would say. Comfortable beds and pillows.

The Equus was our first stop in Honolulu, it's nice and close to the Hilton Village and bus stops. The staff were super friendly and helpful, the Mai Tai's with staff were yum. The beds were so comfortable, they were a dream to sleep in, I'd go back just for the bed. The rooms are compact but comfortable. It's a good walk or a short bus to get to the main part of Waikiki beach, that didn't bother us as we liked to do a but of walking. This Hotel was really reasonably priced, would definitely go back.

I travel to Hawaii to Waikiki two to three times a year for business and this is my first choice EVERY time I come in. It is very easy to find. I am pleased each and every time I visit here. The staff you meet here really give you the personal experience you think you should get from a way more expensive hotel. I honestly think they hire the most friendly people on island. Now to the hotel, yes it is located on a very noisy street, but you will never notice from the rooms. They are very quiet and comfortable. Speaking of rooms, the beds are more comfortable than mine at home so I sleep like a baby while here. The rooms are just the right size, not to big and not too small. If there are two of you, you will not get in each other's way at all. Location of the hotel is about as good as you can get, it is within walking distances to everything, beaches, malls and shopping. I have stayed here at least 7 times and will continue to come back here.

There are a few twists and turns on the drive from the airport to The Equus Hotel but it's in a perfect spot for access to the beach and for shopping. The staff were very helpful at all stages and the free mai tais were an added bonus!

The location of the Equus is Fantastic for the Beach goer and a Shopper, Close to both. The Staff was very happy to assist with any questions that you may have. They actually called in a very experienced hiker on questions we needed answered! Rooms were kept in Superior order. Very pleased to come back to the Equus after a day filled with excitement!

Recently spent one night in the Equus Hotel and my expectations where well exceeded. We basically chose the hotel because of the rate and location. The hotel was clean and adequately equipped. The front desk crew is where my expectations we exceeded, and I will admit that I have high expectations when it comes to customer service. From the moment we checked in the staff made us feel like part of the family. The concierge was welcoming and friendly. The frond desk worked with us on getting a room that we liked. The “house-man” helped with our bags and a rollaway. On our check out day we had a little adventure with the local bus (TheBus) trying to get back from Pearl Harbor. We had called the front desk to let them know we were running late (due to no Waikiki bus showing up) and they sensed our anxiety and said no problem, they would work with us on a late check out. After about 30 minutes they even called back to confirm the bus had arrived and that we were okay. Tim and Puka and the houseman (sorry can’t remember his name) were great!! There are a few stairs (10-15) from the street so be aware you may have to carry your bags up. The houseman will assist with your bags if he is available. We didn’t use the pool and we missed the complimentary Mai Tai’s but had a great stay and would definitely recommend the Equus Hotel in Honolulu.

Equus hotel is a cosy hotel with a great location; two minutes away from ABC stores and five minutes away from Ala Moana shopping centre and Waikiki beach. The rooms are very nice and are looked after daily; the beds are sooo comfy! the staff are very friendly and are always happy to help you with any needs you may have. If holidaying again in Hawaii I would indeed return to the Equus.

Great location... excellent views of the city. Nice cozy rooms. I didn't like the 26$$ valet parking though. But I would stay there again in a heartbeat because of it's proximity to the Waikiki beach.. The front desk even gave us a coupon to enjoy at a local restaurant. :)

I have stayed at Equus a few times and its now my preferred side of Waikiki... Walking distance to world class breaks, fabulous restaurants with live music. Next to the marina which makes it like a time capsule for me since I grew up surrounded by boats. It is not to far from China town night life, all u have to do is hop in a cab. Blaisdel Concert Hall is right around the corner if you are the traveler who will see a show or 2 while visiting...The rooms are clean and comfortable with an indo-china flare. Staff is sweet and accommodating. Will definitely be staying here again and again for those Waikiki getaways!

Nice hotel across fm marina, no views from room. NO breakfast, not even cont., booked thru Choice. FREE wi fi , if you have your OWN device!! They need to install and elevator from garage!! Front desk personnel was wonderful!!
user_name:
Michael C
Winder, Georgia, United States

review_body: Booked directly with Equus, very friendly and efficient reservations. Upon arrival, very helpful and courteous front desk. Pros: Location right on Ala Moana, approx 3 blocks to Ala Moana Mall, several ABC 24-hour convenience stores, 2 blocks to Wailana Coffee Shop (all day bfast and good loco moco and meat loaf). Well maintained rooms ableit functional not luxurious amenities. Reasonably priced.Cons: Limited parking and several slots require excellent maneuvering skills, especially when hotel service vehicles are there. Room views of adjoining condo. One flight of stairs to lobby so watch out ADA- and heavy luggage-bound travelers. One elevator so occasional delays.Would definitely stay here again as this is one of my go-to properties when in HNL. Prefer to get out and enjoy the island rather than stay insular and never leave the premises so this works out great. Self-serve laundromat with available drop-off service only 3 blocks from Equus so laundry not a problem.

This was a nice stay for my trip back to Hawaii. Staff was friendly kept the do not disturb in so service wasn't really needed. The only inconvenience was the construction they were doing which required us to leave around noon, had plans to go anyway so turned out just fine :) felt like home nice hotel to stay at.
