I cannot say enough good things about the staff at the Equus during our recent stay (9/16/2014).From the refreshing juice during check-in to the cocktails on the veranda on Thursdays and Fridays, the welcoming, accommodating staff made us feel welcome. Right after check-in we received a text from the front desk letting us know that we can text them with any immediate concerns.We chose this property primarily because of its central location, just blocks from Ala Moana shopping center, across the street from Ala Moana Beach Park and just a little walk from the western end of Waikiki beach.The hotel is clean and presentable. The glass sliding doors need to be brought up to modern standards. A good central location brings with it traffic noise. Updated infrastructure would help with traffic noise greatly. It would also address the heat transfer from the outside. During our stay, the trade winds stopped so it was quite hot and humid even at night. We had to run the A/C 24-7 just to keep the room bearable. Modern windows would have helped greatly.Having relatives on the island to take us around allowed us to avoid the $25/night parking fee. This is a problem for every hotel in Honolulu.All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to the Equus.

Booked as a package through an OTA. The hotel has decent ratings but it could be improved a little.If you are mobility-impaired, be aware that it's a flight of stairs up to the lobby: No elevator. And then there are steps within the lobby. Only one elevator and that can be slow. Rooms are nice if a bit dark. Rooms are nice and updated. Only flaw is that the sliding doors are single glazed and have no seals left. This will result in a lot of road noise. Replace the sliding doors and it will be much quieter.Fridge is a nice with separate freezer so you don't have the icing problem of cheaper fridges. Coffee making service is a Keurig and it's free. Don't be afraid to ask cleaning stuff for your preferred choice of coffee/tea. Ideally placed close to the beach but also close to Ala Moana and the real Honolulu - closer than Waikiki beach.The pool is small and shaded but water is not very chlorinated - nice if you want to avoid the sun and do some laps. No pool towels provided though.

Nice price and a nice location. Be sure you request a quiet room away from the street. You can walk to the beach and to some nice restaurants in the area. The room was comfortable, the house keeping a bit uneven but not bad and the staff was helpful. No way to avoid them $25/day plus tax(!) fee if you want a car, but the price for the room was the best in the area, especially considering the generally good reviews from tripadviser. By the way, if you want real soap instead of that body wash stuff, you can ask for it and they'll give a small bar of soap.

We checked in pretty late since our flight was delayed, so I guess we missed out on juice and lei's! The room was clean and the King size bed was so comfortable, gave us the best sleep! The room walls were a bit thin you can hear the bathroom upstairs, I know it's an old building, but besides that it was very quiet. Yoshi at the front desk was very helpful, I enquired about late check out on our last day, which they could accommodate! The free wifi is a bonus too! We personally like to park our rental car so we don't have to wait for the valet etc. But Elias greeted us every morning and was very helpful. All the valet gentlemen worked hard. We usually stay closer on the strip, but the walk was good for us and the location was very good, close to the Ala Mona mall. We would def stay there again!

The Equus is a family oriented hotel with a friendly staff and beautiful timeless decor. I absolutely love the historical beauty in the hotel- the pictures of old ranches and horsemen back in the day.The Equus has an great old fashion touch mixed with just the right amount of modernness. Talk about going green, the hotel key has to be in it's slot in the room for the AC to run, and also the patio door must be shut. I love this aspect of the rooms and THE BEDS ARE SO COMFORTABLE! Location is great as well. Right at the beginning of Waikiki strip and not too far from Ala Moana Mall. Almost everything in walking distance. Overall I had a great time at the Equus and I would definitely stay there again!

We were in Honolulu for the weekend to see a concert and decided to stay at the Equus Hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted with a welcome drink and leis. Our group had made 2 separate reservations and asked the front desk, Tim, if there's any chance that we can stay on the same floor. Considering that it was a very busy weekend in Honolulu, we were not expecting that to happen, but Tim went out of his way to accommodate our request, which is greatly appreciated. He also informed us that they will be serving complimentary Mai Tais between 4-7pm. The concierge (which I forgot to ask for his name) is very helpful. He went above and beyond when we asked for dinner recommendations. He actually asked every single staff member that happen to pass by of what they would also recommend for us. The room is very clean and comfortable, they have a green concept for the Air Conditioner. All in all, we are very pleased with our stay, and would highly recommend this hotel.

Now that I've stayed at The Equus a couple of times it's clear that the quality and comfort is consistent with my previous visits....The staff are friendly and helpful local folks who really know Oahu, and the location is outstanding! A small boutique hotel that packs a big value, it's a little gem in the heart of Waikiki. I look forward to my next visit to Honolulu and my next stay at The Equus.

we stayed in room 503. arrived an hour before check-in and our room was ready. upon arrival they gave us each one of those shell necklaces and guava juice. It was a nice touch since it was so hot! the hotel is right on the main street so there's a lot of street noise. The room is old but clean. There's not much room inside so definitely wouldn't be room for kids. we paid about $200 for 3 nights plus another $75 for parking I think. The parking is valet only, but it's the same price as what it said in the hotel description. The guys are really quick at getting your car though. We knew that we would be out and about all day and we just needed a room to shower and sleep in, so this place was perfect for that. The street noise didn't bother us at all since we crashed every night. There is a small pool here, but we didn't use it and didn't see anyone else using it either. This hotel is just 2 blocks from the marina and is at the quieter end of waikiki beach. There's an abc store a block away and several places to eat within a couple of blocks. Overall, I would stay here again if it was just me and hubby. Prosstaff was niceroom was cleanprice was cheapbed was comfyconsroom was smallshower was smallalot of noise from the streetpillows were smelled like sweat

When we arrived in Honolulu, it was early in the morning on check-in day, and my husband and I wondered what we would do. We had lots of luggage and several hours before check-in. We didn't want to haul our luggage around all day, so I called the hotel, and I was so glad to hear that we could drop off our luggage and have it stored until check-in. When we got to the hotel, we were delighted when we found out that we could check in early!! We were greeted with a great big smile and "I have a room ready for you". Needless to say, my husband and I were extremely happy. We were exhausted from our trip, and we couldn't have received better news! A young man brought our luggage up the front steps for us, and we went to our room. The furnishings were very nice, and the room was neat and clean. There are balconies on each floor, just outside the rooms, and the views are breath-taking. There was also a balcony accessible from our room--a great place to stand with your in-room freshly brewed cup of coffee in the morning. The pillow-top bed was so soft and comfortable. It was the most comfortable bed I have every slept in! (I wish I could take it home.) The hotel is located close to Ala Moana Shopping Center, and there are several restaurants and shops within walking distance. The staff is very helpful if you need recommendations for restaurants, tours, or places to shop. We would like to thank the staff at The Equus for a wonderful stay! We recommend The Equus to everyone.

The friendly staff, with their warm aloha spirit and attention to detail, stand out in this economically-priced and well-located hotel. The moment I arrived, I was greeted by a bellhop who transported my luggage for me, and I was then served a refreshing glass of tropical fruit juice. My room was immaculately arranged and spotlessly clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic--walking distance from all the attractions in Waikiki, Ala Moana Beach Park, and Ala Moana Shopping Center. The front desk staff gave me great recommendations for places to eat in the area, and the manager herself greeted me like family and offered to do anything in her power to make me comfortable. This is a family-run boutique hotel, and quality shines through from top to bottom!

I stayed at the equus again last weekend for a birthday staycation..it was great. The staff are very friendly and helpful. They let me keep my stroller in a storage area downstairs so I didn't have to lug it up and down. The manager even sent me a bottle of champagne as a birthday present!! The Room was comfortable and clean. I like the ecofriendly ac and light system. Awesome location...close to ala moana and lots of restaurants. Definitely going to stay there again!

The Equus Hotel is a small Hotel, with BIG service! Visiting for business I was not in need of a view or an ocean front but a clean, comfortable room. Upon checking in, I was greeted with a cold glass of juice and a shell lei. When I got into my room to my surprise the room had a king size bed, a large flat screen TV, an abundance of towels and even my own Keurig coffee machine. The bed was so comfortable that I actually had one of the best night sleep away from home. The bathroom is small but super clean and updated, perfect for a single person or a couple. I did see a small private pool, which I'm sure if I had time would have been relaxing. The hotel is just steps away from the AlaMoana Shopping Center and just around the corner is a McDonalds and a Buffalo Wild Wings. I recommend this beautiful Hotel for a perfect aloha stay!

Recently spent a week at The Equus and couldn't fault it. Room was spotless, bed extremely comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. Wonderful location in a quiet end of Waikiki but still close to the beach. Ala Moana shopping centre a short walk away, ABC store (food, gifts etc) close by as well as fast food (if that is your wish). On the main bus route into Waikiki. Not recommended for anyone with a mobility issue as it is necessary to use a number of steps to access the hotel. Was absolutely perfect for us.

I recently stayed at the Equus Hotel in Honolulu. It was a wonderful location, really friendly staff, and really comfortable beds. A really nice, clean hotel, great attention to details. You are very close to all the wonderful places to visit.
user_name:
Judy W
Haleiwa, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Just got back from Ohau was there for my 40th was exhausted when we arrived check in was at 3 we get there at 1pm they put us on 2nd floor 206 we didn't mind when just wanted to get settled and hit the beach room was clean, small but manageable we had a king bed very very comfortable! Cute fridge which we went to Walmart to stock up on water, mixers food totally walkable. Air worked great. A bit noisy but not bad didn't bother us cuz we passed out. Staff super friendly and helpful. There managers special is not everyday Mai tais it's only Thurs and Friday bummer we got there sat. Walked to Ala Mona beach nice calm a lot of families took bus to diamond head, Waikiki beach & pearl Harbor. ALL in all great location away from the hustle and busy Waikiki which we enjoyed. I've learned that not all reviews are true and we took a chance glad I did, everyones needs are different. Will stay again Thank you equus for making my stay enjoyable coming from a flight attendants perspective and I stay at a lot of hotels

I arrived in Hawaii on August 6th at 4:30 AM. I was not able to sleep on the flight, but knew I needed to waste time before check-in at 3:00 pm in the afternoon. I went to breakfast, went to the Swap Meet and by the time I didn't know what else to do I decided to just drive to the hotel and see if I could check in early expecting to hear a " No" I was half prepared to take a nap in the lobby or walk the beach. At 9:30 AM I arrived at The Equus. I was greeted by the Valet (I'll get to their amazing service later). The valet helped me bring my luggage up where I was greeted by a smiling face. His name was Kevin. I asked if there was any possibility of checking in early. He apologized and said that check in was at 3. I explained that I hadn't slept in 24 hours, and if there was anything that could be done to please let me know. He said he'd look up and see what could be available seeing that the cleaning crews probably weren't available to clean a room so quickly. Kevin welcomed me to sit in the lobby, letting me know where a plug was so I could charge my dying phone. As I got comfortable in the lobby chair, and took a few work calls (real estate never stops, vacation or not) I all of a sudden saw Kevin come over and let me know that he found a room for me! I was ecstatic!! It had only been 10 minutes!!!!! I was able to check into my room at 9:45 AM. I felt like the staff truly cared! I had a little trouble getting into my room and a staff member stayed with my stuff while I went down to get a new key. Valet! Just as amazing!! After one day they knew exactly which car was mine and immediately ran off to grab it when I'd come around the corner! Totally worth the 20 bucks (ish) a night!! Always a smiling face, always a friendly attitude. I cannot wait to come back to Hawaii and I cannot wait to book another room at the Equus!!!!!!!
user_name:
Vanesa W
Las Vegas, Nevada, United States

review_body: We first stayed at their condo rentals until I found we had critters ( roaches) staying with us. I called the desk and asked to change rooms. The person said they had nothing else available. So I carefully checked all our belongings, packed them in the suit cases, and walked down to the desk with all of our things. I told the man at the front desk I refused to stay there do he gave me the room keys to an upgraded condo on the highest floor. I went to the room to check it and as soon as I walked to the kitchen counter I saw roaches crawling all over it. I went back to the desk at told him I don't want to stay there at all. So he gave us a room at the Equus. A lot cleaner but no longer had a view and definitely downgraded in size. My main issue was that he was lazy and had none of these other rooms available before I walked down to the desk.

I just booked a room for a special event in Waikiki and will be staying at the Equus...my favorite boutique hotel there. I left a phone message requesting my date with them and within hours I got a call from the manager herself confirming my reservation. An email followed with the confirmation and new info about handicap access to the hotel and that valet parking is now available. I am looking forward to my time with these nice people, and their hotel perfectly located right across from the Yacht club where my "in town" event is happening. Yay, Equus.

THANK YOU to everyone at the Equus Hotel for making my destination wedding so special! Having a group of family and friends travel from Australia to attend my wedding was one thing but all staying at the same hotel with great service and so accommodating was the cherry on the top! Thank you to Kika and Rene for overseeing accommodations for my family and friends and a special thank you to Puka for always greeting and being attentive to all my guests no matter what the request would be, and to Jackie for going above and beyond for my family. Thank you to all the staff of Equus Hotel for being so helpful during and after my wedding, my husband and I cannot thank you all enough! It was surly our home away from home! Location was so convenient to everything especially last minute shopping and this wedding was one that my family and friends would never forget! So thank you to everyone at the Equus Hotel for making our wedding extra special! Love always, Mr and Mrs Foifua!

Are softball team stayed here for a tournament. The staff was incredible they were so helpful. They loaned us boogie boards for the girls and beach mats. Also very helpful with places to see and visit.Thank you so much for the great stay

I had a room with at moin 5 dead cockroach by all. I reserve Two months in advance all inclusive I think like that have a nice room and I get the receptionist told me that the garden view room and it was a room with a view of nothing the worse of the hotel and I not think there's worse. incompetent and unhelpful reception. I never go back and I recommend anyone to go there !!! I'm really disappointed :(

Admittedly a bit spoiled from our trip to Turtle Bay on the North Shore, we were somewhat disappointed with the Equus. Carpets were stained, walls were thin, and cigarette smoke kept wafting into our room (we were on the second floor). To its credit, the staff was vey friendly and the beds super comfortable. It was inexpensive and close to transit and walk away from beach. Although we would not stay here again, I can agree that the price point was excellent for the area.

We just arrived home from a week in Waikiki, and even though I am exhausted and in pain from sunburn (wear sunscreen, lots!!!!) I just wanted to give these guys the review they deserve. *From the moment we arrived we were given exceptional treatment. A gentleman greeted us with cold pineapple and guava juice. He was a very welcoming and one of the nicest people I have met. The entire front desk is this way, extremely nice and helpful. They asked me if I wanted help every time I carried something. They even kept the lobby stocked with cold fruit infused water. *Room was just as advertised, nothing broken, nasty, or worn out. *Some reviews I read prior to arriving had mentioned noise so I asked for a room towards the back and I stayed on the 8th floor, no noise problem that I could tell. *Housekeepers are amazing! Always made sure I had plenty of everything. They cleaned really well, our beds always looked amazing. I know the difference between a good cleaning and cut corners, these guys did great! *The location could not be better. Within a couple blocks to Ala Moana Park beach and the shopping center, this had a huge variety of food to eat in the food court. My kids loved the beach there. I drove them down to Waikiki beach and they asked to go back to the one by the hotel. It is calmer and we even did a little of snorkeling there seeing fish with wings and some others. It is also close to Sam's club, Walmart, and Starbucks. We was able to park in the garage across the street for $7 per night, and at the marina for either $8 per night or $1 per hour which was perfect for daytime. I would definitely rent a car. While we stayed at The Equus we was able to go to Sea Life Park (kids loved swimming with the dolphins), Chief’s Luau (favorite part of trip to all of us, funny!), Hanauma Bay (amazing! fish everywhere), Waimea Valley waterfall (great experience), Diamond Head (hard hike but worth it), Pearl Harbor (good for kids to learn first-hand), Aloha Stadium swap meet (bought a lot of clothes and gifts for cheap), and several beaches (the lagoons at Ko olina were nice, swam with a turtle there in lagoon #1). *I have a 7 year old daughter and 17 year old son, both of which loved everything we did. They even loved the hotel, so much so that they wanted to spend the last day of Hawaii in the room. For the price I was expecting some disappointment, but there was absolutely none. The only thing I can even consider mentioning is that the pool was a little small. However if you go to Hawaii and spend your time in a hotel pool rather than at the beach across the street, maybe you should have just saved your money and rented a hotel with a pool by your house. My daughter swam in it once but after going into the ocean across the street she decided a pool was definitely not as much fun. I absolutely loved this hotel and all the staff in it, we have no complaints. We will definitely be back. Oahu was such a great experience. The people are the nicest, friendliest, and laid back that we have ever met. No one even honks or yells at all the lost tourist driving horribly (me). I'm in love with Oahu and all of its locals. Mahalo to the Equus and all the residents of Oahu, you gave this family some great memories to last a lifetime.

The Equus Hotel is located minutes away from great restaurants, night life and beaches. The hotel is very comfortable and clean. The staff bent over backwards to make me comfortable. This is the best deal in Waikiki.

I just moved out from Australia and wanted to spend a romantic night with my boyfriend in Waikiki. I was blown away by the warm and cosy feel of the Equus. The rooms were beautifully appointed, the mattress was like sleeping on a cloud and the linen was crisp and of good quality.The hotel is in a perfect location, we walked down to the mall for a bit of shopping then Ala moana to surf in the afternoon and watched the sunset. Tucked away from the main hustle and bustle of Waikiki the Equus is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. We found the staff so warm and helpful during our stay and the attention to smaller details in the room.. cookies / tea and good quality coffee all available! We will def be back to stay at the Equus! It was all round an amazing experience and value for money. Absolutely beautiful! I would recommend to any family or couple looking for a relaxing holiday or a romantic few nights stay.

Location location location! I stayed 12 nights on business mixed with sightseeing. Location minimizes the need for a rental vehicle. Parking is $20/day (typical in this area). Waikiki's north edge is five minutes on foot. The Ala Moana Mall's well-priced and diverse food court helped when I did not want to spend a ton on dinner. It's a ten minute walk. Plenty of restaurants, bars, gift shops, ABC stores, etc. sit within a 5-15 minute radius. My room was clean with fridge, wi-fi, flat panel TV and balcony (I'm not certain that all rooms have balconies). The staff from desk to housekeeping to bellmen always made a point to ask what they could do. Complimentary mai-tais between 4-6 Thu-Sat. I enjoyed the complimentary Wall Street Journal each morning. Hotel offers complimentary polo tickets for the Sunday matches on the North Shore. Note: the elevator begins at the 2nd floor. You need bellmen to move bags, etc. from ground level to front desk via stairs. I would stay here again for sure.

Living on the North Shore of Oahu, I treated myself to a night at the Equus last week. The Equus is a boutique hotel, and I absolutely loved my stay there. The location is perfect..walking distance to Ala Moana Beach Park, the shopping center, and the Ala Wai boat harbor. Because it's not right in the center of Waikiki, I found it much more peaceful.The staff couldn't have been more welcoming, and the hotel is decorated beautifully with an equine theme. The lobby area is very cozy with cold infused waters, and they even had a mai tai hour for guests in the early evening. I liked the fact that the manager was very "hands on" and charming as well...The room was spacious with simple but elegant decor, and the bathroom amenities were very contemporary. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. One of the highlights for me was the "towel art" created by the housekeepers. They actually had a swan and a smaller duck that were made from twisted bath towels!The only down side I will mention is that I only had one night! Thank you Equus staff, for making my night in town such a wonderful treat.

The hotel was clean, rooms were well maintained. All facilities in the room were great. The parking was tight. You need to pay for the parking (almost everywhere in Honolulu/Waikiki/Ala-Moana area hotels). The hotel was in a tight complex and you have to climb some stairs (no elevator or wheelchair access for those set of stairs to go to main lobby). There is no ocean-view as this is in different area than ocean. This is near to Ala-Moana park but a little far from Waikiki beach. We enjoyed our stay in other Waikiki area more.No bathtub, only standing shower. Room and bathroom were clean and well maintained. This hotel is almost on a busy road so there were definitely some street/traffic noise issues. But overall this was an average hotel.

The neat hotel is just like a gem to us. After few days hanging around at glamorous Kalakaua Ave., we are pleased to find such a quiet and warm hotel. Mattress is so comfortable that one night I fell asleep ASAP while just lying on it. Interior decoration style is exotic, pretty nice for appreciation but somehow those cabinets and chairs occupy too much space. If you're a couple with two luggages, you may need to re-arrange those furniture. Swimming pool is so tiny, however who will give up the world class gorgeous beach nearby but here... Room is very clean, staffs are earnest and helpful. Free parking, which is excellent, but be aware that no elevator from parking lot to lobby. Overall it's a great experience and will definitely go back again.

I was most pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. The room was very clean, spacious and king bed just a dream. Bathroom tidy with all the accessories expected of a 4/5 star hotel. All in all very difficult to fault. Mind you I requested quietness and GOT the top floor at the back room #1008. The universal question – would I stay there again, YOU BET!

Don't let the stairs or the lobby scare you off. The rooms in the Equus are exceptionally clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The office staff was friendly and helpful. They even stored out luggage before and after check in/checkout so we could see the sites in the city. Air schedules are sometimes crazy. I only rated it down due to the noise from the street, and no free breakfast.

We spent 2 nights and loved it. Yoshi at the front desk was so nice and friendly. Our room had a great view of the fireworks that another hotel lights off on Friday nights. Comfortable beds, great shower, and cute towel art.

We had a great time at equus. We checked in late due to an extended layover and they were very nice so late. We missed out on the fresh pineapple juice but they got us a different day. The front desk people were very helpful, even letting us use the microwave once! The house keeping staff were great too! We used their services to book a couple activities and they found us the Best spa!!! Our hotel room was the cleanest we've had in a long time. Small, but nice. Bed was Sooooo comfy! Only downside was the small shower. The ac cooled the room off really fast. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Very close to shopping and the beach too.

Stayed here for 2 nights on the ninth floor with a glimpse of the sea. The room was very clean, quite large with super comfortable beds and a good sized bathroom with hot, strong m!shower. Staff were friendly and helpful and our luggage was stored as we arrived prior to check in time. Other reviewers have complained about the entrance steps but a staff member was there to carry our bags. Great place to stay if you want to be away from the busyness of Waikiki but only a short walk or bus ride away. Close to Ala Moana shopping centre and the lovely and much less crowded Ala Moana beach. An eatery called "Goofy Cafe and Dine" over the road on Ala Moana Blvd. Is a great place for breakfast.

Great Location without a heave price tag.Limited on site parking about 8 spots @$20 a day but the 24/7 public parking across the road charge $20 all day and only $7 for 10 hours which works for us for our daily 07:00 departure and return late every night.Close the local shopping mall and good food court at half price most store around 21:00 :-)

I have been coming to Oahu for the past three years for business. The hotel is located in a perfect spot. Blocks from the Ala Moana Beach Park and Shopping, If you like to walk or jog along the Ala Wai Canal, that is just around the corner. Rooms are comfortable, some with balcony some without. If you come and stay here you will be greeted by some super friendly staff and an chilled glass of fresh pineapple juice. You will need it after your long flight. The past three years, Kao, has made sure I am comfortable. Kao remembered me last year and this year when I drove up the driveway. They really make you feel like 'Ohana (family). I will be back for year number 4.

We stayed for 2 weeks at the Equus.Positives: Good location, not that close to Waikiki but still walkable. Very close to Ala Moana beach which is quieter than Waikiki beaches. Also near to Ala Moana Centre which pretty much has all the shops that Waikiki has. Room was decent size and clean. Shower and A/C worked well. Housekeeping was efficient although could be late some days. Wifi had okay speeds in the room.Negatives: Noise levels were very high due to outside traffic - almost unbearable in morning rush hour (we were on third floor). Reception staff although friendly were at times incompetent. We booked a double room but were given a twin room because the staff at front desk thought we were a party of three rather than two. He later admitted it was because another person was standing behind us (subtle racism I guess as the person behind was asian). The same person at front desk also said not to worry about parking and to speak to him on the day when we had the car. We did this but he then said we should have made a reservation beforehand as parking was limited and was full.Safety deposit box in the room requires an actual key from front desk which costs $50 if you lose it.Overall this hotel is good value for money. It would be a lot better if the person at front desk actually gave useful information and if the rooms had better sound proofing.

Friendly staff, comfortable bed, clean - excellent value for the price. We stayed 2 nights and wanted somewhere close to Alamoana shopping centre. It suited us perfectly as we could walk from the hotel.

We get a little present for our honeymoon in the room!! That was very nice!Before arriving in the Equus Honolulu, we did a cruise to visit all the Islands of Hawaii.When we arrived in Honolulu, we realised we left a lot of money in the safe of our cabin cruise. We pannicked and didn't know what to do. We couldn't reach the cruise by calling the number on our tickets. So we asked the staff of The Equus what to do?!We were so pleased they helped us trying to get our money back.Especially Renée did everything she could do to help us!! She couldn't do more! They tranquillized us. I bet no other hotel staff would do this to help their guests!!After we left the hotel, she kept calling to solve our problems !Also other things were great about the hotel! Good place to visit everything, walking distance shopping center. Clean rooms!

Location of the tower was perfect. It was central to Ala Moana shopping and Waikiki. Room was clean and was maintained well. Staff was pleasant & very helpful. They worked with us to accommodate the time difference between check out & departure.

I was very impressed by quality of service and cleanliness of the Hotel.The location is perfect and close to best shopping and dining in Waikiki. The room was very well furnished and the TV flat screen is a plus. Great views and quiet low noise.The Front Desk Manager and staff was very welcoming and friendly from check-in to check out.I highly recommend the hotel and will definitely stay there again since I travel for business from outer islands.

staff very helpful and friendly close to many restaurants and ala monana mall only drawback was the pool water is a little chilly as sun only hits a few hours a day. did not rate restaurant as there is not one in the hotel other reviews complained about the noise I did not notice it to be too loud

The hotel was clean, the staff was extremely friendly, and despite the fact that it is not on the beach, the location is great!!! The rooms are modern, but have character, and the bed was extremely comfortable! My only gripe would be that the pool was really the size of a hot tub, and I wish there were treats, drinks, etc. in the main lobby. Besides that, I enjoyed every moment of my stay there!

We were so happy with our stay at the Equus and loved the intimate, friendly feel. It was a great value, and the location was perfect for us. As Sabbath observers, we have religious restrictions that prevented us from operating the electronic key cards to open our hotel room door. The Equus staff was not only accommodating every time we needed help, but they did so with a gracious smile! Everyone was so friendly and treated us with kindness and respect. We were very impressed with the quality of service and would highly recommend this hotel!
user_name:
Hillel K
New York City, New York

review_body: I did my research on this hotel but no one can describe just how loud it really is! I can't even hear myself think at night...when we complained they offered earplugs...nice but doesn't work for my baby! Also the parking...I knew it was limited but apparently they were all "reserved" already. Who knew you had to reserve it ahead of time. And the parking across the street...it's a six lane major highway (hence the noise) and there is hardly any spots...we had to park on the 7th level so overall it took 15 minutes to get to hotel room from car. I booked the hotel for the cost, which is great but the inconvenience of this hotel isn't worth it to me. I would have given it a four for the cost but the noise is unacceptable considering they know about the problem and do nothing to fix it.

This was our first trip to Hawaii and we were on a budget, so wanted something reasonable. We really like to the location and the Hotel was nice, staff was great. The only complaint we had was the noise. The street noise was loud until late and it took some getting used to. Since the Hotel is older the sliding glass doors didn't keep much of the noise out. However, given the price, we consider it a great value.
user_name:
Galen P
Ulysses, Kansas, United States

review_body: I loved the quaintness of this hotel and that it felt like visiting family more than staying at a hotel. the location is great being near Ala Moana shopping center and at the edge of busy Waikiki. There are many restaurants nearby within walking distance.

Traveling on a budget, I found this option to be spectacular. The city bus dropped me off very close to the hotel entrance, and when I arrived a courteous young man carried my bag up the entry stairs for me. The front desk staff were very helpful and gracious-- they gave me some suggestions of things to do and places to go in the area. The location is fantastically convenient-- on the edge of Waikiki right near Ala Moana Shopping Center, Ala Moana Beach Park, and all of the action and craziness of nighttime Waikiki. There is an ABC store on the block for any late-night purchases you might need to make, and a great affordable diner called the Wailana right down the road. Because of all of this convenience, I found that my decision to save some money (and stress) by not renting a car was totally practical. If you can get away with it, don't rent a car for your stay in Honolulu! When I travel, I look for comfort and convenience, and my room did not disappoint. The A/C kept me cool, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. It was a fantastic place to rest in between my adventures on Oahu. In the morning, I was pleasantly surprised to find an included light breakfast in the lobby area. After my morning swim a five minute walk away at Ala Moana Beach, I came back to the hotel and took a dip in the little pool, which is surrounded by tropical foliage for a jungly feel. All in all, I felt that this hotel offered a lot more than I expected, given its price point and location. If you want a resort experience, go elsewhere (and pay for it!), but if you want an affordable, comfortable, convenient place to stage your adventures in Waikiki, the Equus can't be beat!

Very friendly staff, older building but updated rooms. very close and convenient location, close to shopping, restaurants and the beach.. I will definitely stay here again.Only issue is limited parking, though I was able to park during my stay. Smaller cars will make it very easily.

I travel a lot for work and conferences and loved this hotel. Room furnishings, decor and layout were well above many in its price range. However, the best feature is the staff, everyone was so friendly. The staff went above and beyond to check me in early and hold my luggage for hours (after checking out) before I left to the airport. Best hotel service I can remember receiving.
user_name:
Matt P
South Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: For my birthday weekend my friends and I decided to do a stay cation, from the moment that we checked in to time that we checked out we were greeted with the most friendliest staff ever, Kevin and Renee took the best care of us. They upgraded us to a suite which was beautiful. The bed was the most comfortable bed that I ever slept in, the room was very clean and spacious. They even gave me a $25.00 certificate for the Chart House because it was my birthday, thank you Renee and Kevin!!!. Already planning the next stay cation!!!!. If you want the best customer service and the most friendly staff stay at this hotel. Five Stars!!!!

This hotel was great for a very econmical price. When we went we paid roughly $110 a night. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and very green friendly. Having a private lani and A/C unit was nice. Very comfortable and cute hotel with nice decorations, very comfortable beds, clean rooms with no real issues. The Keurig that comes with the room was very dirty and hard to use however, so I think they need to work on cleaning those on a more regular basis. There are complimentary cocktails a couple days a week which was a pleasant surprise and they were very tasty good Mai Tai's. The location for the price was the number one draw for this hotel as we are college kids on a college budget and this worked out great for all of us. Being really close to the Ala Moana Beach was incredible because it was a much less crowded beach then Waikiki. It was also within walking distance of Waikiki and we could see the fireworks from the Hilton from our room. One great feature of this hotel is the text assistance from the staff. They text you as soon as you check in and are available 24/7 to answer any questions you have about the hotel or the local area. The two worst parts of this hotel is that 1. The street noise was awful, I could hardly sleep. Granted I am a very light sleeper so I know it was worse for me than most, but it was a problem. By the end of the stay I was simply exhausted from hardly sleeping through the noise. My boyfriend is a very heavy sleeper and he too had trouble sleeping through the noise all night long. Our two friends however were in the room next to us and were not bothered by the noise at all, so I think it has to do with how close you are to the main road there, as our friend were further back then us. 2. The pool was broken down and nobody told us. We just went to go check it out and it was brown and gross looking so we did not go in. The next day there was an out of order sign on the entrance, which was disapointing. While there are beaches all around, the pool was an advertised feature that we could not use and were not told by staff that we could not use. But that really was not a big issue, as we spent most of our time at the beach. Mostly the main problem was the noise. The service was great, the beds were great, the rooms were clean and cool and comfortable. Enjoy your stay! We will probably stay again, but ask for a quieter room.

Terrific place for a few days in Waikiki, room is clean and comfortable and staff are fantastic. They are willing to help out for any of your booking needs. Hotel is close to everything including the mall!

My friends and I were able to stay at the Equus Hotel in celebration of my birthday this past month. This is my third time at the Equus and I have to admit that I am never disappointed. The hotel is in the perfect location and it isnʻt overrun by to many tourists. We are also very close to many restaurants. The Chart House is in walking distance of the hotel and is a perfect place to have a nice dinner with your ʻohana.The staff of the hotel are so friendly and full of ALOHA. Puka and Renee are always so helpful and willing to help us with whatever we need. I am also glad that they have a nice continental breakfast during the weekend. I was so happy with everything that I shared a few Hawaiian songs with the front desk people that Friday evening at the Happy Hour.Mahalo Equus for the excellent service.
user_name:
Jonah S
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We recently had two short periods of stay around our main Kauai holiday.Our first arrival was late in the evening where we were confronted by having to drag our 2 suit cases up two flights of stairs in order to reach the lobby -not good for elderly legs! And no mention of it in their advertising.Having already booked in for the next stay we were prepared, only to find that arriving during the daytime there was a lad on duty to help us. From there it started to go downhill. We arrived at 2 pm (Check-in time advertised as 12 pm onwards) and were asked to wait while our room was prepared - an hour or so later we had to enquire as to progress. Finally we were told it was ready; however we had booked twin beds and were confronted by a single king-size, so back to the lobby for more words and rectification. Fortunately another guest had complained about wanting a single and being given a twin, so we were able to swap -after yet more preparation.The location was at the west end of Waikiki in easy walking distance of the Ala Moana Mall.

This place is awesome. First of all, the staff are more than accommodating from the moment you walk on property until you get into your airport shuttle to go home. They have a great texting concierge service that made planning your next adventure on the island easy to do from any location! The bed was the most comfortable place I've ever slept and I consider myself picky when it comes to bedding/mattresses. The Equus also offers complimentary shuttle and tickets to Hawaii Polo matches on Sunday.. plus VIP seating. The match is located on a different part of the island and a great private beach, it was so fun for me and my boyfriend to do with other guests at the hotel. The hotel is a very short walk to Waikiki beach, and the marina across the street were huge pluses too. We played on the beach and then would walk to the marina and watch surfers catching sunset waves. This hotel is really in the best location in Honolulu.. we loved every minute of our stay there!

A very nice small hotel (maybe 70 rooms total on 10 floors?). A great refreshing change to the usual chains. Great staff, very helpful. Excellently equipped classy rooms with fridge and keurigs. Location is a bit off Waikiki main, (which is a good thing!), but right next to the mall, and the beach is about 2 mins walk.

We stayed three days, room was very nice,the hair dryer did not work and covered with lint.Those who can not take steps, the entrance is up a flight of stairs.This was the only hotel on the trip that charged to print boarding passes, there was free Wi-Fi.

I had never stayed here before but bought a 2 day staycation deal coupon. So this weekend 3 friends decided to have a girl's weekend and off we went to The Equus Hotel. the Staff was so friendly, fun and informative from where we should eat to how to catch the Trolly we had a blast and will go back again. ALOHA to Rene and Kevin great staff. Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful.Send feedback

The N. Shore is the place to be..... but when headed to Waikiki for a getaway, the Equus is the place to be. The location is the best. In, but out of the mainstream, is what I liked. Aloha spirit, clean classy rooms with an equine motif, and comfort were all part of an enjoyable stay. I will recommend the Equus to my mainland and local friends as a true find for a getaway vacation. Check it out!

What the most impresses me is their customer service, no matter how you put forward requirements they will try their best to satisfied your need even more than what you asked for. They helped your requiring and made you feel you're back to home. Thanks for all you're help, specia thanks to the Rena.

I Love this little hotel! The Hotel staff was Amazing! When I checked I felt very welcomed and the staff had true aloha and ohana spirit! The room was clean and very relaxing! Loved the bed! The pool was relaxing as well! I come to Honolulu all the time and stayed at huge big name brand hotels and this little gem was a much better experience than many of the other huge hotels! If you wanna relax, be copse to great shopping the beach, and feel like you truly are a guest then I say please stay here! I will be back! Im so glad I found my hotel of choice when I come to Honolulu! Thank you so much for everything! Much love....Ejay

The room was small but in Honolulu aren't they all. Being alone in the room I didn't mind at all. The bed was extremely comfortable and the towels were thicker than the ones I have at home. I thought the Keurig brewer was a really nice touch. I do have one issue however. While I was there on business I really needed a desk and there wasn't one in my room. I can't remember the last hotel room I stayed in that didn't have one. There was a coffee/end table that I was told to use. While I did not reserve the cheapest room, I was advised that I would have to upgrade to get a desk and there no upgrade rooms available. I wish I would have known this in advance. Another suggestion I have is that if you are using a rental car call in advance of your arrival to get on the parking list. I had to park across the street the first night which was no more expensive than parking at the hotel just a little inconvenient. I understand this is Honolulu and parking is truly a luxury. I really enjoyed this hotel vs. where I usually stay and will readily stay here again. Just give me a desk!!

Really nice place. Kind of hard to find the entrance, poor signage and very limited parking. Maybe 20 stairs to get to the front desk and elevator but staff on hand waiting to help with luggage. Large clean room with balcony. Keeping the front door open caused an awesome cross breeze. 3rd floor room, outdoor common hallway, so both front and back doors yield fresh air. Wifi worked well, staff was very pleasant and helpful. Very convenient location near the beach. Huge shopping mall down the road if that's your thing but the ABC store half a block away has got it all. Keurig coffee machine was a nice touch. Would happily return.

First of all check in wasn't until 3 pm we arrived in Waikiki at 7 am and they got us into a room at that time with no extra charge. The décor is dated but the room was very clean, refreshed and restocked daily. The staff was very friendly and polite. Parking is very limited. Our overall experience was great!!

I stayed at the Equus on 4/23/14 and again on 5/4/14, since it was the only Choice hotel in Hawaii and I like racking up the Choice points. I wasn't expecting much, since it had such bad reviews here on TripAdvisor, but I was REALLY surprised at how clean and nice this hotel was. I will admit this is one of the harder hotels that I've ever had to find and I would recommend calling the desk ahead of time for them to tell you they are about 400 feet past McDonalds. And the parking is limited, but there's not much they can do about this either. But the room was spotless, beautifully decorated and had perfect and fast Internet. I found the front desk staff very helpful and wanting to go out of their way to make sure my stay was without a problem. They even sent up a sliced fresh pineapple when I asked for some ice. The hotel doesn't even mention they are only a five minute walk from one of the biggest shopping centers in Hawaii--that has 230 stores. It took me nearly two hours to talk past all the stores on a Sunday afternoon, without even stopping in a store. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel. If the previous reviews were accurate, then I think it is clear that the hotel has worked hard to improve its problems. I was impressed, and the value here is very good for Honolulu.

The Equus, being on the periphery of Waikiki, is near everything; without being in the MIDST of everything. Shopping (Ala Moana Centre), beaches, cocktail lounges, dining, marina. All within a 5-10 min. casual stroll.From parking, to check-in, to housekeeping; a smile and genuine aloha spirit exudes. Suite with kitchenette, marble countertops, comfy bed (slept better than at home), all maintained with high standards. Top drawer! Throughout the facility, the equine and paniola (cowboy) decor, compliments the island feel. Immaculately polished brass handrails to highly maintained handsome teak lanai (patio) furniture, beckons one to enter.Comfort, friendliness and a positive spirit abounds. We are keen on a return staycation. Mahalo to all. Kevan Scott, Haleiwa, Hi.

The Equus Hotel has great customer service. I have booked hotel stays numerous times over the last few years for employees and they are always pleased. The staff is always friendly. Thank you Rene for the extra help!

We stayed at this charming boutique hotel in March 2014. Unfortunately we were only there for a cple of days. The staff were wonderful. We were made to feel welcome from the moment of arrival. The room was clean, actually very charming. It is well worth staying there. It was within walking distance to many restaurants, stores and most importantly "the Beach".Yes, the furniture is not new or ultra modern but this is what adds to the comfy, warm feeling of staying there. Definately a spot we will return to and recommend to our friends.

We had a wonderful stay at The Equus. Their staff did an amazing job in making my wife and I feel welcome during our visit to Hawaii. They were extremely friendly and very accommodating. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. We now know where to stay when we go to Hawaii. We will definitely choose The Equus on our next visit as well. Keep up the great work!

We stayed in two different places in Waikiki. The Shoreline hotel, and The Equus. We had two different experiences, at the same price. Shoreline is really nice, with comfy - but really small - rooms, cleanliness at is best, and really really good location. But it is also quite impersonal. Wich Equus is not. Equus location is good because it is between Honolulu and Waikiki, and because Ala Moana center is very close. Otherwise, it is in a big road and very noisy. We enjoyed being in a more "hawaiian" hotel, with a very good staff, a well decorated room with a balcony. Negative point : bed was too soft, and we can feel that the carpet is definitely not brand new... In short, it is a good option if you want an hotel with a different note.

The Equus is a great place to stay in Waikiki. Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed. They even had a Keurig coffee machine, and supplied coffee daily. Close to the Waikiki Beach, 5 minute walk away. The Ala Moana Shopping Centre is only a 10 minute walk with lots of great shops. You can take the bus to Chinatown, where you can get souvenirs for half the price as at the stores. The ABC Store is just next door for anything you need. You don't need a car while there as there is a bus stop close by, for anything you don't want to walk to. When going on a bus excursion they will pick you up in front of the Hotel. The taxi ride from the airport was expensive, but when going back to the airport we booked a shuttle (at the front desk) for $20, $10 each. Every Friday evening they have fireworks at the beach, you don't want to miss this, it's amazing! Would love to go back to Waikiki.

The hotel was in the right location and its accommodations were awesome. Although it did not serve any breakfast, its location made it easy to remedy that predicament. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be down town and still far enough away to be able to breath.

Genuine, knowledgeable, helpful staff throughout. From phone reservation to booking shuttles to get me to Pearl Harbor, to finding the best bus routes to wander around town, to letting me freshen up in lobby restroom prior to departing to even carrying my bag to van. The staff is great. The rooms are nicely decorated and everything - room, bathroom, public spaces, front steps are spic-and-span clean. I don't know how they charge so little for this location, quality of property and service.A tip about getting food nearby. The Ala Moana Mall is within a ten minute walk and has tons of great local and cheap food. The three locations are spread throughout the Mall, so make sure you find what you're looking for. There's the "official" Makai Food Court with national & local fast food chains. Other national chains like Starbucks are within the Mall proper. But my favorite is the two floors of food within the SHIROYAKI department store, near Macy's and the end of the Mall nearest the Equus. Great, Japanese/Hawaiian local food, and a beer garden where they perch your own tankard of beer on your table. Aloha!

Just arrived from a tiring 20-hour flight from Singapore. It's just 9am and we're not expecting our room to be ready till after lunch, but we were lucky enough to be settled in our hotel room now and resting. Thanks so much to Puka & Rene who assisted us warmly. Our check in was a breeze, didn't even take longer than 10 mins! Plus our room is fab, very clean and we got wifi in the room! Our trip is just starting but already loving it here!

I have lived at the Equus/Waikiki Marina Hotel now for almost 2 years. The staff, led by Rene Kahumoku, is very kind and friendly. Rene always provides excellent service and will do everything she can to make both the guests and residents feel welcome and special. I also would recommend this hotel because of its location. It has close proximity to Ala Moana Mall (it is a block away) as well as Ala Moana Beach Park. There is an ABC store (like a 7-11) right on the corner which makes it convenient to get food, snacks, and small miscellaneous items. Fireworks can been seen from the hotel every Friday night. There are major bus lines that run right in front of the hotel so it is convenient for public transportation. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. It is nice and the rooms are aesthetically pleasing - but it is the people, the staff, that makes the difference. The staff is super-friendly and genuinely interested in making sure the guests/residents have a wonderful time during their stay.

The room is very large, which really helps when traveling with two teenagers. The bedding is more luxurious than those at comparably priced hotels, and the room is beautifully appointed. Our room was one floor above street level, but the traffic noise was acceptable--one does not go to Waikiki for peace and quiet, after all. The pillowtop mattress is soft, and a hit with my family, but impossible for me to sleep on because I need a firm mattress. I hardly slept more than three hours a night over our four-night stay. The bathroom counter is tiny and leaves little room for toiletries. The equally tiny basin has a gooseneck faucet that splashes water on my clothes and the floor, requiring a towel on the floor to absorb the water and a change of clothes after washing my face. The toilet is the loudest I've ever experienced in a hotel.

We stayed at the Equus for two nights en route from New Zealand to Canada. I found the hotel through aeroplan and booked mostly based on price. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was spotless and comfortable. The property is a small place and just as you go into Waikiki so away from some of the craziness but yet very well located near the Ala Moana mall and an easy walk to the downtown and the beach. Staff was very helpful and provided good service. One small note for guests with some disability there is a fairly long stair to get to the small lobby so you will need some balance and muscles to carry bags and yourself up. The bell boy was there quickly to help so was not a problem for us!Would recommend

I was very pleasantly impressed with the Equus Hotel. The rooms are quiet, very nicely appointed, and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki Beach, but if you wish to be on Waikiki Beach, it is a short 10 minute walk. One aspect of the location of the hotel that we loved was that it is just a few hundred yards from the Ala Moana Mall which is not only a primo shopping mall, but also has a food court with over 50 varieties of ethnic food in addition to some some fine dining restaurants. If I had to say some negative things about this hotel, I would have to say that that the building looks blah from the outside, although the entranceway is nicely done with a brass hand rail, and brass strips on the steps that are polished every day. The second negative might be that the lobby is on the second floor with no elevator to get to the lobby that I saw. All in all we loved this place and have booked a return visit for later this year.

For our vacation getaway, we decided to stay home and do a "Stay-cation." We came across the Equus Hotel in the Trip Advisor reviews and decided to give it a try. It is located just a short walk from numerous hotels, the beach, and the world-famous Ala Moana Shopping Center. The hotel has a short flight of stairs from the sidewalk to a small check-in desk. Don't let this fool you. The rooms/amenities and staff are a pleasant treat. The room was large, clean, plush, and comfortable. Towel sculptures (a swan and an owl) adorned our room. The staff was engaging and sincerely friendly, never to busy to chat with the customers. You just do not see this type of service in the hotel industry today. The hotel encourages the guests to "Text for Anything." I tried the feature and was not disappointed. The replies were nearly instantaneous and contained the same Aloha Spirit as my in-person conversations with the staff. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are several just a short walk away. The sounds from the street below travel upwards so it can be a little noisy, but overall, not bad. Mahalo Nui Loa Auntie Rene, Keo, Justin, and the rest of the Equus team. We'll be back!

My family and I stumbled upon the hotel and were overjoyed with how LOCAL this Hotel and Staff is. I was torn between staying at my favorite Hotel which is high end and pricey versus staying at the Equos. Staying at the Equos was one of the best decisions I made. Rene and hotel staff is pleasant, to work with. They were more than willing to make our stay a memorable one. The rooms are clean and relaxing. What hotel leaves a platter of pineapple with a personalized note - wishing my son an enjoyable time at his prom and telling us if there could be anything more they could do to enjoy our stay - EQUUS did !!!!! The location is great, major resturants, Alamoana shopping Center and Alamoana Beach is located walking distance from this Hotel. My family and I were so PLEASED with our stay, upon checking out, we booked a another 2 night staycation to enjoy during Easter weekend . This Hotel shares the essence of PURE ALOHA !!! J.y.g. And ohana

Staff Renee is awesome. She was able to help me with my booking and cancellation. I am very grateful that she was able to help me. I give the hotel and Renee 100 stars out of 10. Please support Renee and the hotel. Alot of aloha

I was looking for an affordable hotel in Waikiki so, after reading several great reviews on Tripadvisor, I chose the Equus. I was not disappointed. The small boutique hotel is well located for shopping, dining, the beach, etc. The room was small, but clean and well appointed (loved the four poster bamboo bed). The staff were very friendly and accommodating. A special shout out to Kiki, Rene and Justin who were all most helpful during my visit.My only advice would be to make sure you bring along a pair of ear plugs as the traffic noise is substantial. Also, be aware that there are two flights to stairs to climb (no elevator) to reach the hotel lobby. When my friend arrived, there was someone available to assist her with her luggage, but at the time I arrived, there was not.Overall, a fantastic stay.

We absolutely love this hotel! The rooms are very comfortable, quiet and clean. The Polo themed decor is a really cool - from the pictures and guestbook all the way to how they fold a small horse origami in your room, they really pay attention to fine detail. Rene, Paulo and the rest of the staff care to your every need and really make you feel special. Located at the beginning of Waikiki there are plenty of places to shop and eat nearby. The harbor is located a block away and offers spectacular sunset views for those who like to explore.

I found this hotel through kayak>amoma.com but had some issues with amoma.com. Amoma originally had reserved for three night and wanted to add an extra night. Had some issues adding an extra night and talked to customer service via email and phone at Amoma and they assured me that an extra night was added and processed. Checked my reservation a little while later and they still had me for three nights but charged me $122 for another night (which was never added). I called equus and spoke to an amazing staff member at the hotel named Rene. Originally they could not find my reservation dates or name at all, Rene found out the hotel was never booked in my name but in my gf's name (my guest which I listed) and it still stated I only reserved for three nights instead of four. She went the whole nine yards and more to investigate and see what was going on(called them and waited on phone and emailed them, told me to recheck bank acct, and did amazing follow ups via email and phone for two days). Eventually amoma contacted myself and Rene,they stated they would refund me the $122 because they charges for a night when there were no open rooms at that time (weird to charge for nothing).Never again will I book through Amoma, poor customer service, impossible to get a hold of them. It was very frustrating trying to get stuff processed but Rene assured and was by my side on top of everything and extremely friendly. She found out the problem and took her time to fix it(reserved an extra night for a lower price than Amoma's rate). I should of booked straight from hotel. Talking with Rene eased my mind because she showed professionalism, kindness, was thorough, & thoughtful. Wanted to say much mahalo to Rene. Appreciate all the help and aloha spirit through all the hecticness of me and my gf moving from Hawaii to Las Vegas. Much luck to you Rene! Aloha! :)

I stayed at the Equus in March 2014, and I must say this was the best Local hotel I could of chosen. I was welcomed with nothing less than a warm Hawaiian welcome and my arrival was given the very best attention that exceeded what was expected. The Equus in my experience, rendered to me as a customer more than what was paid for. I was greeted by Ms. Renne and the entire staff was so pleasant and helpful. While I was checking in,, my bags were taken to my room and everything was set up for me without me even noticing that it was being done as I couldn't keep up with the swiftness of the service. The Equus is a very nice clean and comfortable Hawaiian Hotel that makes you feel at home. It is located on Ala moana Blvd., which is near to the Ala moana shopping center and near to Waikiki Beach. Just a few minutes walking and everything about a great stay in Hawaii is at your reach. They even helped me with my tours on the Island, like the Polynesian Center Tour and the Island Tour, and was very helpful to provide information about any questions that I had. The rooms are very nice and they have a wonderful staff who attends to whatever your needs are in a very prompt manner. I must say that I had such a wonderful time at the Equus that after returning home I had to call them to say Thank You for making our stay the most wonderful experience we could of ever imagine of having in Hawaii. My name is Nick and when you stay there ask for Renne or Packu, They are just a few of the wonderful people on the entire staff.

We visited Hawaii for two weeks in March 2014 and our first few days were spent at the Equus. While in Hawaii we stayed at the Equus, Hilton, Marriott and Hyatt (we used points earned during previous business travel for everything but the Equus)The Equus is a quaint boutique hotel on Ala Moana in Waikiki. The rooms, while small, are well equipped and very well maintained. The hotel is well staffed with helpful, friendly personnel. Wi-Fi is fast, reliable and FREE! This property, all things considered is the best value in Waikiki. When you visit Waikiki you don't spend any time in a hotel. You walk around, go to the beach, shop, and hit the bars and the restaurants. Stay at the Equus for less than half of what you would spend at any other property and use the savings to enjoy Waikiki.I give this property a five star PLUS! I will stay there again on my next visit to Waikiki.

Mahalo to puka, rene and jackie for making me and my family feel at home, always going over and beyond, my housekeeper fely for doing an excellent job with her service, I will come back to this hotel. I will also let my friends and family know about the equus.

Rene, the property manager, was great and she took great care of us and made sure we were happy and comfortable. The room on the 10th floor was nicely decorated and very large for what I've experienced in the area. Highly recommended. Convenient. Affordable. The only negative is the parking situation.

I recently stayed at the Equus hotel with my best friend and it exceeded all of our expectations. The room accommodations were beautiful. The staff were so friendly, attentive and helpful. Especially the front desk manager "Rene." She was the queen of aloha spirit. The location of the hotel was great. Really close to all the main attractions. And compared to other hotels it was very affordable. I am definitely staying here again the next time I visit Oahu!

Older hotel - rooms have been remodeled and are very nice. flat screen tv, nice furniture, good bedding Close to business and Ala Moana Shopping center. we were there for 2 nights for business - it had a great rate and was conveniently located. Unfortunately due to the street noise the rooms facing the street were noisy all night, limiting sleep.no restaurant but rooms had small refrigerator and 1/2 block from ABC store.Good for a quick business trip -- tiny pool, not a place to try to lounge around the pool

I had stayed with this boutique hotel for three nights, the guest services agents were on top with my requests and had made sure it was delievered to my room without an waiting period. My housekeeper which I believe is Romero,(handsome young man) he had done an amazing job servicing my room starting from my bed to the restroom. Where he had organized the amenties, towels and the whole room as if it was my first night at the Equus. They made me feel if I was at home at an higher standard. Would definitely recomend this hotel. Just one problem, the street noise but overall my stay was spectacular.
user_name:
cilla9
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: After reading the reviews, we chose The Equus Hotel for our month-long stay in Oahu. We're glad we did! Guest Services host Puka has been very accommodating to our party of three, which includes a disabled person. He ensures that all our needs are met, with the assistance of his gracious staff. Our room is comfortable, clean and cozy and we are not disturbed by ongoing traffic.The location is excellent, close to Ala Moana Beach Park and the shopping center, as well as downtown Honolulu. We are still here, and look forward to having a most pleasurable stay!
user_name:
Marilyn K
Atlantic City, New Jersey

review_body: Stayed one night and were booked for 7. Really welcoming staff and bed super comfortable. Newly furnished room too and very clean. Problem was the 6 Lane traffic on the street below was constant! No sound proofing and sleep was difficult even with ear plugs! Staff were very gracious about us checking out. So if you need relative quiet don't stay here. We were moved to floor 9 and still couldn't stand the traffic din.

Loved this hotel! We are locals and it's nice to stay downtown in a place that does not have a lot of tourists. They paid so much attention to detail in the way they furnished the rooms, including towels folded into birds and swans awaiting our arrival. Definitely recommend this hotel to both tourist and local people!

OMG what a place to stay! Had such a ball here as the staff were amazing and hours of conversations with them. Rooms were modern and always kept clean by the cleaner. It is really close to the shopping mall and to the main square. Very family orientated but also good for business with some spectacular views. If you here for a long time or just a stop inn - stay here!!

Nice, clean and comfortable hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. Bed is comfortable, showers are great and the air works wonderfully. Only reason not a 5 is the street noise. We did okay with it but light sleepers might not

Select you goal good for seeing the island, close to cruise ship terminal, Ala Mona plaza where there is The Bus terminal, close to Waikiki beach and Ala Mona Beach which is better and centrally locatedStaff make this small and cozy hotelnote good for bleachers or families who have young children as it is a drag to deal with the traffic on Ala Mona Blvd Plus no foodgreat coffee in the room with milk sugar and cookiesThere is a frig so you can go to ABC store one block on the levy of entrance to get everyone which includes breakfast lunch and light supper. Cheap wine and expensive beer is availableavoid second floor. Convent but very noisy. Cannot open window due to street noise. we arrived late for 4 days before we bordered a world cruise with Crystal. Although we asked for a quiet room at the back not so lucky as they were full and we were last ones in. Room 208. Was large but needs some colour, over looked parking lot and Ala Mona Blvd. real disappointment but after 18 hrs flying from Kingston we just wanted to sleep in their very comfy bed

Small boutique hotel that has recently been redone with lovely linens and furnishings. There is no restaurant, which is a bit of a drawback,but the staff makes up for that. They are all so helpful and pleasant to deal with. The concierge duo of Danielle and Chad were really marvelous in helping four of us plan our days and get around Honolulu. It is one of the closest Waikiki hotels to Pearl Harbor and a good value, as well.

Great location; about a block or 2 from Waikiki beach, but can't see it from the hotel. Excellent value - tiny (about 60 rooms on 9 floors), but the room was great, and restaurants and services just down Ala Moana.

Tho I had made an error in booking reservations for 2 rooms, Puka & Rene were incredibly calm & helpful in correcting it & getting us settled into their lovely boutique hotel. Bellman Romero was "everywhere" making sure our bags were stowed until the issue was straightened out. This hotel is a small island of calm in what has become the jungle of Honolulu. Walk into the gorgeous lobby & it's like you're in another world. Yet when you exit onto the street there are several great restaurants & a McDonalds within a 1/4 mi one way & Ala Moana Mall within walking distance the other. Trolleys to go anywhere you could want to go just across the road, & a beach within walking distance. Airport suttle right to the door. All with beatifully appointed rooms with coffee,tea @ your fingertips. Concierge Danielle was also very helpful in taking care of some airliine hangup, we only wish she had been there earlier in the month to take care of booking our tours. Definetly would return here in a heartbeat.

The Equus Hotel is in a great location being on the edge of Waikiki and within walking distance of central Waikiki, Ala Moana Mall and and many places to eat. It is also very convenient to buses that take you to Diamond Head, downtown Honolulu, Pearl Harbor and the airport. From street level you have to climb a flight of stairs to get to the lobby and elevator. The elevator is very slow but you'll get where you are going eventually. The room itself was very nicely decorated and clean. There was also a balcony although the main sight you can see is the building directly across from it. You can easily hear the traffic noise coming up from the street which probably won't keep you up but which you can often hear. There is a small refrigerator in the room along with a K-cup coffee maker which you sometimes need to ask to be replenished.Interestly there is also a very small pool off of the lobby although we never saw anyone in it.

I come to Hawaii 3 times a year on business and every so often I get adventurous and try a new hotel. the Bad: Parking off site about a block away and $20/ day. Not handicapped friendly so if you have lots of luggage and/ or are old you will battle a flight of stairs. And no desk to work from. Room was clean bed is comfortable and they have complimentary wi-fi.

I have stayed here several times now, and place is always consistent! Helpful staff at check in and during stay! Always there to answer any questions and guide you in right direction. Location is ideal as Waikiki beach is few blocks away. Plenty of good restaurants close by, whether it be big name or good chain steak house. Most if all, it is a fabulous "Value" and rooms are comfy as can be! A liitle noise from main drag Ala Moana Blvd, but that dies down in evening!

The Good: Friendly staff, good location. The Bad: Booked a King Deluxe, but put in a Bamboo Queen - charged for the King Deluxe!. Still waiting for a refund on the rate difference. Surprised at having to carry luggage up a flight of stairs to get to the lobby and elevator. Cleanliness was a problem in the shower and around and under the bed. Tip: Probably not a good idea to look under the bed in any hotel - this one was particularly gross. Thankfully we were only there two nights.

We are in an Equus unit in the Marina Towers for a month. After two weeks we can say the service has been excellent. Fely (Felicia) for example has provided excellent service in cleaning our room. Other staff have provided us with extra towels, resloving a problem with the T.V. and patiently giving us the code again for internet access. All of our encounters with Equus staff have been pleasurable. We look forward to our final two weeks in our unit.

I've been to Hawaii many times and this trip I had the pleasure of staying at the Equus Hotel in downtown Honolulu. To begin, the location of the hotel is really great - one block from Waikiki beach and one block from the big Ala Moana shopping mall, plus lots of restaurants. My room was spacious and kept meticulously clean by Ricky. And the bed was very comfortable. I usually find it difficult to sleep the first night in a new place, but not this time. There is parking under the hotel which is an added plus. Also, getting to and from the H1 highway is very direct making it very easy to get around, something I can't say for other hotels I've stayed at. The staff was always friendly and would go out of their way to help in any way. While this is not a five-star hotel located on Waikiki beach, you will not pay a five-star price. In short, this is a great hotel and I would definatlely stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone else.

This was a birthday getaway and a really good find. It's close to everything as far as transportation, restaurants, stores and the room was cozy. Staff was excellent.The price was budget friendly and although I could see some of the ocean from my room, views may be more city like.

Loved the Equus hotel! It's very conveniently located on the edge of Waikiki, a stone's throw from the Ala Moana shopping center. The Equus hotel was welcoming, clean, and the staff are friendly and efficient. The ambiance and decor were very impressive. If you're bored with generic hotels, this is the place to stay. For anyone with a love of horses, a must! Every wall has beautiful paintings and pictures including photographs of Hawaiian equine heritage. I stayedin a lovely suite, which had beautiful furnishings and personal touches (such as throw rugs on the couch) which made it very comfortable. I slept really well in a giant and and extremely comfortable bed........Finally, I would like to mention not only is the Equus luxurious but Eco friendly right down to the toiletries in the modern bathroom.

Hotel was nice, good price and location. Staff was very helpful and friendly. John helped us to do some trips and surfing lessons. We stayed 23 nights, and there were no place to put our clothes or dry swimmingshorts and bikinis.( 4 people) But beds were good and clean and airconditioner worked.Good place for travellers.We booked from internet, and no disappointments. Our teenagers liked too, and wi-fi worked ok !Beach and cityholiday in the same !!!Good restaurants near for breakfast and dinners. Many Mahalos to John and Rene,hope to see you again.Happy family from Finland :) :)

Wow - what a great location! The staff was extra courteous and friendly . My room was nicer than expected and the bed very comfortable. I also really enjoyed all the fantastic historic photos displayed inside and outside the rooms. Definitely recommend staying at the Equus I know I'll be back!

Nice and cheap, close to everything, dealt with John during our stay and he couldn't have been friendlier, he took the time to show us around town and was really informative, definitely coming back, thanks for a great stay guys :)

it was nice to be close to the beach. we got one bedroom appt. the ceiling a bit low, what gives u claustrophobic feeling. a bit insects, but who cares, to be in honolulu and stay at the room?a bit dirty as well.

My husband and I had a great time here we were sorry that we had to leave! We were treated with good care and the day of our wedding hotel staff surprised us with the best rooms they got for free! I love it and would come again anutime

I missed a flight to Maui so booked this hotel as it is a Choice property. The bellman greeted me outside and gave me a glass of pineapple juice in a frozen glass as I was checking in. Yoshi checked me in and gave me dinner options just a block away.
