Yoshi recognized my status with Choice and immediately upgraded my room.After I settled into the room, the bellman knocked on my door and had a half pineapple on a plate for me; wasn't expecting that. The room had a Keurig coffeemaker, refrigerator, really cool rustic old world Hawaiian decor, and real comforable bed. The staff makes it clear the guest is the reason for the superb service.

We arrived a little late and was greeted by two helpful bellman who assisted us with luggage to our room. Check in was smooth, the room was beautiful and clean. Immediately after we arrived to our room, a welcome amenity was delivered by the same bellman that assisted us. I then received a text from the hotel welcoming us and letting us know that we could call them if we needed assistance. On check out I received another e-mail thanking us and welcoming us back to the hotel.I would definitely recommend this hotel if you would like to experience that home away from home feeling.

My wife and I travel to the Big City twice a year to celebrate our birthdays & our wedding anniversary. We have found "An Oasis in a Concrete Jungle!" What we appreciate most about the Equus Hotel is the Family Aloha spirit that you'll experience as soon as you arrive. The location of the Boutique Hotel is perfect for staying out of the "hustle & bustle" of the Big Big City! The island decor and very comfortable beds leaves you refreshed! We highly recommend this Equus Oasis to not only visitors but to Kamaaina's as well :)

I had only three days on Oahu and The Equus hotel and the staff made those three days as amazing as possible. Yoshi at the front desk checked me in not only the fastest check in I've ever had.. but also told me where I could go for the night. I came in so late but didn't want to waste an evening at the same time not knowing where to go I didn't know what to do... he told me about three great local bars that were still serving food within walking distance and then gave me the hint to find this great beach beach just two blocks away. The next day ready to go but not knowing where a man named Romeo saw me looking at a island map and guide in the garage and told me about this really cool local beach I could drive to where there wasn't any tourist ( and it wasn't in my island guide btw)... not only were there no tourist there but other than myself and two other people there was no one else on the beach at all it wasn't too hard to find either and it was an amazing afternoon I felt like I had the island to myself. My last day I had a easy late check out but still sometime before my flight left... I was telling the man at the front desk while checking out I believe his name was Puka which I just thought was so cool, and he told me about a hike I could do on my way to the airport it was only an hour really easy walk almost the whole way but a beautiful waterfall at the end,... I couldn't believe it was the perfect end to a too short of a trip but I Thank Puka for that it was awesome.. I really cant wait to return to Oahu and The Equus. My room was beautiful the staff was amazing, it really was just a great experience.

Front dest John was very helpful and friendly. Also the manager Renne helped me alot and I am so greatful to be serviced with an amazing manager who is going the extra mile for their guest. This is a hotel with a Aloha service. Thank you guys

We were very impressed by the Equus its so friendly and welcoming it made my husband and my self feel very welcome . The rooms were very comfortable and relaxing and very clean. The staff were really friendly and couldn't do enough for us. I would like to say thank you very much to Kika John , Clarence, Romero Jaquie and all the other people l haven't jotted down. We can't wait to go back from Heather & Steve from Aussie

Great staff, excellent customer service. The room was clean and tidy, bed was very comfy and big what you see on the pictures is what you get. Concierge John went particularly out of his way to make us and another guest feel welcome and valued as a customer. John took the time to advise us about places to visit. All the staff where there to meet us with a smiley face on our way in or out of the hotel. The family owned culture within the hotel really shines through. Highly recommended. location is 5 minutes walk from the Ala Moana mall and there are buses that take you everywhere.

Although I would prefer a vacation rental outside the hustle and bustle of Honolulu, I was on a tight budget during my most recent trip to Oahu. We (my husband, 6 month old baby, and self) chose the Equus as our home base. Our room (two double beds with a mini fridge on the 8th floor) faced other hotels and the marina. Our total for five nights with taxes plus parking was just over $650, which is a steal in Waikiki. The room wasn't too noisy, it was clean and had decent water pressure. The customer service was excellent. The folks at the front desk and the concierge were very friendly and helpful. The only things that might be negative (which were not issues for us at all) were that you have to climb a flight of stairs to get to the front desk. I could be mistaken but I did not see an elevator to get to the front desk. So if you have a lot of bags or are unable to walk this could be a problem. The other issue was that there are only about ten parking spaces under the hotel. These are $20 a day. There is parking across the street for the same price. We were able to get a parking space on site for each of the six days that we were there. The location was very close to the Waikiki Beach the Hilton resort complex with all of its restaurants and shops. The next time we have to stay in Honolulu for budget reasons we will definitely return to this friendly hotel. It was a very good value.

I was impressed when I first walked in. There is great attention to detail I really appreciated the time they put in to making me feel welcome. The room was so beautiful and the beds were super comfortable I slept like a baby. There was an awesome Kurig and little fridge with a freezer which came in handy! I loved the huge mirrors all over it made getting ready a much smoother process. I would definitely recommend it to all of my friends and anyone who comes to visit Oahu.

It's the little things that count. After arriving from Chicago for a 1 week trip in Hawaii, I was greeted with juice while I was checking in. I stayed here only 2 nights of my trip and had a pleasant experience. The room was neat and clean with the best shower (awesome water pressure!) you could ever ask for after a long day at the beach. I would stay here again for sure.Nick - Chicago, IL

Spent three days in this hotel as a "staycation." The close proximity to shopping, beach and restaurants was wonderful. And the staff were accommodating to all our needs with aloha. I hope to return in the near future. Mahalo.

Great location, walking distance to shopping, beach and restaurants! Beautiful, clean rooms. Comfy beds, updated decor and nice balcony. Wonderful staff, helpful and make you feel comfortable! Will stay again when we go back!

Clean rooms, Beautiful décor, and extremely wonderful guest service. Absolutely love the waterfall in the main entrance, and the pictures in the waiting room. Right down the street from all the shopping you could want to do, not far from the beach, and bus depot. Easy in and out access parking. Love this little gem and planned to stay there every time I visit my family in Wahiawa.

Need clean, firm bed, and a super showerHotel Equus surpasses alleasy in & out Waikiki can be a mess --- close to a big mall and beachThe staff works at making one feel like a GUESTMahalo nui loa from Hawaii

Let me start with we go on vacation we DO NOT spend the week or two in the room. That having been said, this hotel is WONDERFUL. The rooms are beautiful and the beds beyond comfortable. Out of the mainstream Waikiki, right on the edge which made it great. Walk down the block and you have everything, bus service, car rentals, fast food, slow food, and the nightlife/daylife of Waikiki. Within walking distance also is the Ala Moana Shopping Center and the convention Center.The staff is helpful and go out of their way to be of service. I have stayed in larger hotels where I paid double to triple the amount that The Equus cost and not had nearly as much service and been as comfortable as there. This hotel treats you like family and makes you feel like you are the only person staying there with their attentiveness. Definitely a place to come "home" to at the end of the day and anytime you are on Oahu. As their sign says "E Como Mai" (welcome home). Aloha spirit takes on a whole new meaning from check-in to check out.

I loved the fact that this is a boutique hotel! Rene helped me to problem solve before I even arrived on location. The staff was attentive and helpful. It is a green hotel, which makes the stay even nicer. I stayed for 6 nights and found my room to be comfortable. Yes, it is on Ala Moana Blvd., but that makes it easy if you're walking to the beach or restaurant or driving to the H1 to go to another part of the island. It was an absolutely terrific place to stay. Thank you to Rene and her staff for helping me to make my stay perfect in Hawaii!

We were a little nervous when we booked this hotel because it seemed like a wildcard, being a boutique hotel and having conflicting online reviews, but as soon as we checked in we knew we had struck gold! We stayed in the one bedroom suite (for which I could hardly find any reviews) and it was awesome. The bedroom was very spacious with plenty of room to open all of our (many) suitcases and still walk around. There was a nice leather recliner by the window. The furnishings were tasteful and the bed was extremely comfortable (I am picky)! There was a real door to close, so I could sleep while my spouse had the lights on in the other room (main room). The main room was a combination of a living room (couch + coffee table + a giant TV screen) /dining room (round table + 2 chairs) plus an eat-in kitchen. There was also a partial ocean view from this room. The kitchen had a microwave, a fridge AND a (big) wine cooler, a Keurig coffee maker, nice granite countertops and 4 barstools (in case you invite guests?). Too bad we didn't see pictures of this before we booked, though I can see pictures NOW on the website (so y'all can have a look a priore, not like me who went in blind). This room was on the 10th floor (top) and for someone like me who prefers to take the stairs most of the time, it was nice that the building stairs were accessible at all times and were lit at all times (not by motion sensors like most Waikiki hotels). Since the lobby is on 2, it was only 8 short flights up and down, far quicker than the elevator.Now about the staff. They were the best. Attentive, available, very pleasant, and also able to keep their distance when we didn't need anything. There is clearly someone on staff who is very good at origami, because there were pieces of paper AND TOWELS shaped like animals all over the rooms. I've never stolen anything from any hotel in my life, but I was very tempted to take the towel folded in the shape of a duck home with me :)There was a professional photographer at the hotel when we were there (who tried to grab me into some shots - I declined), so hopefully that means more pictures will be online, which I think is great.The pool barely exists, but I didn't care (there's an ocean, yo). The hotel is not in the hub of waikiki but almost at the edge, right by the canal. That was fine for me, but if your plan is to experience Waikiki 100% of the time then you might want to be more centrally located. Other than that I have nothing else to caveat.

Little concerned about the hotel given location right on Ala Moana blvd. Found the hotel to be very well maintained, great room (little small) clean well appointed. The staff was excellent. Two drawbacks, with windows open you will hear traffic, however I've been in places in Waikiki that charged twice as much and had worse noise. Oddly accessing the hotel from the parking area is a little bit of a challenge. From parking to the lobby you go out to the street down the sidewalk and up two short flights of stairs and then into the lobby. It was easy but if you have any mobility issues at all it could be difficult. With all that said for $130 a night including tax and parking in Waikiki it was a great value for a quality place. No question I will be back.

We had a great weekend here - the room was comfortable and the staff at this hotel are the best! The hotel is located in an area that is within walking distance of Ala Moana's mall and beach park. There are also a lot of really good restaurants in the area which make a night out on the town very convenient. We also loved the polo theme!

Renee checked us in & she was so very warm and welcoming! Decor & furniture was very handsome & beautiful..yes both.:-) Manalo served us delicious welcome drinks & happy hours special while we met other guests. Relaxing, lovely & a great ending to our trip..perfect.

I have visited Oahu, so far, on six occasions, usually as a stopover on the way home from the US, and on the last three occasions have stayed at The Equus, simply due to the value for money, décor and location. I have a serious dislike of gaudy floral patterns and bamboo furniture, so the first time I checked in to the Equus was a delight. Love that "European" styling. The rooms are lovely, with a relaxing colour scheme, comfortable bed and good sized flat screen tv, refrigerator and coffee machine. The location is very handy for the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, which is a hub for the public buses and has a large food court and Waikiki is a comfortable walk away. I have to agree with previous comments regarding the noise, on my last visit particularly I noticed the noise from traffic on Ala Moana Boulevard. Aside from the traffic noise, this hotel is a little gem.

We did an overnighter at the The Equus, and my daughter and her friends had a fun time swimming in the pool, going on a Selfie Scavenger Hunt in Waikiki and watching the Friday night fireworks rooftop on the 40th floor at the Waikiki Marina Tower next door. Best view in Waikiki! Renee and her team were awesome and made sure our rooms were ready and spotless. They even had fresh pineapple waiting for us upon check in for the special occasion. For happy hour (which I learned the hotel does on Thursdays and Friday afternoons), Justin poured some delicious pineapple guava drinks for the birthday girl and all her friends on the hotel's lanai before they walked over to the Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon for an afternoon swim. In the morning, the girls enjoyed a short walk to IHOP for breakfast. We've done birthday sleepovers at The Equus for the past two years and plan to keep coming back! Thank you for another great stay!

I am in the last few days of my (nearly) month long stay at the Equus Hotel in Waikiki, and my stay here was nothing short of what I'd want from a hotel. The staff was always friendly, helpful, and caring. They made me feel like family from the first day I was here. It is not a 5-star hotel, but I received much more than I expected for the price paid. The location of the hotel is ideal....just over a block from beaches in two directions, a block from the mall, and walking distance to MANY restaurants. It is at the Ala Moana side of Waikiki, meaning it is still near the 'craziness' of the heart of Waikiki (walking distance), but far enough away to enjoy some peace and quiet too. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, and I am sure at some point in the future I will. Mahalo to all the Equus staff for making my stay enjoyable!

We stayed at Equus for 6 days and loved it. The hotel has a mesmerizing décor and a lovely atmosphere that keeps you engaged. The staff is the best thing about Equus as they keep you entertained with their chats and their enthusiasm is infectious. Rene was a delight to converse with and was very helpful. The hotel is a great budget hotel that, for us, made for a comfortable stay.

According to the reviews I read, I asked for a room on a high floor at the back of the hotel. We had a double/double on the 7th floor and it was very comfortable although without a lanai (which wasn't a surprise). Staff was very good. Because of the location of the building on the Ewa side of Waikiki and the canyon effect of the high rises, it is very noisy. Newer buildings in Honolulu have noise proofed their windows and walls, but Equus has not. Still, this is a great value for your money in Honolulu and I'd stay here again for a few days.

I stayed here for 7 days on business and I can't say enough of how welcoming and professional the staff is. I love it because it's not your "run of the mill" hotel. Warm atmosphere and vibe. Trust me I travel around 300 days a year for work, and it's such a breath of fresh air to find a hotel like The Equus. Do yourself a favor and stay here, you'll definitely love it!

great location and service - although lots of street noise, we slept well with comfy beds and dark rooms. appreciated the fridge and in room coffee. most of all the staff is fabulous and it was actually the people that worked here that made it so special! impressive

The hotel's location was generally well situated and the rooms clean and pleasant. However, the rooms were pretty noisy because of traffic and some of our party had a difficult time sleeping. Overall a nice hotel, but the noise factor should be considered, particularly if you are a light sleeper.

I absolutely loved this place! I had the Executive King room. The rate was excellent. A short walk to the beach. 2 block walk to an Amazing Mall!! Rene at the front desk was the best!! I can't wait to go back!!

This hotel is in the perfect location - a block from the water and walking distance from Ala Moana and tons of restaurants, etc. Very nice rooms, clean, parking is easy and an excellent value. But the best part is the friendly staff. They really make you feel like part of the ohana, which makes the trip so much more enjoyable. This is the only place I will stay in Waikiki! Highly recommend.

This boutique hotel has exquisite decor and style, extremely comfortable beds, and has one of the best locations for shopping and browsing Waikiki. It's on the up-and-coming end of Waikiki which is just another benefit to stay at! But even more than the comfort and location, the staff is amazing! They're all helpful, friendly and professional, but treat you like family! All of the staff gave great advice on places to visit and to make sure to see! I don't get the chance to stay in hotels very often, but I would highly recommend The Equus Hotel as it is not only unique but you'll feel right at home!

This cozy and quaint boutique hotel, goes above and beyond to make you feel right at home during your stay. The staff is very friendly and helpful and overall I would highly recommend staying here. Can't beat the price for the amenities and the location.

This hotel styles itself as a boutique hotel with a bamboo-polynesian theme, plus horses. It felt a tad strange to me, but that was minor. The location is excellent, one block away from the water, a few blocks over to the main Waikiki beach. Figure a ten minute walk. Parking was a worry but the clerk said they don't sell (it's an extra daily fee, like all hotels in the area) more slots than they have (I counted 13). But it's really only suitable for small cars. There also is a public garage across the street.The room had two chests of drawers, 3 drawers each, plus smaller drawers in the night tables, and a closet. I found the bed very soft, but I find that at most hotels. There are plenty of restaurants and stores nearby - you have the whole Waikiki hotel/tourist district. Because of the orientation of the rooms you do get noise from Ala Moana Blvd, but that seemed to drop off about midnight.Pros: in-room coffee maker (a Keurig!!), in room safe (with a key, not electronic though), and good service when I needed more hangers. There is a small outdoor terrace. Refrigerator in the room without mini-bar (I hate those). Good shower with pressure and hot water, and plush soft towels.Cons: the icemaker is down in the lobby, the chairs were not very comfortable, and the table was a bamboo style so the rounded pieces are not a good writing surface. The lighting wasn't very good, especially for reading. And some small things that show lack of attention to detail - drawers that didn't close properly and in all the days there the cleaning person never replaced (or moved or cleaned) my water glasses - that seemed strange I've never had that happen anywhere else. But overall I had a good stay, and the location is excellent. I would stay there again if the price was good.
user_name:
ral338
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband & I stayed here for three days & we enjoyed the comforts of our room, Beautiful decor, (pillow top beds), great location for shopping at Ala Moana which is a walking distance away, & nearby restaurants for dining. What we appreciated the MOST was the friendly & very helpful staff who treated us like family with the "Aloha Spirit" that Hawaii is famous for!!! The front desk Manager Rene was very helpful & knowledgeable in recommending places to see, visit & dine. We highly recommend The Equus Hotel for our memorable stay & it's "Aloha Spirit!"

Aloha To Our Friendly Customer Service Agents "HAUNANI" "PUKA" "KEO" "JUSTIN" "JACKIE" Yes, we call Your STAFFS CSA'S Because that's what THEY ARE!!! We go there so often that we know Them by Their NAMES!!! They always Treat Us Like OHANA when we go OAHU!! You should be so Proud to Have WORKERS Like THEM!!! My Husband & I always stay @ Your Beautiful EQUUS HOTEL.....We just LOVE it there & We Love Our Room #208...yep that's Our Favorite Room!! Your Hotel is so Convenient Close to everything where we wanna go & visit. So People out there in the World, If You ever Plan a Trip to OAHU....Please CHECK In To The EQUUS Hotel....You'll Be GREETED By Their Friendly STAFFS, You'll Be Comfortable & Feel So @ Home on Your Vacation!!!! Mahalo CSA"S For Your Awesome HOSPITALITY & YES, We Will Be BACK!!!! Aloha Nui, Ed & Momi Kekaula

The hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Honolulu! Everything you would need within walking distance or just a short cab ride. Nicely styled clean rooms and a pool!Very nice stay! Very affordable and highly recommended. The beds are super comfy too!

The room was nice sized, although the bath was a little small, only one person at a time. Well furnished with good AC. One block to the Ala Moana shopping mall and a short walk to the beaches. The desk staff was helpful. Price was affordable for Hawaii. There were half a flight of steps to the check-in...a little hard to manage with luggage, but half way up, staff offered to carry it up. One elevator that was slow. There is a laundromat one block away for those needing to wash/dry clothes.

My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights in October 2013. We arrived far too early to check in but the staff sorted out a room for us anyway and we're lovely about it. When our TV and air con wouldn't work we were promptly moved into the working room right next door. The rooms themselves were exactly what we expected, comfortable and pretty basic but exactly what we needed as a base. It would have been great to have a jug/kettle though. Its not the closest hotel to the beach, and the street is noisy at night but the staff are wonderful and its not far to walk anyway. The ABC store on the corner was a lifesaver too. The staff made us cocktails several nights we were there and we had a great time chatting with them. Lovely people.

We moved here after four nights in central Waikiki and prefer this location near the Waikiki Marina. It's more upscale and is distant from the noise and chaos of Kuhio Street. You can walk to downtown Waikiki Beach in 15 minutes, or ride The Bus.Check-in is 3:00 pm. When we arrived shortly after noon Friday, our room was not yet ready, so the front desk staff stored our luggage while we went to Diamond Head.Our first night here, the hospitality staff was serving complimentary Mai Tai's (no limit per guest) in the outdoor lounge next to the lobby. This is their custom every Thursday and Friday evening. Each one of the half dozen staff members we met is incredibly friendly, helpful, personable. We enjoyed meeting some of the other hotel guests during cocktail hour.The décor here is equestrian themed. Furnishings are beautiful. We were shown two types of rooms - The Bamboo Room, which has one queen bed, and a king room. I loved the Bamboo Room décor, but we guessed that my very tall husband would bang his head on the 4-poster frame if he got up during the night, so we chose the king room. Our room on the 6th floor has gorgeous views from the balcony, where two can sit at the patio table and enjoy the weather. Both nights we've left the sliding door wide open because the ocean breeze here is magnificent. No air conditioning needed. The king bed is exquisite ... just soooo comfortable. Several pillow choices facilitate finding just the right one for pleasant dreams.The king room is somewhat crowded, with all the furnishings, and we had to get creative to place all of our luggage where it would be accessible, but we found nooks for all four pieces. One entire wall of the room is mirrors, so you don't get a claustrophobic feeling at all.The king room has a cute wood mini-dinette table with two chairs, a bureau for clothes, two night stands, and a full size luggage bench. The kitchenette counter area is pretty granite with a Keurig coffee maker and Newman's organic coffees. The hotel actually provides raw sugar (hurray!) and Half & Half, instead of the cheap stuff you usually find with hotel coffee service.The mini-refridge has a freezer so you can bring ice cream up to your room ! No microwave though, so drink your coffee before it cools.The bathroom is smallish, with the vanity/sink area separate from the shower/toilet section. There is no tub so, if you want a soak, you have to go down to the first floor "Refresh" pool. Towels are thick and fluffy, and our housekeeper left us her personal greeting - a chickadee she made out of washcloths ! We delight in those little "above and beyond" services. I love the toiletries - non-toxic Earth Tempo brand. And they actually supply body wash, along with the usual bar soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion. A step above 90% of other hotels in this respect. The free Wi-Fi connection actually works here, unlike the last hotel, which saves money on visits to Starbucks. The wall-mounted flat screen TV is only about 27 inches, but I doubt most visitors to Hawaii are sitting in their hotel rooms watching TV, so screen size is not very relevant. The safe is the old-fashioned kind with a key. Don't lose your safe key because the hotel will have to charge you $50 to replace it. I'd read some complaints about the elevator, but we've had no problem with it. There is only one elevator for ten floors, so sometimes it takes awhile to arrive. But there's no problem whatsoever traveling up and down, and it's certainly not in danger of breaking down. There is no fitness center or restaurant on site, but dozens of restaurants are within a ten minute walk in either direction. I believe the only private gym in Waikiki is 24 Hour Fitness (15-minute walk), and you can pay on a per visit basis if you must work out during your stay. My one complaint would be that there is no recycle bin in the room, since this is a bronze level "green" hotel. But that won't keep me from staying at Equus next time we return to Oahu. This is a fantastic little gem in an area of the city where most lodging is ridiculously overpriced.

We stayed at The Equus hotel October 20-31, 2013. The hotel is not on the beach but it's close to Waikiki beach to the left and across the street and the Ala Moana beach & park to the right another 15 minute walk. Ala Moana beach & park is a huge park with a walking path all around it, very nice for jogging or taking a walk, the beach area is good also.The hotel has 10 floors and it's on a busy street, try to get a room high and at the end of the hotel. The hotel is small, nothing fancy, but the staff keeps the place clean. To the right of the reception there is sitting area, this is where they have pineapple juice for their guests, no charge.In our room we had a single serve coffeemaker, a fridge and a small sink next to the coffeemaker which we found it very convenient to rinse cups or wash hands. The location is great, everything is within walking distance and the buses run regularly, we took the bus several times, just ask the driver if you are not sure you are on the right bus.The Ala Moana mall is close by, there is a food court on the first floor with a lot of restaurants. We were not disappointed staying at The Equus hotel on our vacation.

Overall perfect.... Great location Lovely rooms. We would stay there againClose but not on the beach Very walkable to shopping and great beachesWalk to Waikiki Room was clean and well appointed and personnel were all very helpful

We stayed here based on previous reviews. The rooms are really nice, quite large, with the beds very comfy and the bathroom well appointed. Outside the rooms it is a little stranger. The reception is up a flight of stairs with no lift and the reception area is pretty small. The lift is old and we crossed our fingers every time we got in it that it would make it to our floor. The entrance to the rooms is from an outside corridor - again a little strange but fine. Overall I would recommend it. It was good value, close to the beachs and not too noisy (as it is on one of the mainish roads). It is a short walk to restaurants, malls and bars.

We stayed at Equus Hotel based on TripAdvisor reports and were very happy with our decision. Good position near to restaurants, Waikiki and the Ala Moana Center. I notice a lot of people mention being welcomed with a glass of fruit juice - they must have run out just before we arrived as we were never offered any but still we enjoyed our stay very much and if we visit Waikiki again, we would not hesitate booking at this hotel.

When I go to Honolulu for business, I usually like to stay on one of the edges of Waikiki to avoid the bulk of the tourist crunch. After reading reviews here on TripAdvisor I thought that I would give the Equus a try. I was happy with my decision as the hotel was very nice and well-located. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Parking was extra (I had a car for work visits) and a little tight, but worked out OK. Elevator was somewhat slow, but I have found this to be the case at multiple other properties as well. Room was cozy but not cramped and there are multiple places to eat and things to do within a short walk from the hotel. Noise was not an issue (I stayed in a room towards the back of the building, away from Ala Moana Blvd.). I thought that the Equus was a good value.

I have to say that we had a wonderful time at the Equus. The beds were soft. We didn't hear any street noise and the front staff was amazing. I would definitely stay at the Equus again ! The walk to Waikiki beach is a safe 15 minute walk away and there is a trolley stop about 1 block away if you are unable to walk that far. You also get free Mai Ti's every Friday and Saturday at 5 pm which is a great time to speak with other travelers on what sites they would or wouldn't recommend.

Aloha, I recently stayed at the Equus Hotel with a couple of my friends to watch the Aloha Week Parade. I can honestly say that the Equus Hotel is the perfect place for kamaʻaina to just get away for the weekend to just relax. The hotel is located at the beginning of Waikiki and is surrounded by tons of great restaurants and is in walking distance of the Ala Moana shopping center. We went to the Chart House for dinner, which is right across the street of the hotel. The staff are great and have a lot of aloha for their guests. Renee and Puka were the two fabulous staff members at the front desk, who served us with a smile. I highly recommend this hotel to guests from near and far. It is in a great location, it has a free parking, and if youʻre lucky enough, you can catch a great seat at of the many parades that occur in Waikiki.Mahalo nui loa Equus Hotel

Great value on the Tripadvisor deal - however, do not get the bamboo room. 1) its only a queen, other similar rooms are king size, 2) the bamboo frame is quite low, my head is still hurting, 3) the bamboo frame takes up the room - barely enough space for bags. Was also disappointed with the balcony - too small to sit outside, especially with the noisy AC condensor. The AC will not operate if you leave the doors open. The location is not ideal as well and far away from the main stretch. There are few shops in the area except for the ABC supermarket.

TripAdvisor reviews for this hotel were quite good and the price was excellent. They truly practice sustainability as advertised. Stayed 3 nights and enjoyed every one of them. TripAdvisor offered free upgrade to deluxe King if available. Was not available but front desk substituted discount for parking instead. Perfect location, walk to Waikiki, direct route to and from airport. Didn't hurt having Ala Moana shopping center also within 5 to 10 minutes walking distance - Gomo Tei Ramen for dinner twice, $ and delish!

We stayed here for just one night. At close to the lowest price point for hotels in Honolulu, this hotel is really wonderful.The staff is incredibly friendly - they greeted us with fresh guava juice and let us check in about 2 hours early because the room was available. The room was beautifully furnished, spotless, good Air Conditioning, nice TV, and the bed was AMAZING. King-size, pillow-top - we slept for 12 hours. Notes: parking is not free, despite what some websites and other reviews say. I think we paid about 20 dollars for a day of on-site parking. Not expensive for a Waikiki area hotel, but we were expecting free. Also, it is about a 15-20 minute walk to Waikiki beach. a nice walk, though, through lovely outdoor shopping centers and such. Perfect for our purposes but if you're going to the beach every day, expect to walk.

I had a wonderful trip to Waikiki this past week and a major contributing factor was my stay at the Equus. Very friendly staff greeted me as soon as I checked in, even refreshing me after a long flight from Japan with a cool glass of Lemonade. I enjoyed the texting service the hotel offers. You can text how they're doing service-wise, any trouble issues, or help on deciding where to find a good local spot. The room was outstanding, very comfortable bed. Let me re-state, very, very comfortable. Fridge and all the normal amenities included, Wi-Fi, cable television, etc. Also, the hotel is very environmentally friendly, with eco shampoo/conditioner, a system that shuts off air conditioning and lights when you remove your room key, as well as neat hotel pens made from recycled materials. The key lesson of geography is "location, location, location" and this hotel has that. It's not right on Waikiki Beach, and that's fantastic. If you want the beach, it is laughable walk of less than five minutes. Restaurants galore are nearby, both local and chain restaurants (Da Smokehouse was a personal favorite). ABC stores are a plenty in the area, including one less than 50 yards from the front of the hotel. And the best part of being tucked away off the beach, is no drunk people bothering you late at night, as well as no tourists creating loud noises that carry up to your window. The only gripe one may have is that parking is not free (though no hotel in Waikiki is), it is $20 daily for a handful of spots or $20 for overflow parking across the street. Many tourists will complain about this, but the Equus parking charges are significantly less than other hotels in Waikiki who will charge upwards to $70 daily. Overall, a great stay at the Equus in Waikiki. I highly recommend.

My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights and loved it. This is a cosy little hotel near Waikiki Beach. It is only one street back from the beach, within walking distance of Aloe Moana shopping centre, McDonalds, ABC convenience stores. restaurants and boutique shops. The staff are very pleasant and friendly, the rooms are small but clean and comfortable and they have free cocktail hour every Thursday and Friday. The reason we chose this hotel over others we were researching was the free wi-fi they offered. My daughter recently stayed in the Hilton Hawaiian village hotel which advertises free wi-fi, however you can only access this from the lobby not your rooms. We had no problem accessing the wi-fi throughout the hotel, including our rooms. There is a $20 per night fee for parking which seems a bit excessive, however we felt that as we got a reasonable rate for the room we didn't mind paying the extra $20 for the convenience. There was also a coffee machine that looks a bit like the Aldi ones that uses pods, but it is really only a machine that makes brewed coffee/tea not espresso. There is a fridge in the room but no other coffee or tea making facilities. It would be nice to have a least a kettle in which to be able to make an instant coffee. I was a little disappointed to hear there was no laundry in the hotel, however, there was a public laundry in the McDonalds building a couple of minutes away, it's pretty dingey but it gets the job done. Overall we throughly enjoyed our stay there and will definitely go back again. Thanks for an enjoyable stay Equus.

My wife and I arrived in Honolulu and took a Speedi-Shuttle to Equus. We are in the middle of a move to Molokai. We now know where we will be staying every stay (when we want city life and shopping). This is great, right next to an ABC store, Outback Steak House, and Red Lobster. Rooms very clean, Fresh Pineapple delivered at arrival (yummy) and the Air Con works great, if you stay in. We are walking to the piers that we can see from the hall, very close. Looking forward to our new life here in Hawaii and the opportunity for staying here at the Equus again.

I read one trip advisor review that said they have free parking. Unfortunately I did not fact check that and was massively irritated upon check in. The hotel has a few spaces on site for $20 a night that you have to reserve before getting there. The hotel has a parking arrangement with a garage across the street and around the corner for $20 overnight or $7 for ten hours. So if you get in late and leave early you can reduce your parking cost. The hotel itself is fine. Also make sure you understand that the beach is a few blocks away. They have beach towels for guests. Ala Moana shopping mall is an easy walk and there is a city park across the mall that is good for a morning run or swim.

We had a wonderful weekend at this hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and always willing to assist - we truly felt like we were at a 5 star hotel. We loved the polo theme that appears throughout the hotel and the rooms - polo themes are even used in the wifi password that they provide to each guest. The special touch of placing orange slices in the water and bringing in pineapple juice at check-in was classy. Please note that the other online reviews of the lower floors being noisy are absolutely not true. We will be back again!

My boyfriend and I stayed here at the Equus Hotel a couple weeks ago for about 5 days. We were greeted with ALOHA from the time we stepped out of our car to the duration of our stay. The staff is consistent, friendly, professional and very detailed. I didn't think too much of the hotel by the outside, until i walked up the stairs to the front desk where we were welcomed with smiles and great energy from the front desk workers Puka and Kika. Check in and Check out were smooth and didnt' have to worry about anything. The rooms there at Equus hotel are very CLEAN, BEAUTIFUL and COMFORTABLE. If you ever need a comfortable, affordable and CLEAN place to stay...EQUUS HOTEL, HONOLULU should be your first choice. LOVE this Boutique Hotel ...I WILL BE BACK!! Thank you very much for your hospitality and for representing the people of Hawaii properly. Lot's of ALOHA!!! ...

For the price of the hotel, it was great. The hotel lobby was small but the room was just perfect. I had the deluxe king and it was good size. Comfortable bed, quiet a/c, and loved the decor. Just wish that the bathroom had a vent because once someone did "their business" in there in stank up the whole room. Didn't have a lanai/balcony but it wasn't needed because it was raining. Really close to Red Lobster so we ate dinner there and that was awesome. I would highly recommend this hotel if you just want to relax in the room and you aren't looking for a lobby to chill in. Really close to Ala Moana too so traveling wise, it wasn't bad.

We enjoyed our stay at the Equus Hotel. The employees did everything possible to make the stay enjoyable. We were in Hawaii to go on the Norwegian Cruise of the islands. We needed to check in early and out late. The hotel stored all of our luggage so we could enjoy the beach while we were waiting. The location was perfect. 2 miles from the pier and 10 to the airport. Transposition was easy and inexpensive to both. Hotel is clean and offers you a cooling drink when checking in. Has free wifi.

This is my 3 rd trip to Hawaii, my first time in Equus, the hotel staff are the most hospitable, willing to help with a smile. Efficient clean. The location is very central to wherever one has to go. The beach & all other amenities are close. The ever smiling owner is always around to help, on the final day I was lucky to meet the charming General Manager too.

The Equus Hotel was nice. The staff was pleasant. The rooms were nice. I applaud their eco efforts!The first inconvenience we experienced is that there is no elevator from the street level to the second floor lobby and elevator. With heavy bags, this was a bit of a pain.Our room was pleasant. The road noise from the street was loud though.There is no restaurant in hotel, so you have to walk a block to McDonalds, Outback or Red Lobster. If you want something else, you have to walk further.They could do a little better on their tourism efforts though. They didn't really have any info of the hop on hop off trolley or other things to do in the area. The hop a bus trolley picks up a little over a block away, so this was a pleasant way to see the city and get around for the day.

Our stay this time was excellent! We were on the 10th floor in the executive suite & loved the room. The wi-fi is extremely slow, but all in all it is a GREAT hotel. Thanx 1 MIL!!! To all the staff at the Equus hotel!!!

The Equus Hotel is the best located boutique hotel on waikiki beach, next to the Waikiki beach & Yacht club, 2 min walk from the Ala Moana Mall for great shopping & eating options. Within walking distance from the park, water sports, night life etc. In addition to charming, well appointed rooms with a distinct polo & equestrian decor. small swimming pool. Attentive & helpful staff, onsite parking, laundry & other facilities. I would recommend the Equus Hotel to anybody visiting Hawaii.

Very good experience. Clean, large room. I appreciate that luggage was stored in a locked area before check-n and after check-out.Might want to consider adding a luggage stand, although there is a bench in the room, it is inadequate for multiple suitcases when not traveling alone.

My family and I travel home to Hawaii once a year and have stayed at the Equus for the last two trips. It a smaller but comfortable hotel with less of the hustle and traffic of a larger hotel. The staff at the front office, Puka and Rene, made our stay memorable and we plan on staying there again next year. The location was perfect for my morning coffee and walks. It is in a ideal location away from the center of Waikiki and close to Ala Moana. The only thing I can say that needs work on is the flow of air through the rooms. I prefer fresh air to A/C and it would be nice to have a louvered window in the door to allow the air to flow. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler.

We stayed for three nights at the Equus and found the hotel charming, convenient, comfortable, immaculately clean and affordable. Our room was quiet. The hotel was much closer to the beach than we thought, yet easy to travel all through Honolulu. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We appreciated the fruit flavored water that was always present at reception.

I could have stayed anywhere In Honolulu but after staying at The Equus, I realized this was perfect for my stay In Honolulu! Yoshi, Ranea, and Justin were excellent with everything I needed and beyond! Truly a great place to stay! Thank you for the Hawaiian hospitality! Mahalo!

Equus Hotel is a small charming hotel with an excellent location. The staff is friendly and co-operative. There is a Macdonald an a ABC Superette within two minutes walking distance. Waikiki Beach is just ten minutes walking distance and so is the Ala Moana Mall. Unfortunately there is no restaurant in the hotel and no room service but there are plenty of eateries within five to ten minutes walking distance. Our room was comfortable and the décor old style and charming. On being called for help someone came up to our room immediately and sorted things out.The tarrif is not steep and the rooms are quiet with no light or sound disturbance. I recommend this hotel for stay.

We only needed an overnight stay and stayed here because of the reasonable price and other recommendations. Check in staff was friendly and helpful, arranged for a very early cab pick up the following morning, which was right on time. Location was convenient, but definitely a lot of traffic noise . Our room was clean and comfortable, but you may like more space if staying for an extended period of time. We were pleased and would recommend.

I have been to Hawaii a couple of times and this is easily the nicest hotel I have stayed in - Great Location, very modern- (recently- remodelled), Great Rates and gorgeous rooms. Rooms: The rooms in this hotel are soo nice- really modern bathrooms, plenty of space, the beds were sooo big/comfortable! I have stayed in a number of Hawaiian hotels- more expensive with fancy pictures on their website only to end up in flea ridden dowdy room. This place is really nice & comfortable- feels like a home away from home. Service: From parking our car ( FREE- I might add) to check in and check out - I found the staff so helpful, welcoming & friendly. They do as much as they can to help you settle in and get the most out of your vacation. If you have any issues at all you can text them & they will sort it out straight away- even if you are out and about around Waikiki & looking for a restaurant recommendation. Location: this hotel is located opposite the Hilton Hawaiian Village- making it easy to explore the rest of Waikiki. Parking is free & the biggest Shopping Mall in Hawaii- the Ala Moans centre is literally a 5 min walk away from the hotel. You really have the best of both worlds- great shopping & access to Waikiki Beach across the street.Rates: this hotel has recently been remodelled & definitely offers much better rates than other Hawaiian hotels which jack up the prices at a whim. It's family run & that really makes a difference in terms of how they treat their guests. No breakfast but there are so many options around you it really doesn't matter! After staying in a number of supposedly 4/5 star hotels in Hawaii I would 100% recommend this hotel over any of the others- you will not be disappointed.

We stayed in the Equus in September and loved the location and room. The staff were very friendly and helpful, with great tips on where to go during our stay. The room was very clean and had all the mod cons such as TV, Refrigerator, wifi and air conditioning, which was really appreciated after a long day walking around Waikiki.The elevator was a little dated, but all of the rooms have been refurbished it would appear. Location was great, right next to the Hilton, at a way better price than staying there.

My room was clean and comfortable. I liked the horse-themed decoration; tasteful without being over the top. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Some other reviewers complained of traffic noise, but I wasn't bothered too much. The hotel is a short walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Kahanamoku Beach (a nice, less crowded alternative to Waikiki). The only thing that I found less than satisfactory was the late hour that the rooms are made up. On a couple of occasions I returned around 4:30 or so, wanting to relax a couple of hours before heading out for the evening, only to have housekeeping knock on the door. A little annoying. All told though, I enjoyed my stay here and recommend it for anyone looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable and convenient hotel.

Liked this small hotel although the rooms are tiny and from our room on the 4th floor there was a lot of road noise thru out the night from Ala Moana Blvd. Like that it was across the street from the mall and good restaurants all around. Room was clean with nice shower in bath. Bed was comfy but tv was small. Stall we're very nice and helpfull. Next time I will try a room on at least the 6th floor hoping for some quite. Overall I would give it a 2.5 star at a good price

The service was excellent!! Everyone was very friendly and the hotel was absolutely amazing! The room was really clean and warm welcoming. I will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends. We will be back very soon!!!

This was a clean and reasonable hotel located close to a mall and close to Waikiki. The horse decor was cute, and the beach towel service very convenient, but the best part was the bed.. our room had a really wonderful bed and we slept great!

This was our 2nd stay at the Equus Hotel. We find the staff to be very helpful, friendly and accommodating. We want to especially mention Rene and Puka, who went out of their way to make us feel at home. We also returned because we loved the location (a couple blocks from the quiet end of Waikiki beach, walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, the great variety of restaurants and ready access to public transit). We thought our room was spacious, the king sized bed comfortable and appliances up-to-date. We will definitely return to the Equus Hotel on our next trip to Honolulu. Great value for your money!

Its a lovely place to stay. Close to almost everything good on d island. The rooms are very affordable with a breathtaking view of the ocean. The entire staff was friendly and very helpful. Couldnt ask for more.

I really enjoyed my stay customer service very excellent hotel very clean workers always there to answer questions n to help out if we ever needed something. Very nice view from the room that we stayed at my kids enjoyed the pool.

I travel to Hawaii for business every other month and choose The Equus every time because of the location (close to Ala Moana Mall) and on the edge of Waikiki. The beds are comfy, the staff members are friendly and helpful. The rates are consistently on the lower end -- spend your money on gifts for friends and family. I've stayed at many different locations on Waikiki -- The Equus staff treats me like family.

Great location away from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki and close to ala moana. Very friendly staff happy to oblige even to store luggage for a late flight. The entry way is beautiful there is a good vibe about the place.

I love this place, and every time I visit Oahu I choose to stay here. The gilded entryway, interior design, friendly and efficient staff, prime location -- right next to Ala Moana Mall, between Waikiki and downtown Honolulu -- makes it the PERFECT place to stay on Oahu.

Was pleasantly welcomed with a shell necklace and welcome drink. Room was quite big but seemed alittle old and grimy. Service was excellent and they provided answers to all our needs. Location wise, it's ideal if you would like to be away from the busy Waikiki streets. It is near the convention centre and ala moana shopping centre as well as the beach park.

We visited Oahu in August of 2013. My husband and I based our stay from the North Shore of Oahu, but took many excursions from there, one of them being to Waikiki Beach. While in Waikiki, we stayed at the very charming Equus Hotel. I can't speak highly enough about this hotel. It is smaller than most of the monstrosities on the beach. With its size comes personal attention. In the main lobby, when we arrived, we were greeted with a tropical cocktail from a very friendly staff member (quite tastey I might add). Check in was a smooth and quick process. They told us that if there was anything they could do to make our stay nicer, to let them know. They even gave us their text number in case we had any questions while out in Waikiki, got lost, etc. We didn't need to use it, but it was a nice touch. The room was beautiful. The decor is based on polo throughout the hotel. The theme continued in our room with many unique pieces and photos. The room was very modern and it was evident that it had been updated recently. It was also meticulously clean, which is very important to us when we travel. The towels were folded to look like swans and were placed on the bed. Again, a nice touch. I recommend this hotel highly to anyone traveling to the area. Among the lure of the high rise hotels, stands out this truly precious gem. On a side note, the hotel is affiliated with Hawaii Polo on the North Shore of Oahu. While we were there, we were able to take a sunset trail ride along the beach. It was one of our favorite moments while on vacation. The beach was quiet and peaceful. And come to find out, it was a unique experience as they are the only ones on the island to offer trail rides on the beach. This was on our bucket list of things to do while we visited and we were not disappointed.

Pros - Able to organise early check in- The Hotel hosted mingle sessions which were a really great opportunity to ask questions and relax with house made cocktails and chocolate covered macadamia nuts- Good distance to Ala Moana Mall- Most tours pick you up from the Hotel or from the Ilikai down the road- Air conditioners were of good quality- Green hotel- Yoshi, Renee and LynetteCons - Slow elevator- Far from Waikiki BeachWould definitely stay again :)

have stayed there in oct 2012 and now aug 2013..love love it the staff are great hotel clean and the rooms a great size..the beds and the pillows are to die for ...when we arrived the genltman on the desk was wonderful his name was Puka a great assit to the hotel so so friendly and vey helpful.The hotel is in a great location to ala moana shopping centre its a easy walk.Would stay there again and again.Thanks Puka u made our stay.

Recently had a 4 night stay at the Equus for a convention in Honolulu. From check-in to check-out the staff was wonderful - welcoming, friendly, helpful, down to the parking attendants and cleaning staff. Though the rooms are tiny by many standards (apparently the meaning of "Boutique"), they have everything you could want - large, comfortable bed, wide-screen TV, good fridge, Keurig coffee maker (coffee and tea replenished daily), a safe, etc. The rain-shower head was a revelation. Even the bath products were lovely. The room was clean, modern and had clearly been recently upgraded. The air-conditioner was silent and worked beautifully. My only small complaint is the massive bamboo canopy bed structure. In an already small room, this extra bit of "decor" takes away from the limited space and makes the room more cramped (to say nothing of tall people bumping their heads) - but that's really a small point. Overall a great value and a great stay. Would definitely return.

I had my elderly parents with me and going up the stairs was not an easy task for them. There is no elevator to get you from the street level to the lobby. I was especially worried about my parents when it was raining and they had to get up the stairs using their canes and holding tight to the rail. Another disadvantage is the showers do not have anywhere to put the soap, shampoo, etc., other than on the ledge/step to get in to the shower. I asked for ocean view rooms. That was a disappointment. Don't spend the extra money for the very small view of the ocean you will get. We were a distance from the main Waikiki area. Probably quieter than those on the strip, but too far away to walk with my parents.

The Room is clean and comfortable. There were no bottle water in the refrigerator for sale or hotel complimentary. Needed to walk down the block to get drinking water. Overall the room is great and the location is near to other visiting areas.

From the time we checked in to the time we checked out, it was excellent all the way through, and we only a one-night reservation! Genuine, authentic smiles were everywhere, giving us the impression that the entire staff enjoyed their jobs and felt it was a joy to work there at the hotel. The decor: from potted plants and flowers strategically placed throughout the hotel, to the framed photos hanging on the walkway walls, furniture, to the lobby room, etc., seemed to have suspended us back in time, circa: 1920's - 40's? It was a delight to our imagination to feel like we were taken back in time of nostalgia.Because of our wonderful experience, we are eager to book our next stay-cation! We would look no further to other hotels in Waikiki--Equus is the place to be!

From the sweet flora aroma that welcomes you as you walk up the stairs to the kind and helpful staff, this hotel is a gem. The rooms are nice, clean. The Keurig coffee makers are a bonus! I especially liked that you they offer a anything, anytime policy... they are always willing to help! You can even text their staff at any hour for recommendations on where to eat, what to do, or who's open at two in the morning for tacos, and they will do their best to answer you questions! Its close the everything and a great find!
user_name:
Laura B
Chalan Pago, null, United States

review_body: We only had one day in Hawaii since it was an airport overlay trip. The hotel was in the perfect location to allow us to enjoy the beach and do some small scale shopping! Had a wonderful trip while staying within budget!

The description of the Equus Hotel as being a "boutique hotel" is perfect. From the open-aired, canopied entrance with adjacent tropical foliage and brass-trimmed steps, to its early European/Polynesian decor, makes one feel as though they have stepped back to its earlier years of being a polo hotel. It has a feel of simple elegance without feeling ostentatious. Open breeze ways host wonderful black and white prints of the local history. Who would have guessed a cattle drive ever took place on Oahu? The rooms are quaint and comfortable with the shuttered panel doors on the patio-side allowing lots of indirect daylight to enter, when the panels are slid back. Opening both doors allows the warm, tropical trade winds to blow through. The Equus is located at the beginning of the Waikiki area so is a reprieve from the commercial hustle-bustle of tourism, and glitzy hotels of the more heavily foot/auto trafficked areas. Traffic noise is heavy, however this is the norm on the Waikiki strip. The beach, Ala Moana Mall, Ala Moana Park, (where you will find the locals), restaurants, a marina, army museum, car/scooter/motorcycle/surf rentals. shopping centers and other amenities are all within an easy walking distance of a block or more away. It is easy to take advantage of trolleys and buses should you choose not to walk. Staff at the Equus are friendly, professional, and take pride in their facility. The fresh-water pool area is small but clean, maintained and comfortable. The price was exceptional. We would not hesitate to stay at The Equus again.

Booked for a recent convention and had an excellent stay. When there was a problem with our TV, the front desk sent up a maintenance man promptly, who took care of the issue immediately and courteously. Only issue was that I wasn't able to check in early (although I saw several other people receive keys while I was waiting). However, in the hotel's defense, I was there about 45 minutes before the official check-in time. Front desk staff was generally pleasant. I agree with an earlier review that it was somewhat loud at night, since you're on a major roadway (we were on the 7th floor). I didn't necessarily have difficulty sleeping, perhaps because a roommate put on a white noise app on her phone during the night, but it may be an issue for some. Walk to the convention was easy and quick if using the back entrance (maybe 10 minutes). Wireless Internet quality was good, and rooms were nice and clean. The hotel prides itself on minimal environmental impact, which I thought was great. Be aware that there is no elevator to the ground level (which makes carrying luggage to/from the street difficult), and the elevator between floors is quite slow. It's also kind of in between downtown Honolulu and Waikiki, so expect a long walk (but doable) or bus ride to either.

Good room, friendly service. We were in the only suite and it was roomy and quiet. Good location- just across the road is the beach. The bus is pretty affordable and will take you anywhere in Waikiki. The hotel has a texting service for guests to request help or suggestions while you're out. Possible downsides: No bar, small pool is in the shade, and I didn't see a fitness center. Overall, good. I would stay here again.

Things that were good:Service was friendly.The room was of a decent size.The room was nice. It was clean, bed was nice, air conditioning worked, etc. No problems.The pricing was good.Things that could be issues:Road noise. I was on the 8th floor and it was NOISY even with the sliding door closed. I'm a light sleeper but I had ear plugs. With the ear plugs I had no issues sleeping. My friend was on the 10th floor and he said apparently the 10th floor has very good sound proofing (and also higher prices). He said he barely heard any road noise. So if you're a light sleeper, bring ear plugs or book a room on the 10th floor.Elevator. There's only one elevator and it's slow. You might have to wait a while for the elevator.Location. If you want to do visits to Waikiki, this hotel is a little far unless you take the bus. It's definitely walkable (it's about 1.5 miles away or so) but it's a tad far compared to other hotels when talking about going to Waikiki.Parking. Like most if not all hotels in that area, parking costs money nightly. But they only have like 10 spots and you just have to hope no one steals your spot. I'm not sure if it's possible if you paid for a spot to have your spot taken but the staff seemed to imply this was a possibility. Never happened to us, but it almost did.Getting to front desk. If you have luggage that's hard for you to handle, be warned that there's a few steps that you have to take before you get into the lobby of this hotel. You maybe able to flag someone to help you with your luggage but I wouldn't count on it so expect to carry your luggage up some stairs. It's not that many and the steps are low so you should be able to drag your luggage up without too much problems if you have wheels on your luggage.

Arrived at Hotel to find 19 steps to reception and had to carry all our luggage by our selves. The staff were very unhelpful and didn't explain anything about our room. Had an issue with the air conditioner which needed the room card inserted before it worked but this hadn't been explained to us. The room was very hot when we arrived. The beds were the smallest double beds we had ever seen more like the size of a king single. The lift was the slowest we have ever come across with people waiting considerable times at peak traffic times during the day. There are obviously 2 sections to the hotel as this is not the one shown in the picture.

We were surprised at how many amenities this hotel managed to fit in a quaint space. It's clear that the staff takes pride in their craft. They were genuine and never missed an opportunity to assist us. The atmosphere was warm and surprisingly personal for a small hotel in Waikiki. The theme of Equestrian and old Hawaii cowboy was thread throughout the hotel. We enjoyed the historical photos. The staff made us feel like family and we look forward to visiting again soon. The only downside was that the elevator seemed rather slow to respond.
user_name:
Elizabeth L
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: I had called to make reservations, and puka and rene were wonderful helpers. They provided us with the true Hawaiian hospitality. So I'm booking my next reservation when I come to Hawaii with Equus. My advice to all, is to book the Equus.

This was our sixth stopover at this hotel .20 th July & 5th Aug '13 .The hotel is well situated, clean & tidy and the staff are always obliging and helpful .It is good value accomodation and we would not stay elsewhere when passing through Honolulu . We will return.

We recently stayed 11 days at the Equus for our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. We had had the standard king room which was the perfect size for my wife and I, the bed was amazing (I wish I could have taken it home with me!) service staff were outstanding. Having worked in the hospitality industry for 20 years, I would recommend the Equus to all travellers looking for a great deal in clean, comfortable accommodation with really welcoming staff. We'll be back!

My daughter and I were met at the door by the owner and made to feel very welcome and cared for. Nothing was left undone. After a very long day of traveling the feeling experienced when my head hit the pillow on the high end mattress can't be put into words Thank you

We only had one day in Hawaii since it was an airport overlay trip. The hotel was in the perfect location to allow us to enjoy the beach and do some small scale shopping! Had a wonderful trip while staying within budget!

I was greeted by the friendly staff at the Equus and shown to my room with a view!The place is quiet at night so I drifted right to sleep with my eco friendly AC blowing out cool air.Decorations in my room were classic Hawaii with a set of fun elephant bamboo furniture. My bed was amazingly soft and well made, where do you get those soft sheets? I need some of those.The bathroom is a clean & simple layout. Loved taking a shower and being met with that wonderful AC again! I ordered roomservice that comes from a place close by called Hiking Hawaii. The breakfast arrived hot and steaming. Egg Scramble with veggies. They have Gluten free options for toast! Awesome! Dont forget the Krups Coffee maker that made waking up after a night of dancing and walking around town a very easy transition. I would stay here again when I am in town to save myself the hassle of oversized busy hotels. This place feels like home, the staff is warm and they even have to different iced water containers that have Oranges or Mint in them...pretty refreshing stuff...a thoughtful touch. Wonderful hotel with great service!
user_name:
Angela B
Haleiwa, Hawaii, United States

review_body: We loved staying at this hotel ... The workers are very helpful and filled with aloha ... They felt like FAMILY specially Rene Kahumoku (Aunty) i called her as for respect because she was every loving and helpful ... As for hotel it was very nice prices are cheap we will be staying there everytime we go oahu ...Perfect spot walking distance to alot of things :) see u soon EQUUS HOTEL

I was in Waikiki for a convention that took place mainly at the Convention Center and Hilton Village. This made the Equus a perfect location for us to stay, as it is a close walking distance to both. Personally, I never like staying in "big" hotels and prefer boutique hotels, as long as they are clean and modern. The Equus exceeded my expectations. The best part of the stay was that the staff was extremely welcoming, truly exemplifying the Aloha spirit that you can (arguably) only get in Hawai'i.
user_name:
Kevin N
New York City, New York

review_body: The Equus was as nice and accommodating as most larger chains at a much better rate. It was perfect walking distance from the Hawaii convention center and the beach. The staff was very friendly and offered complementary cocktails in the evening. My husband and I enjoyed that it was a smaller and quieter hotel in the middle of busy Waikiki. The linens were great too!

Aloha One & All Guests Of The World.... You Must Experience The Love & Aloha Here @ The "EQUUS Hotel!!" When You Plan Your Vacation to Oahu, Please book It Here @ The Equus Hotel!!! You'll meet The Friendliest Front Desk Workers Rene & Puka That Will Blow Your Mind!!!! Customer Service is Number One Here @ The Equus Hotel!!! We Always Loved it here because the Rooms are comfortable, it's close to Waikiki & The Ala Moana Beautiful Beaches, The Ala Moana Shopping Center, Lot's of Places To Eat, Close to Ward Movie Theaters & Dave & Busters...It's so convenient to everything. Yes Our Experience was so Awesome That We have Our Family & Friends Booking It @ The Equus Hotel Too!!!! Go Ahead & Go For It....We Love You Equus Hotel!!!!

I couldn't ask for a better hotel and an amazing staff to service me and my family. We been staying here for about 4 weeks now and we enjoying our stay every moment of it. The staff from the housekeeping to the front desk best service friendly, professional and helping hand. The housekeeping come by everyday and give you whatever you need from the bathroom to cleaning the room. If you put your Do Not Disturb sign on the door they will leave a note on your door to let you know when you need service just call them. The bed are comfy, room are spacious and big thing shower good watet pressure. The hotel location is great few steps to Ala Moana Center and Beaches. Come by and see Ms. Rene and her staff, they are amazing. They will help and make you enjoying your visit.We (me n hubby) would like to say a big THANKS to Ms. Rene and her staff for making our 12 year annivesary the best moment ever. Thanks for everything.

I have stayed in Mauii, Big island & Oahu. The best place ever on the 3 islands, was the Equus Hotel in Oahu.I had a GREAT stay. The Front desk clerk, Her name is, Jackie made me feel like family & was ALWAYS helpful with everything. She always had a happy smile & treated me with what felt like the true meaning of aloha I had only heard of up to then. The staff there are all very happy & willing to help out too. They all made me feel very welcomed, & I saw how they treated others in the same warm way.  I will go there again.

I have stayed at the Equus aproximately 9 times in the past few years. I love the location as it is only across the road from the Hilton Hawaaiian Village and easy access to Ala Moana shopping. I have stayed there on my own for business and as a woman in my 30's I've always felt safe there.The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are nicely decored and clean. There is an ABC shop less than one block away for all the small items you may need.Rene is the sweetest and warmest host, and true to the Hawaiian Aloha Spirit. She is always smiling and happy to help. All the staff are lovely....I recommend this little hotel for short business stays and shopaholics!

It's been awhile since my husband and I have visited Oahu and stayed here at The Equus Hotel. We noticed right away that The Equus has gone thru some renovations which has left her even More Beautiful and Priceless than before!!! We love the location of the Equus it's located out of the hustle and bustle of the big city and yet it's walking distance to nearby Fun shopping and Great restaurants. After an unforgettable full day of shopping and sight seeing we headed right back for our New found Oasis-The Equus Hotel! We truly appreciated the warmth, friendliness and hospitality of the staff who seemed to be available whenever we had questions, needed help or directions. You'll find the comforts of home here at The Equus Hotel and even more! Be sure to stop by and say, "Aloha" to Rene (front desk Manager), she's the "Aloha Spirit" personified :)

I had a great stay ( I stayed several months!! It's a very responsible and friendly place! JACQUIE made me feel welcome from day one! Anytime I needed anything, she was always willing to help. She has a great memory and she doesn't forget, she is right on top of things!! KUDOS to her and to her MANY hats!! Also, would like to say PUKA was also very helpful~ always with a smile and a joke! The staff is excellent and would recommend The Equis Hotel!!!

I chose Equus Hotel to get maximum Lyoness benefits and I was very, very pleased. Clinton at the front desk gave me several excellent suggestions of places to visit during my stay in Hawaii (he is a kind of expert on local history) and Renee was very, very nice and helpful giving me a stamp and envelope when I needed to mail a letter. I know this sounds like a little thing, but you would be surprised how many hotels can't be bothered with little things. Each evening I was there they had a free drinks in the lobby with a hotel hostess where you can talk and hang out with other guests and share stories. They have a small pool (no jacuzzi) on the property and the rooms are good sized. Flat screen TV, in room fridge, and state of the art A/C (operated with your room key which saves energy...very green). They have a Keurig coffee maker in the room with various flavors. The parking is tight and I had to park across the street. By the way, across the street is Red Lobster, The Chart House and Outback Steakhouse, so walking to dinner is easy. This boutique hotel is wonderful and I highly recommend you stay here.

We have stayed here before, and we really like the location. You can easily walk to Ala Moana park or to Waikiki. Although a bit small (by U.S. standards) the rooms are clean and comfortable and certainly more than adequate. Basically the hotel had everything we needed. The big plus is the friendly staff; everyone was helpful, some even more so. We would like to thank Keo, Justin, Yoshi, Clinton, and Puka Palenapa for all the times they gave us assistance or a friendly greeting. Justin keep working on that Honolulu Ice Tea it was great! The only downside is inadequate parking at the hotel, (not much they can do about it as space is really limited) for the first half of our stay we had to park elsewhere. Recommend when making a reservation that one ensures reserving a parking space as well.

We chose this hotel only because is twas close to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre and also because we only had a one night stay before our connecting flight home.When we first rocked up, it was not impressive at all. Looked a bit run down, but after checking in and getting to our rooms, it was a lot better. Rooms were nice, shower looked like it was pretty old but overall was average.Good location for shopping but besides that, there is not much else around, unless you go for a 20-30 min walk.Overall a nice little hotel for the price.

My family and I are staying here while we are awaiting our furniture from Baltimore, MD. We have found this place reasonably priced. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff are just wonderful. They go beyond helpful. Renee, who is the manager has made us feel like family. I would highly recommend this hotel.

First time to stay at the Equus Hotel, but, it won't be the last. Really enjoyed the local Hawaiian atmosphere. The staff was terrific. Great happy hours on Thurs and Friday. The hotel room was very nice. It's a great location with Ala Moana Shopping Center in the next block; the beach a short walk the other way. Local bus stop available as well. Plus, rental car places a block away. Couldn't ask for a better location.

i stayed here for 2 nights in june 2013 & would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to be near Waikiki beach but avoid the big busy resort hotels. The Equus is just a couple of blocks from the beach, along the main street with bus routes & shopping. It's a block up from the waterfront, so does not have a view (well, just a view of the other buildings). The Equus is small & nicely decorated; my room was spacious & included a balcony; good wireless internet. The appliances are modern, they have Keurig coffee makers with a selection of teas & coffees. All the staff I met were very friendly & helpful.

The staff at the Equus Hotel were all very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and we had no complaints. The hotel even offered beach towels for guests to borrow which we loved since we were at the beach almost every day. The location was a short walk to the beach. Thank you Equus staff for a giving us a great experience at your hotel!

After we had a not-so-pleasant experience here last year, we were given a two night stay by Rene, the Guest Service Manager at the Equus. This time, we had a lovely room, very clean and comfortable accommodations. The staff on both visits treated us with a ton of aloha, were very helpful and kind. Our room (1004) was nicely decorated and the bed is super comfortable. We were very happy with our stay there this time and would definitely return on our next trip to Oahu. The hotel is located within easy walking distance to great restaurants and entertainment.
user_name:
Sharon T
Waikoloa, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Our room was cute, small and simple. The staff was always helpful with there aloha spirit. After having an exciting yet very tiresome day of site seeing to shopping, coming back to our room my Husband and I cant help but enjoy the comfortable bed. Our room attendant Lorie did an awesome job with the up keeping of our room or should I say mess! To rate it overall, our stay was beautiful as the scenery in Hawaii and filled with so much Aloha! Our room service was never a disappointment! Thanks to the staff for showing the Aloha spirit to us and A BIG thank you to our room attendant Lorie for making our room clean and as comfortable as if we were in our own room at home!!!! We will surely be returning to Hawaii in the near future and will be booking our stay here!

Wonderful customer service from our arrival to check out! The service is great and the accommodations are perfect! The rooms (we had a 1 bdrm suite, king bed room, and the bamboo room) had little touches that just made the experience even more special. We were there with family, including three small boys, and the hotel is perfect for keeping them busy and entertained. We felt like family right from the beginning. All the employees seemed to really love their jobs and that says a lot for how the property is run. Justin was our go-to guy for everything from parking, to bags, to helping us figure out the air conditioner. Miss Rene was at the front desk and you immediately feel like you are part of the family. If you like polo, horses, you will love it too. The eco-friendly nature of the hotel makes you want to conserve and it isn't hard at all. Spend time walking thru the halls and look at all the old pictures. We will definitely be back.
