A cute simple small hotel with such a great staff who makes you feel comfortable and feel like your home . Our room attendant lorie was great she always asked if we needed anything and alwayskept our room spick and clean.

Me and my mother stayed at the marina towers and we loved it so much from the time we arrived at the hotel till the day we left . The staff was so helpfull and nice . We needed some help with our coffe marker and the housekeeper lorie who helped us was such a awesome person LOVED her accent ! The staff and front desk made us feel like family like we were back at home making us just not want to leave ;) we will be back .

We had a standard room with two double beds room side was adequate .We arrived very early in the morning, the staff were kind enough to look after our luggage while we we exploring , We found the room clean,close to the trolley stop, close to bus stop ,close to the shopping centre , 10 minutes from the beach / lagoon

Before flying back home my fiance and I stayed at The Equus for a quick overnight stay after two weeks traveling between the other islands. Let me begin with the pros because I like to start with good news - great rate, friendly staff, clean room, some version of a balcony. Now for the much longer list of "Cons" - No elevator or ramp up at ground level, you have to walk up about 15-20 stairs from the street sidewalk and then you're in the lobby, this is definitely very inconvenient. This also means that either you have to carry your luggage up, or if you're lucky an employee will assist (which means you have to throw money for tip, even if you were planning on taking care of your luggage yourself). Now upon checking in, if your room is not ready they will store your luggage for you - and when your room is ready they will offer to bring it up to your room. The con in this is the comments that might be made when it is dropped off at your room - (after 2 weeks of traveling, including a wedding, we had quite a bit of luggage) - so when the comment is made by, a woman I'm assuming is some sort of manager, "Moving in?" it doesn't go over very well. And luggage assistance on the way out? Thats a joke - especially when you are in a hurry to catch your ride to the airport. The elevator takes 5-8 minutes to get to your floor and then you get down to the lobby level, but wait, you need to drag your luggage down 15-20 stairs to the street level. Of course, there is luggage assistance, but it took them 3-5 mins to get outside when if there was a ramp down the street level you would already be down and not having to give a tip.Once in the room - further cons include - VERY small shower space (stand-up only) - woman forget trying to shave your legs in the shower; A/C is operated by a key system - HINT: Get an extra key and leave it in the key system in the room, otherwise you WILL return to a hot and humid room (even if they say that it doesn't turn all the way off, it's closer to off than on); the lanai is not welcoming or even the least bit appetizing to sit out on, and to open the sliding door to it is a chore in itself - bottom line, don't bother. Now, the location is a challenge in itself - it is a taxi ride to Kalakua and Lewers Street area and Waikiki Beach, walking distance to the mall, and walk right out onto the street and you'll be in the homeless territory of the city. I really like how they classify themselves on the "Upper West Side" as if you'll be staying in the best part of town - you definitely are not.Overall - I'm glad we only stayed for 1 night - if we were booked for more, I would have moved locations. Pay a few dollars more per night and stay at a nicer place.

Hotel is decent for a couple on vacation probably with a room that has 1 bed. We had 2 doubles. The room was very small but we managed to fit a playpen along with all our luggage and items my dad had when he was discharged from the hospital.Cleanliness: Unfortunately my 16 month old was missing a shoe and a ball. I found them under the bed. Under the beds and behind the furniture was a bunch of dust bunnies. Vacuuming regularly is highly recommended.Location is fine: Walking distance to Ala Moana beach and shopping center and also to Waikiki. Central to pretty much anywhere if driving.

My wife and I were on Oahu for one day, visiting from neighboring Kauai. We weren't there for the beaches, so I can't even attest to the location of the hotel to Waikiki beach. It didn't seem far though- but was definitely not right NEXT to the water. We could walk to some good restaurants and to the Ala Moana Mall. We really liked the room. The bed was a little on the soft side, but very comfortable. The bathrooms were definitely renovated not too long ago and were very nice. I was concerned about the street noise upon check in, but I didn't even hear it once it was time to sleep. Best night sleep in a long time! My only qualm was that we reserved a "Standard King" room but only had a Queen bed in our room. It didn't bother us too much, though.

me and my wife stayed on the 6 floor and we wanted to give a big thanks to Linelle who serviced our room through out out stay. she went above and beyond and most of all out of her way to fulfill our request even though we were checking out that very same day. Also Thank you Linelle for leaving special notes saying have a great day. We will be returning.

Our first trip to hawaii stayed at The Equus Hotel. Awesome location its next to the mall, also by ala moana park. would stay there again when we go back no doubt..Great staff especially Linelle thank you for your generosity and hospitality..

Quaint hotel with wonderful, friendly, accommodating staff. It started with Keo, who was the Bellman who after performing his duties gave us recommendations for dinner & things to see within walking distance in the area. He was so kind. The next morning when we stepped off the elevator we were greeted with the most welcoming "aloha" with a beautiful smile from Robin at the front desk. When we called the front desk, you could still hear her smile in her greeting. Upon checkout, Robin was very accommodating to hold our luggage after checkout, while we grabbed a quick breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated with the wood from the island and the chairs are a bit taller in height for those who dislike sitting in low sitting chairs. The table is also in island wood. Very quaint boutique hotel.

Very friendly staff. Friendly atmosphere, close to shopping, and a short walk to the beaches. Staff was very knowledgeable about the area, and advised us on places of interest to check out. I would visit this place again.

This is the first hotel I stayed at with EXCELLENT customer service. I would like to thank Linelle for her time and patience for helping with direction's and helping me with other question's I had. She was more helpful then the front desk clerks. Them alway's being busy answering there phone. What I didn't understand was there was three worker's at the front desk and was wondering why either the two ladie's in the back never helped assist me. I shall return in the near future due to Linelle's GREAT customer service. Thank You Linelle!
user_name:
linda l
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I booked a reservation using their online system. I had a confirmation number and email. Per their regulations, I called 3 days prior to arrival to cancel. I was told that they could not cancel my reservation since I did not have one. I checked on the credit card used to guarantee the room and found out that they are charged my card one night on the day I reserved. They DID NOT state that I had to pay for one night when I made the reservation. I disputed the charge. I did not stay at this hotel. I did drive by it and its in a terrible location. Access to the hotel is via Ala Moana Blvd which is one way in that area so you must be traveling in the direction of the shopping center or you have to make a U-turn near the Ilikai. Oh and just to make the impression even less favorable, I just received a "thanks for staying" message from them. So as I say, do not make a reservation and please do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay.

The Equus hotel is a charming Beautiful hotel. I Loved there new waterfall out front of the hotel. My room was kept up very clean. I stayed on the 5th floor. I want to give a HUGE Thank you to the housekeeper Linelle who took careof my room. I was also surprised to find out she was also The Equus hotels concierge. She does a great job and does need to be recognized. Thank you Linelle for everything. The Equus is very fortunate to have you.

Based on other reviews, I stayed here for 2 nites in late May, 2013. It is clean, the staff friendly, but it is a 2-star hotel. It has no unloading area. The small 7-stall parking area is open (re; subject to break-in). You have to haul baggage from there and up a steep flight of steps to the hotel's single, slow elevator (and we were on the 7th floor). From inside our room, the front opened to one side of the narrow bldg (ie; like a motel) and the balcony door was the other side. We couldn't get A/C to work, called front desk and was told to "jiggle the handle of the balcony door". This didn't work, but a nice, polite maintenance guy used double-sided sticky tape to fix the problem within 30 minutes. The bed was rather soft, there was no tub (shower only) and neither the bathroom nor balcony door would fully shut. Is a 10-minute walk to the beach (if you don't mind walking thru the main entrace of one of the beachfront 5-star hotels. Is also 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Mall. So, if on a tight budget and needing to be on the west end of town, you might consider Equus. Otherwise, for the same price, you can stay at the much nicer Wakiki Resort Hotel, but you will be on the other end of town.
user_name:
Gary B
Flat Rock, North Carolina

review_body: I stayed at this hotel in May and I just wanted to thank the conceiree Linelle for helping me put a Luau Package together I also want to say that she does an awsome job during the Friday evening cocktail hours she was very helpful and very nice and really shows the aloha spirit because of her i will refer my family and friends thank you again Linelle

To say this hotel was a disappointment is an understatement. We choose this hotel last minute because our flight got cancelled. I went off the great reviews I read about the Equus on TripAdvisor. After staying there, I am quite certain those reviewers must have been staying at a different hotel. "Boutique" is the hotel's way of saying it is old with thin walls and single pane windows. There was so much noise from the street below I could not sleep and we were on one of the highest floors. I downloaded white noise and used earplugs and still didn't sleep well. The room is small but the bathroom is tiny. There is a huge 2" gap under the entry door. There are a handful of parking spots under the hotel so we had to hike blocks away and pay $20 a day in a parking garage. We had to climb two flights of stairs from the street to the lobby with bags and children. No elevator. The staff was marginally helpful during our stay.  I would not return to this hotel for any reason. The cost is similar to other nearby hotels, please try one of those instead.

We stayed 5 nights at The Equus Hotel. We rented a car and did not spend anytime at the hotel during the day. When we were at the hotel, it was everything we could hope for. Everything was comfortable and convenient. It was a short walk (40 yards) from parking to the elevator. We were on the 9th floor and I can say that every room on our floor had an ocean view. Outside our front door we could see the boats in the Marina. The hotel is about a half a mile walk to the main drag in Waikiki which was great because the main street there is filled with people. The front desk handled every request of ours immediately. The staff was so nice and helpful. Pookah was working the front desk during the majority of our stay. He was unbelievable. Yoshi also worked the front desk and was just as helpful. The hotel also has an association with a horse stable in the North shore. We booked a horseback ride through the hotel and were not let down. The trail we rode on was right on the sand on the North Shore and they have a great beach where we brought our own picnic lunch. I would definitely recommend the ride. In the room, there is a medium sized fridge/freezer which was great for keeping our own drinks cold. There is a K-cup coffee maker in the room as well. There is a convenient store open til 1 right around the corner with snacks, drinks (hard and soft) and gifts. Also, a couple blocks inland, there is a Walmart. The room we had had a king size big that was great. There is a great balcony with table and chairs on it which was great for sending email in the morning with some coffee as well as watching the passing traffic with some wine in the evening. The staff was unbelievable. All in all, it was a great trip and staying at the Equus made everything easier for us. We absolutely plan on coming back to Honolulu and we will absolutely be staying at the Equus.

Maid service was perfect!! Kitchenette saved us a lot by not having to eat out every night. The savings went twoards attractions. We kept the huge picture window open to enjoy the amazing view of the beach. We had a few pests but Adrian came up right away with bug spray and that's all we needed. Also, ms. Linelle, the concierge makes a to die for Equus signature spiked Hawaiian tea. She is so friendly and told us how to save $$$$ at the Pearl Harbor attractions, I.e. Arizona, uss missouri, and aviation museum. Only complaint besides bugs was a women named Renee. Internet did not work in our room and all she did was pass me along to Internet customer service. Who in turn will call back within 24 hours.. Not good. Then when I did get a call back I was told he spoke to Renee and she knew all along the last guest changed the password. Why wasn't I told this from the beginning? Eventually tech support helped me, not Renee. But thanks to the rest of the staff, will for sure be back.. Thank you again Adrian and Linelle..
user_name:
Michelle D
Boston, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: First and for most I would like to express my sincere thanks to our heavenly father for this opportunity, I would love to give a special thanks to the boss/owner and the lovely staff's of the EQUUS HOTEL for the professional service in welcoming us to your hotel, I love the hotel and your friendly people especially your front desk people, Princess Kolokika Ilalio, Queen Puka and the lovely Miss Renee, thank you so much for everything, serving us with the smile each day and make us feel special.This is like my fourth time at you beautiful hotel, I come back and share with my people about it and some of my co-works, friends and family come and stay at your hotel, I also get the same feed back from them, and this are the same names that comes up, team work a guys, keep up the good work and I love you all.Oh one thing about Equus that I can never forget are there conformable rooms, a lot of space and clean, the service they provide everyday in changing our towels and etc. excellent thanks to the ladies that clean our rooms daily. The showers and the bathrooms are nice and clean.I will be seeing you again next month and that will be June, I hope your boss will consider a special surprise for you folks, keep up the good work, team work guys and make your boss happy with the hard work you do each and every day.I love Equus HotelCaroline Stowers

It any endeavor it is always a pleasure to see professionalism demonstrated…this hotel is professional albeit it smallMost reasonably priced Waikiki Branson hotels are worn out as are their staffs.The Marriott extended is a welcome contrast and is very well run!First, it is clean and the staff is as welcoming and eager to help, one would believe they are in the far east where hotels are excellent --- Good attitudes.Especially Rene, a Hawaiian star, who welcomed me from a long journey - arranged for all to work - a perfect room.My two demands for a hotel room are a firm bed and a generous shower They score A+ on both countsTheir rooms are modern and easy to operate. In short you do not need a Ph.D to use the TV or lights.... or use the shower !They are well located and a shot distance from many restaurants, shows and attractions in Oahu/ Waikiki an easy walk to all spots -- nearby great mall.The elevator was bit slow - worst item I could find...In shortGood valueI will be back

Our family stayed there for a couple of days in the Summer of 2012, it was our first big vacation since my dad passed earlier that year, and we really had a great time during our stay there. Your staff was so gracious and accomodating, we were travelling with 7 kids between my brother and I...so you can only imagine how much fun that was...LOL. Kika, Rene and Puka were so helpful, just made our stay there much more enjoyable. We would definitely stay there again! Mahalo for making us feel at home! Until next time....

first I would like to say that your staff was excellent from your bellman to your front desk clercks . the atmoshere of the hotel was relaxing and made us feel very welcome . we so enjoyed our stay there and wiould like to make it a yearly stay . our convention happens every year and the location is just perfect . as for the room it was clean and I love the energy saver you installed . eveything about our room was excellent . we sure did enjoy our 2 days there thank you to your staff . for making our stay very enjoyable and relaxing ..mahalo Kumu Hula Twyla Ululani Mendez

This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in. From being greeted with a glass of ice cold pineapple juice, to being served a plate of fresh cut pineapple when I got to the room, to the friendliest staff ever, I had to double check my reservation to see if I had paid for an executive suite!! LOL! I felt like a VIP the moment I got there til' the day I left. Rene, Puka, Justin,Kika, and the housekeepers (who does an amazing job), THANK YOU for making my stay in Hawaii a great one. Your aloha spirit was truly felt by this traveler. THANK YOUUUU!
user_name:
Dora S
Pago Pago, null, United States

review_body: AlohaI always return to Equus Hotel..this time i booked the one bedroom apartment ....i love it..the interior is woooowww...super stylish....i dont want to leave already.Beautiful Rene which is the manager of the hotel bring me a bottle of  sparkling wine produced from grapes grown in the Champagne region of France ..i feel spoiled already by the staff of the hotel...Puka and Rene in my eyes represent hawaiian hospitality..aloha spirit...ohana..good mana..so rare to find nowadaysThis hotel is really amazing and unique...i highly recommend..have an excellent location..rooms are so beautiful...european style..everybody work so hard to maintain this hotel to high standards of quality so people who visit this hotel to feel like home.I am always happy to return everytime i travel Honolulu i book this hotel ..simply becouse i love it.Thank you from my heart Puka and Rene it is a great honour to meet you..my respect for you both..

A lovely stay we had at the Equus. The staff so welcoming and pleasant. From check in to check out. They made our stay in Hawaii a memorable one. From front desk clerks to the housekeepers as well as the management, they all gave such great service. The rooms nice, clean and comfortable. The location was perfect and convenient with walking distance to the mall, restaurants and beaches. The Equus caters to families, business or anyone looking for a pleasant stay at a hotel in Waikiki.

Had such a pleasant stay here! Great location, with walking distance to Ala Moana Mall, Waikiki strip and Beach! We were greeted with a fresh glass of pineapple juice when arriving to the lobby, by such great hostess! Then accompanied to our room. The room was very clean, beds were so comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. The relaxing spa pool is wonderful and very private and relaxing! I would recommend staying here mainly for the hospitality of the staff and location! Loved it!

I just love this hotel..reminds me so much of European hotels...very stylish.Everytime i return i feel like home.The staff of this hotel are amazing ...Puka and beautiful Rene have aloha spirit ..make them so unique.Room is always clean...bed very comfortable...very elegant interiors...very stylish..remind me very much of the hotels of French Riviera.I highly recommend this hotel...as i said i always return with pleasure.Mahalo Rene and Puka...Justin and everybody who work there for making me feel like home.Aloha

Jackie was so helpful in everything we needed she was on top of everything she went above and beyond her job duties to make us feel at home! She was so friendly and welcomeing as well! She is a keeper for sure we will go back just to visit her and stay at this hotel again because of her!

Linelle was so very helpful, welcoming and super friendly. She is a keeper. I had a few basic needs before a night out and she not only got me a sewing kit but provided some wonderful conversation and some wine for my husband and I as part of happy hour.. She is a bright star here at Equus.
user_name:
Mary A S
Bridgewater, New Jersey

review_body: Very comfortable beds, nice rooms, clean rooms and bathrooms. Good location just 5-10 mins walk to Waikiki beach. All amenities around hotel. Only downside of this hotel was breakfast nothing really to eat in the morning. I have stayed here for 6 nights. Staff and service very good.

This was a beautiful little hideaway. The hotel was well kept, clean and comfortable and the staff was outstanding. Haunani was gracious and all of the staff was friendly and helpful. I loved that this was a small, unobtrusive hotel compared to the overbearing high rises surrounding it. Thank you, Haunani for a beautiful staycation!

Literally. So, I chose this hotel because the AAA rate was $99/night, about $50 cheaper than most affordable hotels. But then I found out that nearby hotels were just as inexpensive and were in a tower with like 20+ floors... oh well.Anyway, I'm going to make this short and bittersweet.Pros: Affordable, very good climate control system, fridge, nice shower, decent internet connection but NO wireless in room, good cleaning service and replacement of shampoos etc, 0.3 miles from Convention Center (where my conference was), 24-hour front desk service, around the corner from an ABC Store (food and stuff), not far from Hilton complex where the closest beach is.Cons: Noise from adjacent rooms is loud. Walls are thin. If this is an issue for you like it was me, make sure to ask for a room that does not have an optional conjoining door, which is the least sound-proof door in the world. Also, I had roaches. At least one per day. I know this is the tropics, but that's just unacceptable. It's basically because the door is about 1cm off the ground, so anything small can get in. Blech. Also, my climate control remote control did not work properly, I think the battery was dying. The volume control on my tv was busted, too, so I didn't bother using the tv. Hair drier was busted.Caution: If you don't like pillow-top beds that make you nearly fall off, don't stay here. If you are freaked out by roaches, don't stay here. If you make a reservation, make sure you know whether it's the Marina Tower or the Equus, as the Equus is old and roachy, and I imagine the Marina Tower is new and roachless (but I'm not sure, obviously).

Our stay at the Equus was pleasant. Nice room, good facilities, friendly staff.The hotel has a pool but no one uses it as it's small and shaded by high rise buildings.The equus is a great hotel if you want a good room for a reasonable price in Waikiki close to the beach and shops. If you see yourself wanting to lounge by the pool all day "resort style", you'll have to pay more money than here.

My stay at The Equus Hotel was more then what I expected. My room was beautiful and the bed was heavenly. The one person that made my stay one to remember and an awesome stay was Linelle. Not only was she the one that up kept my room and made it spotless, But she also is The Equus Hotels concierge. I always had questions for her Friday nights when the hotel has there cocktail hour. This being my first time to Hawaii she had so much recommendations for me. I tried them all. The dinner cruise,pagoda,Leonard's bakery,Germaine's Luau and the flea market. Thank you Linelle for helping me. I give her two thumbs up, 5 star rating and a tripadvisor review.

I had the best stay at The Equus.My room was great and the best part was meeting Linelle. Excellent customer service. Thank you Linelle. We will be returning. Location is awesome. I also loved the cocktail hour .

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the Equus - found it in a travel book as a "lower price" option and it exceeded my expectations. It has recently been remodeled, and our room was on the top (10th) floor so we were a little further from the street noise. Breakfast was included (and was very hearty!), though it is served at a restaurant down the street. It is also very walk-able to parking, a few restaurants, and the beach. Overall I felt the room was clean, comfortable, and safe - I would definitely stay here again.

Overall a very good stay at the Equus. Found it on-line and the add/photos were not misleading at all. Beautiful room with lovely furnishings and lanai. Hotel workers, Justin and Yoshi were excellent! They went above and beyond to make our stay go well. Nice touch by having fresh pineapple juice upon check in. Would have been nice to have free, fresh brewed coffee in the morning given the price. Parking was not good; had to park across the street and pay $20/night; this was more than the other places we stayed on Oahu. Noisy downtown location and second night's stay room had issues: ants, main door and lanai door stuck and very hard to open. Staff came and addressed ants right away and sprayed.

First night stay was on the 3rd floor toward the front. The room has a small balcony with sliding glass doors. Unfortunately the street in front of the hotel is big city noisy amplified by the surrounding tall buildings. This sound goes through the doors into the room, especially from trucks and motorcycles. Management moved us to the 10th floor toward the back for following night which was better. Equus also has rooms in the 40 storyMarina Tower right behind but still noisy even at 35 floors above the street. If noise doesn't bother you then location is good and price is OK, and rooms are well appointed.

I have stayed at many Waikiki & Oahu hotels. Thought I would try this one next. It is not a large hotel, maybe 80 +/- rooms. However, the staff is far more helpful & responsive than most large hotels and as friendly as they come. The only negative, if you call it that, is the extremely limited parking and size of parking stalls This would be a great hotel for those who use public transportation; it is a charming spot in a great location and, being on the edge of Waikiki, it is within walking distance of Ala Moana, Ala Wai boat harbor and transit lines. Two thumbs up!

The staff are very friendly and quick to respond to our requests. The lobby is small and cozy, where you can connect to free wi-fi and/or use the internet to check in flights etc. There is also asitting area just off of the front desk.Rooms include a small mini bar area with refrigerator; & an In room coffee maker; and safe. There is no restaurant on site, but there are plenty of restaurant choices within walking distance, both upscale and fast-food including coffee shops. Excellent location; and neighbourhood, situated a short distance from the canal. The Ala Moana shopping center is a short walk, and Waikiki beach is nearby as well.The only negatives are stairway which can be difficult when you are carrying bags; and the uninviting shaded, small pool. We enjoyed our stay very much and recommend the Equus.

Where do I start...lets see ill start with the parking lot. So for the entire hotel there are only 7 parking spots...yes that's right 7 and its a first come first serve basis, so your lucky to get one for $20 a day. We were in a minivan and our driver would have to crawl out of the driver window cause there is no room between the spaces (he dropped the rest of us off before parking); Horrible!! The only way to access the hotel is up a flight of stairs...so no ramps. So, good luck if your handicap or have a hard time going up stairs (or have a stroller like we did). The hotel lobby is tiny...I mean it can fit like 4 people or so. The elevators take a very long time and are also slow. We arrived earlier than check in and had requested a early check in but were told when we got there at 8 am that neither of our rooms (we had 2) would be ready til normal check in time of 3pm. So thankfully we had a rental car to keep our luggage in. We believe they handled this very poorly (I have worked in a hotel before and know that it's about accommodating your guests). Our room was suppose to be a king and we received a queen...the hotel room decor is very outdated and not cute! The only place you can use the free wifi is down in the lobby area; which is tiny. The showers were very small leaving it hard to shave my legs. One of the nights, at the hotel next to us, their fire alarm went off and was very loud. Another night a fight broke out in a room below us which kept us up all night (the people involved had to have the ambulance and firefighters called...it was serious). One good thing about the hotel was the bed was extremely comfortable!! Overall, myself or the other party we were with, would never again stay at this hotel. We were very dissapointed : (

Great experience. Wonderful friendly, polite and professional staff. Beautiful rooms and amenities. The service here is outstanding . At the front desk, Rene , Puka and Yoshi ..also Justin ..thank you soooo much ... made me feel like they cared and went above and beyond.Exceptional service from all staff members. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.Hated to leave but will return!.:).

Loved our stay at the Equus Hotel! Our room was clean and well maintained. It is located near Ala Moana Mall and beach which made entertaining very convenient. We thank Mukai, Inc. for finding us this Fab hotel at great price, with complementary breakfast. The staff was so helpful and truly represented the Spirit of Aloha ...shout out to Puka!!!!

This is my 2nd stay at the Equus Hotel and something brought me back, thats the hospitality of the staff. Appreciates the attitude at the bell desk helping with a smile all the time, the front desk staff always answering and coping with requests, and the housekeeping staff keeping the room oh so clean. Thanks to Linelle for the aloha and fresh juice from the get go and the follow ups, great attitude.
user_name:
Faletoa U
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: The concierge, Linelle's charm is only exceeded by her superior customer service. The rooms were clean and inviting.. can not miss the hotels cocktail nights where you can mix with the staff and fellow guests in the lobby. I traveled with 3 children, 1 with a disability that requires a wheel chair for long walks. Even tho the hotel has stairs to the foyer the staff did not hesitate in helping me carry her to the foyer.. rooms were large enough for a family of 4.The hotel is positioned in a safe location and is close to major shopping outlets and restaurants.Have to also mention a young gentleman named Justin who was pleasantly helpful during our stay.

My husband and I stayed at the equus hotel for awhile. When we checked in there Bellsman Keo helped us with our luggage and we got a shell lei. We where then given a glass of chilled juice from Linelle who introduced herself as there concierge. She was very nice and polite. What we were getting tired of was waiting to check in. The clerk at the front desk name yoshe was more concerned answering the phone then helping the guest to check in. He had a line of people waiting. Thank you soooo much to Linelle who took it upon herself to invite me and my husband and the other group of people that was waiting to there lobby area to have a seat and to feel free to ask her any questions that will make our stay more memorable and comfortable. Please work on your front desk clerks thats why i rated service a 1.

I had a great time in hawaii missing all the aloha very friendly people. What i liked most was our concierge lineele.lineele she made my stay very welcome. She had a great attitude towards me and others i just want to say thank you for everything.

I liked my room. It was Beautiful. I liked the fact that they have a concierge Linwood who helped with my stay and my planning of the week. I will be returning soon. Squid nice lobby area. The Front desk needs to speed up there check in when its time to check in.

Very friendly, helpful staff, especially Linelle during the free happy hour Thurs/Fri. Renovated rooms have a fridge to save on meals if you want, lots of fresh airflow with the window open, and great air conditioning when shut. Bring earplugs first few nights, lots of traffic along main Blvd. Parking is very tight under the hotel if you have a large rental car, and expensive at $20 a day.

Thank you Linelle for helping us in everway we needed. Especially with directions. The only down fall was waiting to check in. The front desk clerk took forever but I enjoyed my stay. Thank you Mrs Linelle

This is a great find.........the staff is so friendly and helpful. Our on negatives was the noisy door and windows as the trade winds blow. We though someone was knocking on the door. The rooms are clean and updated.

We were greeted with a cold glass each of pineapple juice, allowed a 4 hour early check-in and given a choice of rooms. Our queen room was clean and comfortable. Couldn't get TV to work and notified front desk. Maintenance was there inside of 5 minutes and got it going. (actually just a loose plug). Staff was friendly and helpful. Yoshi at front desk greeted us every morning when we came down to get our breakfast vouchers, gave helpful advice on beach, shuttle, etc. Yoshi also handed out beach towels...that was a nice little perk. Kika also asked if things were ok and told us to let her know if there was anything she could do. Renee was also nice.....Hey, Nice folks....what can I say? We thought it was Just Fine, thank you....D & T

The Equus gets 2 thumbs up. My room was great and most of all Linelle's customer service was beyond met. I will refer to my friends and family about this hotel. Much Mahalo Linelle. Outstanding job. One of a kind person.

we purchased a decoration paddle in big island and it is kinda oversize, so we had a problem to checked it in. The front dest manager, Rene, is really helpful and helped us find a cardboard. Although it is not completely fit, it is still works. The room is quite clean and the location is good too. Personally, I dont like crowded beach such as Waikiki, this hotel is really close to ala moana beach park which is a cozy beach in comparison with waikiki. Walking distance to ala moana mall too! Anyway, it is good!Enjoy your stay in hawaii! Aloha!

I traveled with a group of 6 people. Friday evenings were the best. Linelle is very knowledgeable and is very good with the guest. I was amazed on how she was able to entertain everyone in the lobby area and have the time and patience to help every single gust. Including me. She is such a people person its hard to come across people like that. Keep up the excellent job Linelle. Hats off to you. Thank you.

I had a great stay at the Equus. Great job To Linelle who helped us with our planning and venturing around the island. We will be returning. The wine was great and so was the atmosphere. The music in the background suits the lobby area.

I liked a lot of things about this hotel. Excellent location and close to everything. Car rentals, ABC Store, Beach, other hotels and restaurants. Older, dated hotel and room was similar to what you'd expect in Europe, i.e.being efficiently laid out without a lot of extra elbow room. Since we wander and try to discover new things when we travel, we do not spend a lot of time in the room itself. The staff is very helpful and accomodating and make any negatives easier to accept. All in all a good value for the location. The bed was very comfortable and the fridge in the room had a freezer that you can actually utilize. The only downsides for my wife and me, was the lack of a larger dresser/chest of drawers for our clothing and the noise from the street. Because it is an older hotel, the balcony doors do not block out the noise. The last night, I used earplugs and slept well. Because Hawaii is 5 hours behind the East Coast, I assume that everyone goes to work early and subsequently, the street noise starts early. My wife is a sound sleeper, so it didn't bother her as much as it did me.If you want to keep your expenses down, but still be well located, Equus is a good choice. The staff is very friendly and more accomodating to your needs than some very expensive properties that we have stayed at. As strange as it sounds, if you bring some inexpensive earplugs along, you can enjoy a good nights sleep and not be awakened by scooters and traffic noise.

Equus hotel was just the perfect fit for us! Linelle was awesome! She made us feel very welcome!! Justin made us laugh everyday, wonderful personality and Yoshi was very helpful. Room was clean, perfect location, walking distance, close to everything! Andy and Dawn

Yes, very friendly. Called down to the front desk two times and they came up to help quickly. Downside...why did I have to call two times? One, internet wasn't working. Strange sequence of passwords which nobody informed me about to begin with. Two, television didn't work. Again, strange sequence of operations to get the tv to operate (which includes unplugging it each time). Next door had a party which seemed to have started at 2 a.m....yes I heard every word. Now mind you, the front desk person gave me a room far from Ala Moana blvd. Two pane windows. Still heard the traffic...motor scooters galore. Rooms are ok and clean, but from the exterior it looks rather dumpy. The upside is the friendliness of the staff and it is close to Ala Moana Mall. Downside is well, its a boutique hotel Small, thin walls, nothing really to do at the hotel except sleep. The pool is not worth putting on swimming trunks for. I would guess it at 8 feet by 15 feet maybe? And no sun really hits the pool, so forget getting a tan here.

Linelle did a fine job, she helped us with dinner plans the next day for our tour and site seeing. She is a great gal and should get a raise. You should work on your web site as I was about to give up on this due to it not wanting to submit.

I found the Equus Hotel, a really good place to be. It's within walking distance of the big shopping centres, across the way from a really relaxed beach, and far away enough from the crowds of Waikiki. The rooms are clean, the bed is luxuriously comfortable, and the people are just delightful. But perhaps the main reason I would return is for Justin, the bellman. Nothing is too much trouble for him, and everything he does is with a smile. Thank you, Justin, for making my stay at the Equus so very enjoyable.

My name is Ben Sili and I had the pleasure of staying at the Equus Hotel last September and was extremely impressed with the level of customer service I received from the staff and the quality and comfort of the room were both of superior quality. I considered that the price I paid was extremely reasonable and I will certainly use your property again when I am in Honolulu. My business necessitates that I travel a great deal, thus I have the experience of a number of hotel properties, yours was a privilege to stay at. To reiterate, the undoubted highlight of my stay at your establishment was the level of commitment that your staff and in particular Ms Kika Ilalio, Puka and Rene provided me with. There was nothing that was too much trouble for her and her demeanor and her obvious care for the guests in her care was apparent and refreshing.

10 min walking distance from Ala Moana shopping centre. Our classic queen room was comfortable and we were very happy with bed.The only one downside was no available parking spaces so we had to park across the road above Red Lobster restaurant for $15 per night. But if you are looking for sightseeing holiday with shopping but not sunbathing on the beach, then the Equus hotel is a great value for money.

We stayed 23 nights at The Equus Hotel. With my wife I occupied one room while my daughter and grand daughter stayed in an adjacent room. We appreciated the hotel's location that allows easy access (walking distance) to beaches (Ala Moana, Magic Island and Waikiki) as well as restaurants and the Ala Moana Shopping. Free internet and local calls are also very convenient. In none of the four weekends when we rent a car we could use the limited space of the garage. The supplied coffee saches (for our rigourous Brazilian taste) were very weak and we made up for buying a pack of delicious Hawaiian Kona coffee - dark roast. At the front desk, Paulo and Yoshi, as well as the other attendants, were particularly efficient and helpful.

I stayed here for a week and found Justin - the bellman provided an excellent level of service, he was friendly, professional and very helpful. Thank you!It rained light showers off and on but you don't need an umbrella, the rainbows that result are spectacular.

The hotel was a cozy hotel that's central to EVERYTHING! And the best part was that I didn't need transportation (limited parking if you rent a car - don't do it); I walked everywhere! The hotel was clean and priced just right. The restaurants were right across the street or a couple of blocks away; the shopping mall was also a few blocks away - all in walking distance. The hotel staff made it their business to ensure that their guests were comfortable and satisfied. Many thanks to Linelle, who gave that extra personal touch! I would stay here again without reservation. It is very clean - that's all I need. It is right off the street, so the sirens can get a little loud (just made me feel even more at home - I'm use to them)! p.s there is a lounge area/breezeway with a pool. Nice balcony with the room and an ATM in the hotel.

i stayed at the equus for 4 nights it was a suprise stay for my birthday from my wife and she and I loved how cute and clean the room was . We enjoyed our stay our room attendent Doreen kept our room clean and made us feel like home . I would recomend any one to stay at this hotel the rooms are cute the location is great and the staff is just so wonderful and friendly.

Very true, good value for the $, close location to Waikiki and only take a few minutes to walk to Ala Moana shopping center. KEO ROCKS, he welcomed us, brought a cold drink while we were checking in and we're sorry we didn't get to say goodbye. Everyone was friendly and helpful - Mahalo!

My wife and I stayed at the Marina Tower from January 14 to 24th. We had a room with a view and kitchenette. That was a great experience. One should not expect any luxuries at this price point at the hotel this old. For the place that old its in great shape overall.Everything was in working order. Daily room service. We heard some complains about roaches but have not seen any and I have to admit looking for them. We took our garbage out to a dump twice a day in order to minimize risk of attracting roaches. It is great location and walk to our favorite Hale Koa beach was pretty short. Everything is close by: car rentals, bus stops, stores etc.If you came to HI for the sun and the beach it is great place to stay without breaking the bank.They have nice tennis court as well which is always in the shade for those who likes to play tennis. We save quite a bit of money by making our own breakfast and sometimes lunch.There is some elevator noise but it is not as bad as in some other older hotels.

This was my first time to Hawaii. When I arrived to this hotel I did not know what to expect it being a small hotel. A gentleman carried my luggage upstairs. The front desk clerk was busy on the phone while I waited. I was greeted by there concierge, which I was surprised that they had one. She introduced herself and brought me a chilled glass of juice and offered me to have a seat in there lobby area which was very cozy. She politely said if I had any questions feel free to ask her and I even recieved a card. I was very impressed. Her first impression made a big difference. Thank You Equus concierge Linelle. I would highly recommend this hotel and I would highly recommend for future visitors to ask for Linelle.

We recently stayed here and wanted to share our positive experience. The hotel has a great location and have friendly, helpful and customer service oriented staff. Mahalo to Rene and Puka! They really made sure we had a nice stay. Overall, good value for your money. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Honolulu!

Me and my girlfriend stayed at this hotel during the pro bowl week. We flew in from the mainland and arrived at the hotel friday evening. We were surprised upon checking in to be greeted by their concierge Linelle. She invited us to their cocktail hour while we waited to register. We just wanted to say thank you Linelle for the warm welcome and for making us feel at home. We will be returning in the near future. Aloha.

BEST FEATURE: LOCATION! On a last-minute visit, we didn't want to inconvenience family so we decided to find a budget hotel conveniently located in town. Equus Hotel was a great find! We used a car for most of our stay (and had no problem getting a parking space in the small lot every night), but we did some walking, too. The hotel is on the edge of Waikiki (not centrally located), but it isn't a bad walk to other Waikiki hotels or the beach. It was actually pretty nice to stroll through the nearby Hilton Hawaiian Village grounds (beautiful hotel, fancy shopping area, penguins!) and Fort DeRussy (also beautiful to walk through; excellent running paths). If you head in the other direction, over the bridge by the harbor, it's an easy walk to Magic Island (beach/park) or Ala Moana Shopping Center, a local favorite for good food and shopping. There are nice restaurants and bars, but Makai Market is my personal favorite! It's not a standard mall food court-- I could eat there every day and find something different and delicious. Check it out- it has 4 stars on Yelp!SURROUNDINGS: Like most of Waikiki, this neighborhood is part tourist area and part low-rent apartments, so there are homeless or practically-homeless and random people hanging around. I would advise visitors to be street-smart like in any tourist area, but I definitely wouldn't say this area is at all dangerous or uncomfortable. In fact, Kalakaua Ave feels much nicer than some parts of Kuhio Ave that actually has prostitutes and shady characters on the street. In general, don't worry-- Hawaii people are pretty friendly and easy-going so it's unlikely you'll run into any unsavory situations.LOBBY: Non-existent. It's super small, typical of boutique hotels, but don't judge this hotel solely by the lobby. The staff is awesomely friendly and helpful, and the rooms are comfortable. If you are staying in the lobby building, there is just one, very slow elevator. We opted for the stairs that led to the garage because it was close to the car and good exercise. On our last day, they stored our bags for free, and I found out that they sometimes hold bags for a couple weeks for international visitors who use it as a home base while taking other trips across the Pacific or to the outer islands!ROOM: Stayed in the main building (not the Marina Tower). King bed, very comfortable. Really liked the bar area with mini-fridge and wide counter space. No bugs at all, like I've read in reviews of the Marina Tower. Horse-themed photographs and decorations were quirky but not too ridiculous. No sound problems with neighbors or cars. Private balcony with table and chairs- we used it to dry our swimsuits. It was nice to get fresh air in the room, but don't get excited for the view. From the 6th floor, we could see a bit of ocean, but mostly just the apartment building next door. Not pretty, not tourist-y, just regular and urban. BATHROOM: Limited privacy. If you will be sharing this room, note that the bathroom door is a sliding wooden door that may not close completely. Also, the bathroom is crazy small, with an unusually-configured toilet/shower area-- feeks like a locker room. Two people really can't be in this space at the same time. For example, brushing your teeth next to each other in front of the short sink/counter is awkward, and with the closet right behind you, there's no room for anyone to get past you while you're standing at the sink. Personally, I felt that the small, weird bathroom was fine because it was clean and I enjoyed the room overall at the price we paid.POOL: Give up- it's tiny, pathetic, and in a weird, unexpectedly windy, and cramped location. But who wants a pool in Hawaii? Go to the gorgeous beach across the street!!!BREAKFAST: The hotel gives you a paper voucher for a free hot breakfast (eggs, meat, hashbrowns, toast and juice) or $3 credit towards anything on the menu at a sports bar down the block. We sat outside on the lanai and enjoyed the sun. Right near the loud street, but we still liked it. As long as you keep your expectations reasonable, this is a free, satisfying meal, which I'd prefer over the McDonald's that was across the street.OVERALL: Would definitely stay here again because we had a good experience with the staff, love the location, and this no-frills hotel met our basic needs for a good price (booked through Orbitz w/a discount code).

Nice big bed, no bed bugs.The room is not clean at all, they just make the bed and change the toweles thats it! The carpet is so dirty that I used shoes!10 min to the beach.I will not stay here next time to dirty for me!Except from that the hotel is good.I even said to them that my room was dirty,they said that they will fix it but they dident

Hotel is centrally located near Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall. It is on the Red line for the tourist bus. There are many eating options close to the hotel. We asked for a "water view" room, and got one, a tiny view of the water between high rise buildings. The staff were helpful. The room was quite spacious and represented good value for money.

We stayed at the Equus for two nights prior to leaving Hawaii. We found the staff couldn't do enough for us, the bed was exceptionally comfortable and the room was clean. If you like shopping Ala Moana shopping centre is huge and walking distance from the hotel. There is car parking at the hotel but not enough spaces for every guest. We were lucky enough to get a park for the time we stayed. Hotel is basic but certainly served our purposes for our stay.

i stayed at the Equus during my stay in Hawaii. There has been times where i wouldve been at home. But when i got to the Equus it made me feel like i already was. There was this one employee that made this trip one to remember. I would like to thank Lenelle for this because she helped me when i needed help with directions around the island n places to eat. I will be coming back in the future. THANK YOU!

First off I will just list the things that suck about this hotel:1. Price2. No microwave in the room (They want to warm your food up for you in a nasty employee break room. They don't want u to enter, I guess bc it's so dang nasty!!! I insisted on warming up my own food. If I was the Board of Health, I would shut this room down. The microwave alone was so disgusting!!!!)3. No laundry facilities (they told me to walk down the street)4. The Internet Ethernet cable is super glued to the back of a dresser. Therefore, u have to sit next to it to use it. If not, you'll have to move the dresser elsewhere. Wifi in the lobby that's about 2x2. 5. No informational guide in the room about ordering food or any nearby restaurant listing. Thank God for Siri. Although, Outback Steakhouse and Red Lobster are about a 2 min walk. 6. They took my personal washcloth!!7. I called for toilet paper and it took so long that I had to go and get it. 8. The refrigerators do not keep your items cold. 9. There is a lot of city noise and parking is very minimal!!!Good:1. Good thing - Clinton was very helpful. 2. The ac worked really well.

rene and puka were top notch in making your stay very warming. The room was clean and the pillow top bed was too comfortable-hard to get up! would have liked to be closer to the beach but the walk did us good. Had to pay $20 a day to reserve our parking at the hotel but was worth it because parking in oahu really sucks.The location was great to people watch from our balcony, had many places to eat close by . The price was right on for our budget and we would stay again.Bill and Bonnie from Washington State.
user_name:
Bill and Bonnie R
Kelso, Washington

review_body: If you are small people, then this "boutique" hotel is for you. Our room was tiny, but the shower was the smallest of the small--no bigger than 3.5 x 3.5 feet. We found it difficult to turn around, and the hot water took forever (I'm talking a good 3-5 minutes to arrive). The bathroom was small with little counter space. As with most hotel bathrooms, there were not enough places to hang towels. (How much does a hook cost, anyway?) The toilet had such a powerful flush that it left the toilet seat wet after every use. The bedroom was small, as was the balcony, which had no light for reading at night. My husband found the bed acceptable, whereas I found the mattress too soft. There were two wicker-rattan chairs, which were uncomfortable when watching TV (we are not bed TV watchers). The room had a large armoir with a few small drawers and a gaping space--not too functional overall. Lighting was poor for reading. The refrigerator was not as cold as it could have been, although there was a nice granite countertop, which added useful space. There were no parking spaces available the entire time we were there, so we had to pay $20 a night across the street. Other than its limitations, the Equus was clean and offered some nice touches. First, service was impeccable. The front-desk night clerk, Clinton, was absolutely wonderful--an exemplary model of what every front desk person should be--courteous, friendly, attending to our every need. There were also complimentary copies of the Wall Street Journal, an inviting pool (though quite small), and an invitation to attend an evening wine tasting in the lobby. The hotel had an optimal location--close to Waikiki and Ala Moana Mall as well as many popular restaurants. Because we are tall people, the Equus was not the hotel for us, but if you are small people, you might consider it a good fit.

My check in (after an 11 hour flight from New York) was easy and Staff were wonderful. I was initially booked into the Marina Tower but found some baby roaches in the room ( not an infestation by any means, just a product of living n the tropics) I just didn't want room mates on my vacation! So I was upgraded and moved to a queen room in the Equus.The four poster bamboo bed was the best I have ever slept in and was pure bliss! The rooms are small - but you literally only sleep there so it is not an issue.The hotel was clean, staff great and it was conveniently located - either a quick walk into the main shopping precinct or alternatively the trolley stop is only across the road.My only criticism would be that wifi is only available in the lobby - a little outdated and somewhat inconvenient as every time you want to check something, make a booking or email you have to traipse back downstairs. I was on the 8th floor and with only one elevator it can sometimes be a little time consuming.Other than the wifi - a wonderful visit, Mahalo to all the staff hope to return soon!

This will be my 5th year staying at The Equus and Marina Towers. I have read other reviews that were mixed, but I am here to set the record straight.  Being Canadian, and living in Santa Monica, California I travel quite frequently all over the world for my conferences. Often, I stay at Hilton's and Sheraton's. Yes they are clean and nice, but they have no character or Charm. The Equus is a boutique Hotel in the best most central location in Waikiki in my opinion. The rooms all have there own theme and are very charming. If you can get a higher floor that would be ideal. Also, next door they own and you might be able to stay at the Marina Towers, those are also lovely accommodations and in certain cases you have a kitchen to cook. The upper floor views on the Harbor are breathtaking in this tower.  The best part of staying at the Equus and Marina Towers is the staff. They cater to your every need from beach towels, to directions to fixing any problem you may have. By far the 2 best employees are Rene and Clinton. Not only are they capable people but so warm and friendly. Clinton, is a Jack of all trades and knows so much about any subject you can ask him about the Hotel and the Island. Rene is the best. The hotel would not function without her, she truly is the Michael Jordan of that establishment. Be sure to deal with her, as she can make the difference between having an average vacation, and a once in a lifetime memorable Hawaiian dream stay. She is like the producer of movie who puts the whole movie together or like a good captain of a ship. She directs all her employees and guest and never cracks under pressure. In concluding, I would 100% refer and recommend this Hotel and Tower to any of my colleagues, friends and family.In fact, I am going to book my annual trip with them today.See you in HawaiiMahalo nui loa

This place was well located if you can walk to get to where you want to go. The bed in our bamboo room was sunk in the middle. Better like the person you're sleeping with because you'll end up right in the middle with them. If you like a really firm mattress this is not a good room for you. The staff was nice yes, but offered little assistance, gave vague direction at best. In fact, we found that although most Hawaiians are very friendly, they really couldn't tell you how to get from here to there. It has nothing to do with the hotel, but don't ever take the bus. Only 1 in the 5 drivers we had was helpful, the rest just shrugged their shoulders and sneered at questions. The literature put out by The Bus was not helpful at all. Back to the hotel - the room was clean and serviced every day. If you are looking for walk out the door to the beach, a hotel with restaurant and bar, concierge service and parking, then don't stay here. But if you are on a budget it's fine.

I absolutely loved this hotel. The bed was comfortable, the room was cozy, and I enjoyed having lunch out on the balcony with my honey. From the looks of the map, it seems like this hotel is a little far from everything, but I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't that far at all. To be honest, I liked that it wasn't square in the middle of the hustle and bustle. There were only minor noise issues, someone being extra loud in the hallway. My only complaint was that the pool was cold! I just went and jumped in the ocean instead!

We wanna shout out a great big Mahaloz to "Haunani" for alwayz hooking Us up when we need it!!! To Keo The most Aloha Bell Man You Could ever have & to Puka alwayz on it making sure We A OK with Our Stay!!! The Equus Hotel is Perfect, Comfortable, Price Reasonable, Staff is Awesome with so much Aloha Alwayz & that's why We would never stay @ another Hotel!!!! Plus it's close to Places that We go to. We Highly Recommend This Equus Hotel to everyone who wanna stay close to Waikiki & the Ala Moana Shopping Center!! Mahalo Again & We'll Be Looking Forward for Another Stay With You Folks!! GOD Bless & Malama Pono!! Aloha, Ed & Momi Kekaula

I have to say, when we first located the hotel that we booked, I was taken aback. I wanted to check out before even checking in. The parking is super small and I almost feel like the hotel is in a sliver on the very busy ala moana blvd. The first room we were offered was on the 4th floor, and man was the road LOUD in the room. So, I went back down with my bags and said it was loud. Luckily they were able to put us on the 9th floor. Still could hear the road but it was better. And it got even better when I laid down on the bed. I mean this is like the most comfortable bed in a hotel or cabin I can remember. Soft pillow-top. It is a King and is absolutely so comfortable. The room is nice too with some antique looking furniture and granite above the mini fridge.And we got used to busy, alley-like feel of the place. Mini fridge and flat screen were very nice too, and we even had a little ocean view from the lania. Nice city and marina lights view at night from the little standing area by the elevator. Pool is a joke, but you're in Hawaii so swim in the ocean. Bottom line, if you can afford it stay somewhere not a main road, but if not, this place is really comfortable and a great value. Thanks Equus.

my friends and I had a blast just staying over here for three nights!it was such a nice hotel!I love the fact that there was a lot of mirrors in the room :)also the staff are really funny and friendly I remeber one of them was linelle she's really helpful!she made sure we had extra towel for when we go swimming also her service was well doneWe are definitely coming back

First of all the price was right. The good: it was clean and the bed was comfy. Good location for me, I don't need beach. But: AC and TV remote didn't work on 1st day. wireless was so slow I gave up. After reporting the AC and TV the next morning, they did fix it. On departure the elevator was broken, I'm glad I travel light. 10 flights of stairs was a bit much. Also tried the wireless just before I left and it was fine. Parking was sold out as well.

I normally stay at a different hotel, but thought I would try this on for my overnight stay this time.Location is 5 minutes walk to the shops. Negative is the 20 or so stairs from the street to the reception area, which certainly needs an update as" you only have one chance to make a first impression" My room was on the 4th. floor in the hotel, not the tower. It looked out to the car parking decks and the property next door. The windows don't open and there was no balcony. However, I requested two beds, just so I would have somewhere to open my large suitcase. There were two full size beds, a flat screen TV, a coffee maker and refrigerator in my room. The TV reception was terrible as the picture on most channels was continually broken up with static. The bed was comfortable and I found the place clean. Internet available in the foyer.

The hotel is located within walking distance to the beach, the marina and the Ala Moana Center. If you have a disability, you'll have to climb many stairs in order to get to the very small, dingy reception area. The staff are not very helpful. They are very abrupt an don't go out of their way to be friendly (I was there for 7 nights). Our "first" room had roaches, we were then moved to another room that was dingy but seemed clean (we never saw any roaches but kept our suitcases zipped up). The maid service consisted of making up the beds and replacing towels. Our room was never vacuumed and our sink never looked as though it was cleaned. The internet never worked in our room. The hallways are dimly lit at night. The full breakfast that is provided by a nearby restaurant is horrid unless you prefer greasy eggs, fried potatoes and the cheapest margarine on your toast. After our first breakfast experience and a full vacation day of being sick, we opted to purchase our breakfast at the IHOP just down the road. Don't stay here.

Old and tired and not so clean. We were very disappointed and glad we only booked one night. we were put in a corner room on the 6th floor. It was really the 3rd floor as the floors were numbered differently. Wifi didn't work either. Lots of stairs to go up to reception on 1st floor and no lift to the car park on the ground floor meant that it was a challenge arriving and departing. The staff were friendly though and the porter did help us to our room from reception in he lift, and from reception to ground on departure. Staff arranged a taxi for us too.

first off the staff were really great people. kudos to jennifer the manager, who baked a homemade cake for my girlfriend's (charm) bday. it was delivered to room upon arrival. thx so much. we will definitely stay again. one day the water from hotel was gonna be shut down for maintenance. however all the staff (jennifer) made sure we were taken care with another room. above all a place where we are already planning to return. a good place to stay. i recommend checking in.

Stayed there for 5 nights. After staying at the Royal Hawaiin (pink) for 6 nights. Obviously the two don't compare and nobody would expect them to. I must say, we were quite impressed with the Equus boutique hotel. It was clean, maintained daily & friendly staff. King bed was comfortable & room while not expansive, was big enough, nice views from the balcony and walkway. We stayed on the 9th floor. Lift is a bit slow, but we weren't in a hurry very often. Close to Ala Moana Shopping Centre (5 min walk) Ross Stores & Walmart (10 min walk) and of course there's an ABC Store nearby. Can easily walk to the main Waikiki Strip (maybe 20 mins). Close to South end of Waikiki Beach (Hilton) and close to Marina and other quieter beaches. Sure breakfast was a short walk, but was fine. Free in room WiFi, unlike some of the more expensive hotels. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in this very affordable hotel. We would stay there again.

This year for my birthday we North Shore Oahu residents decided to "go to Hawaii" with an overnight in Waikiki. The Equus again proved to be just the spot. Beautifully clean rooms furnished with lovely antiques, super soft sheets, new photos in the breezeways of Hawaiian Cowboy life and freshly polished brass on the entry stairway. The staff was very kind and informed. We had a fine vacation.

We stayed here for one night prior to catching our flight back home. I was just looking for somewhere to sleep for the night and the price was right. Basically we were at the hotel for 15 hours so my review is based on a very short stay.The good Although our room was not quite ready at the stated check in time they did everything they could to get us settled as soon as possible. We were assisted with our luggage up all those stairs at the front entrance. The guy who helped us with this was really friendly !The room was clean, although basic and a little dated. For the price I thought it was reasonable though. Close to Ala Moana shopping centre and a few eating options. The not so good There is no wifi in the rooms (they do have ethernet connections but these obviously dont work with many tablets ) and we couldn't get the wifi in the lobby to work which was disappointing since we were hoping to communicate with family back home. Seriously , reliable wifi should be standard for hotels these days.The pillows were awful!Coffee in the rooms-Blerk! We ended up going to McDonalds which is close by the get coffee prior to our departure. To sum up , good for a night or two but I wouldn't recommend this as your primary base if you're staying in Hawaii.

This charming Hotel was a perfect place for my Husband and I to stay while seeing a concert downtown. The location was great! Our room was beautiful! We got the suite. I especially loved all the equine decor! The staff was super friendly and helpful!I highly recommend Equus Hotel!
user_name:
Chris B
Ewa Beach, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Our stay was wonderful rooms were clean, the views were breathtaking, and the staff was incredible especially Linelle Manu our housekeeper and evening security guard she was wonderful willing to show us the new local hot spots since my husband moved away 4 years prior, best places to eat and to go shopping none of the tourist traps, and so friendly had an amazing time and Linelle and the rest of the staff made it so much better made the hotel feel like home and like they were friends not just people who worked there!! Thank you Equus hotel and marina tower we stayed in room 3901 beautiful views and I loved that the windows opened.

It was a bit stressful that the taxi driver took fifteen minutes to find the hotel, then found that I had to climb 20 steps to rec eption with two, 25Kg suitcases, but got there eventually.The room was small and had a pil]e of dirty towels on a unit so moved to a new similar sized room on the fl;oor above. The balcony was ugly. noisy and uncomfortable.The bed though was so comfortable. Room service was poor and the bed was made only once in three days and the linen was not changed. We thought we had made a saving when we booked this hotel at around £85 a night but there was no saving, it wasn't worth even that. All in all OK but only just.

Pros: The hotel is walking distance from the beach, prices are reasonable, and the staff is friendly, AC in the rooms, small balcony for each floor. VERY CLOSE to enterprise car rental.Cons: no view to the ocean (it's blocked by bigger hotels buildings), the rooms are a bit old (which doesn't bother me), abd NOT CLEAN (the first day, I found hair everywhere in the bathroom), the freg is not connected to the power and smells very bad.Summary: go there only if you want to save money, otherwise I would pay up to 50% more and get a better place.

No one seemed to know of this hotel. Even the driver who met us at th airport had to call his office for it's location.Upon arrival, we had to be dropped in front of another building as there is no drive for the driver to pull into in front of the hotel. After carrying our baggage up two flights of stairs, the check in area is small and our reception (we were early) was not too friendly. We left our bags and went sightseeing returning later to a more reasonable reception, which was good because we were quite worried by now as to what we had booked. After checking in we were helped with our bags to the building next door. Even though the young man did not like heights he managed to overcome them to show us our room on the 39th floor. This elevation was useful as the location has a busy road (Ala Moana Blvd) running alongside it.The views were splendid and the room very comfortable with a safe and all the amenities to prepare food if you wished. There is also security on the front door.The location is within walking distance of the Ala Moana Mall and there are plenty of services in the surrounding areas: restaurants, coffee shops and ABC stores.Connection to the Internet is easy. There is no restaurant. There is a small lounge adjacent to the reception with toilet facilities. We used these to change prior to traveling to the airport.
user_name:
StewLee
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Upon Check in at this hotel we were warmly greeted by a young man at the front desk. Check in was a breeze. From the street this property is a hidden gem. You walk up a short stairway alongside a waterfall only to arrive at a quaint and cozy front desk area.When we arrived at our room were were happy to find all of the amenities to make our stay more comfortable and had a lanai that gay us a small glimpse of the beach. Our room was also equipped with a small mini refrigerator which was perfect to store a couple of snack and chill our water bottles. Wifi was also free!I needed some additional amenities and spoke on different occasions with Rene and Puka and both were more than happy to help. Rene works in the front office but also helps with the front desk and Puka I believe works the night shift. They are both perfect examples of demonstrating the spirit of Aloha and making us feel welcome on the island.This property is definitely within walking distance to the beach, mall and close to the epicenter of where all the fun is in Waikiki.Definitely recommend this property especially if you are on a budget as we were.Mahalo Equus Hotel!!!

First I was flying to Hawaii to meet my frist granddaughter last minute my Mother decided she wanted to come so she could meet her great grand child . I emailed the Equus and they emailed me back right away and added a roll away bed And added in the email what a great thing it was that my mother could join us.. We arrived early we were checked right in great with amazing fruit drinks. The lady at the front desk was a RAY OF SUNSHINE. I think her Name is Rene. Every time i went into lobby i was greeted with a beautiful smile. We didn't use the parking garage but i needed a space for one night for my son's car so we could all travel together to paradise cove. Went in and my Ray of Sunshine said not problem gave me the spot. And when i returned the key She remembered where i was going and asked how it was. To me that is perfect customer service ... Now for the room Clean everything we needed . Our cleaning staff was so nice Fely and Grace. There wasn't one person on staff that wasn't so sweet I can guarantee that next June when we fly our for my Granddaughters first Birthday I will be staying here... One more note I was traveling with my mother who is a Senior and my 12 year old daughter and not once did i not feel safe.. And again that is was very important. All i can say is thank you Staff of Equus marine towers for an amazing stay and experiences..This was a very special trip for my family I got to meet my perfect new grand baby but the hotel i was staying in remembered why my family was there and made our stay perfect... Amy Giunta

Staff is very helpful. Even though the lobby is small, it is cozy. The room is clean and modern. The location is perfect! It is close to shopping center and beach! It also offers breakfast voucher if you e stay in duxlue room. Juice will be provided upon arrive and red wine will be offered free in lobby very Monday and thursday. It will be better to buy ocean view room. I will recommend students to stay in this Hotel if your budget is tight! The downside of hotel is lacking of restaurant. If they can offer wifi in room that it will be better!

Stayed just one night in a tower room with ocean view. We were put on the 40th floor with a magnificent view. The room was very clean, well furnished and the bed very comfortable. The staff was helpful, in and out parking convenient, and we even received vouchers for breakfast at a nearby restaurant. And all for a very reasonable price. Would definitely stay there again.

The two of us booked in at the Equus for nine days with no real expectations. We arrived late around midnight and the first thing to note is a flight of stairs to climb with your luggage before reaching reception. No problem checking in (room 606), all very friendly. At that time of night there appears to be no one to help us with our luggage but for us this was not a problem. Reception is serviced by one lift but during our stay we never have to wait more than a couple of minutes for it to arrive, the healthy option is to take the stairs if you are in a hurry. Access to the room is by electronic key x 2. The room was clean, tidy and pleasant albeit a little tired, however the super king sized bed was very comfortable. The view from the room's balcony was of the city. There are coffee making facilities, a small fridge, good iron, ironing board, hair dryer, safe, alarm clock, good air conditioner, flat screen TV with cable programming and a wired internet connection with a very long ethernet cable to reach most corners of the room. Having access to a safe is very useful but you need to ask for a key at reception where you are warned that if the key is lost you will be charged $50 - fair enough just don't lose it. We used the safe to keep important documents and currency etc. The hotel has a small swimming pool which isn't frequented that much and I think there is access to a floodlit tennis court, also not used that much. Breakfast is provided in the form of a voucher which was requested and obtained from reception each morning - don't forget to ask because this is not automatically offered. The breakfast was provided by a local sports bar called Snappers (one block away) - can get very busy if you have a late breakfast but all good before 9.30am. Food offered was OK, scrambled egg, bacon or sausage, pancakes or potatoes, toast and fruit juice or coffee, good American atmosphere to start the day. Hotel location is superb, five minutes from the amazing Ala Moana shopping mall. Five minutes walk from Hilton Hawaiian Village and beaches. The bus route close to the hotel is a gateway to the rest of the island. We caught buses ("TheBus") to top attractions such as Pearl Harbor, Iolani Palace, Diamond Head and the North Shore all for US$2.50 per ride. Tip: Go to the local ABC store, just two minutes from the hotel and buy a four day unlimited pass for US$24 (ask the store how this works). This is a great way to meet the locals and exchange stories. The hotel's housekeeping and maintenance staff were always very friendly. Checkout is at noon and the hotel offers a room to lockup your luggage whilst you spend your final few hours in the city before departing for the airport. Reception was exceptionally helpful when our departing shuttle bus ride to the airport was extremely late to arrive - thanks for this. Small niggles encountered during the nine day stay, traffic noise both day and occasionally night. Also, the last night was had a noisy neighbour move in whom made phone calls all through the night and at the top of his voice - very frustrating but not the hotels fault (obviously he was still in a different time zone). I would without hesitation use this hotel again, we felt comfortable and safe there and it was very good value when compared to other hotels.

I usually stay over on the east side of Waikiki but my usual hotels were booked or too much room for a single. I found openings at the Equus on the west side and decided to try it out. The location is convenient to the key things I like - the beaches at the Hilton complex, the ABC store, the Ala Moana mall. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. The hotel is right on a chief commuting route, and the buildings in this end of Waikiki create a big echo chamber, so expect traffic noise during rush hours, but one is here not to stay in the room but to go out and enjoy Honolulu. The room was the right size for a solo traveler, well appointed, and clean. I liked that they give out Wall St Jrnl's at the front desk, which for me was a nice touch for a business oriented person. They offer an onsite GreenCarHawaii service, which is basically a pay-as-you-go car at $15/hr or $90+/day (ouch! - enterprise and alamo offices are a block away). Didn't use the car but good to have such an option. Grounds were nicely appointed and neat - good places to sit and take up the breezes. All in all, a great value for a solo traveler like me who wants access, willing to walk around, and be in a safe, accommodating hotel.
