Would definitely stay here and fit it into my rotation of fine places to stay on Waikiki that don't cost an arm and a leg.

Pleasantly surprised. Well above expectations. You get a clean and spacious room for 110 bucks. It's near the action in Waikiki, but not too close to the epicenter.The staff was thoroughly helpful and competent. Only gripe was that you had to park at a nearby garage for $20 a night. But all-in-all, unbeatable hotel for the price.

My 2nd time in this hotel. It's absolutely amazing! The staff are wonderful, really helpful. Beds were insanely comfortable.. The complete, and really personal, Aloha experience. I can't wait to go back.
user_name:
Caoimhe Meahbh H
London, United Kingdom

review_body: Up on arrival to this hotel, the staff seemed nice and the place was cute. They had a nice bathroom and the ralph lauren inspired room. However, it seemed small and it was just the two of us! There also wasn't alot of towels in the bathroom. The view was not nice at all. They gave us the room when you opened your front door, a big wall was smack right in front of me, which was not a plus. Overall I give this place an "ok".
They no longer have the continental breakfast. The beds are to die for. Good food nearby. Beach within three blocks. Employees respond immediately to inquiries. I would stay again

The best thing about this place is the staff. They were very nice and helpful.The parking on the other hand was a nightmare but for Honolulu it is par for the course. No room for parking so had to park in the garage across the street and walk back. $20.00 @ day for parking.I had a hard time sleeping due to the fact that the person next to me must have been running so type of odd thing out of their room. The door was opened and closed at least 100 time till 4 AM and every time the door would open it made a very loud noise.I was on the 7th floor and the street noise was loud.But for the price i would stay again.

This hotel was right across from the hawwan prince and it was very close to the alamona shopping mall! Right on the edge of wikkkii beach and area! The rooms were good for the price! And if u like horses the owners of this hotel own polo horses! I was not impressed with wikkkii beach after going to the cayo coco beaches in Cuba! Good sruf on the north shore in the winter!

The garage was a bit hard to find on arrival. We had to park by the river and walk over to find the front desk. After check in we had a parking pass and you have to be early to get one, first come first serve. Small garage so don't bring any tanks in there. The room was just big enough for us. The street level noise could be a factor for some, but we found it to be just part of the busy city. Construction goes on after dark and you will have to hear and experience work going on. The room had no kitchenette but had a little fridge. We had a double double room and weren't expecting a kitchen. The major problem we fought with this hotel was only technical. Every time you went below channel 48 you lost your cable tv. The cable went out after you left your room and came back too. We called the front desk 7 times during our 4 night stay to reboot our tv. I also caught the front desk ignoring the phone calls so I knew I had to walk down stairs to tell them to fix my tv again. The maintenance guy was prompt everytime I must say. They gave a different reason every fix. Be patience, don't turn it below 48, and some no reason at all.Be prepared to walk up some big stairs on check in but staff was helpful if they were around. The pool is also small and closes at sundown so don't expect to catch a dip after you're through sight seeing. We will use this hotel as a backup next time.
user_name:
Allen I
Yukon, Oklahoma, United States

review_body: I wouldn't have even bothered to write a review for this hotel, however, I sincerely hope that by writing this the hotel management will do something about the engineering department making all that NOISE! My fiancé and I stayed for 4 nights recently and nearly every single morning annnd afternoon there was apparently some big, loud project that needed to be done! Even on the weekend mornings :( I swear it even sounded like they were cutting metal on the roof!? Banging on this, power-washing that. Please, please, please (!!!) find a spot in the basement to do this work, find an alternate way, or use less noisy tools... It was so disappointing waking up in paradise with a headache, or trying to relax before dinner but not being able to...

I read many of the reviews on this hotel and because they were very mixed, I decided to book it anyway through Hotwire. At first they got my reservation under the wrong name (they had my last name as my middle name) but Hotwire helped me re-fax the booking and the Equus ended up saying they found my reservation and changed it to my correct last name (super polite/awesome guy who helped me). I also made sure I wasn't staying in the Tower because so many people complained about that.Yes, there's no elevator to the lobby so you need to lug your luggage up, which of course brings me back to my hostel days. And yes there's only one elevator but you never have to wait very long for it. The pool is small but who would swim there if the beach is 5 minutes away? And I've seen them clean the pool. The room was awesome. I was scared there would be cockroaches but after a thorough investigation I found it to be super clean and the room looks like what you see in the picture. It only has a shower stall but it's not so small you can't fit in it (I'm going to attribute this to the fact that they're a Green Association hotel). I also like that they have a very clean fridge with freezer. I've had no issues with the cleaning staff. They've been amazing. Everyone who works here is also super nice. The only drawback is how thin the walls are. You'll hear your neighbour come in and out and if they open the balcony or turn on the TV really loud. Also, Ala Moana is a loud street (drag racing is legal here) so Friday nights are loud. I brought ear plugs but didn't use them and I'm a light sleeper. Breakfast is at Snappers Bar, which is a less than 5 minute walk down Ala Moana served from 8 to 10 AM. It's a lot of food as you get scrambled eggs, toast, pancakes/home fries/rice, sausage/bacon, tea/coffee/juice/soda or you can get $3 off any breakfast menu item. All you need to do is leave tip (I usually left $1 if it was good service and on most days the servers were amazing). Honestly, I've stayed in hostels and this is a real hotel. It is small (hence boutique) but they really make sure you feel welcomed. And I really feel like they listen to customers and make changes accordingly, which is more than I can say about other hotels.

I wanted to mention, that this Hotel has been great to my girlfriend & I in the past and most recently, when I had to make a Cancellation on my reservations. We are repeat customers to this lovely hotel, an Reene at the front-desk/reservations was very understanding & considerate in helping me out on my unfortunate situation. They were kind enough to work with me and I was completely satisfied in the end.This is a Must-Stay hotel with some of the best nightly rates you'll ever find in the Waikiki area.Mahalo's !

At The Equus you are treated like you are at a five store hotel except at a reasonable price. You are greeted with a tropical juice and farewelled with a glass of wine. The beds were a pillowtop dream. I struggled to get out of bed in the morning because I felt so comfortable. When I would finally did get out, I was just a short walk away from the best end of Waikiki beach with more sand and plenty of watersports rentals. Back to the rooms, they are tastefully decorated in Polynesian style. The staff are super congenial and helpful. I will return to stay at The Equus whenever I need a place to stay in Waikiki!

Great location.Across from Marina, and a very short walk to beach and Hilton Lagoon. We did notice the noise - but accepted it, afterall we were on a busy road, in a busy place. Lots of eating outlets, and ABC store 2 doors down. We were on the 10th floor in the Equus Hotel. The room was very spacious, with small view to the sea. This is a no fuss hotel, that has been furnished nicely with a horse theme. Recepition was very small and often crowded - as the only elevator is there too. Really enjoyed our stay.

We stayed here for the 2nd half of our trip. We stayed at the hotel (not marina tower) and I would not call it a hotel, it felt more like a motel once you take the elevator to your floor, doors to hotel room are outside, rooms are not very large, and bathrooms are pretty small. The front desk staff is very, very nice, always smiling and the male service staff walking around were always quick to smile, greet, and give tips. The cleaning service staff were NOT nice, never greeted, and did not clean the rooms well. There was a wrapper on the floor near my bed on the first day and it remained there for the 5 days we stayed in the hotel. The pool is a joke, surrounded by buildings on all four sides, sun does not hit it at all, and it's extremely small, no steps at all, so do not be fooled by the picture on the website. The stay comes with breakfast voucher for Snappers, which is pretty good and does save money during your trip. Basically, you'll get a little more than what you pay for at the Equus.

Very welcoming and friendly staff! We were greeted with fresh pineapple and guava juice upon check in. Rooms were quite spacious and beds were soooo very comfortable! Location is excellent and price is as well. We will definitely be staying here again!! Mahalo :)

Great hotel for a great price! If you don't plan on staying in your room that much I couldn't recommend a better place. Besides the room being over-sized and clean, the bed was like sleeping on a marshmallow!!! I was in heaven! I plan to stay here every time I visit my brother in Hawaii. No doubt about it!

We stayed at the Equus in March after spending a week in Kauai. We flew in on our wedding day and the staff at the Equus could not have been more helpful. Prior to our arrival I contacted the hotel to ensure that everything would be covered for us as well as our guests and Rene took excellent care of us thinking of items I had not even considered. We were extremely happy with our room in the tower and the price worked well within our budget. We would like to return to Hawaii again in the future and I will be contacting Rene at the Equus again. I want to thank the staff, primarily Rene, for all their help with our wedding and honeymoon.

Words cannot explain the enjoyment of our time at The Equus Hotel. The location was the absolute best you could imagine....Minutes from Waikiki Beach, Magic Island, The Mall, Nearby Local Shops, Restaraunts, a convenient store, and even Mc'Donalds. The staff was great from the get go....Guava Juice and Fresh Orange Juice greated us at the door. The room was breathtaking, we recomend the ocean veiw, but the location is perfect either way. Karen, Renae, Jose and Justin were great the entire stay informing us on all the perks of Hawaii and taking care of whatever we needed. We have already started to plan our return and will be staying at the Equus Hotel again... For sure. Mahalo and Aloha. -Nicole and Blake in Arlington Texas!!

Feb 2012 we stayed on Oahu at PK for 5 nights. Great Location. Even though we had a balcony, we preferred our accomodation at 'The Equus 'the following week - and after staying Big Island and Days Inn on Maui.The Equus is close to the Hilton and Beaches and Hire Car and markets. Not as noisy as PK. The room was huge with 180degree views. Separate table for laptop, your own kitchette...we will stay here the whole time next we visit! Andrea

the staff was excellent, easy walking distance to the beach & mall. they had just started the bell man job so didn't use the service. th rooms were clean for the most but the carpet needed a good cleaning
user_name:
Betty R
Fort St James BC

review_body: Aloha! I am back from my vacation and already missing Hawaii. My boyfriend and I booked this vacation back in November and traveled in April. In between that time we were able to call the Equus and speak with Renee many times, ask questions and receive helpful tips. We bought a groupon to stay at the Equus and decided to get a room in the hotel instead of the tower. Renee planned transportation from the airport to our hotel since my boyfriend was traveleing with his surf board. Big john picked us up and greeted us with leis! Upon arriving at the Equus we were greeted with juice and fresh pineapple in our room. Keo was so friendly and helpful! We were on the 9th floor and while we did hear some road noise it's only because construction was going on. We were so tired from our busy days we just fell asleep anyway. Our room was perfect and clean. We just needed the basics but were happy and surprised to see that we had a room with the refrigerator and the small balcony! We also loved how soft the beds were...very comfortable. Each morning we used the breakfast coupon at Snappers which is a block away. The breakfast was good and completely satisfying to start our day. In general the Equus is located in a great spot. A few blocks to Ala Mona park where we snorkled on the beach, restaurants and gift shops nearby, etc. We ate at the Chart House one night on the Marina and it was wonderful. We also watched fireworks Friday night on the beach. :) We rented a car and drove up to North Shore twice. There are two car rental places a block away from Equus which was great. Youre allowed to park at the hotel but you have to get a parking pass in the morning. If you wait until you come back from a day trip then the parking will be full. We started out our vacation hoping for the basics but got so much more. We loved the Equus, the staff, and the time we spent in Hawaii. We cannot wait to go back! My advice would be to just be friendly, nice, relax, and ask questions. It's amazing how much you can learn...

Really enjoyed the location of this little hole in the wall hotel. Stayed in the smaller part of hotel, not the tower. Great location, walking distant to versatile restaurants, shopping mall, stores, beach. Small, but, comfortable clean room. Great place just to rest in. Continental breakfast was perfect start of the day. Be prepared with parking situation, and rainy days. B+ on Hotel and Staff.
user_name:
Doreenie S
Paia, Hawaii, United States

review_body: When ever we come to Oahu we always stay at the Equus Hotel. The location is perfect for us. We always look forward to see the staff at the Equus Hotel. Where greeted by your bell man Keo in the parking lot to help check us in and take our bags up stairs to the front desk. The front desk employees are so wonderful and there hospitality.Doing the check in process Puka is such a helpful guy and always make sure that we are satisfied, before we leave the front desk. But of course we always look forward to see Renee. We just luv that great smile and Renee is always dressed in hawaiian attire with a haku lei, Renee always speaks in a humble voice, and always make sure that we have da best care. So we just want to thank Renee and her staff at the front desk of the Equus Hotel for the Aloha spirit. Keep up the good work. ALOHA!!!!

It may not be the Ritz, but it has a wonderful cozy charm to it. The rooms are very nice, the staff is friendly, and Waikiki and Ala Moana are easily accessible by foot. The price was very reasonable as well. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something a little more boutique and laid back.
user_name:
Cooper H
Honolulu, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Me and the ohana stayed at the Equus from Friday thru Sunday (Staycation) and we loved it! The rooms are very cozy and the staff is very friendly. Rene did a great job in setting us up in a nice room with comfortable beds! We didn't get a chance to swim or spend much time in the hotel over the weekend, but the time we did spend there was awesome. Rene treated us like VIP, so much aloha! The location was perfect for us because my daughter had a prom at the Alamoana Hotel, which is less than 5 minutes away! And of course, the Equus was alot cheaper than the Alamona Hotel, especially for staying for 2 nights. Thank you, Rene, for making our staycation an awesome one!

A very nice, reasonably-priced and walking distance to Waikiki Beach. and I just can't say enough about the staff. KEO who checked me in and brought my luggage to the room - very friendly and helpful Hawaiian gentleman. RENE: oh Rene, I miss you already - she even made a fresh LEI with frangipani flowers at home the 1st night, brought it to the Hotel and put it around my neck the next morning and wished me a very warm ALOHA welcome. She even brought in artistically cut half pineapple to represent a birthday cake for my 60th birthday on April 3rd. And all the other staff: Puka, Jason the house-maids - very friendly and accomodating.

Of all the cheaper hotels in Honolulu I have stayed in, this one is definitely the most classy. The rooms are beautifully furnished and there is a real sense of glamour here. It definitely feels like you are staying in a more expensive hotel but without the huge price tag. The hotel is also withing walking distance to Ala Moana shopping centre - about 5-10 minutes away. The hotel however, is near the highway and is incredibly noisy! Perhaps more should be done about soundproofing the rooms. In the middle of the night, the noise is tolerable, but during peak hour it isn't. We were on the fifth floor and used ear plugs to sleep. Unfortunately I had to wake up early so I didn't sleep so well, as I was worried the ear plugs would also block out the alarm clock!

I called the hotel today because I needed two rooms next to each other. Just wanted to say that I got more than I hoped for--Rene at the front desk called me right back and the special needs were easily accomodated.

We stayed in the actual hotel and not the Tower. The hotel was okay, but didnt feel "boutique" like the name suggests. There is only one lift for the entire hotel (frustrating!) and the staff are not the most friendly and helpful we encountered on this trip.The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre (which also has restaurants) but isnt close to a vast array of bars and eateries (like if you stayed on Kalakaua Ave). Good price though.

This is an economy hotel in a great location. Along the main city bus route from Honolulu to the Waikiki. Just two stops from the Ala Moana shopping centre. Within walking distance to Hilton Hawaian Village and with views over the Marina and the Ala Wai canal. The continental breakfast initially provided was a bit sad, but on our last day were given instead coupons for a hot breakfast in a nearby pub.

We stayed at the Equus for 3 nights. Having lived on this island before and traveled here many times we know our way around pretty much. This hotel is a good value. Most people who visit do not intend to spend the day in their room which is good in this case in particular as the room we had was small. The bed was very comfortable and the decor was clean and seemingly newly renovated. I wish there was WIFI in the room as the LAN only accommodates 1 computer at a time. There is a decent sized mini fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom area is 2 small rooms; one with sink and closet the other with shower stall (no tub) and toilet. All clean and no problems. There is a small lanai with table and ours looked out over the street and nearby building. The swimming pool is truly postage stamp size but I don't see why you'd want to use the pool when the beaches are so close by. All in all it is what it is--a reasonably priced, convenient, clean, and comfortable small hotel close to everything. We paid about $360 for our 3 nights including tax and parking, so pretty reasonable. If you want luxury and all the bells and whistles the Hilton is across the street and you'll pay accordingly. Aloha
This is one of the little known gems in Waikiki and it's as good as it gets. Quiet, but right in the action. Close enough to everything. And the staff is very sweet and accommodating! Real aloha!
user_name:
Candice N
San Francisco, California, United States

review_body: Rene is so helpful in booking and getting any extras you need to you promptly. She even had a lovely pineapple fruit tray for us on Valentines day!The view is spectacular with a full width of the wall of windows in every room, all facing the ocean. With binoculars, we watched the whales from our room every day ( as well as the surfers; and the fireworks on Friday nights -a block away)!!! It is only two blocks to the big Ala Moana Shopping mall, and not much further to both Waikiki beach and Magic Island! We had a new flat screen Tv, free WiFi, king size bed,micro, twoburner stove top, bar fridge, toaster, any cooking utensils we needed on request. The room was large, no balcony but window opens wide. We could have our table right by the opening, so we could hear the sounds and smells of the ocean.Quiet, private, tennis court ( bring your own raquets), outdoor pool, hot tub and lounges.Reasonable price and definitely good value.

The hotel and room is comfy, relaxing, clean, and very accommodating. The rooms were recently renovated and looks brand new. The location is amazing, situated at the very beginning of Waikiki, neighboring Ala Moana Beach/Shopping Center, and within walking distance to several bus lines. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Oahu.

I stayed at The Equus for 10 days this past month and it was such a wonderfule experience; again. My family and I have been coming to The Equus for 15 years and my favorite part is seeing the same friendly faces everytime. The rooms are all renovated and have a very luxurious feel to them. The room I stayed in on this trip, and every trip, are immaculate and the bedding is very soft and cozy. I like the pool area because it is really tropical looking and cool. I come to Waikiki to shop and being able to walk to Ala Moana or straight into Waikiki made everything I needed available. I always like having Mojitos on the lanai provided by the staff because I get to catch up with old friends and make new ones. The Equus is really a wonderful hotel operated by wonderful people, I never feel like just another tourist out of many, I feel like family.

It was okay for a few days, but i wouldnt want to stay here for more then 3 days, the rooms are clean, cute, and the hotel staff are nice.The pool was tiny, it looked like a pond, but the rate was cheap, so for the price it was fine,

The Hotel is okay, the staff are nice, and the price is nice. However, we did not get what we planned. Part of the reason we stayed there were for the advertised tennis courts and larger pool. Turns out they lost their contract to those (they actually belong to a building behind the hotel) a month before we arrive. Uh, that's when we made our reservation. They should have shared this with us. Further, we saw there was parking available & didn't know that meant they only have 8 spots. We ended up parking a 15 minute walk away. If you don't mind the location (15 min walk from Waikiki) & just need a bed, you'll be happy.

The rooms are comfy as can be. Big mattress for great sleep after long trip. Front desk people make the difference here! They totally go out of their way to make the stay a very enjoyable experience! They are quick to check you in, so you can go about enjoying Waikiki! Need a cab? Pronto its there! Good location only a few blocks from Waikiki! Safe as can be! And me I love my MacDonalds coffe in morning..right down the street. More important "Special Thanks" to Renee and Puka for being the difernece from staying there versus other hotels. People do make the differnece!

This is a very good value hotel, clean with adequate housekeeping. It is in a great location, near the Ala Wai canal on Ala Moana Blvd. Close to the bus and easy to walk to the mall, beach, Ala Moana park & restaurants. There was some traffic noise at night, but the beds were comfortable so we slept well. More drawers or a suitcase rack would be nice. Breakfast was simple but OK - fruit, juice, pastries and coffee. It would benefit from more seating, another toaster & hot water with tea bags. The pool is very small and shaded, go to the beach instead. Internet didn't work in the room, which was annoying. It was accessible in the lobby. The staff was outstanding however. We had problems with our netbook, including connecting to the internet. We left it with Jason, who had it working when we returned in the afternoon. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. There is a long flight of stairs at the narrow entrance & Keo offered to lug our suitcases to the sidewalk for us. I would book here again.

Without exception the staff were friendly, efficient and accommodating. As far as I am concerned, this is a good find for budget travellers but it does have its frustrations. My frustrations were as follows: (1) No plug for the bathroom sink; (2) often waiting until 5:00 and beyond for fresh hand towels; (3) slow elevator - you need to be able to climb a flight of stairs to get to the lobby; (4) the bathroom configuration is such that if your roommate is in there with the door closed, you cannot access the closet. I had no problem with the internet in the room; however it works only with devices that plug in. My roommate had to get internet on his phone in the lobby or breakfast room. We both found it mildly annoying that we needed a new code every day. Housekeeping was adequate but no gold stars. The continental breakfast was fine but patience is needed as they keep running out of things so you get to wait for replenishment. We stayed here for two weeks and despite the frustrations would likely stay again if the rate was good (we booked through the hotel directly and got the seniors rate).
user_name:
Linda C
Grand Bay, New Brunswick

review_body: We spent 3 nights here and thought that it was a great value. The location was excellent--we liked being away from the towering hotels that line Wakiki Beach and the convenience of being able to walk to many good restaurants. Our room was clean and we slept well in a comfortable king-sized bed. There was a shower but no tub in the bathroom. Breakfast was a bit of a free-for-all as the space where the food is made available was small. It was other guests who were rude taking lots of food while others waited in line. We found that if we were patient, that there was plenty for everyone. The breakfast was simple pastries, toast, juice and coffee. There is an ABC store nearby where you could buy cheese or yogurt to supplement your breakfast. Refrigerators are in the room. Some guests complained that the were told that breakfast was served until 9:30 though we were clearly told that breakfast ended at 9:00 am. Posting breakfast hours in writing either at the front desk or in the room could eliminate the potential for confusion. In the case mentioned, the staff was more than courteous. There was noise from the busy street below but we didn't lose any sleep because of it. We would absolutely stay here again!

My husband and I did a last min. travel to Hawaii. We wanted to stay in Waikiki for a few days but did not care to be on a beach. These were the things on our the top of our list. good clean room. not much more then $100 a night, pool/spa and close to Hilton were I had some cousins staying. This was a great place if you don't need a big fancy name hotel.

My boyfriend and I are a dual military couple and he suprised me with a vacation to Hawaii. We arrived in Honolulu to find that our original hotel was not fit for human occupancy. We called about 15 other hotels and they were all full. We stumbled upon the Equus on the internet and Clinton was able to accomodate us for the three nights of our trip. Clinton had superb customer service skills, they were head and shoulders above any other person we spoke to that day. It was refreshing to speak to a person who genuinely cared about our needs. He booked us a room in the tower on the 10 the floor. There were some undesirable things about that room but we were not able to move until the morning because a member of our party was very sick. The next morning we packed our bags and went to the front desk and spoke with a gentleman. We briefly told him our problem and immediately he asked us to check out a room in the main building. Ur gave us a key and told us he would watch our bags. We went into the room, were blown away with how beautiful it was and went back and told him we'd love to have it. He quickly changed our room and comped our parking for the previous night. He too was extremely pleasant and genuinely concerned about our trip experience. We wrote a letter to the manager (Rene) telling her about our experience and I happened to meet her by happenstance a few hours later and she graciously comped our first nights stay. No questions asked. She is a lovely lady, inside and out. She has a very genuine and meek spirit and truly sets the bar for customer service. The staff at this hotel truly makes it superior to any other hotel I've stayed at. I will definitely be back. Words can't express the dedication this team shows to its patrons.

When my wife and I read a bunch of reviews of this hotel we were skeptical. Some people were complaining about the bugs, noise of traffic and how the rooms were inadequate. Truthfully we found The Equus to be a bit better than average but does not get the "Very Good" rating. There was nothing that made this establishment stand out. But what do you expect when you are on vacation in Hawaii. Are you really going to stay in your hotel room for the whole duration? If you are then why spend the money. Might as well stay home.Parking is limited but the price is cheaper than the parkade that is connected to the Red Lobster.There continental breakfast is served in a short time frame, from 7:30 to 9:00. You will need to be up pretty early to get any good choices in buns, fruit or coffee.The rooms are comfortable (in the renovated section) which is only 10 floors. Beds are very comfortable. Be careful of the toilets they attack. You will see what I mean.If you are looking for the 5 star rating you better check out the Hiltons or the Trump hotels. This is not, as I mentioned earlier, more than an average hotel.Location of this hotel is on busy Ala Moana Boulevard. Yes you will here traffic but after a certain time period it does get quiet and you will be able to sleep. One thing my wife and I did not know is how close The Equus was to Ala Moana Shopping Center. You can basically walk there. Right when you leave the hotel make a right, you'll go over a little bridge, you'll come to a set lights, now the choice is yours you can go straight and make a right where the buses park or turn right now and left at the next availability.Would we come back to The Equus. Yes because it's affordable, service is fabulous and location is not bad.Oh and there were no bugs in our room #903.
I went there with friends and family and we had a great time.

Aloha Rene and team ,thanks again so much for a wonderful stay again at the Equus Marina ,delighted with the service ,amenities and superb deluxe ocean view room.Visited Hawaii 12 times and this is our 2nd stay at this hotel and the Service is perfect ,rooms superior comfort and ocean views spectacular .......Look no futher book this hotel and ignore some of the other low rated reviews as we will visit this hotel for many Hawaii vacations ,as Rene is wonderful in hawaiin hospitality,Puka and room maids friendly and always willing to help make your vacation PERFECT .OOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU AGAIN SOON ON OUR NEXT HAWAII VACATION .Spent 31 nights at this hotel and every minute was PEFECT,will definately reccommend to Everyone .A BIG Mahola A Hui Hui " UNTIL WE MEET AGAIN ".With a Big MAHOLA to the Equus team ..........RENE ....Thanks again cheers |SHAUN AND GLORIA FROM THE UK.

This is a very well run, clean, comfortable small hotel located close to the Duke Kahanamoku Beach and the Ala Moana Centre end of Waikiki. A fruit and pastry/ toast, coffee, juice breakfast is perfect for us, a middle aged couple. Each room has a small fridge handy for drinks, fruit, etc. We especially enjoy the Hawaiin atmosphere and find the staff helpful and friendly. The beds are comfortable for my bad back- third stay in past five years! We recommend it to friends.

I stayed here with my husband for four nights in a standard King room. The room itself was clean and the pictures on the website are pretty true, except not quite as sparkling and new, and a touch on the smaller size. However, it was great to have a fridge to store simple things like water and leftovers, etc. The hotel is definitely not upscale or fancy by any means but for the price I think it's reasonable. The only downside was parking, which was $18/night I believe but you're going to see that with virtually all the hotels in Waikiki. It's next to Ala Moana Center like others have mentioned and there's a nice beach park within walking distance, but for the main shops and Waikiki beach it's more like a short drive to get there. One thing that might bother some people is there can be considerable street noise (cars not passerbys). I'm not a light sleeper and am used to street noise back home so it didn't bother me but you will hear it if a loud truck passes by on Ala Moana Blvd or it starts to get busy.
user_name:
CuriousGrge
New York City, New York

review_body: We were booked at the start into the Tower (through some error on our part) and after a brief friendly chat with Rene we were changed to the Equus. Our room was cozy and clean. For the price we were paying this was ideal. The staff are really friendly and helpful and always seemed to walk around with a smile.The location was almost perfect(a lot of tours won't pick you up from outside but rather a block away due to construction and one ways). There was slight noise from time to time from the street but besides this the place was wonderful.The breakfast and coffee in the morning was just a nice extra touch towards our amazing vacation.We will be back and come with friends, that is for sure. Mahalo from the two of us Mahalo

We stayed on the 4th floor, it was clean, bathroom is clean to a 2-3star standard. We had a hairdryer and no bed bugs. Interior of the rooms are boutique style cane furniture. Good if you are on a budget. Car parking is average, as most other hotels charge car parking as well. For the closeness to Waikiki and to ala moana shopping mall it is a good option. Breakfast is simple and finishes early so get there early! Internet connection is only at the lobby and by a LAN cable in the room. Hard to find from the main road as you have to drive into the car park to off load luggage as there no frontage from the road except for a small hallway of stairs leading into the reception. No elevator from the car park as the elevator is opposite the reception a floor up.
Nice and clean room, building seems a bit old but everything worked fine. Parking was fine. Very nice location.

We stayed Dec. 16, 2011, went on a cruise, and then spent a week from Dec. 24 to Dec. 31. This was excellent for the price. The hotel is conveniently located. The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was good if you got there by 7:30. They had complementary lemon water in the hall daily and wine two afternoons a week. Our only complaint was the traffic noise. I would ask for a room futher back next time. We could see the firework displays from the Hilton Village from our balcony every evening.

Neat clean hotel with spacious rooms that are well appointed with WIFI. Breakfast was hopeless but the fresh fruit was welcome. Good location within walking distance of most things such as The Royal Hawaiian along beach promenade 10 mins, 5 mins to beach, and 10-15 mins to Ala Morna Shopping Centre and Waikiki centre.

I have used this hotel for many years for guest that come from the mainland. Great team members that know how to treat you. One on one service and very clean rooms. Just a greatplace to send friends that visit Hawaii.

Wow, I must say what I read on the review and the room we stay were different. First the hotel was an older style hotel away from the marina. Parking is the size of an office cube. You are force to park in a lot and pay 20 to 40 dollars a night.Our room was welcome by roaches. Yes, as we walk in. The room was right next to a noisey street. Where all night long we could hear the traffic go over speed bumps. The continental breakfest was funny. It was very limited. You better hurry for the small amount of little muffins, bread with one toaster and water down orange juice. Note, once it gone it 's gone..I really do not understand why anyone would stay there for several nights.But, for a family of four. Please, Please go somewhere else. I think the only good thing was the checkout after one night.

From the moment we walked in we were greeted & treated as "special guests." We appreciated the hospitality shown by the staff, namely, Rene, Jason, Keo, Paulo and Sergia. Mahalo to all of you!Four of us stayed for 11 nights (Nov-Dec) in two rooms, #606 & #607, both rooms were acceptably clean with comfortable king size beds. This boutique hotel is reasonably priced, located within walking distance to the beach and many stores & restaurants. Two thumbs up! (or is it a thumb and a pinky? - smile!)

I am a frequent traveler and in Honolulu balance business and leisure time. The EquusHotel is my favorite place to stay in Honolulu - great location, friendly staff with warm and comfortable room. Not too large, not too small. Enough Hawaiiana to make me feel like I am on the islands, but not overdone. I love the walk through Fort Derussy Park in the morning to Kalakaua Avenue's business area. I highly recommend this charming property!

I first want to say the location was fabulous and the room was clean. And the welcome we received from the staff was probably the best welcome of any place I have been in my life! And I am a world traveler! One person in particular that made us feel like home was Linelle. She was so beautiful and charming with the Aloha spirit making us feel like family from the very first day!! Linelle provided us with a local perspective and gave us the insider information on where to go and what to do. The only downside of the Equus was the trail riding that was supposed to be inclusive of our stay; the Hotel did not inform us that we needed a rental car to participate. That should have been told to us at the beginning when booking our package! And not after we arrived. Maybe a shuttle bus for the guests would be a great solution to offer guests to enjoy the trail riding. After all the hotel's name is Equus!! Besides this; the Equus Hotel was a wonderful experience....Mahalo Linelle And Shaka!

This hotel is just ok, advantage is, it's near all significant places one needs to be. We stayed 6 nights and the maid service is not that good. I'm just thankful for Sergia Columna for letting us use the microwave coz breakfast is served at 7:30 am and it was too late for our tours. All in all, just for the location, it's a good place to stay.

This Aqua Boutique Hotel, The Equus, is the perfect place to rest your head both before and after a day of exploring the many beaches, restaurants, museums, landmarks, and retail outlets, that Waikiki has to offer. No real need for a vehicle, unless you are looking to explore the rest of beautiful Oahu (e.g. the North Shore, where you can go horseback riding on Oahu's most beautiful beach, at Mokuleia Polo Farm). Everything that you need or may want to experience is within walking distance of or a short trolley/bus/taxi ride from this hotel. If you are venturing further than Waikiki, and are in need of a parking spot for your rental vehicle, there is adequate space ($20 USD with in/out privileges). The entrance to the hotel has you climb a set of stairs which passes along side of a quaint garden, bursting with colour and the soothing sound of a babbling fountain. A seating area overlooking the hotel pool, along with the extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly staff which are quite eager to assist you with your luggage and whatever else you may need help with during your stay, greet you at the top. Once you have checked in, an elevator will take you the rest of the way to your room, which will not disappoint. The rooms have stayed true to their roots, maintaining the comfort and authentic style of the island. We stayed in the Classic Executive on the 10th floor, which provided us with Ethernet, bar fridge, desk, a very welcomed pillow-top mattress and comforter, and all the other amenities that you would expect at a boutique hotel. There is a flat screen television as well, but with the activities and spectacular views just outside your room, you will probably not even get around to turning it on. The Equus starts your day off with a complimentary continental breakfast in their comfy lounge, just off to the side of the lobby, and as mentioned earlier, the staff are more than happy to help you make the most of your stay, providing you with maps, brochures and unbiased recommendations pertaining to Oahu before you venture out. So, what are you waiting for, check this place out, and see what it is like to be treated as an individual and not a number. Aloha!

This Hotel is great value for the money it is within walking distance of everything you could need including the largest open air mall Ala Monana Shopping Center and is just steps away from Wikiki beach, it is also right on a bus route and close to a variety of food options. Rooms are clean and neatly done and staff are very accomodating and responsive to any questions. Parking is available onsite if you have a rental. Beds are +++ comfortable which is nice at the end of a busy day. We also accidently left our jackets in the room when we travelled on elsewhere and were thrilled that they had found them such that we got them back prior to our departure. And the complimentary continetal breakfast was a great way to start the day. All and all a great place to stay and we would happily stay there again.

This hotel is okay but far from special. The hotel it's self is in need of up dating and a make over. The rooms are very noisy as in road noise and people noise, the walls let any and I mean any sound through. The maid service is hit and miss, on a Saturday morning she showed up at 8:41 am to do the room, a nice way to wake up, the next day it was at 14:55 ! They would forget towels one day and coffe the next, no major problems just a string of annoying little issues. The counter staff is also hit or miss. One day they are so helpful the next day the young guy at the counter acted like everyone was an incovinance to him.All in all not a bad place but far from a great place to stay, do your home work and look around,

No complaints about this hotel. Breakfast included is an added bonus. Kings beds were extremely comfortable with down comforters and an a/c that cools down the room immediately. We walked to the beach and restaraunts everyday. Recommended

This is my first time in Hawaii and Equus is such a cozy place to experience Hawaii. The amenities are basic but clean and comfortable. The location is perfect being minutes away from everything you want to check out in Honululu. The Ala Moana shopping center is a 10min. walk, restaurants,beach, ABC Convenient stores, bus stops and the friendliest people on earth are within your reach. The room rate is inexpensive but the experience is priceless.
Very reasonable hotel in Waikiki Beach area...close to shopping & beach. Free basic continental breakfast and wired Internet in the room. Very friendly & responsive staff. Will stay here again!

My friends and I booked our Hotel because of the great reviews we heard about it and the prices are very reasonable. The service is super friendly and the hotel is a cute and relaxing place to stay. I can honestly say this is one of the best quality hotels that ive ever stayed in. Next time i come to visit oahu, im going to book a room at the Equus Hotel. Mahalo to Rene and the rest of the friendly staff for making our vacation enjoyable, memorable and relaxing.

We booked a room at the Equus because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor about the comfortable beds.We arrived very late at night and discovered we were not in a room with a comfortable bed. The next morning I went to the front desk and told my story to Puka who quickly arranged for a room with a comfortable bed. He was so gracious. Thank you Puka!!

This is not a 5 star property but is good value for a 3 star. We found the hotel in a good location, we did not wish to be in the middle of Waikiki and was first drop off on the airport shuttle. Whilst the first room was not suitable, rene moved us to a far better room. Internet access was hit and miss, breakfast basic but very nice. Service was outstanding and far better than any chain hotel. We were made to feel very welcome
Stayed here for Halloween..the super comfy bed was so nice to come back to after walking the strip! Nice staff...cute hotel.

I recently had a 1 week stay at the Equus Hotel. The common areas, room, pool and hot tub were very clean. The room was well appointed with a very comfortable pillow top bed. Staff were friendly and helpful, responding to requests promptly. The location was convenient. We have stayed in a number of hotels on Oahu over the years and found the Equus to be a great value.

We went to Oahu for a family wedding & reunion. The Equus was block booked. This is a condo/hotel bulding. Not on the beach. Had to climb a number of stairs to get to the registration desk. No elevators. Not handicap accessible. This was difficult for me with a cracked hip & bad knees. No luggage carts. No help. We reserved two months in advance. We requested that our party be on the same floor ~ not. We requested a kIng size bed ~ found a queen with a mattress that looked like the Rocky Mountains. Jason on the front desk was quite attentive. He was wonderful ~ gave us keys to look at other rooms. Our room was very nice; however, we had no phone, no internet, no safe, 1 facecloth for two people, no kitchen towels or dishcloths, no ice bucket, new fridge with no ice cube trays, no iron, no ironing board, no phone or TV instructions, no area magazines, water tasted like 'hose water', toilet was not working properly (we fixed it), sheets were torn, received coffee the first day & were told we had to pay $1.00 for each day there after, did not receive shampoo or soap each day, elevators stopped working for a few hours one day & the stairs were too much to walk, no hotel shuttle, stayed away from the continental breakfast. Rene's only suggestion was to keep moving us from room to room. One room, someone had broken into the room. The lock had been jimmied ~ plate was loose & door frame damaged. The shower was moldy & smelled. This was supposed to be their best room. OMG! Other than Jason & Jennifer, who both were very helpful in listening, the staff were very rude.Their lies to the family about family created a huge rift. We are now awaiting a report from the Manager Jennifer to resolve the issues. We spent a lot of money to travel there for a family wedding & were grossly disappointed. Amenities that should be in the rooms were just not there & it just did not seem to be a concern to staff. I would never, ever recommend this place. If you are going to Hawaii, you are already spending money for a great vacation. Spend the extra few bucks & go down the street to the Rainbow Tower or the Hilton ~ they are on the beach, have great grounds, pools, restaurants, bars, entertainment & still everything is within walking distance. When in doubt, hop the trolley ~ it takes you just about anywhere. Good Luck! Wish we had known & not depended on the wedding party to book our rooms. Very bad choice.

We had fun on a mini staycation in Waikiki. We like the Equus and have used it as homebase on other occasions. The staff are so nice, the location is great, the price is good. We went to a special birthday lunch at Brasserie du Vin and were glad we did not have to drive a long way home, and could just relax in town.

Rene Kahumoku is absolutely fantastic. There is not one thing that is asked of her that she will not go out of her way. If there is not a way she will find one. As soon as he answers the phone you can just feel the warmth of Aloha and then and there you know that you will be taken care of. This may not be a 5 star but the treatment by Rene and her staff truly makes up for one

I called to speak with Rene and I feel like we are best friends already. He was so helpful and such a pleasure to talk with, He is so resourceful and is so willing to take the time and answer all of my questions. I could not believe how patient he was and how much of a pleasure he is to speak too, I cannot wait to meet Rene and to be in Hawaii again, I want to come there tomorrow and stay there forever. Thank you for the great customer service Rene and I cannot wait to come and celebrate your birthday when I get there..,,,,, Hope you have a great day and as always thank you and Ahola!
You won't find a better place to stay for amenities and location.
user_name:
Michael B
Los Angeles, California, United States

review_body: If you want to be treated like a Royal at a commoners price this is the place to come to in Hawaii.Not even the 5 Star big name hotels and resorts can match the personal service from Rene and her crew.From the pineapple (work of art) and personalised greetings card when you arrive in your room to the friendly faces of all the staff I will return here again. I will also tell others that in Hawaii, the Equus Hotel and Marina Tower is THE place to choose.Thank you Rene for bringing much love and happiness whenever you are around.Mahalo!

My husband and I enjoyed the relaxing and convenient stay at The Equus. With an easy walk to the beach, dinner and the fireworks with a spectacular view! In the evening we also walked to the International Market Place and back that was nice! Mahalo, Renee and Puka for the hospitality!Much Aloha,The Shore's

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Equus. The staff (especially Puka) was very helpful and friendly. We stayed for about a week and had a blast. It's reasonably priced and within walking distance to various attractions. It was the best deal we found.

My boyfriend and I, decided to take a small vacation in Oahu Hawaii during the month of August. We decided to pick the Equus hotel because of the great deal it had offered to us. When we finally arrived in beautiful Hawaii and to our hotel, we where greeted with such welcoming individuals. In addition, we where even given an up-grade to one of the nicest rooms they have free of charge. The room we where given was beautiful clean and spacious. In the fridge we had fresh pineapple decorated beautify with some flowers. Not only did the individuals who worked at this hotel provided us with a kind welcoming but, whenever we had questions or needed directions they always went out of their way to make sure we knew where to go and how to get there.I would suggest this place 100% if you don't feel like spending one million dollars on your vacation, but feel like staying in a place thats welcoming and helpful. The walk from the hotel to Wakki beach is around 15 minutes. We didn't mind that walk because it's nice to get a little active during the vacation. Also this hotel is extremely close to Alamona shopping centre, which is full of beautiful shops, designer stores and awesome restaurants to eat at. The harbour is just a few steps away and it's nice to check out.

Any seasoned traveler knows that, when on the road, it's the PEOPLE that you experience that make for lifelong memories. As much as the balmy weather, warm beaches and technicolor sunsets, Hawaii is all about the people. That Aloha Spirit and genuine warmth can be found at a gem of a boutique hotel at the entrance to Waikiki... the Equus Hotel. Charming with it's equestrian and polo theme throughout, the Equus is very well priced, international in flavor, and conveniently located. Starting as low as $89 (offering various discounts), the Equus provides a complimentary conitnental breakfast including freshly cut pineapple, two tennis courts, a private pool and jacuzzi, and free internet and flat screen TVs in every room. No long lines to check in, endless floors of garage parking, or noisy tour groups. My family has stayed at the Equus dozens of times over the years and we have been consistently well treated. You'll pay quadruple for oceanfront mega-resorts if that's what you want. But if you want charming, quiet, safe, clean, comfortable, affordable all enveloped with aloha, I recommend the Equus Hotel. The Marina Tower shares the property and is a back-up option if the Equus if filled. Make your reservations early, but save us a room! Renee, Puka, Clinton, and owner, Mike Dailey, are consummate hosts and we love them all.

I had a chance to stay at the Equus in Honolulu and i would just like to commend the management and staff for their hospitality and great service. The rooms are great and affordable and you couldn't ask for a better location. Walking distance to the alamoana mall and other various shops. I would recommend the Equus to all my friends and family.
user_name:
Tony S
Pago Pago, American Samoa

review_body: I work @ Bookit.com as a Resolutions representative. I had a guest who needed to add a bed only a couple days before their arrival for their mother-in-law who was accompanying them. I called and spoke with Rene in In-House Reservations. He was cheery and eager to help--great customer service even in working with a booking agent. I told him I needed to add a roll away bed to the guest's booking, have them charge the guest at the time of check-in and we would reimburse the guest for the bed (per our normal procedure). Rene would not hear of this. He took it upon himself to add the roll away bed for free, a 125.00 charge, in order to keep the guest from being inconvenienced whatsoever. Obviously this was a huge help for us here at Bookit.com as well. I was just so amazed and impressed at his eagerness to help everyone in anyway he could. I work with property contacts every day, all day and I have never had any one help me so much and so happily. I am blown away.
user_name:
Amanda K
Panama City Beach, Florida

review_body: My fiancé and I got into Honolulu, Hawaii at about 10pm. We felt run down from our long flight and layovers that we were both ready to strangle each other. As we were dropped off by our taxi driver my fiancé and I were so worn out & tired of dragging our luggage around. Then out of nowhere, we were greeted by a friendly smile. He introduced himself as Mapu (at that point, I realized our vacation has finally started). He directed us to the registration desk at the Equus & he helped us with our luggage. He could see how irritated and tired we were. Throughout our stay he made sure we were comfortable. We felt he went above and beyond. I would stay here again and would recommend The Equus to friends & family. Throughout our stay everyone at the hotel had OUTSTANDING customer service & our room had the best view of Waikiki. It's in a perfect spot, food, shopping & the beach! Everyone made us feel right at home. Thank you Equus & Mapu, our new friends...till we meet again! Mahalo to all!

I arrived at Equus after a lodging from hell and the staff was super friendly and turned my day around (thank you Puka!!) The rooms are clean and beautiful and bright. No complaints about the breakfast, it's your standard continental. Was super pleased that they were able to store my bag for the day after checkout so I could enjoy one last beach day before my flight. Only thing is I have a Mac and needed an adapter to access the internet in the room, but that's no biggie.
We stayed for 16 nights in October 2010, the room was clean and comfortable, service was good, free breakfast and free wifi, and great location. Overall we really love our stay there.
user_name:
underwaterangel
New York City, New York

review_body: Free breakfast with mixed fruit included and free wired internet access makes it easy to decide to stay in this hotel.Sergia was so quick on serving the breakfast and adding more servings when it is all consumed. Also free newspaper every day. The Hotel is also close to the biggest outdoor shopping center which is the Ala Moana Shopping Center and a walking distance to the beach. The pools are seldom used but it is there if needed.Equus had an option to provide remote control to gated parking if the lower parking spaces are occupied.Laundry is on the third floor of the Marina Tower.My daughter used the hair dryer and we make use of the small fridge in the room. There is no microwave oven .

I just wanted to say, much mahalo for having us at your hotel, during the time our hale was being treated for termites.. My daughter in laws Aunty Rene Kahumoku, hooked us up to a room there, and we so enjoyed the gracious hospitality she had given us, as well as other hotel staff members, being just as hospitable, we loved it.. We will certainly tell others of our stay there, once more mahalo nui loa.Fern Cardenas

The Equus Hotel is a basis hotel to say the least. The room was satisfactory. A bed, refrigerator, phone,and hair dryer. Very little storage space for clothing if you are staying more than a week. A place to lay your head at night and not pay the beach front prices. Not many amenities like the beach front properties. A "Light" continental breakfast is served dailyLocation fair to good, walking is no problem for my wife and I.Location was four blocks from the beach. Two blocks to The BUS. Six blocks to the shopping mall .Our only bad experience was road construction in front of the building during our two week stay. The orange cones came up at 7P.M. and left at 7 A.M. A rat-tat-tat all night. We got use to the noise after the third night due to our exhaustive travels on the tour buses

Rene, Puka and Kika:Thank you so much for making sure our stay at your hotel is at its best. With the rate of economy going up and prices of everything else multiplying, you've provided the perfect accommodations and services needed always with a warm and friendly tone. The professionalism attitude from the staff is just awesome. This is my fourth or fifth? visit and I always enjoy seeing your smiling faces. Housekeeping constantly checking and making sure I have enough towels, etc.(so can i have even more coffee please? lol)Location is just perfect! Ala Moana and the Ward Center to the right and Waikiki to the left, so who's complaining?Thanks again and please don't ever change!ciao

First off, Puka, the receptionist was awesome. Secondly, free continental breakfast!Third all the employees were extremely generous. I loved my stay at the Equus. I WILL be coming back again. Watch out now.
My wife and I had an awesome time at the Equus. Thanks to Puka and Rene, I have never felt so welcomed. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Puka and Rene went above and beyond to accommadate me and my family with their customer service and aloha. Cozy atmosphere, and everything is within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel. Great Staff with plenty of Aloha.

The Equus is such a perfect little hotel in a great location with easy access to everything it seemed. There aren't too many rooms which means the service is above and beyond and they are always willing to help with anything you need. They provide a continental breakfast with bakery goods, fruit, and juice which is a great way to start the day before heading out to surf (you can walk to the beach) or work (which was my case). If you stay here, be sure to say hello to Rene (Guest Services Manager), she has a smile that will light up your day.Thank you Equus!!

What a great hotel and how hospitable Renee and staff were during our stay at the Equus! Great location- walk to beach, 24 hour restaurant coffee shop, pubs - and great price. I'd recommend this hotel! :)

Forget the cute boutique reviews. This place is a disaster. There is MAJOR street construction right in front of the hotel that begins at 10 PM (yes PM) and goes non-stop until 6 AM. The noise enters your room from the front door, which is in a open breezeway, and the back slider, which faces an open area betewwn buildings that makes street noise amplify. The driveway to the hotel is impossible to spot, and once you pass it, you have to drive miles to make a left turn to return. The hotel charges $18 for parking that does not exist (they are in a legal battle with a lot the send guests to that have no hotel parking signs posted everywhere. The pool is more like a pond. The vending machined are in the back at another property. The check in desk is a counter in front of a room that looks like the solo clerk sleeps in. There is no ambiance, no charm, no point in staying here (besides the cheap rate). You can actually stay in Wiakiki for less and have a better time. My planned 4 day stay turned to 1 after jackhammers kept me awake all night long.

The hotel Manager Rene is very nice and very accomodating! Excellent customer service and awesome vacation preparation for me and my honey's anniversary celebration! Rene you are the best!Thank you SO much from Raquel & Darren

Property was located conveniently close to all that we wanted to do. We walked to the beach, restaurants and shopping. Service was friendly and really added to our enjoyment. Linelle at the security desk was helpful in recommending restaurant options and helping us with anything we might need. She really went the extra mile. Loved the view from our room also! All in all a great vacation.

I loved staying here!! It was perfect for shopping, going to the beach, and meeting new people! It was also helpful that Linelle recommended great places to eat! I will definitely stay here in the future!!

I have really enjoyed my time here. The location is great and is in walking distance to many of the main attractions of downtown. Linelle, of night security, was very friendly and gave great recommendations for places to go to eat or visit.

Spotlessly clean, fantastic service, Rene and all the staff were very courteous, very helpful. A bit of a hike to Waikiki, but public transport is good. The Ala Moana Mall is close, good food. Would highly recommend this hotel!

Our stay in October 2010 was great, our flight came in early and without hesitation we were allowed to check in early, no questions asked!. We stayed here beforetaking a cruise boat aroound the islands. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and bed very comfortable. We have friends returning to Hawaii for a wedding in the spring and immediately I thought of the Equus and Marina Tower. I contacted Rene and she was exceptional when booking not only for myself but assisting with the bride/groom and parents. I am very much looking forward to returning, great location!

Enormous MAHALO ! to Rene for being a great manager and making booking a hotel easy breezey. He accommodated all of my needs and was genuinely nice & helpful ! . Cant wait to book again. -Paulina&Joanna !
My interaction with the staff is always pleasant. They are also very helpful. They provide provide excellent customer service.

Rene welcome us with warmth Aloha her great hospitality accommodate our needs as pleasant and comfortable for our stay. Preferably I would say that the right person for this job! Thanks Rene for all the help and truly love the room its great!!! Aloha from Steve and Beverly

i was staying in honolulu for only one night before i got onto a cruise ship. since it was only one night i didn't want to spend much. location is pretty good and the air conditioner worked really well, and that was about the only good parts. the room was clean but old and outdated. the breakfast was a joke, just toast and coffee. i have never seen a more pathetic breakfast, not sure why they even bothered. if you are staying for just one night it is acceptable. i left my dress on the hook on the bathroom door. sadly i did not realize it until my cruise was almost over. so i called and housekeeping said it was not in there. which is a lie. i called and left a message to complain to the manager over 3 days ago and have not got a return phone call yet. so make sure you double check for everything because they clearly do not take the time to put in the lost and found.

I arrived in Honolulu on a sailboat. We had just finished the Transpac sailboat race. I was taking my gear to the hotel in a taxi and lost one of my bags. I was freaking and Rene Kahumoku the guest services manager at the hotel said "don't worry Sam, We'll find your bag". Well she did, and was SUPER nice as well as the entire staff. Our room was nice and had a great view of the Ala Wai Yacht Harbor, the surf, fireworks and the beautiful ocean.Your FriendSam Heck

My husband stayed at a 4-star hotel for 1 week and then at the Equus hotel for 3 weeks when relocating to Hawaii, and the Equus was the best hotel ever! With true aloha spirit, they made him feel at home and welcome every day, making his stay so wonderful and comfortable. Renee and Mapu are the best, working hard to be sure their customer's are happy. We totally recommend this hotel as the best hotel in honolulu, outperforming 4 and 5 star hotels stayed at in the past, and truly making your stay a memorable one.

Aloha Kākou (all),The Equus ʻOhana opened their doors and hearts to our ʻOhana in our time of need as well as in times of pleasure. We always feel the ALOHA SPIRIT from the beginning of our stay until the end and even as we are back at home. Rene Kahumoku & her staff has done an exceptional job of always going above and beyond to make us feel at home. Personal touches like a hand written note along with a box of chocolates made us feel welcomed. The rooms are very spacious, clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. Just love, love the down comforter. We always have a peaceful nights rest. Please come and experience what ʻOhana is all about at the Equus.Mahalo nui loa,From Hawaii Island, The Pauʻole, Vigilla & Bernabe ʻOhana

In my many past stays here, Ive written alot about how comfortable, affordable and convenient of a location this hotel is (near stores, beach,bus,restaurants etc...) but this time Id like to comment on the staff. You can stay at the most expensive hotels anywhere in the world but when the staff are unhelpful, rude and/or too busy for you...I don't want to stay there. One of my favorite things about this hotel is how personable they are. They make me feel like I'm at my " home away from home". Here are just a few examples... It was nice every morning to make my way to the fresh fruit, pastries and hot coffee, and be greeted with a friendly " Hello Shari ." from the manager Rene. She is such a sweetheart. One time I was late to breakfast because I was struggling to get myself outta that comfy bed. When they saw I was bummed I missed my morning coffee the staff there, (I apologize for my memory as I cant remember the name of the gal working so hard to get the food out to the table each morning) she went and made me a fresh pot, just for me...WOW! where can you find that? ( at home) I made a comment to Puka, one of the other managers, and he stopped what he was doing and chatted with me for quite awhile. He also had no problem when my plane wasn't arriving until late that night and my dad who lives across the street went to check me in. What a great guy..... I wanted to take a picture of my son and girlfriend for graduation and the lady in the lobby who was selling her jewelry gave me her leis that she was using for her display. Who does that? (home) I was off to Hanama bay and realized I didn't have my backpack so I called the front desk and Rene answered. I could tell she was busy but she asked me to hold on and she went looking for it ,found it and kept it for me until I returned later that evening....Thats the "ALOHA SPIRIT" people.Great Location, comfortable, clean, reasonable rates....helpful & friendly.. I mean really, Why would you want to stay anywhere else?

This small hotel is well situated to get to the beach,Ala Moana Centre ,Waikiki transport, and to freeways.Staff are pleasant,helpful,and knowledgable, and their front desk is open 24 hrs.Our room was clean,tidy & had all necessary amenities . No noise.We have stayed here previously and will return. Rates above it's star rating and is good value.

Welcomed by Rene upon my arrival (Guest Service Manager) I felt at home right from the start. WOW!!! with a very friendly staff! View from the tower is increadible, great size of room with very comfortable bed. Internet, TV and A/C all working very well :) I recommend this hotel to all! Thank you Rene and all your team for a very nice stay - oh and love the continental breakfest!

Where do i start? Arrived in june 2011 for work on the island, stayed at The Equus for 6 weeks. The staff are friendly and helpful. We worked very irregular hours, some days some nights, sleeping when we can, housekeepimg supervisor Jacquie always coordinated around our schedule and kept our rooms clean and comfy. My job keeps me on the road constantly. I stay in alot of hotels. This is the most helpful, friendly, warm and inviting hotel staff I've ever encountered, hands down. Thanks to Rene and Mimi for thier smiles and hospitaity.Thank you Jacquie and Lenelle for keeping us comfortable and taking care of us like family, you're like sisters to us.And thank you Puka for helping me to find my way around, finding certain shops and locating some unique items.I had a great stay at the Equus and would recommend this hotel for buisness or vacation stays. The building is filled with friendly people (staff and guests) and aloha spirit.  Chris Los Angeles

I stayed here with a friend in preparation for the Honolulu Marathon last year. The rooms albeit small, but perfect for our purpose: Rest well and short walk to the Honolulu Marathon starting line. It's about a 5-10 minute walk down Ala Moana to the starting line from the hotel location. The staff is friendly and very accommodating - they will hold on to your bags if check-out time is before your return from the race, which was definitely the case for us. Parking is difficult - I believe there are less than 10 spaces to the property and the elevators are slow, but that is usually the case with the smaller and older buildings.

I am currently staying at The Equus and I must say words can not express how I am feeling right now. My last visit was Oct.2010 and I had the pleasure of meeting Renee and her wonderful staff. That was nine months ago but on Wednesday Renee saw me and she remembered. I introduced her to my hubby and informed her we were in town to renew our vows. She helped me find lieus and hairpieces for our special day. She even went so far as to picking up my flowers. After the ceremony, we were surprised with a room upgrade and a bottle of chilled champagne. Today, I was moved with tears because of the kindness and loved received from Renee and her staff. Hotel is located on Ala Moana blvd which is quarter mile to the mall and restaurants. Clean rooms and great hospitality. This is where I will stay whenever we want to escape the mainland.

My rating above is based on my telephone conversations with Rene, since we have not stayed at The Equus Hotel & Marina Tower. However, we are in the planning stages of our vacation to Oahu in November of this year and I must say, from my very first phone call with Rene, she has been a tremendous help in assuring us that we will have clean accommodations at a reasonable rate! THANK YOU Rene!!

The friendly service we have had from Rene and Puka at the Equus stand out above many. They were extremely very nice to me and my wife on our wedding day true out our stay at the hotel from 7/16 to 7/24. When you speak about customer service they were 100% and above. I will stay there in a heart beat. I thank Rene and her staff for everything.

We loved the location of Equus near the Ala Moana Center (great food court) where all the buses depart. Opposite the center is a beach park which the locals prefer. It's perfect if you don't want to be in the middle of Waikiki. Our room was a bit noisy at night, since it faced (as all rooms) a busy street. The balcony was great though. The breakfast at Equus was good with fresh fruit and Hawaiian coffee. In the morning there was often a rush, since the lobby is small with limited seating and everybody wanted to be first at the fruit trays. The manager Renee is lovely!!!

I was very happy with my stay at this hotel. The room were very clean and had a lot of room around the bed. The staff always had the aloha spirit. The rate was a great deal for staying in Waikiki. I will continue to stay here in the future.

I just booked 12 nights at the hotel online for Feb. 22, 2012 and called to verify the reservation and to ensure we will receive a King Bed, quiet room, and non-smoking. Renee and Mimi were so hospitable and welcoming to my reservation, and said they will block a great room for our late arrival and look forward to our visit. We haven't even arrived yet, but the hospitality I received on the phone this morning has given me a great impression! Thank you!

I have always enjoy my stay at The Equus Hotel and Marina Tower . People are friendly and very nice . They help you anytime they can. I have been there many time and spend many month there . Puka ,Rene and the cleaning staff are so good and nice to be around . Everything is in a Aloha spirit , so just let this place be your next stay. !!

I stayed at this hotel when I first arrived on the island. The hotel grounds are very clean and everyone was always willing to help. When I got to my room their was a personalized welcome note from the guest service manager Rene, accompanied by a box of Hawaiian chocolates! Rene is definitely by far the best! She was very helpful in helping me with any of my requests or needs. Everyone was very polite! Every time I came to the front desk she always remembered me by name! I would definitely recommend this hotel to my good friends and family members!

The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very nice and the staff serviced our room daily with the utmost cleanliness and respect for our things. Loved having a fridge in the room. It allowed us to save money and eat our leftovers without having to throw them away when we were to check out of the hotel. The only upgrade that the hotel might be interested in doing is adding a fan to the bathroom so that the room would not fog up and the towels would dry quicker.
Lovely charming holey in a great location. The room was very comfortable and we both really enjoyed staying here. Great little base when staying in Honolulu

I stayed at the Equus Hotel and Marina tower for 4th of July weekend and I can't explain how impressed I was with the service executed by Renee and her team. Fourth of July is a big thing in Hawaii and its always almost impossible to book anything near ala moana beach park and if you do, it isn't guaranteed that you will get a view of the fireworks. I booked this ocean view room one week in advance and requested in the additional comments box, that I would love to view the fireworks for Independence day. THEY ACTUALLY READ MY COMMENTS!! I had called the day I was checking in to confirm my reservation and that's when I had the pleasure of talking to Renee, she was awesome! You could tell that Renee really loves what she does,the aloha in her voice was so accomodating and she was so excited to tell me about the room she set me and my special someone in. She had set us up on the 35th floor overlooking ala moana beach park. The view was so beautiful during the day and at night...it took my breath away. The view of the fireworks over the water was amazing. The room was very comfortable. Air conditioner was already on and the room was cool. The bed was so comfortable, I wrapped myself up in that down comforter and watched the sailboats stream by from the huge windows. The staff also welcomed us with a pineapple and a hand written note welcoming us to the hotel. The floor was quiet and peaceful, so I recommend it for people who really just want to get away and relax. I read some reviews about rooms not being up to par. The Equus Hotel and just the Ocean View Rooms of the Marina tower have been renovated, the other floors of the Marina tower are still undergoing some construction. The location is very ideal, it is right next to Ala Moana mall and a few steps to the beach. I highly recommend this hotel, the price is great, the room is comfortable, and the sevice will "wow" you. It is nice to know that there is a hotel that not only takes care of tourist, but also extends their aloha to the locals. Mahalo

I stayed here last month for my business trip and the Staff's are very friendly and did an awesome job! While staying here i had an outstanding service from a lady named Linelle! She's was my housekeeper at that time and made sure that my room is clean and organized when i come back from work. She is very informative too, due to me not being familiar to the place, She gave me a lot of informations about good places to eat and have fun. By far this is one of my best trip! I would highly recommend this Hotel and once again i thank you guys for your excellent service!!!

I stayed at the equus for one week and the marina towers for one week on my two week stay in beautiful Hawaii. While in the equus, I had excellent customer service by a lady named Radiant. She made sure my room was clean and spotless whenever I arrived back to the property after work. After one week I was moved to the marina towers and Linelle was the housekeeper on the floor and was such a big help in so many ways.these two are outstanding individuals and I would be more than happy to return to the property on my next business trip to the islands...awesome service and and excellent time! Kudos!

Linelle made our stay fantastic. She was the security guard working at the parking complex and she had the most wonderful attitude. She really reflected the personality of Hawaii and welcomed us with lots of how they say aloha. Every time we came across her she was more than helpful and was full of laughs. Anyone who has the pleasure to meet Linelle is truly blessed.

Stayed here at the Equus for 4 nights..Starting from my arrival Puka Front Office Agent and Renee Guest Service Manager greeted me with the true "Aloha spirit !!" and helped me get situated into my room that reminded me of back home the room was very clean and the bed was very comfy.. Jackie Executive Housekeeper was very pleasant and very helpful in so many ways she went above and beyond guest expectation until the end of my stay!! My BF Hans that works for another Aqua Hotel also visited with me..Everyone made my stay here very relaxing and pleasant !! I will definately be back!!! Keep up that "Aloha Spirit !!" As the locals here say "A hui Hou!!" Until we meet again...there is never good byes!!
