We are really appreciative of the accommodations made for us by the front desk, especially Rene!! Very helpful making changes to our reservation!

Im currently serving in the military and had just made the move down to Oahu. Since there are no main land banks on the island I had completely taken my entire funds with me. So when I went to go make a hotel reservation it was looking near impossible to get a room, until I got on the phone with a wonderful women working at the front desk at The Equus Hotel& Marina Tower. Not only did she work with me around my problem but she took extra care to make sure I was going to be taken care of beyond what required of her. The service is by far extraordinary and I wish I could do more to express my gratitude. Thanks Again!!!!!!!

The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Athena is very professional, personable and helpful. She patiently listened to our requests/comments and responded very professionally. Her customer service is exemplary. The "Continental Breakfast" was disappointing, but overall the pleasantness of the staff more than made up for that.

I actually didn't stay, but my brother and sister-in-law ware on their way to Hawaii for their anniversary. My brother has never been to Hawaii. I called to ask if I could have a box of chocolates or something sent to the room and how I go about doing that. Rene answered the phone and told me that he would be happy to send the chocolates to the room at no charge. He also noted on their account to treat them with VIP status and upgrade their room. He was amazing. What a great phone call !!!! I will definetly look up this hotel when I go to Hawaii. Thank you for starting their vacation off on a great note !!!!!!!!!

My girlfriend and I are from Canada and went to Hawaii on a two week vacation. For the first week we stayed at the marina tower and after returning from Kauai we stayed in the Equus for two nights. When we arrived they instantly made us feel right at home. There were a few people there that went out of their way to make our time in Honolulu even better than it already was. I won't say there names but you'll know who they are if you go. As Canadians, during the stanley cup playoffs, we were obviously going to be watching a game or two. One of the games they both came (after work hours), had a drink (or two), explained more of the history of Hawaii asked us about life in Canada and we had a blast together. My girlfriend was upset that she was never leid during the trip and on the last day her wish came true because someone (you know who you are) gave one to her to send us on our way. WHEN I go back to Honolulu I will absolutely stay her again in a heart beat. Some may want to know about the hotel itself. Very clean, nice accomadations and you felt right at home. I will be giving the top ratings possible and hope my advice will allow somebody else to enjoy their stay as much as I did.Thanks P and R

Nothing really to add. Was a lovely boutique hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and the hotel is in a brilliant location. About 5 minutes walk to the ala moana centre and less than that to the beach and the lagoon.Brilliant stay

Stayed here one night 6/3/2011. Service was very friendly, especially Rene, the service manager. She helped pick a perfect spot for lunch and held our luggage for us while we waited for a late flight to the big island. The bed & pillows were amazingly comfy after a whole day of travel. I slept so well, I didn't want to get out of bed! They have a small complimentary breakfast, toast, fruit & juice. It was great because I woke up starving! Very cute, comfy room, nice flat screen tv, fridge and toiletries were stocked. Hard place to find at night, you must go up a flight of stairs to the lobby and it's not noticeable from the street. Over all I would say yes, book your stay here. Comfy, good price, friendly staff and I really enjoyed the room :). Thank you Rene!!
i really enjoyed staying at the marina tower. its quiet and setback from the road just a little bit which i like. very comfortable room. will definately stay there again.

To be completely honest, we only came to the hotel to sleep and shower. My husband and I keept busy during our entire stay and when we got to the hotel every night we were so tired we didn't care about some of the things some people are complaining about on this website. I did appreciate that the entire staff was very nice, the room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. When my husband and I travel, we don't care about fancy hotels because we don't like to spend much time in our room but we don't want to stay in a crappy hotel either. I think our money was well spent and over all we are happy with the service and quality we were given and the Equus. Mahalo :o)

If traveling to Honolulu - you can't hardly beat the location and the price and the hospitality! It's clean and comfortable and friendly service! Classic Hawaii! Walking distance to everything! Radiant our house keeper was very efficient and friendly!

We stayed overnight - the personnel at front desk were friendly and helpful, the room was average. Had problem with elevator - only one for the building we were in and it was slow. The breakfast was average - however you had to wait long periods to get your food - maybe could have staarted breakfast earlier to allow more spread in customer use.

My boyfriend and I had a great overall stay at the Equus. The rooms are cozy and offer all the amenities including exceptionally comfortable beds that make it hard to wake up and roll out the door to the beach in the morning. The employees are very friendly and helpful. Im definitely planning on staying here again on my next trip to Honolulu.

very comfortable and very relaxing this hotel was a 2 minute walk to the beach and just a few minute drive to everything we stayed on the 22nd floor in the tower and i have got to say 6 nights there was worth every penny. spent most of our time exploring the island and soaking up the sun but when it was time to come home and rest boy was it comfortable

I could not have been happier with our stay at the Equus Hotel. The room was always in immaculate condition and cleaned each day. The entire staff was extremely friendly and helpful and even went way above and beyond what I would expect from a very budget friendly establishment. This was a vacation for my girlfriend and I after not seeing each other in months (we currently live in separate cities). The guest services extra-ordinaire Rene went as far as helping me surprise my girlfriend with flowers and a bottle of wine in the room for when we arrived. I am blown away by how helpful everyone was and the trip was really a memorable one. The hotel is located a short walk from the Waikik beach and is close to everything that you would need. I could not recommend this hotel more, it was perfect!

This is my second stay at this hotel and even though I knew what to expect, I was still surprised and warmed by my experience there! We had 2 rooms and the staff managed to get them side by side, even though when we book we were told that it wasn' a guarntee. the rooms were clean and very comfortable. Amazing beds...great sleeps!The charm of The Equus is that it is a small hotel and because of this, they have the ability to make things personal. Puka is a total sweetheart...an amazing Hawaiin soul and always had a smile and an "Aloha" even if you were just passing by the front desk! Housekeeping staff are great! Never really saw them but they cleaned the rooms daily so I did know that they were around. I love the location. Depending on your speed about a 5-7 mins walk to the beach and about the same to the Ala Moana Shopping centre where on can pick up groceries to keep in the fridge in the room. There are restaurants within walking distance as well.I will be staying there on my next trip there and will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know who goes there! The Equus for a great time and a great stay! Mahalo!

I don't typically write reviews, but I figure I'd give it a shot.My fiance and I stayed for 6 days. We are both currently living on the mainland, but I am from Hawaii and stayed at a bunch of places in the area. I read all the reviews but still decided to choose this hotel. we booked our package on Expedia, so hotel and rental for a very reasonable price.First, yes seeing where to pull in is a bit difficult, if you miss it you have to go all the way around the block. There is one stall CLEARLY marked for "registration". That small lot (about 10 spaces) under the Equus tower is for HOTEL guests first come first serve. At check in they give you a key fob for the garage for their MARINA tower located right behind the Equus tower. Out of the 6 days we only had to park there 2 nights. And yes it is $18 a day.The rooms are nice, it was clean, clearly newly renovated. Not a huge space, but comfortable for a couple. We stayed in the EQUUS tower not the Marina. From what I gathered the Equus tower is the renovated rooms that resemble the pics online. Beds were very comfy with great pillows. Room was quiet, could not here the traffic outside. Bathroom is a bit small, but always had hot water. A bit of a small TV, but you are in Hawaii you shouldn't be watching too much TV anyways. The AC is a very quiet one and kept our room nice and cool. There was a coffee maker and small mini fridge and freezer. It wasn't on when we checked in, but just changed the dial to the highest setting (careful, on the highest setting it will freeze whatever is in the fridge). Ironing board, iron and hair dryer in the bathroom closet. NO WI-FI in room, it is a cable but its free, and it worked just fine, it was fast and reliable. There is WI-FI in the lobby and the front desk can give you the log on info.Continental Breakfast in the lobby. I am not a fan of continental breakfasts period, no matter where I have stayed. It consists of coffee, OJ, toast, rolls, muffins and fruit. But Mc Donalds is a block away, and IHOP (over priced) is 2 blocks away and a bit further is Wailana Coffee house (great breakfast reasonable price)The staff was great, very helpful and love to joke around. we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If you do your research and READ everything around you then you won't be surprised. I didn't walk in there expecting the Four Seasons. Like I said before, not a huge room, great for a couple who will use the room to sleep, shower and rest comfortably.Mahalo to the staff, keep up the good work!

Linelle,Was the security guard and she was also a housekeeper! She made our trip very enjoyable so we wanted to give her due recognition! She is an asset toyour hotel and made our trip very memorable!! We would come back ina heart beat!!! Thank you Linelle for making our trip so memorable!!!
I couldn't have had a better experience with the equus!!! They had a great staff and a perfect location. Everything you need is nearby

This peaceful hotel had an amazing location at Ala Moana blvd and Hobron Ln. You are at the start of Waikiki Beach and you can still avoid all the local tourist traffic associated with Waikiki. Its also a 5 min walk to the Ala Moana shopping center, the Waikiki Marina, or waikiki beach in either direction. There is a constant cross breeze that blows through the rooms when you open the windows and doors.The Staff, especially, Rene Kahumoku, the Guest Service Manager, went out of their way to ensure all our needs were met. One of our friends lost a wallet containing all of their identification and financial documents on our first day here, and didnt realize it until the following day.We asked the hotel staff for assistance and they immediately notified the Honolulu Police Dept. to assist us with our dilemma. The HPD showed up promptly and the hotel confirmed our buddie's identity. Our friend also received a new debit card within 3 days at the hotel. He got his wallet back the day before we left, and all his cash was still in it. Someone found it in Heleiwa at Kua Aina Burgers and the employees there were able to contact our buddy to say they had his wallet. AMAZING!

We stayed at Aqua Equus before departing on our 7 night cruise around the Hawaiian Islands on the Pride of America. We have previously stayed at Aqua Wave which we enjoyed. The location was fine - we like walking so Waikiki was not too far away and Ala Moana shopping centre was very close. Our room (deluxe twin) was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The beds were super comfortable - better than in many 5* hotels. Check in / out was without a hitch. The complimentary breakfast was a nice extra. It's sad about those "glass half empty" people who comment on what they didn't get rather than appreciate what was offered. We have stayed in many hotels in Hawaii and at home in Oz from your 5* Hilton, Marriott, Sheraton to Youth Backpacker Hostels. Aqua Equus EXCEEDED what we expected for space, comfort and value for money. I would be happy to stay there again! I get totally fed up with whining people who write negative remarks rather than look at the positive aspects. As you know, it is a sad fact of human nature one can never please everyone. We were very happy with Aqua Equus. Mahalo

The Equus Hotel is a sophisticated change and breath of fresh air from the typical Waikiki place of stay. Themed for the island's Paniolo Cowboy history, you'll get to see some beautiful photography and artwork depicting a uniquely Hawaiian tradition. I recommend staying in the one bedroom suite, which are beautifully furnished. If you can, take advantage of one of the hotels unique package offerings and check out the Polo fields on the North Shore. The hotel offers oceanside horseback rides, and on Sunday they host the coolest bbq on the island, where the local folks go to watch polo, eat good food, drink good drink, and enjoy the beach away from the crowds of Waikiki.

The Equus is in a fantastic location within walking distance to the marina, beach, and plenty of bars and restaurants. Staff was very helpful in guiding us around the city since it was our first time. Comfortable beds, nice view in the room.

This hotel cannot be faulted in terms of value but...1) The rooms are very noisy (I suppose this is to be expected given the location2) The front desk staff were very unfriendly. As a European I am always very impressed by how friendly and helpful staff are in the US. This, however, was certainly not the case at the Equus. The lift is directly opposite the reception desk but not once during our 5 night stay were we greeted with a hello, or have a nice day on our way in or out.The breakfast was a welcome addition but the quantities put out meant that food and milk ran out very quickly.This is a functional, practical hotel in a good location, but one that doesn't really offer much more than that.

We stayed here for 11 days and found that the hotel was ideally located, near buses, near beaches, near shops, restaurants everything you need. Staff especially Puka very helpful. We arrived early in the morning and he organized an early check in no charge, invited us to join breakfast, even though we it was 6 hours prior to normal check in. Puka also gave us good advise about how to locate medical assistance. Full marks to Puka. On the negative side, the rooms are a bit tired and could do with a spruce up. Full room service everyday was good.

Great location - close to 2 beaches, park, shopping center, bus stops. All the Staff were very friendly and helpful, special thanks to Paolo for fast check-in and check out. Room had everything that I needed - a very comfortable queen bed, a small refrigerator, coffee maker, flat screen TV, a small balcony with table and 2 chairs where I enjoyed reading in the evening. Even so furniture was old and shabby room was very clean - room service every day. Free breakfast and Wi-Fi in the lobby made my vacation more enjoyable. Only one drawback was street noise - 7/24 traffic on the Ala Moana Blvd. I had to sleep in ear plugs but I really light sleeper. Aloha to all the Staff and thank you!

I recently stayed at the Equus for 7 nights on a trip to visit friends in Honolulu. After researching for 3 months, I finally made a decision to book the Equus. My main concern was finding a hotel that was clean without breaking the bank. I wasn't looking for a place to be pampered or to get room service. I absolutely found this at the Equus. We had a king size bed that was amazing. After a long day of walking around and exploring, it was always a pleasure to come back to my room. There was plenty of space for my luggage. We had a large flat screen TV, a balcony (not much of a view, but my boyfriend spent every morning out there reading. It was his favorite part of the trip), and a small fridge. My room was cleaned each day. We both felt at ease while in our room. The staff at the front were also extremely helpful. Although the Equus cannot book tour reservations, I found that the staff was always extremely helpful whenever I asked a question- and if they didn't know, they would find the answer for me. "What bus do I take? What time is the bus? How do I book a luau? Where is this restaurant?". You can also check out towels to take to the pool or beach.The Equus does have a pool and jacuzzi, but you do have to walk outside to the street and around the building to get to it. There are also some tennis courts. In the morning, I had no problem getting sun (other than it seemed to rain each day while I was in Hawaii). Only problem is that the hotel is right on Ala Moana and the traffic doesn't seem to die down even at night. There were nights that I had troubles sleeping, but I would blame that more on the 6 hour time change and my boyfriend's snoring more so than the noise from the street. The AC on low was usually enough to help drown it out.Tip: There is a parking garage behind the Outback where you can park a car for a 10 hour max for $6. We rented a car one day and parked it there overnight.

We stayed at the Equus Hotel for 3 days in Mar'11 & have to to say it was nothing as pictures advertised it. We believed we would be staying in the marina towers.The unit was so small, T.V certainly nothing like the one in their advertising. Street noise was worst then any of our other stays in Waikiki & most being on the main streets. The party in the unit above us was unbelievable, after being woken up numerous times, I rang front desk, at 4.05am, they said they would talk to them. The noise finally stopped at 5/30am. Only good thing for this hotel was it was clean. Will we stay here again, a definate no, will we recommend it, no way. Swim pool, why bother, no sun reaches it, more suitable for a fish pond.

I happened onto the Equus after being dissatisfied with another hotel, and I found it perfect for my needs. Good price, clean rooms, friendly service, free fast internet, easy parking and centrally located. It's not a hotel for everyone...it doesn't sport a restaurant and it's not on the beach; but good eats are close by and the beach is a short walk, and the price allows you to splurge a bit on other things. I was there for business and it provided a great venue to do so -- it's now my new home for the 2 - 3 trips I make to Honolulu a year. I didn't use some of the services (pool and free continental breakfast) so I can't comment. The only negative I can think of is that the lobby area is small and that they have only one elevator...but if you're the patient type, it doesn't matter anyway. I'll be back.

Upon arrival at the hotel we were greated by the amazing Rene. She was incredibly nice and checked us in, in no time. I've stayed at the Equus on several visits and the service just keeps improving. The rooms are well appointed, we were on the 10th floor, partial ocean view but not lanai. The beds I've always had have been kings and they are awesome to say the least, you sink right in and have to pry yourself away to get to the beach. When you do make it outside you're right in the middle of everything. There's an ABC supperette on the same block and multiple restaurants the next block over. I've now now stayed at the Equus five seperate times and wouldn't care to stay any where else in Hawaii, the value can't be beat. Thanks again Rene!!!!

Equus was the perfect choice for us since we had an event to attend to in the Hawaii Convention Center, which is like 5 mins away or less from the hotel. The location is very convenient. The staff was really friendly and helpful with all our needs. (Special shoutout to: Renee, Puca, Jennifer, Paolo and JB.. you guys were great!) The rooms are comfortable and are nicely designed using bamboos. Can't wait to go back again next year!- Kit

This Hotel is great. Just what I'd hoped it would be. Close to beaches, restaurants, YMCA, and night clubs. The Staff were all helpful, especially PUKA the Desk Clerk. He gave me some helpful information which really impressed me and reaffirmed my thinking that I would definitely come back. I'm from NYC (Manhattan) and although the room I stayed in could have been a little cleaner, I saw a few roaches in the kitchen area, the room was spacious, bed was very comfortable, an there was no outside noise at night. I stayed in the Tower. Getting around town is good, except I'm use to buses running all night ,here they stop around midnight. But there is taxi service. I had a rental car from the Airport, the Hotel has parking; however, next time I go and stay at the Hotel I will not rent a car it is not needed. You can get a taxi from the Airport. Driving is too hectic especially when your on vacation. The Freeways have four or five lanes. The continental breakfast was just that. I didn't expect anything more.It started me on my way. I highly recommend this Hotel and will recommend it to my friends, it's a hidden GEM.Can't wait to go back.Thank You.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Equus just a couple of nights. In fact our stay was cut short because of problems getting to Hawaii during our biggest midwest snow storm of the year. The manager and customer service were very helpful to us because of this situation. We loved the location of the hotel. And we loved their breakfasts. We will certainly stay at the same location if we have the good fortunate of visiting Honolulu again.Thanks for making our stay a wonderful experience.

I was supposed to be meeting up with family but a medical situation forced them to cancel so I came alone. But the staff at the Equus hotel made me feel at home, Especially Renee and also Pukka behind the desk. They were very helpful with directions for taking the bus to the North Shore and Pearl Harbor and everything else I needed to know. This hotel has a great location just a few blocks from the beach (good snorkeling), Yacht Basin, Ala Moana shopping center, etc and was just steps from the Ali Wai Canal and an ABC store. Bus stop was just a block away. The room I had (605) was very comfortable with internet access for my laptop and a very comfortable King bed. Recessed room lighting in the bedroom was a nice touch. The shower was roomy and great and the shampoo & cream was great. Every morning they served a nice continental breakfast that included fresh fruit ( the pineapple was delicious). This is where I want to stay on my next trip. Steve

The Equus decorum is aligned with it's Polo association but you do not have to love horses to appreciate the charming and comfortable rooms, including the lanai. The Hotel's location is great: to the east is Waikiki Beach and to the west is the Ala Moana Beach Park - both with-in walking distance with safe swimming and lifeguards on duty. For the shopoholic the Ala Moana Mall ( huge ) is a ten minute walk away but what made our visit truly unique was the staff. they are tops.Thanks Rene- Mahalo and the wonderful time we had in Hawaii

WE enloyed our stay at the Equus and the staff and the location was excellent.Pavlo and all of the staff were excellent.The rooms are renovated and kept clean.I would reccommend this hotel as it was excellent value and I will stay there again if I return to Hawaii. Allan & Faye Manitoba Canada

The front desk staff especially Pukka and Renee had great customer service skills, I would define them as aloha spirit. Housekeeping staff was polite and the rooms are nicely decorated, beds are comfy sheets and towels are clean, but best of all located in the center of it all across the street from the marina and beach and five min walk to the mall.

I really enjoyed my stay here at the Equus and Marina Hotel. Not only was the location great but I've had many laughs and good times with the security on hand. The staff here have such a great attitude and fun to be around. of all the staff members Linelle from housekeeping and security was the best! hands down.

Booking on the internet can be a crapshoot but this one turned out to far surpass our expectations. Location was great - good walks in all directions to Waikiki Beaches, Ala Moana Shopping Centre, Ali Wai Canal, Yacht Basin, Ala Moana Park and a block to TheBus stop. The room was not huge but the bed was really comfortable, there was a lanai for sitting and we didn't come to Hawaii to spend our holiday in our room anyway. Staff was really nice and helpful, breakfast was good and there's a free daily paper.

We stayed for one week at this Hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The room was comfortable and well decorated. Beds very comfortable. Good location for what we wanted to do. Desk staff pleasant but not very informative. The evening desk clerk so nice and accommadating probably because he wasn't as busy. The included continental breakfast quite nice with fresh fruit, juice, toast, and muffins. My only complaint was with the housekeeping which I felt was poor. We did get clean towels every day and our sheets were only changed once. I do expect a clean room everyday. Almost everyday I had to go to the desk and ask for a coffee packet for the coffee machine that is part of the room. My beach flip flops also went missing and may have been thrown away or taken. I did not complain because I didn't want a cheap pair of sandals to affect our remaining stay. There are 2 pools to use and the one near the tennis court is very nice & also has a hot tub. This is a budget hotel so I felt we did get good value for our money.
The room was lovely, the staff were very friendly and the atmosphere was relaxed. The location is ideal and the view was lovely. Overall, it was the perfect stay.

I had the opportunity to stay at your resort last week for 4 days with a friend of mine. We were glad we could find a hotel in central Honolulu / Waikiki area that doesn't charge such steep rates as most hotels in the Waikiki area. The amenities are great which include coffeemaker, on premise laundry, as well as refrigerator for cold drinks, renovated bathroom and friendly continental breakfast while water with fresh lemon is available throughout the day. The ambiient lighting in the rooms is also a wonderful touch since most hotels are only providing bright, florescent lighting these days. The management is very attentive to public appearance and needs, and front desk staff that include Puka & Renee are exceptionally accommodating. I highly recommend this property for anyone wishing to experience a superior location with all the comforts of home seeking a boutique environment and clean public areas and rooms

Stayed at this hotel for one night then a further four nights towards end of our trip. Place is clean and tidy. Rooms are on the smaller side for the US. Breakfast is free but I wouldn't bother. Location wise, approx a 15 min walk to the centre of W. For the amount of time we were in the room, this hotel suited us. Note: The hotel didn't have a bottle opener so take your own.

Hi Rene a Big Aloha from the UK and thank you soooooo much for a wonderful stay for January 2011 at your Hotel, so delighted with the stay and the room Deluxe ocean with marshmellow king size beds made our stay so comfortable .The room had a perfect ocean view and was cleaned daily to by the friendly room maids.We also enjoyed the FREE breakfast each morning and the use of the beach towels for the HOT jacuzzi great for those relaxing moments.Internet free wifi was added bonus to along with the room safe.Well we are soooooo pleased we will surely recommend you and stay here again next year.Rene also gave us a nice christmas bauble and Hawaiin cookies as we left our vacation.Well done Rene perfect hawaiin hospitality please also thank Mimi,Parlo and the rest of the team .Will keep in touch...........mahola Shaun and Gloria Jackson.....UK

This hotel is a hidden charm of one of the most-loved vacation destinations. The people who work here love their hotel and really live up to Hawaii's freindly reputation. It's more like a new home than a hotel in a big city. Located right on the main street in Waikiki, just across from the beautiful marina and beach, and a few minutes' walk into Honolulu-proper, this place is amazing!
Beds were the comfiest I've ever slept in. The staff are really friendly and helpful, and were full of great ideas to make my trip to Hawaii the trip of a lifetime. I will definitely be returning!!
user_name:
Caoimhe Meahbh H
London, United Kingdom

review_body: Wonderful boutique hotel with nicely decorated rooms. The rooms were thoughtfully planned out and carried on with the hotel's theme. We enjoyed having our own kitchen, as well as lanai where my husband liked to read. The rooms were comfortable and cleanDuring our stay the front desk staff was very helpful and gave us lots of tips for our first stay in Hawaii. The hotel is walking distance to many restaurants, we especially liked one in the new hotel across the street. The beach on this side was also much less crowded than in the middle of Waikiki. The hotel is close to the mall, where you can catch the bus to visit other parts of the island, or of course do some shopping.We look forward to staying here again soon!

Just returned from a marvelous vacation trip to Waikiki. I had a most excellent stay at the Equus Hotel! For my tastes, the hotel is perfectly located at the north end of Waikiki. Situated close enough to comfortably walk to Waikiki Central, but yet far enough off the beaten path to get a sense of seclusion from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki, itself. Not to mention, there are plenty of restaurants close by, and also very close walking distance to the beautiful Ala Moana Beach Park and Ala Moana Shopping Center, Yet another big plus for me!Puka, the gentleman who checked me in, really outdid himself when I asked for a room one one of the higher floors (I had read in here that the Ala Moana road noise may be of concern). With a short wait, he set me up on the 9th floor in an outstanding King room (which, by the way, I was able to upgrade to with the Trip Advisor coupon.). The room was absolutely more than I had expected before arriving here and a pleasant surprise!Along with Puka, the entire staff was friendly, informative, and helpful in every way! I would absolutely book this hotel the next time I come back to the area...which I hope is very soon!Trust me, in my opinion, you really can't miss with the Equus Hotel!

The front desk night shift was really nice and even let me use the computer to do an online check-in for my flights. Furthermore, on my last day of the stay I talked to Réne who also works at the front desk. After I had checked out, we chatted about our love for the ocean and she offered me the opportunity to use a hotel room for taking a shower in the evening before leaving for the airport. That way I could go to the beach on my very last day in Honolulu and still not be all sandy and salty on the flight back home. Also she gave me a christmas tree ornament :) Thank you so much!

This is my 5th time at the Equus so have to admit a bias ! We have tried about 10 other mid range hotels but the Equus stands out by far on friendly customer service, generous size and clean rooms and sumptious beds.There are a number of steps up to the Lobby but my Mum is 85 and she did not complain. There is only one lift which can be a little slow. There is traffic noise - but you have glazing and air conditioning and it was certainly not as noisy as the Wyland ( now Courtyard).The receptionists are all fabulous ( Puka esp) and you will always be greeted with a smile and a corteous answer to any issue you raise. A breakfast is provided each day in the adjoining Marina Towers of toast fruit and coffee. There is a fridge and coffee maker in your room and free internet !A big thank you to Rene and her team. We will back again next year which is the best recommendation I can give.Martyn

The hotel does not seem new or fresh and it has several inconveniences. It is difficult to find and the garage is in a separate building. There is no interesting view. Note that the "and Towers" refers to a separate building with different types of accommodation at higher prices. I would not stay there again unless really desperate for some place to stay in the area. Also note that the so-called upgrade coupon probably will not actually get you an upgrade. You will probably find that it is a "if space available" deal and that no upgrade rooms are available.

If you could stay in a clean, comfortable newly renovated room, with all the basic amenities, plus some extras like a flat screen TV and refrigerator, add friendly service and convenient location to, well, everything,top it off with reasonable rates ( including return guest discounts) .... WHY would you stay anywhere else?  I can walk to Ala Moana Shopping Center, or for a quick snack... the ABC store is at the corner, a little further you are at the Food Pantry with fresh fruit, muffins, a warm packaged dinner or even my favorite...Sushi!  I can cross the street and be at the beginning of Waikiki (on the North side) , go for a run at the park, or enjoy Pizza and beer at the Harbor Pub.  You want to go to the main avenue, Kalakaua? The Equus is right on the bus route or just a 15 min. walk. Personally, I like to relax with a nice stroll on the beach with many entrances to take me to the main road.  Dislikes? Well if I were rich and could afford to spend tons of money on a view that I look at a few minutes at night before I go to sleep and a few minutes before I go there, then I wish it was right on the beach like at those Main Premium Hotels.  This is a "short" review of all the great things I could say about staying at "The Equus"  So WHY wouldn't you stay there? Thank you to Puka for always making me feel welcome at your Hotel!!!
I stayed there as a solo traveller in Cctober Good hotel great location very nice room

I have stayed at the Equus before and was very satisfied. I love that it's located near the mall and beach. This last visit however was very disappointing. The room I felt was put together at the last minute with very lumpy, sagging uncomfortable mattresses. Did not have a good nights sleep my whole stay. The walls were not cleaned , had shoe print marks. Night table missing handle & other small problems, Made me wonder if this was because of the low rate we locked into?

We visit Honolulu at least once per year because our son attended Hawaii Pacific University and has remained following his graduation a year ago. We have stayed at the Hyatt, Prince Resort Waikiki, Executive Centre, and several guest houses in the Kailua/Kaneohe area. My overall favorite is the Prince Resort.For our latest trip we decided to save some money on our hotel. I saw a number of favorable reviews for The Equus and we decided to give it a try. We knew that it was across the street from the Prince, so we were familiar with the area. The Equus met our needs very well.We had a king bedroom that was neatly furnished, had a lanai with a view of Ala Moana Blvd, and a compact but very modern bathroom. The room rate included internet access and a continental breakfast plus coffee in the room. The staff, including Kika and Mimi responded to every request or question that we had. One of the biggest drawbacks is the traffic noise on Ala Moana Blvd, even in the middle of the night. That is the price for the convenient location.There are no views of the water from the main building, but a 5 minute walk brings you to the boardwalk at the Hilton lagoon, which provides access to Waikiki Beach. We also had lunch one day at Hilton Hawaiian Village, and some meals at the Waialana Coffee Shop and had dinner once at Red Lobster. Because our son lives in the downtown area, we had dinner twice at Murphy's, which has a variety of meals at reasonable prices.We used the parking garage at the Marina Tower which is adjacent to The Equus. The only challenge is finding a spot that is not marked "Reserved". Sometimes we parked on the second level, other times we were on the fifth level, but we always found a space. We were spoiled the times we stayed at the Prince because of their excellent valet parking, but we paid significantly less to stay at The Equus.We will probably stay at The Equus (or the Marina Tower) on our next trip to Honolulu.

The Equus hotel, staff, and amenities were excellent! Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff were friendly and helpful! The bed was super comfortable, the room good sized, the shower hot and strong, the next door laundry cheap and good, the continental breakfast was good too! We had the best time ! Also, be sure to eat at the Big Fat Greek restaurant up Ala Moana as well as Pho's wrapped sandwiches. I had the best falalfel in 30 years of eating falalfels at the BFGR! So the location is great as well with good food close by and inexpensive by Honolulu standards. This is my fourth trip to Hawaii and my fella's first! The Equus made our stay the best trip we have ever had together! MAHALO EQUUS FOLKS!!!! love and blessings. Lia and Tom
A nice hotel in an affordable price. Alamona shopping mall is within a short walking distance from the Equus. You will enjoy great International food at the mall.

My brother and sister and I decided to come to Hawaii for a vacation after a long stressful year of college. We settled on staying at the Equus and we had a great time. The staff were relaxed and friendly and they were very helpful with directing us around the city. The rooms were very clean and the beds were amazing, one of the most comfortable sleeps I have ever had!

Kia ora :) My husband and I travelled to Oahu, from Aotearoa, with our parents for a cousin's wedding & holiday. We stayed 10 days at The Equus and the whanau (staff) took awesome care of us and helped make our Hawaii experience THE VERY BEST!!We'd like to thank ALL of the staff that we got to know while we stayed there..... Much love to JunJun (housecare), Jackie (security), Achew (front desk), Paolao (front desk), Kiki (front desk) and not to forget 'the man' Mapu (housecare). We are so grateful to you all and look forward to coming back again, this time with our children :)The value for money was tremendous especially for a 10 day stay..... the location is the BEST, right in the middle of Waikiki only a stone-throw away from anything you need.... the room we stayed in was modern, clean and had all amenities necessary.... the service we rate as A++++, helpful, friendly and genuine, you can't get better!!.... sleep quality, well, when your on holiday what else can you ask for, you usually only go back to your hotel to catch some Z's when you really need it (well that was us anyway)... there's too much to see and do :) Excellent!!This was our first time booking over the internet for accomodation, so it was very scary at the beginning. We understand how people feel about this and have given an honest review about The Equus Hotel so other people can enjoy the same as us. It really helps as well when you take the time to talk with the people of Hawaii. We came to realise that the place itself is gorgeous, but the people are what make it beautiful!!!Arohanui, The Tawakaz

What a delight. We were in Honolulu for my friend to get knee surgery for an old injury, and had to switch to this hotel midway during her recovery because of the busy Xmas week. What a stroke of good fortune. This hotel is SO much nicer than the one we were staying at. All the furnishings are plush, plush, plush, bed, sofa, easy chair, etc. And they bent over backwards to get the room ready for us (since we had to check out of the other place by 10:00am) and my friend was in pain from not being able to prop up her leg. They really have the spirit of "aloha" - they care about guests enjoying their stay and are willing to do what it takes. The location is also great, close enough to Waikiki without being on top of it. I would not hesitate to return to the Equus in the future. Lovely hotel.

Our housekeeper Linelle was fantastic! The elevator on the 37th floor (lots of stairs) wasn't working (and its Christmas!), but Linelle climbed every step in order to make sure we got the best care possible. If that doesn't scream customer satisfaction, then nothing does.

Linelle-Thank you very much. Because of you I will come back again and stay in this hotel.You have been wonderful and took really good care of me. This hotel is good and the location is fantastic. Ala Moana center is 5 mins walk, ust across is Ala Moana park. You can see beautiful sunset on this beach. I would recommend this hotel. It has nice samll kitchen area if you like to prepare your own food. Toilet is clean and bed is comfortable,

ALOHA!!!We stayed here for our honeymoon in Hawaii, and it was perfect for us!Firstly, I want to thanks all the staff for their help and kindness, but specialy Rene and Puka : Thank you guys for everything! and Rene thanks again for making our honeymoon unforgettable and special!When I booked this hotel I was looking for an affordable one near Waikiki. I booked the Equus because it was what I was looking for. And boy, I am happy that I followed my insticts. My stay here was perfect!!!There were two us in a large room with high ceiling and one king bed, coffee maker, mini fridge, HDTV. Everything was clean and spacious, and that was all we were looking for. We were on the 9th floor, and there were 1 slow elevator, but honestly who cares!?!? : YOU ARE IN VACATIONS!!!I mean, the whole hotel is kind of old, but the emphasis here is on clean, spacious, good service and close to Waikiki Beach, where most of the action took place.My wireless internet connection was perfect. I stayed in more expensive hotels around the world in the past severals years, and they had much worse connections. Do not hesitate to stay at the Equus hotel in Honolulu! You will not be disappointed!

Aloha! My best friend and I first discovered the Equus one night after having a lot of fun in Waikiki and needing a place to sleep. We were treated very rudely by the staff at the Hale Koa Hotel, Hilton Hawaiian Village, and the Ala Moana Hotel. We were walking past the Equus at 5 a.m. and on a whim stopped to see if they had a room. Not only did they have a room but the night desk was very friendly and apologetic that they had to charge us for a full night just for a few hours of sleep. Since then our first choice... for planned and unplanned stays! is the Equus. The staff is friendly and the rooms are very clean. Rooms with balconies are the best. The beds though are the icing on the cake. They are soooo comfortable! Very nice after a night on the town and all you want to do is sleep it off. Makes it hard to check out though. A relaxing and revitalising breakfast at the nearby Wailana Coffee House tops off our adventure.

The rooms at the Equus are great. Fast, free internet, comfortable beds - everything seems new and in good working order. Although the hotel recently substantially increased their prices making it not such a fantastic deal anymore, it is still a good deal and much cheaper than other, equal places nearby like Ala Moana. The breakfast is tiny and cheap (mostly just bread and butter) but who cares. It is 5 minutes walk to the mall at Ala Moana and just a few minutes to the beaches at Waikiki. The bus stops right in front for $2. You can park free at the mall, if you are willing to take a chance with not getting the warnings they sometimes issue down there. The hotel charges $18 otherwise - not a good deal. Overall - Great place to stay!

We were very pleased with our stay at this property. We were greeted by Rene Kahumoku with a warm smile. She made us feel at home in paradise. She is full of "aloha" and shares this feeling to all the guests. I will definitely stay here again because of her. Mahalo Rene!

We only stayed one night in the suite on the 10th floor, which was a beautifully appointed room (2 rooms, really), with antique-looking furniture, lovely artwork and a very comfortable king-size bed and couch and chairs. Very clean bathroom with a large shower space...nice kitchenette...we had trouble at first with tv, but workman came up right away after we called down and fixed it. The elevator and stairs coming up to the reception have a polished feel, very clean. Very friendly people, and most of all, so close to beaches, shopping and other hotels with great restaurants (would recommend the beach restaurant at the Hilton Hawaiian Village across the street for lunch). For the price it's a real steal!

It was a real pleasure staying at this hotel in hnl. The staff was very personal.The location was very nice as well. Room was very cozy tidy and had a great view especially for the price. Rene the receptionist was very kind to arrange sending my misplaced belongings back to me. It was definitely a winner, and will stay there again in the future.

If you want to go to Waikiki but want to avoid the "same old, same old" of large hotel conglomerates with their ho-hum decor and poolside musicians, consider the Equus. It's an unassuming boutique hotel decorated in the simple, chic style of Ralph Lauren. It is located smack dab in the heart of Waikiki across from the Prince Hotel and just steps from Hilton Hawaiian Village, both of which costs 3-4 times the cost of the Equus. One doesn't go to Waikiki for peace and quiet, complimentary breakfasts, or to hang out in a hotel room. One would go to a resort outside of the city for these. The Equus is an immaculate, tasteful, low budget, aesthetically pleasing boutique hotel that screams: location, location, location. There was no view to speak of, but we weren't there for a view. We were there to access to all of the amenities of the other hotels in town, including the best beaches, restaurants, and shopping. Their covered entrance, compete with polished slate and brass railings, feels like a homestay in an Asian country and is devoid of the typical Waikiki hype. The warmth and friendliness of the front desk staff overshadows the understated front desk and lobby but the impeccable cleanliness and aesthetics of every inch of this hidden treasure are what stand out.

JACQUIE andRENEE are the2 people that really made this stay most enjoyable, JACQUIE for her help fullfilling all my requests that I had made prior to our stay and RENEEfor her very helpfull and friendly personality both on the phone when I made the reservations and at the front desk . When we arrived at the hotel, our rooms were ready to go.. Everything that I had requested from extra towels to roll away beds were there in our rooms. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty and were very helpfull with my entire family and there was quite a few of us.I had even forgotten my key at one point in my room and JACQUIE was nice enough to walk me up to the room and open it for me so I wouldnt have to go all the way down to the front desk to request another key. The staff at this hotel made our stay most enjoyable and we are definitely planning on coming there again.

The Equus hotel helped us have a good time in Waikiki. It was really well located, clean, the staff was nice and informative, and, did I mention the location was great. The big bamboo bed was lovely, and the air conditioning was super cool.

This hotel is so close to the Ala Moana shopping center. Made our holiday shopping much for fun. Also right there is the Ala Moana Beach Park for walking and swimming. For us it feels like a little vacation on our own island. Their rates are really reasonable, too.

I am currently staying here now, been here all week, and overall OK stay. Staying in the Equus itself not the tower in the back that I read about.The free breakfast was kind of a nice little selling point since I was staying all week. The first day I stayed here they had some rolls, finely chopped fruit, and coffee. Nothing spectacular but was OK.I go down for this free breakfast midweek at 8:30am and there was some pieces of bread, looked like it was torn from a loaf and some squeeze bottles of jelly and empty coffee canisters. I asked the girl working down there how long does breakfast go on to and she said 9:00am. It was 8:30am, so I asked where is breakfast and she said with attitude, "This is it.", but she can make something if I wanted to pay.FREE Breakfast + There is No Breakfast = You need to PAYHA! Sorry, that logic makes no sense. Just plan on McDonalds down the street if you want to stay here and tack on $10 a day for some good Hawaiian style platters at McD's a few minutes away.The rooms themselves are decent, some street noise echoes up so if you are a light sleeper may be a little rough. The location is good if you don't mind walking 5-10 minutes in either direction and you are at the Marina, or Ala Moana Mall, or Hilton Hawaiian Village. There is no Wi-fi in the room but there was an Ethernet cable to plug into so it works if you need just one computer online or if you bring your own router.The pool looks like an extra large hot tub and is in the shade right by the entrance where everyone walks in. I did not see one person use it the entire week stay.Decent value compared to other hotels. But be cautious of FREE Breakfast, Pool, and Internet.

STRUCTURE: We purchased a flight/hotel combination from Travelocity.com and choose the Equus for price.LOCATION: Previously we stayed at hotels nearer to Waikiki Beach and The Equus is near the Ala Moana Shopping Center. So this positioned us to use the Transit Center at the Ala Moana Center to good advantage. The Center has a fabulous Food Court. The Equus is right on Ala Moana Boulevard, so there is unavoidable noise at night. But you soon get used to it. BOUTIQUE HOTEL: This is how the hotel bills itself, and all this means is that there are pictures of horses on the walls. Nothing further. We were not impressed, and we're from Texas. We were looking for a room, not horses. Anyone looking for a new theme?BREAKFAST: A continental breakfast is served from 7:30 to 9:30AM. It's juice, coffee and muffins. To add a little protein and sustainability to your breakfast, go to the nearby ABC Store for cheese and add it to your breakfast. Now you have something lasting.MANAGER'S RECEPTION: What a nice touch! Once a week, usually on Tuesday at 5:00PM, the manager invites guests to the foyer for a glass of wine and munchies. A great opportunity to meet other guests and visit with the manager. SERVICE: Good service, never a problem. When we asked why the bathroom fan didn't work, the maintenance man came down to tell us there was a grill on the ceiling, but no ducting for it in the wall. In an old hotel, that made sense.RELATED: The ice machine is in back of the office along with a microwave. Both worked well.THE REVIEWS: The reviews on The Equus' website were professionally written. Reviews on an independent website would be more accurate.SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Equus speaks more to the issue of "value" than "horses." And as SVS (Senior Value Seekers), The Equus suited us just fine. We recommend this hotel.

From the time we checked in, till we left, the employees were great. Very freindly and funny.Our room was GREAT. The decor made us feel like we were in an old Hawaiian Plantation home. The room was very cozy, never feeling like we were in a hotel room.The bed was like a giant marshmellow, that you just fell into and felt like we never wnted to get out.Bathroom was a nice size and very clean with a great shower.For us, the location was perfect. It is within walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping center, how great is that! Also, it is located across the street from the beach and the Ala Wai Harbor.The great find for us, was, when you walk across the street, it leads you through a path that connects to a fantastic ocean walk , with walk way, that begins at one end of Waikiki and can take you as far as your heart desires. We were pleasently surprised at our short but great stay.

The Equus is one of those hotels that is trying really really hard to be a luxury hotel...yet failing at even the most basic levels. During our four night stay there, our room was cleaned once, despite our multiple requests. This wouldn't be so bad if there was some sort of environmentally-friendly policy in place, but as far as we could tell, it was just out of not wanting to do it. Furthermore, the room was still dirty from the last residents, including thick layers of dust under the bed, ketchup stains on the carpet, empty chip bags behind the dresser, and a used kleenex in the coffee machine's reservoir (who ever they were, they must have been real pigs.) We had to request a new coffee machine three times before someone came by to do anything about it. All that being said however, it really is a nice little hotel with a lot going for it. The rooms was largely nice and quiet - something that is apparently rather rare in hoppin' Waikiki. We actually had a lanai, which also seems like a rarity for a economical room. Moreover, the location is great: only a block and half from a major bus stop (and close by several other bus and trolley stops on other routes), two blocks from the beach, and near, but not in the overly pricey and congested heart of Waikiki. Basically, if you don't mind the dust and idiosyncracies, and only plan on using the hotel as a place to lay your weary head, the Equus is a good spot. If you need to be pampered and have a ultra-clean room, I'd adive you to look elsewhere.

My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in the beginning of Sept. and I must honestly say we were please with it for the most part. The hotel staff was mostly friendly, although the lady that brings out the Continental Breakfast items is not very friendly at all. However, the upside to that is, that our room was cleaned & serviced very nicely by the 2 ladies, Terisita & Anchita. They were excellent on taking care of the housekeeping of our room. We never used the pool and never saw anyone ever in it - it looks nice- but it's located in the wrong area of this hotel where sunlight never really gets to it. Parking slots were always used up by the time we came back from a days or nights outing, so that part sucked, but on the flip side we were able to park in the rear of the hotel, at the sister property, Marina Towers. So that worked out great for us. It's still $18 or $20 a day for parking...bummer. The location is not all that bad, but it is on the very West end of Waikiki, so you would either have to driver or take public transit out to the mail part of Waikiki, since it's not really in walking distance. Other than that the Hotel is quaint, smaill, adorable rooms, and quiet -

My husband stayed at your hotel recently and was very impressed with your employee Jacquie in housekeeping/security. She was not only very friendly but also extremely helpful and epitomized the "aloha spirit' of the islands. Mahalo.

My family and I stayed here for 3 nights. We stayed in the main Equus building on the 10th floor and not the tower. Positives: 1. Price. For $105 per night, we had a room with a king sized bed, free internet (fast connection), small flat screen television and refrigerator. 2. Location: The location was within walkable distance to the Ala Moana mall. An ABC store was a few steps down from the hotel. 3. Cleaning Crew: Seemed to do a good job of providing good cleaning services. Negatives: 1. We heard loud traffic noise until 1 AM, and again starting around 7 AM. The door to your room is not inside a building, but rather external, so outdoor noise is a problem. 2. The hotel isn't handicapped accessible from the outside and no ramps or elevators are available to help you up to the lobby. From the street level, the lobby is about a 20 stair climb, with your luggage. 3. The rooms were a little rough around the edges. Our room had standing water in the shower drain. It was a little gross; however the drain worked. The walls were worn and some of the details seem rough or unfinished. Our bathroom fan was constantly on (could not be turned off) and was pretty loud. The elevator was very slow. We stayed up on the 10th floor and had to wait a long time to get the elevator to our floor. 4. "Business Center"- We had to print a single document and though internet is free in the individual rooms, it is a charge service to use the computer with printer downstairs in their lobby. We had to access the internet to print a document and it ended up costing us extra money. It would be nice if little things like this were included for guests.All in all, if you're looking for a place that is a budget hotel in Waikiki, this works for a short stay. You definitely miss out on a lot of the amenities of the larger hotels and resorts but it's also about 80-100 cheaper per night. You can certainly use that extra money in Waikiki. I wouldn't recommend the place for families with small children as the noises might keep the kids up. Most of the people we saw staying here were younger singles and couples without children.

The Equus Hotel in Honolulu is a great Boutique hotel that is just on the fringe of Waikiki.Not too big and not too small. It is just right in size and comfort. The staff is friendly and reliable. From the front desk (Puka, Renee ect) as you check in till the end of your stay all of the staff show their Aloha! The continental breakfast in the morning was just perfect every day. I especially enjoyed the interior of the hallways and the rooms. They had great shots of Hawaii and the sport of Polo that set the mood of our whole stay. Even the security (Jackie, Mapu) were there on hand to answer any questions. I would not only recommend it to my family, friends and business associates but anyone else that happened to ask about where to stay on Oahu.Happy Guests
this hotel was a 5minute walk to waikiki beach,great value,very hawaiian

We found this hotel for such a great price. My husband and I were going to be in Honolulu for 4 nights and Equus was excellent for a young couple. We knew we weren't going to be in the room often. The hotel is close enough to "the strip" of shops on kalakaua. The staff at Equus were incredibly hospitable, especially Sergia, who'd helped with directions and adviced us on restaurants. We got there early and were disappointed we had to wait for our reserved room. The front desk decided to put us in a room with a better view (23rd floor with an ocean view!) so we could check in right away. The rooms were a good size, very clean if a little used-up looking. Parking was similar to the rest of the hotels ($18/night). The pools and the hot tub were always kept very clean and there wasn't usually anyone there, which I liked. The free continental breakfast for guests (muffins, croissants, fruits) were always served with coffee and juice. It was good and satisfying.

We booked the hotel with priceline and got a really good deal.The room was clean and was even nicer than I expected.Too bad the room was a bit noisy. :-(The pool should not be mentioned at all, since it is tiny and had a very heavy chlorine smell. :-(Staff was very helpful and did everything they could to provide us with information about the area and the bus lines running to Pearl Harbour etc.When we stayed at this property it was part of the AQUA hotelgroup and we had access to the nearby AQUA Hotels and their pools after we asked the staff about this.Great little hotel for a reasonable price!Would recommend it for people not too concerned about great pools and a bit noisy rooms.

My husband and I stayed at the Equus Hotel and Marina Tower for 6 nights. We stayed in the Equus itself, not the Marina Tower. We had to circle the block 4 times to even figure out which hotel it was, no real signs for it, took forever and the parking lot was full so it was very confusing. You have to park in the little parking lot and walk around the corner and up stairs.Check-in took 3 minutes and the elevator to the fourth floor was very fast. They were also pretty helpful whenever we had a question on how to get someplace, etc. The bed was the most comfortable bed my husband and I had EVER been in. I wish I could have taken the mattress home with me! The room was clean, although the carpets had a few stains in them, but it was no big deal. The website said that it was newly renovated, but I didnt really think it was at all. We loved the trey lighting in the room! It gave it a much more romantic feel. Everything was great, shower was small but that didn't bother us. The King room was very roomy as well!The only complaint I had was houskeeeping would show up anywhere from 8am-1pm. They weren't very organized in that manner and left trash bags and linen bags in the hallways for hours. No wonder we never had towels or pillowcases! Whenever we came back to the hotel, we usually had no hand towels or only one towel and a missing pillowcase. It didn't bother us that much, because we just started stashing the towels after the 2nd night instead of having them take them so we know we would have towels!! Location was great for the most part, a Mcd's and IHOP around the corner. Bus Stop to Waikiki and other major areas across the street from Mcd's. Pretty noisy, but seemed to die down at 12am, although the noise never bothers us. Any hotel in the area would be loud! If you rent a car, parking was $18/day. Expensive, and considering there is only limited parking...I would suggest parking for FREE down the block by the Ala Moana Center, not a long walk, and saves a lot of $!! I wish we would have known that when we got there!Overall, it's a great hotel especially for the price!

I had the pleasure of staying at the Equus Hotel and Marina Tower Hotel in Honolulu and had a nice experience. One employee, Jacquie, who was in charge of housekeeping and doubled as Security was extremely pleasant, professional and helpful. When I lost my driver's license, she was kind enough to bring my mail to my room, knowing that I was eager to get my replacement license. She greeted all of the guests as if they were family and made sure that all of their needs were attended to. This is a valued employee and should be recognized for the outstanding job that she does.

Hi yes, I've stayed at your hotel this past summer and I must saythat you guys some of the best helping, customer-caring staff!I would mostly like to thank a particular Ms. Kika Ilalio for makingme and my grandmother's stay a very comfortable one. She came in every day with a smile and never failedto make us feel like we were long time friends. She is an asset to the hotel and I suggest that you promote her!

i have stayed here at the Equus Hotel a couple times now and would absolutely recommend to anyone! Staff is extremely polite and very helpful. I live here on the island and we stayed for a town getaway and completely left my favorite pair of shoes. I called the hotel 2 days later and asked them if they happen to find the shoes! HOUSEKEEPING IS AWESOME!! They had my shoes and kept them for me until I was able to get down there and pick them up! STAFF IS AMAZING AND VERY POLITE AND HELPFUL!

We had read some not so great reviews on tripadvisor prior to setting off to Hawaii in Aug 2010 but when we arrived at The Equus after a 10 hour flight we were pleasantly surprised. We stayed at the HOTEL and not in the Marina Tower.There is a flight of stairs up to the lobby which may be a bit of an obstacle for some but once we got to the lobby the helpful staff let us check in early. The lift is right next to check in and we didn't experience the long delays that past travelers have written about.Our room was right by the road and whilst you could hear traffic, by 11pm the whole road seems to be more quiet, however it probably wouldn't hurt to ask for a room away from the road if it is available. Both the room and the bathroom are a good size.Our room was cleaned daily and the free breakfast in the lobby was enough to get your day started. We used the pool/spa at the towers next door and the laundry is cheap and convenient to use (also located in the tower building).The location is great with just a short walk both into the main part of Waikiki as well as the excellent Ala Moana shopping centre.For the price, The Equus is good value.

I plan on coming back to hawaii, and i will definately try to stay at the Equus Honolulu if theres room. The rooms are comfy and the staff is more frendly then i ever expected. I waned to give a special thanks to Linelle, she really made sure we were well taken care of.

I have been in the Equus and the Marina tower for just over 3 weeks now. I would personally like to thank an employee named Linelle for all of her hard work and dedication she has showed. I travel very often and out of all recent hotel visits this has been my most pleasurable. Linelle has taken it upon herself to make sure that me and my colleague have absolutely everything that we need for our stay. I cannot ask for anything more than I have thus far. Anyone looking for a well priced room, great service, and a wonderful location should choose Equus Hotel or the Marina Tower (sister building).

linelle is a great asset to the marina tower she was always willing to help with what ever we needed from help with our luggage driving directs to the best resturants thanks linelle hope to see you next visit

We stayed for a total of 7 nights in this hotel. It is a little far away from Waikiki area, but there are buses running very frequently to and from Waikiki. It was only a 5 minutes walk from the Ala Moana Mall. The room we had was clean, although we did notice a few little tiny bugs crawling in the bathroom sink, nothing too gross. The AC was strong and very quiet. Housekeeping came every morning and provided us with clean towels and new toiletries. Breakfast was decent, there were fruits, juice and some baked items, but you have to be there right at 7:30 am or else there will be nothing left. One night, some guy tried to get into our room at 5:30 am. We thought someone was trying to break in, so we called front desk. Security came to our floor to look around and they informed us it was just a drunk guy and he was on the wrong floor. We were pretty scared since we were still sleeping, but they reassured us and were very helpful. Overall, this hotel was worth the money and we got a great deal here. We only stayed in the hotel to sleep since we were out doing activities all day. I would recommend it to anyone who just needs a place to stay with good cable t.v., free internet, clean sheets, and a decent breakfast.

I have stayed at the equus and Mariana towers for five days; the hotel is so clean and the staff are very nice especially, Rene, she is a very a nice and helpful lady, she helped me a lot along my stay. I strongly recommend this hotel for anyone visits Honolulu. By the way,the Mariana tower has amazing rooms with ocean view

Room is nicer than some reviews made out, slightly noisy from traffic due to location, but near great shopping and Waikiki not far. Front staff very helpful, I arrived early in the morning and they gave me an early check in, thank you Pukka.

My family stayed at this hotel for a few months while my Aunt had surgery. They received such wonderful customer service from Kika. Thank you so much for making them feel right at home during thier very long stay at your hotel.
Kika is the best. She has helped my family with great service and care.

First off, the staff of The Equus were absolutely nothing short of awesome! They really made my family's stay comfortable & were always willing to accomodate. One staff member in particular, Kika, was our favorite. She always greeted us with a huge smile & was very warm & gave us the "ohana" feel. There were many instances in which she went out of her way to lend a helping hand. Because of her dedicated service I will definitely be going back there.The rooms were also great. I wasn't expecting it to look that great -other hotels in the same price range that I've stayed at were well below the standard of The Equus. It was clean, quaint & was always restocked. The pool was also great! If you'd rather go to the beach, there's the Ilikai beach right across the street which is an enclosed beach with the open beach on right across. The Equus is within walking distance to Wailani's, an Ihop restaurant, & a sports bar and grill. Across the street is the Hilton Hawaiian Village where we took our 16 month old to the penguins, which he absolutely loved! Choice location, great value & AWESOME STAFF!

I had a great experience at the Equus Hotel. The front desk staff including Ms. Reneigh was very helpful and welcoming. The housekeepers, especially Ms. Jackie, Ms. Radiant, and Ms. Linelle, were very generous and friendly with a warm Aloha. Overall, my stay at the hotel was wonderful because of the staff's hospitality. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

I'm looking for budget friendly honeymoon to give me and my wife. Searched all over net for best looking hotel close to many amenities. Called explained what I was looking for and liked to do, was thoroughly please with picture that was painted for me by Renee. Not only did she WOW me with her hospitality on phone, but she assured me that we will have an unforgettable honeymoon. Very personable, highly recommended!!!!Anil and April

Tucked away, hidden besides tall buildings and the beauty of Honolulu City lights you'll find an Oasis, a Hidden Treasure worth discovering and finding, It's The Equus Hotel.There's much to enjoy about the hotel. First it's location, it isn't competing with all the busy'ness of the city, it isn't clamored with all the hustle and bustle of LARGE city living instead it's a rare gem. Although small in size compared to the towering LOUD hotels the city has, it's BIG on Hospitality and the Aloha spirit that we have all come to love and cherish. It's BIG on offering you the personal touches of Hospitality that could out do any fancy hotel, the Pure Kona Coffee and fresh baked goods offered in their quaint hotel reception room is a welcoming way to start your day. Friendly staff that greet you as you come and go, once your in your room, you'll start to unwind. There's a big city out there, but here in the comforts of "almost home" we begin to unwind, take deep breaths and relax. The down comforters and comfortable beds makes sleeping in a new habit! The Equus has gone through some major renovations and as frequent visitors to the Big Big City we appreciate all the "Up-do's!"Be sure to say, "Aloha" to Rene Kahumoku {front desk receptionist) she's the one with the Great Big Hawaiian Smile that'll brighten up anyone's day no matter what's going on! It's the Smile and Aloha spirit that you want to encounter after a long long trip of getting to Hawaii. Whatever you need, she'll do her utmost best to assist you in finding your way around the island. (don't leave the island without getting a HUG from her, it'll leave a Smile on your heart for the rest of your life!!!) I get a hug everytime we visit!The Equus hotel offers a beautiful swimming pool, which I haven't ventured into because the city calls to me...hahahaha :) We're looking forward to our next visit and stay at the Hidden Treasure of the Equus Hotel.

The Equus ~Is by far one of the most beautiful boutique hotels that my husband and I have ever had the pleasure of staying. The staff is so friendly and wonderful we have stayed there before and will continue to stay there. The guest services manager renee just embodies the aloha spirit. She is so wonderful to see everytime we return to the equus. It's as if we never left. Renee goes above and beyond her duties to make us feel comftorable and welcome us back to the equus.We love everything about the hotel the location is phenominal right across the ala moana shopping center. At the entrence to waikiki. The complimentary continental breakfast. The decor is so beautiful. It's like you have taken a step back in time old hawaii meets new contemporary hawaii...... I cannot say enough about how much my husband and myself enjoy the equus.........The guest services manager is is so pleasant and so wonderful we enjoy seeing her smiling face every time we return...........Thank you equus and renee for making us feel ever so special every time we return....... If anyone is looking for a place to stay with aloha look no more the equus is the place for you....Just ask for renee and you to will feel the aloha spirit....

Our three-month stay at the The Equus was as good as home! The purpose of travel was for medical reasons and the Management and Staff were fun and friendly in a professional way that we almost felt at home. Their prompt services are excellent.I love the location!Keep up the good work!Much alohas

I was greeted by your guest service agent Rene. She made me feel welcome. I being a solo traveler for many years now really appreciated the ALOHA she displayed on my arrival. She was very pleasant,helpful in getting me to my room in a timely manner. She also answered questions for me concerning dining,shopping,places of interest.. Rene made my trip to the island memorable.

We stayed at the Equus hotel after four days on the big island. Had we have come here first I would have rated this hotel higher. It just happened to follow a hotel that impressed us no end.The Equus hotel is a good hotel. The location is just on the edge of town between Waikiki and Honolulu. It is within walking distance (5mins) to the Ala Moana shopping centre, and a 5 min bus ride to waikiki.The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the smaller side, but are not cramped. There is a small fridge to keep drinks cold, and an ABC less than 100mts away to buy water, soda etc. The rooms were clean and the airconditioning worked well. The hotel is not sound proof, but it is not overly noisy at night to keep you from sleeping, just the occasional siren from emergency services passing.We found we could access the pool in the building behind, that is a sister hotel. This pool is a lot warmer than the small one in the Equus, as it is in the sun all day, and has a hot tub attached too.We found this hotel perfectly adequate to meet our needs. It was clean, had easy access to everything either by walking a short distance, or on the bus, and the staff were helpful. The only down fall to this hotel was the 20 stairs you had to climb to get to reception and the elevator to the rooms.

Been a month since we came back from our trip and stayed at the Equus hotel for 7D6N. Had a pleasant stay, room was clean and had no problem connecting to the internet in the room. Paolo helped us with our requests most of the time. Had free breakfast which was okay to start off our morning. Requested for a late check out which was granted but the front desk on our last day did not even bother checking that we have requested for the late check out days before and she was rude and not helpful at all, eventually it was resolved. Would definitely come back,maybe minutes walk to waikiki beaches but there are buses along the route. Not the best spot for the pool
Clean and conviently located. Maid service not good. Good price for value received.

If you're just looking for a place to sleep and shower, then this hotel is ok. If you're looking for a resort type place, such as the establishments on Waikiki Beach, then Equus is not for you. The marketing photos on the internet of this hotel are very deceiving. We were expecting a much more modern-looking set up. From appearances, the building has been touched up and cosmetically remodeled. But it honestly needs major renovation before I would consider returning. There were other things that detracted from Equus. First and foremost is the front-desk staff. There were 2 middle-age gentlemen who were not friendly at all. Whenever we approached either of them to ask a question, they wouldn't even take the time to look up from what they were doing, nor would they smile. Seemed to us, they had either been there way too long to care anymore, or just didn't enjoy dealing with guests. Second, after checking in and going up to our room, we discovered a urine-like smell in the bathroom. We thought it might be from the toilet, but that was clean, Then we checked the shower. Turned out the smell was from the shower curtain, which was clearly in need of a good laundering or even replacement. That smell intensified whenever we took a shower and the curtain got wet. Third, the free breakfast that is advertised is a joke-- just coffee, vats of juice, and really awful muffins. After the first day, we drove to the local Safeway to pick up our own breakfast provisions that lasted us during our stay. You can also go down to the ABC store just on the corner, but it's a lot more expensive than stocking up at Safeway or Walmart. There were other housekeeping issues that could be improved upon, such as using fitted sheets on the mattress, and installing more towel racks in the bathroom, and vacuuming the bathroom daily. But again, if these small things don't bother you, and you're looking for a cheap place to stay, then it's adequate. Also, ask for a room not overlooking the street. The room we were in was just above the street, so traffic noise was pretty bad. If you're going to walk to Waikiki, it will take you a good 20 minutes.

The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it does have extremely comfortable beds, and they give you plenty of pillows. Unfortunately, this is negated by the noise level. Despite supposedly "soundproof" windows, you hear all the street noises - including the construction that starts at 6 AM - even on the top floors. The location of this hotel is just ok. You are near Waikiki beach but outside the nice area where all the shops and restaurants are located. It is about 1.5 miles to walk to central Waikiki beach. This hotel is also not for anyone who has trouble walking or with carrying your luggage. It is not wheelchair accessible. There is a flight of stairs to get in--no elevator (for the first flight). You have to carry your own luggage up the stairs--the hotel does not offer any assistance in this regard.Overall, the service is lacking. The front desk rarely answers the phone, and the people at the front desk tend to be unfriendly and unhelpful (especially the night staff). There is only one elevator and it is slow so it can take a long time to get up and down if you are on a higher floor. Perhaps the most disappointing thing about this hotel is the "continental breakfast."
