The "breakfast" consists only of regular coffee (no tea -- and incidentally there is no tea or regular coffee in the rooms either, just decaf coffee) that is so bad it is undrinkable, and rolls that are a cross between a potato roll and a hamburger bun filled with some sweet dough-like substance. If you get to breakfast in the first 15 minutes, you might be able to get a couple pieces of pineapple or watermelon--but this runs out by 7:45 and there is so little of it to begin with that you would be lucky to get any. There are no muffins, croissants, bananas, apples, or basically anything edible.
user_name:
Lava120
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Pro: Located nearby Ala Moana Center and beach. Con: - Small and dirty bathroom- did not replace bathroom amenities and clean towels. I requested for the body wash and shower cap however "sorry, we just run out of stock"- street view and noisy at night, slept with ear plugs

This is the 2nd time that my family and I stayed at the Equus Hotel.Is a very nice boutique hotel with horses as the main theme of the hotel.Situated in a nice place next to the beach and shopping malls.Equus hotel will continue to be my 1st choice in terms of location, service and pricing of the room rates for my next trip back to Hawaii

I def. recomend this hotel I know that many people complain about the noise. In reality the noise is minimal. I thought it was a peaceful stay, with very nice beds. Super friendly workers. It's a cute and small hotel, makes you feel special.

I'm a returning customer of the Equus hotel. I was so pleasantly surprised staying here the first time, that I have come back to stay a 2nd time and have also recommended this place to many people (I work in the Airline Industry). The price is reasonable, the location is awesome (walking distance to the beach and Ala Moana Shopping Centre & bus stops), the staff are friendly & helpful - especially Rene, the rooms are clean and tidy - the place has a Balinese feel to it with the dark wood, tiles & marble which I like - it really makes you feel like you're on holiday. Compared to other places I have stayed at in Waikiki, I much prefer the Equus as the rooms are bigger and you get more for your money. I really can't understand the bad reviews on this hotel - I think some people just expect too much but at the end of the day, you're on holiday, hardly in your room anyway, you just need somewhere safe, clean, tidy & comfortable to sleep so the Equus ticks all the boxes for me. We are hoping to return in December and will be happily staying here again. Another bonus was on the Roberts shuttle bus - we were the first to be dropped off and the last to be picked up from the Equus.

This hotel was a pleasant surprise, considering how much I paid for the week. Very affordable price for a family of 3 on a tight budget. Nicely decorated, very comfortable beds-plenty of pillows. The entrance to the hotel had a big flight of stairs to the lobby, but it was very inviting and it made the hotel look like you were at a high priced resort instead of a 2-3 star hotel. Great patio area, pool and lobby area.Wondered whether or not they had housekeeping the first 2 days...starting day 3 they did make the bed and emptied the trash, replaced bath with clean towels. Staff was very friendly. Everyone spoke and said good morning and smiled whenever we saw them. The hotel was very helpful with check in and out. Nice location, close to a variety of dining options, close lots of shopping and beaches.

My wife and I went to the equus based on a friend's recommendation for our honeymoon and I have to say that we were very pleased with our stay. The guest services manager, Rene, was very friendly and gave us an excellent upgrade. The room was really clean and spacious and the housekeeping staff were helpful and friendly as well. We had a great time there and would recommend this to anyone else thinking of honeymooning in Hawaii!
A great place to stay. It's quite, clean, affordable, its staff is very helpful 24/7, and if you book your room in advance you get fantastic discounts. Definitely a great choice.

My husband and I booked this hotel online and were hoping that we would be happy with the accommodations. We arrived in Honolulu and upon entering the hotel, I immediately fell in love with feel of the hotel. Not too large and very warm and inviting. What I adored was the room! We booked ours on the top floor (10th) to have quiet from street and it was so very quiet! The room was amazing, pillow top mattress, luxury thread count sheets, flat screen tv, internet (free), mini kitchen with fridge and granite counter. Cool inset lighting around room. I loved this room and the price was awesome! The service was fast and friendly, anytime I needed anything! The only negative I could say would be for their ice machine in the main hotel to be functioning, there was ice in their other hotel, the tower behind this hotel but it was not as handy as in the same building. The staff would run and offer to get the ice for you as well. Also, the elevator was quick! No wait usually. The pool is small and I did not care about that as I planned to spend my time at the beaches of Waikiki, not at a hotel pool. Location was right within walking distance of everything, an ABC convenience right at the corner, the mall a block away! Renee the manager was so sweet as was the rest of the staff at this great hotel. Highly recommend and will return when we are able to visit this beautiful island :)

The rooms are adequately depicted online. I stayed in the double city view. The beds are very comfortable in a nicely decorated room. There is a nice refrigerator, coffemaker station, with remote control air conditioning and very nice flat screen tv. ROoms are very clean. The only small drawback is there is one closet in the bathroom but there are about six or seven drawers to store items in the rooms. Other notes about the hotel is that there is no air in the elevator(but its not hot), there is a vending machine with prices ranging from $1.00 to 1.75, there is access to a microwave(a plus), A bag of ice(upon request). There is internet access in the lobby by one computer that charges .20 per minute and 3.25 per printed page.The staff was the best, they were nice, friendly and very accomodating.one note is that i stayed on the 9th floor at the end of the hall in room 908, there was no lighting in the hallway and it was dark which was a little disconcerting but there was no incidence- The hall should be well lite-I did notify the desk but no lighting was placed-this could be difficult for people with poor eyesite or single travelers.

I enjoyed a great spring vacation with my boyfriend in Hawaii and we stayed at the Equus Hotel. We were welcomed very warmly by the front desk staff and were surprised on how nice the room was. The bed was so comfortable and I really like the atmosphere in the rooms with the polo theme. I am usually very picky when it comes to the cleanliness of hotel rooms, but our room at the Equus was very clean and it also smelled fresh and clean!. The location is ok, there are a couple of good restaurants in the area and also waterfront dining right across the street. It is a short walk to the Ala Moana center with good shopping and nice bars. All in all we had a great stay at the Equus and I hope I can return for another vacation!

I recently stayed at the Equus with my boyfriend and had a wonderful time. I prefer boutique hotels and have found that good ones are hard to find in Waikiki, but the Equus was excellent. The rooms make you feel as if you are staying in a Ralph Lauren catalogue, full of luxurious charm. The service is wonderful and the hotel is well kept and clean, which is very important to me! Don't let the not-on-the-beach location deter you. Everything is within walking distance and the distance from the strip is very nice. Access to the hotel is easy and we were happy not to have to deal with the mess of Waikiki traffic. Like I said, we'll definitely be back!
Quality and friendly serviceFantastic location Beach within walking distanceReknown shopping center within walking distanceAccessible to all tours
We loved the unique room decorations. The beds were very comfortable. The service was adequate. The morning breakfast was delicious and true to Hawaii. We can't wait to come again!

Have stayed at the Equus with my husband a few times in the past and in November was there by myself. The rooms are beautiful and the beds comfortable. Got the best sleep I have had in a hotel. The value is amazing in Hawaii with the hotel being so close to the shopping center (Ala Moana Center) and around the conrner from the convention center not to mention that it is only a block to the Ala Moana Beach Park where there is always something going on and a great beach. It is also located right at the beginning of Waikiki so you can walk to the sidewalks or take the beach all the way almost to Diamond Head. Looking forward to staying there again and recommend it to everyone that goes to Oahu but doesn't want to be in the heart of Waikiki. Great rooms, great value and a great staff that truely tries to help in whatever way they can....

This was an overnight stay to attend a cultural event in Honolulu. The hotel was the perfect place to relax on nice beds with tons of pillows and take a wonderfully hot shower in the sparkling clean bathroom. It is in a safe location and was welcoming and felt cozy in a sometimes hectic Waikiki. The front desk staff was local, extra nice and very helpful. There were fresh flowers in the lobby, the brass around the entry was beautifully polished and the pool looked inviting. In addition to a coffee maker in the room, there was a nice continental breakfast downstairs in the lobby in the morning, including fresh fruit and tasty pastries. A nice treat not even mentioned when I booked the room. The Equus is a great deal, delightful, sparkling clean, and cozy.

Hotel is located on Ala Moana Blvd, so it is imperative that one requests and gets a room away from the street. The street noise, day or night is awful, if your a light sleeper bring ear plugs. Check-in was quick, room is nice, flat screen tv, free internet, large bed, fridge and balcony. Bathroom is small, and compact with shower. Room was clean, nice air conditioning system which did not make noise. Continental breakfast included, which is certainly lacking. There is an IHOP a few blocks away as well as a McDonalds. Did not really interact with the staff so have no comments regarding them.

A really nice little hotel. Nothing fancy but clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful. It's a little off the beaten path but the 10 or 15 minute walk to Waikiki beach was just fine. Also, "The Bus" is easy to catch to absolutely anywhere. It was also just a short walk to the Aloa Moana Mall. The room was a little small but who goes to Hawaii to spend time in their room. Most tours pick you up at the front door or a short walk to the hotel across the street.
Excellent choice in decorations for The Equus Hotel!! 5 stars, love that it plays homage to Polo! Staff very friendly and helpful!! Would recommend to anyone!
The hotel isreally unique and comforting. I love the horsey theme throughout the building. Beds are very comfortable and clean. Great price for a lovely room.
nice place . good price - good times - i was impressed with the hotels suave and pleasurable style- would return again

Fab hotel! Enjoyed my stay greatly. Clean, close to everything...1st pick up or drop off for the tours etc. Walking distance to the beach, mall and restaurants. Great service and VERY friendly staff. Will be back for sure. Would recommend it to everyone...it is all you need in a hotel.

I am from the island of maui and frequent oahu at least twice a year. This was the first time i've stayed at the equus and I was surprised to say the least. There were both positive and negatives. The location is outstanding with ala moana and some restraunts nearby. If you walk a little farther, you'll be accesible to more ideal locations such as walmart. The bed was VERY comfortable and the t.v. was great size with high definition. On the flipside, there was no microwave which dissapointed me. I was almost certain I saw they did have a microwave on their website. The shower head wasn't really flexible considering the shower had barely enough space for one person, so water constantly was getting out of the shower. Speaking of the shower, the hot water had a personality of its own. Sometimes the water would be hot, most times you'd have to wait for the water to get hot. Pretty sad I thought. I literally stood there butt naked waiting for the water to get hot. It took almost a full 5 minutes to get there. Room service ladies were pretty jumpy. FIrst off, 8 a.m. is way too early in my book to be knocking on my door for service. And they didn't let much time pass in between knocking on my door and bascially opening da door wide open with their own key card. Like two knocks, and then next thing I know door is flying open. What if I was naked or doing "the business"? I found that to be a bit intrusive. My biggest complaint of all has to be the elevator. That thing is TERRIBLE!!! It took soooo long. And it wasn't just one time either. Every single time whether I was going up or going down, it took an eternity to get there. Generally speaking this is a good hotel, especailly for the rate. But the negatives sure did weigh heavy on my stay there.

I only found out about The Equus late last year whilst searching through the internet looking at making a booking for December 09 . As a frequent visitor to Hawaii, I have always stayed at "middle of the road" priced hotels. Well what a surprise it was when I found the Equus! This hotel offers excellent value for the dollar! For what I had paid previously, paying a similar rate the Equus exceeded my expectations. The DBL/DBL room that I booked was extremely spacious, beautifully laid out, and not to mention, exceptionally clean. The staff were very professional, particulary Rene. I met Rene on my arrival and she went out of her way to make us feel very welcome. When I asked to be put in a room away from any noise, this was taken care of without a problem, as I suffer from a sleep disorder. Rene juggled things around and met my requests, she was so obliging and made our stay very memorable. The continental breakfast was a bonus, and the coffee excellent! great kick start to the day. Location, location, location, this was absolutely great, just a short stroll to the Ala Moana Mall, beaches and convenient stores. Bus stop practically 100 yards from the entrance. I was so impressed I have just re-booked to stay at the Equus in January 2011, cant wait to get back to Paradise and looking forward to returning to the Equus. I certainly would recommend this Hotel without hesitation. From Bev - New Zealand

The housekeeping and front desk staff is so friendly and helpful. I would like to especially thank Rene at front desk who went above and beyond to make sure we had the best rates and most comfortable stay at The Equus and Aqua Marina Hotel. I will definitely come back and reccomend these hotels to all my family and friends! Mahalo!

We found our hotel room to be clean and very nicely appointed. The bed was comfortable. The continental breakfast was meager. The pool was tiny and did not receive any sun. The location was good for us - about 10 to 15 minutes' walk from the hustle and bustle of central Waikiki, and just around the corner from the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. We appreciated the arrangements that the front desk assistant made for us to have late check-out. We felt we received very good value for the price by booking through the Expedia web site.

I was very disappointed in this boutique hotel, while this property was perfect location for me, the room was terribly small and not suitiable for two, the pitchers on the web make it so much larger, and better than reality. Your first impression of the Hotel after a long flight you must now carry all of your luggage up a steep flight of stairs to the small platform of a reception area and dest for check in, turn around take three steps to a slow elevater. after a long flight first thing is a long hot shower, very very very small shower stall no tub and most of all NO HOT WATER, next day NO HOT WATER, I informed Rene, If this is not corrected I will request room in a sister property. The continental breakfast is a joke...in a very small room off from the front desk every one grabing these small bits of mini muffins and fruit, and juice and trying to get out of the way and try to find a place to set or stand.... Maid service I came back to my room one afternoon and my room door was wide open, the maid was three doors down the hall cleaning another room, Not Good!! sheets not changed daily I was there six nights and my sheets where changed twice, there was a notice on my door stating on Sundays limited service. I had requested three seperate wake up calls and all three were never done, coffee packs used first night and were never replaced, Mini-refrigerater never would work, Plasma TV, had to call for service three times. The best thing about this hotel is the the beds the best! The owner of the property hapened to be in the lobby, I introduced my self and expressed my concerns and he said I'm sorry, and my response that that was not exceptiable and that we should have the services that you advertise your hotel to be, and have to pay good money and have to experance these problems, when we are on holiday and that "word of mouth" goes along way. Fellow travelers this 63 room Aqua Hotel was just remodeled and should not have these problems and sorry to say I would not recommend this property at this time there is nothing that made me feel the spirit of aloha or want to go back.

I've stayed at this hotel 3 times. Great location if you want to be in Waikiki. The Equus is clean and the rooms are comfortable and attractive. The staff is always friendly and helpful. This last visit, the gentleman at the front desk, Puka, was especially helpful getting my parents and I quiet(er) rooms. (Honolulu can be so noisy!)Only drawbacks are the wireless internet doesn't seem to work, and the one elevator can be quite slow at times.
Well decorated roomordinary breakfastvery small lobbyI booked through expedia and the price changed very often.

Do you want to dip your tootsies in the pacific ASAP as you leave your hotel? Do you desire panoramic ocean views from your room? if so, then the Equus may not be for you. From the Equus we had an easy two block walk (passing some great little pup&grills and other well known eateries) to the beach. This is why we came! At one hundred to three hundred dollars less per night than what the folks strolling the beach next to us were paying, well, the two block walk was refreshing. Do you want a clean comfortable room, that may also give you a shot of the ocean (there are some on the upper levels I am told)? Do you enjoy being served by a friendly staff? Note: Everybody in Honolulu is friendly so in this respect the staff at the Equus is not unique. Do you want great price per room and save your money for the evenings or take various day tours, then we highly reccommend the Equus.

In the last three years during trips to O'ahu, i have stayed at an Aqua resort at least a dozen times. The overall experience has been positive and pleasant. But there are times when scheduled maintenance and other unexpected issues, may not be the recipe for the perfect holiday. But you are in Hawai'i, so embrace the Aloha Spirit and make the best of the situation. The last trip I stayed at the Aqua Marine, which is partner with the Aqua Equus. I checked in on 3 Mar and Puka at the front desk was very courteous and expedient. I came back to O'ahu from Maui on 13 Mar early in the morning. Puka again did an excellent job and gave me a nice room. I may have been lucky that there was a vacant room available. But it is always nice to have a room to settle into when you first arrive. But if things do not go as planned or hoped - remember - Aloha and Hang Loose...

I made my reservation, then cancelled, then had to redo my reservation, all the while your staff was very pleasant, courteous, and very helpful. This was my second time I stayed at Equus and both times your staff was professional and pleasant. I would continue to use this location when I need a place to stay. Special thanks to Rene and Alika.

The room key had to be re-programmed three different times; I finally asked to have the door lock itself checked. The room key worked after this was done.On Day Two, the bathroom sink plugged up - water rapidly filling the basin. Upon calling the desk, I was asked "Did you turn the water off?" Of course, the water was turned off; there was obviously an obstruction in the drainpipe. My husband & I grabbed the ice bucket liner and started bailing the water. It still overflowed; soon the bathroom floor & entry area had about an inch or more of water, not to mention the entry area into the bedroom area. The rug/carpeting was soaked. Plumbers arrived and dismantled the pipe; one plumber informed us that this had happened before. The other plumber got out a vacuum to suck up the water from the rug/carpeting as well as the bathroom/entry areas. Never once did we receive an apology nor an offer to move us to a different room. I should have insisted upon moving, but at this point, was just plain disgusted with the hotel as well as the service.Breakfast: What a joke. If you qualify mini-muffins with a limited assortment of fruit (which they ran out of on more than one occasion) a continental breakfast, guess it would be okay. But we ended up just leaving the hotel and going to breakfast out.

Stayed here for 2 nights in late February, (cannot thank Puka on the front desk enough for getting us in to our hotel room early after a long overnight flight from Australia!) and got a Fantastic price in comparison to other nearby hotels. After reading some of the reviews on this site i cannot understand why they are complaining, As this inot in the bright lights of Waikiki, but is easily acesible by Foot and by bus (excellent and cheap public transport on Oahu). I had absolutley no complaints regarding traffic noise, or the speed of the elevators or the pool (to complain about these for the price you pay here, you are obviously VERY picky). I will be returning to Hawaii for 2 weeks early next year, and will be staying here (longer this time) for sure!

I stayed at this hotel during the last two weeks of February 2010. I really enjoyed my time at The Equus. The staff are really friendly and the hotel is kept really clean. On the one occassion during my stay that I had a problem (my iron didn't work) it was promptly attended to. Although my room wasn't too big it was well appointed. It had an en suite, balcony and air conditioning. The bed was really confortable and I slept well.The Equus is conveniently located on Ala Moana Bld which means that it is far enough away from the tourist centre so as to avoid crowds but close enough to walk there. It is also one block away from the Ala Moana Centre and across the road from the Ala Moana Beach Park. My only criticism is that the hotel insists that you not check in until 3pm. Furthermore, housekeeping comes to clean your room at about 8.30am. While this is a little annoying, it didn't really affect my time at the hotel.All in all, The Equus is a lovely little hotel in a really good location. I would recommend it to anyone.

The best thing about this hotel is the bed...... (Very soft) The rooms itself was overall nice but the maid service was very poor and didn't do a good job at all. The hotel was very loud and in a high traffic area, very hard to sleep at night. The elevator took forever just to get to the sixth floor.. Would never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.....

Rene and her staff are the best. They are always very accomodating.The beds are comfortable. Rooms are very clean, free internet and flat screen TV, how can you go wrong. Then there is complimentary coffee, muffins and pastries every morning. Just a little something to get your day going. Hotel is walking distance to great restaurants and Ala Moana Shoppign Center right next door. I love this Boutique Hotel. You don't have to deal with large parking lots and heavy elevator traffic like the other larger Hotels. I always love my stay. I have been a regular of the Equus for over two years now. Best place to stay for Business and/or Pleasure.

Comfortable, Friendly, Great Location and Clean all the main points for finding the perfect place to stay. Would absolutely stay again the next time I get to Hawaii! Staff was very hospitable, friendly and willing to accommodate our needs. Our room was very comfortable and clean to the highest expectations. We were in the perfect spot close to everything!

I first stayed here nine years ago when it was called the Hawaii Polo Inn. It was a good deal then and I liked my stay so much that I knew I would one day come back. Well, that day finally arrived. The hotel has been renamed and remodeled and for the price it is well worth it. If you're just looking for an economy place to sleep, then I have no complaints. I really didn't hang around much as I was always out walking from early morning to night. In fact, I will one day return for a third stay at this hotel--I only hope that I don't wait nine years.

The hotel room is good size very clean - the king size bed is very comfortable. Internet is high speed in the rooms but supplied by cable to hook up to your USB port on the computer. The continental breakfast consists of different types of buns, fresh fruits, coffee & tea. Rene the beautiful smiling lady made our stay so comfortable, memorable & enjoyment in Waikiki. She has a real touch for people and the rest of the staff are just as accommodating. I wished there are more people like Rene & Puka in the hotel business. The Ala Moana Shopping Centre is 2 blocks from the hotel and Ala Moana Beach is across from the Shopping Centre and located on the Honolulu side. The main transit location is located at the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, which is ideal if you use transit and you can travel to all parts of the Island from there.Wilkie & Khim - Vancouver Canada - Feb. 26, 2010

The person named "askabrit" summed up this hotel pretty well. I agreed with their rating. This is not a fancy hotel, but you don't pay the big price. It' close to shopping, close to conveniece store, and a short walk to the beach.

We started our most enjoyable and relaxing weekend with an early check in. The Equus front desk staffs the friendliest and most obliging, with our earlier check in. Our room was ready, comfortable, and immaculate. They had a cozy equestrian country décor, but with the convenient amenities of most high end hotels. The price was terrific, and everything including Waikiki beach, and Ala Moana Center was in strolling distance. Our room was incredible, with a very inviting king sized comfortable bed, flat screen tv, internet and the property had a charming tropical pool area. Our weekend was well worth the price and calling direct to the helpful hotels reservations. We will be defiantly coming back again and even trying their other properties that were suggested by the most accommodating hotel manager, Rene.

My friend and I stayed here for 10 days and overall we were pleased with the hotel for the price we paid. All the reviews we looked at before we went are pretty accurate. There are no views, it is located on a busy noisy street (I wore earplugs at night), no bath only a shower, breakfast would be good if you didn't have to be there before 8am to get any pastries and fruit. Arrive at 8:10am and you are out of luck. The housekeeping service was hit and miss although bed sheets and towels were always sparkling clean. Pool is more artistic than usable, always in the shade and cold according to the one person we saw in it. Location was great for us, one block from the beach (next to the Hilton Wikiki Resort), a short walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Center which has a great eat street and the Ala Moana Park (great for swimming). "The Bus" service was great, stops close to hotel, easy to get to Waikiki and Honolulu. Service at the hotel was always friendly but you need to ask for things i.e. ice, safe key, hairdryer. We had a broken light outside our room which made it hard to see to put our key card in the door at night. After a few days we mentioned it to the front desk and it was fixed the same day. Yes, I would stay there again if the price was right.

Our stay at the Equus was for 6 nights and was most enjoyable. Close to shopping and beaches. Our front desk lady, Rene, was absolutely wonderful. She made us feel so welcome and her joyous smile was so infectious.

Dates Stayed: Jan. 21/2010 - Feb. 2/2010We decided to go to Hawaii (our fist time) as a celebration of the upcoming birth of our first child and did a lot of research on places to stay with the criteria that our accomodations not necessarily be 5 star or have 5 star prices as after all we were in Hawaii so the amount of time we'd be staying in the hotel would be minimal. After much research through TripAdvisor and other sites, we decided to stay at the Equus. First impressions? This is a quant little hotel just off the main Waikiki strip. It's not a flashy hotel screaming "touris trap". It's clean, the staff are very friendly (and responsive) and the rooms while not huge are quite nice. One thing people should keep in mind is that when you take into consideration the costs to stay (which is very reasonable), the value is extremely good. It's not on the main strip nor is it a "resort" so if you want that night life and conveniences, then this isn't the hotel for you so you need to decide what kind of trip you are looking for. For us, we were going to be spending very little time near the strip but exploring the island so we were more concerned with a comfortable bed and clean ammenties.The hotel comes with a free continental breakfast which is a nice service but expect to be fighting with other guests for food (consists of juices, coffee, fresh fruit and pastries). The breakfast is only served between 8AM and 9AM so if this doesn't work for you, this service won't be for you. One thing of note, if street noises bother you, then ask for an ocean view room so that you're not facing the main road. Our room actually faced the road but in all honesty, we didn't notice the street noise anymore after our second night. Something else you should be aware of at the Equus. It has incredibly comfortable beds, probably the reason why we didn't notice the road noise. If you're renting a car (which isn't a bad idea for Oahu), parking is available for $18/night. The parkade is in an adjacent building which has a metal link garage door so only individuals with a garage opener will be able to get into the facility. When you rent a vehicle, you will have to register the vehicle with Equus's front desk which they will then provide the garage opener for you. Your vehicle will be more than safe here.The Hilton Hawaiian Village is about 2 blocks south west of the Equus as is the beach so you're not very far away. The Hilton is a major pick up point for buses, tour groups and other activities so the proximity comes in handy. It's also a nice spot to relax and there are some nice restaurants there. In the opposite direction of the Equus is the Ala Moana Mall (approximately 10 minute walk) so if you wanted to do some shopping or just need to pick up some ammenties, this is a good resource. Something also nice is that the food court there provides a nice option if you don't want restaurant food.All in all, the Equus was a nice hotel that we would come back to again and have no issues with recommending to anyone else.

The folks on this site with major complaints obviously have not read the reviews....they are quite accurate in describing this hotel. My room was clean and comfortable...as was the bath.....to me those are the most important elements in a hotel stay. My concerns were minor....and without them, I would have rated this stay as 5 stars......those concerns were.....continental breakfast is not worth the hassle....standing in line while the usual 'fiddle and diddle' folks just can't seem to take what they need and move on! I tried the b'fast scene one day and that was enough for me. Signing on to the internet was difficult, but once on.....it worked well......unfortunately, the water in the shower never got above 'sort of warm!'..........beyond those minor points....this was a very good stay! One recommendation if you are arriving at the airport and need transportation to Waikiki.....DO NOT use VIP transport.....I have never experienced a more miserable shuttle serivce than this!!!!!

Although it was a bit noisy at night, (after all it is on a main street) we didn't have any trouble sleeping. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would definately stay here again if I was to go back to Honolulu. Although there was no bathtub, I was not in the room long enough to have enjoyed one anyway.

Of all the monstrosities that loom over Waikiki, Equus is a diamond in the rough. Tucked away off the beaten path enough to not get the noise of the strip but still very close to the excitement, this hotel was wonderful for the town getaway my husband and I were looking for. Even though it was a bit hard to find at first, the feeling of being less conspicuous was nice. As the name implies, Equus has a theme, and for a horse lover like me, I was in heaven staring at the endless pictures of old paniolos (hawaiian cowboys) and horses running on the beach. The rooms were a perfect blend of old hawaiiana memorabilia and pieces of restored antique furniture perfectly blended with the newest amenities. The location was great...I had a view of some Waikiki surf spots from the room and the receptionist told us all the best places to go on a Friday night. We started with happy hour at the Chart House, then to Indian food (we decided to skip the Thai place and save it for next time) which my husband said had the best garlic nan (bread) he's ever eaten. Then off to the Hilton to see the Friday fireworks--a GREAT show--don't miss it if you are in Waikiki on a Friday...and to round table pizza for a little late night munch. The ABC store right below the hotel was fully stocked with everything from food to beach mats (and ice cream!). Needless to say, we had quite a feast that evening and we still have many places to go next time. The hotel looks like it has been recently refurbished: new appliances, countertops, fixtures, tile, furniture, just about anything that isn't restored antique is brand new. The kitchen and living room were my favorites. I could have entertained a small party as the kitchen was fully stocked with all the (new) silverware and accessories I would need. In the living room sat a plush red couch, complete with cozy blanket, that sat right in front of a new flat screen. My husband and I fell asleep and could barely get off the couch to make it to our bed. I would go there just to spend another night on that couch! Parking was also a plus. In many hotels in Waikiki you have to walk forever to get to your car but the parking lot of Equus was conveniently on the ground level and was easy to get in and out of. Overall, I really wish I had more time to check out the rest of the hotel but had to leave the next morning. I give Equus two big thumbs up, it surpassed my expectations.

Our sixth stay at the Equus so it has become home from home. We have tried other hotels but keep coming back to the familiar excellent service we receive from Rene and all of the team at the Equus ( a big thank you to Puka. Lygaya and Sergia). The combination of small boutique hawaiian hospitality, excellent service It is true that there are steps from the road to the first floor with no elevator but my elderly mother had no problems with them. Also given the economic environment the hotel has removed some of the added value elements it used to provide for free ( like the water bottles on arrival, the manager's drinks party on a tuesday and was during our recent stay only operating a full room service on 6 days of the week).That said they have upgraded the cable service and still offer the best free continental breakfast ( fresh fruit, two juices, coffee and a selection of nice pastries) around. It is now serevd for just an hour 8.00 to 9.00 and can be a bit of a bun fight at busy times). Sergia manages to serenely weave amongst the guests keeping stocks replenished.The rooms are kept very clean and maintenance issues are resolved promptly and effeciently. The staff all work very hard and seem genuinely friendly.Car parking is an issue with all Waikiki hotels and really you should be using the excellent bus service on the island. The hotel is a 1/4 mile from a major bus terminal point at the Ala Moana Shopping Center which has buses all over the island running every 15 mins or so. See the TheBus web site for schedules and maps. If you are staying over 20 days the monthly bus pass is excellent value ( and for over 60's is a steal).There is a small pool but it is better to use the pool at the Aqua Marina next door ( access using your key card). The jacuzzi was still awaiting repair ( since december !).So good I cannot wait to go back !

My wide and I stayed at the Equus for 6 nights. The Equus offered us very good value and was one of the lower priced hotels near Waikiki. I asked for a quiet room and instead of a room on the street that we had paid for, we were given an upgrade to a very nice room in the rear of the hotel. The room was everything I need: clean, well appointed, comfortable bed, quiet, plenty of hot water and lots of towels. Breakfast is included, however it's just coffee, buns and some fruit and one must lineup to get these. The hotel is very close to the Ala Moana center with everything you might need including a food court with a good salad bar. The staff was helpful although I didn't find them particularly knowledgeable about Honolulu. But they were all pleasant and quite helpful with hotel matters. A bus stop a half a block down the street provided buses to wherever we wanted to go. If you have a car it will cost you $18/night to park at the hotel. However there is metered parking (up to 24 hours) for $00.25/hour in the marina parking lot across from the Hilton Lagoon about a five minute walk from the hotel. There is a small shaded pool but in January, I never saw a person in it.

The rooms, by and large, are nice, but VERY NOISY! The property is perpendicular to Ala Moana Blvd with open corridors on one side for room access. This lets noise in both through the window and door of the room. The lobby and the bottom of the elevator are more than a full floor above street level which is a pain for baby strollers or, in general, for people who come and go a lot. The staff help is nice, but not my idea of convenience.The minuscule pool was "temporarily" out of service for our week of stay. Not much of a loss. The one-hour "continental" breakfasts were so so, slow to restock the trays, often running out of fruit. No decaffeinated coffee anywhere.

We stayed at the hotel for 12 nights, the rooms are very nice nothing fancy, but very comfortable. The beds are amazing; the cleaning staff was very nice and did a nice job.There is a small fridge in the room which is nice as well, there are no bathtubs, but other then that it was a nice room. The first night they had a bit of screw up, we were coming on a honeymoon and asked for a king size bed, but what we got was 2 doubles. I was very upset but they promised us that the next night they would move us, which they did, Yes the charge for parking is 18 dollars but its nice to have the convince .Rene at the front desk was the sweetest women she always was willing to help and always gave us helpful hints. Thank you Rene for making our holidays wonderful.RE: the breakfast it is not very good but what you want for nothing, if you want breakfast go out. There is coffee and juice .. My only complaint is there is not always milk for coffee. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I'm still glowing after my trip to Hawaii and stay at the Equus Hotel. The hotel was affordable and really nice. It's off Waikiki enough to avoid the bad traffic, but close enough to walk and enjoy all it has to offer. The best part was waking up every morning of my stay, running to Ala Moana Beach Park for a wake-up run, then taking off the shoes and swimming while the sun came up behind Diamond Head--I'll never forget it. The rooms are newly remodeled. The beds are comfortable and sheets spectacular. I heartily recommend this hotel. Also, the staff was personable and very friendly. My wife wanted a higher room and the receptionist worked with housekeeping to free up a great room within 20 minutes of our request. It was the best. Every morning we were greeted with a smile and another great tip for sightseeing for the day.

What a wonderful experience at The Equus. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the cleaning service was very good. The hotel was reasonably priced. We were provided with a wonderful Continental breakfast each morning of coffee, juice, fresh fruit and the most wonderful pastry! I can't really think of any negatives.

I have stayed at The Equus a number of times mostly when I have been transiting through Hawaii, but stayed there once during a vacation with my wife. As other reviewers have noted, its got a great location, it may be hard to find at first, but its a very comfortable place to stay, not a loud and flashy place. There is a refrigerator in the unit, so you can store drinks or food, and there is internet access, but its not wireless. The beds are super comfortable, you can fall right in and fall asleep. Customer service is great as well, but the best, is Rene, the guest services manager. After having a delayed flight into Hawaii, meaning instead of arriving at 330am, i arrived at 11:30am, which was just about the time to check out, I asked Rene if she could give me a later checkout, she gave me the latest checkout she could, which was right when I had to leave for my flight anyways, and it allowed me to get some rest and shower after a long delayed flight. I stay here everytime I have to fly through Hawaii (4-6 times a year), its a great deal, and a great staff). If you're looking for a place to stay, you'll get the most for your money staying here.

Our 3 night stay at the Equus exceeded our expectations. The room was elegantly appointed with a warm decor. The bed was very comfortable. Room was immaculate with excellent high speed wireless connection. The large flat screen TV was great. The best part was the personable, efficient service at the front desk. The location on the west side of Waikiki with easy access to downtown Honolulu was very convenient for our business meetings. We will stay again on our next trip to Honolulu.

We enjoyed our stay at this family owned inn, and it was so convenient to be so near the Ala Moana Center, and the finer restaurants in Honolulu...the business area we were frequenting in the Ward Center area, located a 5 minute bus ride from the hotel. These rooms are beautiful and comfortable, flat screen TV and internet, free local phone calls,breakfast and newspapers in the morning, and just down the road from Waikiki Beach.We were delighted to be able to see Elton John in concert during our stay, and were near enough to the arena to take a cab for around 10 bucks. The money we saved on our accomodat ions paid for the concert. Hope to return before summer

I've been a frequent traveler to The Equus for years and have put up with many, many issues over the years - but they finally did something that will cause me to never stay here again.I had a confirmed credit card guaranteed stay for 3 nights. I even called 2 days in advance of my stay, spoke to the Front Desk confirming my stay. They told me it was confirmed and guaranteed they had me booked in an upper floor. You should also know, as a policy of this hotel, they charge your credit card 3 nights in advance of your first night's stay. Basically, I had paid for a room before I even stepped in the hotel.After travelling for most of the day, I arrived at 10:30 at night only to be told, "We are overbooked and we are sending you to the other end of Waikiki. Too bad, so sad." The front desk clerk tells me that if I don't like it, to call the General Manager. So he puts me on the phone with her and she tells me the same thing and to hand the phone back to the clerk. He talks to her for a few minutes and hangs up, looks at me and says, "We have no room for you. Do you want this other room or not?" I would not accept the hotel he was giving me until he finally decided to call one of their other properties nearby. He gets me a room, then says to me, "we are going to honor the same rate we quoted you here to." Unbeleivable.My friends, this place is messed up. They will throw you out on the street even with a guaranteed reservation. You'd think they'd care enough to call, email, text or even fax me a note saying they couldn't honor the reservation and they wanted to make new accomodations...but no...they wait until you arrive.The funny thing, and the irony of this - the next day they couldn't apologize enough...but at 10:30 at night, no one is around to take care of a guest! Stay here at your own risk - in my opinion - there are too many other hotels who would glady accept your business - and honor your reservation.

The hotel a few blocks from the Ala Moana Shopping centre. To get in you have to walk up a set of stairs from the main street. There is a really small lobby and one elevator. The outside of the hotel is dated and it looks more like a motel 6 than a boutique hotel.The rooms are nicer than the outside suggests. There is a mini fridge and a coffee maker. There is no wireless internet but the ethernet cable is pretty long. The problems with the room started with bed bugs, a condom wrapper that was left in the room (we found it the third day on a side table next to the bed) and when the cleaning staff stole out beach towels [not hotel towels, they were much bigger and fluffier] right out of our luggage. The luggage was open with the towels on top, but it was in our luggage.The breakfast is a real joke, there is not enough food for the crowd that comes down, they only had poi buns and coffee and juice and when we asked if there was anything else besides the buns (which are essentially purple dinner rolls with no butter, jam etc) they were extremely rude.On out second day my wife woke up with two small bites, by the third day she had lots of bites and after getting them looked at we had BED BUGS! We informed the front desk and were moved to another room. Thankfully the bites stopped.With all the problems we spoke to the manager and asked if they were going to do anything for us to make up for the problems. They said they would look into something but never got back to us. One thing the clerk did do was comp our parking, but refunded the wrong card [we paid parking separate from the room], then two weeks later charged us the same amount they refunded without letting us know. Since we have a Canadian credit card this caused us to pay exchange fees multiple times. I called the hotel when I got my visa bill and they were extremely rude and so I had to call visa and file a dispute as the charge was two weeks after out checkout and was clearly not authorized. Visa made good on the difference, but the hotel did not.I would never stay at this hotel again and recommend it to no one!

Unfortunately due to personal circumstances we were unable to fillful our stay with The Equus Hotel. But I wanted to say that the customer service was Superb. I spoke with Rene and he was so very helpful and understanding when cancelling our booking. I am a Travel Agent also and will be using this hotel & all Aqua Resorts for any personal vacations and I will be recommending my clients to stay here too. If you want friendly, helpful assistance you will find it with the staff at The Equus.

The hotel is in a great spot, close to the mall and waikiki beach. We walked everywhere from the hotel and the bus stop is right outside Mc Donald's. We rented a car for a few days to go outside Waikiki, and did not park in the hotel. It would have cost us $18 a day to park there. There is a $3-6 parking fee across the street at the marina for 12-24 hours. I would definitely stay in this hotel again. Its perfect if you know that you'll be out most of the time and you just need a place to sleep. Its clean, decent, fast service and good location. The only time I found it disappointing is on our last day, they run out of fruits for breakfast at 8:30 am, when they are only serving breakfast for an hour and they knew that they have a lot of guests that are there for new year's eve. It was an expectedly busy day and they are not prepared.

Generally I was very pleased with my stay at the Equus. It's in a great location; bus stops nearby, walking distance to many beautiful beaches, Waikiki and the Ala Moana Centre, as well as many eating establishments. There's a steep flight of stairs to reception and this may be an issue for those with mobility problems. The microwave is on the main level and you have to use washer and dryer facilities at their sister hotel next door. Very tiny swimming pool. None of these were a problem for me but it is something to be aware of. Staff are generally friendly but I found I had to engage them first. Rooms are clean enough, although they forgot to clean my room one day.Overall, good value for money and I would recommend this hotel.

The hotel was beautiful and in a great location. Its close to great restaurants and beautiful beaches and i would definitely recommend it for anyone who will be staying in the Honolulu area. The staff were very nice and the atmosphere of the hotel was very inviting. Overall it was a great stay and i would definitely come back!

Everything was very nice here, from the professional and very polite staff, to the excellent rooms. A little small but well utilized areas. Refrigerator/freezer for ice, balcony, big screened TV's, and the best beds and pillows that I have had in a hotel in a long time.Clean, soft towels. Cutest outside area with teak wood chairs. Airline shuttle or cab pickup, right outside the door. What more could you possibly want?No restaurant but there are plenty within walking distance. You can take the public shuttle for $2.00 to Waikiki Beach (catch it across the street).Loved it!!!!!!!

Loved it! the rooms are comfortable and good size. its at a perfect location close to everything waikiki has to offer: beachs, shoping, and dinning.The decor is also very stylish with an interesting theme. The managment is extermely customer friendly, at tuesday mingling which includes a good cocktail! i learned the best the island has to offer from chating with some of the staff.

We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Equus. This was our first trip to Honolulu and my husbands first trip to Hawaii. The staff was friendly and quick upon check in. The room was clean and decorated well. Nothing large or oppulant but nice, cozy, and updated. The bed was huge and comfortable. I was worried from some of the negative reviews about the street noise but it was minimal and did not bother our sleep at all. Pool was small but I have learned from previous trips to Hawaii not to book a room based on the pool, you spend your entire time on the beach. We had one small problem with our TV and within minutes somone was in our room and reset the TV. The staff was great with questions and bus instructions. The continental breakfast was conservative but filled us up and was always fresh. My only complaint was that it was a little further from Wakiki beach than we thought, but it was a nice walk back to the hotel. Really enjoyed the value and service.

I loved staying here. The rooms were a little small, but very up to date. The air condition worked great on the hot days and evenings. Perfect location, close to the Ala Moana shopping mall, buses and the beach (only 1 block away). Breakfast was provided each morning in the lobby - just enough for all guests. There is a small swimming pool and a cute out door area to relax in with plenty of shade. We walked every where as it is close to all amenities and the beach. Perfect hotel for short stay or a long stay.

I stayed here twice, on the way over and again on the way home from the US Mainland. This place is cute. One block back from Waikiki beach, within walking distance of buses and restaurants, small, cosy , clean and very friendly. Coming from Australia, my 66 year old mother and I needed to crash and their beds were soooooo comfortable, it wa like sleeping on a cloud! The only were the walls were a little thin (could hear footsteps of those above and doors closing etc) and the breakfast is very simple but of the whole this hotel is a very good choice to make - I'll be back for sure...
We enjoyed our stay at The Equus. We took the bus almost everywhere we went. Located near the Ala Moana Center and other great shopping places. We will stay at The Equus again. Great management.

While the rooms are small they are very clean. The decor is creative; the service friendly. Location is perfect ... within easy walking distance of the heart of Waikiki and Ala Moana shopping center but far enough away to be out of the tourist craziness! Highly recommend.

We just spent a week at the Equus hotel in Hawaii and it was a little piece of heaven amongst the barrage of tourists in the surrounding hotels. Its a quick block from the beachfront but is quiet and non intrusive unlike the noisy tourist filled hotels on the beach. It has many top restaurants nearby and all the comforts of home and we didn't want to leave. We were welcomed at happy hour with island mojito's and big aloha smiles. Im going back in 6 months:)
Very cute hotel, typical small rooms of Honolulu, but very clean and close to everything. I recommend you do not rent a car as this hotel is near everything and parking was pricey.

We booked this room as a stopover between flights using the the Priceline service (where you pick the area and the price and are booked into a mystery hotel). It was pretty good at GBP45 incl tax for the night. The bed was very comfy and the room pleasant. Boutique in this case seemed to be an old hotel with new matching furniture. The biggest downside was the dial up internet, meaning we couldn't use it for an iphone. The shower was a little damp smelling and covered in limescale, but the room was otherwise clean. We missed breakfast due to our early departure, so can't comment there, but the staff did arrange a good priced airport shuttle for us which we couldn't book form the airport at such short notice.

This hotel was the perfect place for us to stay. The friendly atmosphere capped off what was a fantastic hotel. The staff were amazing, really friendly and personable...they remembered us from day to day and helped us out when we needed it. The rooms were awesome too...the amazing-ness of the beds actually tempted us to give up on the Hawaiian sunshine outside, just because they were so ridiculously comfy!!!! The boutique-y atmosphere was great, and overall it was one of the best hotel experiences I've had!!

We stayed at The Equus and loved it. The front desk staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was very new and clean. We had a king size bed with lots of pillows which was very comfortable. We enjoyed the big flat screen TV and free high speed internet. The continental breakfast had lots of fresh fruit which I was very happy about.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Equus with very helpful staff both prior to my arrival and once I got there (especially Rene). Although there was no wireless internet in the room, the cable link was very good. The location of the hotel is great too as it is nice and close to the Ala Moana Centre for excellent shopping.

The service was great, the front desk staff was very helpful. The lobby has internet access per minute basis. There are 2 pools and tennis courts. We enjoyed the room. We had 1 huge bed in our room which was very comfortable and liked the fact that the room could be blacked out but also had a balcony with nice views. The location is great, few feet from Waikiki beach, Ala Moana mall, and other tourist attractions. Many great restaurants in the area. So much to do within walking distance which is nice. Overall, we enjoyed our stay!

My experience in Honolulu exceeded my expectations!! I thought that i would feel bored for being alone in Honolulu but fortunately, i was wrong!! I had a great experience in Hawaii thank to the hospitality of Equus Management and Staff ! The staff is the best i could have!! Helpful and gentle! This hotel has a great location, close to the best shopping Center, the Ala Moana Center, bus stop, waikiki beach and there are great restaurants nearby! The guest room is very comfortable, clean and safe.There is a Flat TV, very comfortable bed , A/C is very silent ( i coudn´t even know when it was turned on or off!!). There is breakfast and i had the opportunity to have a cocktail made by Ms Rene. Ms Rene is very kind, polite and helpful! Not mentioning the pleasant talk i had with Ms Susan Weander, the Manager of the hotel! For sure i recommend this hotel! Thank you very much for your hospitality, The Equus Hotel!

Having stayed at The Equus several times over the years, I must recommend them for their overall pleasant and effecient staff. The rooms are comfortable, with fridge and Wi-Fi. Rene the manager recently efficiently and proffesionaly recently resolved a billing error through my credit card company. Well done! I'll be back. Aloha and Mahalo! Ted c Pollock

Our recent stay at the Equus Aqua Hotel in Waikiki was very enjoyable. The room rates were affordable, the rooms were clean with amenities such as a flat screen tv and small refrigerator. The hotel personnel, especially Renee and Clarence, were very cordial and accomodating. They served a generous and delicious continental breakfast and offered access to internet services and local daily newspapers.Only drawback was no access from the parking lot to the lobby by elevator and small shower space.

We were leaving on a 7 day cruise the following day and needed somewhere easy to get to the pier. There was a parade on with many floats so hubby and I packed our bags and walked towards the floats. It wasn't our intention to walk the 2-3miles to the pier but because there was entertainment, the Ala Moana Shopping Centre as well as many other shops we just kept walking. After a leisurely stroll we arrived at the pier after many stops at bars, shops etc. It did help that we were only travelling with a wheeled suitcase each. We checked in our luggage, got our boarding passes and spent the rest of the time at a lovely bar in the centre of the mall directly opposite Pier 2 before boarding.

This hotel, with a small, family atmosphere, is a wonderful value for the thrifty traveler. The rooms are clean, with very comfortable beds and plenty of fluffy pillows, the staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly, and the location is very convenient to the convention center, The Bus, the ABC convenience store, and Ala Moana Park.

After reading some negative reviews we were a bit apprehensive but were delighted with the outcome! The room was clean, updated and very comfortable. The location was perfect for our meeting and the nearby ABC store came in handy for purchasing snacks to keep in our in-room refrigerator. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! If you forced me to say anything negative it would be that the coffee packet wasn't always replaced - but, you can get as many as you want from the front desk.

I was pleasantly surprised to find a flat screen TV, quiet and very efficient split a/c, wonderful bedding, coffee maker and refrig/freezer combo in my room. Convenient location at the top of Waikiki, walkable to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Kalakaua Avenue. Complementary juice/coffee and muffin/pastry breakfast buffet is offered every morning from 8-9:00 am. As a bonus, my friends and I also enjoyed the use of the tennis court that is shared between the Aqua Marina and the Equus. I would definitely stay there again. The only negatives were no handicap access to the lobby, no dresser available in room and very loud toilet flush.

We booked this hotel for 1 night through the Aqua website and found it great for the value. It is in Ala Moana, a bit further from Waikiki but much quieter. It is located close to the Hilton Village and there is a good coffee shop Wailana's about 5 min walk away. Make sure to get the macadamia nut pancakes with guava syrup at Wailana!The hotel charges $18 for parking but the clerk told me across the street at the Red Lobster public lot it is only $5 for 10 hours so that was where we parked. You can also look for street parking around the canal but those are hard to get since we checked in late at 10pm.The bed was very comfy and the rooms were clean. It's a convenient location. You can take the bus or a long walk to Waikiki.I'd stay here again next time!

The service was great, the staff very friendly and helpful. Close to Waikiki Beach, Alo Moana Centre. Good shopping at the ABC Store across the street from MacDonnalds. When I firts stayed in Honolulu 37yrs ago it was called the Driftwood, it has been totally remodeled. I will stay here again on my next trip, it will not be 37yrs between trips.The ABC Store sold Australian wine cheaper than I can buy it at home. I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

very surprised..............hotel did not look that promising at first......... Room was amaizing.very cozy, well furnished and fantastic bed. spent much more time relaxing in bed than planned. Since it is a small hotel there was no view, but the room made up for it. only 2 minor negatives. ice machine broken and no wake up call as requested. I would definetly stay tere again.

I booked the Equus when I was to attend a wedding at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, and was so glad I did. It was close to everything The room was big enough, the bed sooo comfortable and the bathroom was nicely tiled and immaculately clean. All this for about 1/3 the price of the Hilton! The staff is genuinely friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Well, the hotel is cheap, which was the primary reason i chose it, also it is off the beaten path. it is a 2 star hotel, rooms are tiny, decor is eeeeh, furniture is old, bathroom is small and also clean, however the bed is comfortable and clean. You get a coffee maker and the fridge in your room. Free WiFi in the room is a myth, well at least in the room 603. Front desk did give me a Clearwire modem, which didnt work, i suspect because they didnt pay the bill, since I tried 6 different modems and non of them worked. There is free WiFi by the pool, its free becasue you steal it from neighboring buildings, its fine by me, however it is strange that they actually advertise internet that you have to steal. If you're into food, the hotel is within walking distance of some great restaurants -- Hazuki, Sasabune, Jinroku, etc.Also, DO NOT PAY FOR PARKING!!!!!! It's $18 a day and you can find free parking by the canal a block or two away!!!! We were here for 6 days, including weekends and were able to find parking any day of the week with no problems.

A place where the staff do wait on guests joyfully. The bed itself is cozy with unforgetable pillows. Equus is well located, close to everything you need to have a wonderful time in waikiki. René is a must. We would definitely stay there again! Marcia & Fernando from Brazil.

My husband and I stayed there. It was absolutely wonderful, Very clean comftorable,Customer service was great. The guest relations was the best ever. It is a beautiful hotel the decor everything. The bed was so comftorable. We would stay again in a heart beat......... We would suggest this property to anyone

I recently had my second experience staying at the Equus Hotel on Waikiki and had confirmed my first impression of this charming hotel. In contrast to the huge, resort-type hotels that characterize Waikiki, the Equus is a small jewel offering personal, friendly service; nicely decorated, clean, and very comfortable rooms; and economical prices. I love this hotel and will make it my regular accommodation whenever I'm in Honolulu, which is often.

Stayed 6 nights recently at the Equus and have to say I was very pleased with this hotel. It is away from the "center" of Waikiki but that was fine with us. I had no problem with traffic noise at night which seem to be on every review for any hotel in/close to the center of Waikiki. The front desk staff was awesome...no request wasn't met. We changed rooms without any problem (A/C concern), were provided beach towels, local information, late check out provided...then extended even later when we couldn't make that. Just a great staff! The bed was extremely comfortable. I slept great! the shower/bathroom was a little small, but not cramped. There is an ABC store at the other end of the block, several restuarants close by(even more if you count the ones in the Ala Moana Mall...not the food court but the restuarants on the higher levels Morton's Steakhouse, Tanaka, etc.) Breakfast can be had at the 24 hr diner 5 -7 mins away (walk) just down the street; eggs/bacon/all you can eat pancakes for about $6.  Overall, a great value if booked early...less than $70 a night. You won't like this if you want to be in the middle of everything. If you're looking to save money and plan on spending time in other parts of the island anyway, this is a good option. Our time was spent on beaches away from Waikiki and we had good access to the highway from here. The Bus system is great for getting into the center of Waikiki if you don't want to look/mess with parking and probably cheaper than the parking would be anyway.

I selected this property based on reviews and price. The nightly rate was under $ 100 and the room was clean and cozy. Bed very comfortable, shower/bathroom small but adequate. A/C worked well enough, although we were unable to turn up the ac past a certain point. The hotel is located on a busy street which is quite noisy until about 10pm. It starts up again around 7am, so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. We were up on the 8th fl and could still hear the traffic. The patio overlooked the apartment building next door and it was way too hot to sit outside anyway, so we never used it. The Ala Moana Shopping center is around the corner, about a 10 min walk, if shopping is of interest. The beach at the Hilton Hawaiian Village is about a 10-15 min walk, although crowded and the water seemed pretty dirty while we were there. Prefer Ala Moana Beach park in the other direction, but a further walk. Waikiki is about a 20 min walk from the hotel, we did it a couple of times to have dinner and then took a taxi back. The hotel pool is tiny, no lounge chairs that we saw. Not especially inviting, but ok for a dip if desired. The continental breakfast is a joke, coffee, juice, the same fruit (melon, pineapple) every morning and some unappetizing rolls, a few pastries, and those didn't look so great either. Wouldn't take much to improve with icewater, some butter and jam and a variation of fruit and fresh rolls/toast.The staff was hospitable and pleasant. We didn't use the parking, but did rent a Hertz car at the Hilton for the day and toured the island. There are other car rental agencies in the area as well that might be worth comparing rates to. Took VIP transfer ($20 rd trip), and that worked out well. www.viptrans.com. Overall, the room was clean and adequate size, the bed comfortable the rate was good. If you're looking for a reasonable, clean place and don't care about frills, ocean views, and don't mind walking into Waikiki, this hotel is fine. We spent most of our time exploring and for a few days it worked for us.

My two girlfriends agreed that the Polo and Hawaiian theme throughout the hotel was interesting and elegant. Our room was comfortable (beds are nice!) and we were so happy that we were just steps from the beach, our favorite restaurants and starbucks were in the same block and the Ala Moana mall was just a short, lovely walk over the bridge on the Ala Wai Canal. We can't wait to come back!

We stayed at this hotel for three nights at the end of July. It was a great little hotel with extremely comfortable beds and nicely renovated rooms. Our room was on the small side, but had a king-size bed and a LCD TV.Pros: -Excellent Price - I paid $75/night-Location is within walking distance (15 minutes) to the beach. About 20 minutes to the major shops and restaurants along Waikiki Beach. -Very comfortable beds (I stay in a hotel 3 nights a week for work and this bed is one of the most comfortable)Cons:-Could be noisy depending on the time of day. We were on the 9th floor out of 10 total and you could easily hear traffic, but it died down later on in the evening.-The breakfast was a joke. I realize it says continental breakfast, but this one was ludacris. They shouldn't even say they offer breakfast. We went down our first morning and there was coffe, orange juice and one dinner roll. We tried the next morning and they had the same plus two pastries a little fruit.-Parking was $18 a day , but that seems about average for the hotels in that area.-Super small shower. You could barely turn around.Overall this was a great hotel for people who are budget conscious, yet still want a clean comfortable room within walking distance to major attractions.They do offer free internet, but I had to borrow a modem (no extra cost) from the front desk.

i was in Hawaii for a business trip, but wanted to have some time to relax and be a tourist.this hotel was right near waikiki and ala moana shopping center, i was able to walk into waikiki as well as catch a bus from ala moana to anywhere my heart desired!this is a VERY charming and quaint hotel, not decorated like a typical hotel.lovely stay. thank you!

This hotel was GREAT! As many of the other reviews have stated the beds were amazing, if only I could have taken it home, and extra pillows not needed the beds are well stocked. The staff was INCREDIBLE! They were very helpful in assisting me with directions to local eatery and sightseeing. They did everything with a smile. I wish I could name every one of the staff members that I met that was friendly but it is just too much as they all were great. From front desk, housekeeping, even the maintenance all offered assistance to me. I was traveling with a very young infant and my significant other and this hotel really made me feel like a part of their OHANA. (family) I was so grateful to find this spectacular hotel on my brief stay at a great price. Complimentary breakfast, Tuesday night management cocktail, flat screen TV and internet; that was more than a simple person like me really needed and was absolutely appreciative.Again I want to thank all the staff for my pleasant stay and my great time.

I recommended this hotel to all my friends because I loved the staff and rooms! The beds were very comfortable and stacked with pillows (felt like a soft cloud), i love the horsey local polo photos on the walls, and the front desk people were so nice! The hotel staff really was so friendly and happy to help, it was a relief from the monotony of the mainland hotels.Rene and Mariah at the front desk and the pillowy beds made my stay wonderful!

It's strange to say it, especially on a trip to such a beautiful island, but the Equus was one of the highlights of my trip to Oahu. The recent rennovations to this hotel have truly turned it into one of the best kept secrets of the Waikiki district. The family run attention to detail and personal touch made me feel right at home and a part of the holiday that can be so often quite stressful was absolutely effortless.

The Equus is a great place for anyone local or visiting. Affordable and located within walking distance from great stores, bars, scenic spots, and restaurants, you're guaranteed a favorable experience.

We stayed at the Equus for just one night as a layover and were pleasantly suprised. The room was nicely decorated , clean, and quite comfortable. My only complaint was that we stayed in a corner room on the 3rd floor and the traffic noise was pretty loud - most of the night. The staff were very helpful with suggestions for dinner and with directions. I would definitely recommend the Equus for anyone staying in Honolulu.

*Front Desk/Reservations Staff, Puka AhSing and Rene Kahumoku, exceptional customer service - "aloha spirit personified"! During these tough economic times, coordinating hotel rooms for approx. 16 staff on a budget, w/a great location, can be tough. Fortunately, we found a diamond-in-the-rough.Very impressed w/cleanliness of the rooms, linens and bathrooms. One of my staff said, "bed was heavenly - so comfortable". Great having mini-frig, coffee maker in room. Also, impressed w/their morning continental breakfast held right in their lobby--great way to meet other hotel guests and enjoy a cup of coffee. Convenient parking and just a 5-minute walk to Ala Moana Center, Waikiki, etc. Again, all staff there were so friendly and professional. We're a local company that has Corp. Accts. w/other hotels in the area, but price-wise, service and after speaking w/Puka and Rene they helped us set up all the arrangements and made booking the rooms with the Equus easy. Response from both Puka and Rene regarding billing, etc. was terrific - - "they are so on it!". Look forward to working w/them in the future.We have another outer-island staff retreat/mtg. scheduled in a few months and will definitely plan on staying there again.

I was looking for a hotel close to Waikiki and found the Equus at the last minute and booked my room for three days just hours before we travelled to Honolulu. What a great find! Clean rooms and the most sumptuous beds with lots and lots of soft pillows. We slept like babies!I can't wait to go back and stay at the Equus. The staff was professional and kind and the manager was fantastic. It is a very clean hotel and on a busline so you can go to the International Market at night in total comfort!

We just came back from Hawaii, where we hope to return in the near future. We stayed for a full week at The Equus. Rooms were spacious, clean, and tastefully decorated. Beds were very comfortable and full of pillows. There is no ocean or mountain view, but the hotel is so well located that we didn't need a view from our room; especially, we didn't need to pay $100 or more to get a view. The whole view is just minutes away from the hotel!We paid extra for parking in a sister hotel next door and got free internet service in our room. We were given a modem to easily connect to our computer and worked without major interruptions, excepting a couple of times when we needed to reset it. The breakfast is basic; a little bit repetitive but for what we paid... we just went a couple of times out for breakfast to eat something different. But our savings in lodging were nicely spent around Oahu in many of the attractions that one can find in this beautiful island. Somebody mentioned about lack of hot water for three days. We were there when it happened, the second boiler did its work for us and only for one afternoon we didn't have hot water. The rest of the time it worked just fine.I think this hotel is a great deal if you like being close to the city. We drove to the mountains and to the north and south shores and it was always very easy to get back to the hotel. We’ll definitely stay there again!
Puka and Renee was so helpful with making my reservation always with a smile, housekeeper was kind and service was a 10. breakfast was good..

The Equus at first seemed to be quite a good value in hotel. We checked in on a Tuesday, which happened to be Mohito night, which they served complimentary from 5-6. That is about where it ended. We have currently been without hot water for the last 3 days, with their short term fix to go to a sister hotel next door (Waikiki Marina) which did indeed have hot water, just not a functioning shower head (the Marina rooms were much less desirable, although they were up in the air higher so it was a better view but the room was much more outdated). The location is located near the ocean, but not a beach. You will need to walk down to the Hilton Hawaiin Village for a beach. If you want to lay next to the VERY small pool, hope you like the shade as I have not seen the sun hit it.The hotel is also extremely noisy. We can hear the traffic from the street better in our room than we could if we stood right on the street. Please imagine the noise all night as this is on a very busy road.The Equus also advertises "In Room High Speed Internet." This is false. When asked, they can provide modems, but currently all were checked out. We have 3 nights left and we are searching for a new hotel so we can check out of this one. If you don't care about going to the beach, having internet access, and hot water, then this would be a good value for you. If you are requiring 1 of the above, look elsehere.

My son and I stayed in Hawaii for 16 days and travelled to 4 islands. We stayed in Honolulu for 4 days at the Equus Hotel. The room was very nice with the best beds and pillows of our entire trip and we stayed at other places that were a great deal more expensive. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great for us being only 2 bloks from the Ala Moana Center(food and transportation). The Equus was the best bargain we had in Hawaii.

Pleasant staff, excellent bed. I was only in the room to sleep as I was attending a conference and sight-seeing. Stay elsewhere and pay double or triple if you're looking for an ocean view or other amenities.

I am an Aqua hotel fan. Having stayed and reviewed Hotel Renew and Coconut, both old Waikiki properties, upgraded and made funky, I had higher than usual expectations for Equus. The hotel was booked by my secretary on order to "book one of those great Aqua properties." The price is cheap: about $82/night, all in, including tax. Unfortunately, Acqua misses with Equus - perhaps one old Waikiki property too horrible to restore. No matter how many granite countertops are installed in the decently renovated rooms, the sound of garbage truck safety beep beep beeping and the crashing sounds of dumpsters at 0800 is too much. The sound was startling from our 7th floor room. Road noise from Ala Moana Drive can be loud at times as well as cars race down the wide thoroughfare through the night. The lobby is very small and can only be reached by climbing a flight of stairs to the 2nd floor - if you can't manage your bags up a flight of stairs, you'll be challenged. The first floor is taken up mostly by the small parking lot and, bizarrely, the hotel towel washing machine. Rooms are clean and efficient. That says a lot.
