Many peer properties are not as clean as the Equus. The bed is comfortable, and a smallish flat screen TV is installed. One small beef: despite placing Japanese language shopping ad flyers in the room, the two Japanese language channels are disabled (We are native Japanese). A little on the cheap side, considering Waikiki is normally awash in Japanese tourists.The hotel has a small pool, a nice amenity considering the price. However, its very small and located in a perpetual shadow between two buildings. Not very inviting. Location is ok, about a 15 minute walk to Beachwalk and 15 minutes to Ala Moana shopping center. An ABC store, McDonalds, and Starbucks is located nearby. A few homeless people are hanging out in the area.Shockingly, the hotel is NOT equipped with wireless internet. The other Acqua properties I have stayed at in the past have had a very robust web of wireless internet for free. Considering the price, I can understand why there may be no internet in the rooms, but lobby would be appreciated. The front desk sent me to the Starkbucks, where I found a weak connection for the cost of a latte. Inconvenient. The hotel is decked out with funky Hawaiian cowboy (paniolo) photos in the hallways and rooms. I give credit for trying to squeeze a little design sense into this tired property. The unexplained Bishop Museum copyright warnings on the title plates are a little weird. There is only one elevator, a little creaky and slow. Waiting time not too bad.One minor rant - we had a hard time pronouncing the hotel name suitably for cab drivers to understand. Eventually they understood after spelling the hotel name out.To sum, the price is cheap, but the hotel is iffy. Hanging a few panilo photos and installing granite counters all over the place does not create a "boutique" hotel. Perhaps I could suggest to Aqua the name of the property be changed to "The Equus - an Aqua BUDGET hotel." That would better meet expectations and accurately describe the property. And then I wouldn't complain. For price sensitive travelers this hotel could be acceptable, with the caveat that street noise will be an issue.

We've already stayed in the heart of Waikiki several times in the past and this time appreciated being so close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The area was still noisy but didn't affect sleeping. The continental breakfast was simple but certainly adequate and food prep staff very friendly, a nice bonus. The room seemed very clean and was attractively furnished. Pool is present but not really usable due to tiny size. Biggest negative was having to pull luggage up a flight of stairs to the entrance. Still a very good value for the reasonable cost.

I've stayed here several times, and would dread having to go back to the huge tourist tourist hotels. Hemingway would feel comfortable here. Nice antique decor, right size building, good personality, starting with the gleaming brass that greets you entering the courtyard. Rather than being modern, this hotel is decorated in the old style, though tastefully redecorated just recently. Comfortable beds (lots of pillows) and antique furniture that I'm suspecting comes from Indonesia or some such place. One modern feature is the quietest air conditioning I've ever encountered. This is a place to express your individuality, rather than checking into the faceless chain hotels. The prices are much lower than chain hotels, so use your savings to take the best room in the house, and still come out ahead. No restaurant, but not needed, since you're surrounded by all Waikiki has.

we stayed for one night and it was the best experience we had. The employees were very helpful and the room were nice. Parking was a little bit complecated but the front desk will help you out on that. Great and affordable hotel!

The hotel staff were fantastic. They new the area and bus system which was very helpful. The rooms were clean and the room phone/internet was free. The continenal breakfast was fruit, juice and buns. A great way to start a day. Mojito night was my hightlight as I met Rene who served the beverage and we had a great discussion about Hawaii. I did find that it was quite noisy from the traffic on Ala Moana Ave as by room was close to the road.

This was my second trip to Oahu and although people tend to think of Honalulu as expensive there are some great options and this is one of them. Having lived in a hotel for a year with work, I like nice hotels and I didn't expect this to be a great hotel but it was and great value for money. I paid for a part city view but upgraged to a King Room on the 9th Floor (907) for $10 a night and it was so worth it. I know other visitors have mentioned the noise, and it is on Ala Moana Blvd, so yes it's noisy but if like me you carry earplugs there's no problems. The room was spacious, nice furniture, lovely comfortable bed, great sized flat screen TV, and a nice bathroom. The nice large fridge allows you to stash whatever you need in terms of drinks and food and there is a microwave at the back of reception if you need it.Breakfast was basic but thats fine, the fruit was lovely and free, so can't beat free. The staff were really friendly and arranged for my hotel pick up which at only $10 is also a bargain.The pool isn't really usable as its down the side of reception but use the lagoon or the beach at the hilton village, the Equus even give you beach towels so you dont need to stuff them into your suitcase.The only thing I didnt like was the balcony outside the room wasnt really usable firstly as there wasnt really view and it was noisy, but there were live in pigeons so it was covered in poo.... but as I only used it to dry a towel it didnt affect my stay.

My husband and I came for our 25th wedding anniversary. The room was smaller than we thought it would be but it was very quaint and homey. It was noisy but not too bad. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. We would recommend anyone to stay there.

My husband and I stayed here for five days in March. We loved the hotel! The rooms were a good size, nice decor, very clean and neat. The hotel is far enough away from Waikiki area that it's not overcrowded on the streets, but close enough that you can walk to Waikiki in 20 mins. Also close to Ala Moana Mall, we save lots of money by walking over there and eating some meals in the food court. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The only negatives were the fact that you had to haul your luggage up a flight of stairs when checking in/checking out, as the lobby was not on ground level. The elevator was also extremely slow, we took the stairs most of the time. The street below was noisy at night, but you are in the heart of Honolulu, so to be expected. Save yourself some money and don't rent a car if you want to get around. The bus system is great or you can walk to many things right in the area. If you are going to rent a car, just know you can haggle with the car rental places for a better deal.

When you arrive at HNL -- the airport has a special flavor.You smell the bountiful flowers and feel the trade winds on your face...... it is Hawaii.So is Hotel Equus and it environs. The open air passageways to all the room overlook the yacht club and have much of the same aromatic and visual flavor as one would expect in old Hawaii. Trade Winds are far superior to A/C and a closed up hallway.We had a super time. it was relaxed as was the staff... supper people...perhaps a touch of retraining... nonetheless they made the stay lovely.The value $$$ for the room was terrific. The owners must have spent serious $$ on the remodel as our rooms were far better than last stay.The nonsense charges email, local calls were all complimentary.Outrigger hit us for 20 cents a minute for our Emails... for what cost them zero.There is no valet parking or fluffy robes...just a relaxed environment and lovely people.Mahalo,One Happy Guest

After traveling professionally for some 20 years and staying in typical large nondescript hotels, it was great to spend some time in a small, boutique hotel, filled with charm. It was like being in Europe, although our room was tremendous--located on an upper floor, filled with equestrian items --and with a wonderful view. The staff was helpful and courteous, and downright pleasant. Breakfast was continental style--bread, muffins, and fruit. Yes, we had to take our luggage from the garage to the first floor elevators, but that too was a different experience...and a fun one too! Overall, we had a terrific time and I would seek this hotel out again.

Great hotel and service. Renee, at the front desk was absolutely kind and helpful!!!This hotel is NOT in Waikiki. It's about a 30-45 walk. The beach is about 3 long blocks away. There are only a few restaurants in the area. But the rooms are great. Traffic is a bit loud. Dont travel in March...it's windy, water is cold and your not guaranteed sunshine.

We don't have a lot of money so we took a chance on Equus. I had done Google map tours of the place and knew we would be in a busy section. But we had a great time! The staff was very kind and bright. The food was limited but good. No meat but we are vegetarians anyway. Rooms were average size with a fridge, wifi and good tv. Location was what pleased us most. Basically between Ala Moana park and the graceful side of Waikiki. The marina and abc store nearby was good. (not abc liquer but abc general store). The walk to the beach was pleasant. I had a 9' surfboard and access was easy. However I would recommend a strap for carrying. Car rental nearby, but reserve day before. Don't forget Ala Moana shopping center just a block away; wow. Ala Moana park is for the locals and it was sweet. We found the beach at Waikiki in front of the HIlton glorious. Hilton is breathtaking in many ways. Outrigger and other seagoing venues are within reach. Charterhouse Restaurnat, Red Lobster are rather expensive but good. Sushi and other fast food places around if you are into that. I think we felt best about our hosts at Equus, I trusted them and they did not fail me.

Pros: inexpensive rate; spacious room clean, simply furnished; friendly staff; good location at edge of Waikiki on bus lines and near Ala Moana shopping centerCons: bring earplugs... constant noise in room from busy Ala Moana Blvd; minimal breakfast of plain rolls, coffee, juices, and sliced non-tropical fruit (no fruit on Sunday).

I have to agree with the review from Washington...this was the worst hotel we had in a month of travel half-way around the world. The location was awful, unless you're in Hawaii to shop at a large mall - we weren't. All the rooms are outdoor access and the hotel is on a very noisy street - felt like we were in London. Sure there's a bus for $2 to Waikiki, but if you wanted to walk about and feel like you were in Hawaii, this was not the location!The pictures on the Web show something entirely different than what we experienced. The exterior picture is that of the neighboring facility. In reality, you could miss this hotel if you weren't looking intently. Getting into the hotel is an issue, up a flight of stairs with your luggage, and the elevator to the rooms is an embarrassment - further the one small elevator is also used by the cleaning and maintenance staff all day long...good luck getting on with two cleaning carts or the carpet cleaning man with his equipment.According to other reviews written, it's like we must have stepped into the only room that wasn't recently renovated. It looked nothing like the pictures posted. The furniture was supposed to look "island" like, but it looked old and stained. The staff was horrendous - we never met any of the friendly staff that others have spoken about. The "pool" was horrible, unless you walked through the parking garage to use the neighboring pool.The "breakfast" was nothing but a dinner roll and juice. We did go down very early one morning and found there was also a limited amount of fresh fruit and pastry. We arrived at the time it was supposed to be open and felt like we were imposing on the woman who was setting it up. She kept sighing and mumbling under her breath!The one good thing was the in-room internet which allowed us to find a new hotel! We moved out.

This was our first visit to Hawaii and we needed a day before a business meeting. We found the spacious room nicely appointed with interesting funiture. The location is the Wakiki Hotel closest to the airport which saved at least a half hour each way with the shuttle in congested traffic. The night and early morning views of the marina were great. The pool area is quite small but why would you go to the pool with the beach a block away? Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. On the negative side there is a lot of street noise if you like to keep the windows open when you sleep. I would definately stay here again.

We stayed here twice during January 2009 and found the rooms to be qutie spacious and comfortable. The 1st time we were given a room on the 5th floor at the rear of the hotel. This room was everything it needed to be, quiet, comfortable, etc. However, the 2nd time we stayed the room was on the 2nd floor at the street end. This room unfortunately was so noisy that we didn't get much sleep the night before our early morning flight. Having said that, the bus stop is very close by, a major shopping centre is a 5 minute walk and we were the 1st drop off from the airport shuttle. There is also a small breakfast offered in the reception area each morning (get in early!). We would definately stay there again but would request a room furtherest from the street.

Enjoyed my stay very much - a nicely appointed room(no view, but who lazes about when there's stuff to do?),clean, recently refurbished. Desk staff very friendly andhelpful. A few small niggles: elevator a tad rickety, and the wireless in the pool area kept cutting out. Also, thelocks on the doors rattled a bit loose, probably not amajor security issue but slightly disquieting, On thewhole, a good buy.

My family and I visited Oahu this summer. We stayed at the Equus for a month. It was fantastic! The room was great.The staff was always helpful and friendly, we became friendsduring our stay. Take the trail ride at the Hawaii Polo Club.The property has a grest pool , tennis court and secure parkingfor a reasonable fee. We can't wait to return to Hawaii and we willdefinitly stay at the Equus Hotel.

I have spent many nights at all kinds of Honolulu/Waikiki hotels and resorts and have yet to find a better location,room or price!The rooms are so "homey" and I love the bed full of pillows. I usually park right under the hotel and can get out of the city fast. I highly recommend this Aqua location- even my 12 year old loved the room and walking across the street to red lobster!!

The staff was extra friendly & the location was great (unless you are a person that doesn't do anything but sit on Waikiki Beach all day). You are 1 block from a great Mall, 5 minute walk to a great local bay & park & a few minute walk to Waikiki Beach. The rooms were plenty big & the decor was very nice. I see a few people whining on here that were expecting the Ritz Carlton... what the heck do you people want? Anyway, great value!! Can't wait to go back!

Rooms nice inside but the noise from the street comes thru even closed doors, could not enjoy the lanai area. Internet is advertised but some rooms are not able to get reception using the Clearwire system. Location is a fair walk away from the touristy Waikiki but close to the Ala Moana Mall, more urban residential.Reception staff were very helpful and professional. Same breakfast of taro rolls, juice, and bananas got old quick.Other Aqua Hotels have been better and I do recommend them.
Staff were very accomodating and very friendly!

Surprisingly above expectations despite some negative reviews. Surely a bit noisy for somebody but not for me who is an urban. It was less noisy then my apartment on at Parc Lafontaine in Montreal. Very helpful and friendly check-in, prompt room maintenance in the morning. I had a Polo King room with a huge King Bed. Continental Breakfast is quite correct with Fresh Fruits, Fresh Juices and Bread. If you are a carnivore McDonald's is one minute away. The beach is 5 minutes walk and Ala Moana Shopping Center at 5 minutes walk too, so, many choice for good food (Assaggio Italian Restaurant, Todai Shusi and Seefod Buffet , Thai food, etc...). Check in and check out have taken less than 5 minutes. Big refrigerator and ABC store is next door, cold beers and snack foods are 1 minutes away. Bathroom and toilet very clean.Fine prints:Small pool but why bother ? the beach is 5 minutes walk away.Only shower, but myself, I took only shower and don't like taking a bath. Bathroom and toilet very clean.

Found cheap airfare from LAX to HNL during Thanksgiving week, and decided to take a quick, last minute, unbudgeted trip to do some diving and relaxing. Searched around for a decent, budget hotel, thought the Equus sounded interesting, and booked on Orbitz.This is NOT a "Boutique Hotel". They claims all types of extra amenities and services that simply do not exist. Yes, the rooms and furnishings have been updated, but it should be compared to a Ramada or Comfort Inn. At the prices charged, you should be able to do MUCH BETTER, or save a few bucks and stay at a budget motel.Examples: There is NO WIFI. The front desk clerk will send you to the pool area, in an attempt to find an open connection (from a neighbor). If unsuccessful, they will send you down the street to Starbucks. All of their promotional materials and even check-in documents claim extras like 24 hour coffee and teas in the lobby - no longer available.The pool is also a joke - situated in a narrow opening between two buildings, so there is no sun - or even furniture to lay down. Hope you don't mind stairs - there is no elevator service from the lobby to the street level / parking - a lawsuit in the waiting (handicap access) - good thing Carlos is there to help with luggage. The only rest room on the main floor is in their "hospitality room" - where the sink is used to prepare breakfast; I went to wash my hands after using the rest room, and there were coffee pot components there.BTW: The pictures shown on the Orbitz web site are of a COMPLETELY DIFFERENT PROPERTY.Upon returning home, we filed a complaint with Orbitz, who did not seem to care. After waiting 2 weeks, we were given a $25 code for use wuthin the next 12 months.Despite what others have claimed, there is a VERY nice beach in walking distance - Ala Moana Regional Park, just across from the mall. The beach is clean, maintained and not crowded, and the swimming area is well protected.

We just came home from two weeks in Oahu. We stayed at the Equus after having it recommended by Expedia at the last minute. We originally had booked in another hotel closer to the beach that refused to accomodate what we paid for with Expedia - so we transferred.The Equus is a quaint smaller hotel of approx. 100 rooms. There is no ocean view but possibly a marina view from some of the higher floors in the front corner room. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful and were able to answer any questions we had.The room was VERY CLEAN and comfortable. We had a queen bed in a canopy made of bamboo which was very cool and just what you would expect for Hawaii. The room had a great refrigerator/freezer combo and granite countertop in both the room and bathroom. No tub but stand up shower made of tumbled granite which was fine for us. The bed was very comfortable and sliding doors lead to a lanai with city views. We also had a terrific flat screen TV in our room on the wall. So much better than other hotels with the old TV nailed to the bureau.The hotel also has free internet right through the TV with a wireless keyboard and mouse right in the room, which is fantastic. A very cool bonus and completely handy. For those who need something printed they have a complete setup in the lobby at .20 cents a min. + .35 print per page, but it is well worth the convenience. We loved being able to check email, check bus routes on thebus.org before we headed out for the day. This is a fabulous perk to staying with the Equus.Additionally, the hotel offers a nice continental breakfast each morning of coffee, orange or guava juice, fruit cocktail, fresh whole fruit and a variety of rolls, muffins, etc. Very nice and great touch.The downsides to staying at this hotel first is the location. While it is very convenient to the Ala Moana Shopping Center and bus routes, the only beach option is to cut across the Hilton Hawaiian Village and use that beach or take the bus down to Waikiki. If you were to walk to the Waikiki beach it would take 20-30 minutes. We did it but were hot by the time we got there. We ultimately used the Hilton beach most days. Also, the street noise is very loud. We did not get a good nights sleep any of the nights because of the noise from the street. There is little the hotel can do for this so take ear plugs unless you are used to city noise. There are no laundry facilities at this hotel, they recommend you walk to the Aqua Condo building behind the hotel and go to their 3rd floor coin operated laundry, however when we did this there were 3 people waiting there for their laundry and were using the 2 working machines. So we hauled our laundry down the street to a laundromat. The elevator in this hotel is handy, however we had serious rain on our trip and it seems the elevator goes out of service in heavy rain. This made it necessary for us to walk up to our room and counting the flight of stairs to the lobby then up to our 7th floor room it was a bit of a pain. This would have presented a major problem for anyone with an infirmity or major handicap.Finally, the pool. The pool is very well maintained but small with a heavy rush of moving water in the middle. I never once saw anyone in it. It is bordered on all sides by buildings and is not inviting. Pretty to look at but not functional, as a matter of fact I didn't notice if it had stairs, however I didn't go close to look.I would recommend the Equus for a clean nice place to stay, but if you are looking to spend every day at the beach with little effort you would be better off paying a bit more to stay closer. If you are on business this is perfect since you are close to the Convention Center, Ala Moana and the free internet in the room.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Equus and the benefits far outweigh the downsides. Compared to the hotel we were initially booked in it was light years better. It is everything a boutique hotel should be.

My husband, our 3-year-old and I have stayed at 3 Aqua properties -- the Waikiki Wave, the Marina and The Equus. Of the three, the Waikiki Wave was the best, but this hotel definitely had its merits. It's located on the northernmost end of Waikiki beach, across the street from the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Even our 3-year-old had no trouble walking along Ala Moana Blvd. to cut through the Hilton Hawaiian Village to get to Waikiki Beach. Ala Moana Beach Park is also within walking distance.Two of the main reasons we chose this hotel were for in-room internet access and parking. For a $65 deposit, the hotel provides a router for reliable high speed internet access at no charge. As for parking, it's true that you have to park in the parking structure of the hotel behind the Equus (the Aqua Marina), but it has a remote controlled security gate and unlimited in and out privileges. (You don't have to wait for your car or tip a valet every time you leave the hotel.)The free continental breakfast isn't worth staying for. Instead, venture down Ala Moana Blvd. to the Wailana Coffee House for a really great breakfast. (It's a favorite among locals and tourists.)When entering the hotel, you do have to walk up one flight of stairs before reaching the elevator, which some may find very inconvenient.The rooms are small, but comfortable and clean. The air conditioning works great and is virtually silent! We did not have a balcony, but some rooms do. Our room had a shower, but no bathtub. In addition to the bathroom sink, there was a bar with a sink, a coffee maker and a small refrigerator. One word of warning -- the two "double" beds in our room were quite small, but that's typical of hotel beds in Hawaii.If you MapQuest directions from the airport to The Equus before you arrive, you'll have no trouble finding the hotel. We would certainly stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel both pre and post a cruise on the Pride of America.Once advantage of its location is that the Equus was the first drop - off with the Airport bus (we used Roberts - $9 each person one way).The Equus is decribed as a boutique. A flight of stairs up from street level. At the top of the stairs is a small lobby area with reception and a lounge area with one computer terminal plus some chairs and lounges. This is where they serve breakfast in the mornings. Yes, as reported here, there is only one elevator and it is a bit slow.Our room was 902. Not much of a view. We don’t think any of the rooms would have much of a view.BUT, the room was comfortable, huge comfy bed, large Philips flat screen TV which also had a computer attached to it with a full keyboard and wireless mouse. However, problems with Internet connection. Also, could not get a connection with our laptop. They were having problems with the system and to mangements credit, they arranged to have one of the rooms at their sister property next door opened up for Internet use.There was a small balcony with a table and two chairs. Large sliding louvre shutters. Which was just as well because of the high rise just across the way!Large bathroom, coffee making facilities, drip style with fresh coffee which we didn’t use.One advantage for shoppers - it's just a short 10 minute walk to the All Moana shopping centre. However, the walk to Waikiki is something else! - at a leisurely stroll, about 1 hour.The bed was as M sez - “fabulous”.Big screen TV had 32 channels. But a lot of news type networks. All with USA news.A lot of sirens during the night but too tried to worry about after flying in from Australia the previous day.The breakie in the lobby was so-so. Breakie consists of two juices (orange but watery - didn’t try the other one). Coffee with whitener (doncha hate that!). Fruit, great bananas. Then some pastries like little croissants, Danish. Just so-so. Noticed some of the guests went down to Starbucks.Summing up the location of The Equus: Fine for the Ala Moana but a little too far away for the Waikii Beach area. We thought about it, and did change the last two nights to another hotel when we returned 5 weeks later on our way back home.

I believe in getting what you pay for. This is a clean budget hotel. The hotel was clean, the rooms were clean and newly renovated. The rooms were cleaned daily and there was a fridge in the room as well as clean showers. Surprisingly the hotel also had a mini pool but on the downside it closes at 7pm. Upon check in we got two free bottles of water which was a nice touch. This hotel is hard to find and it is far from the beach so you can't get to the beach by walking. I was tossing between staying at this hotel or a different AQUA property which seemed to be closer to the beach (few blocks away).However, this hotel offers a free breakfast so the wife decided to stay here. It was the same price as the other AQUA property. So we decided to stay here but the breakfast was definitely not worth it. They just have a few danishes and muffins, some fruits and that's just about it. Oh yes, they also have some free juices. It also gets pretty crowded in the morning so there isn't much room to eat your very basic free breakfast and there are no tables to eat your breakfast on, just some chairs. If you're choosing to stay here for the free breakfast I think you will be dissapointed.I regret choosing this Aqua property over the other one. Because we had no intention to go to Waikiki beach for a swim (we did that when we stayed at another property on another leg of the trip) but instead we planned to go to other parts of the island the location did not bother us too much. Finding the hotel is a challenge and parking the car can also be a challenge as there is very, and I mean very limited parking under the hotel. Instead, you need to park your car next door at Aqua Marine and then walk back to this hotel. The parking charge is $18 per day whether you park next door or in the hotel parking lot. We did try going to Waikiki at night to purchase something and there is nowhere to park for free even though we circled the entire Waikiki 3 or 4 times. Only place to park is at the end of Waikiki near the Zoo. We had no issues at all staying at this hotel but because of its location I think next time we would go for another hotel closer to Waikiki but would definitely stay here if we had no choice as this was a very clean hotel.

This is the second time my husband and I stay at the Equus.The Equus is not only affordable but clean , cozy and close to all Bus routes. The staff was very friendly and informative. Loved being close to the Mall and beach. Look forward to visiting again My morning walks around Alai Wai were a great wake up.Mahalo to the Equus staff, look forward to seeing all of you again.

Small hotel near the Ala Moana marina and shopping centre. The inside of the hotel has been recently renovated and is very tasteful. The beds are very comfortable and have more pillows than even I can use! Previous comments have been made about the road noise, which is noticeable, but I'm not sure what else to expect on a busy road in a major city. There are 2 beaches nearby (10-15min walk), Dukes opposite the Hilton and the lovely Ala Moana beach park on the other side of the Marina. All the staff were very friendly, especially Rene, and if you're there on a Tuesday there's a nice touch of a drinks reception where management and guests mingle. Mike, the manager really does seem to be looking for honest opinions and comments for his hotel.

I was returning from a 6-month Navy deployment, and my Wife and I wanted some alone time together away from the kids for a few days. We got it! We researched the Equus online and liked what we had seen, initially. After easily booking the hotel thru the Aqua Resorts website, we did more online research. The comments we found were NOT very good. Alot of highly negative comments. Alot of complaining about the location. Alot of dissatisfaction with the the facilities. Alot of whining about parking. Alot of moaning and groaning about no food in the area. We almost cancelled the entire reservation due to all of these negative reviews. However, once we got there we found the complaints were 100% wrong. This hotel is great! We had room 1008, a Polo Executive Suite and it was exactly like the website picture depicted. The room was on the 10th floor, at the end of the hall, completely away from the street. Little to no street noise was heard. It didn't have a balcony, but we didn't need one. The view was great, the King bed was comfortable, and the internet was fast. No wireless, but Paulo at the desk lent me a cable to direct connect it to my laptop. The shower is a 1-person one, but that's all we needed. Our only 2 issues with the entire stay was that the deadbolt on our door jammed, but was promptly fixed. And the right railing on the stairs leading to the lobby was loose. Otherwise this hotel was more than great. I guess alot of other reviews were prior to and during the remodeling, but our stay was nothing like those. There's an Outback steakhouse, Red Lobster, McDonalds, Starbucks, a British pub, and an ABS Convenience store within a block. This place is well worth the money. The staff were PLEASANT and HELPFUL! ;) IF you are planning on a 'visit', the front desk staff is wonderful! Renee, Paulo and Puka were friendly and accommodating! We would DEFINITELY stay again!

I'm a huge fan of Aqua Resorts (boutique series) hotel in Oahu. My usual stay is at the Aqua Palms and Spa. They seemed to be relatively full during my trips, thus tried the Equus hotel because it's still in the category of their "boutique" line. My first stay there was very impressive. Don't let the exterior fool you. The company invested a lot of money to renovate the hotel. The interior was well designed, moderately contemporary with what they were challenged with. I am in love with the comfort of the bed! THE BED IS WONDERFUL!Anyway, since then, I've stayed at the Equus about five times, just on November 21, as a matter of fact. Unfortunately, each stay encountered some problems... I'll explain my most recent trip. 1. During my online reservation, I requested that there be extra bath towels. No extras were left. I needed to request from housekeeping.2. Upon check-in, person said that he'll "upgrade" me to a king bed (I booked two doubles). It didn't matter to me, I was by myself. Not sure if it's considered an upgrade, my opinion, no.3. Entering the room, it seemed half done. Everything seems to be ok, however the extra pillows that are usually propped up nicely, were just thrown on the bed. Not sure if housekeeping forgot to finish... I also walked on a wrapper that stuck to my shoes. - Strike 1.Reported room to front desk. Didn't seem to have believed me. Not sure why I'd lie. He assigned me another room.4. This room didn't have extra towels (item #1), shampoo was missing, although hair conditioner and lotion was there. - Strike 2.5. When walking to the shower (carpet to ceramic tile), I almost slipped because either the carpet was a little damp or the tiles were damp enough to have made me lose my footing. 7. When I was ready to sleep, I noticed an unusual smell, something like detergent or possibly carpet shampoo. That smell seemed to get stronger as the hours passed. I needed to open the patio door to vent the smell. Strike 3.I reported it to both houskeeping and front desk, but fell on deaf ears.My experience with the Aqua Resorts are good - overall. What bugs me the most? DO THEY READ THE COMMENT CARDS? I've always left comments, yes, good and constructive criticism type, but never got an e-mail back... Good luck folks, I'll start to go back to my original favorite, Aqua Palms and Spa...

I have stayed with The Equus before, and it seems that it just keeps getting better and better. Every time I return, they have improved and continue to impress. The amazing aloha spirit of the friendly staff adds such a personal feel to the stay. It is an incredibly unique hotel, which goes out of its way to make you feel individually looked after. Besides this, the rooms are beautiful and the location is unbeatable. The beds are also to die for!!! Best sleep I have ever had! All in all, I will continue to recommend the Equus to everyone, and certainly always look forward to staying there!

I was very satisfied with my stay at the Equus. I got a super great deal on Travelocity and came expecting a really budget hotel. Luckily this hotel worked out great for me. It was so close to the convention center, the mall and Ala Moana park which was awesome to jog around. The king sized bed was comfortable and the flat screen tv was nice. The bathroom size was a little annoying for me being a girl that likes to spread out. Way too small to blow dry your hair without melting but luckily there were mirrors and outlets convenient for drying your hair in the main room. Also the shower is teeny tiny and trying to shave my legs in there was comical. A tub would have been really nice to have, but again I can't complain considering what I paid. The room is probably best for no more than 1-2 people. (Probably not big enough for 2 girls considering the bathroom situation).The staff was really friendly. The pool was kinda unusable except for maybe a quick dip as it was always in the shade and pretty small. I noticed they kept a loud jet on in the pool at all times that I could hear from inside my room. I think they used it to cover some of the street noise which was considerable. There was all sorts of construction going on and busses and delivery trucks going by. I just shut my sliding doors at night. The only other thing that the room was dark as you couldn't keep the sliding shutters open without everyone in the apartments directly across the way being able to see in. Oh well.The fresh fruit and juice in the tiny lobby in the morning was nice as well.

Hotel EQUUSLocation: Waikiki Honolulu, HawaiiThis letter is a rare visit to a web site ---- my second ever review Why ... I was impressed.Hotel Equus is not a five star hotel.... albeit there many touches, which emulmate a five star atmosphere. There front desk area is clean and not filled with promotional propaganda...the front desk has zero items on the counter....A touch of class you usually see in really expensive hotels..... someone clearly cares about the details which make a place special.They have achieved a lovely boutique property look with rooms; which are fresh and have a Ralph Lauren look.Not sure they have handicap access...they do have a rare tennis court in Waikiki...no valet parking. No restaurants exceot for breakfast service A little hidden away....but worth findingSome number of years ago, the travel industry called good and bad customer letters "orchid" and "onion" letters. Well, this is an orchid letter. It is one of the rare, favorable commentaries on hotel service in the world today. For some time, have believed that old-fashioned hard work and professionalism as well as the standards and criteria that make Hotel Industry great have long since either disappeared or perhaps gone overseas to the Far East. Clearly this is not the case with HOTEL EQUUS Honolulu, Hawaii. and their get things done attitude. The staff is well trained and of whom all a hotel industry people should use for an example. Super clean, organized, a nice breakfast . A warm friendly place with a very motivated staff.Hotels today, rarely has professionals, and now we have an outstanding individuals of whom to be proud!Please tell Rene' at front desk was very competent. A classic Hawaiian beauty tooIt is always a pleasure in any walk of life or endeavor to see professionalism demonstrated. Even our maid was competent...a clean and room with a super attitude.Please accept my heartfelt gratitude for this superb service. Please pass the word to other properties too.Once again Mr. Michael Dailey thank you for making this hotel special. Awesome property…. make our trip to Ireland special…staff made us feel right at home. Aloha nui loa from Patrick BrentChairman BF&C and a hotelier of many years, who knows quality 10 November 2008

Right, this hotel is not in the middle of Waikiki beach, but it's just a 5 minutes walk to get to the Hilton side of the beach on your left. On your right, you're just 3 minutes walk to the Ala moana Park. If you want to be right in the middle of everything, maybe this place is not for you. But if you don't mind that, it's a great little place to stay for a few days at a very reasonable price.The room and bed we had was comfortable, many pillows, a balcony, spotless. Continental breakfast is included and good. Staff are friendly and helpful. Yes, the elevetor is so so, but as we were at the second floor, it didn't matter, we took the stairs.Next time I go to Hawaii, I'll stay there for sure.

My husband and I were taking a 6 day vacation/visiting friends, because we were staying such a long time we did not want to spent over $100 per night. We purchased the buy 5 night get 1 night free for $80/night.I can say for the price that we were paying we were satisfy with our stay. The shower was very (I mean very) small. There was not much room between the end of the bed and the TV, even though they said WIFI, but it was restricted to area in front of the TV and the bathroom.It was about a 15 - 20 min walk to the main section of Waikiki. If you have visited Las Vegas, think of the location like Sahara, still on the strip, but towards the end. There is a lot of noise as others had mentioned because of the road constructions, you learn to block it out.I would hesitate recommending the hotel to others unless you are on a budget and are not planning on staying in the room much.

From the very first contact at the desk , we had a very nice experince. The Staff was excellant and very helpful. One of the manager's came to our room with the model for the internet and stayed until it was connected (which was very easy) and we were online. It was walking distant from the convention center. We had read previous reviews abount the slow elevators but I have waited as long or longer in some of the bigger hotels. The staff came to our car and unloaded our luggage and carriied them to our room. We intend to stay there again next year and incurage our other attendee from San Diego to do so.

In Honolulu on business with a team of engineers and scientists. The rooms were cozy and comfortable but lacked a desk. The Equus provided wireless modems for internet access at no charge, but the number was limited and subject to first come/first serve availability. Although the hotel is not perfect for the business traveler, the staff at the Equus were extremely courteous and helpful. They made every effort to meet our needs for meeting space and printer accessibility. Fantastic location for the business traveler: near many county and state offices; walking distance to a wide variety of restaurants; and walking distance to numerous retailers and the Ala Moana Mall. There is no elevator access to street level which could pose a problem for travelers with multiple and/or larger bags. Parking is available but there is an additional fee.
My stay was beyond comfortable! It was very pleasant! The staff was extremely warm and friendly and I would definitely stay here again! I highly recommend The EQUUS.

Good location, within walking distance to Ala Moana Centre (for shopping and dining) and lagoon/beach. Bus stop nearby to Chinatown (more dining) and Pearl Harbor. Large and clean room with two double comfortable beds. Free internet (with own laptop) and free in-room safe. Friendly and helpful front desk.No privacy from windows so kept shutter closed at all times. Only one elevator and housekeeping tended to hold it for a long time. Stairs to front lobby from street level poses problems with carrying heavy luggage.

After many visits to Oahu, and numerous bland stays at the large resorts, I decided to take a friend's suggestion and try this delightful renovated boutique hotel, THE EQUUS. Wondering what a hotel with a Latin name was doing in the tropics, I walked along Ala Moana Blvd. and came upon this charming property with its brass stairway and intimate design. The lobby is open-air and very smart...the front desk staff were professional and personable. I took a room on the 8th floor that featured Hawaiian style bamboo bed and furnishings, Everything was clean and first-rate, and the bathrooms featured new marble and tile.The location of the hotel is perfect for us business travellers, as it is a block away from Ala Moana Center, and the convention center. Sure beats having to rent a car...Although there is no hotel restaurant, there is the Hawaii Prince Hotel and their fine dining right across the street, and our very favorite Honolulu restaurant , CHART HOUSE at the Ala WaiHarbor also across the street. Ala Moana Center andd Ward Centers offer dozens of great places to eat, as well as those located around Waikiki. Laundry facilities, tennis, and a jacuzzi are right next door at the Waikiki Marina, another hotel operated by the Aqua group.My room featured an entertainment system called INN NE TWORK which was teriffic! 32" flat screen TV doubled as monitor for Dell computer, and gave me movies, radio, and the internet.I would recommend The Equus for anybody visitng Oahu who wanted to be near, but not ON the beach. The west end of Waikiki Beach is only 2 blocks away, and offers the best swimming and beaching in the area.I found out that The Equus is a family owned business, and I am sure that this is part of the reason the place is run so well.I will be back

I have stayed in this property more than a dozen times. It's within walking distance to Ala Moana Shopping Center and Kalakaua Ave in Waikiki. The rooms closest to Ala Moana Blvd can be noisy though closing the sliding glass doors keeps much of the noise out. The hotel rooms were renovated over the past two years and are really lovely to stay in - large comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, in-room fridge. The best part of the hotel is the really great staff who go out of their way to take care of everything you ask them. A continental breakfast and complimentary newspaper available in the lobby each morning is a real bonus. if you keep in mind that this is a boutique hotel, you will be very happy with your stay here especially given their extremely reasonable rates. Across the street from Ala Moana Beach Park with gorgeous beaches, restaurants and shopping very close at hand and the YMCA for those who like to get some exercise in. I will continue to stay here into the future.

I stayed at the Equus for a week, and I loved it. I read previous reviews before I booked the hotel. The one concern in all reviews was noise so when i booked my room I asked for a room away from the road. I couldnt hear a thing. So that was good. The room service was great. The staff even better. They were always helpful with advice on how to get around on island and the best times to see some of the popular attractions. The conntinental breakfast was okay it had a couple different pastrys and breakfast sandwiches. It could have been better. But overall it was good. The hotel even offered to hold my bags due to late night flight with no charge. That was great. I always recomend this hotel to family and friends heading to Hawaii.

I stayed at the Equus for two nights in the Polo City View King room and I wasn't disappointed at all. There was a flat screen TV with HD inputs as well as a wireless modem that was given to me for effortless internet access. The room looks just like the photos say (small but functional), but the "city view" is nothing more than looking at the balconies of a neighboring hotel. No problem there because a hotel room is meant only for sleeping anyway. The building does seem old, but the room I was in felt updated and had no issues as far as peeling paint/bad odors. The bathroom was small but once again, felt recently updated. The lanai could've gotten a quick wipe down of the table out there/sweep up during the maid service, but other than that the room was spotless. The room I stayed in had no microwave and there was only one ice maker in the property, in a vending area behind the check in desk. There was a microwave there as well which leads me to believe that this is a common microwave/ice maker for the entire hotel. The location was perfect for me, about 2 blocks away from Ala Moana mall, Ala Wai park/beach, and there is an ABC store on the corner for quick snacks, drinks, etc. I felt somewhat at ease walking around the area at night because of other tourists on the street (Ala Moana Blvd.) and this hotel is within walking distance of all the shopping and restaurants of Waikiki. The weekend I was there was pretty quiet, but noise from the boulevard below can and does get into the room easily, probably due to the fact that the only thing between you and outside is a big glass door (for the lanai). If you're a really light sleeper, I'd recommend ear plugs. Overall, I would recommend this property for single travelers or a husband and wife due to the size of the King room. I would definitely come back here, given the ridiculously low price I paid (less than $150) for two nights.

I'm a Honolulu resident that wanted to take a weekend in Waikiki, so I thought I'd try the Equus. I booked the Polo Executive Suite, it's very comfortable. If you're on a budget this hotel is perfect for you. Bus stops are a block away, eateries are close by and numerous, and the staff is extremely helpful. There are some drawbacks - if you're planning on using a rental car, parking is limited and quite expensive. The hotel is a bit noisy because the hotel is adjacent to Ala Moana Blvd. which is a very busy street. Overall I would rate Equus a solid 8 for mainland visitors on a budget.

Looks good from the outside... inside is a little rundown..no elevator from the street up to the lobby..so carrying lugguage was a bit of a pain..we were there when they were doing roadworks..so was real noisy with road surfacing..even on nights when they werent ripping up the street there was a lot of car sounds...but you do get use to it. Great ac..renovated bathroom was nice...bed was not the most comfortable. Lobby staff were very helpful and friendly, cleaning crew didn't seem to understand english very well.Close to restaurants and a bus to main shopping centre. I would stay there again if I was wanting cheap accomodation.Breakfast wasnt very interesting or worth going down stairs for.But as I said I would stay there again.

We found the Aqua Equus on this website and were ultimately pleased with our choice. We were looking for a smaller property and weren't concerned about beachfront so we opted for the Equus. We were very pleased with it's location since it was only a few blocks from the beach and a 20 minute walk to the Ala Moana shopping center and directly on a major bus route. When we arrived we were somewhat skeptical when we saw the front entrance of the hotel from Ala Moana Boulevard. It's entrance is small and, if you aren't paying attention, you will drive right by. It looks more like the entrance to an apartment than that of a hotel. The lobby is dated but tidy, open to the outside and has a small sitting area adjacent (where you can get a coffee and pastry breakfast each morning). Our room with king bed was on the 9th floor and was clean and relatively quiet even though the busy (all day and much of the night) Ala Moana Blvd runs right in front of the hotel. The elevator could use a major overhaul. It (there is only one) was old and slow as molasses. Use the stairs if you need to get up or down in a hurry. We stayed for 3 nights and were quite happy with the room, the staff and the location. If you are looking for a place that's comfortable and reasonable, then try the Equus. By the way, there wasn't a hair dryer in the room, but the front desk will lend you one if you ask.

Had a wonderful week at the Equus Boutique hotel on our honeymoon. Room had many amenities including flat screen monitor for movies and high-speed internet access--which worked without a hitch. Best bed we've ever slept in too.Service was above average and we were surprised to get a knock on the door by a maid delivering a wonderful basket of local fruits and champagne. Continental breakfast started a little late for our tastes but compared to most continental breakfasts served, this one was pretty respectable. Cannot say enough about Rene the manager and Pacu the assistant manager, who were gracious from the moment we arrrived.We give this (4) thumbs-up!

To say that this property is full of surprises, both good and bad, is an understatement. I must admit that for what I paid for the room each night, I got what I paid for. Firstly, the rooms displayed on the Equus' website are not what I got. A few pictures of polo players and horses does not make it Ralph Lauren inspired. The furniture was outdated and some needed repair. A corner chip on the right side night stand snagged a pair of trousers I was wearing. The bed was king-sized and clean. The door leading to the lanai was difficult to open; I had to use some force to open and close it. The bathroom, although small, was clean but I did encounter a few "crawling creatures" during my stay. The shower stall left very little room for movement and I couldn't adjust the showerhead to adequately allow water to fall upon me. There is one small elevator at the site and it takes an extremely long time to rise. Most of the time I took the stairs instead of waiting for the elevator. For those of us without a laptop, there is computer access in the lobby however, it will cost you .15 cents per minute (pre-paid with cash or credit card). The free continental breakfast consists of tasty muffins and pastries, fruits, juices and coffee. To compensate take a walk a block from the hotel to the ABC Store where you can find reasonably priced food items, souvenirs, and a variety of drinks and spirits. The staff at the Equus is quite friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect for my needs. Everything could be found within a 2 to 3 block range. Although it rained everyday during my stay, I still ventured down the street to Ala Moana Park and to the Ala Moana Marketplace. This was my first visit to Hawaii and would I stay at the Equus again? Yes, but I don't believe it would be my first choice.

We booked this hotel for a 1 night stay during our stopover on Oahu. We needed a place to stay in Honolulu/Waikiki area and didn't want to pay a ton because we were literally only going to sleep there. We didn't need massive amounts of amenities, just a safe, clean and comfortable place to stay. The Equus was a perfect fit for us. It had a reasonable rate, was easy to find, parking was $18 in a secured garaged parking lot, the check in process was quick, the elevator was slow (but not rickety as some previous reviewers have suggested) and our room on the 6th floor was very nice. I guess we were high up enough as the noise did not bother us and we even could see a portion of the ocean off in the distance. The room seemed small (probably because the bed was so large - it was a king) but clean, the bathroom fixtures were all new, there was a fridge, coffee maker and a flat screen tv. It was about a 15 minute walk through Fort Derussy to the heart of Waikiki beach. We walked over to get some dinner and felt the walk was easy and safe. We did not stick around for the continental breakfast in the morning because we had to catch a flight so I cannot comment on it. Overall we were very pleased with the Equus and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a short stay, no frills hotel in the Waikiki area.

If you want a four star hotel, pay the going four star price. If not stay here. Total refurbishment since my last stay very nice. Yes the trim on the elevator needs attention, but I believe the mechanicals had been totally rebuilt recently, prior visit it was clean but decidely run down . Now very clean room, quality linens new furniture and rebuilt baths, all tastefully done. This is a smaller hotel with ltd services, but location is ideal, five minutes from the beach and ten from Ala Moana Centre. The road noise is there, but in all fairness to the hotel there was a repaving project going on during the last week in Sep. The noise did subside after midnight. I suspect many other Waikiki hotels are equally noisy. If you want total quiet go stay at a resort out of town, Waikiki is in the middle of Honolulu folks. I paid 1/3 the going rate of a room at the Hilton Hawaiin village and pocketed the difference, as all I wanted was a clean bed. ABC store just up the steet (a Hawaiian 711) and Outback and Red Lobster are right across the street. Many other restaurants and bars in local area. Breakfast was continental, coffee, fruit and pastries, if you want more, stay elsewhere or pay for a full hot breakfast, it was not a big deal with me as I do not eat much breakfast as a rule. Very cooperative front desk staff unlike prior stay so that is a big improvement as well. An internet connection would have been appreciated, a computer is in the lobby but too pricey to use very long.

Our room was very clean with updated bathroom facilities. We only noted a few rare ants. Our biggest complaint was the significant road noise. The road noise from the busy street was relentless. It felt like I set up a tent on the curb. If you book this hotel, bring earplugs!

I went to Honolulu for 2 weeks on a business trip in May. I wanted to find a reasonably-priced hotel for myself and a coworker in Honolulu, near the beach. I found the Aqua website, and chose the Equus to work best for us, after considering price, location, amenities, and appearance.  We had booked a special online price, and got a great rate ($100 average per night). We checked in late on a Saturday night. We were given our keys quickly, and given directions to park in another Aqua hotel next door. The lobby area was modest, and small, but nice-looking.  My room was on the 8th floor (9 floors total), and I had a king room with private lanai. The room was on the smaller side, but had a very comfortable bed with great linens, a large flat screen tv, rustic wood furniture (I'd love to have it in my house!), and it was decorated in a paniolo (Hawaiian cowboy) theme. My room had a microwave and refrigerator. It would be perfect for 1-2 people, but not more than 2 people.  The bathroom was good sized, with a tile shower, granite counter, and awesome-smelling shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and soap, which were replenished every day.  Every morning, my coworker and I ate breakfast, and the clerk at the front desk was very accomodating to us...we left the hotel before breakfast was served, but I was allowed to collect a bag of pastries and fresh fruit each morning.  The hotel was about a 5 minute walk (maybe 3-4 blocks) from the beach, which I considered reasonable. There was a pool in the hotel, but I didn't use it, and didn't see it in use the whole 2 weeks I was there, but it looked clean.  The hotel doesn't have extras like a restaurant, exercise room, or spa, but everything I could have needed was within a reasonable walk. It was within walking distance to many restaurants and the Ala Moana shopping center.  The only negative thing I can think of about this hotel is that because it is an "open air hotel," meaning the entrances to the doors are on the outside of the hotel, there is a railing over a wall outside the room entrance doors. This wall was a little too low for my comfort (I'm 5'6")....and it was a long way down. Families with children might be nervous around this wall, but it also may not be a problem for most people. The hotel is also on Ala Moana drive, a busy street, and the street noise can be heard through the lanai doors, but after the first night, I got used to it, and actually enjoyed the noise.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and I'd also like to try some of the other Aqua hotels.

This hotel was booked for me as a last minute booking due to mis-communications with an original booking at a different hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful even when I had originally booked two nights but only needed one. The room was great with a newly remodeled bathroom. The view wasn't too great, but I was more interested in sleeping than anything else. I had friends staying at the Westin Moana Surfrider and the walk to their hotel was very pleasant, only took about 15 minutes, and I was in the center of Waikiki beach. I would stay there again when passing through Waikiki.

Its been said before but I didnt think a hotel could really be that noisy! I stayed in 3 different rooms and all were noisy. Outside road noise and continous slamming of door noise in the morning (must be the maids and people going for bkft). Beds are soft and only fullsize. The hotel rooms are nice and the air cond is quiet. Breakfast was only juice and coffee, no decaf, muffins and if youre lucky they bring out a fruit plate. Usually there were apples or bananas avl. You are a few miles to the heart of Waikiki, however you are within walking distance to a big mall. Pay for internet is avl in the lobby. There is no beach within walking distance. Tiny pool. Microwave avl outside the lobby.

We stayed at the Equus because our son had to have surgery at Kapiolani. We stayed for 10 days so we needed someplace under $100. At $90 a night, we were surprised to see how nice the entry and decor was (although after climbing the 10 or 12 steps to get up to the lobby numerous times a day we were a little annoyed) and enjoyed how clean the room was. But the parking was HORRIBLE. If you have children do NOT stay here. You have to go down the elevator, down the flight of stairs that they have no elevator for, walk around the corner, through a parking lot, take another elevator into the parking garage, and THEN you can load all your stuff into your car. It seriously took us 20 minutes to leave or return each time. Then each night, at exactly 3:20, the air conditioner beeped about 7 or 8 times. Each time I reported it to the front desk, they said they would "check on it". Everytime I asked about whether or not it had been fixed, they said they didn't know. Hmmm...If you can't keep track of what's fixed and what hasn't been fixed, what is the point of customers asking for something to be fixed? Just a waste of time. My 18 month old son woke up everytime it beeped and screamed for a few minutes. THEN...to top it off, I walked in while the cleaning people were there, just to grab something. The woman was wiping our cups out with a white washcloth! (I take it that it was one of ours, since I doubt that most cleaning companies use white hotel towels to clean rooms). After watching numerous dateline nbc-type specials on how hotels don't actually wash your cups anymore, I had told my husband not to use them. He thought I was just being paranoid. Hmmmm... After they left, I smelled both wine glasses (one we had eaten ice cream out of and the other we hadn't used.) One glass smelled faintly sweet with a slightly chemical odor, and the other smelled like nothing. The internet also didn't work (which was a huge disappointment since my husband needed to work from the hotel while we were gone for the surgery) and the parking was almost $20 a night (which made our $90 hotel room not so cheap after all). Basically, if you like climbing stairs, don't have young children or much luggage, and don't mind dirty glasses or not getting a straight answer about simple questions like when the internet is going to be working (we basically got the response of..."It's not working" to our question of "When will the internet be working?"), then it's worth staying here. After all, if you'll be at the beach all day, you may not notice these things when you come back. So for that, it is worth the price. But $17 parking when you could valet park at another hotel for $20? I would definitely pay more to stay in a hotel that has more amenities than save a few bucks and get a headache in return.

We checked into Equus after a 5 night stay at Aqua Bamboo, wish we had stayed at Bamboo.Rooms were nice BUT....Strong mildew smell in the shower, this was our third hotel for this stay, two others (Aqua Bamboo and ResortQuest Circle) did not have this problem.No one knew where to obtain towels....folks downstairs said the front desk, the front desk said try downstairs at the laundry. As a matter of fact, we obtained two towels from downstairs before we even checked in...didn't even ask for a room key!NO weather stripping on door (rm 606); Curtains are actually shutter doors which look nice but let in light; preferred light blocking curtains at Bamboo.Staff was NOT at all welcoming and/or friendly. When we checked into Bamboo we asked if we could check in early, she checked and told us yes, our room was ready. Equus, check in is at 3pm, didn't even bother to check. Same thing w/checkout - Bamboo allowed a courtesy 1 hr late checkout. Same person at Equus told us no late check outs allowed. I totally understand if a hotel cannot accommodate due to booking levels, however, she didn't even bother to check to see if the room was ready.Ran into housekeeping standing between our door and the room next door. Did not even offer to move themselves or the cart out of the way, didn't say good morning, nothing.......I travel often and am ALWAYS asked how my stay was. Guess they don't care at Equus.Both hotels on Aqua's website are rated as three stars; however, customer service was a world apart. Compared to the other two hotels we stayed at, this one was very disappointing.On a positive note, the toliet paper at Equus was better than Bamboo.....

I've been staying at the Equus Polo regularly for 2 years. I was there during their renovations. It's a great, small hotel to stay in. Staff are fantastic and Renee will do anything to make your stay pleasurable. I love the fact it is small and personalised. And the happy hours!! The renovations are are fabulous and add a real atmosphere to the hotel. Although it is in the Aqua chain - don't overlook it. It's one of the better places to stay in Honolulu.

I travel to Oahu for business 4-7 times a year and this is the ONLY hotel I stay at. Since I don't require all of the 'action' of Waikiki, I am fine with staying far from it. Even if you are there on holiday, you are a short trip to all of it.The staff at the hotel is great. Everyone is extremely helpful. In particular, I've gotten to know Puka who works the morning and afternoon shift. This guy is a real gem - he is so helpful and kind whenever I stay at the hotel. Last month, their Internet crashed. These folks did everything they could to make sure internet was available for any guest at the Marina next door. The rooms are outstanding. A/C, Internet, bathrooms and showers are super. And they did a great job when they upgraded their beds. You cannot beat it for the price and location in my book.Yes, there are a few negatives. The elevator is really slow - my advice - don't sweat it - you are in Hawaii! Don't think you'll get a meal with the breakfast, if you need something substantial, go down the street to ABC, McDonald's or Starbucks. And there is no pool...it's not big enough to stick your big toe in it. Pakring is next door at the Marina as they have a small 10 space lot.To me, these 'negatives' are really insignficant when you get a great room with a great staff who really works at making your stay enjoyable. If you need all of the glitz with a big hotel, don't stay here. But, if you just need a place to sleep and be in a central location, the Equus is it.I won't consider staying at any other hotel when I am in Oahu. Thanks to Puka and the entire staff for making the Equus such a great place to stay.

This was one of the worst places I have EVER stayed. There is NO iron or ironing board. There is NO hair dryer. The internet was DOWN and the electricity was out for about 6-8 hours. My room phone did not work. There are only about 10 channels on the TV. It is VERY loud there. I had booked 7 nights but left after 2 because it was so crappy. They charged my card $300 over what the 7 nights would be and NEVER told me and it is NOT on any paperwork that they give you. I told the clerk that we were not happy and she said, "well, you owe me this much.". They should not have charged us for the 2nd night. It was hot and miserable....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
user_name:
aviatorswife
Wherever the Navy sends us!

review_body: Just returned from a very enjoyable trip to Hawaii. In Waikiki we stayed at the Equus and really liked it. First all the good things about it,the size, small and friendly,updated room very nicely done,the location is a bit out of the thick of things but in an area I like. We had an ABC store on the corner and a bus stop 1 block away.The room we had wasn't big (but not too small either)nor was the nicely tiled shower or bathroom. Almost the only complaint I had was that the sound proofing wasn't good. We weren't bothered at night but during the day the hotel was noisy.The lobby is very cosy and is used for the free continental breakfast, and provides a wonderful place for guests to mingle.I will include some pictures.

Not knowing much about Waikikii, we booked the hotel as it was close to the Ala Moana Shopping Center. 5min walk.The room was clean, plus there was enough room for two weeks worth of shopping and bags. Coffee was provided, and a small mini fridge.We booked a room with two double beds, and it was the most comfortable sleep I had in Honolulu.We were in Waikikii to shop and sightseeing, so the hotel was afforable and all we wanted was a good nights sleep. The only problem was you had to carry your bags up a few steps, but the staff were more than happy to assist.The young lady , Athena, was always friendly and had a welcoming smile. Fantastic after a hectic days shopping.I recommend the hotel for a good nights sleep. But if you are after Resort style, lie by the pool holiday., cocktail bar service. Not here.We were happy with what we paid for, and that was a comfortable clean, welcoming, cosie style hotel and we got it.Very happy.Helena

I was pleasantly surprised that I could find a nicely appointed hotel near the beach in Waikiki for $100 a night! All the rooms had been renovated with granite and tile bathrooms (although I had no tub so inquire if you need one), flat screen TV, patio with furniture, internet access (some rooms have it included as part of the flat screen tv! How fun!), SS fridge/freezer, and a coffee maker. It has the feel of an adolescent timeshare condo with more than the usual hotel room. The only possible negative observation worth stating is that if you are claustrophobic or tend toward XXL sizes, you may want to also inquire about larger rooms since the bathrooms, showers and general room space is on the tight side. Personally I liked it that way but for some it may be a drawbackThere was a light breakfast of pastries, coffee, fruit and fruit juices in the lobby, a small pool and an ice machine. I enjoyed the cocktail happy-hour Wednesday put on by the manager, David.Although the location is not on the beach, there are city buses which cost $2 and include one transfer, there are free shopping shuttles that take you to all the common spots during the day, and of course it is a really nice walk. The Ala Moana shopping center is close walking distance as well.If you don't like dated, impersonal overpriced hotels, this is a good bet to try.

Although our stay at the Equus was only for one night, my husband and I were very pleased with this hotel. We needed a place to stay before going to the airport for an early morning flight home and did not want to stay at an airport hotel since some of those reviews were scary. The room we had was on the 7th floor, nicely decorated, really clean and the bed was very comfortable. The pool area was small but looked very welcoming. The lobby was cute and the staff was friendly and accomodating.The only negatives we noticed: noise from the street, but it did not bother us, as we usually sleep with the tv on anyways; the elevator was old and slow, but we didn't mind; and stairs leading up to the hotel lobby were a pain if you had a lot of luggage. The location of the Equus was a good choice for us since we were still close enough to walk to where all the action of Waikiki is, but yet was also within a short ride to the airport. If you want to be in the middle of it all, then I don't believe it would be a good location for your whole vacation, but for a night or two it would be fine.For the price, location, and comfort level, we enjoyed this hotel.
Close to everything, not ocean front, but works for the price.Nice room, small continental bkfast, small pool, great rates, make a nice place to rest.Enjoy Oahu

My boyfriend is stationed at Schofield Barracks so I've been out there 3 times in the past year to visit. The Aqua Equus has by far been the best hotel out of the three I've stayed at. The room was neat and clean, had a very comfy bed and was just overall a nice place to stay. You don't spend much time in your hotel room but it's nice to be able to go back to a clean, quiet hotel room after a long day in the sun. Pro's and Con's . . . .PROs - Clean, quiet, free continental breakfast (just coffee, juice, and some pastries), very nice TV with computer monitor connected to it (nice for watching DVDs), great location (a bit of a walk to Waikiki beach but nice to be away from the crowd), just a walks distance to the Ala Moana shopping center and a few blocks more to the movie theater and Dave and Busters. CONs - Elevator takes forever, there are a flight of stairs from the street to the lobby so be ready to lug all your suitcases up those stairs, parking is $18 a day (but for all you military people, park at Fort de Russy using your military ID for a lot cheaper)Overall, I definitely recommend this hotel over any other. It's reasonably priced and better than other hotels in this price range. And considering how expensive everything can be out in Hawaii, it's nice to find a nice hotel without putting a hole in your pocket.

Like so many others, I read review after review on this and many other properties before finally making the decision to book here. What finally became the deciding factors were the price and pictures of the refurbished rooms. With 6 of us traveling I wanted the most affordable rooms with the greatest comfort. I am pleased to say that we were extremely delighted at the results. For the most part what I have read in others reviews are pretty accurate, but I'd like to break it down.The rooms are redone (look just like the pictures), about standard size and are clean. The beds are very comfortable with great pillows and comforters. The bathrooms only have a shower but have nice tile work and the pressure wasn't bad (I could actually get the shampoo out of my long hair) . The toilets are really loud when they flush but they do flush, so that's a good thing. There is a small safe in the closet in the bathroom and also a laundry basket (this was nice to have to put dirty clothes in it while we were there). Overall, the room was great.There ARE stairs from the street up to the front desk, and more than just a couple but not anything overbearing even with luggage for 6 people. It is true, the elevator is in rehab (although while we were there the floor did get finished, now they just need to finish the door panel and put up the new wall paper), but definately not a reason to cross this hotel of your list of prospects. The breakfast is simple with a small varity but very tasty and fresh. The hotel is on a busy, noisey street (but we were on the 3rd floor and had absolutely no problems with noise with the windows closed), there is free WiFi in the rooms but we had trouble connecting. However it is another company that manages the internet vs. the hotel themselves so they gave us the number and we contacted them and finally got connected. The pool was small and unfortunately people had thrown numerous cigarette butts into it, but wait -the hotel next door is also part of the aqua chain and your room key allows you into their pool which is a little larger, more private (it's behind the tennis courts) and has a jacuzzi as well as and outdoor shower. We went over there (45 second walk) and were completely satisfied. As budget hotels go, this one ranks very high.Finally, the staff was wonderful and very accomodating. We arrived our first night close to midnight after a late flight. When we got to the front desk they greeted me by name like they knew me before I even got a chance to tell them who I was. We checked out the next day because we were flying to another island but were coming back in a week. This time we arrived early before check in and they were able to get us into one of the two rooms early. We stayed the next several days here and all of the staff from the front desk (day or night staff) to the housekeeping department was incredible with a great aloha spirit. On our last day we had a late flight out so we had a late check out and then they stored our bags until it was time to leave for the airport at NO extra cost. They were simply amazing.Couple of ending thoughts for you who haven't made up your mind, if your nit-picky, think hard about it but if you are willing to have the aloha spirit and looking just to have a good time. I wouldn't hesitate. The hotel is not close to Waikiki but you are only about a block away from The Bus line that will take you anywhere for $2.00 per adult $1.00 per student (under 17) . It's diagonal from the ILIKAI hotel and across the street from the Hawaiian Prince hotel. There are a several restraunts close by including Red Lobster, Outback, Subway, McDonalds and Rainbow Sushi. Not to meantion it only being a little over 5 minutes to walk to the 4 story Ala Moana Shopping Center just down the street with one of the best food courts I've seen. (Japanize, Korean, American, Italian, etc....) Departing note-it is as cheap to rent a limo for your airport tranportation as it is to take a taxi. $28.99+tip (total not per person) will take you and up to 5 guests to or from the Equus to the airport. The cab (minivan) is about the same price give or take a couple of bucks due to traffic. Hope this helps and Aloha!
Hotel is in a great location. The hotel staff are very friendly and personable. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. This is my fourth time staying at this hotel and would recommend.

After reading the mixed reviews I decided to try this location out for an overnight stay before an international flight. Mainly due to a better beach location then an airport hotel and the online price that was offered. What a big mistake this was!I took an airport shuttle to the location. From reading the previous reviews I was prepared to haul my luggage up the flight of stairs from the street entrance. The street entrance was quite nice with a small side garden patio off to the left of the open-air check in desk. I was allowed to check in a couple hours early, which was very helpful. The first sign that I had made a mistake in this location was the elevator. Yes it was slow but I knew about that from other reviews so I was expecting that. What shocked me was the physical appearance of the elevator. The floor had tiles half taken out, one of the doors had its decorative surface removed, wallpaper was either peeling or in the process of being removed, not quite sure. It appeared as a DIY project gone wrong! As I arrived at my designated floor my first view was a large pile of dirty towels on a bench opposite the elevator (note to self was not to sit on the bench) I preceded to my room. The rooms are not on an inside hallway and the room doors are all accessible from the outside. The outside corridor was somewhat dingy and rundown looking.I entered my room and was thankfully surprised on the nice décor of the room. The bed décor was well appointed and the furniture fit well into the room. The bed was very comfortable and there were lots of pillows, which made the bed comfortable to lie in. Bedding was of good quality. There was a flat screen TV mounted opposite to the bed, which was a nice touch. The room was fairly clean and had no odors. The Aircon worked well with a temperature control that was easy to operate. Unfortunately is all that was good in the room.The sliding glass door out to the patio/lanai was unlocked upon arrival. It also looked like there had been numerous attempts to enter the door with a crowbar or screwdriver. That did not bode well for a single woman traveler. The bathroom was somewhat small, which was not a problem. The sink did not have a stopper in it so it was hard to wash out a few items in the sink.
