The grout between the tiles was dingy and not well done. I know that the location had undergone a redo…but the work was not done well. The shower was very small and the tile was dingy, which gave the appearance of being unclean and dirty. The front door did not meet the doorjambs leaving a gap of up to a ¼ inch between the door and doorjamb. The closet that was in the bathroom had not been redone like the rest of the room, the interior walls were very old looking and stained which gave the appearance of being dirty. But the main problem with this location was the ROAD NOISE! I had read the reviews about it and took that into consideration. I figured that I was a city girl and a sound sleeper so the road noise would not be a problem, I was very, very wrong. The road noise appeared to amplify between the buildings for most of the night ending about 4am. It was a very long and sleepless night. I would not consider location again due to the how loud the road noise is. One last note, I was told upon check out that the elevator was waiting for permits to be redone and that after several years the permits have been issued.

Great value hotel in a central location for beaches, restaurants and shopping. Recently refurbished with good room amenities including WiFi. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. There are stairs up to the hotel lobby from the street. There is an elevator to all floors from the lobby but you can keep yourself fit by using the stairs. Stayed for 14 nights and use the hotel as abse to explore Oahu.

Stayed one night pre-cruise at the Equus and were very pleased. The elevator was under renovation and very slow so being on the 4th floor, we took the stairs a lot. Yes, it was a bit of a pain dragging luggage up the stairs to reception and if you have issues with stairs, you might want to choose another hotel. The room itself was very nice and clean and the beds comfy. We had a shower (no bath) with plenty of towels and hot water and that was fine with us as we rarely use hotel bathtubs anyway. We weren't bothered by the street noise but we aren't overly sensitive to noise. We found Renee at reception to be extremely friendly and accommodating. We checked in at noon and although our room wasn't ready, she found another one that was and gave us all bottled water while we waited. We really appreciated that as we were heading out on a tour right away and needed to store our luggage somewhere. Can't really comment on the pool or breakfast as I didn't make it down for either but we did take advantage of the free internet in the lobby. There is an ABC store down the street that was pretty handy too. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and found it to be a good value compared to other properties in the area.

Got a Savvy Surfer rate of $94.00 - $105.24 with tax. Clean rooms, friendly staff, Fridge and coffee maker, flat screen TVPool was small and probably not suited for big kids. Elevator is worst feature. Does not go to ground floor so you have to carry your luggage up a full flight to the lobby where you take the slow single old elevator. Other then that the place was quiet and convienient. There is an ABC store, McDonalds and a Starbucks are close by as well.. Great Deal for an expensive location. Would definately book again..

My mother and I stayed two nights. The hotel has been renovated and the rooms are very nice. The beds are the most comfortable I have slept in and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only issue is that there is a flight of stairs to get into the building and also around the reception area which is difficult with heavy luggage but we found the staff promptly assisted us to move our bags quickly. We were on the 9th floor and did hear some traffic noise which may be an issue if you are a light sleeper. The flat screen TV was nice.

The Equus is a good choice for those who do not like the feel of a huge reasort. The property is smaller and a bit older, but very nicely kept. The room we stayed in had been recently updated . The bed was very comfortable, nice flat screen TV, new fridge and in-room safe. It might have been a tad small but was perfect for us and had the look and feel of a room that could have cost a lot more. The staff were helpful and friendly and housekeeping did a good job. The breakfast was nothing special. The usual fare of fruit, pastries, coffee and juice. But it was fresh and enjoyable. The location is also a good reason to make The Equus your choice. It is a 10 min. walk to the beach and also a short walk to the heart of shopping in Waikiki. The pool is very small but you are able to use the bigger pool at it's sister property next door. The only things on the downside I can think of are; an elevator that could be updated and an $18 a day parking fee but I understand that resort parking fees are the norm in Waikiki. We really enjoyed our stay and would absolutley stay there again.

I've had an excellent experience with the Equus Hotel, first when my fiance and I stayed there last year during our holiday in Hawaii and more recently this year when we contacted them to book rooms for guests attending our upcoming wedding. Their "no commitments" wedding plan is extremely flexible from a reservations/deposit standpoint and they provided our group with an excellent discount. We've had significant difficulties dealing with a number of other Hawaii based wedding providers (resorts, hotels, restaurants, tour group organizers, etc.), however the staff at Aqua Resorts have been outstanding with their prompt and thorough communications and in meeting our group's needs. I can't recommend them strongly enough, particularly from a value for money perspective.

We are Oahu residents who take long weekends in Waikiki roughly every other month, so we have stayed at a lot of the competing properties. The Equus is a real find. Because of the low price, we had limited expectations, but we were blown away. The beds are some of the best hotel beds I've ever experienced, and the room was clean, modern, tasteful, and comfortable. We also liked the location- we were easily able to walk to Magic Island, Ala Moana, Beachwalk, and Ward Center. There are thoughtful touches as well - conditioner as well as shampoo, water at check-in, coffee in the room. Best of all, the price. This was truly an occasion where you get more than what you pay for.

We have stayed at Aqua Waikiki Wave previously on business and decided to give this property a try. I suggest to all those that you take this property with CAUTION, while old it has some good renovations going for it, it is basicly clean "on the surface and out the front at least" but that is where it all stops and rates a LONG last to others in the chain. Staff at the desk were bad on booking in, just as bad the next morning with the guy who if he thinks he is running a $400 buck a night joint better realise that that those sort of places give SERVICE with a smile and care, the breakfast, forget that ,burnt coffee, small danishes squashed into a square plastic container and for room service, it "arrived at 4.40 in the afternoon with a HI ! do you want anything ? at a $150 PLUS a night you would think we would get more than the fresh towels we had to ask for, as for the bed, no it wasnt refreshed or made for us,bottom line give this place a big miss, pay the extra and go to the Wave where parking ( no worst than here or no more expensive , addtional to the room rate by the way) is tight but at least the STAFF are super freindly, rooms are big enought to turn around in and the room service and decore is very modern, a $20 bucks WELL worth spending in a city where all accomodation is over priced with around 5 trips to the island a year while my wife loves the horse theme it will be our last in this hotel, most welcome to answer any questions

Finding a place in Hawaii under $150 is tough, but the Equus fit the bill, and the renovations made the room quite pleasant. A staff member told me the neighboring Aqua property Waikiki Marina is nowhere near as nice. We were told all renovations were done, but the room below was having work on it (only noisy in the mid-day, so not much of a bother).Staff very helpful in finding us a room early (we had kids and tons of luggage).Pool is cold (shaded all day) and small. Walk to beach is about 10 minutes-and now that the Hilton lagoon is open there is another option.The lack of a 1st floor elevator is a real problem for anyone with heavy/many bags or a stroller.

Husband and I stayed at the Equus for 6 nights right during the Christimas holiday in 12/07. We picked Equus because of its low rate (at least lower in comparison!). We were not disappointed with the hotel. The location is a about a 15-minute walk Waikiki Beach (the Hilton Hawaiian Howaiian stretch). It's a 10-minute walk to a major mall. There are plenty of shops and eateries nearby. They even let us check in at 9am in the morning! We especially liked the conti. breakfast. The pastries were so good and it really saved us a few extra bucks to have the breakfast provided to us. Free internet too! We asked for several extra towels for the beach and they provided that to us, no problems. Friendly staff.The Equus is recently renovated and the rooms are adequate. It's not terribly big, but enough for 2 people. While we had no complaints with the Equus, I think we would like to stay closer to the beach next time.

We were pleasantly suprised by the Equus. Its really not much to look at from the outside, but the rooms were fantastic, clean and recently renovated. Not the best location if you're looking to be mainly in Waikiki but an easy trip on TheBus or by taxi. Though not near Waikiki, Its incredibly convient to several great little shopping centers, as well as the marina. Another benefit to being outside the main tourist area in Waikiki is that many of the resturants and shops in the area are more affordable. If you like sushi, there's a great place named Aloha Sushi right down the street in the Discovery Bay shopping center that's both tasty and cheap. It looks like its part of the Subway, but its actually part of its own small chain. If you're looking for a fantastic hotel on a budget this is the place for you!

While the outside looks a bit dull, the rooms have recently been refurbished, and the result is great. Super quiet aircon, and the king beds are Amazing! My experience with staff was mixed, but overall quite positive. Use of the gym costs $10 per day, but the in room Wifi is free. Good location for shopping (close to ala moana shopping mall).

Held my luggage both before the cruise departure and after. We stayed a day before the Pride of America (NCL) cruise and the saturday night afterwards and were very pleased with the service and the room. Tech geeks will love the interactive TV with access to a computer for iPod, divx and .mp3 play. Can't beat the price and it's just a 5 min public transit ($2 per person) to the market and waikiki beach. i know it sounds like a lot compared to the hotels on the beach, but $94 + $2pp and a 5 min bus is well worth it instead of paying more for an outdated room. There is an ABC store right outside, which is always convenient ($3 24oz beer cans??? I couldn't believe it). Stayed Dec 14th and 23rd 2007.

The room was nice, We didn't even notice the construction. I have no complaints with the hotel itself. I had many complaints with finding the parking garage, which is actually in another hotel. The hotel is on a one-way street, which is very very busy, and I held my breath every time we slowed down to turn into the driveway, because I was sure someone was going to run over us. The entrance is nowhere near the driveway or garage, and you have to carry your luggage a loooong way. I will not be staying here again.

My stay at the Equus was phenominal. From the beginning as we were greeted with personalized service everyone was very accommodating and the resort itself was soooooooooo relaxing. Mahalo Puka & Renee!

This is a small property in the Aqua chain that is currently being renovated. However, the only inconvenience caused by the construction was confined to the elevator. The elevator is very old and extremely slow and this was compounded with the use by construction personnel who were working on the top floor (the 10th). Our room was on the 8th floor and I found the stairs to be much faster than using the elevator. At 65 years of age, however, the trip up was only three times and down maybe a dozen times.Our room was very nice and comfortable. The wide-screen television (although it only had analog stations available) was very nice. We didn't watch much television, of course, but it did give us free access to the Internet -- a nice perk, indeed.In addition to the elevator, there are three other negatives that need mention. The elevator does not go to the ground floor so luggage has to be lugged up the stairs to the 2nd floor desk at check-in and back down when you leave. (It is also very confusing as to where to park during the check-in period but eventually one figures it out -- perhaps after several trips around the ten block circle.) Secondly, if you have a car, count on paying $18 a day for garage space. The alternative is to find a parking place on the street. Yeah, right. Lastly, is the noise. This property is on one of the busiest streets in Honolulu and the traffic noise is quite loud and doesn't really diminish in the wee hours. I wear 33db ear plugs at night which blocks out (I thought) all sound. Nevertheless, the sound, for example, of those rental motorcycles, particularly between 2 and 4 a.m., was as if they were in the room with me -- remember, I was on the 8th floor.In any event, we were completely satisfied with our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone willing to accept the above (very minor, actually) negatives. This hotel is very close to a wide variety (in price and type) of restaurants and is within walking distance of the ocean and Waikiki... or by bus.

we were so happy to find the nice, friendly staff with the true aloha spirit. this boutique hotel has a personable feel where the "old Hawaii meet new" decor. just 1 block from ala moana- perfect location!! thanks for a fun and special get away.

After comparing various Aqua properties, we chose to stay at the Equus based on the pictures on the website. We booked our room and sent a confirmation e-mail to request a remodeled room and were assured all rooms were remodeled. We were hugely disappointed when we arrived and our room looked nothing like what is pictured. The bedding was dated and tired with a Hawaiian palm theme. The armoire, end table and nightstand had multiple chips out of the wood, gouges and scratches. Had our children been toddlers, we could not have stayed in the room due to the risk of splinters. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable but we were disappointed overall with the condition of the room. Given our numerous pieces of luggage and (by check in time) sleeping kids, we did not opt to change rooms. Also, one morning around 8am we requested four beach towels. After checking multiple locations, the front desk told us they only had three clean towels. I wondered how soon it would be before other guests could get even one clean beach towel.I believe I had appropriate expectations of a budget "boutique" hotel and assumed the website accurately depicted what we should expect. It was disappointing to come that far and feel like your expectations were not met.The staff members were very polite to us and the breakfast suited our needs just fine. The street noise was noticeable but did not bother us. We saw other guests staying there, but we never once heard anyone which was nice.Based on our experience, I would not recommend the Equus, although I might possibly consider other Aqua properties.

For about $85/night, it was an acceptable stay. The hotel seems to be near the end of remodeling and except for one really noisy day, I didn't notice much. I was a little surprised by the state of the elevator, but maybe they are waiting to update that after everything is done. Also, the elevator does not have a safety door and it will close on you, so be careful! The staff was friendly enough. Yes, there is technically a pool, but it's situated in between buildings, so I doubt it ever sees sunlight. Also, it is super tiny. As for the room, the bed was a bit too soft for me. The shower is not very big. It was big enough for me, but I am a 5' 2" female that weighs about 105 lbs. I don't know how anyone larger would fit. Flat screen tv, remote control a/c and fridge in every room is a nice touch.The location isn't too bad...a 5 minute walk to Ala Moana beach and mall (10 minutes in flip flops). Free breakfast is a nice touch. They offer assorted pastries, juices and coffee. They also provide the Honolulu Advertiser newspaper for free. Good reading for the beach! There is a McDonald's and a Starbucks across the street if you have to have your chain food fix. Not sure if I'll stay there again, but if you're on a budget, then it's not a bad deal.

The service was great. We were always greeted with smiles and willingness to please. The hotel is about 2 to 3 blocks from Ala Moana Park/Marina and Ala Moana Shopping Center not Waikiki Beach. Waikiki Beach is about 5 to 10 minutes away. The rooms are small but very clean. There's a refrigerator, coffee maker with complimenary coffee of course, flat screen T.V., balcony (not a view of any thing spectacular though), great beds and fluffy pillows. The beds get a 5 star rating. Complimentary breakfast includes juice and pastries. So if you have a big appetite for breakfast McDonalds and Starbucks is right down the street. On the hotel premises there are vending machines and a microwave. Laundry can be done at the Wakiki Marina which is right behind the Eqqus. Room service was sporadic. We didn't know if they were coming at 3:30 in the afternoon or 8:30 in the morning and we had to request towels often. There was construction in the area so if you're wanting quiet time this is not the place to stay. Great Place at a Great Price! Would definitely stay again.

We visited the Hawaiian Islands in August and September, and each time we stopped off in Honolulu we stayed at the Aqua Equus. The staff were always friendly and helpful even when arriving in the middle of the night. The rooms were always comfortable and clean with good en-suite bathrooms. The location can't be bettered as it is between Waikiki for the beach and the Ala Moana Centre for food and shopping, both in easy walking distances. Also there is a Starbucks and an ABC store just about next door. Overall a great find and very good value for money.

After hours of website research I took the plunge and booked this hotel. The Aqua website guarentees the best price. Room was very nice, marble sink and countertops with fridge, just renovated. Great bed. Interactive TV and internet that was free on slim TV monitor. One of the first stops on our bus from the airport and about 3 minutes walk from the Hilton. Beach and marina across the road. Only down side was that it was noisy. Not a resort but great for a place to sleep that is clean, comfortable, friendly and elegant. We paid $88 a nightTony, Toronto, Canada

We stayed at the Aqua Equus Oct. 13th, 2007. After travelling all day the plush queen sized beds were most enjoyable. The continental breakfast in the morning offered tasty pastries and fresh fruit, along with coffee and juices. The only down side to the Equus were the stairs that you had to lug your luggage up to get from the parkade/street level to the lobby/elevators. The hotel is located at the marina end of the "strip" and is a fair distance from wakiki beach. And our room did not have a bathtub. Besides these minor issues I would still recommend this property.

Most of these reviews are right on target. Excellent rooms and beds, without any "resort frills". You won't beat it for comfort, style and cleanliness. However if you require a rotating restuarant, piano-bar, dinner show, spa and full-hot breakfast with your hotel, then the Equus is probably not for you. Other than that it's a great room to unwind and relax for another days activities. For those that insist on negatives.1. The street traffic is noticeable even on the 8th floor.2. You do have to walk to anywhere. ABC store or McDonalds is a 2 minute walk. Red Lobster and Outback Steakhouse are maybe 3 minute walks. Only because you have to wait to cross the street. I guess that's a negative? And the beaches really are a 10-15 minute walk.If all you plan to do is hit the beach this is probably not the place for you. However, if you want 5-star comfort for a 2-star price. Equus is hard to beat.

We stayed at the Equus for part of our Honeymoon in October. The hotel was better than expected. PROS: Clean, central, friendly. CONS: Noisy, there's no ramp into the hotel. The "continental" breakfast consists of juice, fruit, muffins and pastries. The room we received was very noisy, not great for sleeping, after complaining they moved us next door to Waikiki Marina. Great service tho!

This was our first time stayinig in a hotel on Oahu since my husband was born and raised there (and family is still there). It took a bit of convincing and since The Equus seemed nice with such a great price, we booked and am SO glad we did.The room itself is on the small side but still comfortable. The bed was great with nice bedding (I even liked the faux Hawaiian quilt on the bed!). Everything was clean, especially the bathroom which is what concerned me the most about this "budget" hotel...but it was very nice and extremely clean. The free wireless internet connection was nice since we were both on working vacations. We only took advantage of the free continental breakfast on the day that we left but it was a nice little spread.The only thing we could have used in the room was a little table (either a small dining table or even a desk) but no biggie, we ate and used our laptops in bed :)The cons of this hotel are what have been mentioned on TA before, the slow elevator and the parking. For such a great price, we didn't really mind the slow elevator...it does take a few extra minutes but it's not that big of a deal. The parking lot is terrible though, we always hoped that we wouldn't get hit on the way in/out....it's a circular path with cars going both directions on a one-lane path. Parking was an additional $18/day.We would definitely book at The Equus again in the future!
Stayed at the Equus. Local shopping Centre very handy. Service was great. Rooms even better! Slept on a king size bed. Would go back in no time!

Last month I stayed in Hawaii on business...I wanted to stay in Waikiki but didn't want a hotel full of college students on summer break. The Equus was extremely inexpensive, and I'm always up for trying different hotels, so I originally only got my reservation for a couple days. I ended up extending it for two additional weeks. Flat-screen plasma TV's in some of the rooms, the only place I found for the price with a free continental breakfast; it was really a great place to stay. The employees there were really great to me, and it seemed like there was always someone polishing the brass steps at the front of the hotel. Great place...I'd go back there again whether I'm traveling again for business, or for vacation.

We stayed at the Equus for a week in August and I would definitely stay there again. The rooms were clean, it was a pretty good location and value for money. Like other posters have said it is not a well-known location so make sure you have the address with you to find it. We just had to walk across the road to another hotel to get the tour buses so it was fine.THE PROS - The staff were friendly - particularly the girl at the front desk whose name I can't remember - and let my sister check in early after she arrived feeling really sick. Also our air-con broke down one day and they fixed it right away. The room was nicely renovated and clean. It had the most comfortable beds and pillows we've ever slept on. The TV had about 40 channels. there's an internet computer in the lobby that just cost a few dollars to use. It was 5 minutes walk to Ala Moana shopping centre although a bit longer into Waikiki. there's an ABC shop on the corner and a McDonalds nearby as well as a few restaurants. CONS - I agree with another poster that they could try to clean their rooms faster - we got back some days at about 4pm and our room still hadn't been done but that was a minor irritation. There was a bit of noise but we had the air-con on so that drowned it out. On the first morning we were there some kids were diving in the pool at about 6am but they were quickly told to stop. Also the toilets sound like airline toilets when they flush so you hear the neighbouring rooms flushing but you get used to it. lol. We had a room right down the hall from the check-in counter so I can't comment on the lift because we didn't use it. The only other downside I can think of is that we had to go to the Aqua property next door to do our laundry but housekeeping was using all the washers and dryers to do the sheets and towels so they should really have separate facilities for guests. Apart from that it was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again.

i loved my stay in room 206. the architecture was very warm and womb like. the staff was remarkable. mei was the sweetest woman i have ever met and mariah was very helpful in aiding our adventures beyond waikiki. i give this hotel 4 and a half stars and plan to return on my next trip to hawaii. i can't wait to see the hotel after the renovations are complete. a roof garden would really be a cherry on this supreme sunday .

We were wanting to go to Hawaii for our honeymoon. Most hotels were priced over $175.00, the we came across the Equus. We were hesitant at first as it was a newly renovated hotel and there have been many reviews since the renovations were completed. But at an average of $80.00 per night, we decided we'd take the gamble. We arrived late night and did have some difficulty finding the place, as it is not a very large building. Our first impression was that the front dest looked like some cheap motel ( I say this in comparison to the usual Sheraton, Hilton, etc..). However, the clerk was very nice and efficient. The rooms were spotless, which is the first thing I look for in a hotel. And the bed....what can I say...If I could have fit it in my luggage, I would have taken it home! I guess the bed provides the extra comfort you'll need to get a good night's sleep with all the noise coming from outside. We were on the 4th floor and still it sounded like there was a traffic jam in our room. It does quiet down late at night. Housekeeping was not very well organized, we often came back to our room in the late afternoon ( 3 or 4PM) and housekkeping had come by, but only to pick up the dirty towels and UNmake the bed...Another crew would come in later with clean towels and line (usually around 4:30, as they finished at 5:00Parking is located in a separate building behind the hotel, and is secured by a remote controlled gate. This was not a big inconvenience, as it is only a 30 second walk to the parking. And besides, parking is only $15.00 a night compared to $25.00 charged by most other properties. The pool is nothing to write home about...it is located between two buildings so it does not get much sun...it was so cold, that a hotel employee was surprised I was actually swimming in it! Overall, we enjoyed our stay...Clean rooms, Welcoming staff, but most of all, an ideal location for the price!

I was apprehensive about this hotel since some of the locals who were providing my transportation to the hotel were not aware of this hotel and the driver of our van seemed to give it a so-so type of description. I also read some of the feedback from sights such as this which provided feedback that did not come across very positive. Well! To my and my daughter's delight...the accomodations provided at The Equus were just fine! The owners did a fine job of renovating the rooms. It felt very welcoming and I loved the "Hawaiian plantation" type of decor! The room was very modest but clean (very important to us above all! I am, afterall a Director of Housekeeping at another hotel!) I did not expect a lot of "fru fru" in my room, but was very pleased overall with our stay at The Equus! If someone is looking for simplicity and cleanliness, yes, I would suggest this small hotel. Use your money playing!! A person can not arrive at this property expecting the upgrades usually found in bigger hotels! The staff was pleasant with us and helpful when we needed help! Again...expect simple and pleasant! It was easy enough to get to the beach and the heart of Waikiki once we figured out our direction and which bus would take us to certain destinations. I feel we got what we paid for and left quite happy! If you've travelled to Europe, this hotel reminds me of some of the smaller places you would find, say, in Rome or Spain. P.S. The pool was veeerrrry cold...even on a sunny, hot day!

My partner and I just returned from a recent trip to Honolulu and a stay at The Equus. The hotel it self is a cozy one, not overly decorated and with just enough amenties to keep you happy. Located right on Ala Moana Blvd., it is conveniently located close to Waikiki, Ala Moana Center and other attractions. Our only concerns were the one elevator, the on-site "off site" parking, located at the Aqua Waikiki Marina (just behind The Equus), and the hum of traffic that somehow filtered through the sliding glass doors (we were on the 5th floor. Other than that, the staff was very friendly and courteous, especially at the the Front desk, and the rooms were very clean and very cozy. I would definitely do a return visit.

This is a small boutique hotel that has been recently remodeled. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds great! Nice details were included and complimentary water at check-in appreciated. The parking garage is a little difficult, as no way to go directly from hotel tower to parking. Ask for rooms away from Ala Moana Blvd., or the noise will get you! Great value for the money and comfortable.

The hotel was recently renovated with a granite countertops and a huge comfortabe bed with tons of pillows. The tv was a flat screen Westinghouse and the room was always clean, with the hotel staff curtious and friendly. The downside is parking is expensive and will have to find a side street to park on. The hotel is walking distance from Wakiki beach. I was visiting friends so neither were an issue for me. Would definately stay again!!!
I loved the renovations. The staff was wonderful. I would recommend this property.
Friendly staff and as said by others very comfortable beds.

Despite the difficult parking situation, construction and its one elevator that was very slow, I still would recommend the Equus.My friend and I booked via bookit.com for around $80 per night.The beds at this budget-minded boutique hotel were comfortable. So comfortable that my friend and I shared the double bed and still slept well! The small, red, rectangular pillows are the room's best amenity.Rooms also come with a sink in the bedroom, a mini-refrigerator and a plasma TV.The bathroom was tiny, but we received fresh towels every day.Construction was going on, but I didn't hear any noise until around 11 a.m.If you go, don't get too high of a floor because construction at times blocked the elevator for us. We didn't use the elevator much, though, because it was very slow and my friend and I didn't mind walking the five floors.It's a short walk to the Ala Moana shopping center and around a 30-minute walk to Waikiki Beach.Parking was $15 per day. They give you a garage opener so you can get into the garage. There were plenty of open spaces. Just remember to give them back the opener before you check out. You have to use the opener to leave the garage as well, so it's best to return the opener after you leave the garage.

The rooms in this place were nice, comfortable, and clean. The service was awful and the room I had was right off the street and very loud, you could hear cars, music, and people all night long. This is not a hotel for any one who actually wants to sleep in their room.. Every morning around 8AM the maid would bang on the door with the cord to the vacum cleaner and see if you wanted your room to be cleaned if not they skipped it... You could hear the maids in the hallways from 8-2PM talking very loudly with music playing from their carts... I also asked the reception for information on getting a shuttle to the airport and he looked at me like I asked for his first born and handed me a phone book??? Pros- clean and comfortable rooms, close to Ala Moana mall, free internetCons- poor service, loud, staff very unorganized and rude, location not so nice.

I stayed in March 20007 and this was my first stay in Honolulu. This hotel has beautiful rooms that have the most comfortable beds and linens. I am just going to list the many things you will find: iron, ironing board, mini frig, abundant selection of fruits, juices, rolls and muffins at breakfast , coffee makers, locked parking available, friendly staff, great location and low prices. I was able to stay for 95.00/nite. I can't remember parking price but it was not more than 15.00 per nite and you had remote control that allowed you to come and go as you pleased.

Stayed here for one evening after a VERY LONG flight from Pennsylvania. Beautiful room...comfortable...newly remodeled...clean...friendly staff...wonderful! The king sized bed was awesome...best sleep I ever had!
Nice clean, newly remodeled rooms combined with a terrific location and staff with aloha spirit make this a great choice!

I stayed here for one night with my husband in a remodeled room. Immediately upon arrivial we were given two bottles of water. There was a light continental breakfast with juice, fruit & rolls. We also stayed two nights at the Aqua Palms hotel. This was far superior then the Aqua Palms. The furnishings were nicer at the Equus and the bed was very comfortable. The bed at the Aqua Palms was very hard and the room was musty. The room had a boutique feel. There was a new fridge to store bottled water and snacks. I would stay here again.

Our stay at the Aqua Equus hotel was enhanced by the help we received from all of the people at the front desk, especially Linelle who was great. I will be going back in May to set up a photobooth for a wedding reception and have already booked my next stay with Linelle and company, The king sized bed in the newly remodeled room was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in! Bill & Nancy WickBonney Lake Wa.

We stayed at the Hotel Equus during the week of April 9th. The room on the 10th floor was not remodeled. The room was dated and old. Be careful when booking a stay to ensure that you get a remodeled unit. There is also some noise due to the location of the property on Ala Moana.The service is nice as are the continental breakfast and newspaper..

I stayed four nights in this 3 star property- I really had no expectations, I had the friendliest and easiest check in ever, The location suited me completly as it is only 5 minutes walk from Ala Moana Mall and 10 minutes from Waikiki beach - far enough away from both with being so close to everything!The hotel offers a free basic continental breakfast and free wireless connection which came in really usefull and also offered every 4th night free so it was under $100AUD per night!The rooms are modern with flat screen LCD televisions and the bed was very comfortable - The outside is nothing pretty - a concrete block that encases a true gem. If there had to be a down side it would be the lift - a little slow and jolty but nothing major!

For the price, you cannot beat it. The renovated rooms are fantastic - tasteful, comfortable, and by no means generic. TVs are beauties and internet worked just fine. Staff was polite and willing. Beds are comfortable. Location in the middle of it all. Really, you can't go wrong.

We stayed four nights beginning March 27, 2007 and had a wonderful time. Most of the "complaints" you read are true- stairs to get to lobby, slow elevator service, difficult to spot the entrance if you are unfamiliar with Waikiki, the microwave is off the lobby, not in the room, and the shower is quite small.That being said, the rooms are large, nicely remodeled, and have everything except the microwave that you would expect in a mid-scale establishment. The staff is top-notch; knowlegable and friendly! We stayed on the fourth floor, and utilized the stairs whenever not carrying luggage to avoid the slow (very slow) elevator. It was a short, pleasant wlak to the heart of Waikiki (restaurants on Kuhio, shopping on Kalakaua) and about a 20 minute stroll to the Aqaurium. Only about a 10 minute walk to Ala Moana Beach/Park, which is a nice alternative to the crowded beach at Waikiki, we only rented a car on days we were traveling to the Aloha Stadium Swapmeet and Polynesian Cultural Center.Housekeeping was very good, and unlike other hotels in this price range, they gave us coffee everyday without a $2-3 charge. I am a "bargain" shopper when it comes to hotels in Waikiki, and this was a supirior value to the Ohana properties I usually book at. We spent our last two nights at the Royal Hawaiian (using SPG points) and preferred the facilities and staff at the Equus. Off-peak, I would pay up to about $120 a night for this property, but got this trip for just $80 on Expedia.TIPS: Rent a car from the Enterprise on Kalakaua about three blocks from this hotel only on the days you really need a car, returning to the enterprise lot at night and save the hassle and expense of parking. Online a base car runs $33 with taxes, and you can book it from the computer in the Equus lobby for .15 a minute. Don't miss the swapmeet at Aloha Stadium (15 miles away) on Weds, Sat & Sun, or the Polynesian Cultural Center on the North side of the Island (40 miles +/-) and their great Luau dinner!

Lots of unfair reviews of the Equus. My husband and I stayed there for a romantic weekend getaway and absolutely loved it. Our newly renovated room was small (think cozy and romantic) but clean, safe, and quiet. I did not get to meet the famous Linnelle, but the staff I did encounter were helpful and friendly. Probably the only complaint I have about this hotel is the parking. I would advise you to call ahead for specifics because it was confusing for me, and I'm a local! This is not a 5-star hotel. Have some real expectations, and you'll like the Equus too. I'll definitely be back sooner than later.

Warning to the disabled! You must climb about 2 flights of stairs to reach the front desk. Front desk and some rooms are on the 2nd floor with rooms going up to the 10th floor. There is only one elevator which goes from the 2nd floor upwards. Today, the elevator got stuck - which meant I was stuck on the 6th floor and I had a tour departure to meet in 15 minutes.I chose this hotel due to the price, its location and the fact it was a strictly no smoking hotel. I must walk with a cane and travel with a respirator. It was a very difficult climb up those stairs daily to the point that I reduced a lot of the activities I would have done.Another point I must state - when I booked my reservation, I was not told that there is a substantial daily parking charge.Furthermore, in route to Hawaii, we were stranded overnight in Chicago. The airline we were flying contacted them to let them know we would not be arriving that night and a supposed Equus hotel manager said we would likely not be charged for that first night which had been guaranteed with a credit card. Upon arriving, I found out that I was still charged for the unused night, and no one knew who the person was with the name given, nor when the manager (with a different name) of the hotel would be back. If we had known then when the airline called, we would have been reimbursed by the airline at that time. This I feel is grossly unfair on the part of the hotel.Overall, the staff is fabulous. The room I would describe as shabby-chic. Fresh paint, granite counter tops, fabulous new plasma tv and remote controlled air conditioner, rooms refurbished with new linens and Hawaiian shutters - except they forgot to do the furniture which is chipped and bashed.

My husband and I booked to stay at the Equus through ---. We stayed there for 7 nights from 14 March 2007 to 21 March 2007 and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff were very friendly, resourceful and extremely helpful. We didn't have a street directory so we asked them for direction. First up was for the quickest way to the Airport. The direction was very clear and effective that we got there in 20 minutes. On Friday 16 March, we asked for the direction to La'ie as we booked to tour the Polynesian Cultural Centre. We followed the instructions and we got there in 50 minutes. We were happy to pay $15 per night parking fee as this was well publicised beforehand in ---. This is quite reasonable in comparison to parking in Sydney City where we pay the same amount or more for a 3 hours parking except perhaps for the Casino where we pay $10 for the whole night. The room was very clean and what we saw on --- was exactly what we received when we got there. The maids cleaned our room on a daily basis. We love the location 'cause it's only a short walk to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. For Swimming, we walked across from Ala Moana Shopping Centre to Magic Island where they have a beautiful beach for swimming, not to mention the beautiful Ala Moana Park. If you head towards the other direction to Waikiki, ABC stores is at the corner and McDonalds is immediately on the opposite side of the street. If you'd like a swim along that side, just walk across from McDonalds towards the Ilikai Hotel and walk along the jetty until you come to another beautiful beach where they have all the surfers heading out for the big waves while you swim at the lagoon. At the next Corner is Wailana Coffee Lounge (and Karaoke Bar) which opens 24 hours. Across the Street from the Wailana is the Todai Japanese Seafood Buffet that serves scrumptuous food at a reasonable price. The hotel has a small pool and I enjoyed my swim there with a very peaceful surrounding. It was great also to be able to phone to any local number free of charge. I guess my only complaint was walking up the steps from the street to the lobby, but then this gave me a good exercise. Overall we had a fabulous time at the Equus and we would stay there again if we go back to Hawaii.

Stayed for four nights. What the other reviewers said is basically true--what used to be a motel-type building stuck between two larger buildings next to a busy road is being upgraded to a 'boutique' hotel. Basically, the interior and exterior are two different stories: the entrance is a just a staircase off the street, and there's virtually no lobby to speak of; the reception is located in the elevator hall. But once you get inside the room (one of the renovated ones, that is), everything is there; you could almost believe you're in a four-star hotel. Comfy bed, flat-screen TV, granite counter-top, empty fridge, nice clean bathroom, complete set of toiletries, nice strong shower; the in-room wireless internet was 'free' but flaky; if you use the internet station downstairs it costs you 15 cents a minute. Parking is 15 dollars a day (although you could wing it and park overnight in the nearby streets, e.g. along the canal). Free morning call at 8:45am every weekday courtesy of drilling and hammering. As for view--what you see is just the building next door or busy Ala Moana Blvd. Location--it's more like a 15-20 minute walk to central Waikiki, or you could take the $2 shopping shuttles. In summary, if you could get a good price for the room and don't care about the setting, this place might work for you. But wait till the construction is over.

We stayed for 11 nights at the Aqua Equus from February 6 to February 17, 2007. We decided to stay here as it was advertised as a value-for-money, newly-renovated hotel. I booked our accommodation through Expedia Australia which looked to be the best value for the accommodation. Prior to booking the accommodation, I also emailed (--)to confirm that all rooms had been renovated as previous posts below recommended that I get a renovated room. I received a response from "Amanda" from Aqua's Central Reservation to confirm that all rooms had been renovated. Also, as per previous posts, I requested for a room on high level. Now here is our story...We got a room on Level 9 - and it's a 10-storey building. We DID NOT get a renovated room - or at least I say this because it looked NOTHING like the pictures. The carpet was old and water-stained, the furniture was dilapidated and TV was not an LCD flat screen. We did not have a microwave in the room unlike the published Aquakit thing-a-ma-jig, rather there was a communal microwave on the ground floor behind reception.On our first day - extremely tired from the 10.5 hour from Sydney, we were kept awake by drilling. The staff would yell and scream down the hallway and even up and down the floors. Even when the "Do Not Disturb" sign was at our door, the housekeeping staff would still try and enter the room - the only thing that maintained our privacy was the door chain. The noisy staff carried on pretty much throughout the first week.Then on the second week, they seemed to have disappeared. Didn't hear a peep. Didn't even see them. But our room still got fixed - sometimes.We found that if we left the room after noon, chances are our room would not get fixed/cleaned. We liked the Waikiki nightlife, so we slept in on most days. So all-in-all within our 11 night stay, our room was probably attended to about 6 times. We never got the chance to have the complimentary breakfast either- but I saw it briefly one morning and it didn't look like something worth peeling myself out of bed for.The well published Linelle was friendly, but so were other younger guys (sorry I didn't get their names). But there were these two older gentlemen- One had a slick ponytail and one had greasy curls. Could someone teach these guys how to smile? They had a "don't you dare talk to me" aura and trigger-happy deathstares. If you don't like your job, quit and stop ruining our vacation! ;o)We are a young couple working in the IT industry. The internet in our room was reliable and we enjoyed the cable TV. We loved the location as it was 100m to Ala Moana and an easy 10 minute walk one-way to Waikiki. We were packing down food like it was going out of fashion and since we would take about 2 round trips to Waikiki daily (for afternoon beach and for dinners), the walks helped us keep the weight down. The food was also cheaper at Ala Moana so we would lunch there and dinner at Waikiki. We would walk back to the hotel after 11:30 nightly (since all shops at Waikiki closed at 11:00pm but we would have Cold Stone Creamery on the way home) and we never had any issues in terms of safety.Would I recommend it? Well, I think there is a negative wherever you stay, unless you're willing to pay through the nose. This is a reasonable budget accommodation and perhaps we would stay here again as the location, free internet and cable suited us. I guess I just feel duped by some of what they published and we never got - well mainly the fact that all the rooms had been renovated. We definately would not recommend it to our parents as they would probably feel like they're staying in a motel along a major highway, and I would NOT recommend it to young families as it is right at a main road and it may be tricky getting in and out with kids and the steep flight of stairs from the street to the front door. But if you just want a room that is closer to a nice mall and the Hilton Beach than a famous, over-crowded beach (Waikiki), and you don't mind the street noise - all on a budget - well then this may just be the hotel for you.

We arrived to find The Equus conveniently located next to EVERYTHING that's happening. Linelle at the front desk was warm and welcoming. She had many suggests for how we might want to start off our first evening in Oahu. Linelle is actually one of the Equus' selling points. Her cordial nature makes you feel like the Equus could be your home away from home. We enjoyed her service very much. The room was eloquently renovated and looked EXACTLY like the advertised photos online (at the hotel's website.) Need I say more??? I would recommend it highly. However, as with any of the downtown hotels, prepare yourself for the typical traffic related noises. The furnishings were very nice and warm and the true granite tops throughout and plasma TV were classy additions. Something noteworthy that you wont catch in the online pictures is the atmospheric recessed lighting throughout. It's the perfect finishing touch to nicely decorated room ... give the Equus a try...it's a great place to stay that's easy on the pocketbook.Michael G

First time in Hawaii and was at the Hawaii Polo Inn in the midst of their renovations. Amazing to see all the work going on and the fact that the staff was so pleasant and everyone so easy going during all this was wonderfull. The renovated rooms were like pictures from a magazine......beautiful attention to detail etc. A very knowledgable staff and such aloha spirit. Hotel is close to shopping and beach and parks.......with staff always ready to help with directions and suggestions. I definitely will be staying with the Aqua Equus anytime I go to Oahu and have recommended it to others that I know are going there. Can't beat the price and the comfort and the true Hawaiian spirit!

The Equus, formerly the Hawaii Polo Inn is a newly renovated, warm Hawaiian hospitality, getaway for us. We enjoyed the Equus and it's friendly staff. Linelle greeted us each morning at breakfast with her warm Hawaiian smile.. Everyday the Equus offers coffee, tea, juice, pastries and fresh fruit for its guests' all at no extra charge. At check-in we were greeted by friendly and helpful local staff that checked us in with ease and remembered us by name. This time we were given Hawaiian bottles of water at check in. It was a wonderful surprise and very appreciated.Our room was very warm and cozy. It has free wireless, free phone calls and our room came with a coffeemaker and a nice refrigerator with a nice size freezer compartment for our nightly pints of haagen dazs ice cream. The furniture and design of the rooms were very well appointed. We were treated like guests staying at a 5 star hotel. The Equus is the place to be for your money!! Beds were very comfortable.You can't beat the location. Only 2 blocks from Ala Moana Shopping Center and 2 blocks from the closest beach. We didn't have to rent a car. Parking is only $15 per day . Our friends across the street paid $25 per nite for parking. The Equus is only steps away from fabulous restraunts. Visit the Shanhai Bistro only a block away, our favorite. The best Happy hour!!The Equus will be our home away from home and we look forward to returning soon.The Kona Crew

Booked online at the last minute for mid-January; arrived as they were taking down the "Hawaii Polo Inn" nameplate on the front of the hotel and putting up an "Aqua Equus" sign.Best price I could find was booking one of their specials directly through the Aqua website. I was placed in one of what previous reviewers have described as the newly-renovated rooms.The good:The room itself was sparkling new and well-appointed. The flat-screen TV showcased NFL playoff highlights from earlier in the day, equestrian-themes art decorated the walls, and a fairly large lanai contained a table and a couple of chairs. The king bed was very comfortable -- similar to the Hampton Inn chain's Cloud Nine beds, but a little firmer and a more comfortable top layer of linens. Also a mini-fridge.High-speed Internet access in the room was available either through a direct Ethernet cable or through a wireless hub located underneath the television. The wireless signal easily reached to the lanai. For those who might not be bringing their computers to Oahu, the lobby is outfitted with a couple of $0.15/minute workstations and a printer.Good bathroom toiletries -- an ample supply of soft towels and extra shampoos and soaps provided. Quite useful for taking two or three showers a day! Had plenty of hot water on all occasions.Service was excellent and very hospitable. Had nice chats with several of the folks in the lobby, and they were quite enthusiastic and welcoming.Finally, the location is terrific. Right across the street from the Hawaii Prince, which means you do have to cross the street to get to the beach. But you have easy access to Ala Moana beach park (less crowded, more locals) as well as Waikiki. Easy parking with full in and out privileges, but it does cost $15/day. The location is pretty good if you're driving, as you don't have to fight the Waikiki mess to get downtown, out of town, or to the airport.The not-so-good:Road and parking lot noise from below definitely drifted into the room. The management would do well to invest in better-fitting, and better sound-insulating, doors and windows to the lanais. In the meantime, perhaps a higher floor would be helpful, although the single elevator is pretty slow.Finding the right driveway for the hotel the first time was difficult, and the staff of the adjacent Aqua property directed me into their parking garage, for which the Equus staff didn't have a remote control to let me out. Once I got into the Equus parking lot, there was no problem.Although the website promises an in-room safe, my room was lacking one. And I was told that they are small safes, that wouldn't hold a laptop computer in any case. Folks, if you're going to advertise in-room Internet access and be a "boutique," you're going to attract business travelers extending their stay, and you need to have a way for them to secure their laptops.The mixed:Breakfast. Although the fresh oranges were fabulous, the orange juice was not so good. Coffee was good, but the mix of baked goods was always short on muffins (very popular), so much of the time the only choices were croissants (without jam or butter to top) or blueberry rolls (look better than they taste).The hotel has a pool, but I was too busy at the beach, touring the island, and visiting friends to check it out. Maybe next time...

what can i say i was simply blown away, I'm irish and we know about hospitality and a bit about trying to keep things authentic. The hawaii polo inn was a real revelation, i found a real sense of hawaiian culture and hospitality the staff were all so friendly and warm. the rooms were also magnificent, the attention to detail was fantastic. With the newly renovated rooms i felt like i was getting a 5 star room for the price of a 2 star. It passed all of my tests and if i ever go back to honolulu the polo inn will be the only stop for me.

My travel agent says she checked and the rental car parking was free. It is not. The Hawaii Polo website mentions the safe fee but no mention of the hefty parking charges.Several outdated review web sites also list parking as free. Lots of street noise after midnight garbage trucks, backup alarms bring earplugs. Definitely not a five star but they do not claim to be. Would not recommend.

It's a Jeckle and Hyde inn. The older rooms are what I would expect to find on skid row.The newly renovated rooms are fantastic...thoroughly modern. They are $50 more though. We chose to upgrade to the better room.It's a little noisy if you are near the main street. Walking distance to two very nice beaches. 5 minute walk to a huge upscale mall.

The best deal in Waikiki! We could never have dreamed of finding a better price or value. With the Inn's low price and convenient location within walking distance of all the attractions of Waikiki, we saved a fortune by not having to rent a car while we were visiting O'ahu! What really sets the Inn apart is its kama'aina feel--this is definitely not your typical tourist hotel and everything about the place from its decor to its Hawai'ian hospitality were completely authentic. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful during our stay--they really went out of their way to make us feel welcome and help us make the most of our short time in Hawai'i. I would especially like to thank Gary, Puka, Joone, and Renee for making our stay so special and making us feel like part of the ohana.
